A cewar hukumomin mulkin mallaka, adadin mutanen da suka mutu a hukumance ya kai 8 (da kuma 20 da suka samu raunuka), amma an yi sabani a kan wannan adadi. [1] Damuwar da ta biyo baya a kan USCC da shugabanninta ya jagoranci sababbin masu fafutuka don ɗaukar nauyin jagoranci tare da Um Nyobè ya zama babban sakatare na kungiyar a shekara 1947. [2]

A watan Satumban 1945, mazauna garin sun bude wuta a Douala a kan zanga-zangar yajin aikin da a karshe ta rikide zuwa tarzoma. A cewar hukumomin mulkin mallaka, adadin mutanen da suka mutu a hukumance ya kai 8 (da kuma 20 da suka samu raunuka), amma an yi sabani a kan wannan adadi. [1] Damuwar da ta biyo baya a kan USCC da shugabanninta ya jagoranci sababbin masu fafutuka don daukar nauyin jagoranci tare da Um Nyobè ya zama babban sakatare na kungiyar a 1947. [2]

items.sourceText: Kaunda was the first president of independent Zambia. In 1973, following tribal and inter-party violence, all political parties except UNIP were banned through an amendment of the constitution after the signing of the Choma Declaration. At the same time, Kaunda oversaw the acquisition of majority stakes in key foreign-owned companies. The 1973 oil crisis and a slump in export revenues put Zambia in a state of economic crisis. Western pressure forced Kaunda to change the rules that had kept him in power. Multi-party elections took place in 1991, in which Frederick Chiluba, the leader of the Movement for Multi-Party Democracy, ousted Kaunda.

targets.targetText: Kaunda shi ne shugaban ƙasar Zambia na farko mai cin gashin kai. A shekarar 1973, bayan rikicin ƙabilanci da na jam'iyyu, an dakatar da dukkan jam'iyyun siyasa ban da UNIP ta hanyar yin kwaskwarima ga kundin tsarin mulki bayan sanya hannu kan sanarwar Choma. A sa'i ɗaya kuma, Kaunda ya sa ido kan yadda ake samun mafi yawan hannayen jari a manyan kamfanoni mallakar kasasyhen waje. Rikicin mai a shekarar 1973 da raguwar kuɗaɗen shigar da ake samu a ƙasashen waje ya sanya ƙasar Zambiya cikin halin matsin tattalin arziki. Matsin lamba na ƙasashen yamma ya tilastawa Kaunda sauya dokokin da suka sa shi kan ƙaragar mulki. An gudanar da zaɓukan jam'iyyu da yawa a shekarar 1991, inda Frederick Chiluba shugaban jam'iyyar Movement for Multi-Party Democracy ya kori Kaunda.

Kaunda shi ne shugaban kasar Zambia na farko mai cin gashin kai. A shekarar 1973, bayan rikicin kabilanci da na jam'iyyu, an dakatar da dukkan jam'iyyun siyasa ban da UNIP ta hanyar yin kwaskwarima ga kundin tsarin mulki bayan sanya hannu kan sanarwar Choma. A sa'i daya kuma, Kaunda ta sa ido kan yadda ake samun mafi yawan hannayen jari a manyan kamfanoni mallakar kasashen waje. Rikicin mai a shekarar 1973 da raguwar kudaden shigar da ake samu a kasashen waje ya sanya kasar Zambiya cikin halin matsin tattalin arziki. Matsin lamba na kasashen yamma ya tilastawa Kaunda sauya dokokin da suka sa shi kan karagar mulki. An gudanar da zabukan jam'iyyu da yawa a shekarar 1991, inda Frederick Chiluba shugaban jam'iyyar Movement for Multi-Party Democracy ya kori Kaunda.

items.sourceText: Adda was born in Gabès on 2 June 1921 into a Jewish family.[1] Unusually she was educated first with girls and then coeducationally. Despite attending primary school classes with a mix of Muslim, Jewish, and European girls, all of her teachers were French or European; the experience of undisguised racism from European teachers awakened Adda's awareness of European colonialism. Her Jewish community suffered some racism from antisemitic fascists, but the community was protected by the Muslim majority. Aged fifteen she was married to a man seven years her senior and she remained married to him for seven years until she divorced him. At the time Tunisia was part of the French Empire except during the Second World War when it was occupied by Nazi Germany. Adda engaged in political activism by covertly distributing anti-Nazi and anti-colonial leaflets against the German occupying forces in Vichy Tunisia.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Adda a Gabes a ranar 2 ga watan Yuni 1921 a cikin dangin Yahudawa. [1] Saɓanin yadda aka saba gani ta fara karatun ta da 'yan mata sannan ta haɗa kai. Duk da cewa ta halarci azuzuwan firamare tare da ’yan matan Musulmi, Yahudawa, da Turawa, duk malamanta Faransawa ne ko Turawa; Kwarewar wariyar launin fata da ba a ɓoye ba daga malaman Turai ta farkar da Adda game da mulkin mallaka na Turai. Al'ummarta yahudawa sun fuskanci wariyar launin fata daga 'yan farkisan kin jinin Yahudu, amma al'ummar musulmi sun sami kariya. Tana da shekara goma sha biyar ta auri wani mutum mai shekara bakwai kuma ta zauna da shi shekara bakwai har ta sake shi. A lokacin Tunusiya tana cikin daular Faransa sai dai lokacin yakin duniya na biyu lokacin da Jamus da Nazi ta mamaye ta. Adda ta tsunduma cikin fafutukar siyasa ta hanyar rarraba takardun adawa da Nazi da na mulkin mallaka a ɓoye a kan sojojin mamaya na Jamus a Vichy Tunisia. [2]

An haifi Adda a Gabas a ranar 2 ga Yuni 1921 a cikin dangin Yahudawa . [1] Sabanin yadda aka saba aka fara karatun ta da 'yan mata sannan ta hada kai. Duk da cewa ta halarci azuzuwan firamare tare da ’yan matan Musulmi, Yahudawa, da Turawa, duk malamanta Faransawa ne ko Turawa; Kwarewar wariyar launin fata da ba a ɓoye ba daga malaman Turai ta farkar da Adda game da mulkin mallaka na Turai. Al'ummarta yahudawa sun fuskanci wariyar launin fata daga 'yan farkisan kin jinin Yahudu, amma al'ummar musulmi sun sami kariya. Tana da shekara goma sha biyar ta auri wani mutum mai shekara bakwai kuma ta zauna da shi shekara bakwai har ta sake shi. A lokacin Tunusiya tana cikin daular Faransa sai dai lokacin yakin duniya na biyu lokacin da Jamus na Nazi ta mamaye ta. Adda ya tsunduma cikin fafutukar siyasa ta hanyar rarraba takardun adawa da Nazi da na mulkin mallaka a boye a kan sojojin mamaya na Jamus a Vichy Tunisia . [2]

items.sourceText: In 1955, Mohammed became the chairperson of the 'Umoja wa Wanawake wa Tanzania' (UWT - United Women of Tanzania), which was the women's branch of TANU. Within three months of her coming into the position, she was able to enroll more than 5000 women into TANU and helped play a major role in the fight for independence against British colonial rule. Mohammed was able to bring the UWT's ideas to the masses and also unified women against colonialism by giving them one voice.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1955, Bibi Mohammed ta zama shugabar 'Umoja wa Wanawake wa Tanzania' (UWT - United Women of Tanzania), wacce ita ce reshen mata ta TANU. A cikin watanni uku da zuwanta wannan muƙami, ta sami damar shigar da mata sama da 5000 cikin kungiyar ta TANU, ta kuma taimaka wajen taka rawar gani a yakin neman yancin kai da Turawan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya suka yi. Mohammed ya iya kawo ra'ayoyin UWT ga jama'a tare da hada kan mata wajen yaki da mulkin mallaka ta hanyar ba su murya ɗaya. [1]

A cikin 1955, Mohammed ya zama shugabar 'Umoja wa Wanawake wa Tanzania' (UWT - United Women of Tanzania), wadda ita ce reshen mata ta TANU. A cikin watanni uku da zuwanta wannan mukami, ta sami damar shigar da mata sama da 5000 cikin kungiyar ta TANU, ta kuma taimaka wajen taka rawar gani a yakin neman yancin kai da Turawan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya suka yi. Mohammed ya iya kawo ra'ayoyin UWT ga jama'a tare da hada kan mata wajen yaki da mulkin mallaka ta hanyar ba su murya daya. [1]

items.sourceText: The mastermind of the plot was Tanzania's former minister of foreign affairs, Oscar Kambona, who once was very close to President Nyerere. Kamaliza was convicted of treason, together with the other conspirators including Kambona who was not tried in absentia while living in self-imposed exile in Britain although prosecutors and intelligence officials said he was the ringleader. He secretly left Tanzania for Britain in July 1967 and masterminded the coup attempt from there.

targets.targetText: Wanda ya shirya makircin shi ne tsohon ministan harkokin wajen Tanzaniya, Oscar Kambona, wanda ya taba zama na kusa da shugaba Nyerere. An samu Kamaliza da laifin cin amanar kasa, tare da sauran masu hada baki da suka hada da Kambona wanda ba a yi masa shari’a ba a lokacin da yake zaman gudun hijira a Birtaniya duk da cewa masu gabatar da kara da jami’an leken asiri sun ce shi ne jagoran. Ya bar Tanzaniya a asirce zuwa Birtaniya a watan Yulin 1967 kuma ya shirya yunkurin juyin mulkin daga can.

Wanda ya shirya makircin shi ne tsohon ministan harkokin wajen Tanzaniya, Oscar Kambona, wanda ya taɓa zama na kusa da shugaba Nyerere. An samu Kamaliza da laifin cin amanar ƙasa, tare da sauran masu haɗa baki da suka haɗa da Kambona wanda ba a yi masa shari’a ba a lokacin da yake zaman gudun hijira a Birtaniya duk da cewa masu gabatar da ƙara da jami’an leken asiri sun ce shi ne jagoran. Ya bar Tanzaniya a asirce zuwa Birtaniya a watan Yulin 1967 kuma ya shirya yunkurin juyin mulkin daga can.

items.sourceText: By the time Somalia gained its independence in 1960, Daar had attained widespread prominence as a nationalist figure. In short order, he was elected the country's first President, a position he would assume from 1960 to 1967. During his tenure, he proactively pursued an irredentist national policy for the restoration of lost Somali territories. Notable incidents include the 1964 Ethiopian–Somali Border War, the Shifta War of Kenya, the Front de Libération de la Côte des Somalis battle for Djiboutian Independence as well as support for the ELF in Eritrea and the Bale Revolt of the Oromo in Ethiopia. His rivals in Kenya and Ethiopia had subsequently signed a defence pact in 1965 in order to curb what they deemed as expansion on their doorstep. In line with these policies, President Aden also enrolled Somalia into a number of organisations to advocate for the freedom and liberties of all colonised nations such as the Non-Aligned Movement, the Organisation of African Unity and the World Muslim Congress in which Somalia hosted the Congress' 6th conference in 1966. Notable countries which Somalia in his time advocated for and supported with men or material include South Africa and Palestine during the Six Day War.[5]

targets.targetText: A lokacin da Somaliya ta sami 'yancin kai a shekara ta 1960, Daar ya samu fice sosai a matsayin mai kishin ƙasa. A takaice dai an zaɓe shi a matsayin shugaban ƙasar na farko, muƙamin da zai riƙe daga shekarun 1960 zuwa 1967. A lokacin mulkinsa, ya bi diddigin manufofin ƙasa na rashin gaskiya don maido da yankunan Somaliya da suka ɓata. Sanannun abubuwan da suka faru sun haɗa da Yaƙin kan iyaka na Habasha da Somaliya na shekarar 1964, Yaƙin Shifta na Kenya, Front de Libération de la Côte des Somaliya yaƙin neman ‘yancin kai na Djibouti da kuma goyon bayan ELF a Eritrea da tawayen Bale na Oromo a Habasha. Abokan hamayyarsa a Kenya da Habasha sun rattaba hannu kan yarjejeniyar tsaro a shekara ta 1965 domin dakile abin da suka ɗauka na faɗaɗa kofarsu. Dangane da waɗannan manufofi, shugaba Aden ya kuma shigar da ƙasar Somaliya cikin kungiyoyi da dama domin neman ‘yancin walwala da ‘yancin dukkan al’ummomin da suka yi wa mulkin mallaka kamar kungiyar ‘yan tawaye, kungiyar haɗin kan Afrika da kuma Majalisar Musulmi ta Duniya inda Somalia ta karɓi bakuncin taron majalisar wakilai karo na 6 a shekarar 1966. Fitattun ƙasashe da Somaliya a zamaninsa ta ba da goyon baya da maza ko kayan aiki sun haɗa da Afirka ta Kudu da Falasdinu a lokacin yakin kwanaki shida. [1]

A lokacin da Somaliya ta sami 'yancin kai a shekara ta 1960, Daar ta samu fice sosai a matsayin mai kishin kasa. A takaice dai an zabe shi a matsayin shugaban kasar na farko, mukamin da zai rike daga 1960 zuwa 1967. A lokacin mulkinsa, ya bi diddigin manufofin kasa na rashin gaskiya don maido da yankunan Somaliya da suka bata. Sanannen abubuwan da suka faru sun haɗa da Yaƙin kan iyaka na Habasha da Somaliya na 1964, Yaƙin Shifta na Kenya, Front de Libération de la Côte des Somaliya yaƙin neman ‘yancin kai na Djibouti da kuma goyon bayan ELF a Eritrea da tawayen Bale na Oromo a Habasha. Abokan hamayyarsa a Kenya da Habasha sun rattaba hannu kan yarjejeniyar tsaro a shekara ta 1965 domin dakile abin da suka dauka na fadada kofarsu. Dangane da wadannan manufofi, shugaba Aden ya kuma shigar da kasar Somaliya cikin kungiyoyi da dama domin neman ‘yancin walwala da ‘yancin dukkan al’ummomin da suka yi wa mulkin mallaka kamar kungiyar ‘yan tawaye, kungiyar hadin kan Afrika da kuma Majalisar Musulmi ta Duniya inda Somalia ta karbi bakuncin taron majalisar wakilai karo na 6 a shekarar 1966. Fitattun kasashe da Somaliya a zamaninsa ta ba da goyon baya da maza ko kayan aiki sun hada da Afirka ta Kudu da Falasdinu a lokacin yakin kwanaki shida. [1]

items.sourceText: Shermarke was assassinated two years later by one of his own bodyguards. The slaying led to an unopposed, bloodless coup d'état by the Somali Army on 21 October 1969, the day after Shermarke's funeral. Spearheading the putsch was Major General Muhammad Siad Barre, who at the time commanded the army.[8]

targets.targetText: Bayan shekaru biyu ɗaya daga cikin masu tsaronsa ya kashe Shemarke. Kisan ya kai ga juyin mulkin ba tare da hamayya ba, wanda Sojojin Somaliya suka yi a ranar 21 ga watan Oktoban 1969, washegarin bayan jana'izar Shemarke. Wanda ya jagoranci shirin shine Manjo Janar Muhammad Siad Barre, wanda a lokacin ya jagoranci sojoji. [1]

Bayan shekaru biyu daya daga cikin masu tsaronsa ya kashe Shemarke. Kisan ya kai ga juyin mulkin ba tare da hamayya ba, wanda Sojojin Somaliya suka yi a ranar 21 ga Oktoban 1969, washegarin bayan jana'izar Shemarke. Wanda ya jagoranci shirin shine Manjo Janar Muhammad Siad Barre, wanda a lokacin ya jagoranci sojoji. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1990, with the start of the civil war, Daar along with former Minister of Information Ismail Jim'ale Osoble, former Minister of Education Hassan Ali Mire, and about 100 other Somali politicians signed a manifesto expressing concern over the violence and advocating reconciliation.[1][9] Daar was summarily arrested, and remained imprisoned until the ultimate collapse of Barre's regime the following year.[4]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1990, lokacin da aka fara yakin basasa, Daar tare da tsohon ministan yaɗa labarai Ismail Jim'ale Osoble, tsohon ministan ilimi Hassan Ali Mire, da kuma wasu 'yan siyasa 100 na Somaliya sun sanya hannu kan wata takarda ta nuna damuwa game da tashin hankali da kuma bada shawarar yin sulhu. [1] [2] An kama Daar a takaice, kuma ya kasance a kurkuku har zuwa ƙarshen rushewar mulkin Barre a shekara mai zuwa. [1]

A cikin 1990, lokacin da aka fara yakin basasa, Daar tare da tsohon ministan yada labarai Ismail Jim'ale Osoble, tsohon ministan ilimi Hassan Ali Mire, da kuma wasu 'yan siyasa 100 na Somaliya sun sanya hannu kan wata takarda ta nuna damuwa game da tashin hankali da kuma bada shawarar yin sulhu. [1] [2] An kama Daar a takaice, kuma ya kasance a kurkuku har zuwa karshen rushewar mulkin Barre a shekara mai zuwa. [1]

items.sourceText: After the military coup, many politicians, scholars, and religious leaders, including Boqor, were arrested, being seen as potential rivals and a threat to the new rule.[1][8] After his release, he became one of the 114 members of the "Manifesto Group", which signed a peace agreement aimed at ending fighting between Siad Barre's government and United Somali Congress (USC) militias in Mogadishu.

targets.targetText: Bayan juyin mulkin da sojoji suka yi, an kame da yawa daga cikin ‘yan siyasa, malamai, da malaman addini ciki har da Sarki, da ake ganin za su iya zama abokan hamayya da kuma barazana ga sabuwar mulkin. [1] [2] Bayan da aka sake shi, ya zama ɗaya daga cikin mambobi 114 na kungiyar "Manifesto Group", wacce ta sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar zaman lafiya da nufin kawo ƙarshen faɗa tsakanin gwamnatin Siad Barre da 'yan tawayen United Somali Congress (USC) a Mogadishu.

Bayan juyin mulkin da sojoji suka yi, an kame da yawa daga cikin ‘yan siyasa, malamai, da malaman addini ciki har da Sarki, da ake ganin za su iya zama abokan hamayya da kuma barazana ga sabuwar mulkin. [1] [2] Bayan da aka sake shi, ya zama daya daga cikin mambobi 114 na kungiyar "Manifesto Group", wadda ta sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar zaman lafiya da nufin kawo karshen fada tsakanin gwamnatin Siad Barre da 'yan tawayen United Somali Congress (USC) a Mogadishu .

items.sourceText: In mid-1968, Josina was named a delegate to the Second FRELIMO Congress, where she was a strong advocate for the full inclusion of women within all aspects of the liberation struggle. She was then appointed head of the Women's Section in FRELIMO's Department of International Relations. In this position, she traveled periodically to international meetings on women's rights and the role of women in development where she uses examples of FRELIMO experiences to advocate for women's equal participation in all aspects of the development process. She was then 24 years old.

targets.targetText: A tsakiyar 1968, an nada Josina a matsayin wakiliyar FRELIMO Congress ta biyu, inda ta kasance mai ba da shawara ga cikakken shigar da mata a cikin kowane bangare na gwagwarmayar 'yanci. Daga nan aka nada ta shugabar sashin mata a sashen hulda da kasashen duniya na FRELIMO. A cikin wannan matsayi, ta yi tafiya lokaci-lokaci zuwa tarurrukan kasa da kasa game da yancin mata da kuma rawar da mata ke takawa wajen ci gaba inda ta yi amfani da misalan abubuwan da FRELIMO ta samu don ba da shawara ga mata su kasance daidai da su a kowane bangare na ci gaba. Tana da shekara 24 a lokacin.

A tsakiyar shekarun 1968, an naɗa Josina a matsayin wakiliyar FRELIMO Congress ta biyu, inda ta kasance mai ba da shawara ga cikakken shigar da mata a cikin kowane ɓangare na gwagwarmayar 'yanci. Daga nan aka naɗa ta shugabar sashin mata a sashen hulɗa da ƙasashen duniya na FRELIMO. A cikin wannan matsayi, ta yi tafiya lokaci-lokaci zuwa tarurrukan ƙasa da ƙasa game da yancin mata da kuma rawar da mata ke takawa wajen ci gaba inda ta yi amfani da misalan abubuwan da FRELIMO ta samu don ba da shawara ga mata su kasance daidai da su a kowane ɓangare na ci gaba. Tana da shekara 24 a lokacin.

items.sourceText: The war started on 1 September 1961 with the Battle of Adal, when Hamid Idris Awate and his companions engaged the occupying Ethiopian Army and police.[49] In 1962, Emperor Haile Selassie unilaterally dissolved the federation and the Eritrean parliament and annexed the country.[50][51]

targets.targetText: Yakin ya fara ne a ranar 1 ga Satumbar 1961 da yakin Adal, lokacin da Hamid Idris Awate da abokansa suka yi artabu da sojojin Habasha da 'yan sanda da suka mamaye. [1] A shekarar 1962, Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ya rusa tarayya da majalisar dokokin Eritiriya ba tare da izini ba tare da mamaye kasar. [2] [3]

Yakin ya fara ne a ranar 1 ga watan Satumbar 1961 da yakin Adal, lokacin da Hamid Idris Awate da abokansa suka yi artabu da sojojin Habasha da 'yan sanda da suka mamaye. [1] A shekarar 1962, Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ya rusa tarayya da majalisar dokokin Eritiriya ba tare da izini ba tare da mamaye ƙasar. [2] [3] Manazarta

items.sourceText: The village of Besikdira hosted the only school within the entire Sekwina region, built in 1962 by Father Gebrekudos Meskel. The primary school was shut for 20 years after the war, but rebuilt by an Italian aid organisation in 2004.

targets.targetText: Kauyen Besikdira ya karbi bakuncin makaranta daya tilo a cikin dukkan yankin Sekwina, wanda Uba Gebrekudos Meskel ya gina a shekarar 1962. An rufe makarantar firamare na tsawon shekaru 20 bayan yakin, amma wata kungiyar agaji ta Italiya ce ta sake gina shi a shekarar 2004.

Ƙauyen Besikdira ya karɓi bakuncin makaranta ɗaya tilo a cikin dukkan yankin Sekwina, wanda Uba Gebrekudos Meskel ya gina a shekarar 1962. An rufe makarantar firamare na tsawon shekaru 20 bayan yakin, amma wata kungiyar agaji ta Italiya ce ta sake gina ta a shekarar 2004.

items.sourceText: The First Battle of Massawa took place from 1977 to 1978 in and around the coastal city of Massawa. The port was besieged by the Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF) against the forces of Ethiopia and was one of two battles in and around the city.

targets.targetText: Yakin Massawa na farko ya faru ne daga shekarun 1977 zuwa 1978 a ciki da wajen birnin Massawa da ke gaɓar teku. Rundunar ‘yan tawayen ƙasar Eritiriya (EPLF) ce ta yi wa tashar jiragen ruwan kawanya da dakarun Habasha, kuma ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin faɗace-faɗacen da aka yi a birnin da kewaye.

Yakin Massawa na farko ya faru ne daga 1977 zuwa 1978 a ciki da wajen birnin Massawa da ke gabar teku. Rundunar ‘yan tawayen kasar Eritiriya (EPLF) ce ta yi wa tashar jiragen ruwan kawanya da dakarun Habasha, kuma ta kasance daya daga cikin fadace-fadacen da aka yi a birnin da kewaye.

items.sourceText: After the Italians were completely pushed out of Eritrea, Hamid settled in western Eritrea but eventually recruited an army of 50 people and began to raid the Kunama and Nara tribes from 1942 to 1948. His actions eventually attracted the attention of the British authorities, who offered a considerable award for his capture, dead or alive. Afterwards, Hamid and his armed faction surrendered to British in 1951 after they agreed not to prosecute him for his crimes.[5]

targets.targetText: Bayan da aka kori Italiya gaba daya daga Eritriya, Hamid ya zauna a yammacin Eritrea amma daga karshe ya dauki sojoji 50 ya kuma fara kai farmaki kan kabilar Kunama da Nara daga 1942 zuwa 1948. Ayyukansa sun jawo hankalin hukumomin Biritaniya, waɗanda suka ba da kyauta mai yawa don kama shi, a mace ko a raye. Bayan haka, Hamid da kungiyarsa dauke da makamai sun mika wuya ga kasar Burtaniya a shekarar 1951 bayan sun amince ba za su gurfanar da shi a gaban kuliya ba. [1]

Bayan da aka kori Italiya gaba ɗaya daga Eritriya, Hamid ya zauna a yammacin Eritrea amma daga ƙarshe ya ɗauki sojoji 50 ya kuma fara kai farmaki kan ƙabilar Kunama da Nara daga shekarun 1942 zuwa 1948. Ayyukansa sun jawo hankalin hukumomin Biritaniya, waɗanda suka ba da kyauta mai yawa don kama shi, a mace ko a raye. Bayan haka, Hamid da kungiyarsa ɗauke da makamai sun miƙa wuya ga ƙasar Burtaniya a shekarar 1951 bayan sun amince ba za su gurfanar da shi a gaban kuliya ba. [1]

items.sourceText: After the war, she returned to her studies, becoming a journalist. In the 1977 Algerian legislative election, she was elected to the People's National Assembly, one of 9 women elected. She held her seat until 1982.[5]

targets.targetText: Bayan yakin, ta koma karatu, ta zama 'yar jarida. A zaɓen 'yan majalisar dokokin Aljeriya a shekara ta shekarar 1977, an zaɓe ta a majalisar dokokin ƙasar , ɗaya daga cikin mata 9 da aka zaɓa. Ta ci gaba da zama har zuwa shekara ta 1982. [1]

Bayan yakin, ta koma karatu, ta zama 'yar jarida. A zaben 'yan majalisar dokokin Aljeriya a shekara ta 1977, an zabe ta a majalisar dokokin kasar, daya daga cikin mata 9 da aka zaba. Ta ci gaba da zama har zuwa 1982. [1]

items.sourceText: Chapter Five outlined the consequences of self-determination as the following:[1] Algeria's Independence from France would be recognised by France immediately, the transfer of jurisdiction would be realised, any regulations would come into force simultaneously, and that an election for the Algerian National Assembly would be organised by the provisional executive within a period of three weeks.

targets.targetText: Babi na biyar ya fayyace sakamakon ‘yancin kai kamar haka: [1] Faransa za ta amince da ‘Yancin Aljeriya daga Faransa nan take, za a tabbatar da miƙa mulki, duk wasu ka’idoji za su fara aiki a lokaci guda, sannan kuma hukumar zartaswa ta wucin gadi za ta shirya zaɓen majalisar dokokin Aljeriya a cikin makonni uku. Manazarta

Babi na biyar ya fayyace sakamakon ‘yancin kai kamar haka: [1] Faransa za ta amince da ‘Yancin Aljeriya daga Faransa nan take, za a tabbatar da mika mulki, duk wasu ka’idoji za su fara aiki a lokaci guda, sannan kuma hukumar zartaswa ta wucin gadi za ta shirya zaben majalisar dokokin Aljeriya a cikin makonni uku.

items.sourceText: Larbi Tebessi was arrested in 1943 and then released. Then he was imprisoned in 1945 after the Sétif and Guelma massacre on May 8, 1945. Larbi Tebessi managed to create a school and he spread his anti-colonial ideas.

targets.targetText: An kama Larbi Tebessi a 1943 sannan aka sake shi. Sannan an daure shi a shekara ta 1945 bayan kisan kiyashin Setif da Guelma a ranar 8 ga Mayu, 1945. Larbi Tebessi ya sami nasarar ƙirƙirar makaranta kuma ya yada tunaninsa na adawa da mulkin mallaka.

An kama Larbi Tebessi a shekarar 1943 sannan aka sake shi. Sannan an ɗaure shi a shekara ta 1945 bayan kisan kiyashin Setif da Guelma a ranar 8 ga watan Mayu, 1945. Larbi Tebessi ya sami nasarar ƙirƙirar makaranta kuma ya yaɗa tunaninsa na adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka.

items.sourceText: Sheikh Larbi Tebessi represented the main current of the ulema association who rallied the principles of the National Liberation Front in 1956. This was instigated by Zighoud Youcef head of the department of Constantinois and founding member of the FLN and after insurgency of August 20, 1955.

targets.targetText: Sheikh Larbi Tebessi shi ne ya wakilci babban jigo na kungiyar malamai da suka hada ka’idojin kungiyar ‘yanci ta kasa a shekarar 1956. Zighoud Youcef shugaban sashen Constantinois kuma memba na FLN ne ya ingiza wannan kuma bayan tawaye na Agusta 20, 1955.

Sheikh Larbi Tebessi shi ne ya wakilci babban jigo na kungiyar malamai da suka haɗa ka’idojin kungiyar ‘yanci ta kasa a shekarar 1956. Zighoud Youcef shugaban sashen Constantinois kuma memba na FLN ne ya ingiza wannan kuma bayan tawaye na watan Agusta 20, 1955.

items.sourceText: In 1982 Zimbabwean police arrested Masuku and Dumiso Dabengwa, the ZIPRA intelligence chief, for allegedly planning a coup d'état against then-Prime Minister Robert Mugabe. The Supreme Court found Masuku, Dabengwa, and four others not guilty in 1983, but police detained them again under emergency regulations, holding them for four years. The government released Masuku because of poor health and Vote Moyo, a ZAPU official, on 11 March 1986.[1][2]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1982 'yan sandan Zimbabwe sun kama Masuku da Dumiso Dabengwa, babban jami'in leken asiri na ZIPRA, bisa zarginsu da shirya juyin mulkin da aka yi wa firaminista Robert Mugabe na lokacin. Kotun kolin kasar ta samu Masuku, Dabengwa, da wasu mutane hudu a shekarar 1983, ba su da laifi, amma ‘yan sanda sun sake tsare su a karkashin dokar ta-baci, inda suka tsare su na tsawon shekaru hudu. Gwamnati ta saki Masuku saboda rashin lafiya da kuma Vote Moyo, jami'in ZAPU, a ranar 11 ga Maris 1986. [1] [2]

A cikin shekarar 1982 'yan sandan Zimbabwe sun kama Masuku da Dumiso Dabengwa, babban jami'in leken asiri na ZIPRA, bisa zarginsu da shirya juyin mulkin da aka yi wa firaminista Robert Mugabe na lokacin. Kotun kolin ƙasar ta samu Masuku, Dabengwa, da wasu mutane huɗu a shekarar 1983, ba su da laifi, amma ‘yan sanda sun sake tsare su a ƙarƙashin dokar ta-ɓaci, inda suka tsare su na tsawon shekaru huɗu. Gwamnati ta saki Masuku saboda rashin lafiya da kuma Vote Moyo, jami'in ZAPU, a ranar 11 ga watan Maris 1986. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Masuku arrived in Rhodesia with Dumiso Dabengwa on 24 December 1979. Dabengwa had a meeting arranged with an informant from the country's Central Intelligence Organisation, but could not attend so sent Masuku in his stead. They judged this meeting very important, as the informant claimed that a few weeks earlier that Josiah Tongogara was killed in an ambush in Mozambique. The meeting took place in the Wimpy Bar in Salisbury (Harare), organised by "The Senator", which was his codename.

targets.targetText: Masuku ya isa Rhodesia tare da Dumiso Dabengwa a ranar 24 ga Disamba 1979. Dabengwa ya yi wani taro da wani mai ba da labari daga Hukumar Leken Asiri ta kasar, amma bai samu halartar taron ba, ya aika Masuku a madadinsa. Sun ɗauki wannan taro da muhimmanci sosai, kamar yadda mai ba da labarin ya yi iƙirarin cewa ‘yan makonnin da suka gabata an kashe Josiah Tongogara a wani harin kwantan bauna da aka kai a Mozambique. Taron ya gudana ne a mashaya mai suna Wimpy da ke Salisbury (Harare), wanda “The Senator” ya shirya, wanda shine sunan sa.

Masuku ya isa Rhodesia tare da Dumiso Dabengwa a ranar 24 ga watan Disamba 1979. Dabengwa ya yi wani taro da wani mai ba da labari daga Hukumar Leken Asiri ta ƙasar, amma bai samu halartar taron ba, ya aika Masuku a madadinsa. Sun ɗauki wannan taro da muhimmanci sosai, kamar yadda mai ba da labarin ya yi iƙirarin cewa ‘yan makonnin da suka gabata an kashe Josiah Tongogara a wani harin kwantan ɓauna da aka kai a Mozambique. Taron ya gudana ne a mashaya mai suna Wimpy da ke Salisbury (Harare), wanda “The Senator” ya shirya, wanda shine sunan sa.

items.sourceText: Manuel Pinto da Costa ran as the MLSTP–PSD candidate in the 1996 presidential election. In the first round, he came in second behind the incumbent President Miguel Trovoada, winning 39% of the vote to Trovoada's 41%. In the second round he was defeated by Trovoada who captured 52.7% of the vote to his 47.3%.

targets.targetText: Manuel Pinto da Costa ya yi takara a matsayin ɗan takarar MLSTP-PSD a zaɓen shugaban ƙasa na shekarar 1996. A zagayen farko, ya zo na biyu bayan shugaban ƙasar mai ci Miguel Trovoada, inda ya samu kashi 39% na kuri'un da aka kaɗa, yayin da Trovoada ta samu kashi 41%. A zagaye na biyu ya sha kaye a hannun Trovoada wanda ya samu kashi 52.7% na kuri'un da aka kaɗa inda ya samu kashi 47.3%.

Manuel Pinto da Costa ya yi takara a matsayin dan takarar MLSTP-PSD a zaben shugaban kasa na 1996. A zagayen farko, ya zo na biyu bayan shugaban kasar mai ci Miguel Trovoada, inda ya samu kashi 39% na kuri'un da aka kada, yayin da Trovoada ta samu kashi 41%. A zagaye na biyu ya sha kaye a hannun Trovoada wanda ya samu kashi 52.7% na kuri'un da aka kada inda ya samu kashi 47.3%.

items.sourceText: The SPDM has been critical of the government of President Isaias Afwerki, accusing it of being undemocratic and repressive. The party has also expressed concern over the government's handling of the border dispute with Ethiopia, which has led to a protracted conflict between the two countries. While the SPDM's official position is that it seeks a peaceful and democratic resolution to the conflict between the Saho people and the Eritrean government, some members of the party have expressed support for greater autonomy or even independence for the Saho region.[9] The Saho people have historically faced marginalization and discrimination,[10] and the SPDM has been a vocal advocate for their rights and interests.[11] However, the party leadership has emphasized the importance of national unity and cohesion, and has emphasized that any changes to the country's political structure must be achieved through peaceful and democratic means.

targets.targetText: Jam'iyyar SPDM dai na sukar gwamnatin shugaba Isaias Afwerki, inda ta zarge ta da rashin bin tafarkin demokraɗiyya da danniya. Jam'iyyar ta kuma bayyana damuwarta kan yadda gwamnatin ƙasar ke tafiyar da rikicin kan iyaka da ƙasar Habasha, wanda ya haifar da daɗewar rikici tsakanin ƙasashen biyu. Yayin da matsayin SPDM a hukumance shi ne na neman ganin an sasanta rikicin Saho da gwamnatin Eritriya cikin lumana da Dimokuraɗiyya, wasu 'yan jam'iyyar sun nuna goyon bayansu ga samun 'yancin cin gashin kai ko ma 'yancin cin gashin kai ga yankin Saho. [1] Mutanen Saho a tarihi sun fuskanci wariya da nuna bambanci, [2] kuma SPDM ta kasance mai fafutukar kare hakkinsu da muradun su. [3] Sai dai shugabannin jam’iyyar sun bayyana muhimmancin haɗin kan ƙasa da haɗin kan kasa, kuma sun jaddada cewa duk wani sauyi da za a yi a tsarin siyasar ƙasar dole ne a samu ta hanyar lumana da dimokuraɗiyya.

Jam'iyyar SPDM dai na sukar gwamnatin shugaba Isaias Afwerki, inda ta zarge ta da rashin bin tafarkin demokradiyya da danniya. Jam'iyyar ta kuma bayyana damuwarta kan yadda gwamnatin kasar ke tafiyar da rikicin kan iyaka da kasar Habasha, wanda ya haifar da dadewar rikici tsakanin kasashen biyu. Yayin da matsayin SPDM a hukumance shi ne na neman ganin an sasanta rikicin Saho da gwamnatin Eritriya cikin lumana da dimokuradiyya, wasu 'yan jam'iyyar sun nuna goyon bayansu ga samun 'yancin cin gashin kai ko ma 'yancin cin gashin kai ga yankin Saho. [1] Mutanen Saho a tarihi sun fuskanci wariya da wariya, [2] kuma SPDM ta kasance mai fafutukar kare hakkinsu da muradun su. [3] Sai dai shugabannin jam’iyyar sun bayyana muhimmancin hadin kan kasa da hadin kan kasa, kuma sun jaddada cewa duk wani sauyi da za a yi a tsarin siyasar kasar dole ne a samu ta hanyar lumana da dimokuradiyya.

items.sourceText: In 1958, the Eritrean Liberation Movement (ELM) was founded.[1] The ELM, which was composed primarily of students and laborers, focused on organizing demonstrations against Ethiopian occupation. ELM strongholds were located in the urban central highlands, where a large proportion of Christians lived.[2] It organized Eritreans clandestinely and played a significant role in awakening nationalists sentiments in urban areas until a major police crackdown. While the ELM had played a positive role in working towards self-determination, the organization proved incapable of escalating to armed struggle against the Ethiopian Empire.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1958, an kafa ƙungiyar 'yanci ta Eritrea (ELM). [1] ELM, wacce ta ƙunshi ɗalibai da ma'aikata, ta mayar da hankali kan shirya zanga-zangar adawa da mamayar Habasha. Wuraren ELM suna cikin tsaunukan tsakiyar birane, inda yawancin kiristoci ke zama. [2] Ta shirya 'yan Eritriya a ɓoye tare da taka rawar gani wajen tada ra'ayin 'yan kishin ƙasa a cikin birane har sai da wani babban jami'in 'yan sanda. Yayin da ELM ta taka rawar gani wajen yin aiki don tabbatar da kai, ƙungiyar ta nuna ba ta da ƙarfin haɓaka zuwa gwagwarmayar makami da Daular Habasha. [1] Manazarta

A cikin 1958, an kafa ƙungiyar 'yanci ta Eritrea (ELM). [1] ELM, wadda ta ƙunshi ɗalibai da ma'aikata, ta mayar da hankali kan shirya zanga-zangar adawa da mamayar Habasha. Wuraren ELM suna cikin tsaunukan tsakiyar birane, inda yawancin kiristoci ke zama. [2] Ta shirya 'yan Eritriya a boye tare da taka rawar gani wajen tada ra'ayin 'yan kishin kasa a cikin birane har sai da wani babban jami'in 'yan sanda. Yayin da ELM ta taka rawar gani wajen yin aiki don tabbatar da kai, ƙungiyar ta nuna ba ta da ƙarfin haɓaka zuwa gwagwarmayar makami da Daular Habasha. [1]

items.sourceText: King Hassan II of Morocco rallied political support and announced that his country would oppose independence as an option in the Western Sahara referendum. In response, Spain stalled and postponed the long-planned self-determination referendum, which caused dismay among the Sahrawi population, especially the youth.[1]

targets.targetText: Sarkin Maroko Hassan na biyu ya nuna goyon bayan siyasa tare da bayyana cewa ƙasarsa za ta yi adawa da ‘yancin kai a matsayin wani zaɓi a zaɓen raba gardama na yammacin Sahara. A martanin da Spain ta mayar, ta dakatar da ɗage zaɓen raba gardama na 'yancin kai da aka daɗe ana shirin gudanarwa, wanda ya haifar da firgici a tsakanin al'ummar Sahrawi, musamman matasa. [1]

Sarkin Maroko Hassan na biyu ya nuna goyon bayan siyasa tare da bayyana cewa kasarsa za ta yi adawa da ‘yancin kai a matsayin wani zabi a zaben raba gardama na yammacin Sahara. A martanin da Spain ta mayar, ta dakatar da dage zaben raba gardama na 'yancin kai da aka dade ana shirin gudanarwa, wanda ya haifar da firgici a tsakanin al'ummar Sahrawi, musamman matasa. [1]

items.sourceText: He came from the Akamba people of Kenya, who were the driving force behind a political protest against the British in 1937 led by Samuel Muindi Mbingu.[4]

targets.targetText: Ya fito ne daga kabilar Akamba na kasar Kenya, wadanda su ne suka jagoranci zanga-zangar siyasa da aka yi wa Turawan mulkin mallaka a shekarar 1937 karkashin jagorancin Samuel Muindi Mbingu. [1]
Ya fito ne daga ƙabilar Akamba na ƙasar Kenya, waɗanda su ne suka jagoranci zanga-zangar siyasa da aka yi wa Turawan mulkin mallaka a shekarar 1937 ƙarƙashin jagorancin Samuel Muindi Mbingu. [1]

items.sourceText: The declaration of a state of emergency in October 1952 led to the arrest of Ngei, Jomo Kenyatta and others. Ngei earned Kenyatta's undying friendship when, during their imprisonment in Lodwar, Ngei physically stopped a colonial jailer from beating up Kenyatta by seizing the whip and challenging the jailer to beat him (Ngei) first. The "Kapenguria Six" included Fred Kubai, Bildad Kaggia, Achieng Oneko and Kung'u Karumba. The last surviving member, Oneko, died on 9 June 2007.[1] Mashujaa Day, which until recently was known as Kenyatta Day, is a national holiday in Kenya held every year to commemorate the detention of the six on 20 October 1952.[2]

targets.targetText: Ayyana dokar ta ɓaci a watan Oktoban 1952 ya kai ga kama Ngei, Jomo Kenyatta da sauransu. Ngei ya samu abokantakar Kenyatta ne a lokacin da suke zaman kurkuku a Lodwar, Ngei a jiki ya hana wani ɗan gidan kaso daga dukan Kenyatta ta hanyar kwace bulala tare da ƙalubalantar mai tsaron gidan ya buge shi (Ngei). "Kapenguria shida" sun haɗa da Fred Kubai, Bildad Kaggia, Achieng Oneko da Kung'u Karumba. Memba na ƙarshe da ya tsira, Oneko, ya mutu a ranar 9 ga watan Yuni 2007. [1] Ranar Mashujaa, wacce har zuwa kwanan nan ana kiranta da Kenyatta Day, ita ce ranar hutu ta ƙasa a Kenya da ake gudanarwa kowace shekara don tunawa da tsare mutane shida a ranar 20 ga watan Oktoba 1952. [2]

ayyana dokar ta baci a watan Oktoban 1952 ya kai ga kama Ngei, Jomo Kenyatta da sauransu. Ngei ya samu abokantakar Kenyatta ne a lokacin da suke zaman kurkuku a Lodwar, Ngei a jiki ya hana wani dan gidan kaso daga dukan Kenyatta ta hanyar kwace bulala tare da kalubalantar mai tsaron gidan ya buge shi (Ngei). " Kapenguria shida " sun hada da Fred Kubai, Bildad Kaggia, Achieng Oneko da Kung'u Karumba. Memba na ƙarshe da ya tsira, Oneko, ya mutu a ranar 9 ga Yuni 2007. [1] Ranar Mashujaa, wadda har zuwa kwanan nan ana kiranta da Kenyatta Day, ita ce ranar hutu ta kasa a Kenya da ake gudanarwa kowace shekara don tunawa da tsare mutane shida a ranar 20 ga Oktoba 1952. [2]

items.sourceText: Disagreements soon cropped up with two main rivals Oginga Odinga and Kenneth Matiba each wanting to run for presidency and not wanting to listen to reason. It was Shortly after this that Muliro left for London for a fundraising mission for the newly formed Ford political party. It was to be an ill-fated trip: on his return, upon his arrival at the Nairobi airport on the morning of August 14, 1992, he collapsed and died. The controversy over his death was heightened by the absence of an official post mortem. Muliro was buried on his rural farm in Sibanga area of Kenya.

targets.targetText: Ba da jimawa ba aka samu rashin jituwa tsakanin manyan abokan hamayya biyu Oginga Odinga da Kenneth Matiba kowannen su na son tsayawa takarar shugaban kasa kuma ba sa son sauraron dalili. Jim kadan bayan haka ne Muliro ya tafi birnin Landan domin gudanar da ayyukan tara kudade ga sabuwar jam'iyyar siyasa ta Ford da aka kafa. Zai zama balaguron rashin lafiya: a dawowarsa, da isowarsa filin jirgin saman Nairobi da safiyar ranar 14 ga Agusta, 1992, ya fadi ya mutu. Takaddamar da ake yi kan mutuwar tasa ta yi kamari ne sakamakon rashin wani jami’in da aka binne gawarwakin mutane a hukumance. An binne Muliro a gonarsa ta karkara da ke yankin Sibanga a kasar Kenya.

Ba da jimawa ba aka samu rashin jituwa tsakanin manyan abokan hamayya biyu Oginga Odinga da Kenneth Matiba kowannen su na son tsayawa takarar shugaban ƙasa kuma ba sa son sauraron dalili. Jim kaɗan bayan haka ne Muliro ya tafi birnin Landan domin gudanar da ayyukan tara kuɗaɗe ga sabuwar jam'iyyar siyasa ta Ford da aka kafa. Zai zama balaguron rashin lafiya: a dawowarsa, da isowarsa filin jirgin saman Nairobi da safiyar ranar 14 ga watan Agusta, 1992, ya faɗi ya mutu. Takaddamar da ake yi kan mutuwar tasa ta yi kamari ne sakamakon rashin wani jami’in da aka binne gawarwakin mutane a hukumance. An binne Muliro a gonarsa ta karkara da ke yankin Sibanga a ƙasar Kenya.

items.sourceText: At the time of his death, Oneko was the only one of the "Kapenguria six" still alive. Mashujaa Day (previously known as Kenyatta Day until the promulgation of the new Kenya constitution on 27 August 2010) is a national holiday in Kenya that commemorates the detention of the Kapenguria Six on 20 October 1952.[9]

targets.targetText: A lokacin mutuwarsa, Oneko shine kaɗai ɗaya daga cikin "Kapenguria shida" har yanzu yana raye. Ranar Mashujaa (wanda aka fi sani da Kenyatta Day har zuwa lokacin fitar da sabon kundin tsarin mulkin Kenya a ranar 27 ga watan Agusta 2010) biki ne na ƙasa a Kenya wanda ke tunawa da tsare Kapenguria Six a ranar 20 ga watan Oktoba 1952. [1]

A lokacin mutuwarsa, Oneko shine kadai daya daga cikin "Kapenguria shida" har yanzu yana raye. Ranar Mashujaa (wanda aka fi sani da Kenyatta Day har zuwa lokacin fitar da sabon kundin tsarin mulkin Kenya a ranar 27 ga Agusta 2010) biki ne na kasa a Kenya wanda ke tunawa da tsare Kapenguria shida a ranar 20 ga Oktoba 1952. [1]

items.sourceText: To end the resistance, the now largely disgraced intelligence officer Richard Meinertzhagen invited Koitalel to a peace truce meeting after leading a rebellion against the colonial invasion of the Nandi. The peace meeting was to be held at 11:00AM on Thursday, October 19, 1905. Suspecting that he would be killed as his father Kimnyole had foretold, Samoei instructed Meinertzhagen to come with five companions to meet him at Ketbarak (present-day Nandi Bears Club). Samoei was to come with five foretellers.[1]

targets.targetText: Don kawo ƙarshen adawar, jami'in leken asirin Richard Meinertzhagen wanda yanzu ya cika wulakanci ya gayyaci Koitalel zuwa taron sulhun zaman lafiya bayan ya jagoranci tawaye ga mamayar da Turawan mulkin mallaka suka yi wa Nandi. Za a yi taron zaman lafiya da karfe 11:00 na safe ranar Alhamis 19 ga watan Oktoba, 1905. Da yake zargin cewa za a kashe shi kamar yadda mahaifinsa Kimnyole ya annabta, Samoei ya umurci Meinertzhagen ya zo tare da abokansa biyar su same shi a Ketbarak (Nandi Bears Club na yanzu). Samoei ne zai zo da masu tsinkaya guda biyar. [1]

Don kawo karshen adawar, jami'in leken asirin Richard Meinertzhagen wanda yanzu ya cika wulakanci ya gayyaci Koitalel zuwa taron sulhun zaman lafiya bayan ya jagoranci tawaye ga mamayar da Turawan mulkin mallaka suka yi wa Nandi. Za a yi taron zaman lafiya da karfe 11:00 na safe ranar Alhamis 19 ga Oktoba, 1905. Da yake zargin cewa za a kashe shi kamar yadda mahaifinsa Kimnyole ya annabta, Samoei ya umurci Meinertzhagen ya zo tare da abokansa biyar su same shi a Ketbarak (Nandi Bears Club na yanzu). Samoei ne zai zo da masu tsinkaya guda biyar. [1]

items.sourceText: The Nandi resistance was led by Koitalel Arap Samoei, the Orkoiyot of the Nandi at the time. On 19 October 1905, on the grounds of what is now Nandi Bears Club, Arap Samoei was asked to meet Col Richard Meinertzhagen for a truce. However, Meinertzhagen and his men killed Koitalel Arap Samoei and his entourage, ending the resistance.[2] Afterward, the British decapitated Koitalel's body and took his head to London as proof of his death as well as a macabre trophy of colonialism.[3]

targets.targetText: Koitalel Arap Samoei, Orkoiyot na Nandi ne ya jagoranci gwagwarmayar Nandi a lokacin. A ranar 19 ga Oktoba, 1905, a dalilin abin da ake kira Nandi Bears Club a yanzu, an nemi Arap Samoei ya sadu da Col Richard Meinertzhagen don sasantawa. Sai dai Meinertzhagen da mutanensa sun kashe Koitalel Arap Samoei da mukarrabansa, inda suka kawo karshen turjiya. [1] Bayan haka, ’yan Birtaniyya sun yanke kan gawar Koitalel suka kai kansa Landan a matsayin shaidar mutuwarsa da kuma kofin macabre na mulkin mallaka. [2]

Koitalel Arap Samoei, Orkoiyot na Nandi ne ya jagoranci gwagwarmayar Nandi a lokacin. A ranar 19 ga watan Oktoba, 1905, a dalilin abin da ake kira Nandi Bears Club a yanzu, an nemi Arap Samoei ya haɗu da Col Richard Meinertzhagen don sasantawa. Sai dai Meinertzhagen da mutanensa sun kashe Koitalel Arap Samoei da mukarrabansa, inda suka kawo karshen turjiya/tawaye. [1] Bayan haka, ’yan Birtaniyya sun yanke kan gawar Koitalel suka kai kansa Landan a matsayin shaidar mutuwarsa da kuma kofin macabre na mulkin mallaka. [2]

items.sourceText: Kungu Karumba along with five other men, including Jomo Kenyatta, were arrested on October 20, 1952 in Kapenguria by British colonial governor, for being involved in a revolutionary group called the Mau Mau, which led a revolt against British colonial rule. Reason as to why the case was held in Kapenguria was so that the Mau Mau could not get to free the men. The area was remote at the time. He was convicted and locked up in prison for seven years with hard labor before the country's independence on December 12, 1963.[1][2]

targets.targetText: An kama Kungu Karumba tare da wasu mutane biyar da suka hada da Jomo Kenyatta a ranar 20 ga Oktoba, 1952 a Kapenguria daga hannun gwamnan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya, saboda hannu a wata kungiyar juyin juya hali mai suna Mau Mau, wacce ta jagoranci tawaye ga mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya. Dalilin da ya sa aka gudanar da shari'ar a Kapenguria shi ne don Mau Mau ya kasa samun 'yantar da mutanen. Yankin ya kasance mai nisa a lokacin. An yanke masa hukunci kuma an kulle shi a gidan yari na tsawon shekaru bakwai tare da aiki tukuru kafin kasar ta samu ‘yancin kai a ranar 12 ga Disamba, 1963. [1] [2]

An kama Kungu Karumba tare da wasu mutane biyar da suka haɗa da Jomo Kenyatta a ranar 20 ga watan Oktoba, 1952 a Kapenguria daga hannun gwamnan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya, saboda hannu a wata kungiyar juyin juya hali mai suna Mau Mau, wacce ta jagoranci tawaye ga 'yan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya. Dalilin da ya sa aka gudanar da shari'ar a Kapenguria shi ne don Mau Mau ya kasa samun 'yantar da mutanen. Yankin ya kasance mai nisa a lokacin. An yanke masa hukunci kuma an kulle shi a gidan yari na tsawon shekaru bakwai tare da aiki tukuru kafin ƙasar ta samu ‘yancin kai a ranar 12 ga watan Disamba, 1963. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Mustapha Stambouli (March 10, 1920 in Mascara, Algeria – April 20, 1984 in Mascara, Algeria) was an Algerian nationalist leader.

targets.targetText: Mustapha Stambouli (10 ga Maris, 1920 a Mascara, Aljeriya - 20 ga Afrilu, 1984 a Mascara, Aljeriya) jagoran kishin kasa ne na Aljeriya.
Mustapha Stambouli (10 ga Maris, 1920 a Mascara, Aljeriya - 20 ga watan Afrilu, 1984 a Mascara, Aljeriya) jagoran kishin ƙasa ne na Aljeriya.

items.sourceText: A law student, he was active for the nationalist cause from the late 1930s in the Parti du peuple algérien (PPA), and was jailed several times by the colonial authorities of France. In 1948, he was arrested on the Libyan border, as he tried to join Arab guerrillas in Palestine. He joined the Front de libération nationale (FLN), and served as an officer in its armed wing, the Armée de libération nationale (ALN), during the Algerian War of Independence (1954–62). He eventually became a secretary of state in the Gouvernement provisoire de la republique algérienne (GPRA), an exile government set up by the FLN.[1][2][3] Following independence in 1962, he was elected to the constituent assembly, but played no major political role after that.

targets.targetText: Dalibin shari'a, ya kasance mai fafutukar neman kishin kasa daga karshen 1930s a cikin Parti du peuple algérien (PPA), kuma hukumomin mulkin mallaka na Faransa sun daure shi sau da yawa. A cikin 1948, an kama shi a kan iyakar Libya, yayin da yake kokarin shiga cikin 'yan tawayen Larabawa a Falasdinu . Ya shiga cikin Front de Liberation nationale (FLN), kuma ya yi aiki a matsayin jami'i a reshenta na makamai, Armée de Liberation nationale (ALN), a lokacin Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya (1954-62). Daga karshe ya zama sakataren gwamnati a cikin Gouvernement provisoire de la republique algérienne (GPRA), gwamnatin gudun hijira da FLN ta kafa. [1] [2] [3] Bayan samun 'yancin kai a shekarar 1962, an zabe shi a matsayin dan majalisar wakilai, amma bai taka rawar siyasa ba bayan haka.

Ɗalibin shari'a, ya kasance mai fafutukar neman kishin ƙasa daga karshen shekarar 1930s a cikin Parti du peuple algérien (PPA), kuma hukumomin 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa sun ɗaure shi sau da yawa. A cikin shekarar 1948, an kama shi a kan iyakar Libya, yayin da yake kokarin shiga cikin 'yan tawayen Larabawa a Falasdinu. Ya shiga cikin Front de Liberation nationale (FLN), kuma ya yi aiki a matsayin jami'i a reshenta na makamai, Armée de Liberation nationale (ALN), a lokacin Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya (1954-62). Daga ƙarshe ya zama sakataren gwamnati a cikin Gouvernement provisoire de la republique algérienne (GPRA), gwamnatin gudun hijira da FLN ta kafa. [1] [2] [3] Bayan samun 'yancin kai a shekarar 1962, an zaɓe shi a matsayin ɗan majalisar wakilai, amma bai taka rawar siyasa ba bayan haka.

items.sourceText: If insurgents were then sentenced to the death penalty or to hard labor for life, others were simply deported to New Caledonia after being taken prisoner at Fort Quélern, then transported by the ship La Loire to on board thirty-four Algerian political deportees via the ninth convoy that left the port of Brest on 5 June 1874 and arrived at the port of Nouméa on 16 October 1874.[21]

targets.targetText: Idan an yanke wa masu tayar da ƙayar baya hukuncin kisa ko kuma yin aiki mai tsanani na rayuwa, wasu kawai an fitar da su zuwa New Caledonia bayan an kama su a kurkuku a Fort Quélern, sannan jirgin La Loire ya kai shi a kan jirgin 34 na siyasa na Aljeriya ta hanyar jirgin [1] na tara wanda ya bar tashar jiragen ruwa na Brest a ranar 5 ga watan Oktoba 1874 da Noumé a tashar jiragen ruwa na shekarar 1874. [2]

Idan an yanke wa masu tayar da kayar baya hukuncin kisa ko kuma yin aiki mai tsanani na rayuwa, wasu kawai an fitar da su zuwa New Caledonia bayan an kama su a kurkuku a Fort Quélern, sannan jirgin La Loire ya kai shi a kan jirgin 34 na siyasa na Aljeriya ta hanyar jirgin [1] na tara wanda ya bar tashar jiragen ruwa na Brest a kan 5 Oktoba 1874 da Noumé a tashar jiragen ruwa na 1874. [2]

items.sourceText: Born in 1940, Bouyali fought for the National Liberation Front (FLN) in the Algerian War of Independence, becoming a captain. In the 1963–1965 period, he joined the maquis of the FFS, leading to his exclusion from the FLN. He later became an electrician for the national electricity company SONELEC, and had seven children. Near the end of the 1970s, he fell under the influence of imam Abdelhadi Doudi of the El-Achour Mosque, in the south of Algiers and began preaching at this Mosque in 1980. He was described as visionary imam who preached against Western-inspired iniquities of Algerians.[1]

targets.targetText: An haife shi a shekara ta 1940, Bouyali ya yi yaƙi don Ƙungiyar 'Yanci ta Ƙasa (FLN) a Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya, ya zama kyaftin. A cikin lokacin 1963-1965, ya shiga cikin maquis na FFS, wanda ya kai ga cire shi daga FLN. Daga baya ya zama ma’aikacin lantarki na kamfanin wutar lantarki na kasa SONELEC, kuma ya haifi ‘ya’ya bakwai. A kusan karshen shekarun 1970, ya fada karkashin jagorancin limamin masallacin El-Achour, a kudancin Algiers, kuma ya fara wa'azi a wannan masallaci a shekarar 1980. An bayyana shi a matsayin limami mai hangen nesa wanda ya yi wa'azi kan zaluncin Aljeriya da kasashen yamma suka yi. [1]

An haife shi a shekara ta 1940, Bouyali ya yi yaƙi a Ƙungiyar neman 'Yanci ta Ƙasa (FLN) a Yaƙin neman 'Yancin ƙasar Aljeriya, ya zama kyaftin. A cikin shekarun 1963-1965, ya shiga cikin maquis na FFS, wanda ya kai ga cire shi daga FLN. Daga baya ya zama ma’aikacin lantarki na kamfanin wutar lantarki na ƙasa SONELEC, kuma ya haifi ‘ya’ya bakwai. A kusan ƙarshen shekarun 1970, ya faɗa ƙarƙashin jagorancin limamin masallacin El-Achour, a kudancin Algiers, kuma ya fara wa'azi a wannan masallaci a shekarar 1980. An bayyana shi a matsayin limami mai hangen nesa wanda ya yi wa'azi kan zaluncin Aljeriya da ƙasashen yamma suka yi. [1]

items.sourceText: The battle of the borders,[3] was a group of military operations initiated mainly on the Algeria-Tunisia border during the Algerian war, from 21 January to 28 May 1958, by the paratrooper units of the French army against the attacks, and bombardments of the Morice line by the combatants of the Armée de libération nationale (ALN), the military branch of the FLN, stationed in Tunisia.

targets.targetText: Yakin kan iyakoki, [1] wani ruƙuni ne na ayyukan soji da aka fara musamman akan iyakar Aljeriya da Tunisiya a lokacin yakin Aljeriya, daga 21 ga watan Janairu zuwa 28 ga watan Mayu 1958, da ruƙunin sojojin Faransa na yaki da hare-haren, da bama-bamai na layin Morice da mayakan Armée de Liberation Nationale (ALN), reshen Tunisiya, da ke cikin wani reshen soji ta Tunisia.

Yakin kan iyakoki, [1] wani rukuni ne na ayyukan soji da aka fara musamman akan iyakar Aljeriya da Tunisiya a lokacin yakin Aljeriya, daga 21 ga Janairu zuwa 28 ga Mayu 1958, da rukunin sojojin Faransa na yaki da hare-haren, da bama-bamai na layin Morice da mayakan Armée de Liberation Nationale (ALN), reshen Tunisiya, da ke cikin tashar soja ta Tunisia .

items.sourceText: On 16 September 1961, the French learned about a meeting of FLN commanders, including Mohammed Chabani, hiding with around 370 mujahideen fighters in Djebel Bouk'hil. The next day, 17 September the area was completely surrounded, and the battle began.[1][2]

targets.targetText: A ranar 16 ga Satumban 1961, Faransawa ta sami labarin taron kwamandojin FLN, ciki har da Mohammed Chabani, inda suka buya tare da mayakan mujahidai kusan 370 a Djebel Bouk'hil. Washegari, 17 ga Satumba, an kewaye yankin gaba ɗaya, aka fara yaƙi. [1] [2]

A ranar 16 ga watan Satumban 1961, Faransa ta sami labarin taron kwamandojin FLN, ciki har da Mohammed Chabani, inda suka ɓuya tare da mayakan mujahidai kusan 370 a Djebel Bouk'hil. Washegari, 17 ga watan Satumba, an kewaye yankin gaba ɗaya, aka fara yaƙi. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: According to Algerian sources, the battle was a resounding FLN victory, with losses of the French army were as follows: between 400 and 800 dead and more than 1,500 wounded. As well as the loss of large amounts of ammunition 44, the loss of 100 soldiers, the downing of eight aircraft and the destruction of three armored vehicles. 45 and about 150 pieces of weapons such as automatic rifles (50 guns) and others . As for the losses of the National Liberation Army, estimates varied, and in general, they range between 60 and 70 dead and 60-90 Wounded, and 15 weapons lost, it was not possible to keep them on the night of going out while on a mule convoy.[12][13] The FLN leadership ambushed by the French managed to escape, almost miraculously, certain death and encirclement by the superior French army.[3]

targets.targetText: A cewar majiyoyin na Aljeriya, yakin da aka gwabza ya yi nasarar samun nasarar FLN, tare da asarar sojojin Faransa kamar haka: tsakanin 400 zuwa 800 da suka mutu, wasu fiye da 1,500 suka jikkata. Kazalika asarar dimbin alburusai 44, asarar sojoji 100, fadowar jiragen sama 8 da lalata motoci masu sulke guda uku. 45 da kusan guda 150 na makamai kamar bindigogi masu sarrafa kansu (bindigogi 50) da sauransu. Dangane da hasarar da aka yi wa rundunar 'yantar da kasa, alkaluma sun banbanta, kuma a dunkule, sun kai tsakanin mutum 60 zuwa 70 da suka mutu, da kuma jikkata 60-90, da kuma bacewar makamai 15, ba zai yiwu a ajiye su a daren da za a fita ba, yayin da suke cikin ayarin alfadari. [1] [2] Shugabannin FLN da Faransawa suka yi wa kwanton bauna sun yi nasarar tserewa, kusan ta hanyar mu'ujiza, wasu mutuwa da kewaye da manyan sojojin Faransa suka yi. [3]

A cewar majiyoyin na Aljeriya, yakin da aka gwabza ya yi nasarar samun nasarar FLN, tare da asarar sojojin Faransa kamar haka: tsakanin 400 zuwa 800 da suka mutu, wasu fiye da 1,500 suka jikkata. Kazalika asarar ɗimbin alburusai 44, asarar sojoji 100, faɗowar jiragen sama 8 da lalata motoci masu sulke guda uku. 45 da kusan guda 150 na makamai kamar bindigogi masu sarrafa kansu (bindigogi 50) da sauransu. Dangane da hasarar da aka yi wa rundunar 'yantar da ƙasa, alkaluma sun banbanta, kuma a dunkule, sun kai tsakanin mutum 60 zuwa 70 da suka mutu, da kuma jikkata 60-90, da kuma ɓacewar makamai 15, ba zai yiwu a ajiye su a daren da za a fita ba, yayin da suke cikin ayarin alfadari. [1] [2] Shugabannin FLN da Faransawa suka yi wa kwanton ɓauna sun yi nasarar tserewa, kusan ta hanyar mu'ujiza, wasu mutuwa da kewaye da manyan sojojin Faransa suka yi. [3]

items.sourceText: The battle coincided with the 16th day of Ramadan, when 30,000 French colonial soldiers equipped with heavy weapons and supported by tanks, 30 reconnaissance planes and 12 helicopters were sent to encounter 330 mujahideen of the Algerian National Liberation Front armed with makeshift rifles. The FLN militants put up a strong resistance against the French colonial army. As a result of the battle, the Algerians heavily defeated the French colonial army which lost 500 to 700 soldiers killed, 400 seriously wounded and 1 aircraft shot down, while the Algerians only had 120 killed and 60 wounded. A few days later, the French army took revenge by bombarding the entire region of Fellaoucene and the Trara mountains from Nedroma to Ghazaouet with napalm bombs and transferring the population.[2][3][4][5][6]

targets.targetText: Yakin ya zo daidai da ranar 16 ga watan Ramadana, inda aka aike da sojojin Faransa yan mulkin mallaka 30,000 dauke da manyan makamai tare da tankokin yaki, da jiragen bincike 30 da jirage masu saukar ungulu 12 don yin arangama da mujahidai 330 na kungiyar 'yantar da kasar Aljeriya dauke da bindigu na wucin gadi. Mayakan FLN sun yi turjiya mai karfi a kan sojojin Faransa yan mulkin mallaka. A sakamakon yakin, 'yan Aljeriya sun yi kakkausar suka ga sojojin Faransa 'yan mulkin mallaka inda suka kashe sojoji 500 zuwa 700, 400 suka samu munanan raunuka, sannan aka harbo jirgin sama guda 1, yayin da 'yan Aljeriya suka kashe 120 kawai, sannan 60 suka jikkata. Bayan 'yan kwanaki, sojojin Faransa sun dauki fansa ta hanyar kai bama-bamai a yankin Fellaoucene da tsaunin Trara daga Nedroma zuwa Ghazaouet tare da bama-bamai na napalm tare da jigilar jama'a. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5]

Yakin ya zo daidai da ranar 16 ga watan watan Ramadana, inda aka aike da sojojin Faransa yan mulkin mallaka 30,000 ɗauke da manyan makamai tare da tankokin yaki, da jiragen bincike 30 da jirage masu saukar ungulu 12 don yin arangama da mujahidai 330 na kungiyar 'yantar da ƙasar Aljeriya ɗauke da bindigu na wucin gadi. Mayakan FLN sun yi turjiya mai karfi a kan sojojin Faransa yan mulkin mallaka. A sakamakon yakin, 'yan Aljeriya sun yi kakkausar suka ga sojojin Faransa 'yan mulkin mallaka inda suka kashe sojoji 500 zuwa 700, 400 suka samu munanan raunuka, sannan aka harbo jirgin sama guda 1, yayin da 'yan Aljeriya suka kashe 120 kawai, sannan 60 suka jikkata. Bayan 'yan kwanaki, sojojin Faransa sun ɗauki fansa ta hanyar kai bama-bamai a yankin Fellaoucene da tsaunin Trara daga Nedroma zuwa Ghazaouet tare da bama-bamai na napalm tare da jigilar jama'a. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5]

items.sourceText: The ambush led to the complete destruction of the small unit of French marines, with a total of 20 French soldiers killed, including their commander, Hervé Artur. One French soldier was taken prisoner and later released. Algerian losses are unknown, but thought to number around one killed and a few wounded.

targets.targetText: Wannan harin kwanton ɓauna ya kai ga halaka ƙananan ruƙunin sojojin ruwan Faransa gaba ɗaya, inda aka kashe sojojin Faransa 20, ciki har da kwamandansu, Hervé Artur. An kama wani sojan Faransa ɗaya fursuna kuma daga baya aka sake shi. Kawo yanzu dai ba a san asarar da Aljeriya ta yi ba, amma ana kyautata zaton kusan guda ɗaya ne ya mutu, wasu kaɗan kuma suka jikkata.

Wannan harin kwanton bauna ya kai ga halaka kananan rukunin sojojin ruwan Faransa gaba daya, inda aka kashe sojojin Faransa 20, ciki har da kwamandansu, Hervé Artur. An kama wani sojan Faransa daya fursuna kuma daga baya aka sake shi. Kawo yanzu dai ba a san asarar da Aljeriya ta yi ba, amma ana kyautata zaton kusan guda daya ne ya mutu, wasu kadan kuma suka jikkata.

items.sourceText: A decade later, the ensuing political conflicts of the French Fourth Republic, aggravated by the outbreak of the Algerian War and economic discontent, led to popular revolts against the government, which was headed by fractious political parties. The government's policy on Algeria angered the millions of French settlers, army officers and right-wing politicians in France. French Army generals in both Paris and Algiers began exerting pressure on French politicians to return de Gaulle to a position of power.

targets.targetText: Shekaru goma bayan haka, rikice-rikicen siyasa da suka biyo baya na Jamhuriya ta Hudu ta Faransa, sakamakon barkewar yakin Aljeriya da rashin gamsuwa da tattalin arziki, ya haifar da boren jama'a ga gwamnati, wacce ke karkashin jam'iyyun siyasa masu tayar da kayar baya. Manufar gwamnati kan Aljeriya ta fusata miliyoyin mazauna Faransawa, hafsoshin soji da 'yan siyasa na hannun dama a Faransa. Janar-janar din sojojin Faransa a birnin Paris da Algiers sun fara matsa lamba kan 'yan siyasar Faransa su mayar da de Gaulle kan karagar mulki.

Shekaru goma bayan haka, rikice-rikicen siyasa da suka biyo baya na Jamhuriya ta Huɗu ta Faransa, sakamakon ɓarkewar yakin Aljeriya da rashin gamsuwa da tattalin arziki, ya haifar da boren jama'a ga gwamnati, wacce ke ƙarƙashin jam'iyyun siyasa masu tayar da ƙayar baya. Manufar gwamnati kan Aljeriya ta fusata miliyoyin mazauna Faransawa, hafsoshin soji da 'yan siyasa na hannun dama a Faransa. Janar-janar din sojojin Faransa a birnin Paris da Algiers sun fara matsa lamba kan 'yan siyasar Faransa su mayar da de Gaulle kan ƙaragar mulki.

items.sourceText: On 26 March, a crowd of Pied-Noirs marched in the Algerian capital of Algiers in opposition to the Évian Accords, as they did not wish for Algeria to become independent of French colonial rule.[2] The French Army, anticipating violent confrontations with anti-independence Pied-Noirs, had installed roadblocks throughout the city, including one on the Rue d'Isly. As the crowd was attempting to march towards the neighbourhood of Bab El Oued, they were confronted on the Rue d'Isly by 45 soldiers from the French Army's 4th Tirailleur Regiment, which was composed mainly of conscripted Algerian Muslims. This unit was one of the remaining mostly (80%) Muslim infantry regiments of the French Army of Africa. On 17 March 1962 it had been brought into Algiers from active service in the Algerian countryside (bled) to take up urban pacification duties for which the young tirailleurs were not trained or prepared.[6][5]

targets.targetText: A ranar 26 ga watan Maris, taron Pied-Noirs ya yi maci a babban birnin Algiers na Aljeriya domin nuna adawa da yarjejeniyar Évian, saboda ba sa fatan Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai daga turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa. [ 2 ] Sojojin Faransa, suna tsammanin fuskantar tashin hankali tare da adawa da 'yancin kai Pied-Noirs, sun sanya shingen hanya a ko'ina cikin birnin, ciki har da daya a kan Rue d'Isly. A daidai lokacin da jama'a ke yunkurin yin tattaki zuwa unguwar Bab El Oued, sun yi arangama da su a kan Rue d'Isly da sojoji 45 daga runduna ta 4 ta Tirailleur ta sojojin Faransa wadda ta kunshi musulmin Aljeriya da aka tilasta musu shiga aikin. Wannan ruƙunin ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin mafi yawan (80%) na sojojin sojojin Faransa na Sojojin Faransa na Afirka. A ranar 17 ga watan Maris 1962 an kawo shi cikin Algiers daga sabis na aiki a cikin karkarar Aljeriya ( bled) don gudanar da ayyukan samar da zaman lafiya a cikin birane wanda ba a horar da matasan tirailleurs ko shirya don su ba. [1] [ 5 ]

A ranar 26 ga Maris, taron Pied-Noirs ya yi maci a babban birnin Algiers na Aljeriya domin nuna adawa da yarjejeniyar Évian, saboda ba sa fatan Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai daga turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa. [ 2 ] Sojojin Faransa, suna tsammanin fuskantar tashin hankali tare da adawa da 'yancin kai Pied-Noirs, sun sanya shingen hanya a ko'ina cikin birnin, ciki har da daya a kan Rue d'Isly. A daidai lokacin da jama'a ke yunkurin yin tattaki zuwa unguwar Bab El Oued, sun yi arangama da su a kan Rue d'Isly da sojoji 45 daga runduna ta 4 ta Tirailleur ta sojojin Faransa wadda ta kunshi musulmin Aljeriya da aka tilasta musu shiga aikin. Wannan rukunin ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin mafi yawan (80%) na sojojin sojojin Faransa na Sojojin Faransa na Afirka . A ranar 17 ga Maris 1962 an kawo shi cikin Algiers daga sabis na aiki a cikin karkarar Aljeriya ( bled ) don gudanar da ayyukan samar da zaman lafiya a cikin birane wanda ba a horar da matasan tirailleurs ko shirya don su ba. [1] [ 5 ]

items.sourceText: Smith apparently deemed the incident minor in nature and did not report it to his superiors. However, Deighton did report the incident.[1] The governor of Natal, Sir Henry Ernest Gascoyne Bulwer, regarded it as a minor affair, one expected to occur on a border between a European power and a tribal people.[1] Frere initially agreed with this assessment, writing: "I concur with you in attributing no special importance to the seizure and temporary arrest of the surveyors, which was partly due to their own indiscretion, and was evidently in no way sanctioned by the Zulu authorities." [4]

targets.targetText: Da alama Smith ya ɗauki lamarin ƙarami a yanayi kuma bai kai rahoto ga manyansa ba. Sai dai Deighton ya bayar da rahoton faruwar lamarin. [ 1 ] Gwamnan Natal, Sir Henry Ernest Gascoyne Bulwer, ya yi la'akari da shi a matsayin ƙaramin al'amari, wanda ake sa ran zai faru a kan iyaka tsakanin ikon Turai da mutanen ƙabilu. [ 1 ] Da farko Frere ya amince da wannan tantancewar, inda ya rubuta: "Na yarda da ku da cewa ba wani mahimmanci na musamman ga kamawa da kuma kama masu binciken na wucin gadi, wanda wani ɓangare ne na rashin sanin yakamata, kuma a bayyane yake hukumomin Zulu ba su ba da izini ba." [ 4 ]
