items.sourceText: Some weeks after the battle, a larger British force made up of White and Native troops came to a standstill with the same Ashanti army that defeated McCarthy's force. Casualties on the British side included 176 dead and 677 men wounded. After the battle, the British army along with their regular troops withdrew back the coast.[5]

targets.targetText: Makonni kaɗan bayan yakin, wata babbar rundunar Birtaniyya da ta kunshi sojojin White da na 'yan asalin ƙasar sun tsaya cik tare da sojojin Ashanti guda daya da suka ci karfin McCarthy. Waɗanda suka mutu a ɓangaren Birtaniyya sun haɗa da mutuwar mutane 176 da kuma wasu mutane 677 da suka jikkata. Bayan yakin, sojojin Birtaniya tare da sojojinsu na yau da kullum sun janye daga bakin teku. [1]

Makonni kadan bayan yakin, wata babbar rundunar Birtaniyya da ta kunshi sojojin White da na 'yan asalin kasar sun tsaya cik tare da sojojin Ashanti guda daya da suka ci karfin McCarthy. Wadanda suka mutu a bangaren Birtaniyya sun hada da mutuwar mutane 176 da kuma wasu mutane 677 da suka jikkata. Bayan yakin, sojojin Birtaniya tare da sojojinsu na yau da kullum sun janye daga bakin teku. [1]

items.sourceText: The Battle of Amoaful was fought on 31 January 1874 during the Third Anglo-Ashanti War when Sir Garnet Wolseley defeated the Ashantis after strong resistance.[2] The attack was led by the 42nd Regiment of Foot.[2] At Amoaful, one combat post-mortem pays tribute to the Ashanti commander: "The great Chief Amanquatia was among the killed. Admirable skill was shown in the position selected by Amanquatia, and the determination and generalship he displayed in the defence fully bore out his great reputation as an able tactician and gallant soldier."[3] Lance-Sergeant Samuel McGaw was awarded the Victoria Cross for action during the battle.[4]

targets.targetText: An yi yakin Amoaful ne a ranar 31 ga Janairun 1874 a lokacin yakin Anglo-Ashanti na uku lokacin da Sir Garnet Wolseley ya ci Ashantis bayan turjiya mai karfi. [1] Rundunar ta 42 ce ta jagoranci harin. [1] A Amoaful, daya daga cikin wadanda aka kashe a cikin fada ya ba da lambar yabo ga kwamandan Ashanti: "Babban Cif Amanquatia yana cikin wadanda aka kashe. An nuna fasaha mai ban sha'awa a matsayin da Amanquatia ya zaba, kuma jajircewa da jajircewar da ya nuna a cikin tsaro ya haifar da babban suna a matsayinsa na ƙwararren mai dabara da soja mai jajircewa." [2] Lance-Sergeant Samuel McGaw an ba shi kyautar Victoria Cross don aiki a lokacin yakin. [3]

An yi yakin Amoaful ne a ranar 31 ga watan Janairun 1874 a lokacin yakin Anglo-Ashanti na uku lokacin da Sir Garnet Wolseley ya ci Ashantis bayan turjiya mai karfi da ya fuskanta. [1] Rundunar ta 42 ce ta jagoranci harin. [1] A Amoaful, ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda aka kashe a cikin faɗan ya ba da lambar yabo ga kwamandan Ashanti: "Babban Cif Amanquatia yana cikin waɗanda aka kashe. An nuna fasaha mai ban sha'awa a matsayin da Amanquatia ya zaɓa, kuma jajircewa da jajircewar da ya nuna a cikin tsaro ya haifar da babban suna a matsayinsa na ƙwararren mai dabara da soja mai jajircewa." [2] Lance-Sergeant Samuel McGaw an ba shi kyautar Victoria Cross don aiki a lokacin yakin. [3]

items.sourceText: Abdellah Belhouchet (1924 – September 16, 2003) was an Algerian military officer and nationalist activist, best known for his role during the Algerian War of Independence and in the development of the Algerian People's National Army (ANP).[1] Belhouchet assumed various positions throughout his military career, including chief of staff of the People's National Army from 1986 to 1988, and served as deputy minister of National Defense.[2] He was also a member of the National Council of the Algerian Revolution and the Revolutionary Council and military advisor to president Chadli Bendjedid.[3]

targets.targetText: Abdellah Belhouchet (1924 - Satumba 16, 2003) hafsan sojan Aljeriya ne kuma mai fafutukar kishin ƙasa, wanda aka fi sani da rawar da ya taka a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya da kuma ci gaban rundunar sojojin ƙasar Aljeriya (ANP). [1] Belhouchet ya riƙe muƙamai daban-daban a tsawon aikinsa na soja, ciki har da babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin ƙasar daga shekarun 1986 zuwa 1988, kuma ya kasance mataimakin ministan tsaro na ƙasa . [2] Har ila yau, ya kasance memba na majalisar ƙasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya da majalisar juyin juya hali kuma mai bai wa shugaba Chadli Bendjedid shawara kan harkokin soji. [3]

Abdellah Belhouchet (1924 - Satumba 16, 2003) hafsan sojan Aljeriya ne kuma mai fafutukar kishin kasa, wanda aka fi sani da rawar da ya taka a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Aljeriya da kuma ci gaban rundunar sojojin kasar Aljeriya (ANP). [1] Belhouchet ya rike mukamai daban-daban a tsawon aikinsa na soja, ciki har da babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin kasar daga 1986 zuwa 1988, kuma ya kasance mataimakin ministan tsaro na kasa . [2] Har ila yau, ya kasance memba na majalisar kasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya da majalisar juyin juya hali kuma mai ba shugaba Chadli Bendjedid shawara kan harkokin soji . [3]

items.sourceText: In the 1991 documentary The Algerian Years, Mohammedi detailed the activities of his soldiers who took part in the massacre of Melouza, against the messalists. At the end of his life, he was a supporter of the Islamic Salvation Front, which he saw as a popular movement capable of changing the regime in place.

targets.targetText: A cikin shirin 1991 na shekarun Aljeriya, Mohammedi ya yi cikakken bayani game da ayyukan sojojinsa da suka shiga cikin kisan kiyashin da aka yi wa Melouza, a kan masu tsattsauran ra'ayi. A karshen rayuwarsa ya kasance mai goyon bayan jam'iyyar ceto ta Musulunci, wadda yake ganin wata kungiya ce ta jama'a da za ta iya sauya tsarin mulki a wurin.

A cikin shekarar shirin 1991 na shekarun Aljeriya, Mohammedi ya yi cikakken bayani game da ayyukan sojojinsa da suka shiga cikin kisan kiyashin da aka yi wa Melouza, a kan masu tsattsauran ra'ayi. A ƙarshen rayuwarsa ya kasance mai goyon bayan jam'iyyar ceto ta Musulunci, wacce yake ganin wata kungiya ce ta jama'a da za ta iya sauya tsarin mulki a wurin.

items.sourceText: He became a member of the Federation of France's National Liberation Front from 1957, then member of the National Council of the Algerian Revolution from 1957 to 1962[6] He then went to Tunisia where he led the newspaper El Moudjahid which appeared in the French language. He is the author of the article known as "The information poisoned", which was a source of controversy between the Tunisian Government and the Provisional Government of the Algerian Republic. It represented the Provisional Government along with Mohamed Seddik Benyahia in Melun talks at June 1960 and participated in the first negotiations in Evian.[7] During the internal crisis that occurred after independence, Boumendjel rallied with Ferhat Abbas to form the Ben Bella group. He was appointed Minister of Public Works in September 1962 to 1963.

targets.targetText: Ya zama memba na Tarayyar Jam'iyyar 'Yancin Kasar Faransa daga shekarar 1957, sannan ya zama memba na Majalisar kasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya daga 1957 zuwa 1962 [1] Daga nan ya tafi Tunisiya inda ya jagoranci jaridar El Moudjahid wadda ta fito cikin harshen Faransanci. Shi ne ya rubuta labarin da aka fi sani da "Bayanan da aka kashe", wanda ya haifar da cece-kuce tsakanin gwamnatin Tunisiya da gwamnatin wucin gadi ta Jamhuriyar Aljeriya. Ta wakilci gwamnatin wucin gadi tare da Mohamed Seddik Benyahia a tattaunawar Melun a watan Yuni 1960 kuma ta shiga cikin tattaunawar farko a Evian . [2] A lokacin rikicin cikin gida da ya faru bayan samun 'yancin kai, Boumendjel ya hada kai da Ferhat Abbas don kafa kungiyar Ben Bella . An nada shi Ministan Ayyukan Jama’a a watan Satumba 1962 zuwa 1963.

Ya zama memba na Tarayyar Jam'iyyar 'Yancin Ƙasar Faransa daga shekarar 1957, sannan ya zama memba na Majalisar ƙasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya daga shekarun 1957 zuwa 1962 [1] Daga nan ya tafi Tunisiya inda ya jagoranci jaridar El Moudjahid wacce ta fito cikin harshen Faransanci. Shi ne ya rubuta labarin da aka fi sani da "Bayanan da aka kashe", wanda ya haifar da cece-kuce tsakanin gwamnatin Tunisiya da gwamnatin wucin gadi ta Jamhuriyar Aljeriya. Ta wakilci gwamnatin wucin gadi tare da Mohamed Seddik Benyahia a tattaunawar Melun a watan Yuni 1960 kuma ta shiga cikin tattaunawar farko a Evian. [2] A lokacin rikicin cikin gida da ya faru bayan samun 'yancin kai, Boumendjel ya haɗa kai da Ferhat Abbas don kafa kungiyar Ben Bella. An naɗa shi Ministan Ayyukan Jama’a a watan Satumba 1962 zuwa 1963.

items.sourceText: Boulahrouf was also a reader of al-Umma newspaper, organ of the Star of North Africa party, and contributed to the formation of the first groups of Muslim Scouts in the region of Annaba.[3] He also participated in organizing a demonstration of solidarity with the Tunisian Destour Party and was first arrested in 1938. As soon as the Algerian People's Party was dissolved, Boulahrouf's activity took place underground and he worked to broaden the grassroots of the party dissolved. He participated in the founding of the Movement of Friends of the Manifesto and Liberty. He was one of the organizers of the events of May 8, 1945, which earned him to be arrested again to be released after the proclamation of amnesty for political prisoners.

targets.targetText: Boulahrouf ya kuma kasance mai karanta jaridar al-Umma, kungiyar jam'iyyar Star of North Africa, kuma ya ba da gudunmawa wajen kafa kungiyoyin musulmin Scout na farko a yankin Annaba. [1] Ya kuma shiga cikin shirya zanga-zangar nuna goyon baya da Jam'iyyar Destour ta Tunisiya kuma an kama shi a shekara ta 1938. Da aka ruguje jam'iyyar Aljeriya, Boulahrouf ya fara gudanar da ayyukansa a ƙarƙashin ƙasa, inda ya yi kokarin faɗaɗa tushen jam'iyyar. Ya shiga cikin kafa ƙungiyar Abokan Manifesto da 'Yanci. Yana ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka shirya abubuwan da suka faru a ranar 8 ga watan Mayu, 1945, wanda ya sa aka sake kama shi don a sake shi bayan ayyana yin afuwa ga fursunonin siyasa.

Boulahrouf ya kuma kasance mai karanta jaridar al-Umma, kungiyar jam'iyyar Star of North Africa, kuma ya ba da gudunmawa wajen kafa kungiyoyin musulmin Scout na farko a yankin Annaba. [1] Ya kuma shiga cikin shirya zanga-zangar nuna goyon baya da Jam'iyyar Destour ta Tunisiya kuma an kama shi a shekara ta 1938. Da aka ruguje jam'iyyar Aljeriya, Boulahrouf ya fara gudanar da ayyukansa a karkashin kasa, inda ya yi kokarin fadada tushen jam'iyyar. Ya shiga cikin kafa kungiyar Abokan Manifesto da 'Yanci . Yana daya daga cikin wadanda suka shirya abubuwan da suka faru a ranar 8 ga Mayu, 1945, wanda ya sa aka sake kama shi don a sake shi bayan ayyana yin afuwa ga fursunonin siyasa.

items.sourceText: In 1951, his parliamentary mandate ended, and three years later, an armed rebellion for Algeria's independence erupted led by the Front de libération nationale (FLN), a PPA/MTLD splinter group. In 1956, Lamine Debaghine was made a member of the FLN's exterior delegation (i.e. outside the country) and its shadow parliament, the CNRA, later CCE.[5] Lamine Debaghine was elected minister of foreign affairs in the first lineup of the FLN's government-in-exile, GPRA, under Ferhat Abbas's presidency, holding the post for the period 1958-1960. In this role, he served as a primary spokesman of the FLN to the outside world, and worked to build alliances with the newly independent countries of the Arab world and other regions. However, being outside the country, he had limited authority over the actual armed rebellion of the FLN's armed wing, the Armée de libération nationale (ALN). A Time Magazine article from 1957 described him as Abbas's close collaborator, "Dr. Mohammed Lamine-Debaghine, 40, [the] bitterly anti-French veteran nationalist who is subject to bouts of depression caused by attacks of neuralgia that partially paralyze his face."[6] As an ally of Abane Ramdane, he was later sidelined by Ramdane's rivals, including Ahmed Ben Bella and others, and he was excluded from the GPRA's two following ministerial lineups, as well as from any important role in post-independence politics.[3]

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 1951, wa'adinsa na majalisa ya ƙare, kuma bayan shekaru uku, tawaye da makamai don 'yancin kai na Aljeriya ya ɓarke a ƙarƙashin jagorancin Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN), ƙungiyar PPA/MTLD. A cikin shekarar 1956, Lamine Debaghine ya zama memba na wakilan FLN na waje (watau a wajen ƙasar) da majalisar inuwarta, CNRA, daga baya CCE. [1] An zaɓi Lamine Debaghine a matsayin ministar harkokin waje a cikin jerin gwano na farko na gwamnatin FLN na gudun hijira, GPRA, ƙarƙashin shugabancin Ferhat Abbas, tana riƙe da muƙamin na tsawon lokaci 1958-1960. A cikin wannan rawar, ya yi aiki a matsayin mai magana da yawun FLN na farko ga ƙasashen waje, kuma ya yi aiki don kulla kawance da sabbin ƙasashen Larabawa masu cin gashin kansu da sauran yankuna. Duk da haka, kasancewarsa a wajen ƙasar, yana da iyakacin iko kan ainihin tawayen da ke ɗauke da makamai na reshen FLN, Armée de Liberation nationale (ALN). Wani labarin da Mujallar Time ta buga a shekarar 1957 ta bayyana shi a matsayin na kusa da Abbas, "Dr. Mohammed Lamine-Debaghine, mai shekaru 40, [wanda] tsohon sojan kishin ƙasa na Faransa wanda ke fama da tsananin damuwa sakamakon hare-haren neuralgia wanda wani ɓangare ya gurgunta fuskarsa." [2] A matsayinsa na aminin Abane Ramdane, daga baya abokan hamayyar Ramdane, ciki har da Ahmed Ben Bella da sauran su suka yi watsi da shi, kuma an cire shi daga jerin ministoci biyu na GPRA, da kuma shiga duk wata muhimmiyar rawa a siyasar bayan samun 'yancin kai. [3]

A shekara ta 1951, wa'adinsa na majalisa ya ƙare, kuma bayan shekaru uku, tawaye da makamai don 'yancin kai na Aljeriya ya barke a karkashin jagorancin Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN), ƙungiyar PPA/MTLD. A cikin 1956, Lamine Debaghine ya zama memba na wakilan FLN na waje (watau a wajen ƙasar) da majalisar inuwarta, CNRA, daga baya CCE. [1] An zabi Lamine Debaghine a matsayin ministar harkokin waje a cikin jerin gwano na farko na gwamnatin FLN na gudun hijira, GPRA, karkashin shugabancin Ferhat Abbas, tana rike da mukamin na tsawon lokaci 1958-1960. A cikin wannan rawar, ya yi aiki a matsayin mai magana da yawun FLN na farko ga kasashen waje, kuma ya yi aiki don kulla kawance da sabbin kasashen Larabawa masu cin gashin kansu da sauran yankuna. Duk da haka, kasancewarsa a wajen ƙasar, yana da iyakacin iko kan ainihin tawayen da ke ɗauke da makamai na reshen FLN, Armée de Liberation nationale (ALN). Wani labarin da Mujallar Time ta buga a shekarar 1957 ta bayyana shi a matsayin na kusa da Abbas, "Dr. Mohammed Lamine-Debaghine, mai shekaru 40, [wanda] tsohon sojan kishin kasa na Faransa wanda ke fama da tsananin damuwa sakamakon hare-haren neuralgia wanda wani bangare ya gurgunta fuskarsa." [2] A matsayinsa na aminin Abane Ramdane, daga baya abokan hamayyar Ramdane, ciki har da Ahmed Ben Bella da sauran su suka yi watsi da shi, kuma an cire shi daga jerin ministoci biyu na GPRA, da kuma shiga duk wata muhimmiyar rawa a siyasar bayan samun yancin kai. [3]

items.sourceText: In 1921 Latif founded the United Tribes Society; an organisation that called for an independent Sudan in which power would be shared by tribal and religious leaders. Latif gained prominence in 1922, after he wrote an article for the al-Hadarah newspaper supporting the cause of sedition and Sudanese nationalism. In the article, titled "Claim of the Sudanese Nation," Latif pressed for Sudanese self-determination, more education, an end to the sugar monopoly, and higher posts for Sudanese in the Anglo-Egyptian administration.[4]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1921 Latif ya kafa United Tribes Society ; kungiyar da ta yi kira ga kasar Sudan mai cin gashin kanta wacce shugabannin kabilu da na addini za su raba madafun iko. A shekarar 1922 ne Latif ya yi fice, bayan ya rubuta wata kasida ga jaridar al-Hadarah da ke goyon bayan yunkurin tayar da fitina da kishin kasar Sudan. A cikin labarin, mai taken "Da'awar al'ummar Sudan," Laf ya matsa don cin gashin kai na Sudan, ƙarin ilimi, kawo karshen tsarin sukari, da manyan mukamai ga Sudan a cikin gwamnatin Anglo-Masar . [1]

A cikin shekarar 1921 Latif ya kafa United Tribes Society ; kungiyar da ta yi kira ga ƙasar Sudan mai cin gashin kanta wacce shugabannin ƙabilu da na addini za su raba madafun iko. A shekarar 1922 ne Latif ya yi fice, bayan ya rubuta wata kasida ga jaridar al-Hadarah da ke goyon bayan yunkurin tayar da fitina da kishin ƙasar Sudan. A cikin labarin, mai taken "Da'awar al'ummar Sudan," Laf ya matsa don cin gashin kai na Sudan, ƙarin ilimi, kawo karshen tsarin sukari, da manyan muƙamai ga Sudan a cikin gwamnatin Anglo-Masar. [1]

items.sourceText: In U.S, Ojike lectured extensively[7] about his experience living in an African cultural environment and his views about colonialism and racism. He wrote rejoinders to articles that portrayed Africa in a negative light[8] in addition to writing two books and a pamphlet on African culture. His books explained cultural practices and debunked the notion of African inferiority.[9] In My Africa, he introduced Americans to his culture partly as a way to promote a cultural relationship between the two cultures. In America, he embraced and learned about a democratic system of governance. He was also passionate about cultural and political nationalism, he rejected colonialism as detrimental to democracy and the idea that African society is a passing culture.[8] Though a cultural nationalist, Ojike did not believe in rejection of all forms of Western culture but the notion of 'cultural plasticity' where Africans borrow certain aspects of a foreign culture but still retain the core social and political values that promotes stability, progress and dignity.[9]

targets.targetText: A Amurka, Ojike ya yi lacca sosai [ 7 ] game da kwarewarsa ta rayuwa a cikin yanayin al'adun Afirka da ra'ayinsa game da 'yan mulkin mallaka da wariyar launin fata. Ya rubuta sake haɗawa zuwa labaran da ke nuna Afirka a cikin mummunan haske [ 8 ] ban da rubuta littattafai biyu da ƙasida kan al'adun Afirka. Littattafansa sun bayyana ayyukan al'adu kuma sun yi watsi da ra'ayi na kasan Afirka. [ 9 ] A cikin Afirka tawa, ya gabatar da jama'ar Amirka ga al'adunsa wani ɓangare a matsayin hanyar inganta dangantakar al'adu tsakanin al'adun biyu. A Amurka, ya rungumi kuma ya koyi tsarin mulkin dimokradiyya. Ya kuma kasance mai kishin al'adu da siyasa, ya ki amincewa da 'yan mulkin mallaka a matsayin illa ga dimokuradiyya da ra'ayin cewa al'ummar Afirka al'ada ce mai wucewa. [ 8 ] Ko da yake ɗan kishin ƙasa na al'adu, Ojike bai yarda da kin amincewa da duk wani nau'i na al'adun Yammacin Turai ba amma ra'ayi na 'al'adar al'ada' inda 'yan Afirka ke aro wasu al'amuran al'adun ƙasashen waje amma har yanzu suna riƙe da ainihin dabi'un zamantakewa da siyasa waɗanda ke inganta zaman lafiya, ci gaba da mutunci. [ 9 ]

A Amurka, Ojike ya yi lacca sosai [ 7 ] game da kwarewarsa ta rayuwa a cikin yanayin al'adun Afirka da ra'ayinsa game da mulkin mallaka da wariyar launin fata. Ya rubuta sake haɗawa zuwa labaran da ke nuna Afirka a cikin mummunan haske [ 8 ] ban da rubuta littattafai biyu da ƙasida kan al'adun Afirka. Littattafansa sun bayyana ayyukan al'adu kuma sun yi watsi da ra'ayi na kasan Afirka. [ 9 ] A cikin Afirka tawa, ya gabatar da jama'ar Amirka ga al'adunsa wani bangare a matsayin hanyar inganta dangantakar al'adu tsakanin al'adun biyu. A Amurka, ya rungumi kuma ya koyi tsarin mulkin dimokradiyya. Ya kuma kasance mai kishin al'adu da siyasa, ya ki amincewa da mulkin mallaka a matsayin illa ga dimokuradiyya da ra'ayin cewa al'ummar Afirka al'ada ce mai wucewa. [ 8 ] Ko da yake dan kishin kasa na al'adu, Ojike bai yarda da kin amincewa da duk wani nau'i na al'adun Yammacin Turai ba amma ra'ayi na 'al'adar al'ada' inda 'yan Afirka ke aro wasu al'amuran al'adun kasashen waje amma har yanzu suna riƙe da ainihin dabi'un zamantakewa da siyasa waɗanda ke inganta zaman lafiya, ci gaba da mutunci. [ 9 ]

items.sourceText: Ojike believed in selective importation and imitation. He wanted Africa to be economical free and politically independent. One of his slogans was "boycott the boycottables",[15] a reduction in consumption of Western goods but investments in education and other economically productive ventures.[15] He preferred palm wine to imported gin and promoted the wearing of African clothes among elites civil servants. He voiced support for the introduction of an African national costume and supported African music and dance, his interest in African music led the founding of the All African Dance Association.

targets.targetText: Ojike ya yi imani da shigo da zaɓaɓɓu da kwaikwayo. Ya so Afirka ta kasance mai 'yanci ta fuskar tattalin arziki da siyasa. Ɗaya daga cikin takensa shine "kauracewa ƙauracewa ƙauracewa", [ 15 ] rage yawan amfani da kayayyakin Yammacin Turai amma saka hannun jari a fannin ilimi da sauran harkokin tattalin arziki. [ 15 ] Ya fi son giyar dabino fiye da gin da ake shigo da shi daga kasashen waje kuma ya inganta sanya tufafin Afirka a tsakanin manyan ma'aikatan gwamnati. Ya nuna goyon bayansa ga bullo da wata rigar kasa ta Afirka tare da tallafawa kade-kade da raye-rayen Afirka, sha'awarsa ga wakokin Afirka ne ya jagoranci kafa kungiyar raye-rayen Afirka ta Duka.

Ɗaya daga cikin takensa shine "kauracewa ƙauracewa ƙauracewa", [ 15 ] rage yawan amfani da kayayyakin Yammacin Turai amma saka hannun jari a fannin ilimi da sauran harkokin tattalin arziki. [ 15 ] Ya fi son giyar dabino fiye da gin da ake shigo da shi daga ƙasashen waje kuma ya inganta sanya tufafin Afirka a tsakanin manyan ma'aikatan gwamnati. Ya nuna goyon bayansa ga ɓullo da wata rigar ƙasa ta Afirka tare da tallafawa kaɗe-kaɗe da raye-rayen Afirka, sha'awarsa ga wakokin Afirka ne ya jagoranci kafa kungiyar raye-rayen Afirka ta Duka.

items.sourceText: In the days leading up to the sultan's speech, French colonial forces in Casablanca, specifically Senegalese Tirailleurs serving the French colonial empire, carried out a massacre of working class Moroccans. The massacre lasted for about 24 hours from 7–8 April 1947, as the tirailleurs fired randomly into residential buildings in working-class neighborhoods, killing 180 Moroccan civilians. The conflict was instigated in attempt to sabotage the Sultan's journey to Tangier, though after having returned to Casablanca to comfort the families of the victims, the Sultan then proceeded to Tangier to deliver the historic speech.[5][6]

targets.targetText: A kwanakin baya gabanin jawabin Sarkin, sojojin Faransa na mulkin mallaka a Casablanca, musamman Tirailleurs na Senegal da ke yiwa daular Faransa mulkin mallaka, sun aiwatar da kisan kiyashi kan 'yan Morocco masu aiki. Kisan kiyashin ya dauki kusan awanni 24 daga 7-8 ga Afrilu 1947, yayin da ‘yan tirailleurs suka yi harbi ba kakkautawa a cikin gine-ginen zama a unguwannin masu aiki, inda suka kashe farar hula 180 na Morocco. Rikicin dai ya taso ne da nufin yi wa tafiyar Sarkin Musulmi zagon kasa zuwa Tangier, ko da yake bayan ya koma Casablanca domin ta'aziyyar iyalan wadanda lamarin ya shafa, Sarkin Musulmi ya zarce zuwa Tangier don gabatar da jawabi mai cike da tarihi. [1] [2]

A kwanakin baya gabanin jawabin Sarkin, sojojin Faransa na mulkin mallaka a Casablanca, musamman Tirailleurs na Senegal da ke yiwa daular Faransa ta 'yan mulkin mallaka aiki , sun aiwatar da kisan kiyashi kan 'yan Morocco masu aiki. Kisan kiyashin ya ɗauki kusan awanni 24 daga ranakun 7-8 ga watan Afrilu 1947, yayin da ‘yan tirailleurs suka yi harbi ba kakkautawa a cikin gine-ginen zama a unguwannin masu aiki, inda suka kashe farar hula 180 na Morocco. Rikicin dai ya taso ne da nufin yi wa tafiyar Sarkin Musulmi zagon ƙasa zuwa Tangier, ko da yake bayan ya koma Casablanca domin ta'aziyyar iyalan waɗanda lamarin ya shafa, Sarkin Musulmi ya zarce zuwa Tangier don gabatar da jawabi mai cike da tarihi. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Assou Oubasslam was born in 1890[1][2][3] in Ksar Taghya, south of Tinghir. His full name was Aissa Ou Ali n Ait Baslam. His father was the leader (amghar n-tmazirt) of the Ilimshan clan of the Ait Atta.[4] He was a Sufi, a charismatic leader, influenced by the leadership role of his father. In 1919, he was appointed as the tribal leader of "Ilm Chan". As the French colonial occupation advanced and posed a threat to the eastern High Atlas, he took command of the Amazigh resistance against the French colonizers and their collaborators. Assou Oubasslam engaged in numerous battles, most notably the Battle of Bougafer in 1933, where he achieved a significant victory against the French.

targets.targetText: An haifi Assou Oubasslam a shekara ta 1890 [1] [2] [3] a Ksar Taghya, kudu da Tinghir . Cikakken sunansa Aissa Ou Ali n Ait Baslam . Mahaifinsa shi ne shugaban ( amghar n-tmazirt ) na gidan Ilimshan na Ait Atta. [4] Shi Sufi ne, shugaba mai kwarjini, wanda aikin mahaifinsa ya rinjayi shi. A 1919, an nada shi a matsayin shugaban kabilar "Ilm Chan". Yayin da mulkin mallaka na Faransa ya ci gaba kuma yana yin barazana ga Gabashin High Atlas, ya dauki kwamandan tsayin daka na Amazigh a kan masu mulkin mallaka na Faransa da masu haɗin gwiwa. Assou Oubasslam ya sha fadace-fadace da dama, musamman yakin Bougafer a shekarar 1933, inda ya samu gagarumar nasara a kan Faransawa.

An haifi Assou Oubasslam a shekara ta 1890 [1] [2] [3] a Ksar Taghya, kudu da Tinghir. Cikakken sunansa Aissa Ou Ali n Ait Baslam. Mahaifinsa shi ne shugaban ( amghar n-tmazirt) na gidan Ilimshan na Ait Atta. [4] Shi Sufi ne, shugaba mai kwarjini, wanda aikin mahaifinsa ya rinjayi shi. A shekarar 1919, an naɗa shi a matsayin shugaban kabilar "Ilm Chan". Yayin da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa ya ci gaba kuma yana yin barazana ga Gabashin High Atlas, ya ɗauki kwamandan tsayin daka na Amazigh a kan masu mulkin mallaka na Faransa da masu haɗin gwiwa. Assou Oubasslam ya sha faɗace-faɗace da dama, musamman yakin Bougafer a shekarar 1933, inda ya samu gagarumar nasara a kan Faransawa.

items.sourceText: Thousands of Moroccans lost their lives in this battle, and the French forces employed systematic genocide. The civilian casualties in Bougafer were estimated at four thousand, including children and women.[1] The resistance of Assou Oubasslam only surrendered on March 25, 1933,[2] after enduring a prolonged siege by land and air. The resistance of Assou Oubasslam came to an end.

targets.targetText: Dubban 'yan Moroko ne suka rasa rayukansu a wannan yakin, kuma sojojin Faransa sun yi amfani da kisan kare dangi. Fararen hula da aka kashe a Bougafer sun kai dubu huɗu, da suka haɗa da yara da mata. [1] Juriya na Assou Oubasslam ya miƙa wuya ne kawai a ranar 25 ga watan Maris, 1933, [2] bayan ya jimre da tsayin daka ta ƙasa da iska. Juriyar Assou Oubasslam ta zo ƙarshe.

Dubban 'yan Moroko ne suka rasa rayukansu a wannan yakin, kuma sojojin Faransa sun yi amfani da kisan kare dangi. Fararen hula da aka kashe a Bougafer sun kai dubu hudu, da suka hada da yara da mata. [1] Juriya na Assou Oubasslam ya mika wuya ne kawai a ranar 25 ga Maris, 1933, [2] bayan ya jimre da tsayin daka ta kasa da iska. Juriyar Assou Oubasslam ta zo karshe.

items.sourceText: The parties agreed to hold elections for the National Assembly of Angola in October 1975. From 31 January 1975 to independence, a transitional government consisting of the Portuguese High Commissioner Admiral Rosa Coutinho and a Prime Ministerial Council (PMC) would rule. The PMC consisted of three representatives, one from each Angolan party to the agreement, with a rotating premiership among the representatives. Every PMC decision required two-thirds support. The twelve ministries were divided among the Angolan parties and the Portuguese government, three for each. The author Witney Wright Schneidman criticised that provision in Engaging Africa: Washington and the Fall of Portugal's Colonial Empire for ensuring a "virtual paralysis in executive authority". The Bureau of Intelligence and Research cautioned that an excessive desire to preserve the balance of power in the agreement restricted the transitional Angolan government's ability to function.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Jam’iyyun sun amince da gudanar da zaɓen ‘yan majalisar dokokin Angola a watan Oktoban shekarar 1975. Daga ranar 31 ga watan Janairu 1975 zuwa 'yancin kai, gwamnatin riƙon kwarya da ta kunshi Babban Kwamishinan Portugal Admiral Rosa Coutinho da Majalisar Firayim Minista (PMC) za ta yi mulki. PMC ta ƙunshi wakilai uku, ɗaya daga kowace jam'iyyar Angola da ke kan yarjejeniyar, tare da shugabancin karɓa-karɓa tsakanin wakilan. Kowane shawarar PMC na buƙatar goyon bayan kashi biyu bisa uku. An raba ma'aikatun goma sha biyu a tsakanin jam'iyyun Angola da gwamnatin Portugal, uku na kowanne. Marubucin Witney Wright Schneidman ya soki wannan tanadi a cikin Haɗakar da Afirka: Washington da Faɗuwar Daular Mulkin Mallaka ta Portugal don tabbatar da "gurguwar dabi'a a cikin ikon zartarwa". Ofishin leken asiri da bincike ya yi gargadin cewa wuce gona da iri na son kiyaye daidaiton iko a cikin yarjejeniyar ta hana gwamnatin riƙon kwarya ta Angola damar yin aiki. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: The negative publicity put pressure on the British parliament to take action to salvage Britain's deteriorating image. Colonial detention camps were closed throughout Kenya, and the prisoners were freed soon after.[12] Attempts were then made to find a solution to maintaining British interests in Africa without the use of force, indirectly leading to a hastening of independence across British colonies in Africa.[13] In British novelist Graham Greene's 1960 novel A Burnt-Out Case, "Hola Camp" is listed alongside Sharpeville and Algiers as a site which had justified Africans in "all possible belief in European cruelty."

targets.targetText: Wannan mummunar tallar ta sanya matsin lamba ga majalisar dokokin Biritaniya da ta ɗauki matakin ceto martabar Burtaniya da ke kara taɓarɓarewa. An rufe sansanonin tsare ‘yan mulkin mallaka a duk faɗin Kenya, kuma an sako fursunonin ba da jimawa ba. [1] Daga nan ne aka yi ƙoƙarin samar da mafita don kiyaye muradun Birtaniyya a Afirka ba tare da amfani da karfin tuwo ba, wanda hakan ya kai ga gaggauta samun ‘yancin kai a duk faɗin ƙasashen Afirka da Birtaniya ta yi wa mulkin mallaka. [2] A cikin littafin marubuci ɗan Burtaniya Graham Greene na 1960 A Burnt-Out Case, "Hola Camp" an jera shi tare da Sharpeville da Algiers a matsayin wani shafi wanda ya ba da hujjar 'yan Afirka a cikin "dukkan yiwuwar yarda da zalunci na Turai."

An rufe sansanonin tsare ‘yan mulkin mallaka a duk fadin Kenya, kuma an sako fursunonin ba da jimawa ba. [2] A cikin littafin marubuci ɗan Burtaniya Graham Greene na 1960 A Burnt-Out Case, "Hola Camp" an jera shi tare da Sharpeville da Algiers a matsayin wani shafi wanda ya ba da hujjar 'yan Afirka a cikin "dukkan yiwuwar yarda da zalunci na Turai."

items.sourceText: Members of the group have taken several foreign citizens hostage in Cabinda. In May 2000, FLEC-FAC kidnapped three foreign and one local employee of a Portuguese contractor who were released in two months.[1]

targets.targetText: Mambobin kungiyar sun yi garkuwa da wasu ‘yan kasashen waje a Cabinda. A watan Mayun 2000, FLEC-FAC ta yi garkuwa da wasu 'yan kasashen waje uku da ma'aikacin gida daya na wani dan kwangila na kasar Portugal wadanda aka sako cikin watanni biyu. [1]

Mambobin ƙungiyar sun yi garkuwa da wasu ‘yan ƙasashen waje a Cabinda. A watan Mayun 2000, FLEC-FAC ta yi garkuwa da wasu 'yan ƙasashen waje uku da ma'aikacin gida ɗaya na wani ɗan kwangila na ƙasar Portugal waɗanda aka sako cikin watanni biyu. [1]

items.sourceText: France has had a large interest in Angola. The French oil giant TotalEnergies which made a new offshore oil discovery in October 2009, has been expanding its presence in Angola. The country is the second largest contributor for production of TotalEnergies after Nigeria.[7] According to Angolan media, France and Portugal will allow extradition of leaders of the separatist movement in the wake of the 2010 attacks on Togo's football team for which FLEC claimed the responsibility.[8]

targets.targetText: Faransa na da sha'awar Angola sosai. Katafaren kamfanin mai na ƙasar Faransa TotalEnergies wanda ya yi wani sabon binciken mai a teku a watan Oktoban 2009, yana ƙara faɗaɗa kasancewarsa a ƙasar Angola. Ƙasar ita ce kasa ta biyu mafi yawan bayar da gudummawar samar da makamashin TotalEnergies bayan Najeriya. [1] Kafofin yaɗa labaran Angola sun ce Faransa da Portugal za su ba da izinin miƙa shugabannin kungiyar 'yan aware bayan harin da aka kai wa kungiyar kwallon kafa ta Togo a shekara ta 2010 wanda FLEC ta ɗauki alhakinsa. [2]

Katafaren kamfanin mai na kasar Faransa TotalEnergies wanda ya yi wani sabon binciken mai a teku a watan Oktoban 2009, yana kara fadada kasancewarsa a kasar Angola. Kasar ita ce kasa ta biyu mafi yawan bayar da gudummawar samar da makamashin TotalEnergies bayan Najeriya . [2]

items.sourceText: Fred Gisa Rwigema (also sometimes spelled Rwigyema; born Emmanuel Gisa; 10 April 1957 – 2 October 1990) was a Rwandan military officer and revolutionary. He was the founder of the Rwandan Patriotic Front (RPF), a political and rebel group formed by Rwandan Tutsi exile descendants of those forced to leave the country after the 1959 Hutu Revolution.

targets.targetText: Fred Gisa Rwigema (wani lokaci kuma ana rubuta Rwigyema; an haife shi Emmanuel Gisa; 10 Afrilu 1957 – 2 Oktoba 1990) hafsan sojan Rwanda ne kuma mai neman sauyi ɗan juyin juya hali. Shi ne wanda ya kafa kungiyar kishin ƙasa ta Rwandan Patriotic Front (RPF), kungiyar siyasa da 'yan tawaye da 'yan ƙabilar Tutsi 'yan Rwanda suka kafa daga zuriyar waɗanda aka tilastawa barin ƙasar bayan juyin juya halin Hutu na 1959.

Fred Gisa Rwigema (wani lokaci kuma ana rubuta Rwigyema ; an haife shi Emmanuel Gisa ; 10 Afrilu 1957 – 2 Oktoba 1990) hafsan sojan Rwanda ne kuma mai neman sauyi. Shi ne wanda ya kafa kungiyar kishin kasa ta Rwandan Patriotic Front (RPF), kungiyar siyasa da 'yan tawaye da 'yan kabilar Tutsi ' yan Rwanda suka kafa daga zuriyar wadanda aka tilastawa barin kasar bayan juyin juya halin Hutu na 1959.

items.sourceText: The Kabyle myth is a colonial trope that was propagated by French colonists in French Algeria based on a supposed binary between the Arab and Kabyle peoples, consisting of a set of stereotypes of supposed differences between them.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Kabyle myth wani yanki ne na 'yan mulkin mallaka wanda Turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa suka yaɗa a Aljeriya ta Faransa bisa tsarin da ake tsammani tsakanin al'ummar Larabawa da Kabyle, wanda ya kunshi nau'ikan ra'ayoyin da ake zaton bambance-bambance a tsakaninsu. [1] [2] [3]

Tatsuniya ta Kabila wani yanki ne na mulkin mallaka wanda Turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa suka yada a Aljeriya ta Faransa bisa tsarin da ake tsammani tsakanin al'ummar Larabawa da Kabyle, wanda ya kunshi nau'ikan ra'ayoyin da ake zaton bambance-bambance a tsakaninsu. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: The French colony came to consider the Kabyle population more prepared to assimilate into French civilization "by virtue of the supposed democratic nature of their society, their superficial Islamicization, and the higher status of Kabyle women,"[4] as well as the belief that they were ancient Christians, of Celtic origin, who could easily be re-Christianized.[2]

targets.targetText: Turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa sun zo ne don yin la'akari da yawan mutanen Kabyle da suka fi shirye su shiga cikin wayewar Faransa "ta hanyar dabi'ar da ake zaton dimokuradiyya na al'ummarsu, da Musulunci na sama, da matsayi mafi girma na matan Kabyle," [1] da kuma imani cewa su Kiristoci ne na d ¯ a, na asalin Celtic, waɗanda za a iya sake komawa Kirista cikin sauƙi. [2]

[2]

items.sourceText: Following the fall of the Derg, Ras Alimirah Hanfadhe returned to Asaita with his son. Over the following years, the ALF was able to elect its members to the Presidency of the new Afar Region, first Habib Alimirah, and then Alimirah Hanfadhe. However the Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Democratic Front (EPRDF) was not happy about its alliance with the ALF due to its conservative ideology, the ALF’s apparently lavish expenditure of the regional budget, its undisguised favor towards the Aussa area for economic development, and the intrigues of the various members of the Alimirah family with regional players. (Sarah Vaughan notes that "at the outbreak of the Ethio-Eritrean conflict it was reported that one of the sultan’s sons favoured the Eritreans, and another the Ethiopians.")[5] Yet the EPRDF did not want to align with the ANLM due to its association with the hated Derg, so it fostered the creation of a third political organization, the Afar People's Democratic Organization (APDO), which won control of the Afar Region and 3 of the Regions 8 seats in the House of Peoples' Representatives from the ALF in the 1995 general elections.[5]

targets.targetText: Bayan faɗuwar mulkin dergi, Ras Alimirah Hanfadhe ya koma Asaita tare da ɗansa. A cikin shekaru masu zuwa, ALF ta sami damar zaɓar membobinta zuwa Shugabancin sabon yankin Afar, na farko Habib Alimirah, sannan Alimirah Hanfadhe. Sai dai kuma jam'iyyar EPRDF ta Habasha ba ta ji daɗin kawancen da ta yi da ALF ba saboda akidarta na 'yan mazan jiya, da yadda ALF ke kashe makudan kudade a kasafin kuɗin yankin, da tagomashin da ba a ɓoye ga yankin Aussa don bunƙasa tattalin arziki, da kuma makircin 'yan uwa daban-daban na gidan Alimirah da 'yan wasan yankin. (Sarah Vaughan ta lura cewa, "a [1] rikicin Ethio-Eritrea ya ɓarke, an ba da rahoton cewa ɗaya daga cikin 'ya'yan sarkin ya goyi bayan 'yan Eritrea, wani kuma na Habasha." kujeru a majalisar wakilai daga jam'iyyar ALF a babban zaɓen shekarar 1995. [1]

Bayan faduwar mulkin dergi, Ras Alimirah Hanfadhe ya koma Asaita tare da dansa. A cikin shekaru masu zuwa, ALF ta sami damar zabar membobinta zuwa Shugabancin sabon yankin Afar, na farko Habib Alimirah, sannan Alimirah Hanfadhe. Sai dai kuma jam'iyyar EPRDF ta Habasha ba ta ji dadin kawancen da ta yi da ALF ba saboda akidarta na 'yan mazan jiya, da yadda ALF ke kashe makudan kudade a kasafin kudin yankin, da tagomashin da ba a boye ga yankin Aussa don bunkasa tattalin arziki, da kuma makircin 'yan uwa daban-daban na gidan Alimirah da 'yan wasan yankin. (Sarah Vaughan ta lura cewa, "a [1] rikicin Ethio-Eritrea ya barke, an ba da rahoton cewa daya daga cikin 'ya'yan sarkin ya goyi bayan 'yan Eritrea, wani kuma na Habasha." kujeru a majalisar wakilai daga jam'iyyar ALF a babban zaben 1995 . [1]

items.sourceText: Following the election, on 8 November 1995 EPRDF troops surrounded their family residence in Assayita, then after exchanging gunfire overpowered Alimirah's guards, and entered the residence, where they confiscated weapons and other items. According to observers, this action against the Sultan and the ALF was another effort to reduce his influence in the Afar Region. Despite the EPRDF's persistent efforts to bring the group under its control, the ALF is said to have remained independent.[6]

targets.targetText: Bayan kammala zaben ne a ranar 8 ga watan Nuwamban shekarar 1995 sojojin EPRDF suka kewaye gidansu da ke Assayita, sannan bayan sun yi musayar wuta sun yi galaba a kan masu gadin Alimirah, inda suka shiga gidan, inda suka kwace makamai da sauran kayayyaki. A cewar masu lura da al'amura, wannan mataki da aka dauka kan Sultan da ALF wani yunkuri ne na rage tasirinsa a yankin Afar. Duk da kokarin da kungiyar ta EPRDF ke yi na mayar da kungiyar a karkashinta, an ce ALF ta ci gaba da zaman kanta. [1]

Bayan kammala zaɓen ne a ranar 8 ga watan Nuwamban shekarar 1995 sojojin EPRDF suka kewaye gidansu da ke Assayita, sannan bayan sun yi musayar wuta sun yi galaba a kan masu gadin Alimirah, inda suka shiga gidan, inda suka kwace makamai da sauran kayayyaki. A cewar masu lura da al'amura, wannan mataki da aka ɗauka kan Sultan da ALF wani yunkuri ne na rage tasirinsa a yankin Afar. Duk da kokarin da ƙungiyar ta EPRDF ke yi na mayar da ƙungiyar a ƙarƙashin ta, an ce ALF ta ci gaba da zaman kanta. [1]

items.sourceText: After the state of emergency was lifted, the new Minister of Justice, B.J. Vorster, introduced legislation that made many parts of the emergency regulations permanent (the Sabotage Act of 1962, and the 90-day Detention Act of 1963). Much of the Liberal Party's leadership was banned, detained or forced underground, rendering it impotent.[2]

targets.targetText: Bayan da aka ɗage dokar ta-ɓaci, sabon Ministan Shari'a, BJ Vorster, ya gabatar da dokar da ta sanya sassa da yawa na ƙa'idodin gaggawa na dindindin (Dokar Sabotage na shekarar 1962, da Dokar Tsaro ta kwanaki 90 na 1963). Yawancin shugabancin jam'iyyar masu sassaucin ra'ayi an hana su, tsare su ko tilasta su a ƙarƙashin ƙasa, wanda hakan ya sa ba su da karfi. [ 2 ]

Bayan da aka ɗage dokar ta-baci, sabon Ministan Shari'a, BJ Vorster, ya gabatar da dokar da ta sanya sassa da yawa na ƙa'idodin gaggawa na dindindin ( Dokar Sabotage na 1962, da Dokar Tsaro ta kwanaki 90 na 1963). Yawancin shugabancin jam'iyyar masu sassaucin ra'ayi an hana su, tsare su ko tilasta su a karkashin kasa, wanda hakan ya sa ba su da karfi. [ 2 ]

items.sourceText: After the modification by the Slave Trade Act of 1800, Section 2 allowed for forfeiture by owners and the possibility of a $2,000 fine.[1] Section 3 affected foreign merchants.[2] Section 4 forfeited any slaves on board the ship and a fine of $200 per slave.[2] In short, the Act limited the international slave trade to foreign ships, and foreign ships using United States' ports had to agree not to export from U.S. ports.[3][4]

targets.targetText: Bayan gyare-gyare ta Dokar Kasuwancin Bayi na 1800, Sashe na 2 ya ba da izini ga masu mallaka da kuma yiwuwar cin tarar $2,000. [1] Sashe na 3 ya shafi 'yan kasuwa na kasashen waje. [1] Sashi na 4 ya yi asarar duk wani bawa da ke cikin jirgin da kuma tarar dala 200 ga kowane bawa. [1] A takaice dai, dokar ta takaita cinikin bayi na kasa da kasa ga jiragen ruwa na kasashen waje, sannan jiragen ruwa na kasashen waje da ke amfani da tashoshin jiragen ruwa na Amurka sun amince ba za su fitar da su daga tashoshin jiragen ruwa na Amurka ba. [2] [3]

[1] Sashi na 4 ya yi asarar duk wani bawa da ke cikin jirgin da kuma tarar dala 200 ga kowane bawa. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: In 1893, judging that his power over Ethiopia was secure, Menelik repudiated the treaty; in response the Italians ramped up the pressure on his domain in a variety of ways, including the annexation of small territories bordering their original claim under the Treaty of Wuchale, and finally culminating with a military campaign and across the Mareb River into Tigray (on the border with Eritrea) in December 1894. The Italians expected disaffected potentates like Negus Tekle Haymanot of Gojjam, Ras Mengesha Yohannes, and the Sultan of Aussa to join them; instead, all of the Ethiopians flocked to the Emperor Menelik's side in a display of both nationalism and anti-Italian feeling, while other peoples of dubious loyalty (e.g. the Sultan of Aussa) were watched by Imperial garrisons.[30] In June 1894, Ras Mengesha and his generals appeared in Addis Ababa carrying large stones which they dropped before the Emperor Menelik (a gesture that is a symbol of submission in Ethiopian culture).[2] There was overwhelming national unity in Ethiopia as various feuding noblemen rallied behind the emperor who insisted that Ethiopia, unlike the other African nations, would retain its freedom and not be subjugated by Italy.[20]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1893, yana yanke hukunci cewa ikonsa a kan Habasha yana da aminci, Menelik ya yi watsi da yarjejeniyar; A sakamakon haka turawan Italiya sun ƙara matsa lamba a kan yankinsa ta hanyoyi daban-daban, ciki har da mamaye ƙananan yankuna da ke kan iyaka da ainihin da'awarsu a ƙarƙashin yarjejeniyar Wuchale, daga ƙarshe kuma ta kai farmakin soji suka keta kogin Mareb zuwa cikin Tigray (a kan iyaka da Eritriya) a watan Disamba 1894. Italiya sun yi tsammanin wasu masu iko kamar Negus Tekle Haymanot na Gojjam, Ras Mengesha Yohannes, da Sarkin Aussa za su shiga tare da su; a maimakon haka, dukkan mutanen Habasha sun yi tururuwa zuwa ɓangaren Sarki Menelik a cikin nunin kishin ƙasa da kuma kyamar Italiya, yayin da sauran al'ummomin da ke da shakku (misali Sarkin Aussa) sojojin Imperial suna kallonsu. [1] A cikin watan Yunin 1894, Ras Mengesha da hakimansa suka bayyana a Addis Ababa suna ɗauke da manyan duwatsu waɗanda suka jefo a gaban sarki Menelik (wani alama ce ta biyayya a al'adun Habasha). [2] An samu gagarumin haɗin kan ƙasa a ƙasar Habasha yayin da wasu masu faɗa aji daban-daban suka yi marawa sarki baya wanda ya dage cewa Habasha ba kamar sauran ƙasashen Afirka ba, za ta ci gaba da rike 'yancinta, kuma ba Italiya ta yi mata mulkin mallaka ba. [2]

A cikin 1893, yana yanke hukunci cewa ikonsa a kan Habasha yana da aminci, Menelik ya yi watsi da yarjejeniyar; A sakamakon haka turawan Italiya sun kara matsa lamba a kan yankinsa ta hanyoyi daban-daban, ciki har da mamaye kananan yankuna da ke kan iyaka da ainihin da'awarsu a karkashin yarjejeniyar Wuchale, daga karshe kuma ta kai farmakin soji suka keta kogin Mareb zuwa cikin Tigray (a kan iyaka da Eritriya ) a watan Disamba 1894. Italiyawa sun yi tsammanin wasu masu iko kamar Negus Tekle Haymanot na Gojjam, Ras Mengesha Yohannes, da Sarkin Aussa za su shiga tare da su; a maimakon haka, dukkan mutanen Habasha sun yi tururuwa zuwa bangaren Sarki Menelik a cikin nunin kishin kasa da kuma kyamar Italiya, yayin da sauran al'ummomin da ke da shakku (misali Sarkin Aussa) sojojin Imperial suna kallonsu. [1] A cikin watan Yunin 1894, Ras Mengesha da hakimansa suka bayyana a Addis Ababa suna ɗauke da manyan duwatsu waɗanda suka jefo a gaban sarki Menelik (wani alama ce ta biyayya a al'adun Habasha). [2] An samu gagarumin hadin kan kasa a kasar Habasha yayin da wasu masu fada aji daban-daban suka yi marawa sarki baya wanda ya dage cewa Habasha ba kamar sauran kasashen Afirka ba, za ta ci gaba da rike 'yancinta, kuma ba Italiya ta yi mata mulkin mallaka ba. [2]

items.sourceText: While many tribal chiefs refused to send their men to reinforce the Portuguese, Maguiguana managed to assemble around 10,000 men or eight regiments, equipped with around 2,000 rifles.[1] Of the eight regiments however, five were made up of Ndau or Tonga little inclined to fight for Gungunhana.[1] There was deep dissent within the entourage of the emperor and this along with severe food shortages undermined the armys morale.[1] The Nguni or Vatua were not experienced in guerilla warfare and they could not afford to withdraw from their lands.[1]

targets.targetText: Yayin da shugabannin kabilu da yawa suka ƙi aika mazajensu don ƙarfafa Portuguese, Maguiguana ya gudanar da tattara kusan mutane 10,000 ko kuma ƙungiyoyi takwas, sanye da bindigogi 2,000. [1] Daga cikin rundunonin guda takwas, biyar sun kunshi Ndau ko Tonga kadan ne masu son yakar Gungunhana. [1] An samu rashin jituwa sosai a cikin ayarin sarki kuma hakan tare da matsananciyar karancin abinci ya raunana kwarin gwiwar sojojin. [1] Nguni ko Vatua ba su da gogewa a yaƙin neman zaɓe kuma ba za su iya janyewa daga ƙasashensu ba. [1]

Yayin da shugabannin ƙabilu da yawa suka ƙi aika mazajensu don ƙarfafa Portuguese, Maguiguana ya gudanar da tattara kusan mutane 10,000 ko kuma ƙungiyoyi takwas, sanye da bindigogi 2,000. [1] Daga cikin rundunonin guda takwas, biyar sun kunshi Ndau ko Tonga kaɗan ne masu son yakar Gungunhana. [1] An samu rashin jituwa sosai a cikin ayarin sarki kuma hakan tare da matsananciyar ƙarancin abinci ya raunana kwarin gwiwar sojojin. [1] Nguni ko Vatua ba su da gogewa a kamfen kuma ba za su iya janyewa daga ƙasashensu ba. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1936 Omar Derdour and a group of fellow students founded a division of the Algerian Muslim Scholars Association and became active in education in the fields of religious and national awareness.[3] In 1937, Derdour returned to his village to establish a madrasa for the education of children and adults.[1] Ben Badis considered him the "soul of the Islahiste[a] movement in the Aures".[2] At the end of 1937, the French authorities became aware of his activities and imprisoned him in Batna for "inciting the population to civil disobedience".[5] Derdour was released on 6 January 1938, but was imprisoned a second time in August 1939 to complete his four-month sentence and was fined 8,000 francs. He was released in September 1939 upon the outbreak of World War II (1939-1945).[6] During the war the authorities suppressed all political activities, and he was forced to limit himself to non-political education.[3]

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 1936 Omar Derdour tare da wasu gungun ɗalibai sun kafa wani ɓangare na kungiyar malaman musulmi ta Aljeriya kuma suka kasance masu fafutuka a fannin ilimi a fagen ilimin addini da na ƙasa. [ 3 ] A shekara ta 1937, Derdour ya koma ƙauyensa don kafa makarantar koyar da yara da manya. [ 1 ] Ben Badis ya ɗauke shi a matsayin "rai na Islahiste [ a ] motsi a cikin Aures". [ 2 ] A ƙarshen shekarar 1937, hukumomin Faransa sun fahimci ayyukansa kuma suka ɗaure shi a Batna saboda "tunanin jama'a ga rashin biyayya". [ 5 ] An saki Derdour a ranar 6 ga watan Janairun 1938, amma an ɗaure shi a karo na biyu a watan Agustan 1939 don kammala hukuncin ɗaurin watanni huɗu kuma an ci tarar 8,000 francs. An sake shi a watan Satumba na 1939 a lokacin ɓarkewar yakin duniya na biyu (1939-1945). [ 6 ] A lokacin yakin hukumomi sun dakile duk wasu harkokin siyasa, kuma an tilasta masa ya takaita kan ilimin da ba na siyasa ba. [ 3 ]

A shekara ta 1936 Omar Derdour tare da wasu gungun dalibai sun kafa wani bangare na kungiyar malaman musulmi ta Aljeriya kuma suka kasance masu fafutuka a fannin ilimi a fagen ilimin addini da na kasa. [ 3 ] A shekara ta 1937, Derdour ya koma ƙauyensa don kafa makarantar koyar da yara da manya. [ 1 ] Ben Badis ya dauke shi a matsayin "rai na Islahiste [ a ] motsi a cikin Aures". [ 2 ] A ƙarshen 1937, hukumomin Faransa sun fahimci ayyukansa kuma suka ɗaure shi a Batna saboda "tunanin jama'a ga rashin biyayya". [ 5 ] An saki Derdour a ranar 6 ga Janairun 1938, amma an daure shi a karo na biyu a watan Agustan 1939 don kammala hukuncin daurin watanni hudu kuma an ci tarar 8,000 francs. An sake shi a watan Satumba na 1939 a lokacin barkewar yakin duniya na biyu (1939-1945). [ 6 ] A lokacin yakin hukumomi sun dakile duk wasu harkokin siyasa, kuma an tilasta masa ya takaita kan ilimin da ba na siyasa ba. [ 3 ]

items.sourceText: After Algeria gained independence, Omar Derdour devoted himself to teaching Islam and Arabic. He founded the first Islamic institute in Batna in May 1963, followed by the creation of similar institutions in several cities across the country, reaching 10,000 students.[2] In 1981, Derdour was appointed director of the institute in Sidi Okba for training imams and regional inspectors of religious affairs in Batna, Khenchela and Oum El Bouaghi, holding this position until his retirement.[9] In 1986, Derdour was appointed regional inspector of Religious Affairs in Batna and Khenchela provinces.[3] In the 2000s he built a mosque and a zawiya in the locality of El Hamza in the municipality of Oued Taga and a school in the village of his birth.[9]

targets.targetText: Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, Omar Derdour ya dukufa wajen koyar da addinin Musulunci da Larabci. Ya kafa cibiyar Musulunci ta farko a garin Batna a watan Mayun shekarar 1963, sannan ya samar da irin waɗannan cibiyoyi a garuruwa da dama na ƙasar, inda ya kai ɗalibai 10,000. [ 2 ] A cikin shekarar 1981, an naɗa Derdour darektan cibiyar da ke Sidi Okba don horar da limamai da masu kula da harkokin addini na yankin Batna, Khenchela da Oum El Bouaghi, yana riƙe da wannan muƙamin har sai da ya yi ritaya. [ 9 ] A cikin shekarar 1986, an naɗa Derdour mai kula da harkokin addini na yanki a lardunan Batna da Khenchela. [ 3 ] A cikin shekarun 2000 ya gina masallaci da zawiya a unguwar El Hamza da ke ƙaramar hukumar Oued Taga da kuma makaranta a ƙauyen da aka haife shi. [ 9 ]

Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, Omar Derdour ya dukufa wajen koyar da addinin Musulunci da Larabci. Ya kafa cibiyar Musulunci ta farko a garin Batna a watan Mayun shekarar 1963, sannan ya samar da irin wadannan cibiyoyi a garuruwa da dama na kasar, inda ya kai dalibai 10,000. [ 2 ] A cikin 1981, an nada Derdour darektan cibiyar da ke Sidi Okba don horar da limamai da masu kula da harkokin addini na yankin Batna, Khenchela da Oum El Bouaghi, yana rike da wannan mukamin har sai da ya yi ritaya. [ 9 ] A cikin 1986, an nada Derdour mai kula da harkokin addini na yanki a lardunan Batna da Khenchela . [ 3 ] A cikin shekarun 2000 ya gina masallaci da zawiya a unguwar El Hamza da ke karamar hukumar Oued Taga da kuma makaranta a kauyen da aka haife shi. [ 9 ]

items.sourceText: On January 18, 1955, when he was not yet 28 years old, he died at the Battle of Douar Souadek, (Conde-Smendou), near Constantine. He was the first wilaya leader to fall.

targets.targetText: Ranar 18 ga Janairu, 1955, lokacin da bai kai shekara 28 ba, ya mutu a yakin Douar Souadek, (Conde-Smendou), kusa da Constantine . Shi ne shugaban wilaya na farko da ya fadi.
Ranar 18 ga watan Janairu, 1955, lokacin da bai kai shekara 28 ba, ya mutu a yakin Douar Souadek, (Conde-Smendou), kusa da Constantine. Shi ne shugaban wilaya na farko da ya faɗi.

items.sourceText: After Algeria gained independence, Zbiri was appointed to command the 5th Military Region and was actively engaged in the reorganization of the newly formed Algerian People's National Army (ANP). In 1963, Zbiri was promoted to chief of staff of the People's National Army, while maintaining the rank of colonel, which was the highest military rank at the time. During this period, Colonel Houari Boumédiène held the position of minister of Defense.[1] Zbiri played a central role in the 1965 military coup, which overthrew president Ahmed Ben Bella and brought Houari Boumédiène to power. Following the coup, Zbiri became a member of the Council of the Revolution, the governing body established by Boumédiène's regime.[3]

targets.targetText: Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, an nada Zbiri ya zama kwamandan yankin soji na 5 kuma ya taka rawar gani wajen sake fasalin sabuwar rundunar sojojin kasar Aljeriya (ANP). A shekarar 1963, Zbiri ya samu mukamin babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin kasa, yayin da yake rike da mukamin Kanal, wanda shi ne mafi girman mukamin soja a lokacin. A wannan lokacin, Kanar Houari Boumédiène ya rike mukamin ministan tsaro . [1] Zbiri ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a juyin mulkin soja na 1965, wanda ya hambarar da shugaba Ahmed Ben Bella kuma ya kawo Houari Boumédiène kan mulki. Bayan juyin mulkin, Zbiri ya zama mamba na majalisar juyin juya hali, hukumar da gwamnatin Boumédiène ta kafa. [1]

Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, an naɗa Zbiri ya zama kwamandan yankin soji na 5 kuma ya taka rawar gani wajen sake fasalin sabuwar rundunar sojojin ƙasar Aljeriya (ANP). A shekarar 1963, Zbiri ya samu muƙamin babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin kasa, yayin da yake riƙe da muƙamin Kanal, wanda shi ne mafi girman muƙamin soja a lokacin. A wannan lokacin, Kanar Houari Boumédiène ya riƙe muƙamin ministan tsaro.
