items.sourceText: Make died on 15 April 2006 in the HF Verwoerd hospital in Pretoria at the age of 75.[1] He was survived by his widow Alma Liziwe Make and daughter Titise.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: Make ya mutu a ranar 15 Afrilu 2006 a asibitin HF Verwoerd a Pretoria yana da shekaru 75. [1] Ya rasu ya bar matar sa Alma Liziwe Make da diyarsa Titise. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]
Make ya mutu a ranar 15 ga watan Afrilu 2006 a asibitin HF Verwoerd a Pretoria yana da shekaru 75. [1] Ya rasu ya bar matar sa Alma Liziwe Make da diyarsa Titise. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: Makwetu died on 1 April 2016 at the age of 88 and was buried on 16 April 2016. Makwetu is survived by his wife Mandisa and two sons.[10]

targets.targetText: Makwetu ya rasu ne a ranar 1 ga Afrilu 2016 yana da shekaru 88 kuma an binne shi a ranar 16 ga Afrilu 2016. Makwetu ya bar matarsa Mandisa da 'ya'ya maza biyu. [1]
Makwetu ya rasu ne a ranar 1 ga watan Afrilu 2016 yana da shekaru 88 kuma an binne shi a ranar 16 ga watan Afrilu 2016. Makwetu ya bar matarsa Mandisa da 'ya'ya maza biyu. [1]

items.sourceText: He later became a member of the ANC and consequent party organiser in the areas of Benoni and Atteridgeville. He was one of the initial recruits of the Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) organisation, which was founded in December 1961. Maphotho became involved in underground activities of the ANC prior to him leaving the country to go to Dar es Salaam, Tanzania on 28 February 1961. The ANC deployed him to the Beirut International School in 1962. He returned to Dar es Salaam in 1963 and was soon sent for military training in the now-dissolved Soviet Union.[4]

targets.targetText: Daga baya ya zama memba na ANC kuma sakamakon haka ya shirya jam'iyyar a yankunan Benoni da Atteridgeville . Ya kasance daya daga cikin wadanda aka fara daukar ma'aikata na kungiyar Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK), wacce aka kafa a watan Disamba 1961. Maphotho ya shiga cikin ayyukan karkashin kasa na ANC kafin ya bar kasar don zuwa Dar es Salaam, Tanzania a ranar 28 ga Fabrairun 1961. ANC ta tura shi makarantar kasa da kasa ta Beirut a 1962. Ya koma Dar es Salaam a shekara ta 1963 kuma nan da nan aka tura shi horon soji a cikin Tarayyar Soviet da ta wargaje yanzu . [1]

Daga baya ya zama memba na ANC kuma sakamakon haka ya shirya jam'iyyar a yankunan Benoni da Atteridgeville. Ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda aka fara ɗaukar ma'aikata na kungiyar Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK), wacce aka kafa a watan Disamba 1961. Maphotho ya shiga cikin ayyukan ƙarƙashin ƙasa na ANC kafin ya bar ƙasar don zuwa Dar es Salaam, Tanzania a ranar 28 ga watan Fabrairun 1961. ANC ta tura shi makarantar ƙasa da ƙasa ta Beirut a shekarar 1962. Ya koma Dar es Salaam a shekara ta 1963 kuma nan da nan aka tura shi horon soji a cikin Tarayyar Soviet da ta wargaje yanzu . [1]

items.sourceText: He died of COVID-19 during the COVID-19 pandemic in South Africa, on the morning of 9 January 2021, after being admitted to hospital the day before.[5][6]

targets.targetText: Ya mutu sakamakon COVID-19 yayin ɓarkewar cutar ta COVID-19 a Afirka ta Kudu, da safiyar ranar 9 ga watan Janairu, 2021, bayan an kwantar da shi a asibiti ranar da ta gabata. [1] [2]
Ya mutu sakamakon COVID-19 yayin barkewar cutar ta COVID-19 a Afirka ta Kudu, da safiyar 9 ga Janairu, 2021, bayan an kwantar da shi a asibiti ranar da ta gabata. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: In 1972, when Nxumalo was only 15, he was detained without trial for his participation in a school boycott. The following year, only 16, he was arrested again. Being charged with public violence for his role in student and worker strikes. Nxumalo would study law at the University of Natal. Continuing his activism, he would join and participate heavily in the South African Student Organization (SASO).

targets.targetText: A cikin 1972, lokacin da Nxumalo yana ɗan shekara 15 kawai, an tsare shi ba tare da shari'a ba saboda halartar kauracewa makaranta. A shekara mai zuwa, 16 kawai, an sake kama shi. Ana tuhumarsa da cin zarafin jama'a saboda rawar da ya taka a yajin aikin dalibai da ma'aikata. Nxumalo zai karanci shari'a a Jami'ar Natal. A ci gaba da fafutukarsa, zai shiga kuma ya taka rawa sosai a cikin kungiyar dalibai ta Afirka ta Kudu (SASO).

A cikin shekarar 1972, lokacin da Nxumalo yana ɗan shekara 15 kawai, an tsare shi ba tare da shari'a ba saboda halartar ƙauracewa makaranta. A shekara mai zuwa, 16 kawai, an sake kama shi. Ana tuhumarsa da cin zarafin jama'a saboda rawar da ya taka a yajin aikin ɗalibai da ma'aikata. Nxumalo zai karanci shari'a a Jami'ar Natal. A ci gaba da fafutukarsa, zai shiga kuma ya taka rawa sosai a cikin kungiyar ɗalibai ta Afirka ta Kudu (SASO).

items.sourceText: The Manifesto of N'sele (French: Manifeste de la N'sele) was a political document issued in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (later renamed Zaire) on 19[1] or 20[2] May 1967 which set out the official political stance of the Popular Movement of the Revolution (Mouvement Populaire de la Révolution, MPR), a political party which had been founded by Joseph-Désiré Mobutu in 1966. The manifesto was created at an MPR meeting in N'sele, Kinshasa where it was based.[2]

targets.targetText: Manifesto na N'sele (Faransanci: Manifeste de la N'sele) takarda ce ta siyasa da aka bayar a Jamhuriyar Demokradiyyar Kongo (daga baya aka sake masa suna Zaire) a ranar 19 [1] ko 20 [2] Mayu 1967 wanda ya bayyana matsayin siyasa na Movement Popular of the Revolution (Mouvement Populaire de la Révolution, MPR), Jam'iyyar siyasa da Joseph-Désiré Mobutu ya kafa a 1966. An kirkiro wannan takardar ne a wani taron MPR a N'sele, Kinshasa inda aka kafa ta.[2]

Jawabin Manufar N'sele (Faransanci: Manifeste de la N'sele) takarda ce ta siyasa da aka bayar a Jamhuriyar Demokradiyyar Kongo (daga baya aka sake masa suna Zaire) a ranar 19 [1] ko 20 [2] Mayu 1967 wanda ya bayyana matsayin siyasa na Movement Popular of the Revolution (Mouvement Populaire de la Révolution, MPR), Jam'iyyar siyasa da Joseph-Désiré Mobutu ya kafa a 1966. An kirkiro wannan takardar ne a wani taron MPR a N'sele, Kinshasa inda aka kafa ta.[2]

items.sourceText: He was one of the founders and chief architect of Zimbabwe African National Union party in August 1963 in conjunction with Herbert Chitepo, Robert Mugabe and Edgar Tekere in the Highfields House of Enos Nkala. In 1964 there was a party Congress at Gwelo, where Sithole was elected president and appointed Robert Mugabe to be his secretary general. ZANU was banned in 1964 by Ian Smith's government. He spent 10 years in prison after being arrested on 22 June 1964[3] alongside Mugabe, Tekere, Nyagumbo and Takawira for his political activities. While in prison he specifically authorised Chitepo to continue the struggle from abroad as a representative of ZANU. Sithole was convicted on a charge of plotting to assassinate Ian Smith and released from prison in 1974.

targets.targetText: Ya kasance daya daga cikin wadanda suka kafa kuma shugaban gine-ginen jam'iyyar Zimbabwe African National Union a watan Agusta 1963 tare da Herbert Chitepo, Robert Mugabe da Edgar Tekere a Highfields House of Enos Nkala . A shekarar 1964 an yi taron jam'iyyar a Gwelo, inda aka zabi Sithole a matsayin shugaban kasa, aka nada Robert Mugabe a matsayin babban sakatarensa. Gwamnatin Ian Smith ta dakatar da ZANU a shekarar 1964. Ya shafe shekaru 10 a gidan yari bayan an kama shi a ranar 22 ga watan Yuni 1964 [1] tare da Mugabe, Tekere, Nyagumbo da Takawira saboda harkokin siyasa. A lokacin da yake gidan yari ya ba Chitepo izinin ci gaba da gwagwarmaya daga kasashen waje a matsayin wakilin ZANU. An yanke wa Sithole hukuncin kisa kan zargin yunkurin kashe Ian Smith kuma aka sake shi daga kurkuku a shekara ta 1974.

Ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa kuma shugaban gine-ginen jam'iyyar Zimbabwe African National Union a watan Agusta 1963 tare da Herbert Chitepo, Robert Mugabe da Edgar Tekere a Highfields House of Enos Nkala. A shekarar 1964 an yi taron jam'iyyar a Gwelo, inda aka zaɓi Sithole a matsayin shugaban ƙasa, aka naɗa Robert Mugabe a matsayin babban sakatarensa. Gwamnatin Ian Smith ta dakatar da ZANU a shekarar 1964. Ya shafe shekaru 10 a gidan yari bayan an kama shi a ranar 22 ga watan Yuni 1964 [1] tare da Mugabe, Tekere, Nyagumbo da Takawira saboda harkokin siyasa. A lokacin da yake gidan yari ya ba Chitepo izinin ci gaba da gwagwarmaya daga ƙasashen waje a matsayin wakilin ZANU. An yanke wa Sithole hukuncin kisa kan zargin yunkurin kashe Ian Smith kuma aka sake shi daga kurkuku a shekara ta 1974.

items.sourceText: On 18 March 1975 Chitepo was assassinated in Lusaka, Zambia, with a car bomb. Mugabe, in Mozambique at the time, was unanimously chosen to be the first secretary of ZANU. Later that year there was a factional split, with many Ndebele following Joshua Nkomo into the equally militant ZAPU. Sithole eventually founded the moderate ZANU-Ndonga party, which renounced violent struggle, while the Shona-dominated ZANU (now called ZANU PF) followed Mugabe with a more militant agenda.[4]

targets.targetText: A ranar 18 ga Maris, 1975, an kashe Chitepo a Lusaka, Zambia, da wata mota da bam. An zabi Mugabe da ke Mozambique a wancan lokacin, a matsayin babban sakataren jam'iyyar ZANU na farko. Daga baya a waccan shekarar an sami rarrabuwar kawuna, inda Ndebele da yawa suka bi Joshua Nkomo cikin jam’iyyar ZAPU mai fafutuka. A karshe Sithole ya kafa jam'iyyar ZANU-Ndonga mai sassaucin ra'ayi, wacce ta yi watsi da gwagwarmayar tashin hankali, yayin da Shona - wacce ke da rinjaye a ZANU (wanda ake kira ZANU PF) ta bi Mugabe da wata manufa ta tsageru. [1]

A ranar 18 ga watan Maris, 1975, an kashe Chitepo a Lusaka, Zambia, da wata mota da bam. An zaɓi Mugabe da ke Mozambique a wancan lokacin, a matsayin babban sakataren jam'iyyar ZANU na farko. Daga baya a waccan shekarar an sami rarrabuwar kawuna, inda Ndebele da yawa suka bi Joshua Nkomo cikin jam’iyyar ZAPU mai fafutuka. A ƙarshe Sithole ya kafa jam'iyyar ZANU-Ndonga mai sassaucin ra'ayi, wacce ta yi watsi da gwagwarmayar tashin hankali, yayin da Shona - wacce ke da rinjaye a ZANU (wanda ake kira ZANU PF) ta bi Mugabe da wata manufa ta tsageru. [1]

items.sourceText: Julia Zvobgo's earliest experience with racist repression was when she witnessed the arrest of her husband, then returning from the United States.[3] Her husband was subsequently sentenced to 18 months’ imprisonment. Having become a member of Zanu at its formation in August 1963, Zvobgo and other young women bore the brunt of suppressive racist colonial rule which peaked under the Rhodesian Front.[3] The banning of Zanu in 1964 saw her husband detained and restricted for six years at Sikombela and other camps of incarceration across the country.[3] As a result, she went to the UK. From 1968 -1971 she studied in the United Kingdom and at Hillcroft in Surrey. Later, on a United Nations scholarship, she completed a diploma in Institutional Management at Leeds Polytechnic.[2] She then continued her higher education in 1975 in the United States where her husband was studying and teaching. In 1977, she obtained a BA in Political Science from Lewis University in Illinois, USA. When her husband left for Mozambique to join others in the liberation struggle, Zvobgo moved to study at the University of Notre Dame in Indiana. In August 1978 she obtained a Master of Science degree in Administration.[4]

targets.targetText: Farkon abin da Julia Zvobgo ta fuskanta game da zaluncin wariyar launin fata shine lokacin da ta ga yadda aka kama mijinta, sannan ta dawo daga Amurka. [1] Daga baya aka yankewa mijinta hukuncin ɗaurin watanni 18 a gidan yari. Bayan zama memba na Zanu a lokacin kafuwarta a watan Agustan 1963, Zvobgo da sauran 'yan mata sun ɗauki nauyin mulkin wariyar launin fata na 'yan mulkin mallaka wanda ya kai kololuwa a ƙarƙashin Rhodesian Front. [1] Haramcin Zanu a shekarar 1964 ya sa aka tsare mijinta kuma aka tsare shi tsawon shekaru shida a Sikombela da sauran sansanonin ɗauri a faɗin ƙasar. [1] A sakamakon haka, ta tafi Birtaniya. Daga shekarar 1968-1971 ta yi karatu a Burtaniya da Hillcroft a Surrey. Daga baya, a kan tallafin karatu na Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, ta kammala difloma a cikin Gudanar da Gudanarwa a Leeds Polytechnic. [2] Daga nan ta ci gaba da karatunta na gaba a shekarar 1975 a ƙasar Amurka inda mijinta yake karatu da koyarwa. A shekarar 1977 ta samu digirin digirgir (BA) a fannin kimiyyar siyasa daga jami'ar Lewis dake Illinois ta ƙasar Amurka. Sa’ad da mijinta ya tafi Mozambique don ya shiga cikin gwagwarmayar ’yanci, Zvobgo ta koma karatu a Jami’ar Notre Dame da ke Indiana. A watan Agusta 1978 ta sami digiri na biyu na Kimiyya a Gudanarwa. [3]

Farkon abin da Julia Zvobgo ta fuskanta game da zaluncin wariyar launin fata shine lokacin da ta ga yadda aka kama mijinta, sannan ta dawo daga Amurka. [1] Daga baya aka yankewa mijinta hukuncin daurin watanni 18 a gidan yari. Bayan zama memba na Zanu a lokacin kafuwarta a watan Agustan 1963, Zvobgo da sauran 'yan mata sun dauki nauyin mulkin wariyar launin fata na mulkin mallaka wanda ya kai kololuwa a karkashin Rhodesian Front . [1] Haramcin Zanu a shekarar 1964 ya sa aka tsare mijinta kuma aka tsare shi tsawon shekaru shida a Sikombela da sauran sansanonin dauri a fadin kasar. [1] A sakamakon haka, ta tafi Birtaniya. Daga 1968-1971 ta yi karatu a Burtaniya da Hillcroft a Surrey . Daga baya, a kan tallafin karatu na Majalisar Dinkin Duniya, ta kammala difloma a cikin Gudanar da Gudanarwa a Leeds Polytechnic . [2] Daga nan ta ci gaba da karatunta na gaba a shekarar 1975 a kasar Amurka inda mijinta yake karatu da koyarwa. A shekarar 1977 ta samu digirin digirgir (BA) a fannin kimiyyar siyasa daga jami'ar Lewis dake Illinois ta kasar Amurka. Sa’ad da mijinta ya tafi Mozambique don ya shiga cikin gwagwarmayar ’yanci, Zvobgo ta koma karatu a Jami’ar Notre Dame da ke Indiana. A watan Agusta 1978 ta sami digiri na biyu na Kimiyya a Gudanarwa. [3]

items.sourceText: After two years in Coimbra, she moved to Lisbon, where she enrolled in the history and philosophy program at the University of Lisbon. There, she began to frequent Casa dos Estudantes do Império, a meeting place for students from African colonies of Portugal. It was then that she began to identify herself with the liberation movement. The students discussed the situations in their different countries and what role they could play in the fight for freedom.[1][4]

targets.targetText: Bayan shekaru biyu a Coimbra, ta koma Lisbon, inda ta shiga cikin tsarin tarihi da falsafa a Jami'ar Lisbon. A can, ta fara yawan Casa dos Estudantes do Império, wurin taro na ɗalibai daga yankunan Afirka na Portugal. Daga nan ne ta fara bayyana kanta a cikin yunkurin kwato 'yanci. Ɗaliban sun tattauna batutuwan da ke faruwa a ƙasashen su daban-daban da irin rawar da za su taka wajen fafutukar kwato 'yanci. [1] [2]

Bayan shekaru biyu a Coimbra, ta koma Lisbon, inda ta shiga cikin tsarin tarihi da falsafa a Jami'ar Lisbon . A can, ta fara yawan Casa dos Estudantes do Império, wurin taro na dalibai daga yankunan Afirka na Portugal. Daga nan ne ta fara bayyana kanta a cikin yunkurin kwato 'yanci. Daliban sun tattauna batutuwan da ke faruwa a kasashensu daban-daban da irin rawar da za su taka wajen fafutukar kwato 'yanci. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: When Morocco regained independence from France and Spain in 1956, the country expressed a keen interest in all of Spain’s remaining colonial possessions in Morocco, claiming that they were historically and geographically all part of Moroccan territory. Sultan Mohammed V encouraged efforts to re-capture the land and personally funded anti-Spanish guerillas to claim Ifni back for Morocco.[10]

targets.targetText: A lokacin da kasar Maroko ta sami 'yencin kanta daga hannun Faransa da Spain a shekarar 1956, kasar ta nuna matukar sha'awarta ga daukacin sauran yankunan da Spain ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a kasar Maroko, inda ta ce a tarihi da kuma yanayin kasa duk wani yanki ne na kasar Morocco. Sultan Mohammed V ya karfafa yunƙurin sake kwace ƙasar kuma da kansa ya ba wa 'yan tawayen Spain kuɗi don neman Ifni ga Maroko. [1]

A lokacin da ƙasar Maroko ta sami 'yancin kanta daga hannun Faransa da Spain a shekarar 1956, ƙasar ta nuna matukar sha'awarta ga ɗaukacin sauran yankunan da Spain ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a ƙasar Maroko, inda ta ce a tarihi da kuma yanayin ƙasa duk wani yanki ne na ƙasar Morocco. Sultan Mohammed V ya karfafa yunƙurin sake kwace ƙasar kuma da kansa ya ba wa 'yan tawayen Spain kuɗi don neman Ifni ga Maroko. [1]

items.sourceText: On 21 November, Spanish intelligence in Ifni reported that attacks were imminent by Moroccans and local tribes operating out of Tafraout. Two days later, Spanish lines of communication were cut, and a force of 2,000 Moroccans stormed Spanish garrisons and armories in and around Ifni.

targets.targetText: A ranar 21 ga watan Nuwamba, jami'an leken asirin Spain a Ifni sun ba da rahoton cewa 'yan Moroko da ƙabilun yankin da ke aiki a Tafraout na gab da kaiwa hari. Bayan kwana biyu an yanke layukan sadarwa na ƙasar Spain, sannan dakaru 2,000 'yan kasar Morocco sun kai hari a sansanin sojojin Spain da ke cikin garin Ifni da kewaye.

A ranar 21 ga Nuwamba, jami'an leken asirin Spain a Ifni sun ba da rahoton cewa 'yan Moroko da kabilun yankin da ke aiki a Tafraout na gab da kaiwa hari. Bayan kwana biyu an yanke layukan sadarwa na kasar Spain, sannan dakaru 2,000 'yan kasar Morocco sun kai hari a sansanin sojojin Spain da ke cikin garin Ifni da kewaye.

items.sourceText: The Wahehe War (1891–1898)[2][3] was a major engagement between the Hehe people of southern Tanzania, led by Chief Mkwawa, and Germany in colonial German East Africa. The Wahehe war began with a decisive Hehe victory at the Battle of Lugalo near Iringa in 1891, when Mkwawa's forces ambushed and destroyed a German column led by Emil von Zelewski. The Germans then conducted sustained military campaigns against the Hehe until they finally captured Mkwawa’s fortress in 1894. Mkwawa was able to continue a guerrilla resistance against the Germans until his death in 1898. The Wahehe War became a symbol of African resistance to colonial authority.

targets.targetText: Yaƙin Wahehe (1891-1898) [1] [2] ya kasance babban haɗin gwiwa tsakanin mutanen Hehe na kudancin Tanzaniya, wanda Cif Mkwawa ya jagoranta, da Jamus a Jamus ta Gabashin Afirka ta 'yan mulkin mallaka. Yakin Wahehe ya fara ne da gagarumin nasarar Hehe a yakin Lugalo kusa da Iringa a shekarar 1891, lokacin da sojojin Mkwawa suka yi kwanton ɓauna tare da lalata wani ruƙunin Jamus ƙarƙashin jagorancin Emil von Zelewski. Daga nan ne Jamusawa suka ci gaba da kai hare-hare na soji a kan Hehe har sai da suka kwace sansanin Mkwawa a shekarar 1894. Mkwawa ya iya ci gaba da gwagwarmaya da Jamusawa har zuwa rasuwarsa a shekara ta 1898. Yaƙin Wahehe ya zama alama ce ta juriyar Afirka ga ikon 'yan mulkin mallaka.

Yaƙin Wahehe (1891-1898) [1] [2] ya kasance babban haɗin gwiwa tsakanin mutanen Hehe na kudancin Tanzaniya, wanda Cif Mkwawa ya jagoranta, da Jamus a Jamus ta Gabashin Afirka ta mulkin mallaka. Yakin Wahehe ya fara ne da gagarumin nasarar Hehe a yakin Lugalo kusa da Iringa a shekarar 1891, lokacin da sojojin Mkwawa suka yi kwanton bauna tare da lalata wani rukunin Jamus karkashin jagorancin Emil von Zelewski . Daga nan ne Jamusawa suka ci gaba da kai hare-hare na soji a kan Hehe har sai da suka kwace sansanin Mkwawa a 1894. Mkwawa ya iya ci gaba da gwagwarmaya da Jamusawa har zuwa rasuwarsa a shekara ta 1898. Yaƙin Wahehe ya zama alama ce ta juriyar Afirka ga ikon mulkin mallaka.

items.sourceText: On October 28, 1894, German troops, commanded by Colonel Freiherr Friedrich von Schele, attacked Chief Mkwawa's stronghold at Kalenga.[7] Although the fort was captured, Mkwawa escaped and launched a guerrilla campaign against the Germans. He continued this campaign until July 19, 1898, when he committed suicide at the Mlambalasi Rock Shelter to evade capture. He was buried near there. Mkwawa's brother Chambila was also courageous and fought with him to the end.[8][9]

targets.targetText: A ranar 28 ga Oktoba, 1894, sojojin Jamus, karkashin jagorancin Kanar Freiherr Friedrich von Schele, sun kai hari ga sansanin Cif Mkwawa a Kalenga. [1] Ko da yake an kame sansanin, amma Mkwawa ya tsere ya kaddamar da yakin neman zabe a kan Jamusawa. Ya ci gaba da wannan kamfen har zuwa ranar 19 ga Yuli, 1898, lokacin da ya kashe kansa a sansanin Dutsen Mlambalasi don gujewa kama shi. An binne shi kusa da wurin. Shi ma dan’uwan Mkwawa Chambila ya yi jajircewa, ya yi yaki da shi har karshe. [2] [3]

A ranar 28 ga watan Oktoba, 1894, sojojin Jamus, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Kanar Freiherr Friedrich von Schele, sun kai hari ga sansanin Cif Mkwawa a Kalenga. [1] Ko da yake an kame sansanin, amma Mkwawa ya tsere ya kaddamar da kamfen a kan Jamusawa. Ya ci gaba da wannan kamfen har zuwa ranar 19 ga watan Yuli, 1898, lokacin da ya kashe kansa a sansanin Dutsen Mlambalasi don gujewa kama shi. An binne shi kusa da wurin. Shi ma ɗan’uwan Mkwawa Chambila ya yi jajircewa, ya yi yaki da shi har karshe. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: In July 1891, Emil von Zelewski commanded a battalion of German Schutztruppe troops from the East African coast and into Hehe territory, which he proceeded to destroy using a scorched earth policy that resulted in the destruction of many settlements.[5] On 17 August near Lugalo, Zelewski's men lacked reconnaissance and were ambushed by approximately 3,000 Hehe warriors under Chief Mkwawa. Within minutes, Zelewski and most of his men were dead, with only a few managing to escape. A memorial was later placed on the site.[6]

targets.targetText: A cikin watan Yulin 1891, Emil von Zelewski ya umarci bataliyar sojojin Jamus Schutztruppe daga gabar tekun gabashin Afirka da kuma yankin Hehe, wanda ya ci gaba da lalata shi ta hanyar amfani da wata ƙazamin ƙasƙanci wanda ya haifar da lalata ƙauyuka da yawa. [1] A ranar 17 ga Agusta kusa da Lugalo, mutanen Zelewski ba su da leken asiri kuma mayakan Hehe kusan 3,000 ne suka yi musu kwanton bauna a karkashin Cif Mkwawa . A cikin 'yan mintoci kaɗan, Zelewski da yawancin mutanensa sun mutu, wasu kaɗan ne kawai suka sami nasarar tserewa. Daga baya aka sanya abin tunawa a wurin. [2]

A cikin watan Yulin 1891, Emil von Zelewski ya umarci bataliyar sojojin Jamus Schutztruppe daga gabar tekun gabashin Afirka da kuma yankin Hehe, wanda ya ci gaba da lalata shi ta hanyar amfani da wata ƙazamin ƙasƙanci wanda ya haifar da lalata ƙauyuka da yawa. [1] A ranar 17 ga watan Agusta kusa da Lugalo, mutanen Zelewski ba su da leken asiri kuma mayakan Hehe kusan 3,000 ne suka yi musu kwanton ɓauna a ƙarƙashin Cif Mkwawa. A cikin 'yan mintoci kaɗan, Zelewski da yawancin mutanensa sun mutu, wasu kaɗan ne kawai suka sami nasarar tserewa. Daga baya aka sanya abin tunawa a wurin. [2]

items.sourceText: Following a prior defeat at Beerdhiga, the British regrouped their forces in the Horn of Africa under new leadership, focusing their efforts against Sayid Muhammad Abdullah Hassan, a figure they referred to as the "Mad Mullah." The British devised a plan to launch a three-pronged attack on the Daraawiish. The first front, from Hobyo, consisted of 5,296 soldiers, including British and Boer troops from South Africa, as well as Somali, Yao, and Sikh fighters. The second front moved from Berbera, passing through Buhodle, with a force of 3,745 soldiers, which included Somalis, Sudanese, Sikhs, and Yaos, alongside British Royal Engineers. The third front advanced from Jigjiga via Dhagahbur, consisting mostly of Ethiopian troops under British leadership. These three groups were supposed to converge at Agarweyne by mid-October 1903.[3]

targets.targetText: Bayan shan kaye da aka yi a Beerdhiga, Turawan mulkin mallaka sun sake hada rundunoninsu a Kahon Afirka karkashin sabon jagoranci, inda suka mai da hankali kan kokarinsu kan Sayyid Muhammad Abdullah Hassan, wani adadi da suka kira "Mad Mullah." Turawan ingila sun tsara wani shiri na kaddamar da hari ta fuskoki uku a kan Daraawiish. Gaban farko, daga Hobyo, ya ƙunshi sojoji 5,296, ciki har da sojojin Birtaniya da na Boer daga Afirka ta Kudu, da kuma mayakan Somaliya, da Yao, da na Sikh. Gaba na biyu ya taso daga Berbera, ya ratsa ta Buhodle, tare da dakaru 3,745, wadanda suka hada da Somaliya, Sudan, Sikhs, da Yaos, tare da Injiniyoyin Sarauta na Burtaniya. Gaba na uku ya ci gaba daga Jigajiga ta hanyar Dutsen, wanda ya kunshi yawancin sojojin Habasha karkashin jagorancin Birtaniya . Wadannan rukunoni guda uku yakamata su hadu a Agarweyne a tsakiyar Oktoba 1903. [1]

Bayan shan kaye da aka yi a Beerdhiga, Turawan mulkin mallaka sun sake haɗa rundunoninsu a Kahon Afirka ƙarƙashin sabon jagoranci, inda suka mai da hankali kan kokarinsu kan Sayyid Muhammad Abdullah Hassan, wani adadi da suka kira "Mad Mullah." Turawan ingila sun tsara wani shiri na kaddamar da hari ta fuskoki uku a kan Daraawiish. Gaban farko, daga Hobyo, ya ƙunshi sojoji 5,296, ciki har da sojojin Birtaniya da na Boer daga Afirka ta Kudu, da kuma mayakan Somaliya, da Yao, da na Sikh. Gaba na biyu ya taso daga Berbera, ya ratsa ta Buhodle, tare da dakaru 3,745, waɗanda suka haɗa da Somaliya, Sudan, Sikhs, da Yaos, tare da Injiniyoyin Sarauta na Burtaniya. Gaba na uku ya ci gaba daga Jigajiga ta hanyar Dutsen, wanda ya kunshi yawancin sojojin Habasha ƙarƙashin jagorancin Birtaniya. Waɗannan ruƙunoni guda uku yakamata su haɗu a Agarweyne a tsakiyar watan Oktoba 1903. [1]

items.sourceText: The Battle of Berea was a battle between British forces under Sir George Cathcart and Basuto-Taung forces under King Moshoeshoe I that took place on 20 December 1852. The battle began when British forces broke into three columns and crossed the Caledon River in southern Africa, with the goal of seizing Basuto cattle as a form of punishment for past Basuto cattle raiding.

targets.targetText: Yakin Berea yaki ne tsakanin sojojin Birtaniya karkashin Sir George Cathcart da Basuto - Taung sojojin karkashin Sarki Moshoeshoe I wanda ya faru a ranar 20 ga Disamba 1852. An fara yakin ne a lokacin da sojojin Birtaniya suka balle ginshikan uku suka tsallaka kogin Caledon da ke kudancin Afirka, da nufin kwace shanun Basuto a matsayin wani nau'i na ukuba kan hare-haren Basuto da suka wuce.

Yakin Berea yaki ne tsakanin sojojin Birtaniya ƙarƙashin Sir George Cathcart da Basuto - Taung sojojin ƙarƙashin Sarki Moshoeshoe I wanda ya faru a ranar 20 ga watan Disamba 1852. An fara yakin ne a lokacin da sojojin Birtaniya suka balle ginshikan uku suka tsallaka kogin Caledon da ke kudancin Afirka, da nufin kwace shanun Basuto a matsayin wani nau'i na ukuba kan hare-haren Basuto da suka wuce.

items.sourceText: During the early 19th century, a diverse group of Sotho, Nguni and Tswana speaking tribes settled in the Caledon River region in southern Africa. The latter two formed the minority of the population and were gradually assimilated by the culturally dominant Sotho. King Moshoeshoe I united the various Sotho speaking chieftainships into a single nation during a period of political turbulence known as Lifaqane. By approximately 1828, Moshoeshoe's act had transformed the denigratory exonym of Sotho into the name of the nascent Basuto nation.[1][2][3] In the region's African societies cattle raiding played a crucial societal role in increasing a chief's prestige. By stealing cattle from rival tribes and then redistributing it to his followers under the mafisa system, the chief retained its nominal ownership while strengthening his relationship with his subjects.[4]

targets.targetText: A farkon karni na 19, gungun kabilu daban-daban na Sotho, Nguni da Tswana sun zauna a yankin kogin Caledon a kudancin Afirka. Na biyun sun zama tsirarun jama'a kuma a hankali Sotho mai rinjaye a al'adu sun hade su. Sarki Moshoeshoe na I ya haɗa manyan sarakunan Sotho da ke magana a cikin al'umma guda a lokacin rikicin siyasa da aka sani da Lifaqane . A kusan 1828, aikin Moshoeshoe ya canza sunan Sotho mai wulakantacce zuwa sunan al'ummar Basuto . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] A cikin al'ummomin Afirka na yankin, sace-sacen shanu ya taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen kara daukaka martabar sarki. Ta hanyar satar shanu daga kabilun da ke hamayya da juna sannan kuma a sake rabawa mabiyansa a karkashin tsarin mafisa, basaraken ya ci gaba da rike matsayinsa na suna tare da karfafa dangantakarsa da talakawansa. [ 4 ]

A farkon ƙarni na 19, gungun ƙabilu daban-daban na Sotho, Nguni da Tswana sun zauna a yankin kogin Caledon a kudancin Afirka. Na biyun sun zama tsirarun jama'a kuma a hankali Sotho mai rinjaye a al'adu sun haɗe su. Sarki Moshoeshoe na I ya haɗa manyan sarakunan Sotho da ke magana a cikin al'umma guda a lokacin rikicin siyasa da aka sani da Lifaqane. A kusan shekarar 1828, aikin Moshoeshoe ya canza sunan Sotho wulaƙantacce zuwa sunan al'ummar Basuto. [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] A cikin al'ummomin Afirka na yankin, sace-sacen shanu ya taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen ƙara ɗaukaka martabar sarki. Ta hanyar satar shanu daga ƙabilun da ke hamayya da juna sannan kuma a sake rabawa mabiyansa a ƙarƙashin tsarin mafisa, basaraken ya ci gaba da riƙe matsayinsa na suna tare da karfafa dangantakarsa da talakawansa. [ 4 ]

items.sourceText: The Battle of Erego (also known as Beerdhiga) occurred on October 6, 1902, in Hodayo, about 70 miles north of Galkacyo. The battle involved British colonial forces, led by Colonel Swayne, and Somali troops (known as Dervishes) under the command of Haji Muhammad Abdullah Hassan. The Dervishes won by ambushing the British forces.[6] The battle was an early conflict of the Somaliland campaign.

targets.targetText: Yakin Erego (wanda aka fi sani da Beerdhiga ) ya faru ne a ranar 6 ga Oktoba, 1902, a Hodayo, kimanin mil 70 daga arewacin Galkacyo . Yakin ya hada da sojojin mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya karkashin jagorancin Kanar Swayne da sojojin Somaliya (wanda aka fi sani da Dervishes ) karkashin jagorancin Haji Muhammad Abdullah Hassan . Derwishes sun ci nasara ta hanyar yi wa sojojin Ingila kwanton bauna. [1] Yakin ya kasance farkon rikicin yakin neman zaben Somaliland .

Yakin Erego (wanda aka fi sani da Beerdhiga) ya faru ne a ranar 6 ga watan Oktoba, 1902, a Hodayo, kimanin mil 70 daga arewacin Galkacyo. Yakin ya haɗa da sojojin mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya ƙarƙashin jagorancin Kanar Swayne da sojojin Somaliya (wanda aka fi sani da Dervishes) ƙarƙashin jagorancin Haji Muhammad Abdullah Hassan. Derwishes sun ci nasara ta hanyar yi wa sojojin Ingila kwanton ɓauna. [1] Yakin ya kasance farkon rikicin yakin kamfen na Somaliland.

items.sourceText: The British forces were on a mission to locate Hassan, who was known as "the Mad Mullah" for his resistance to colonial rule. This search led them to Erego, where they were ambushed by Hassan's forces.[7]

targets.targetText: Sojojin Birtaniyya na cikin wani aiki na neman gano Hassan wanda aka fi sani da "Mad Mullah " saboda tsayin daka da ya yi ga mulkin mallaka. Wannan bincike ya kai su Erego, inda sojojin Hassan suka yi musu kwanton bauna. [1]

Sojojin Birtaniyya na cikin wani aiki na neman gano Hassan wanda aka fi sani da "Mad Mullah" saboda tsayin daka da ya yi ga 'yan mulkin mallakai. Wannan bincike ya kai su Erego, inda sojojin Hassan suka yi musu kwanton ɓauna. [1]

items.sourceText: However, when the transport planes with the paratroopers landed on the airfield, Tunisian troops engaged them with targeted machine gun fire. In response, French jets supported by troops armed with 105 mm howitzers attacked the Tunisian roadblocks, destroying them completely. French tanks and armoured cars then rolled into Tunisian territory, and fired into the town of Ferryville, killing 27 soldiers and civilians. The following day, the French launched a full-scale invasion of the town of Bizerte. The Tunisians' few artillery posts were destroyed by rockets fired by French planes. Tanks and paratroopers penetrated into the city from the south, while marines stormed the harbour from landing craft. Three French cruisers were positioned offshore. Tunisian soldiers, paramilitaries,[3] and hastily organised civilian volunteers engaged the French in heavy street fighting, but were forced back by vastly superior French forces. The French overran the town on 23 July 1961.

targets.targetText: Sai dai a lokacin da jiragen saman jigilar kayayyaki tare da ma'aikatan suka sauka a filin jirgin saman, sojojin Tunisiya sun yi musu luguden wuta da bindiga. A martanin da aka mayar, jiragen Faransa da ke samun goyon bayan sojoji dauke da makamai 105 'Yan ta'addar mm sun kai hari kan shingayen hanyar Tunisiya, inda suka lalata su gaba daya. Tankunan Faransa da motoci masu sulke daga nan ne suka yi birgima cikin yankin Tunisiya, suka yi luguden wuta a cikin garin Ferryville, inda suka kashe sojoji 27 da fararen hula. Washegari ne Faransawa suka kai wani gagarumin farmaki a garin Bizerte. Rokokin da jiragen Faransa suka harbawa 'yan Tunisiya sun lalata wasu ƴan matsugunan bindigu. Tankuna da jami'an tsaro sun kutsa cikin birnin daga kudu, yayin da ma'aikatan ruwa suka mamaye tashar jiragen ruwa daga jiragen ruwa na sauka. An ajiye jiragen ruwa na Faransa guda uku a teku. Sojojin Tunisiya, ƴan sa-kai, [1] da masu aikin sa kai cikin gaggawar shirya farar hula sun tsunduma Faransa cikin mummunan fadan titi, amma manyan sojojin Faransa sun tilasta musu komawa baya. Faransa ta mamaye garin a ranar 23 ga Yuli 1961.

Sai dai a lokacin da jiragen saman jigilar kayayyaki tare da ma'aikatan suka sauka a filin jirgin saman, sojojin Tunisiya sun yi musu luguden wuta da bindiga. A martanin da aka mayar, jiragen Faransa da ke samun goyon bayan sojoji ɗauke da makamai 105 'Yan ta'addar mm sun kai hari kan shingayen hanyar Tunisiya, inda suka lalata su gaba ɗaya. Tankunan Faransa da motoci masu sulke daga nan ne suka yi birgima cikin yankin Tunisiya, suka yi luguden wuta a cikin garin Ferryville, inda suka kashe sojoji 27 da fararen hula. Washegari ne Faransawa suka kai wani gagarumin farmaki a garin Bizerte. Rokokin da jiragen Faransa suka harbawa 'yan Tunisiya sun lalata wasu ƴan matsugunan bindigu. Tankuna da jami'an tsaro sun kutsa cikin birnin daga kudu, yayin da ma'aikatan ruwa suka mamaye tashar jiragen ruwa daga jiragen ruwa na sauka. An ajiye jiragen ruwa na Faransa guda uku a teku. Sojojin Tunisiya, ƴan sa-kai, [1] da masu aikin sa kai cikin gaggawar shirya farar hula sun tsunduma Faransa cikin mummunan faɗan titi, amma manyan sojojin Faransa sun tilasta musu komawa baya. Faransa ta mamaye garin a ranar 23 ga watan Yuli 1961.

items.sourceText: The Libyan Arab Force, also known as the Sanusi Army, consisting of five infantry battalions made up of volunteers, was established to aid the British war effort. With the exception of one military engagement near Benghazi, this force's role did not extend beyond support and gendarmerie duties.[1] It was initially known as the British Arab Force and was renamed the Cyrenaica Defence Force in March 1943.

targets.targetText: Dakarun Larabawa na Libya, wanda kuma aka fi sani da Sunusi Army, wanda ya kunshi bataliyoyin sojan ƙasa biyar waɗanda suka haɗa da masu aikin sa kai, an kafa su don taimakawa yakin na Burtaniya. Ban da wani aikin soja a kusa da Benghazi, aikin wannan rundunar bai wuce aikin tallafi da jandarmomi ba. [ 1 ] Da farko an san shi da Sojojin Larabawa na Burtaniya kuma an sake masa suna Rundunar Tsaro ta Cyrenaica a cikin watan Maris 1943.

Dakarun Larabawa na Libya, wanda kuma aka fi sani da Sunusi Army, wanda ya kunshi bataliyoyin sojan kasa biyar wadanda suka hada da masu aikin sa kai, an kafa su don taimakawa yakin na Burtaniya. Ban da wani aikin soja a kusa da Benghazi, aikin wannan rundunar bai wuce aikin tallafi da jandarmomi ba. [ 1 ] Da farko an san shi da Sojojin Larabawa na Burtaniya kuma an sake masa suna Rundunar Tsaro ta Cyrenaica a cikin Maris 1943.

items.sourceText: Following the outbreak of World War II in 1939, Idris of Libya supported the United Kingdom—which was now at war with Italy—in the hope of ridding his country of Italian occupation. He argued that even if the Italians were victorious, the situation for the Libyan people would be no different than before the war. Delegates from both the Cyrenaicans and Tripolitanians agreed that Idris should conclude agreements with the British that they would gain independence in return for support during the war.[1] Vladimir Peniakoff was commissioned as a second lieutenant and served in the Libyan Arab Force,[2] before creating a unit known as Popski's Private Army.

targets.targetText: Bayan barkewar yakin duniya na biyu a shekara ta 1939, Idris na Libya ya goyi bayan Burtaniya —wanda yanzu ke yaki da Italiya—da fatan kawar da kasarsa daga mamayar Italiya. Ya kara da cewa, ko da Italiyawa sun yi nasara, lamarin da al'ummar kasar Libya ke ciki ba zai sha bamban da kafin yakin. Wakilai daga duka mutanen Kireneka da na Tripoli sun amince cewa Idris ya kulla yarjejeniya da Birtaniya cewa za su sami 'yancin kai don samun goyon baya a lokacin yakin. [ 1 ] Vladimir Peniakoff an ba shi izini a matsayin mukaddashin na biyu kuma ya yi aiki a cikin Sojojin Larabawa na Libya, [1] kafin ƙirƙirar rukunin da aka sani da Sojoji masu zaman kansu na Popski .

Bayan ɓarkewar yakin duniya na biyu a shekara ta 1939, Idris na Libya ya goyi bayan Burtaniya —wanda yanzu ke yaki da Italiya—da fatan kawar da ƙasar sa daga mamayar Italiya. Ya kara da cewa, ko da Italiyawa sun yi nasara, lamarin da al'ummar ƙasar Libya ke ciki ba zai sha bamban da kafin yakin. Wakilai daga duka mutanen Kireneka da na Tripoli sun amince cewa Idris ya kulla yarjejeniya da Birtaniya cewa za su sami 'yancin kai don samun goyon baya a lokacin yakin. [ 1 ] Vladimir Peniakoff an ba shi izini a matsayin mukaddashin na biyu kuma ya yi aiki a cikin Sojojin Larabawa na Libya, [1] kafin ƙirƙirar ruƙunin da akafi sani da Sojoji masu zaman kansu na Popski.

items.sourceText: The violent repression of the nationalist insurgency left deep scars in Malagasy society. A generation of the managerial class was wiped out, creating challenges for the country when it achieved independence in 1960. Madagascar's first three deputies were arrested, tortured and kept in prison until they were given amnesty in 1958. Another leader who survived the conflict, Monja Jaona, was also jailed for nine years and then founded the Madagascar for the Malagasy Party (MONIMA), which has had considerable influence on Malagasy politics. France classified most documents related to the Uprising, and the French government maintained silence on the subject until French president Jacques Chirac termed it "unacceptable" during an official visit to Madagascar in 2005. Several Malagasy directors have set films in the period of the Uprising. In 1967, the Malagasy government declared 29 March an annual holiday, and in 2012, a museum dedicated to the Uprising was inaugurated in Moramanga.

targets.targetText: Mummunan danniya da 'yan tawaye masu kishin ƙasa suka yi ya bar taɓo sosai a cikin al'ummar Malagasy. An shafe tsararraki na masu mulki, wanda ya haifar da ƙalubale ga ƙasar lokacin da ta sami 'yancin kai a shekarar 1960. An kama mataimakan Madagascar guda uku na farko, an azabtar da su tare da tsare su a kurkuku har sai da aka yi musu afuwa a shekarar 1958. Wani shugaban da ya tsira daga rikicin, Monja Jaona, shi ma an ɗaure shi na tsawon shekaru tara sannan ya kafa jam'iyyar Madagascar ta Jam'iyyar Malagasy (MONIMA), wacce ta yi tasiri sosai a siyasar Malagasy. Faransa ta ware mafi yawan takardu masu alaka da tashe tashen hankula, kuma gwamnatin Faransa ta yi shiru kan batun har sai da shugaban Faransa Jacques Chirac ya ce ba za a amince da shi ba a wata ziyarar aiki da ya kai Madagascar a shekara ta 2005. Wasu daraktocin Malagasy da dama sun shirya fina-finai a lokacin tashin hankali. A cikin shekarar 1967, gwamnatin Malagasy ta ayyana ranar 29 ga watan Maris a matsayin hutun shekara, kuma a cikin shekarar 2012, an buɗe gidan kayan gargajiya da aka sadaukar don tayar da hankali a Moramanga.

Mummunan danniya da 'yan tawaye masu kishin kasa suka yi ya bar tabo sosai a cikin al'ummar Malagasy. An shafe tsararraki na masu mulki, wanda ya haifar da kalubale ga kasar lokacin da ta sami 'yancin kai a 1960. An kama mataimakan Madagascar guda uku na farko, an azabtar da su tare da tsare su a kurkuku har sai da aka yi musu afuwa a shekarar 1958. Wani shugaban da ya tsira daga rikicin, Monja Jaona, shi ma an daure shi na tsawon shekaru tara sannan ya kafa jam'iyyar Madagascar ta Jam'iyyar Malagasy (MONIMA), wacce ta yi tasiri sosai a siyasar Malagasy. Faransa ta ware mafi yawan takardu masu alaka da tashe tashen hankula, kuma gwamnatin Faransa ta yi shiru kan batun har sai da shugaban Faransa Jacques Chirac ya ce ba za a amince da shi ba a wata ziyarar aiki da ya kai Madagascar a shekara ta 2005. Wasu daraktocin Malagasy da dama sun shirya fina-finai a lokacin tashin hankali. A cikin 1967, gwamnatin Malagasy ta ayyana ranar 29 ga Maris a matsayin hutun shekara, kuma a cikin 2012, an buɗe gidan kayan gargajiya da aka sadaukar don tayar da hankali a Moramanga.

items.sourceText: It all began around 8 a.m., when the insurgents reached Bou Jaad. By 8:30, groups of Beni Khirane entered the city by truck and horseback. Around 9 a.m., the Smaala, Bani Smir, and Beni Khirane tribes stormed the city.[7] Over 20,000 men attacked the city, similar to razzias, even attacking the hospital.[8] At 11 a.m., the 2nd Battalion of the 4th R.E.I was alerted to the atrocities in Oued Zem.[9] Armed with axes, sticks, stones, and rifles, Moroccans shot at and stoned the French gendarmes in Oued Zem. One of them, gendarme Soumagne, was fatally wounded.[4] For several hours, Lieutenant Bach and his men attempted to hold off the Smaala forces, both on foot and horseback, most armed with rifles, from the European quarter until reinforcements arrived. The gendarmerie on site reported between 50 and 75 Europeans killed (over 77 according to the Foreign Legion[9]).[1][10][11] Additionally, 19 security force members were killed.[9]

targets.targetText: Lamarin dai ya fara ne da misalin karfe 8 na safe, lokacin da maharan suka isa Bou Jaad. Da karfe 8:30, gungun 'yan ƙabilar Beni Khirane suka shiga birnin da manyan motoci da dawakai. Da misalin karfe tara na safe ne ƙabilun Smaala, Bani Smir, da Beni Khirane suka mamaye birnin. [1] Sama da mutane 20,000 ne suka kai hari a birnin, irin su Razias, har ma da kai hari a asibiti. [2] Da karfe 11 na safe ne aka sanar da runduna ta 2 ta 4 ta REI game da ta'asar da aka yi a Oued Zem. [3] Masu ɗauke da gatari, sanduna, duwatsu, da bindigu, 'yan Morocco sun harbe tare da jifan jandarmomi na Faransa a Oued Zem. Ɗaya daga cikinsu mai suna Gendarme Soumagne ya samu rauni sosai. [4] Na tsawon sa'o'i da yawa, Laftanar Bach da mutanensa sun yi ƙoƙarin kashe sojojin Smaala, a ƙafa da dawakai, mafi yawan makamai da bindigogi, daga kwata na Turai har sai da ƙarfafawa suka isa. Jandarma a wurin ya ruwaito tsakanin 50 da 75 Turawa sun kashe (fiye da 77 bisa ga Ƙungiyar Ƙasashen waje [3] ). [4] [5] [6] Bugu da ƙari, an kashe jami'an tsaro 19. [3]

Da misalin karfe tara na safe ne kabilun Smaala, Bani Smir, da Beni Khirane suka mamaye birnin. [1] Sama da mutane 20,000 ne suka kai hari a birnin, irin su Razias, har ma da kai hari a asibiti. items.sourceText: Despite the Brussels Conference Act of 1890, which made it illegal to sell gun and ammunition to Africans, traders from both Germany and Portugal continued to smuggle in weapons, alcohol, ivory, and cattle into Ovamboland (the area made up of ethnic Ovambo). Ovambo leaders sought guns above all else in their dealings with merchants since they needed them for their raids. Due to decades of these illegal arms trades, many of the Ovambo kingdoms owned large amounts of guns and their military capacity was not to be underestimated. Almost every Ovambo owned a gun, and a revolt even broke out there a decade before. The German and Portuguese had tried to stop the trading of arms but were unable to do so. This all changed when Mandume rose to power in 1911. Mandume expelled all traders from his kingdom because of the colonial intrusion which threatened his sovereignty, while other Kingdoms were still welcoming to traders.[10]

targets.targetText: Duk da Dokar Taro na Brussels na shekarar 1890, wanda ya haramta sayar da bindigogi da harsasai ga 'yan Afirka, 'yan kasuwa daga Jamus da Portugal sun ci gaba da yin safarar makamai, barasa, hauren giwa, da shanu zuwa Ovamboland (yankin da ke da 'yan ƙabilar Ovambo). Shugabannin Ovambo sun nemi bindigogi fiye da komai a cikin mu'amalarsu da 'yan kasuwa tunda suna buƙatar su don kai farmaki. Saboda shekaru da dama da aka yi ana sayar da makamai ba bisa ka'ida ba, yawancin masarautun Ovambo sun mallaki bindigogi masu yawan gaske kuma ba za a raina karfinsu na soja ba. Kusan kowane Ovambo ya mallaki bindiga, kuma tawaye ma ya ɓarke a can shekaru goma da suka wuce. Jamusawa da Portuguese sun yi ƙoƙarin hana cinikin makamai amma sun kasa yin hakan. Wannan duk ya canza lokacin da Mandume ya hau mulki a shekarar 1911. Mandume ya kori dukkan ‘yan kasuwa daga masarautarsa saboda kutsen da Turawan mulkin mallaka suka yi masa wanda ke barazana ga mulkinsa, yayin da sauran masarautu ke maraba da ‘yan kasuwa. [ 10 ]

Wannan duk ya canza lokacin da Mandume ya hau mulki a 1911. items.sourceText: Mandume rejected the idea of Portuguese colonial rule and demanded to be on equal terms with the colonial rulers in their distant capitals. Mandume also sought close relations with the Germans despite them owning the southern half of his kingdom. He even as far as to describe the governor of German South West Africa, Theodor Seitz, as his "brother in Windhuk."[11]

targets.targetText: Mandume ya ki amincewa da ra'ayin 'yan mulkin mallaka na Portugal kuma ya buƙaci su kasance daidai da masu mulkin mallaka a manyan biranensu masu nisa. Mandume ya kuma nemi kusanci da Jamusawa duk da cewa sun mallaki rabin kudancin mulkinsa. Har ma ya kwatanta gwamnan Jamus ta Kudu maso Yammacin Afirka, Theodor Seitz, a matsayin "ɗan'uwansa a Windhuk." [ 11 ]
