items.sourceText: As a response to the violence caused by the attacks on Lourenço Marques and the refusal to submit to Portuguese authorities, the Portuguese administration demanded the delivery an annual payment of 10,000 pounds in gold and authorization for the collection of taxes and other commercial and military from the kings Matibejane and Maazul. Gungunhana probably did not want a confrontation with the Portuguese, but the war-faction led by Maguiguana won out, therefore he gathered all his mangas of warriors under the command of Maguiguana.[1]

targets.targetText: A matsayin martani ga tashin hankalin da harin da aka kai Lourenço Marques ya haifar da kuma kin mika kai ga mahukuntan kasar Portugal, gwamnatin kasar ta Portugal ta bukaci a ba da kudin da ya kai fam 10,000 na zinari a duk shekara da kuma ba da izini na karbar haraji da sauran kasuwanci da sojoji daga sarakunan Matibejane da Maazul. Wataƙila Gungunhana ba ya son arangama da Portuguese, amma ƙungiyar yaƙi da Maguiguana ke jagoranta ta yi nasara, don haka ya tattara dukan mangas na mayaka a ƙarƙashin umarnin Maguiguana. [1]

A matsayin martani ga tashin hankalin da harin da aka kai Lourenço Marques ya haifar da kuma kin miƙa kai ga mahukuntan ƙasar Portugal, gwamnatin ƙasar ta Portugal ta buƙaci a ba da kuɗin da ya kai fam 10,000 na zinari a duk shekara da kuma ba da izini na karɓar haraji da sauran kasuwanci da sojoji daga sarakunan Matibejane da Maazul. Wataƙila Gungunhana ba ya son arangama da Portuguese, amma ƙungiyar yaƙi da Maguiguana ke jagoranta ta yi nasara, don haka ya tattara dukan mangas na mayaka a ƙarƙashin umarnin Maguiguana. [1]

items.sourceText: Brahim Chergui (1922 – 7 January 2016), known as H'mida was a revolutionary during the Algerian war of independence. He was the first leader of the Zone Autonome d'Alger (ZAA).[1] Chergui was captured by French paratroopers on 23 February 1957. He was placed into the cell next door to Larbi Ben M'hidi. Chergui was severely tortured and was imprisoned in the Serkadji prison in Algiers until being released when Algeria gained independence in 1962.[2] Chergui died at the age of 94 in Hôpital Militaire Aïn Naâdja, Algiers on 6 January 2016.

targets.targetText: Brahim Chergui (1922 - 7 ga Janairu 2016), wanda aka fi sani da H'mida ɗan juyin-juya hali ne a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya . Shi ne shugaban farko na Zone Autonome d'Alger (ZAA). [1] Sojojin Faransa sun kama Chergui a ranar 23 ga Fabrairun 1957. An sanya shi a cikin tantanin da ke kusa da Larbi Ben M'hidi . An azabtar da Chergui mai tsanani kuma an tsare shi a kurkukun Serkadji a Algiers har zuwa lokacin da aka sake shi lokacin da Aljeriya ta sami 'yancin kai a 1962. [2] Chergui ya mutu yana da shekaru 94 a asibitin Militaire Ain Naâdja, Algiers a ranar 6 ga Janairu 2016.

Brahim Chergui (1922 - 7 ga watan Janairu 2016), wanda aka fi sani da H'mida ɗan juyin-juya hali ne a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya. Shi ne shugaban farko na Zone Autonome d'Alger (ZAA). [1] Sojojin Faransa sun kama Chergui a ranar 23 ga watan Fabrairun 1957. An sanya shi a cikin tantanin da ke kusa da Larbi Ben M'hidi. An azabtar da Chergui da a zaba mai tsanani kuma an tsare shi a kurkukun Serkadji a Algiers har zuwa lokacin da aka sake shi lokacin da Aljeriya ta sami 'yancin kai a shekarar 1962. [2] Chergui ya mutu yana da shekaru 94 a asibitin Militaire Ain Naâdja, Algiers a ranar 6 ga watan Janairu 2016.

items.sourceText: Omar Derdour (Arabic: عمر دردور), full name Abou El Kacem Omar Derdour (13 October 1913 – 19 March 2009), was an Algerian Muslim leader, nationalist, and political worker.

targets.targetText: Omar Derdour ( Arabic ), cikakken suna Abou El Kacem Omar Derdour (13 Oktoba 1913 - 19 Maris 2009), shugaban musulmin Aljeriya ne, mai kishin kasa, kuma ma'aikacin siyasa.
Omar Derdour cikakken suna Abou El Kacem Omar Derdour (13 Oktoba 1913 - 19 Maris 2009), shugaban musulmin Aljeriya ne, mai kishin ƙasa, kuma ma'aikacin siyasa.

items.sourceText: Following the descent of "Rehaim" on March 18, 1950; the dismantling of a large part of the organization's network, which resulted in the arrest of 130 people and the discovery of his responsibilities in the structure; and the failure of the French administration to capture him, a judgment was entered against him in absentia that sentenced him to 10 years in prison. In 1952, with Ben Boulaïd, he created the core of a clandestine movement in Algiers, whose mission was to make bombs in anticipation of the outbreak of the "National Revolution".

targets.targetText: Bayan saukar "Rehaim" a ranar 18 ga watan Maris, 1950; tarwatsa wani babban ɓangare na hanyoyin sadarwa na kungiyar, wanda ya yi sanadin kama mutane 130 tare da gano nauyin da ke kansa a cikin tsarin; da gazawar gwamnatin Faransa wajen kama shi, an yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin shekaru 10 a gidan yari ba ya nan. A cikin shekarar 1952, tare da Ben Boulaïd, ya kirkiro ginshiƙan motsi na ɓoye a Algiers, wanda manufarsa ita ce yin bama-bamai a cikin tsammanin ɓarkewar "Juyin Juyin Hali na Ƙasa".

Bayan saukar "Rehaim" a ranar 18 ga Maris, 1950; tarwatsa wani babban bangare na hanyoyin sadarwa na kungiyar, wanda ya yi sanadin kama mutane 130 tare da gano nauyin da ke kansa a cikin tsarin; da gazawar gwamnatin Faransa wajen kama shi, an yanke masa hukuncin daurin shekaru 10 a gidan yari ba ya nan. A cikin 1952, tare da Ben Boulaïd, ya kirkiro ginshiƙan motsi na ɓoye a Algiers, wanda manufarsa ita ce yin bama-bamai a cikin tsammanin barkewar "Juyin Juyin Halitta na Ƙasa".

items.sourceText: Ighilahriz was born in Oujda to a Berber family and her family moved to Algiers in 1948. Though she was born in Morocco, the Ighilahriz family originated from the Kabylie region of Algeria, whose Berber tribes had been some of the fiercest opponents of French rule in Algeria. Ighilahriz "describes herself as coming from a whole family of nationalists," calling her mother "illiterate but hyperpoliticised" and saying that her maternal grandfather clandestinely manufactured guns for "revolutionaries."[2] When hearing about the beginning of the Algerian War on 1 November 1954, her father, who worked as a baker, told her: "It is the end of the humiliation".[3]

targets.targetText: An haifi Ighilahriz a Oujda ga dangin Berber kuma danginta sun ƙaura zuwa Algiers a shekarar 1948. Ko da yake an haife ta a Maroko, dangin Ighilahriz sun samo asali ne daga yankin Kabylie na Aljeriya, wanda ƙabilar Berber suka kasance daga cikin masu adawa da mulkin Faransa a Aljeriya. Ighilahriz "ta bayyana kanta a matsayin ta fito daga dukan dangin 'yan kishin ƙasa," tana mai kiran mahaifiyarta "marasa rubutu amma mai yawan siyasa" tare da cewa kakanta na uwa ya kera bindigogi a ɓoye don "masu juyin juya hali." [1] Lokacin da aka ji labarin farkon yakin Aljeriya a ranar 1 ga watan Nuwamba 1954, mahaifinta, wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin mai burodi, ya gaya mata: "Wannan shine ƙarshen wulakanci". [2]

An haifi Ighilahriz a Oujda ga dangin Berber kuma danginta sun ƙaura zuwa Algiers a 1948. Ko da yake an haife ta a Maroko, dangin Ighilahriz sun samo asali ne daga yankin Kabylie na Aljeriya, wanda kabilar Berber suka kasance daga cikin masu adawa da mulkin Faransa a Aljeriya. Ighilahriz "ta bayyana kanta a matsayin ta fito daga dukan dangin 'yan kishin kasa," tana mai kiran mahaifiyarta "marasa rubutu amma mai yawan siyasa" tare da cewa kakanta na uwa ya kera bindigogi a boye don "masu juyin juya hali." [1] Lokacin da aka ji labarin farkon yakin Aljeriya a ranar 1 ga Nuwamba 1954, mahaifinta, wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin mai burodi, ya gaya mata: "Wannan shine ƙarshen wulakanci". [2]

items.sourceText: Following the failed coup, Zbiri spent several years in hiding and exile.[1] There is limited information on his activities during this period, though he reportedly spent time in neighboring countries.[9] Eventually, Zbiri was allowed to return to Algeria, although his influence on national politics significantly diminished after the failed coup.[9]

targets.targetText: Bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba, Zbiri ya kwashe shekaru da dama yana ɓuya da gudun hijira. [1] Akwai taƙaitaccen bayani game da ayyukansa a wannan lokacin, kodayake an ba da rahoton cewa ya shafe lokaci a ƙasashe makwabta. [1] Daga karshe dai an kyale Zbiri ya koma ƙasar Aljeriya, duk da cewa tasirinsa a siyasar ƙasar ya ragu matuka bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba. [1]

Bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba, Zbiri ya kwashe shekaru da dama yana buya da gudun hijira . [1] Akwai taƙaitaccen bayani game da ayyukansa a wannan lokacin, kodayake an ba da rahoton cewa ya shafe lokaci a ƙasashe makwabta . [1] Daga karshe dai an kyale Zbiri ya koma kasar Aljeriya, duk da cewa tasirinsa a siyasar kasar ya ragu matuka bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba. [1]

items.sourceText: Zbiri was regarded as one of the notable figures in Algerian history due to his attempt to challenge the political establishment and military during a period of consolidation for the newly independent state.[10] His role was often viewed in the broader context of the power struggles and factionalism that characterized Algeria's early post-independence years.[11]

targets.targetText: An ɗauki Zbiri a matsayin ɗaya daga cikin fitattun mutane a tarihin ƙasar Aljeriya saboda yunkurinsa na ƙalubalantar kafa siyasa da soja a lokacin da ake samun haɗin kai ga sabuwar ƙasa mai cin gashin kanta. [1] Ana kallon rawar da ya taka a fagen gwagwarmayar mulki da ɓangaranci wanda ya nuna farkon shekarun da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai. [2]

An dauki Zbiri a matsayin daya daga cikin fitattun mutane a tarihin kasar Aljeriya saboda yunkurinsa na kalubalantar kafa siyasa da soja a lokacin da ake samun hadin kai ga sabuwar kasa mai cin gashin kanta. [1] Ana kallon rawar da ya taka a fagen gwagwarmayar mulki da bangaranci wanda ya nuna farkon shekarun da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai. [2]

items.sourceText: This band presents songs of different themes, much more popular, until 1954 when all cultural activity is prohibited. Just after the strike of eight days of January 28, 1957, these artists which were forbidden to perform in their country regain Tunisia, and others among them, joined the maquis. Among the members of the troupe are Mustapha Sahnoun, Mustapha Kateb, Boualem Raïs, Sid Ali Kouiret

targets.targetText: Wannan ruƙunin yana gabatar da waƙoƙin jigogi daban-daban, waɗanda suka fi shahara, har zuwa shekara ta 1954 lokacin da aka haramta duk ayyukan al'adu. Bayan yajin aikin kwanaki takwas na ranar 28 ga watan Janairu, 1957, waɗannan mawakan da aka hana yin wasan kwaikwayo a ƙasarsu sun dawo Tunisia, da wasu daga cikinsu, sun shiga cikin maquis. Daga cikin mambobin kungiyar akwai Mustapha Sahnoun, Mustapha Kateb, Boualem Raïs, Sid Ali Kouiret.

Wannan rukunin yana gabatar da waƙoƙin jigogi daban-daban, waɗanda suka fi shahara, har zuwa 1954 lokacin da aka haramta duk ayyukan al'adu. Bayan yajin aikin kwanaki takwas na ranar 28 ga Janairu, 1957, wadannan mawakan da aka hana yin wasan kwaikwayo a kasarsu sun dawo Tunisia, da wasu daga cikinsu, sun shiga cikin maquis . Daga cikin mambobin kungiyar akwai Mustapha Sahnoun, Mustapha Kateb, Boualem Raïs, Sid Ali Kouiret.

items.sourceText: Mohamed Rahmoune (1940 – 4 February 2022), commonly known as Si Rabah or simply as Rahmoune, was a prominent revolutionary leader during the Algerian war of independence as a member of the Front de Libération Nationale (FLN; National Liberation Front) that launched an armed revolt throughout Algeria and issued a proclamation calling for a sovereign Algerian state.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Mohamed Rahmoune (1940 - 4 ga watan Fabrairu 2022), wanda aka fi sani da Si Rabah ko kuma kawai a matsayin Rahmoune, ya kasance fitaccen jagoran juyin juya hali a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya a matsayin memba na Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN; National Liberation Front) wanda ya kaddamar da tawaye ɗauke da makamai a duk faɗin Aljeriya tare da fitar da sanarwar kira ga ƙasar Aljeriya mai cin gashin kanta. [1] [2]

Mohamed Rahmoune (1940 - 4 ga Fabrairu 2022), wanda aka fi sani da Si Rabah ko kuma kawai a matsayin Rahmoune, ya kasance fitaccen jagoran juyin juya hali a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya a matsayin memba na Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN; National Liberation Front) wanda ya kaddamar da tawaye dauke da makamai a duk fadin Aljeriya tare da fitar da sanarwar kira ga kasar Aljeriya mai cin gashin kanta. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Moudjahid Rahmoune died on February 4, 2022, at the home of his family in Thénia at the age of 82.[1]

targets.targetText: Moudjahid Rahmoune ya mutu a ranar 4 ga watan Fabrairu, 2022, a gidan danginsa a Thénia yana da shekaru 82. [1]
Moudjahid Rahmoune ya mutu a ranar 4 ga Fabrairu, 2022, a gidan danginsa a Thénia yana da shekaru 82. [1]

items.sourceText: On 26 November 1957, Peschard and 10 other rebels were killed by the French army near the town of Medjana. Following the end of the Algerian War for Independence, Peschard was declared a martyr of the conflict.[3][2] According to Jean-Luc Einaudi, she was the only Algerian of European descent to be named as a martyr of the conflict.[4]

targets.targetText: A ranar 26 ga watan Nuwamban 1957, sojojin Faransa sun kashe Peschar da wasu 'yan tawaye 10 a kusa da garin Medjana. Bayan kawo ƙarshen yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya, an ayyana Peschard a matsayin shahidiya a wannan rikici. [1] [2] A cewar Jean-Luc Einaudi, ita kaɗai ce ‘yar ƙasar Aljeriya ‘yar asalin Turai da aka bayyana sunanta a matsayin shahidan rikicin. [3]

A ranar 26 ga Nuwamban 1957, sojojin Faransa sun kashe Peschar da wasu 'yan tawaye 10 a kusa da garin Medjana . Bayan kawo karshen yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya, an ayyana Peschard a matsayin shahidan wannan rikici. [1] [2] A cewar Jean-Luc Einaudi, ita kadai ce ‘yar kasar Aljeriya ‘yar asalin Turai da aka bayyana sunanta a matsayin shahidan rikicin. [3]

items.sourceText: Mohamed Mechkarini (1896–1935) is a Kabyle rebel who attacked colonial administrators in the early twentieth century. Finally captured, he was arrested on January 6, 1929.

targets.targetText: Mohamed Mechkarini (1896-1935) ɗan tawayen Kabyle ne wanda ya kai hari ga masu mulkin mallaka a farkon ƙarni na ashirin. A ƙarshe aka kama shi, an kama shi a ranar 6 ga watan Janairu, 1929.
Mohamed Mechkarini (1896-1935) ɗan tawayen Kabyle ne wanda ya kai hari ga masu mulkin mallaka a farkon karni na ashirin. A ƙarshe aka kama shi, an kama shi a ranar 6 ga Janairu, 1929.

items.sourceText: Having been taken prisoner in Germany, Zemmouri soon suffered the effects of the propaganda which was made in the native prison camps for the recruitment of the Turkish army, and consented to serve in the enemy ranks.

targets.targetText: Bayan da aka kai shi fursuna a Jamus, ba da daɗewa ba Zemmouri ya sha wahala sakamakon farfagandar da aka yi a sansanonin fursunoni na ƙasar don ɗaukar sojojin Turkiyya, kuma ya yarda ya yi aiki a cikin sahun abokan gaba.

Bayan da aka kai shi a matsayin fursuna a Jamus, ba da daɗewa ba Zemmouri ya sha wahala sakamakon farfagandar da aka yi a sansanonin fursunoni na ƙasar don ɗaukar sojojin Turkiyya, kuma ya yarda ya yi aiki a cikin sahun abokan gaba.

items.sourceText: Women were central to Algerian resistance efforts. The FLN's strategic use of women in their bombings and attacks was a result of French stereotypes about Muslim women as innocent, submissive, and oppressed.[11] When Algerian militants formed the FLN in 1954, thousands of women, including Lavalette, joined in their anticolonial struggle.[2][3][4] Like other women at the time, but unlike other Pied-Noirs, Lavalette distributed resources (like pamphlets), transported messages, and provided food and housing to freedom fighters as they infiltrated rural mountain villages to kill French sympathizers and workers.[8][10][12]

targets.targetText: Mata sun kasance tsakiyar yunƙurin juriya na Aljeriya. Dabarar da FLN ta yi na amfani da mata wajen kai hare-haren bama-bamai da hare-harensu ya samo asali ne sakamakon ra'ayin Faransawa game da matan musulmi a matsayin marasa laifi, masu biyayya, da zalunci. [1] Lokacin da mayakan Aljeriya suka kafa FLN a shekara ta 1954, dubban mata, ciki har da Lavalette, sun shiga gwagwarmayar kin jinin mulkin mallaka. [2] [3] [4] Kamar sauran mata a lokacin, amma ba kamar sauran Pied-Noirs ba, Lavalette ta rarraba albarkatu (kamar ƙasidu), jigilar sakonni, da kuma ba da abinci da gidaje ga mayakan 'yanci yayin da suke kutsawa cikin ƙauyukan masu tsaunuka don kashe masu goyon bayan Faransa da ma'aikata. [3] [4] [5]

Mata sun kasance tsakiyar yunƙurin juriya na Aljeriya. Dabarar da FLN ta yi na amfani da mata wajen kai hare-haren bama-bamai da hare-harensu ya samo asali ne sakamakon ra'ayin Faransawa game da matan musulmi a matsayin marasa laifi, masu biyayya, da zalunci. [1] Lokacin da mayakan Aljeriya suka kafa FLN a shekara ta 1954, dubban mata, ciki har da Lavalette, sun shiga gwagwarmayar kin jinin mulkin mallaka. [2] [3] [4] Kamar sauran mata a lokacin, amma ba kamar sauran Pied-Noirs ba, Lavalette ya rarraba albarkatu (kamar ƙasidu), jigilar sakonni, da kuma ba da abinci da gidaje ga mayakan 'yanci yayin da suke kutsawa cikin kauyukan tsaunuka don kashe masu goyon bayan Faransa da ma'aikata. [3] [4] [5]

items.sourceText: Following the death of her husband, increasing violence, and forced homelessness, Lavalette moved back to Médéa to live amongst her friends. She died in 2014, one year after publishing her memoir.[1] Civilian’s narratives such as Lavalette’s are important because they explain the suffering of the general people who are not actively fighting in the war. Furthermore, her generation of women are particularly hesitant to publicly talk about their experiences due to their continued fights for equality under an Islamic Fundamentalist regime.[10] Lavalette has explained her own reluctance to share her experiences for fear of violence.[10][2] Eveline Safir Lavalette’s importance, as both a fighter and an everyday citizen, explores the psychological impacts of the war, untold by common narratives of war that are male-centric and focused on political conflict instead of personal turmoil. As a result, her memoir has scholarly importance. She has been referenced by multiple researchers, scholars, and historians since her death in 2013.

targets.targetText: Bayan mutuwar mijinta, ƙara tashin hankali, da tilasta rashin matsuguni, Lavalette ta koma Medéa don ta zauna tare da abokanta. Ta rasu a shekara ta 2014, shekara guda bayan buga littafin tarihinta. [1] Bayanan farar hula irin su Lavalette suna da mahimmanci saboda suna bayyana wahalar da jama'ar da ba sa yin gwagwarmaya a yakin. Bugu da ƙari kuma, tsararrakinta mata ba su da shakku musamman a bainar jama'a game da abubuwan da suka faru a bainar jama'a saboda ci gaba da fafutukar da suke yi na tabbatar da daidaito a ƙarƙashin tsarin mulkin Musulunci. [1] Lavalette ta bayyana nata rashin son raba abubuwan da ta faru saboda tsoron tashin hankali. [1] [2] Muhimmancin Eveline Safir Lavalette, a matsayin mayaƙi da ɗan ƙasa na yau da kullum, yana bincika tasirin tunani na yaƙin, wanda ba a bayyana shi ta hanyar labarun yaƙi na gama-gari waɗanda ke da alaƙa da maza kuma suna mai da hankali kan rikicin siyasa maimakon tashin hankali na mutum. Sakamakon haka, tarihinta yana da mahimmancin ilimi. Masu bincike da yawa, masana, da masana tarihi sun yi magana da ita tun mutuwarta a cikin shekarar 2013.

items.sourceText: He was convicted for theft of military effects in 1943, and for intentional assault and battery against an officer in 1952. In 1954, when the Algerian War broke out, he escaped from the Barberousse prison, where he was serving a two-year sentence for attempted murder, and joined the National Liberation Front (FLN). The FLN militants explained to him that Algeria was a victim of colonialism and recruited him to their cause.[1] He later was caught and transferred to a prison in Damiette, now known as Aïn Deheb, where he would escape again.[9] He returned to Algiers and made contact a few months later with Yacef Saadi.

targets.targetText: An same shi da laifin satar tasirin soji a 1943, da kuma harin ganganci da batir a kan wani jami'in a 1952. A shekara ta 1954, lokacin da yakin Aljeriya ya barke, ya tsere daga gidan yarin Barberousse, inda yake zaman daurin shekaru biyu saboda yunkurin kisan kai, sannan ya shiga kungiyar 'yantar da kasa ta kasa (FLN). Mayakan na FLN sun bayyana masa cewa, Aljeriya ta yi fama da ‘yan mulkin mallaka, inda suka dauke shi aiki domin yakar su. [1] Daga baya an kama shi kuma aka tura shi gidan yari a Damiette, wanda yanzu ake kira Ain Deheb, inda zai sake tserewa. [2] Ya koma Algiers kuma ya yi tuntuɓar 'yan watanni tare da Yacef Saadi .

An same shi da laifin satar tasirin soji a shekarar 1943, da kuma harin ganganci da batir a kan wani jami'in a shekarar 1952. A shekara ta 1954, lokacin da yakin Aljeriya ya ɓarke, ya tsere daga gidan yarin Barberousse, inda yake zaman ɗaurin shekaru biyu saboda yunkurin kisan kai, sannan ya shiga kungiyar 'yantar da ƙasa ta (FLN). Mayakan na FLN sun bayyana masa cewa, Aljeriya ta yi fama da ‘yan mulkin mallaka, inda suka ɗauke shi aiki domin yakar su. [1] Daga baya an kama shi kuma aka tura shi gidan yari a Damiette, wanda yanzu ake kira Ain Deheb, inda zai sake tserewa. [2] Ya koma Algiers kuma ya yi tuntuɓar 'yan watanni tare da Yacef Saadi.

items.sourceText: On 30 September 1956, two bombs exploded in two public places in Algiers, the Milk Bar and the Cafétaria, killing four and wounding fifty-two. They were planted by Zohra Drif and Samia Lakhdari respectively, while a third bomb, planted by Djamila Bouhired at the Air France terminal, did not explode.[17] These events mark the beginning of the battle of Algiers.[18] These three women, along with Djamila Bouazza, also planted a bomb on 26 January 1957 at the Coq Hardi brewery, part of the “bombs network” headed by Yacef Saâdi, assisted by Ali la Pointe.[19]

targets.targetText: A ranar 30 ga Satumbar 1956, bama-bamai biyu sun fashe a wurare biyu na jama'a a Algiers, Bar Milk da Cafétaria, inda suka kashe hudu tare da raunata hamsin da biyu. Zohra Drif da Samia Lakhdari ne suka dasa su, yayin da bam na uku, wanda Djamila Bouhired ya dasa a tashar jirgin saman Air France, bai fashe ba. [1] Wadannan al'amura sun nuna farkon yakin Algiers . [2] Wadannan mata guda uku, tare da Djamila Bouazza, sun kuma dasa bam a ranar 26 ga Janairu 1957 a Coq Hardi Brewery, wani ɓangare na "cibiyar bama-bamai" wanda Yacef Saâdi ke jagoranta, wanda Ali la Pointe ya taimaka. [3]

A ranar 30 ga watan Satumbar 1956, bama-bamai biyu sun fashe a wurare biyu na jama'a a Algiers, Bar Milk da Cafétaria, inda suka kashe huɗu tare da raunata hamsin da biyu. Zohra Drif da Samia Lakhdari ne suka dasa su, yayin da bam na uku, wanda Djamila Bouhired ya dasa a tashar jirgin saman Air France, bai fashe ba. [1] Waɗannan al'amura sun nuna farkon yakin Algiers. [2] Waɗannan mata guda uku, tare da Djamila Bouazza, sun kuma dasa bam a ranar 26 ga watan Janairu 1957 a Coq Hardi Brewery, wani ɓangare na "cibiyar bama-bamai" wanda Yacef Saâdi ke jagoranta, wanda Ali la Pointe ya taimaka. [3]

items.sourceText: After the overthrow of the Estado Novo in the Carnation Revolution, in 1974, Alves returned to the Angolan capital. In Luanda, he made contact with other anti-colonial figures, such as José Jacinto Van-Dúnem, and the Portuguese Communist Party, who came to see him as a "genuine revolutionary leader".[3] By this time, the MPLA was beset by factional infighting, with a Congress being held in Lusaka to resolve the conflict through an organisational solution.[4]

targets.targetText: Bayan hambarar da Estado Novo a cikin juyin juya halin Carnation, a cikin shekarar 1974, Alves ya koma babban birnin Angola. A Luanda, ya yi hulɗa da wasu masu adawa da mulkin mallaka, irin su José Jacinto Van-Dúnem, da Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Portugal, wanda ya zo ya gan shi a matsayin "shugaban juyin juya hali na gaskiya". [ 3 ] Ya zuwa wannan lokaci, MPLA ta fuskanci rikicin ɓangaranci, inda aka gudanar da wani taro a Lusaka domin warware rikicin ta hanyar sasantawa tsakanin kungiyoyi. [ 4 ]

Bayan hambarar da Estado Novo a cikin juyin juya halin Carnation, a cikin 1974, Alves ya koma babban birnin Angola. A Luanda, ya yi hulɗa da wasu masu adawa da mulkin mallaka, irin su José Jacinto Van-Dúnem, da Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Portugal, wanda ya zo ya gan shi a matsayin "shugaban juyin juya hali na gaskiya". [ 3 ] Ya zuwa wannan lokaci, MPLA ta fuskanci rikicin bangaranci, inda aka gudanar da wani taro a Lusaka domin warware rikicin ta hanyar sasantawa tsakanin kungiyoyi. [ 4 ]

items.sourceText: Mendes died in combat, at 27 years old, during a raid on the headquarters of the Portuguese colonial army in Karipande, Moxico, Angola, on April 14, 1968.[1] He was buried near the river Lundoji 50 kilometres (30 mi) from the then headquarters of Karipande, from the Front East of the Third Political-Military Region.[2] In August 1968, the People's Liberation Movement of Angola (MPLA) assigned Hoji-ya-Henda the title of "dear son of the Angolan people and heroic fighter of the MPLA".

targets.targetText: Mendes ya mutu a cikin yaki, yana da shekaru 27, a lokacin wani samame a hedkwatar sojojin mulkin mallaka na Portugal a Karipande, Moxico, Angola, a ranar 14 ga Afrilu, 1968. [1] An binne shi kusa da kogin Lundoji mai 50 kilometres (30 mi) daga hedkwatar Karipande a lokacin, daga Gabashin Gabas na Yankin Siyasa-Soja (Political-Military Region) na Uku. [2] A watan Agustan 1968, jam'iyyar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola ( MPLA ) ta ba Hoji-ya-Henda laƙabin "ɗan ƙaunataccen ɗan al'ummar Angola kuma jarumin gwagwarmaya na MPLA".

Mendes ya mutu a cikin fada, yana da shekaru 27, a lokacin wani samame a hedkwatar sojojin mulkin mallaka na Portugal a Karipande, Moxico, Angola, a ranar 14 ga Afrilu, 1968. [1] An binne shi kusa da kogin Lundoji mai 50 kilometres (30 mi) daga hedkwatar Karipande a lokacin, daga Gabashin Gabas na Yankin Siyasa-Soja na Uku. [2] A watan Agustan 1968, jam'iyyar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola ( MPLA ) ta ba Hoji-ya-Henda lakabin "ɗan ƙaunataccen ɗan al'ummar Angola kuma jarumin gwagwarmaya na MPLA".

items.sourceText: On 16 November 1955, Mohammed V arrived in Morocco. He announced the end of the French protectorate, and by proxy, the end of the "minor jihad" (Arabic: الجهاد الأصغر), which was primarily related to securing independence. At the same time, he announced the beginning of the "major jihad" (Arabic: الجهاد الأكبر), which was aimed at collectively building the new Morocco.[1][17] Negotiations between France and Morocco continued in February and March 1956, with the former suggesting that Morocco become "an independent state united with France by permanent ties of interdependency," while the latter pushed for a complete annulment of the 1912 Treaty of Fes.[3] The Franco-Moroccan Declaration of Independence was signed on 2 March 1956, although about 100,000 French troops remained on Moroccan land at the time.[3]

targets.targetText: A ranar 16 ga Nuwamba 1955, Mohammed V ya isa Maroko. Ya sanar da ƙarshen kariya ta Faransa, kuma ta hanyar wakili, ƙarshen "ƙananan jihadi" (Arabic: ), wanda ya danganta da samun 'yancin kai. A lokaci guda, ya sanar da farkon "babban jihadi" (Arabic: ), wanda aka yi niyya ne don gina sabuwar Morocco. Tattaunawar tsakanin Faransa da Maroko ta ci gaba a watan Fabrairu da Maris na shekara ta 1956, tare da tsohon ya ba da shawarar cewa Maroko ta zama "jiha mai zaman kanta da ke da alaƙa da Faransa ta hanyar dindindin na dogaro da juna," yayin da ƙarshen ya tura don soke Yarjejeniyar Fes ta 1912. An sanya hannu kan sanarwar 'yancin kai ta Franco-Moroccan a ranar 2 ga Maris 1956, kodayake kimanin sojojin Faransa 100,000 sun kasance a ƙasar Morocco a lokacin.

A ranar 16 ga Nuwamba 1955, Mohammed V ya isa Maroko. Ya sanar da ƙarshen kariya ta Faransa, kuma ta hanyar wakili, ƙarshen "ƙananan jihadi" (Arabic: ), wanda ya danganta da samun 'yancin kai. A lokaci guda, ya sanar da farkon "babban jihadi" (Arabic: ), wanda aka yi niyya ne don gina sabuwar Morocco.[1][2] Tattaunawar tsakanin Faransa da Maroko ta ci gaba a watan Fabrairu da Maris na shekara ta 1956, tare da tsohon ya ba da shawarar cewa Maroko ta zama "jiha mai zaman kanta da ke da alaƙa da Faransa ta hanyar dindindin na dogaro da juna," yayin da ƙarshen ya tura don soke Yarjejeniyar Fes ta 1912.[1] An sanya hannu kan sanarwar 'yancin kai ta Franco-Moroccan a ranar 2 ga Maris 1956, kodayake kimanin sojojin Faransa 100,000 sun kasance a ƙasar Morocco a lokacin.[1]

items.sourceText: General João Rodrigues Lopes, known by his nom de guerre Ludy Kissassunda (27 September 1932[1] – 6 January 2021) was an Angolan general and politician. Born in 1932 in N'zeto, Zaire Province, he held important ranks during the Angolan War of Independence and the Angolan Civil War, holding a particularly important role with the reorganization of troops of, as well as the overall logistics of, the People's Liberation Army of Angola, which would later become the People's Armed Forces of Liberation of Angola (FAPLA).[2]

targets.targetText: Janar João Rodrigues Lopes, wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Ludy Kissassunda (27 Satumba 1932 [1] - 6 Janairu 2021) Janar ne kuma ɗan siyasa na Angola. An haife shi a shekara ta 1932 a N'zeto, lardin Zaire, ya rike mukamai masu muhimmanci a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Angola da yakin basasar Angola, yana da muhimmiyar rawa tare da sake tsara sojojin, da kuma dukkanin kayan aiki na rundunar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola, wanda daga bisani za ta zama rundunar sojojin Angola ta FAPLA. [2]

Janar João Rodrigues Lopes, wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Ludy Kissassunda (27 Satumba 1932 [1] - 6 Janairu 2021) Janar ne kuma ɗan siyasa na Angola. An haife shi a shekara ta 1932 a N'zeto, lardin Zaire, ya riƙe muƙamai masu muhimmanci a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na kasart Angola da yakin basasar Angola, yana da muhimmiyar rawa tare da sake tsara sojojin, da kuma dukkanin kayan aiki na rundunar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola, wanda daga bisani za ta zama rundunar sojojin Angola ta FAPLA. [2]

items.sourceText: During his political career, he was a member of the Politburo of the Central Committee of the People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), being one of Agostinho Neto's closest associates.[3] He was the founder and director of the Department of Information and Security of Angola (DISA), the MPLA's (and later Angola's) intelligence agency, from 1975 to 1979. He was also the governor of Malanje Province from 1980 to 1986, and of Zaire Province from 1995 to 2004.[4]

targets.targetText: A lokacin aikinsa na siyasa, ya kasance memba a ofishin siyasa na kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), kasancewarsa ɗaya daga cikin makusantan Agostinho Neto. [1] Shi ne wanda ya kafa kuma darekta na Sashen Watsa Labarai da Tsaro na ƙasar Angola (DISA), hukumar leken asiri ta MPLA (da kuma Angola), daga shekarun 1975 zuwa 1979. Ya kuma kasance gwamnan lardin Malanje daga shekarun 1980 zuwa 1986, da na lardin Zaire daga shekarun 1995 zuwa 2004. [2]

A lokacin aikinsa na siyasa, ya kasance memba a ofishin siyasa na kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), kasancewarsa daya daga cikin makusantan Agostinho Neto . [1] Shi ne wanda ya kafa kuma darekta na Sashen Watsa Labarai da Tsaro na Angola (DISA), hukumar leken asiri ta MPLA (da kuma Angola), daga 1975 zuwa 1979. Ya kuma kasance gwamnan lardin Malanje daga 1980 zuwa 1986, da na lardin Zaire daga 1995 zuwa 2004. [2]

items.sourceText: He was elected at the first conference of the MPLA party, in December 1962, as secretary of the organization and cadres and as a member of the central committee of the MPLA.[1][11] In 1963, with its expulsion from Democratic Republic of Congo/Zaire, and its flight across the river to Congo-Brazzaville, the MPLA fell into a state of total disarray and might have ceased to exist had Lara's brilliant organizational skills and cunning political decisions not saved it.[12]

targets.targetText: An zabe shi a taron farko na jam'iyyar MPLA, a watan Disamba na shekarar 1962, a matsayin sakataren kungiyar da 'yan kadarori kuma a matsayin memba na kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA. [1] [2] A cikin 1963, tare da fitar da ita daga Jamhuriyar Dimokuradiyyar Kwango/Zaire, da kuma jirgin da ta yi ta haye kogin zuwa Kongo-Brazzaville, MPLA ta fada cikin wani yanayi na rudani kuma mai yiwuwa ta daina wanzuwa idan har hazikan kungiyar Lara da dabarun siyasa ba su cece ta ba. [3]

An zaɓe shi a taron farko na jam'iyyar MPLA, a watan Disamba na shekarar 1962, a matsayin sakataren kungiyar da 'yan kadarori kuma a matsayin memba na kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA. [1] [2] A cikin shekarar 1963, tare da fitar da ita daga Jamhuriyar Dimokuraɗiyyar Kwango/Zaire, da kuma jirgin da ta yi ta haye kogin zuwa Kongo-Brazzaville, MPLA ta faɗa cikin wani yanayi na ruɗani kuma mai yiwuwa ta daina wanzuwa idan har hazikan kungiyar Lara da dabarun siyasa ba su cece ta ba. [3]

items.sourceText: On 10 December 1977, despite the tragic results of the purge, Lara was re-elected to the central committee of the MPLA, which made him the second most important member of the political bureau (after only Neto) and vice-president of the party, being responsible for the organization and the ideological sector.[1]

targets.targetText: A ranar 10 ga Disamba 1977, duk da mummunan sakamakon tsarkakewa, an sake zabar Lara a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, wanda ya sanya shi zama memba na biyu mafi mahimmanci a ofishin siyasa (bayan Neto kawai) kuma mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar, wanda ke da alhakin kungiyar da kuma bangaren akida. [1]

A ranar 10 ga watan Disamba 1977, duk da mummunan sakamakon tsarkakewa, an sake zaɓar Lara a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, wanda ya sanya shi zama memba na biyu mafi mahimmanci a ofishin siyasa (bayan Neto kawai) kuma mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar, wanda ke da alhakin kungiyar da kuma ɓangaren akida. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1980 he was re-elected member of the MPLA's central committee, political bureau and secretary of organization. In addition, he was elected chairman of the intergovernmental council of the Pan-African News Agency (PanaPress), a position he held for 5 years. In the same year, he was elected deputy representing the province of Moxico. While in this term, he was responsible for the special parliamentary commission for coffee production and the permanent parliamentary health commission.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1980 an sake zaɓe shi mamba a kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, ofishin siyasa da sakataren ƙungiya. Bugu da ƙari, an zaɓe shi a matsayin shugaban majalissar gudanarwa ta kamfanin dillancin labarai na Pan-African Pan-African News Agency (PanaPress), muƙamin da ya riƙe tsawon shekaru 5. A wannan shekarar, an zaɓe shi mataimakin wakilin lardin Moxico. Yayin da yake cikin wannan wa'adin, shi ne ke da alhakin kwamitin majalisar dokoki na musamman kan samar da kofi da kuma hukumar lafiya ta majalisar din-din-din. [1]

A cikin 1980 an sake zaɓe shi mamba a kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, ofishin siyasa da sakataren ƙungiya. Bugu da kari, an zabe shi a matsayin shugaban majalissar gudanarwa ta kamfanin dillancin labarai na Pan-African Pan-African News Agency (PanaPress), mukamin da ya rike tsawon shekaru 5. A wannan shekarar, an zabe shi mataimakin wakilin lardin Moxico . Yayin da yake cikin wannan wa'adin, shi ne ke da alhakin kwamitin majalisar dokoki na musamman kan samar da kofi da kuma hukumar lafiya ta majalisar din-din-din. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1985, Angolan President José Eduardo dos Santos removes him from the MPLA's political bureau, remaining only on the party's central committee, in what is called an Edwardian internal political purge against adversaries. In March 1986, he assumed the functions of 1st secretary of the National Assembly, which he remained until 1992.[1]

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 1985, shugaban Angola José Eduardo dos Santos ya tsige shi daga ofishin siyasa na MPLA, wanda ya rage kawai a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar, a wani abu da ake kira kawar da siyasar cikin gida ta Edwardian kan abokan adawa. A cikin Maris 1986, ya karbi aikin sakatare na 1 na Majalisar Dokoki ta kasa, wanda ya kasance har zuwa 1992. [1]

A shekara ta 1985, shugaban Angola José Eduardo dos Santos ya tsige shi daga ofishin siyasa na MPLA, wanda ya rage kawai a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar, a wani abu da ake kira kawar da siyasar cikin gida ta Edwardian kan abokan adawa. A cikin watan Maris 1986, ya karbi aikin sakatare na 1 na Majalisar Dokoki ta ƙasa , wanda ya kasance har zuwa shekara ta 1992. [1]

items.sourceText: On 8 January 2010, while being escorted by Angolan forces through the disputed territory of Cabinda, the team bus of the Togo national football team was attacked by gunmen belonging to FLEC/PM as it travelled to 2010 Africa Cup of Nations tournament. The ensuing gunfight resulted in the deaths of the assistant coach, team spokesman and bus driver, as well as injuring several others. Mingas expressed "condolences", saying the team was attacked by mistake.[9]

targets.targetText: A ranar 8 ga watan Janairun 2010, yayin da sojojin Angola ke rakiyar su ta yankin Cabinda da ake takaddama a kai, wasu 'yan bindiga na kungiyar FLEC/PM sun kai wa motar bas ɗin tawagar 'yan wasan kwallon kafa ta Togo hari a lokacin da suke tafiya gasar cin kofin ƙasashen Afirka ta shekarar 2010. Rikicin da ya biyo baya ya yi sanadiyar mutuwar mataimakin kocin, kakakin kungiyar da direban bas, tare da jikkata wasu da dama. Mingas ya bayyana "ta'aziyya", yana mai cewa an kai wa tawagar hari ne bisa kuskure. [1]

A ranar 8 ga watan Janairun 2010, yayin da sojojin Angola ke rakiyar su ta yankin Cabinda da ake takaddama a kai, wasu 'yan bindiga na kungiyar FLEC/PM sun kai wa motar bas din tawagar 'yan wasan kwallon kafa ta Togo hari a lokacin da suke tafiya gasar cin kofin kasashen Afirka ta 2010 . Rikicin da ya biyo baya ya yi sanadiyar mutuwar mataimakin kocin, kakakin kungiyar da direban bas, tare da jikkata wasu da dama. Mingas ya bayyana "ta'aziyya", yana mai cewa an kai wa tawagar hari ne bisa kuskure. [1]

items.sourceText: Lucrécia Paim (Caxito, October 16, 1939 - Quincuzo, Congo Quinxassa, March 1967) was an Angolan feminist, human rights defender and nationalist activist, considered a martyr of the country's decolonization process. She was a member of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) and co-founder of its women's wing, the Organization of Angolan Women (OMA).[1] She was captured,[2] tortured and executed by the National Front for the Liberation of Angola (FNLA) in the context of the fratricidal struggle between the MPLA and the UPA/FNLA.[3]

targets.targetText: Lucrécia Paim ( Caxito, Oktoba 16, 1939 - Quincuzo, Kongo Quinxassa, Maris 1967) yar Angola ce mai ra'ayin mata, mai kare haƙƙin ɗan adam kuma mai fafutukar kishin ƙasa, wanda ake ɗauka a matsayin shahidi na tsarin mulkin ƙasar. Ta kasance memba na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) kuma wacce ta kafa reshen mata, Kungiyar Matan Angolan (OMA). [1] An kama ta, [2] ta azabtar da ita kuma ta kashe ta a hannun National Front for the Liberation of Angola (FNLA) a cikin mahallin gwagwarmayar 'yan uwantaka tsakanin MPLA da UPA/FNLA. [3]

Lucrécia Paim (Caxito, Oktoba 16, 1939 - Quincuzo, Kongo Quinxassa, Maris 1967) 'yar Angola ce mai kare 'yancin mata, sannan mai kare haƙƙin ɗan adam kuma mai fafutukar kishin ƙasa, wacce ake ɗauka a matsayin shahidiya na tsarin mulkin ƙasar. Ta kasance memba na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) kuma wacce ta kafa reshen mata, Kungiyar Matan Angolan (OMA). [1] An kama ta, [2] tare da azabtar da ita kuma ta mutu ta a hannun National Front for the Liberation of Angola (FNLA) a cikin mahallin gwagwarmayar 'yan uwantaka tsakanin MPLA da UPA/FNLA. [3]

items.sourceText: Jonas Malheiro Sidónio Sakaita Savimbi (Portuguese: [ˈʒɔnɐʃ ˈsavĩbi]; 3 August 1934 – 22 February 2002) was an Angolan revolutionary, politician, and rebel military leader who founded and led the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA). UNITA was one of several groups which waged a guerrilla war against Portuguese colonial rule from 1966 to 1974. Once independence was achieved, it then became an anti-communist group which confronted the ruling People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) during the Angolan Civil War. Savimbi had extensive contact with anti-communist activists in the United States, including Jack Abramoff and was one of the leading anti-communist voices in the world.[1] Savimbi was killed in a clash with government troops in 2002.[2]

targets.targetText: Jonas Malheiro Sidónio Sakaita Savimbi  ; 3 ga Agusta 1934 - 22 ga Fabrairu 2002) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Angola, ɗan siyasa, kuma jagoran sojan tawaye wanda ya kafa kuma ya jagoranci Ƙungiyar Ƙungiyar Ƙasa ta Ƙasar Angola ( UNITA ). UNITA na daya daga cikin kungiyoyi da dama da suka gudanar da yakin neman zabe da mulkin mallaka na Portugal daga 1966 zuwa 1974. Da zarar an samu 'yancin kai, sai ta zama wata kungiya mai adawa da gurguzu wacce ta fuskanci jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola ( MPLA ) mai mulki a lokacin yakin basasar Angola . Savimbi ya yi mu'amala mai yawa da masu adawa da kwaminisanci a Amurka, ciki har da Jack Abramoff kuma yana daya daga cikin manyan masu adawa da kwaminisanci a duniya. [1] An kashe Savimbi a wata arangama da sojojin gwamnati a shekara ta 2002. [2]

Jonas Malheiro Sidónio Sakaita Savimbi (3 ga Agusta 1934 - 22 ga Fabrairu 2002) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Angola, ɗan siyasa, kuma jagoran sojan tawaye wanda ya kafa kuma ya jagoranci Ƙungiyar Ƙungiyar Ƙasa ta Ƙasar Angola (UNITA). UNITA na day6a daga cikin kungiyoyi da dama da suka gudanar da guerrilla war da mulkin mallaka na Portugal daga shekarun 1966 zuwa 1974. Da zarar an samu 'yancin kai, sai ta zama wata kungiya mai adawa da gurguzu wacce ta fuskanci jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) mai mulki a lokacin yakin basasar Angola. Savimbi ya yi mu'amala mai yawa da masu adawa da kwaminisanci a Amurka, ciki har da Jack Abramoff kuma yana ɗaya daga cikin manyan masu adawa da kwaminisanci a duniya. [1] An kashe Savimbi a wata arangama da sojojin gwamnati a shekara ta 2002. [2]

items.sourceText: It certainly seems that Savimbi was not in the inner circle of UPA activists in early 1961. He took no part in planning the uprising of March 1961, nor did he participate in it.

targets.targetText: Tabbas da alama Savimbi baya cikin da'irar masu fafutukar UPA a farkon shekara ta 1961. Bai shiga cikin shirin tashin watan Maris na 1961 ba, bai kuma shiga ciki ba.
Tabbas da alama Savimbi baya cikin da'irar masu fafutukar UPA a farkon 1961. Bai shiga cikin shirin tashin watan Maris na 1961 ba, bai kuma shiga ciki ba.

items.sourceText: Holden Roberto and the UPA wanted a student organization affiliated with their party. In December 1961, Roberto chaired a meeting at Camp Green Lane near Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Savimbi attended this meeting and became one of a number of organizers who created the UNEA, (União Nacional dos Estudantes Angolanos) in March 1962 at Lucerne, Switzerland. Savimbi was elected Secretary-General.[11]

targets.targetText: Holden Roberto da UPA sun buƙaci ƙungiyar ɗalibai da ke da alaƙa da jam'iyyarsu. A cikin watan Disamba 1961, Roberto ya jagoranci taro a Camp Green Lane kusa da Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Savimbi ya halarci wannan taron kuma ya zama ɗaya daga cikin masu shiryawa da yawa waɗanda suka ƙirƙira UNEA, (União Nacional dos Estudantes Angolanos) a cikin watan Maris 1962 a Lucerne, Switzerland. An zaɓi Savimbi a matsayin Sakatare-Janar. [ 11 ]

Holden Roberto da UPA sun bukaci ƙungiyar dalibai da ke da alaƙa da jam'iyyarsu. A cikin Disamba 1961, Roberto ya jagoranci taro a Camp Green Lane kusa da Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Savimbi ya halarci wannan taron kuma ya zama ɗaya daga cikin masu shiryawa da yawa waɗanda suka ƙirƙira UNEA, (União Nacional dos Estudantes Angolanos) a cikin Maris 1962 a Lucerne, Switzerland. An zabi Savimbi a matsayin Sakatare-Janar. [ 11 ]

items.sourceText: In a very short time, he was a member of the Executive Committee of the UPA. It was he who encouraged the PDA (Partido Democrático de Angola) to join in a united front with the UPA, creating the FNLA (Frente Nacional de Libertação de Angola) and when these parties formed the GRAE (Govêrno Revolucionário de Angola no Exílio) on April 3, 1962, Savimbi became Foreign Minister of this organization.

targets.targetText: A cikin kankanin lokaci, ya kasance memba na kwamitin zartarwa na UPA. Shi ne wanda ya karfafa PDA (Partido Democrático de Angola) don shiga cikin haɗin kai tare da UPA, ya haifar da FNLA (Frente Nacional de Libertação de Angola) kuma lokacin da waɗannan jam'iyyun suka kafa GRAE (Govêrno Revolucionário de Angola no Exílio) a ranar 3 ga Afrilu, 1962, Ministan Harkokin Waje na wannan kungiyar Savimbi.

A cikin kankanin lokaci, ya kasance memba na kwamitin zartarwa na UPA. Shi ne wanda ya karfafa PDA (Partido Democrático de Angola) don shiga cikin haɗin kai tare da UPA, ya haifar da FNLA (Frente Nacional de Libertação de Angola) kuma lokacin da waɗannan jam'iyyun suka kafa GRAE (Govêrno Revolucionário de Angola no Exílio) a ranar 3 ga watan Afrilu, 1962, Ministan Harkokin Waje na wannan kungiyar Savimbi.

items.sourceText: He was born on July 14, 1927,[1] at the mission of San Jose de Luali in the region of Dinge,[7] or in Mboma Lubinda,[3] Cabinda, into a modest family.[7]

targets.targetText: An haife shi a ranar 14 ga Yuli, 1927, [1] a aikin San Jose de Luali a yankin Dinge, [2] ko kuma a cikin Mboma Lubinda, [3] Cabinda, cikin dangi mai girman kai. [2]
An haife shi a ranar 14 ga watan Yuli, 1927, [1] a aikin San Jose de Luali a yankin Dinge, [2] ko kuma a cikin Mboma Lubinda, [3] Cabinda, cikin dangi mai girman kai. [2]

items.sourceText: He went into exile to France.[1] N'zita died in Paris on June 3, 2016.[2][3] His funeral was on June 10.[6] Upon his death, his son, Emmanuel N'zita, succeeded him as Commander of the Armed Forces of Cabinda a few days later.[11][2]

targets.targetText: Ya tafi gudun hijira zuwa Faransa. [1] N'zita ya mutu a birnin Paris ranar 3 ga Yuni, 2016. [2] [3] An yi jana'izarsa a ranar 10 ga Yuni. [4] Bayan mutuwarsa, dansa, Emmanuel N'zita, ya gaje shi a matsayin kwamandan sojojin Cabinda bayan 'yan kwanaki. [5] [2]

items.sourceText: José Jacinto da Silva Vieira Dias Van-Dúnem, also known as Zé Van-Dúnem Filósofo[1] (29 August 1939 – 8 July 1977) was an Angolan militant, politician, and anticolonial activist.

targets.targetText: José Jacinto da Silva Vieira Dias Van-Dúnem, kuma aka sani da Zé Van-Dúnem Filósofo [1] (29 Agusta 1939 - 8 Yuli 1977) ɗan gwagwarmayar Angola ne, ɗan siyasa, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da mulkin mallaka.

José Jacinto da Silva Vieira Dias Van-Dúnem, wanda kuma akafi sani da Zé Van-Dúnem Filósofo [1] (29 Agusta 1939 - 8 Yuli 1977) ɗan gwagwarmayar Angola ne, ɗan siyasa, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da 'yan mulkin mallaka.

items.sourceText: He became a member of the MPLA's delegation to the 25th Congress of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, held from 24 February to 5 March 1976, led by Nito Alves.[2] Van-Dúnem became even more ideologically aligned with the Soviet model and advocated for a more orthodox form of communism.[2]

targets.targetText: Ya zama memba na tawagar MPLA zuwa babban taro na 25 na Jam'iyyar Kwaminis ta Tarayyar Soviet, wanda aka gudanar daga 24 ga Fabrairu zuwa 5 ga Maris 1976, karkashin jagorancin Nito Alves. [1] Van-Dúnem ya zama ma fi dacewa a akida tare da tsarin Soviet kuma ya ba da shawarar samar da tsarin gurguzu na al'ada. [1]

Ya zama memba na tawagar MPLA zuwa babban taro na 25 na Jam'iyyar Kwaminis ta Tarayyar Soviet, wanda aka gudanar daga 24 ga watan Fabrairu zuwa 5 ga watan Maris 1976, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Nito Alves. [1] Van-Dúnem ya zama ma fi dacewa a akida tare da tsarin Soviet kuma ya ba da shawarar samar da tsarin gurguzu na al'ada. [1]

items.sourceText: The first child of Antónia Vieira Dias and Mateus Van-Dúnem,[2] José Jacinto Van-Dúnem came from a family connected to the founding members of the modern Angolan nationalist movement,[2] especially with regards to his grandfather, Manuel Pereira dos Santos Van-Dúnem,[2] and his great-uncle, Manuel Inácio dos Santos Torres Vieira Dias.[2] His sister, Francisca Van Dunem, was the first Black government minister in Portugal, serving as the Minister of Internal Administration and Minister of Justice.[5]

targets.targetText: Ɗan fari ne a wurin mahaifinsa mai suna Antónia Vieira Dias da Mateus Van-Dúnem, [1] José Jacinto Van-Dúnem ya fito ne daga dangin da ke da alaƙa da waɗanda suka kafa ƙungiyoyin kishin ƙasa na Angolan na zamani, [1] musamman game da kakansa, Manuel Pereira dos Santos Van-Dúnem, [1] da kuma babban kawunsa, Dia Manuel Iná. [1] 'Yar'uwarsa, Francisca Van Dunem, ita ce ministar gwamnatin Baƙar fata ta farko a Portugal, tana aiki a matsayin Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida da Ministan Shari'a. [2]

Ɗan fari na Antónia Vieira Dias da Mateus Van-Dúnem, [1] José Jacinto Van-Dúnem ya fito ne daga dangin da ke da alaƙa da waɗanda suka kafa ƙungiyoyin kishin ƙasa na Angolan na zamani, [1] musamman game da kakansa, Manuel Pereira dos Santos Van-Dúnem, [1] da kuma babban kawunsa, Dia Manuel Iná. [1] 'Yar'uwarsa, Francisca Van Dunem, ita ce ministar gwamnatin Baƙar fata ta farko a Portugal, tana aiki a matsayin Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida da Ministan Shari'a . [2]

items.sourceText: Tudun Wada is a suburb in Kaduna South Local Government Area located in the city of Kaduna, the capital of Kaduna State in Northern Nigeria, Nigeria.[1] The postal code of the area is 800.[2]

targets.targetText: Tudun Wada wata unguwa ce dake cikin karamar hukumar Kaduna ta kudu dake cikin garin Kaduna babban birnin jihar Kaduna a Arewacin Najeriya, Nijeriya. [1] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 800. [2]
Tudun Wada wata unguwa ce dake cikin karamar hukumar Kaduna ta kudu dake cikin garin Kaduna babban birnin jihar Kaduna a Arewacin Najeriya . [1] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 800. [2]

items.sourceText: Saminaka is a town and headquarters of Lere Local Government Area[2] and of Saminaka chiefdom of the Akurmi people[3] in southern Kaduna state in the Middle Belt region of Nigeria.[1][4] The postal code of the area is 811.[5]

targets.targetText: Saminaka birni ne kuma hedkwatar karamar hukumar Lere [1] kuma na masarautar Saminaka ta al'ummar Akurmi [2] a kudancin jihar Kaduna a yankin Middle Belt a Najeriya . [3] [4] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 811. [5]

Saminaka birni ne kuma hedkwatar karamar hukumar Lere [1] kuma saminaka masarautar al'ummar Akurmi ne[2] a kudancin jihar Kaduna a yankin Middle Belt a Najeriya. [3] [4] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 811. [5]

items.sourceText: Liceu married Maria Natércia de Almeida Vieira Dias in 1949, having 4 children with her: Carlitos Vieira Dias, Luzia Zizi, Ferdinando "Xinito" Vieira Dias, and Felipe de Nery "Pino" Vieira Dias.[1]

targets.targetText: Liceu ta auri Maria Natércia de Almeida Vieira Dias a 1949, tana da yara 4 tare da ita: Carlitos Vieira Dias, Luzia Zizi, Ferdinando "Xinito" Vieira Dias, da Felipe de Nery "Pino" Vieira Dias. [1]

items.sourceText: Avelino Henrique Saíde Vieira Dias Rodrigues Mingas (13 February 1934 – 27 May 1977) was an Angolan revolutionary, economist, writer, and politician who was a notable figure in the anti-colonial struggle for independence in Angola. He was the first Minister of Finance of Angola and one of the ten members of the first national legislature, the Revolutionary Council of the People (or the "Council of the Revolution"). He was also a member of the Central Committee of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA). A close associate of Agostinho Neto and Lúcio Lara, he was killed by people associated with the fractionists during the 1977 Angolan coup attempt.

targets.targetText: Avelino Henrique Saíde Vieira Dias Rodrigues Mingas (13 Fabrairu 1934 – 27 May 1977) ɗan juyin juya hali ne, masanin tattalin arziki, marubuci, kuma ɗan siyasa ɗan ƙasar Angola wanda ya yi fice a gwagwarmayar neman ‘yancin kai a Angola. Shi ne ministan kudi na farko na Angola kuma daya daga cikin goma na majalisar dokoki ta farko ta kasa, majalisar juyin juya hali ta al'umma (ko "majalisar juyin juya hali"). Ya kuma kasance memba na kwamitin tsakiya na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA). Wani makusancin Agostinho Neto da Lúcio Lara, mutanen da ke da alaka da ' yan ta'adda sun kashe shi a lokacin yunkurin juyin mulkin Angola na 1977 .

Avelino Henrique Saíde Vieira Dias Rodrigues Mingas (13 Fabrairu 1934 – 27 May 1977) ɗan juyin juya hali ne, masanin tattalin arziki, marubuci, kuma ɗan siyasa ɗan ƙasar Angola wanda ya yi fice a gwagwarmayar neman ‘yancin kai a Angola. Shi ne ministan kuɗi na farko na Angola kuma ɗaya daga cikin goma na majalisar dokoki ta farko ta ƙasa, majalisar juyin juya hali ta al'umma (ko "majalisar juyin juya hali"). Ya kuma kasance memba na kwamitin tsakiya na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA). Wani makusancin Agostinho Neto da Lúcio Lara, mutanen da ke da alaka da ' yan ta'adda sun kashe shi a lokacin yunkurin juyin mulkin Angola na shekarar 1977.

items.sourceText: He became a militant in the nationalist movements, influenced by his uncle. However, as a result of both his uncle and his father being arrested in the beginning of the 1960s, he moved to Portugal for his studies.[6] There, he came to be known as an excellent athlete and sportsman. While playing for a local sports team, he was warned that he would be arrested. He was able to outsmart the Portuguese police under the pretext of participating in a sports competition in Spain, and subsequently fled to Paris.[6] He took refuge with Mário Pinto de Andrade,[2] owing to his formal affiliation with the MPLA.[6]

targets.targetText: Ya zama mai fafutuka a harkar kishin kasa, wanda kawunsa ya yi tasiri. Koyaya, sakamakon kama kawunsa da mahaifinsa a farkon shekarun 1960, ya koma Portugal don karatunsa. [1] A can, an san shi a matsayin ƙwararren ɗan wasa da ɗan wasa. Yayin da yake taka leda a kungiyar wasanni na gida, an gargade shi cewa za a kama shi. Ya sami damar wuce gona da iri a 'yan sandan Portugal a karkashin zargin shiga gasar wasanni a Spain, kuma daga baya ya gudu zuwa Paris . [1] Ya fake da Mário Pinto de Andrade, [2] saboda kasancewarsa na yau da kullun tare da MPLA. [1]

Ya zama mai fafutuka a harkar kishin ƙasa, wanda kawunsa ya yi tasiri. Koyaya, sakamakon kama kawunsa da mahaifinsa a farkon shekarun 1960, ya koma Portugal don karatunsa. [1] A can, an san shi a matsayin ƙwararren ɗan wasa da ɗan wasa. Yayin da yake taka leda a kungiyar wasanni na gida, an gargaɗe shi cewa za a kama shi. Ya sami damar wuce gona da iri a 'yan sandan Portugal a ƙarƙashin zargin shiga gasar wasanni a Spain, kuma daga baya ya gudu zuwa Paris. items.sourceText: In 2019, president of Angola João Lourenço ordered the revision of the official history of the events of the 1977 coup attempt inside the “Reconciliation Plan in Memory of Victims of Armed Conflict in Angola”.[20] Mingas’ daughter, lawyer Xissole Madeira Vieira Dias Mingas, received, in June 2021, her father's official death certificate.[21]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 2019, shugaban Angola João Lourenço ya ba da umarnin sake duba tarihin hukuma na abubuwan da suka faru na yunƙurin juyin mulkin 1977 a cikin "Shirin sulhu don tunawa da waɗanda rikicin ya rutsa da su a Angola". [1] Ɗiyar Mingas, lauya Xissole Madeira Vieira Dias Mingas, ta samu, a watan Yuni 2021, takardar shaidar mutuwar mahaifinta a hukumance. [2]

[1] Diyar Mingas, lauya Xissole Madeira Vieira Dias Mingas, ta samu, a watan Yuni 2021, takardar shaidar mutuwar mahaifinta a hukumance. [2]

items.sourceText: Djorf Torba Dam is a dam in Kenadsa District, Béchar Province, Algeria, crossing the Oued Guir about 50 kilometres (31 mi) west of the capital, Béchar.[3][4] It is used for the purposes of irrigation and water supply.[2] The area around the head of the dam features a number of notable ancient monuments.[5] The dam has resulted in a significant reduction in the flow of Oued Guir and Oued Saoura in locations downstream of the dam.[1]

targets.targetText: Djorf Torba Dam wani madatsar ruwa ne a cikin Gundumar Kenadsa, Lardin Bechar, Aljeriya, yana haye Oued Guir kimanin kilomita 50 (31 yammacin babban birnin, Béchar .[1][2] Ana amfani dashi don dalilai na ban ruwa da samar da ruwa.[3] Yankin da ke kusa da shugaban madatsar ruwan yana da wasu sanannun abubuwan tunawa na dā.[4] Dam din ya haifar da raguwa mai yawa a cikin kwararar Oued Guir da Oued Saoura a wuraren da ke ƙasa da madatsar ruwan.

Djorf Torba Dam wani madatsar ruwa ne a cikin Gundumar Kenadsa, Lardin Bechar, Aljeriya, yana hayin Oued Guir kimanin nisan kilomita 50 (31 daga yammacin babban birnin, Béchar .[1][2] Ana amfani dashi don dalilai na ban ruwa da samar da ruwa.[3] Yankin da ke kusa da shugaban madatsar ruwan yana da wasu sanannun abubuwan tunawa na dā.[4] Dam ɗin ya haifar da raguwa mai yawa a cikin kwararar Oued Guir da Oued Saoura a wwuraren da ke ƙasa da madatsar rruwan.

items.sourceText: Lamia Fathi Abusedra (26 January 1974) is a Libyan engineer, revolutionary, and political ambassador. From May 2022, she has served as the Permanent Representative of Libya to the United Nations at Geneva.

targets.targetText: Lamia Fathi Abusedra (26 Janairu 1974) injiniyar Libya ce, 'yar juyin juya hali, kuma jakadiyar siyasa. Daga watan Mayu 2022, ta yi aiki a matsayin wakilin dindindin na Libya a Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya a Geneva.

Lamia Fathi Abusedra (26 Janairu 1974) injiniyan Libya ce, mai neman sauyi, kuma jakadiyar siyasa. Daga Mayu 2022, ta yi aiki a matsayin wakilin dindindin na Libya a Majalisar Dinkin Duniya a Geneva .

items.sourceText: Victim of a heart attack, Basri died in Chefchaouen on October 14, 2003, soon after a Paris surgical operation. He was buried on 15 October.

targets.targetText: Wanda ya kamu da ciwon zuciya, Basri ya mutu a Chefchaouen a ranar 14 ga Oktoba, 2003, jim kadan bayan wani aikin tiyata a Paris. An binne shi a ranar 15 ga Oktoba.
Wanda ya kamu da ciwon zuciya, Basri ya mutu a Chefchaouen a ranar 14 ga watan Oktoba, 2003, jim kaɗan bayan wani aikin tiyata a Paris. An binne shi a ranar 15 ga watan Oktoba.

items.sourceText: Festus Olanrewaju Akingbaso commonly known as Fessy West (Born 6 June 1970) is a Nigerian entrepreneur and politician, he is currently serving as the representative for the Idanre/Ifedore Federal Constituency in the 10th House of Representatives under the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Festus Olanrewaju Akingbaso wanda aka fi sani da Fessy West (an haife shi a ranar 6 ga watan Yunin shekara ta 1970) ɗan kasuwa ne kuma ɗan siyasan ƙasar Najeriya, a halin yanzu yana aiki a matsayin wakilin mazaɓar Tarayya ta Idanre / Ifedore a cikin Majalisar Wakilai ta 10 a ƙarƙashin inuwar jam'iyyar Peoples Democratic Party . [1] [2][3]

items.sourceText: Afolahan was born on 26 December 1949 in Ibadan, Oyo State. He studied in Nigeria and the United Kingdom. Posts included deputy commandant, National War College, Abuja, Chief of Naval Operations and Chief of Naval Plans.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Afolahan a ranar 26 ga watan Disambae shekarar 1949 a Ibadan, Jihar Oyo . Ya yi karatu a Najeriya da ƙasar Ingila. Matsayin da ya riƙe sun haɗa da mataimakin kwamandan, Kwalejin Yaƙin Ƙasa, Abuja, Shugaban Ayyukan Sojan Ruwa da Shugaban Shirye-shiryen Sojan Rukunin.[1]

An haifi Afolahan a ranar 26 ga watan Disamba 1949 a Ibadan, Jihar Oyo . Ya yi karatu a Najeriya da Ingila.Matsayi sun hada da mataimakin kwamandan, Kwalejin Yakin Kasa, Abuja, Shugaban Ayyukan Sojan Ruwa da Shugaban Shirye-shiryen Sojan Rukunin.[1]

items.sourceText: Speaking at a seminar in Lagos in May 2000, Afolahan called on Nigerian youths to abstain from sex or at least use condoms to ensure an AIDS-free society.[3]

targets.targetText: Da yake magana a wani taro a jihar Legas a watan Mayu na shekara ta 2000, Afolahan ya yi kira ga matasa na Najeriya da su guji yin jima'i ko aƙalla amfani da kwaroron roba don tabbatar da al'umma marar cutar kanjamau.[1]

items.sourceText: In Tumu, the weather is hot all year round, with a partly cloudy dry season and an unpleasant, overcast wet season. The average yearly temperature is rarely lower or higher than 25°F or 31°F; it often ranges above 100°F.[3]

targets.targetText: A garin Tumu, yanayi yana da zafi a duk shekara, tare da wani ɓangare na lokacin fari da kuma mummunan lokacin rigar. Matsakaicin zafin jiki na shekara-shekara ba ya da ƙasa da 25 ko sama da ° F ko 31 ° F; sau da yawa yana sama da 100 ° F.[1]

A Tumu, yanayi yana da zafi a duk shekara, tare da wani ɓangare na lokacin fari da kuma mummunan lokacin rigar. Matsakaicin zafin jiki na shekara-shekara ba ya da ƙasa ko sama da 25 ° F ko 31 ° F; sau da yawa yana sama da 100 ° F.[1]

items.sourceText: El Hamouti was born in Beni Ensar, in the Rif region of northern Morocco. He belonged to the Hamouti clan of the Mazzuja lineage, part of the larger Guelaya tribe. His father, Khader Muhand u Hamou, was a prominent trader who distributed goods from Melilla throughout the region.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi El Hamouti a Beni Ensar, a yankin Rif na arewacin Maroko. Ya kasance dan kabilar Hamouti na zuriyar Mazzuja, wani yanki na babban kabilar Guelaya . Mahaifinsa, Khader Muhand u Hamou, hamshakin dan kasuwa ne da ke rarraba kayayyaki daga Melilla a duk fadin yankin. [1]

An haifi El Hamouti a Beni Ensar, a yankin Rif na arewacin Maroko. Ya kasance ɗan ƙabilar Hamouti na zuriyar Mazzuja, wani yanki na babban ƙabilar Guelaya. Mahaifinsa, Khader Muhand u Hamou, hamshakin ɗan kasuwa ne da ke rarraba kayayyaki daga Melilla a duk faɗin yankin. [1]

items.sourceText: Abdellah Zakour (in Tachelhit: ⵄⴱⴷⵍⵍⴰⵀ ⵣⴰⴳⵓⵔ), also known as "Amghar Gou Ablla" (Ait Abdallah, 1885 - 1972)[1] was a Moroccan Berber military leader who opposed the French conquest of Morocco in the early 20th century.

targets.targetText: Abdellah Zakour (a cikin Tachelhit), wanda aka fi sani da "Amghar Gou Ablla" (Ait Abdallah, 1885 - 1972) [1] ya kasance shugaban soja na Berber na Maroko wanda ya yi adawa da nasarar Faransa a Maroko a farkon ƙarni na 20.

items.sourceText: In 2021, the High Commissioner for Former Resistants and Former Members of the Liberation Army in Morocco has released a 257-page book entitled "The Battle of Ait Abdallah against the French Colonization.".[4] The film "Words of Lead" (2020) by Ahmed Baidou relating the story of the Battle.[5]

items.sourceText: Samuel Maharero was a son to Maharero, an important Herero warrior and cattle raider. He was baptised in 1869[1][2] and went to the local Lutheran schools, where he was seen as a potential priest. When his father died in 1890, he gained the chieftainship in the area of Okahandja, although he did not gain much of his father's wealth and cattle according to Herero inheritance customs. Initially, he maintained fairly good relations with the German colonial administration under Theodor Leutwein. However, increasing problems, involving attacks by German farmers, economic difficulties and pests, and the use of Herero land for railroads, all led to diminished relations. Angered by the ill-treatment of the Herero people by German settlers and colonial administrators, who viewed the tribes as a cheap source of labor for cotton and other export crops, Maharero secretly planned a revolt with the other chiefs against the German presence, though he was well aware of the odds against him. In a famous letter to Hendrik Witbooi, the Nama chief, Maharero sought to build alliances with the other tribes, exclaiming "Let us die fighting!"[3]

targets.targetText: Samuel Maharero ɗa ne ga Maharero, babban jarumin Herero kuma barayin shanu. An yi masa baftisma a cikin 1869 [1] [2] kuma ya tafi makarantun Lutheran na gida, inda aka gan shi a matsayin babban firist. Lokacin da mahaifinsa ya rasu a shekara ta 1890, ya sami sarauta a yankin Okahandja, duk da cewa bai sami dukiyar mahaifinsa da shanu da yawa ba bisa ga al'adun gado na Herero. Da farko, ya ci gaba da kyakkyawar dangantaka da gwamnatin mulkin mallaka na Jamus a ƙarƙashin Theodor Leutwein . Sai dai karuwar matsalolin da suka hada da hare-haren da manoman Jamus ke kai wa, da matsalolin tattalin arziki da kwari da kuma amfani da filin Herero wajen hanyoyin jiragen kasa, duk sun haifar da raguwar dangantaka. Da yake fusata da cin zarafin al'ummar Herero da Jamusawa mazauna da masu mulkin mallaka suka yi, wadanda suke kallon kabilun a matsayin wata hanya mai arha wajen yin sana'ar auduga da sauran amfanin gona da ake fitarwa zuwa kasashen waje, Maharero a asirce ya shirya tayar da kayar baya tare da sauran sarakunan kan kasancewar Jamusawa, duk da cewa yana sane da rashin jituwar da ke tattare da shi. A cikin wata sanannen wasiƙa zuwa Hendrik Witbooi, shugaban Nama, Maharero ya nemi kulla kawance da sauran kabilu, yana cewa "Bari mu mutu muna fada!" [3]

Samuel Maharero ɗa ne ga Maharero, babban jarumin Herero kuma ɓarayin shanu. An yi masa baftisma a cikin shekarar 1869 [1] [2] kuma ya tafi makarantun Lutheran na gida, inda aka gan shi a matsayin babban firist. Lokacin da mahaifinsa ya rasu a shekara ta 1890, ya sami sarauta a yankin Okahandja, duk da cewa bai sami dukiyar mahaifinsa da shanu da yawa ba bisa ga al'adun gado na Herero. Da farko, ya ci gaba da kyakkyawar dangantaka da gwamnatin mulkin mallaka na Jamus a ƙarƙashin Theodor Leutwein. Sai dai ƙaruwar matsalolin da suka haɗa da hare-haren da manoman Jamus ke kai wa, da matsalolin tattalin arziki da kwari da kuma amfani da filin Herero wajen hanyoyin jiragen ƙasa, duk sun haifar da raguwar dangantaka. Da yake fusata da cin zarafin al'ummar Herero da Jamusawa mazauna da masu mulkin mallaka suka yi, waɗanda suke kallon ƙabilun a matsayin wata hanya mai arha wajen yin sana'ar auduga da sauran amfanin gona da ake fitarwa zuwa ƙasashen waje, Maharero a asirce ya shirya tayar da kayar baya tare da sauran sarakunan kan kasancewar Jamusawa, duk da cewa yana sane da rashin jituwar da ke tattare da shi. A cikin wata sananniyar wasiƙa zuwa Hendrik Witbooi, shugaban Nama, Maharero ya nemi kulla ƙawance da sauran ƙabilu, yana cewa "Bari mu mutu muna faɗa!" [3]

items.sourceText: Kambonde II kaMpingana (1865 – June 22, 1909) was the King of Ondonga from 1884 until his death in 1909. He was the brother of King Nehale lyaMpingana, with whom he shared a prolonged power struggle over control of Ondonga. His reign was marked by political divisions within Ondonga and increasing European influence in the region.[1]

targets.targetText: Kambonde II kaMpingana (1865 - Yuni 22, 1909) shine Sarkin Ondonga daga 1884 har zuwa mutuwarsa a 1909. Shi ɗan'uwan Sarki Nehale lyaMpingana ne, tare da wanda suka yi doguwar gwagwarmayar iko akan iko da Ondonga. Mulkinsa ya kasance alama ce ta rarrabuwar kawuna a cikin Ondonga da karuwar tasirin Turai a yankin. [1]

Kambonde II kaMpingana (1865 - Yuni 22, 1909) shine Sarkin Ondonga daga shekara ta 1884 har zuwa mutuwarsa a shekarar 1909. Shi ɗan'uwan Sarki Nehale lyaMpingana ne, tare da wanda suka yi doguwar gwagwarmayar iko akan iko da Ondonga. Mulkinsa ya kasance alama ce ta rarrabuwar kawuna a cikin Ondonga da ƙaruwar tasirin Turai a yankin. [1]

items.sourceText: Following the death of King Iitana yaNekwiyu on September 26, 1884, Kambonde became the king of Ondonga. However, his younger brother, Nehale, refused to acknowledge his authority. This led to the division of Ondonga into two separate territories: western Ondonga, ruled by Kambonde, and eastern Ondonga, ruled by Nehale.[2][2] Kambonde maintained diplomatic relations with missionaries and European settlers, in contrast to Nehale’s resistance to foreign influence. The Finnish Missionary Society, viewing Nehale as an obstacle to their work, supported Kambonde with weapons and ammunition to strengthen his position.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: Bayan rasuwar Sarki Itana yaNekwiyu a ranar 26 ga watan Satumba, 1884, Kambonde ya zama sarkin Ondonga. Duk da haka, ƙanensa, Nehale, ya ƙi amincewa da ikonsa. Wannan ya kai ga rarraba Ondonga zuwa yankuna biyu: yammacin Ondonga, wanda Kambonde ke mulki, da kuma gabashin Ondonga, wanda Nehale ya yi mulki. [1] [2] Kambonde ya ci gaba da kulla hulɗar diflomasiyya da ‘yan mishan da turawa, saɓanin yadda Nehale ya bijirewa tasirin ƙasashen waje. Ƙungiyar Mishan ta Finnish, suna kallon Nehale a matsayin mai hana su aiki, sun tallafa wa Kambonde da makamai da harsasai don ƙarfafa matsayinsa. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

Bayan rasuwar Sarki Itana yaNekwiyu a ranar 26 ga Satumba, 1884, Kambonde ya zama sarkin Ondonga. Duk da haka, ƙanensa, Nehale, ya ƙi amincewa da ikonsa. Wannan ya kai ga rarraba Ondonga zuwa yankuna biyu: yammacin Ondonga, wanda Kambonde ke mulki, da kuma gabashin Ondonga, wanda Nehale ya yi mulki. [1] [2] Kambonde ya ci gaba da kulla huldar diflomasiyya da ‘yan mishan da turawa, sabanin yadda Nehale ya bijirewa tasirin kasashen waje. Ƙungiyar Mishan ta Finnish, suna kallon Nehale a matsayin mai hana su aiki, sun tallafa wa Kambonde da makamai da harsasai don ƙarfafa matsayinsa. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: As German influence in Ovamboland increased, Kambonde maintained a diplomatic stance. By 1898, he was in favor of Ovamboland becoming part of the German protectorate. Finnish missionary Martti Rautanen, a key advisor, played a role in influencing Kambonde's decision. During the Ovaherero War (1904–1908), Samuel Maharero attempted to rally Ovambo kings to fight against the Germans. An Ovaherero envoy sought Kambonde’s assistance, but Finnish missionaries advised him to remain neutral. The only major act of resistance from Ondonga came from Nehale’s attack on Fort Namutoni in January 1904.[5]

targets.targetText: Yayin da tasirin Jamus a Ovamboland ya karu, Kambonde ya ci gaba da kasancewa a matsayin diflomasiyya. A shekara ta 1898, ya kasance yana goyon bayan Ovamboland ya zama wani ɓangare na kariyar Jamus. Wani ɗan mishan Finnish Martti Rautanen, babban mai ba da shawara, ya taka rawa wajen yin tasiri ga shawarar Kambonde. A lokacin Yaƙin Ovaherero (1904-1908), Samuel Maharero ya yi ƙoƙari ya tara sarakunan Ovambo don yaƙar Jamusawa. Wani wakilin Ovaherero ya nemi taimakon Kambonde, amma masu wa’azi a ƙasashen waje na Finland sun ba shi shawarar ya daina saka hannu. Babban aikin juriya daya tilo daga Ondonga ya fito ne daga harin Nehale a Fort Namutoni a cikin Janairu 1904. [1]

Yayin da tasirin Jamus a Ovamboland ya ƙaru, Kambonde ya ci gaba da kasancewa a matsayin diflomasiyya. A shekara ta 1898, ya kasance yana goyon bayan Ovamboland ya zama wani ɓangare na kariyar Jamus. Wani ɗan mishan Finnish Martti Rautanen, babban mai ba da shawara, ya taka rawa wajen yin tasiri ga shawarar Kambonde. A lokacin Yaƙin Ovaherero (1904-1908), Samuel Maharero ya yi ƙoƙari ya tara sarakunan Ovambo don yaƙar Jamusawa. Wani wakilin Ovaherero ya nemi taimakon Kambonde, amma masu wa’azi a ƙasashen waje na Finland sun ba shi shawarar ya daina saka hannu. Babban aikin jajircewa ɗaya tilo daga Ondonga ya fito ne daga harin Nehale a Fort Namutoni a cikin watan Janairu 1904. [1]

items.sourceText: Herman Andimba Toivo ya Toivo (22 August 1924 – 9 June 2017) was a Namibian anti-apartheid activist, politician and political prisoner. Ya Toivo was active in the pre-independence movement, and is one of the co-founders of the South West African People's Organisation (SWAPO) in 1960, and before that, its predecessor the Ovamboland People's Organization (OPO) in 1959.

targets.targetText: Herman Andimba Toivo ya Toivo (22 ga Agusta 1924 - 9 ga watan Yuni 2017) ɗan gwagwarmayar wariyar launin fata ne na Namibiya, ɗan siyasa kuma ɗan fursuna na siyasa. Ya Toivo ya kasance mai fafutuka a yunkurin samun 'yancin kai, kuma yana ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa kungiyar jama'ar Kudu maso yammacin Afirka (SWAPO) a shekarar 1960, kuma kafin nan, ita ce kungiyar Ovamboland People's Organisation (OPO) a shekarar 1959.

Herman Andimba Toivo ya Toivo (22 ga Agusta 1924 - 9 ga Yuni 2017) ɗan gwagwarmayar wariyar launin fata ne na Namibiya, ɗan siyasa kuma ɗan fursuna na siyasa . Ya Toivo ya kasance mai fafutuka a yunkurin samun 'yancin kai, kuma yana daya daga cikin wadanda suka kafa kungiyar jama'ar Kudu maso yammacin Afirka (SWAPO) a shekarar 1960, kuma kafin nan, ita ce kungiyar Ovamboland People's Organisation (OPO) a shekarar 1959.

items.sourceText: Andimba grew up in the northern part of Namibia, however he spent some time in Cape Town in the 1950s. He became politicised there and joined the African National Congress (ANC). Back in Namibia he became one of the early petitioners to the United Nations, advocating for the independence of Namibia. Due to his political activism he was tried in 1966 under the Terrorism Act, and sentenced to 20 years in prison. He served 16 years in Robben Island in the same section as Nelson Mandela, to whom he was a personal friend. He was released in 1984 and rejoined SWAPO as secretary general in exile in Lusaka, Zambia. Ya Toivo returned to Namibia in 1989 in the wake of the country's independence and served as a member of parliament and as cabinet minister in Sam Nujoma's first government. He retired from active politics in 2006. Ya Toivo is a national hero of Namibia.

targets.targetText: Andimba ya girma a arewacin Namibiya, duk da haka ya yi ɗan lokaci a Cape Town a cikin 1950s. Ya shiga siyasa a can ya koma jam’iyyar African National Congress (ANC). A baya a Namibiya ya zama daya daga cikin wadanda suka fara kokewa Majalisar Dinkin Duniya, mai fafutukar neman ' yancin kai na Namibiya . Saboda gwagwarmayar siyasarsa an yi masa shari'a a shekarar 1966 a karkashin dokar ta'addanci, kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin daurin shekaru 20 a gidan yari. Ya yi shekaru 16 a tsibirin Robben a cikin sashe daya da Nelson Mandela, wanda abokinsa ne. An sake shi a cikin 1984 kuma ya koma SWAPO a matsayin babban sakatare a gudun hijira a Lusaka, Zambia. Ya Toivo ya koma Namibiya ne a shekarar 1989 bayan samun 'yancin kai a kasar, ya kuma taba zama dan majalisa da minista a gwamnatin farko ta Sam Nujoma . A shekara ta 2006 ya yi ritaya daga siyasa. Ya Toivo gwarzon kasa ne na Namibiya.

Andimba ya girma a arewacin Namibiya, duk da haka ya yi ɗan lokaci a Cape Town a cikin shekarar 1950s. Ya shiga siyasa a can ya koma jam’iyyar African National Congress (ANC). A baya a Namibiya ya zama ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka fara kokewa Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, mai fafutukar neman 'yancin kai na Namibiya. Saboda gwagwarmayar siyasarsa an yi masa shari'a a shekarar 1966 a ƙarƙashin dokar ta'addanci, kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin shekaru 20 a gidan yari. Ya yi shekaru 16 a tsibirin Robben a cikin sashe ɗaya da Nelson Mandela, wanda abokinsa ne. An sake shi a cikin shekarar 1984 kuma ya koma SWAPO a matsayin babban sakatare a gudun hijira a Lusaka, Zambia. Ya Toivo ya koma Namibiya ne a shekarar 1989 bayan samun 'yancin kai a ƙasar, ya kuma taɓa zama ɗan majalisa da minista a gwamnatin farko ta Sam Nujoma. A shekara ta 2006 ya yi ritaya daga siyasa. Ya Toivo gwarzon ƙasa ne na Namibiya.

items.sourceText: In December 1958, Toivo, with the assistance of Goldberg, sent a tape to Mburumba Kerina and Michael Scott documenting human rights violations in South West Africa, after Chief Hosea Kutako was refused permission by the South African authorities to represent his people at the United Nations.[9] This was used to petition the United Nations. Consequently, he was deported from Cape Town, first to Keetmanshoop and Windhoek and later to Ovamboland, where he was placed under house arrest in his home village Okaloko.[10]

targets.targetText: A watan Disamba 1958, Toivo, tare da taimakon Goldberg, ya aika da wani kaset zuwa Mburumba Kerina da Michael Scott da ke tattara bayanan take haƙƙin ɗan adam a Afirka ta Kudu maso Yamma, bayan da Cif Hosea Kutako ya ki amincewa da izinin hukumomin Afirka ta Kudu ya wakilci mutanensa a Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya. [1] An yi amfani da wannan don kai ƙarar Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya. Saboda haka, an kore shi daga Cape Town, da farko zuwa Keetmanshoop da Windhoek daga baya zuwa Ovamboland, inda aka tsare shi a gidan kurkuku a ƙauyen su Okaloko. [2]

A watan Disamba 1958, Toivo, tare da taimakon Goldberg, ya aika da wani kaset zuwa Mburumba Kerina da Michael Scott da ke tattara bayanan take haƙƙin ɗan adam a Afirka ta Kudu maso Yamma, bayan da Cif Hosea Kutako ya ki amincewa da izinin hukumomin Afirka ta Kudu ya wakilci mutanensa a Majalisar Dinkin Duniya. [1] An yi amfani da wannan don kai ƙarar Majalisar Dinkin Duniya . Saboda haka, an kore shi daga Cape Town, da farko zuwa Keetmanshoop da Windhoek daga baya zuwa Ovamboland, inda aka tsare shi a gidan kurkuku a kauyensu Okaloko. [2]

items.sourceText: Yakubu Nabame (c. 1819–1854) was the King of Argungu and leader of the Kebbawa resistance from 1849 until his death in 1854. He is best known for reigniting and leading the struggle for independence against the Sokoto Caliphate, which had conquered Kebbi during its early 19th-century jihad. After years of exile at the Caliph's palace in Sokoto, Nabame returned to Kebbi, declared himself Sarkin Kebbi ('Lord of Kebbi') in 1849, and initiated a revolt that marked the first major territorial loss for the Caliphate outside Bornu. His resistance ended an 18-year truce and continued until the fall of the Caliphate in 1903, cementing Kebbi's independence as an irreversible reality. Nabame is remembered as a heroic figure in Kebbi's history.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Yakubu Nabame (1819-1854) shi ne Sarkin Argungu kuma jagoran gwagwarmayar Kebbawa daga shekarun 1849 har zuwa rasuwarsa a shekarar 1854. Ya shahara wajen jan ragamar mulki da jagorantar gwagwarmayar neman yancin kai da Daular Sakkwato wacce ta mamaye Birnin Kebbi a lokacin jihadin farko na ƙarni na 19. Bayan ya kwashe shekaru yana gudun hijira a fadar Halifa da ke Sakkwato, Nabame ya koma Kebbi, ya ayyana kansa a matsayin Sarkin Kebbi ('Ubangijin Kebbi') a shekarar 1849, sannan ya tayar da bore wanda ya zama babban hasarar farko ga Khalifanci a wajen Bornu. Juriya da ya yi ya kawo ƙarshen zaman lafiya na tsawon shekaru 18, ya ci gaba har zuwa faɗuwar Halifanci a shekarar 1903, inda ya tabbatar da ’yancin kai na Kebbi a matsayin haƙiƙanin da ba za a iya jurewa ba. Ana tunawa da Nabame a matsayin jarumi a tarihin Kebbi. [1] [2]
