Ya shahara wajen jan ragamar mulki da jagorantar gwagwarmayar neman yancin kai da Daular Sakkwato wacce ta mamaye Birnin Kebbi a lokacin jihadin farko na karni na 19. Bayan ya kwashe shekaru yana gudun hijira a fadar Halifa da ke Sakkwato, Nabame ya koma Kebbi, ya ayyana kansa a matsayin Sarkin Kebbi ('Ubangijin Kebbi') a 1849, sannan ya tayar da bore wanda ya zama babban hasarar farko ga Khalifanci a wajen Bornu . Juriya da ya yi ya kawo karshen zaman lafiya na tsawon shekaru 18, ya ci gaba har zuwa faduwar Halifanci a 1903, inda ya tabbatar da ’yancin kai na Kebbi a matsayin haƙiƙanin da ba za a iya jurewa ba. Ana tunawa da Nabame a matsayin jarumi a tarihin Kebbi. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Boshielo was renowned as a prolific recruiter to the CPSA and ANC.[1][2] Among those he recruited was his close friend John Nkadimeng.[5][4] Around 1957, Nkadimeng and Boshielo met with Nelson Mandela on a fortnightly basis to discuss politics. Nkadimeng later recalled that Boshielo and Mandela often had vociferous arguments: while Mandela wanted white activists excluded from leadership positions in the anti-apartheid struggle, Boshielo supported a non-racialist position inspired by materialist analysis.[5]

targets.targetText: Boshielo ya shahara a matsayin ƙwararren ma'aikacin CPSA da ANC. [1] [2] Daga cikin waɗanda ya ɗauka har da amininsa John Nkadimeng. [3] [4] A cikin shekarar 1957, Nkadimeng da Boshielo sun gana da Nelson Mandela a kowane mako biyu don tattaunawa akan siyasa. Daga baya Nkadimeng ya tuna cewa Boshielo da Mandela sau da yawa suna da muhawara mai ma'ana: yayin da Mandela ya so a cire masu fafutukar farar fata daga muƙaman jagoranci a gwagwarmayar yaki da wariyar launin fata, Boshielo ya goyi bayan matsayin da ba na wariyar launin fata ba wanda aka yi wahayi zuwa ga binciken jari-hujja. [3]

Boshielo ya shahara a matsayin ƙwararren ma'aikacin CPSA da ANC. [1] [2] Daga cikin wadanda ya dauka har da amininsa John Nkadimeng . [3] [4] A cikin 1957, Nkadimeng da Boshielo sun gana da Nelson Mandela a kowane mako biyu don tattaunawa akan siyasa. Daga baya Nkadimeng ya tuna cewa Boshielo da Mandela sau da yawa suna da muhawara mai ma'ana: yayin da Mandela ya so a cire masu fafutukar farar fata daga mukaman jagoranci a gwagwarmayar yaki da wariyar launin fata, Boshielo ya goyi bayan matsayin da ba na wariyar launin fata ba wanda aka yi wahayi zuwa ga binciken jari-hujja . [3]

items.sourceText: Vusumzi L. Make (1931 – 15 April 2006)[1] was a South African civil rights activist and lawyer.[2] He and the American poet Maya Angelou met in 1961,[3][4] lived together in Cairo, Egypt, before parting ways in 1962.[3][5] He was a professor at the University of Liberia in Monrovia, Liberia, from 1968 to 1974.[1]

targets.targetText: Vusumzi L. Make (1931 – 15 Afrilu 2006) [1] ɗan rajin kare hakkin jama'a na Afirka ta Kudu ne kuma lauya. [2] Shi da mawakiyar Amurka Maya Angelou sun haɗu a shekara ta 1961, [3] [4] sun zauna tare a birnin Alkahira na ƙasar Masar kafin su rabu a shekarar 1962. [3] [5] Farfesa ne a Jami'ar Laberiya a Monrovia, Laberiya, daga shekarun 1968 zuwa 1974. [1]

Vusumzi L. Make (1931 – 15 Afrilu 2006) [1] ɗan rajin kare hakkin jama'a na Afirka ta Kudu ne kuma lauya. [2] Shi da mawakiyar Amurka Maya Angelou sun hadu a shekara ta 1961, [3] [4] sun zauna tare a birnin Alkahira na kasar Masar kafin su rabu a 1962. [3] [5] Farfesa ne a Jami'ar Laberiya a Monrovia, Laberiya, daga 1968 zuwa 1974. [1]

items.sourceText: Clarence Mlami Makwetu (6 December 1928 – 1 April 2016) was a South African anti-apartheid activist, politician, and leader of the Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC) during the historic 1994 elections.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Clarence Mlami Makwetu (6 Disamba 1928 - 1 Afrilu 2016) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne, ɗan Afirka ta Kudu, ɗan siyasa, kuma shugaban jam'iyyar Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC) a lokacin zaɓen 1994 mai tarihi. [1] [2]

Clarence Mlami Makwetu (6 Disamba 1928 - 1 Afrilu 2016) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne, ɗan Afirka ta Kudu, ɗan siyasa, kuma shugaban jam'iyyar Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC) a lokacin zaɓen shekarar 1994 mai tarihi. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: In April 1992, Makwetu declared at his political party's Annual Congress that the PAC was now not opposed to taking part in the negotiations to end the apartheid, so long the negotiations were held in a "neutral venue under a neutral chairman."[7] The PAC unsuccessfully argued during the Codesa negotiations that any settlement that did not tackle the land question was flawed, and this failure lead the party to be divided over whether to participate in the 1994 elections. Makwetu argued for participation, and ordered the party's military wing, the Azanian People's Liberation Army (Apla), to end its armed struggle, but with the party not fully behind the campaign, the party only won five seats in the historic first non-racial election. In 1994, he became one of the PAC's three MPs in South Africa's first democratic Parliament.

targets.targetText: A cikin Afrilu 1992, Makwetu ya bayyana a taron shekara-shekara na jam'iyyar siyasa cewa PAC a yanzu ba ta adawa da shiga cikin tattaunawar kawo karshen mulkin wariyar launin fata, don haka an gudanar da tattaunawar a cikin "wuri na tsaka-tsaki a karkashin wani shugaba mai tsaka tsaki." [1] PAC ba ta yi nasara ba yayin tattaunawar Codesa cewa duk wani sulhu da ba a magance batun kasa ba yana da kurakurai, kuma wannan gazawar ta sa jam’iyyar ta rabu kan ko za ta shiga zaben 1994 . Makwetu ya bayar da hujjar shiga, sannan ya umarci reshen soja na jam’iyyar, Apla, da ya kawo karshen gwagwarmayar da ta ke yi, amma kasancewar jam’iyyar ba ta da cikakken goyon bayan yakin neman zabe, jam’iyyar ta lashe kujeru biyar ne kawai a zaben farko mai cike da tarihi wanda ba na kabilanci ba. A cikin 1994, ya zama ɗaya daga cikin ƴan majalisa uku na PAC a Majalisar Demokraɗiyya ta farko ta Afirka ta Kudu.

A cikin watan Afrilu 1992, Makwetu ya bayyana a taron shekara-shekara na jam'iyyar siyasa cewa PAC a yanzu ba ta adawa da shiga cikin tattaunawar kawo ƙarshen mulkin wariyar launin fata, don haka an gudanar da tattaunawar a cikin "wuri na tsaka-tsaki a ƙarƙashin wani shugaba mai tsaka tsaki." [1] PAC ba ta yi nasara ba yayin tattaunawar Codesa cewa duk wani sulhu da ba a magance batun ƙasa ba yana da kurakurai, kuma wannan gazawar ta sa jam’iyyar ta rabu kan ko za ta shiga zaɓen 1994. Makwetu ya bayar da hujjar shiga, sannan ya umarci reshen soja na jam’iyyar, Apla, da ya kawo ƙarshen gwagwarmayar da ta ke yi, amma kasancewar jam’iyyar ba ta da cikakken goyon bayan yakin neman zaɓe, jam’iyyar ta lashe kujeru biyar ne kawai a zaɓen farko mai cike da tarihi wanda ba na ƙabilanci ba. A cikin shekarar 1994, ya zama ɗaya daga cikin ƴan majalisa uku na PAC a Majalisar Demokraɗiyya ta farko ta Afirka ta Kudu.

items.sourceText: Makwetu was unseated as leader in 1996, being accused of bringing the party into disrepute, and retired.[8] Following his expulsion from the PAC in 1997, Makwetu went on to form and lead the Pan Africanist Movement (PAM). Makwetu's nephew, Mazwi, said his uncle resorted to land activism in his home town of Cofimvaba in the former Transkei where he had a farm, livestock and several fields.[2]

targets.targetText: A shekarar 1996 ne aka kwance Makwetu a matsayin shugaba, inda aka zarge shi da kawo wa jam’iyyar kunya, kuma ya yi ritaya. [1] Bayan fitarsa daga PAC a shekarar 1997, Makwetu ya ci gaba da kafa kungiyar Pan Africanist Movement (PAM). Dan uwan Makwetu, Mazwi, ya ce kawun nasa ya yi yunkurin neman filaye ne a garinsu na Cofimvaba a tsohuwar Transkei inda yake da gonaki da dabbobi da gonaki da dama. [2]

A shekarar 1996 ne aka kwance Makwetu a matsayin shugaba, inda aka zarge shi da kawo wa jam’iyyar kunya, kuma ya yi ritaya. [1] Bayan fitarsa daga PAC a 1997, Makwetu ya ci gaba da kafa kungiyar Pan Africanist Movement (PAM). Dan uwan Makwetu, Mazwi, ya ce kawun nasa ya yi yunkurin neman filaye ne a garinsu na Cofimvaba a tsohuwar Transkei inda yake da gonaki da dabbobi da gonaki da dama. [2]

items.sourceText: In 2004, Makwetu was awarded the Order of Luthuli in Silver by President Thabo Mbeki for his contribution to the struggle for a non-racial‚ non-sexist‚ just and democratic South Africa.[9]

targets.targetText: A cikin 2004, Shugaba Thabo Mbeki ya ba Makwetu lambar yabo ta Luthuli a Silver saboda gudummawar da ya bayar ga gwagwarmayar rashin kabilanci, rashin jinsi, adalci da dimokuradiyya Afirka ta Kudu. [1]

A cikin shekarar 2004, Shugaba Thabo Mbeki ya ba Makwetu lambar yabo ta Luthuli a Silver saboda gudummawar da ya bayar ga gwagwarmayar rashin ƙabilanci, rashin jinsi, adalci da Dimokuraɗiyyar Afirka ta Kudu. [1]

items.sourceText: Clarence Mazwangwandile Mini (6 November 1951 – 12 May 2020) was a South African doctor, anti-apartheid activist, freedom fighter, human rights activist. Mini was regarded as a pioneer of the medical industry in South Africa, especially for his crucial contributions in eliminating the HIV/AIDS from the country.[1] He also actively advocated against apartheid during his career and also voiced against corruption which mounted during the presidency of Jacob Zuma.[2] He served on the Board of Healthcare Funders, at times as its chair.[3][4] He died on 12 May 2020 due to COVID-19 complications at the age of 68 while serving as the chairperson of the Council of Medical Schemes.[5] His term as chairperson of CMS was due to end by September 2020.[6]

targets.targetText: Clarence Mazwangwandile Mini (6 Nuwamba 1951 - 12 ga Mayu 2020) likita ne ɗan Afirka ta Kudu, mai fafutukar yaki da wariyar launin fata, mai fafutukar 'yanci, mai fafutukar kare hakkin ɗan Adam. An ɗauki Mini a matsayin majagaba na masana'antar likitanci a Afirka ta Kudu, musamman saboda muhimmiyar gudummawar da ya bayar wajen kawar da cutar kanjamau daga ƙasar. [1] Ya kuma bayar da himma wajen yaki da wariyar launin fata a lokacin aikinsa sannan kuma ya nuna adawa da cin hanci da rashawa da ya taso a lokacin shugabancin Jacob Zuma. [2] Ya yi aiki a Hukumar Kula da Kiwon Lafiya, a wasu lokuta a matsayin shugabanta. [3] [4] Ya mutu a ranar 12 ga watan Mayu 2020 sakamakon rikice-rikice na COVID-19 yana da shekaru 68 yayin da yake aiki a matsayin shugaban Majalisar Shirye-shiryen Likita. [5] Wa'adinsa na shugaban CMS ya kamata ya ƙare zuwa watan Satumba 2020. [6]

Clarence Mazwangwandile Mini (6 Nuwamba 1951 - 12 ga Mayu 2020) likita ne dan Afirka ta Kudu, mai fafutukar yaki da wariyar launin fata, mai fafutukar 'yanci, mai fafutukar kare hakkin dan Adam. An dauki Mini a matsayin majagaba na masana'antar likitanci a Afirka ta Kudu, musamman saboda muhimmiyar gudummawar da ya bayar wajen kawar da cutar kanjamau daga kasar. [1] Ya kuma bayar da himma wajen yaki da wariyar launin fata a lokacin aikinsa sannan kuma ya nuna adawa da cin hanci da rashawa da ya taso a lokacin shugabancin Jacob Zuma . [2] Ya yi aiki a Hukumar Kula da Kiwon Lafiya, a wasu lokuta a matsayin shugabanta. [3] [4] Ya mutu a ranar 12 ga Mayu 2020 sakamakon rikice-rikice na COVID-19 yana da shekaru 68 yayin da yake aiki a matsayin shugaban Majalisar Shirye-shiryen Likita. [5] Wa'adinsa na shugaban CMS ya kamata ya ƙare zuwa Satumba 2020. [6]

items.sourceText: His return to South Africa was crucial when the country was confronted with AIDS epidemic which was at its peak and he pioneered the fight to combat the spread of the AIDS virus. He also co-chaired the first national meeting of organisations at Nasrec in 1992 highlighting the importance of tackling HIV.[9] Mini also faced a backlash for his statements about HIV/AIDS by many members of the African National Congress, as most facts regarding the virus were denied by the African National Congress. Mini along with his wife Nancy opened an HIV clinic in Germiston and started treating patients with AIDS for free when Thabo Mbeki served as the President of the country from 1999 to 2008, who consistently denied the spread of AIDS and refused to distribute life saving antiretroviral medicine to treat patients living with AIDS.[2] He was appointed chairperson of Council of Medical Schemes in 2010 by the then minister of health, Aaron Motsoaledi.

targets.targetText: Komawarsa Afirka ta Kudu na da matukar muhimmanci a lokacin da ƙasar ta fuskanci ɓullar cutar kanjamau wacce ta kai kololuwarta kuma ya jajirce wajen yaki da yaɗuwar cutar kanjamau. Ya kuma jagoranci taron farko na kungiyoyi a Nasrec a shekarar 1992 inda ya bayyana mahimmancin magance cutar kanjamau. [1] Mini ya kuma fuskanci koma baya kan kalaman da ya yi game da cutar kanjamau da yawa daga cikin mambobin majalisar dokokin Afirka, saboda yawancin hujjojin da ke tattare da kwayar cutar, Majalisar Tarayyar Afirka ta musanta. Mini tare da matarsa Nancy sun buɗe asibitin yaki da cutar kanjamau a Germiston kuma sun fara jinyar marasa lafiya da ke ɗauke da cutar kanjamau kyauta a lokacin da Thabo Mbeki ya zama shugaban ƙasar daga shekarun 1999 zuwa 2008, wanda ya yi watsi da yaɗuwar cutar kanjamau kuma ya ki rarraba magungunan ceton rai don kula da marasa lafiya da ke ɗauke da cutar kanjamau. [2] Ministan lafiya na lokacin, Aaron Motsoaledi ya naɗa shi shugaban majalisar tsare-tsaren lafiya a shekarar 2010 .

Ya kuma jagoranci taron farko na kungiyoyi a Nasrec a shekarar 1992 inda ya bayyana mahimmancin magance cutar kanjamau. items.sourceText: He was arrested on 31 March 1963, along with seven colleagues, sentenced to twenty years in prison, and transferred to Robben Island. On the island, he suffered abuse from prison warders, including being buried alive to his neck, and urinated on. This and other forms of ill-treatment were exposed to the international community, came before the United Nations General Assembly, and led to some improvements in conditions.[2]

targets.targetText: An kama shi a ranar 31 ga watan Maris 1963, tare da abokan aiki bakwai, an yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin shekaru 20 a gidan yari, kuma aka kai shi tsibirin Robben. A tsibirin, ya fuskanci cin zarafi daga masu kula da kurkuku, ciki har da binne shi da rai har zuwa wuyansa, kuma ya yi fitsari. Wannan da sauran nau'ikan musgunawa an fallasa su ga al'ummomin duniya, sun zo gaban babban taron Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, kuma sun haifar da wasu gyare-gyare na yanayi. [1]

items.sourceText: After his release on 20 June 1983, he rejoined the PAC, and spent about ten days with his family before leaving the country to join the PAC in exile. He was appointed Secretary for Foreign Affairs and, after the death of John Nyathi Pokela, was appointed chairman and commander in chief of the Azanian People's Liberation Army (APLA), the PAC's military wing, from 12 August 1985 until 1990.[3] He served as Deputy President of the PAC from 1990 to 1994.[2]

targets.targetText: Bayan an sake shi a ranar 20 ga watan Yuni 1983, ya koma PAC, kuma ya shafe kusan kwanaki goma tare da iyalinsa kafin ya bar ƙasar ya shiga PAC a gudun hijira. An naɗa shi Sakataren Harkokin Waje kuma, bayan mutuwar John Nyathi Pokela, an naɗa shi shugaba da kwamandan rundunar sojojin 'yantar da jama'ar Azaniya (APLA), reshen soja na PAC, daga ranar 12 ga watan Agusta 1985 har zuwa shekara ta 1990. [1] Ya yi Mataimakin Shugaban Hukumar PAC daga shekarun 1990 zuwa 1994. [2]

items.sourceText: Mlangeni was born in Bethlehem, Orange Free State. After having to give up his studies owing to poverty, after 1946 he experienced worker exploitation as a factory worker. When working as a bus driver, he was active in a strike for better working conditions and a living wage, and in 1951, joined the African National Congress Youth League (ANCYL). In 1954, he joined the African National Congress (ANC).[3] In 1961, he was sent for military training outside the country, but on his return in 1963 was arrested, after being accused of recruiting and training an armed force. He was found guilty in the Rivonia Trial and sentenced to life imprisonment on Robben Island, where he was Prisoner 467/64.[3]

targets.targetText: An haifi Mlangeni a Baitalami, Jihar Orange Free State. Bayan ya daina karatunsa saboda talauci, bayan shekarar 1946 ya fuskanci cin zarafin ma'aikata a matsayin ma'aikacin masana'anta. Lokacin da yake aiki a matsayin direban bas, ya kasance yana cikin yajin aiki don ingantacciyar yanayin aiki da albashi, kuma a cikin shekarar 1951, ya shiga kungiyar matasa ta National Congress Youth League (ANCYL). A shekarar 1954 ya shiga jam'iyyar ANC. [1] A shekarar 1961, an tura shi horon soji a wajen ƙasar, amma bayan dawowarsa a shekarar 1963 aka kama shi, bayan da aka zarge shi da ɗaukar ma’aikata da horar da sojoji. An same shi da laifi a cikin Kotun Rivonia kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin rai da rai a tsibirin Robben, inda yake fursuna 467/64. [1]

items.sourceText: In 2017, Mlangeni [9] appeared with fellow defendants at the Rivonia Trial, Denis Goldberg and Ahmed Kathrada, along with lawyers Joel Joffe, George Bizos and Denis Kuny in a documentary film entitled Life is Wonderful, directed by Sir Nicholas Stadlen,[10] which tells the story of the trial. (The title reflects Goldberg's words to his mother at the end of the trial on hearing that he and his comrades had been spared the death sentence).[11][12][13][14]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 2017, Mlangeni [1] ya bayyana tare da abokan aikinsa a Kotun Rivonia, Denis Goldberg da Ahmed Kathrada, tare da lauyoyi Joel Joffe, George Bizos da Denis Kuny a cikin wani fim mai suna Life is Wonderful, wanda Sir Nicholas Stadlen ya jagoranta, [2] wanda ya ba da labarin shari'ar. (Laƙabin yana nuna kalaman Goldberg ga mahaifiyarsa a ƙarshen shari'ar da suka ji cewa an kare shi da 'yan uwansa daga hukuncin kisa). [3] [4] [5] [6]

(Lakabin yana nuna kalaman Goldberg ga mahaifiyarsa a karshen shari'ar da suka ji cewa an kare shi da 'yan uwansa daga hukuncin kisa). [3] [4] [5] [6]

items.sourceText: In July 1963, he was arrested at Liliesleaf Farm along with Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki, Ahmed Kathrada, Denis Goldberg, Raymond Mhlaba, and Andrew Mlangeni. At the Rivonia Trial, all of the men and Nelson Mandela (who had been imprisoned earlier) were found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment.[3]

targets.targetText: A cikin Yuli 1963, an kama shi a Liliesleaf Farm tare da Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki, Ahmed Kathrada, Denis Goldberg, Raymond Mhlaba, da Andrew Mlangeni . A Kotun Rivonia, dukkan mutanen da Nelson Mandela (wanda aka daure a kurkuku) an same su da laifi kuma an yanke musu hukuncin daurin rai da rai. [1]

items.sourceText: She and her husband were forced to leave Potchefstroom in 1931, and they moved to Johannesburg.[1] She joined the Communist Party's Political Bureau in 1937 and then its Central Committee. She also became a member of the party's Johannesburg committee in the 1940s and was a leader in the women's section of the party.[2][3]

Ta kuma zama mamba a kwamitin jam'iyyar Johannesburg a shekarun 1940 kuma ta kasance jagora a ɓangaren mata na jam'iyyar. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Nxumalo would play a large role in the Soweto uprising, which were a series of student-led protests in response to the Apartheid and the introduction of Afrikaans into the school curriculum.[4] The students believed Afrikaans to be the “language of the oppressor”.[2] It is estimated that 20,000 students would participate, protests would begin on June 16, 1976. The students would be met with police brutality, with anywhere from 176 to 700 killed.[4]

targets.targetText: Nxumalo zai taka rawa sosai a yunkurin Soweto, wanda ya kasance jerin zanga-zangar da dalibai suka jagoranta don mayar da martani ga wariyar launin fata da kuma shigar da Afrikaans a cikin manhajar makaranta. [1] Daliban sun yi imanin Afrikaans shine "harshen azzalumi". [2] An kiyasta cewa dalibai 20,000 za su shiga, za a fara zanga-zangar a ranar 16 ga Yuni, 1976. Daliban za su fuskanci cin zarafi na 'yan sanda, inda aka kashe daga 176 zuwa 700. [1]

items.sourceText: Later, Nxumalo would hold a leading position in the ranks of Umkhonto weSizwe. Lending his services around Africa, serving in nations like Angola, and Swaziland.[1] While at Funda Camp, which was an Umkhonto weSizwe preparation camp on the outskirts of Luanda, Angola, Nxumalo was seriously injured by a bullet mistakenly shot by a new recruit. Nxumalo however would go on to make a full recovery.[2]

targets.targetText: Daga baya, Nxumalo zai rike babban matsayi a cikin sahu na Umkhonto weSizwe. Bayar da lamuni a Afirka, yana aiki a ƙasashe kamar Angola, da Swaziland. [1] Yayin da yake a sansanin Funda, wanda wani sansanin shiri ne na Umkhonto weSizwe da ke wajen Luanda, Angola, Nxumalo ya ji rauni sosai sakamakon wani harsashi da wani sabon ma'aikaci ya harbe shi da kuskure. Nxumalo duk da haka zai ci gaba da yin cikakken murmurewa. [2]

Nxumalo duk da haka zai ci gaba da yin cikakken murmurewa. [2]

items.sourceText: In June 1977, Schoon married Jeanette Curtis,[4] a banned student and trade union activist, the sister of Neville Curtis.[5] The couple feared for their safety in South Africa and moved to Botswana, first to the capital Gaborone, then to Molepolole, teaching at Kgari Sechele Secondary School, and later back to Gaborone where they jointly ran the Botswana branch of the [International Voluntary Service],[6] all the while continuing to work for the anti-apartheid movement. They had two children: Katryn (1978) and Fritz (1981). During this time, internally within the African National Congress, the Schoons broke Craig Williamson's cover. He was an apartheid government spy named later publicly confirmed as a highly successful infiltrator of the liberation movements.[7] This allowed the ANC leadership to attempt to manipulate Williamson covertly for the movement's ends for a time. Later, following a warning from the United Kingdom's High Commissioner (ambassador) in Botswana that Marius was a target for assassination by the apartheid government security forces, the Schoon family moved to Angola via Lusaka, Zambia.

targets.targetText: A cikin Yuni 1977, Schoon ya auri Jeanette Curtis, [1] ɗalibi da aka dakatar kuma mai fafutukar kasuwanci, 'yar'uwar Neville Curtis . [2] Ma'auratan sun ji tsoro don kare lafiyarsu a Afirka ta Kudu kuma sun koma Botswana, da farko zuwa Gaborone babban birnin kasar, sannan zuwa Molepolole, suna koyarwa a makarantar sakandare ta Kgari Sechele, daga bisani kuma suka koma Gaborone inda suka yi aiki tare da reshen Botswana na [Ma'aikatar Sa-kai ta kasa da kasa], [3] duk yayin da suke ci gaba da aiki don gwagwarmayar yaki da wariyar launin fata. Suna da 'ya'ya biyu: Katryn (1978) da Fritz (1981). A cikin wannan lokacin, a cikin Majalisar Tarayyar Afirka, Schoon ya karya murfin Craig Williamson . Shi ɗan leƙen asirin gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ne da aka ambata daga baya aka tabbatar da shi a matsayin wanda ya yi nasarar kutsa kai cikin ƙungiyoyin 'yantar da jama'a. [4] Wannan ya baiwa shugabancin ANC damar yin yunƙurin yin amfani da Williamson a ɓoye don ƙarshen motsi na ɗan lokaci. Bayan haka, bayan gargadin da babban jakadan Burtaniya (jakadar) a Botswana ya yi cewa jami'an tsaron gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ne suka kashe Marius, dangin Schoon sun koma Angola ta hanyar Lusaka na kasar Zambia.

Suna da 'ya'ya biyu: Katryn (1978) da Fritz (1981). A cikin wannan lokacin, a cikin Majalisar Tarayyar Afirka, Schoon ya karya murfin Craig Williamson. Shi ɗan leƙen asirin gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ne da aka ambata daga baya aka tabbatar da shi a matsayin wanda ya yi nasarar kutsa kai cikin ƙungiyoyin 'yantar da jama'a. [4] Wannan ya baiwa shugabancin ANC damar yin yunƙurin yin amfani da Williamson a ɓoye don ƙarshen motsi na ɗan lokaci. Bayan haka, bayan gargadin da babban jakadan Burtaniya (jakadar) a Botswana ya yi cewa jami'an tsaron gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ne suka kashe Marius, dangin Schoon sun koma Angola ta hanyar Lusaka na ƙasar Zambia.

items.sourceText: He was hanged for treason on August 4, 1905.[1][2] His brother continued Kinjikitile's work and the rebellion continued until 1907, with over 100,000[11] or 200-300,000 Africans killed in the German suppression of the revolt.[4] Present-day Tanzanians consider the failed rebellion to have been the first stirring of nationalism, and Kinjikitile "Bokero" Ngwale a proto-national hero.[4]

targets.targetText: An rataye shi da laifin cin amanar kasa a ranar 4 ga Agusta, 1905. [1] [2] Dan uwansa ya ci gaba da aikin Kinjikitile kuma tawayen ya ci gaba har zuwa 1907, inda aka kashe sama da 100,000 [3] ko 200-300,000 na Afirka a cikin murkushe tawayen Jamus. [4] 'Yan Tanzaniya na yau suna ɗaukar tawayen da bai yi nasara ba shi ne farkon abin da ya haifar da kishin ƙasa, kuma Kinjikitile "Bokero" Ngwale jarumi ne na ƙasa. [1]

items.sourceText: Daniel Nyamayaro Madzimbamuto was born in Murehwa, on October 8, either 1929[1] or 1930.[2] This was a rural area north of Salisbury, Southern Rhodesia (now Harare, Zimbabwe).[3] He was the son of a Tribal Trust Land farmer, and the eighth child of a family of 10.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Daniel Nyamairo Madzimbamuto a Murehwa, a ranar 8 ga watan Oktoba, ko dai 1929 [1] ko 1930. [2] Wannan yanki ne na karkara a arewacin Salisbury, Kudancin Rhodesia (yanzu Harare, Zimbabwe). [3] Ya kasance ɗan wani manomin Land Trust Land, kuma ɗa na takwas a cikin iyali 10. [2]

items.sourceText: After Zimbabwe's independence in 1979–80, Madzimbamuto became Deputy Postmaster General at the Zimbabwe Posts and Telecommunications Corporation.[1][6] He held this post until retirement in 1998.[1]

targets.targetText: Bayan da Zimbabwe ta samu 'yancin kai a shekarar 1979–80, Madzimbamuto ya zama Mataimakin Babban mai Watsa Labarai a Kamfanin Wasika da Sadarwa na Zimbabwe. [1] [2] Ya riƙe wannan muƙamin har sai da ya yi ritaya a shekarar 1998. [1]

Bayan da Zimbabwe ta samu 'yancin kai a 1979–80, Madzimbamuto ya zama Mataimakin Babban Malamin Watsa Labarai a Kamfanin Wasika da Sadarwa na Zimbabwe. [1] [2] Ya rike wannan mukamin har sai da ya yi ritaya a shekarar 1998. [1]

items.sourceText: Tavarwisa worked as a primary school teacher until she left to join the Zimbabwe African National Liberation Army (ZANLA) to fight for the country's liberation. She was one of the early cadres and first female commanders of the movement.[1] Her initial responsibility was to carry and supply arms from Zambia to Mozambique to the frontlines in Zimbabwe (formerly Rhodesia). She was also responsible for disseminating the movement. She cooperated particularly among the peasants to gather their support.[4] Tavarwisa also ensured that women in the camps were not being sexually harassed or exploited.[3]

targets.targetText: Tavarwisa ta yi aiki a matsayin malamar makarantar firamare har sai da ta tafi ta shiga kungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin kai ta Zimbabwe (ZANLA) domin fafutukar kwato ƙasar. Ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin jiga-jigan farko kuma mata na farko kwamandojin tafiyar. [1] Aikinta na farko shi ne ɗaukar makamai daga Zambiya zuwa Mozambique zuwa fagen daga a Zimbabwe (tsohuwar Rhodesia). Ita ce kuma ta ɗauki nauyin yaɗa harkar. Ta ba da haɗin kai musamman a tsakanin manoma don samun goyon bayansu. [2] Tavarwisa ta kuma tabbatar da cewa ba a cin zarafin mata da ke sansanin ba. [3]

Tavarwisa ta yi aiki a matsayin malamin makarantar firamare har sai da ta tafi ta shiga kungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin kai ta Zimbabwe (ZANLA) domin fafutukar kwato kasar. Ta kasance daya daga cikin jiga-jigan farko kuma mata na farko kwamandojin tafiyar. Ta ba da hadin kai musamman a tsakanin manoma don samun goyon bayansu. [2] Tavarwisa ta kuma tabbatar da cewa ba a cin zarafin mata da ke sansanin ba. [3]

items.sourceText: He was a leading trade union leader, who progressed on to become president of the banned National Democratic Party, and was jailed for ten years by Rhodesia's white minority government. After his release in 1974, ZAPU contributed to the fall of that government, along with the splinter rival ZANU, created in 1963.[1]

targets.targetText: Ya kasance babban shugaban kungiyar kwadago, wanda ya ci gaba har ya zama shugaban jam'iyyar National Democratic Party da aka dakatar, kuma gwamnatin tsiraru fararen fata ta Rhodesia ta ɗaure shi na tsawon shekaru goma. Bayan da aka sake shi a shekarar 1974, ZAPU ya ba da gudummawa ga faɗuwar waccan gwamnatin, tare da ɓangarorin abokin hamayyar ZANU, wanda aka ƙirƙira a shekarar 1963. [1]

Ya kasance babban shugaban kungiyar kwadago, wanda ya ci gaba har ya zama shugaban jam'iyyar National Democratic Party da aka dakatar, kuma gwamnatin tsiraru fararen fata ta Rhodesia ta daure shi na tsawon shekaru goma. Bayan da aka sake shi a 1974, ZAPU ya ba da gudummawa ga faduwar waccan gwamnatin, tare da ɓangarorin abokin hamayyar ZANU, wanda aka ƙirƙira a 1963. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1983, fearing for his life in the early stages of the Gukurahundi, Nkomo fled the country. Later in 1987, he controversially signed the Unity Accord allowing ZAPU to merge with ZANU to stop the genocide.[2]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1983, Nkomo, saboda tsoron rayuwarsa a farkon matakan Gukurahundi, ya gudu daga ƙasar. Daga baya a shekarar 1987, ya sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar Unity Accord mai cike da cece-kuce inda ya baiwa ZAPU damar hadewa da ZANU domin dakatar da kisan kiyashin. [1]

A cikin shekarar 1983, Nkomo, saboda tsoron rayuwarsa a farkon matakan Gukurahundi, ya gudu daga ƙasar. Daga baya a shekarar 1987, ya sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar Unity Accord mai cike da cece-kuce inda ya baiwa ZAPU damar haɗewa da ZANU domin dakatar da kisan kiyashin. [1]

items.sourceText: His farm, "Porta Farm" situated 25 kilometres (16 mi) from Harare on Bulawayo Road, was legally purchased in 1992 under "willing buyer – willing seller" arrangements. It was later confiscated by Robert Mugabe's ZANU-PF government, on the grounds that it harboured the "undesirables" of Harare. These were people who had been left homeless after being summarily evicted from shanties in Harare before the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting 1991. Sithole had felt compassion for them, and what he felt was the breach of their human rights; he therefore had invited some of them to stay on the farm. This incensed the government, which then carried out an eviction operation. This was co-ordinated by the Ministry of Local Government and National Housing as well as the City of Harare. Pre-dawn raids were carried out and, in the aftermath, Porta Farm was confiscated.[9][10]

targets.targetText: Gonansa, "Porta Farm" mai nisan 25 kilometres (16 mi) daga Harare a kan titin Bulawayo, an siya ta bisa doka a cikin 1992 a ƙarƙashin shirye-shiryen "mai siye - mai sayarwa". Daga baya kuma gwamnatin Robert Mugabe ta ZANU-PF ta kwace shi, bisa hujjar cewa tana dauke da abubuwan da ba a so na Harare. Wadannan mutane ne da aka bar su ba tare da matsuguni ba bayan an kore su daga gidajen zama a Harare kafin taron shugabannin Commonwealth na 1991 . Sithole ya tausaya musu, kuma abin da yake ji shi ne tauye hakkinsu na dan Adam ; don haka ya gayyaci wasu daga cikinsu su zauna a gona. Hakan dai ya harzuka gwamnati, inda daga nan ne ta gudanar da aikin korar mutanen. Ma’aikatar kananan hukumomi da gidaje ta kasa da kuma birnin Harare ne suka hada kai. An kai hare-hare kafin wayewar gari kuma, bayan haka, an kwace gonar Porta. [1] [2]

Gonansa, "Porta Farm" mai nisan 25 kilometres (16 mi) daga Harare a kan titin Bulawayo, an siya ta bisa doka a cikin shekarar 1992 a ƙarƙashin shirye-shiryen "mai siye - mai sayarwa". Daga baya kuma gwamnatin Robert Mugabe ta ZANU-PF ta kwace shi, bisa hujjar cewa tana ɗauke da abubuwan da ba a so na Harare. Waɗannan mutane ne da aka bar su ba tare da matsuguni ba bayan an kore su daga gidajen zama a Harare kafin taron shugabannin Commonwealth na shekarar 1991. Sithole ya tausaya musu, kuma abin da yake ji shi ne tauye hakkinsu na ɗan Adam; don haka ya gayyaci wasu daga cikinsu su zauna a gona. Hakan dai ya harzuka gwamnati, inda daga nan ne ta gudanar da aikin korar mutanen. Ma’aikatar ƙananan hukumomi da gidaje ta ƙasa da kuma birnin Harare ne suka haɗa kai. An kai hare-hare kafin wayewar gari kuma, bayan haka, an kwace gonar Porta. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Julia Tukai Zvobgo (born Julia Tukai Whande; 8 November 1937 – 16 February 2004) was a Zimbabwean activist and politician.[1]

targets.targetText: Julia Tukai Zvobgo (an haife shi Julia Tukai Whande; 8 ga Nuwamba 1937 – 16 ga Fabrairu 2004) 'yar gwagwarmaya ce kuma 'yar siyasa 'yar ƙasar Zimbabwe. [1]
Julia Tukai Zvobgo (an haife shi Julia Tukai Whande; 8 ga Nuwamba 1937 – 16 ga Fabrairu 2004) yar gwagwarmaya ce kuma ɗan siyasa ɗan Zimbabwe . [1]

items.sourceText: Zvobgo's commitment to her family and nationalist values made her endure the constant harassment and torture at the hands of the Rhodesian security agents who accused her of smuggling political messages to and from her detained husband and his colleagues.[1] From 1968-1978 Julia studied abroad and later joined her husband in the armed struggle in Mozambique where she was elected Administrative Secretary for Women's Affairs.[3] She attended problems of women in military and refugee camps and was one of the pioneers of the Women's League.[3]

targets.targetText: Yunkurin da Zvobgo ta yi ga danginta da kimar kishin ƙasa ya sa ta jimre da cin zarafi da azabtarwa a hannun jami’an tsaro na Rhodesia waɗanda ke zarginta da safarar saƙon siyasa zuwa da kuma daga mijinta da aka tsare da kuma abokan aikinsa. [1] Daga 1968-1978 Julia ta yi karatu a kasashen waje sannan daga baya ta shiga hannun mijinta a fagen gwagwarmaya a Mozambik inda aka zabe ta sakatariyar harkokin mata. [1] Ta halarci matsalolin mata a sansanonin soja da na ’yan gudun hijira kuma ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin majagaba na Ƙungiyar Mata. [1]

Yunkurin da Zvobgo ta yi ga danginta da kimar kishin ƙasa ya sa ta jimre da cin zarafi da azabtarwa a hannun jami’an tsaro na Rhodesia waɗanda ke zarginta da safarar saƙon siyasa zuwa da kuma daga mijinta da aka tsare da kuma abokan aikinsa. [1] Daga shekarar 1968-1978 Julia ta yi karatu a ƙasashen waje sannan daga baya ta shiga hannun mijinta a fagen gwagwarmaya a Mozambik inda aka zabe ta sakatariyar harkokin mata. [1] Ta halarci matsalolin mata a sansanonin soja da na ’yan gudun hijira kuma ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin majagaba na Ƙungiyar Mata. [1]

items.sourceText: Maria da Luz Freire de Andrade (1934 – November 6, 2024), better known as Lilica Boal, was a historian, philosopher, educator, and anti-fascist activist in Cape Verde. She fought for the independence of Guinea-Bissau and Cape Verde, and against the Portuguese Estado Novo dictatorship.

targets.targetText: Maria da Luz Freire de Andrade (1934 - Nuwamba 6, 2024), wacce aka fi sani da Lilica Boal, ƴar tarihi ce, ƴan falsafa, malami, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da fascist a Cape Verde . Ta yi gwagwarmaya don samun 'yancin kai na Guinea-Bissau da Cape Verde, da kuma adawa da mulkin kama-karya na Portuguese Estado Novo .

Maria da Luz Freire de Andrade (1934 - Nuwamba 6, 2024), wacce aka fi sani da Lilica Boal, masaniya a fannin tarihi ce, ƴar falsafa, malama, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da fascist a Cape Verde. Ta yi gwagwarmaya don samun 'yancin kai na Guinea-Bissau da Cape Verde, da kuma adawa da mulkin kama-karya na Portuguese Estado Novo.

items.sourceText: In this period, Boal joined the leadership of the Women's Democratic Union (UDEMU), the party's women's wing, taking responsibility for international relations. She participated in international women's conferences that dealt with the situation of women in Africa and the world.

targets.targetText: A wannan lokaci Boal ya shiga shugabancin kungiyar mata ta UDEMU, reshen mata na jam’iyyar, inda ya dauki nauyin hulda da kasashen duniya. Ta halarci tarukan mata na kasa da kasa da suka shafi yanayin mata a Afirka da ma duniya baki daya.

A wannan lokaci Boal ta shiga shugabancin kungiyar mata ta UDEMU, reshen mata na jam’iyyar, inda ta ɗauki nauyin hulɗa da ƙasashen duniya. Ta halarci tarukan mata na ƙasa da ƙasa da suka shafi yanayin mata a Afirka da ma duniya baki daya.

items.sourceText: From 1974 to 1979 she was the director of the party's Instituto Amizade in Guinea-Bissau, and she was later appointed to the No. 2 spot at the Ministry of Education, serving as director-general of coordination from 1979 until the end of 1980.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Daga 1974 zuwa 1979 ta kasance darakta na Instituto Amizade na jam'iyyar a Guinea-Bissau, kuma daga baya aka nada ta a matsayi na 2 a ma'aikatar ilimi, ta kasance babban darakta na daidaitawa daga 1979 har zuwa karshen 1980. [1] [2]

Daga shekarun 1974 zuwa 1979 ta kasance darakta na Instituto Amizade na jam'iyyar a Guinea-Bissau, kuma daga baya aka naɗa ta a matsayi na 2 a ma'aikatar ilimi, ta kasance babbar darakta na daidaitawa daga shekarun 1979 har zuwa karshen 1980. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Hostilities ceased in April 1958 (although small skirmishes still occurred) with the Treaty of Angra de Cintra, signed by the Spanish and Moroccan governments, by which Cape Juby and most of the Ifni territory were transferred to Morocco. The city of Sidi Ifni remained in Spanish possession until 1969, when, under international pressure, it was relinquished to Morocco.

targets.targetText: An daina tashin hankali a watan Afrilun 1958 (ko da yake ana ci gaba da samun ƙananan ɓangarorin) tare da Yarjejeniyar Angra de Cintra, wanda gwamnatocin Spain da na Morocco suka sanya hannu, wanda Cape Juby da yawancin yankin Ifni suka koma Maroko. Birnin Sidi Ifni ya ci gaba da zama a hannun Sipaniya har zuwa shekara 1969, lokacin da, a ƙarƙashin matsin lamba na ƙasa da kasa, aka mika shi ga Morocco.

An daina tashin hankali a watan Afrilun 1958 (ko da yake ana ci gaba da samun ƙananan ɓangarorin) tare da Yarjejeniyar Angra de Cintra, wanda gwamnatocin Spain da na Morocco suka sanya hannu, wanda Cape Juby da yawancin yankin Ifni suka koma Maroko. Birnin Sidi Ifni ya ci gaba da zama a hannun Sipaniya har zuwa 1969, lokacin da, a karkashin matsin lamba na kasa da kasa, aka mika shi ga Morocco.

items.sourceText: A popular idea among the public in France was to possess an unbroken stretch of territory from Tunis to the Atlantic Ocean, including expansion into the "Taza corridor" in the Moroccan interior.[7] Lyautey was in favour of this and advocated French occupation of the Middle Atlas mountains near Taza, through peaceful means where possible.[8] This French expansion into the Middle Atlas was strongly opposed by the "powerful Berber trinity" of Mouha ou Hammou Zayani, leader of the Zaian Confederation; Moha ou Said, leader of the Aït Ouirra; and Ali Amhaouch, a religious leader of the Darqawa variant of Islam prevalent in the region.[9][10]

targets.targetText: Shahararriyar ra'ayi tsakanin jama'a a Faransa shi ne mallakar wani yanki mai nisa daga Tunis zuwa Tekun Atlantika, gami da fadada hanyar " Taza corridor" a cikin cikin Moroccan. [1] Lyautey ya goyi bayan wannan kuma ya ba da shawarar mamaye tsaunukan Atlas na tsakiya kusa da Taza, ta hanyar lumana inda zai yiwu. [2] Wannan faɗaɗa Faransa zuwa tsakiyar Atlas ya kasance mai tsananin adawa da "mafi karfi na Berber Trinity" na Mouha ou Hammou Zayani, shugaban kungiyar Zaian; Moha ou Said, shugaban kungiyar Aït Ouirra; da Ali Amhaouch, shugaban addini na Darqawa bambancin Musulunci da ke da yawa a yankin. [3] [4]

[3] [4]

items.sourceText: Ibas was born in Nko, Cross River State, South South Nigeria.[10] He enlisted into the Nigerian Defence Academy as a member of 26 Regular Course on 20 June 1979 and was commissioned sub-lieutenant on 1 January 1983. He began his primary education at Nko Primary School, Nko, in 1966 and completed at Big Qua Primary School, Calabar in 1971. He then proceeded to the Hope Waddell Training Institute, Calabar from 1972 to 1976. Between 1977 and 1979, he attended the School of Basic Studies Ogoja before proceeding to the Nigerian Defence Academy in 1979.

targets.targetText: An haifi Ibas a Nko, Jihar Cross River, Kudancin Kudancin Najeriya . [1] Ya shiga cikin Kwalejin Tsaro ta Najeriya a matsayin memba na 26 Regular Course a ranar 20 ga Yuni 1979 kuma an ba shi izini a ranar 1 ga Janairun 1983. Ya fara karatun firamare a makarantar firamare ta Nko, Nko, a shekarar 1966 kuma ya kammala a makarantar firimare ta Big Qua, Calabar a shekarar 1971. Daga nan sai ya ci gaba zuwa Cibiyar Horar da Hope Waddell, Calabar daga 1972 zuwa 1976. Tsakanin 1977 da 1979, ya halarci Makarantar Nazarin asali ta Ogoja kafin ya ci gaba zuwa Kwalejin Tsaro ta Najeriya a 1979.

items.sourceText: The First Frontier War broke out in 1779 between Boer frontiersmen and the amaXhosa. In December 1779, an armed clash occurred, resulting from allegations of cattle theft by Xhosa people. In November 1780, the Cape governor, Baron van Plettenberg declared that the eastern border of the Cape colony was the entire length of the Great Fish river despite many amaXhosa polities being already established west of the river, and no negotiations involving this decision were made with them beforehand.[7] Van Plettenberg appointed Adreaan Van Jaarsveld to lead commandoes to force the Xhosa to move east of the river, if they were unresponsive to requests to do so. This led to multiple attacks by the commandoes to forcefully remove Xhosa polities out of the area. When the imiDange refused to move, Van Jaarsveld and his commandoes had their chief, Jalamba, agree to another meeting for discussions. During the meeting he scattered large amounts of tobacco around and let the Xhosa have it. While some were distracted picking up the tobacco, Van Jaarsveld and his gunmen proceeded to shoot at them leading to a death toll of anywhere from 100 to 200, including Jalamba.[8][7] Soon after this, the Van Jaarsveld commandoes began attacking and looting the cattle of multiple other chiefdoms in the Zuurveld which included the amaGwali, amaNtinde, and amaMbalu. A large amount of the Xhosa population west of the river became dispersed, and Van Jaarsveld disbanded his commandoes on July 19, 1781, feeling he had fulfilled his job of expelling the Xhosa although many of them were able to move back into the area soon after.[8][7]

targets.targetText: Yakin Farko na Farko ya ɓarke a cikin shekarar 1779 tsakanin Boer frontiersmen da amaXhosa. A cikin watan Disamba 1779, an yi artabu da makamai, sakamakon zargin satar shanu da mutanen Xhosa suka yi. A cikin watan Nuwamba 1780, gwamnan Cape, Baron van Plettenberg ya bayyana cewa iyakar gabas na yankin Cape shine tsayin babban kogin Kifi duk da yawancin amaXhosa da aka riga aka kafa a yammacin kogin, kuma babu wata tattaunawa da ta shafi wannan shawarar da aka yi da su tukuna. [1] Van Plettenberg ya naɗa Adreaan Van Jaarsveld ya jagoranci kwamandojin don tilastawa Xhosa matsawa gabas da kogin, idan ba su amsa buƙatun yin hakan ba. Wannan ya haifar da hare-hare da yawa daga kwamandojin don kawar da siyasar Xhosa da karfi daga yankin. Lokacin da imiDange ya ƙi motsawa, Van Jaarsveld da kwamandojinsa sun sa shugabansu, Jalamba, ya amince da wani taro don tattaunawa. A yayin taron ya watsar da taɓa da yawa kuma ya bar Xhosa ya samu. Yayin da wasu suka shagaltu da karɓar taba, Van Jaarsveld da ‘yan bindigarsa sun ci gaba da harbe su wanda ya yi sanadiyar mutuwar mutane 100 zuwa 200 ciki har da Jalamba. [2] [1] Ba da daɗewa ba bayan wannan, kwamandojin Van Jaarsveld suka fara kai hari tare da kwashe shanun wasu masarautu da yawa a cikin Zuurveld waɗanda suka haɗa da amaGwali, amaNtinde, da amaMbalu. Yawancin mutanen Xhosa da ke yammacin kogin sun watse, kuma Van Jaarsveld ya wargaza kwamandojinsa a ranar 19 ga watan Yuli, 1781, yana jin ya cika aikinsa na korar Xhosa ko da yake da yawa daga cikinsu sun sami damar komawa yankin ba da daɗewa ba. [2] [1]

items.sourceText: The Bizerte crisis (French: Crise de Bizerte; Arabic: أحداث بنزرت, romanized: ʾAḥdāth Bīzart) occurred in July 1961 when Tunisia imposed a blockade on the French naval base at Bizerte, Tunisia, hoping to force its evacuation. The crisis culminated in a three-day battle between French and Tunisian forces that left 630 Tunisians and 24 French dead.

targets.targetText: Rikicin Bizerte ya faru ne a cikin watan Yulin 1961 lokacin da Tunisiya ta ƙaƙabawa sansanin sojin ruwan Faransa da ke Bizerte, a ƙasar Tunisiya takunkumi, da fatan tilastawa ficewa daga ƙasar. Rikicin dai ya kawo karshe ne a faɗan da aka kwashe kwanaki uku ana gwabza tsakanin dakarun Faransa da na Tunisiya wanda ya yi sanadin mutuwar 'yan Tunisiya 630 da Faransawa 24.

Rikicin Bizerte ( French ; Arabic ) ya faru ne a cikin watan Yulin 1961 lokacin da Tunisiya ta kakaba wa sansanin sojin ruwan Faransa da ke Bizerte, a kasar Tunisiya takunkumi, da fatan tilastawa ficewa daga kasar. Rikicin dai ya kawo karshe ne a fadan da aka kwashe kwanaki uku ana gwabza tsakanin dakarun Faransa da na Tunisiya wanda ya yi sanadin mutuwar 'yan Tunisiya 630 da Faransawa 24.

items.sourceText: After Tunisia gained independence from France in 1956, France remained in control of the city and its naval base, a strategic port on the Mediterranean, which played an important part in French operations during the Algerian War. France had promised to negotiate the future of the base, but had so far refused to remove it. Tunisia was further infuriated upon learning that France planned to expand the airbase.

targets.targetText: Bayan da Tunisiya ta sami 'yancin kai daga Faransa a shekara ta 1956, Faransa ta ci gaba da rike birnin da sansanin sojojin ruwa, tashar jiragen ruwa mai mahimmanci a tekun Bahar Rum, wadda ta taka muhimmiyar rawa a ayyukan Faransa a lokacin yakin Aljeriya . Faransa ta yi alkawarin tattaunawa kan makomar sansanin, amma kawo yanzu ta ki cire shi. Tuni Tunisiya ta kara fusata da jin labarin cewa Faransa na shirin fadada sansanin sojin sama.

Bayan da Tunisiya ta sami 'yancin kai daga Faransa a shekara ta 1956, Faransa ta ci gaba da riƙe birnin da sansanin sojojin ruwa, tashar jiragen ruwa mai mahimmanci a tekun Bahar Rum, wacce ta taka muhimmiyar rawa a ayyukan Faransa a lokacin yakin Aljeriya. Faransa ta yi alkawarin tattaunawa kan makomar sansanin, amma kawo yanzu ta ki cire shi. Tuni Tunisiya ta ƙara fusata da jin labarin cewa Faransa na shirin faɗaɗa sansanin sojin sama.

items.sourceText: The movement was founded in western Ethiopia, and included fighters such as the Shewan Ras[nb 1] Abebe Aregai,[citation needed] and a number of intellectuals who included the sons of Hakim Workneh Eshete and Heruy Welde Sellase, and Yilma Deressa.[5] Its chairman was Alemework Beyene, a veterinary surgeon educated in Britain. The organization had a constitution consisting of ten points, which included: asserting the supremacy of the political sphere over the military, injunctions against mistreating peasants and prisoners of war, forbidding its members from seeking exile and urging them to prefer death to capture by the enemy.[6]

targets.targetText: An kafa kungiyar ne a yammacin Habasha, kuma ta hada da mayaka irin su Shewan Ras [ nb 1 ] Abebe Aregai ,  da hazikai da dama wadanda suka hada da 'ya'yan Hakim Workneh Eshete da Heruy Welde Sellase, da Yilma Deressa . [1] Shugabanta shine Alemework Beyene, likitan likitan dabbobi da ya yi karatu a Burtaniya. Kungiyar dai tana da kundin tsarin mulki da ya kunshi abubuwa goma, wadanda suka hada da: tabbatar da fifikon fagen siyasa a kan sojoji, umarnin hana cin zalin manoma da fursunonin yaki, da hana mambobinta neman gudun hijira da kuma bukace su da su gwammace mutuwa maimakon makiya. [2]

An kafa kungiyar ne a yammacin Habasha, kuma ta haɗa da mayaka irin su Shewan Ras [ nb 1 ] Abebe Aregai ,  da hazikai da dama waɗanda suka haɗa da 'ya'yan Hakim Workneh Eshete da Heruy Welde Sellase, da Yilma Deressa. [1] Shugabanta shine Alemework Beyene, likitan dabbobi da ya yi karatu a Burtaniya. Kungiyar dai tana da kundin tsarin mulki da ya kunshi abubuwa goma, waɗanda suka haɗa da: tabbatar da fifikon fagen siyasa a kan sojoji, umarnin hana cin zalin manoma da fursunonin yaki, da hana mambobinta neman gudun hijira da kuma buƙatar su da su gwammace mutuwa maimakon makiya. [2]

items.sourceText: The group was effectively disbanded following the surrender of the Ras Imru Haile Selassie 18 December 1936.[7] The majority of its members were killed by the Italians following the unsuccessful attempt on Rodolfo Graziani's life on 19 February 1937.[8] The few survivors included Alemework and Yilma.

targets.targetText: An wargaza kungiyar sosai bayan mika wuya na Ras Imru Haile Selassie a ranar 18 ga Disamba 1936. [1] Yawancin mambobinta Italiyawa ne suka kashe bayan yunkurin da Rodolfo Graziani ya yi bai yi nasara ba a ranar 19 ga Fabrairun 1937 . [2] Wadanda suka tsira sun hada da Alemework da Yilma.

An wargaza kungiyar sosai bayan miƙa wuya na Ras Imru Haile Selassie a ranar 18 ga watan Disamba 1936. [1] Yawancin mambobinta Italiyawa ne suka kashe bayan yunkurin da Rodolfo Graziani ya yi bai yi nasara ba a ranar 19 ga watan Fabrairun 1937. [2] Waɗanda suka tsira sun haɗa da Alemework da Yilma.

items.sourceText: The Black Lions convinced Ras Imru Haile Selassie to join them in the armed struggle since he was part of the dynamics that created the movement. Ras Imru was appointed by Emperor Haile Selassie as prince regent in his absence. Ras Imru was to reorganize and continue to resist the Italians. To do this, he fell back to Gore in southern Ethiopia. On 19 December 1936, after the Italians pinned him down on the north bank of the Gojeb River, Ras Imru surrendered. The Black Lions organization then collapsed, and many of its members were murdered.[9]

targets.targetText: Bakar Lions sun shawo kan Ras Imru Haile Selassie ya shiga cikin su a gwagwarmayar makami tun yana cikin sauye-sauyen da suka haifar da harkar. Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ne ya nada Ras Imru a matsayin yarima mai jiran gado a lokacin da ba ya nan. Ras Imru zai sake tsarawa kuma ya ci gaba da adawa da Italiya. Don yin haka, ya koma Gore a kudancin Habasha. A ranar 19 ga Disamba, 1936, bayan da Italiyanci suka kama shi a arewacin gabar kogin Gojeb, Ras Imru ya mika wuya. Daga nan ne kungiyar Black Lions ta ruguje, kuma aka kashe da yawa daga cikin mambobinta. [1]

Black Lions sun shawo kan Ras Imru Haile Selassie ya shiga cikin su a gwagwarmayar makami tun yana cikin sauye-sauyen da suka haifar da harkar. Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ne ya naɗa Ras Imru a matsayin yarima mai jiran gado a lokacin da ba ya nan. Ras Imru zai sake tsarawa kuma ya ci gaba da adawa da Italiya. Don yin haka, ya koma Gore a kudancin Habasha. A ranar 19 ga watan Disamba, 1936, bayan da Italiya suka kama shi a arewacin gabar kogin Gojeb, Ras Imru ya miƙa wuya. Daga nan ne kungiyar Black Lions ta ruguje, kuma aka kashe da yawa daga cikin mambobinta. [1]

items.sourceText: The Malagasy Uprising (French: Insurrection malgache; Malagasy: Tolom-bahoaka tamin' ny 1947) was a Malagasy nationalist rebellion against French colonial rule in Madagascar, lasting from March 1947 to February 1949. Starting in late 1945, Madagascar's first French National Assembly deputies, Joseph Raseta, Joseph Ravoahangy [mg; ru] and Jacques Rabemananjara of the Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM) political party, led an effort to achieve independence for Madagascar through legal channels. The failure of this initiative and the harsh response it drew from the Socialist Ramadier administration radicalized elements of the Malagasy population, including leaders of several militant nationalist secret societies.[4]

targets.targetText: Tashin hankali na Malagasy Tawayen kishin ƙasa ne na Malagasy akan 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa a Madagascar, wanda ya kasance daga watan Maris 1947 zuwa watan Fabrairu 1949. Tun daga ƙarshen 1945, Mataimakin Majalisar Faransa na farko na Madagascar, Joseph Raseta, Joseph Ravoahangy [ mg ; ru ] da Jacques Rabemananjara na jam'iyyar siyasa ta Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM), sun jagoranci yunkurin samun 'yancin kai ga Madagascar ta hanyar doka. Rashin nasarar wannan shiri da kuma martani mai zafi da ya samu daga gwamnatin Socialist Ramadier ya janyo tsatsauran ra'ayi na al'ummar Malagasy, gami da shugabannin kungiyoyin asiri na 'yan kishin ƙasa da dama. [1]

Tashin hankalin Malagasy ( French ; Malagasy ) Tawayen kishin kasa ne na Malagasy akan mulkin mallaka na Faransa a Madagascar, wanda ya kasance daga Maris 1947 zuwa Fabrairu 1949. Tun daga ƙarshen 1945, Mataimakin Majalisar Faransa na farko na Madagascar, Joseph Raseta, Joseph Ravoahangy [ mg ; ru ] da Jacques Rabemananjara na jam'iyyar siyasa ta Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM), sun jagoranci yunkurin samun 'yancin kai ga Madagascar ta hanyar doka. Rashin nasarar wannan shiri da kuma martani mai zafi da ya samu daga gwamnatin Socialist Ramadier ya janyo tsatsauran ra'ayi na al'ummar Malagasy, gami da shugabannin kungiyoyin asiri na 'yan kishin kasa da dama. [1]

items.sourceText: By May 1947, the French began to counter the nationalists. The French tripled the number of troops on the island to 18,000, primarily by transferring soldiers from French colonies elsewhere in Africa. The colonial authorities sought to fight on the physical and psychological fronts and engaged in a variety of terror tactics designed to demoralize the population. The French military force carried out mass execution, torture, war rape, torching of entire villages, collective punishment and other atrocities such as throwing live Malagasy prisoners out of airplanes (death flights).

targets.targetText: A watan Mayun 1947, Faransawa sun fara yaƙi da masu kishin ƙasa. Faransawa sun ninka adadin dakaru a tsibirin har sau uku zuwa 18,000, musamman ta hanyar tura sojoji daga ƙasashen da Faransa ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a wasu wurare a Afirka. Hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun nemi yin yaki ta fuskar zahiri da tunani tare da shiga dabaru iri-iri na ta'addanci da aka tsara don kashe mutane. Sojojin Faransa sun aiwatar da hukuncin kisa da yawa, azabtarwa, fyaɗen yaki, kona daukacin ƙauyuka, azabtar da jama'a da sauran ta'addanci kamar jefa fursunonin Malagasy daga cikin jiragen sama (jirgin mutuwa).

A watan Mayun 1947, Faransawa sun fara yaƙi da masu kishin ƙasa. Faransawa sun ninka adadin dakaru a tsibirin har sau uku zuwa 18,000, musamman ta hanyar tura sojoji daga kasashen da Faransa ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a wasu wurare a Afirka. Hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun nemi yin yaki ta fuskar zahiri da tunani tare da shiga dabaru iri-iri na ta'addanci da aka tsara don kashe mutane. Sojojin Faransa sun aiwatar da hukuncin kisa da yawa, azabtarwa, fyaden yaki, kona daukacin kauyuka, azabtar da jama'a da sauran ta'addanci kamar jefa fursunonin Malagasy daga cikin jiragen sama ( jirgin mutuwa ).

items.sourceText: The Menalamba rebellion was only the first manifestation of ongoing opposition to French rule that occasionally erupted in violent clashes between the Malagasy and the colonial authorities in Madagascar. Secret nationalist societies began to form in the 1910s. Conscription of Malagasy soldiers to fight for France in World War I strengthened resentment of foreign rule, and in the interwar period these nationalist organizations proliferated. Germany's defeat of the French army and occupation of France in 1940, the imposition of a Vichy regime in Madagascar and the subsequent capture of the island by the British in 1942 further tarnished the colonial government's image. Popular anger was especially aroused by its policies of forced labor in lieu of taxes, involuntary conscription into the army to fight in World War II, and the required contribution of large quantities of rice per head annually.[1]

targets.targetText: Tawayen Menalamba ita ce farkon bayyanar adawar da ake ci gaba da yi wa mulkin Faransa wanda a wasu lokuta yakan barke a tashin hankali tsakanin Malagasy da hukumomin mulkin mallaka a Madagascar. Ƙungiyoyin masu kishin ƙasa na sirri sun fara samuwa a cikin 1910s. Dakatar da sojojin Malagasy don yaƙar Faransa a Yaƙin Duniya na ɗaya ya ƙarfafa ɓacin ran mulkin ƙasashen waje, kuma a lokacin tsaka-tsakin waɗannan ƙungiyoyin masu kishin ƙasa sun yaɗu. Kashin da Jamus ta yi wa sojojin Faransa da mamayar Faransa a shekarar 1940, da kafa gwamnatin Vichy a Madagascar da kuma kwace tsibirin da turawan Ingila suka yi a shekarar 1942 ya kara bata sunan gwamnatin mulkin mallaka. Babban hasashe ya taso musamman saboda manufofinta na aikin tilastawa maimakon haraji, shiga aikin soja ba tare da son rai ba don yaƙi a yakin duniya na biyu, da kuma gudummawar da ake buƙata na yawan shinkafa kowace shekara. [1]

Tawayen Menalamba ita ce farkon bayyanar adawar da ake ci gaba da yi wa mulkin Faransa wanda a wasu lokuta yakan ɓarke a tashin hankali tsakanin Malagasy da hukumomin mulkin mallaka a Madagascar. Ƙungiyoyin masu kishin ƙasa na sirri sun fara samuwa a cikin shekarar 1910s. Dakatar da sojojin Malagasy don yaƙar Faransa a Yaƙin Duniya na ɗaya ya ƙarfafa ɓacin ran mulkin ƙasashen waje, kuma a lokacin tsaka-tsakin waɗannan ƙungiyoyin masu kishin ƙasa sun yaɗu. Kashin da Jamus ta yi wa sojojin Faransa da mamayar Faransa a shekarar 1940, da kafa gwamnatin Vichy a Madagascar da kuma kwace tsibirin da turawan Ingila suka yi a shekarar 1942 ya kara ɓata sunan gwamnatin mulkin mallaka. Babban hasashe ya taso musamman saboda manufofinta na aikin tilastawa maimakon haraji, shiga aikin soja ba tare da son rai ba don yaƙi a yakin duniya na biyu, da kuma gudummawar da ake buƙata na yawan shinkafa kowace shekara. [1]

items.sourceText: In the aftermath of Samaya, some of the leaders of Bamako began making overtures to Toure. The French, eager to possess this key strategic town on the Niger, rushed a force to establish a fort there on February 1, 1883.[1]: 76  Kebe Brema, Samori's brother, led a force to Bamako to lure the French out of their defenses. They fought two battles at Woyo Wayanko creek in early April, with Kebe Brema winning the first but eventually being forced to retreat.[4]

targets.targetText: Bayan Samaya, wasu daga cikin shugabannin Bamako sun fara zagayawa zuwa Toure. Faransawa, suna son mallakar wannan muhimmin gari mai mahimmanci a Nijar, sun garzaya da wata runduna don kafa katanga a can ranar 1 ga Fabrairu, 1883. [1] : 76 Kebe Brema, dan uwan Samori, ya jagoranci wata rundunar soji zuwa Bamako domin kwato Faransawa daga kariyar da suke yi. Sun gwabza fada biyu a kogin Woyo Wayanko a farkon watan Afrilu, inda Kebe Brema ya yi nasara a karon farko amma daga karshe aka tilasta masa ja da baya. [2]

Bayan Samaya, wasu daga cikin shugabannin Bamako sun fara zagayawa zuwa Toure. Faransawa, suna son mallakar wannan muhimmin gari mai mahimmanci a Nijar, sun garzaya da wata runduna don kafa katanga a can ranar 1 ga watan Fabrairu, 1883. [1] : 76 Kebe Brema, ɗan uwan Samori, ya jagoranci wata rundunar soji zuwa Bamako domin kwato Faransawa daga kariyar da suke yi. Sun gwabza faɗa biyu a kogin Woyo Wayanko a farkon watan Afrilu, inda Kebe Brema ya yi nasara a karon farko amma daga karshe aka tilasta masa ja da baya. [2]

items.sourceText: When an 1885 French expedition under Col. A. V. A. Combes attempted to seize the Buré gold fields by capturing Niagassola, Toure counter-attacked. Dividing his army into three mobile columns, he worked his way around the French lines of communication and quickly forced them to withdraw.[5] Already embroiled in conflict with Mahmadu Lamine and the Toucouleur Empire, the French were compelled to negotiate the Treaty of Kenieba Koura, signed on March 28, 1886. This pact recognized French hegemony over the left bank of the Niger as far upstream as Siguiri, and Samory's control of Bure and the Manding region.[2]: 80–1  As part of the agreement, Samory's eldest son and heir Djaoulen-Karamo was sent on a diplomatic/fact finding/goodwill mission to France.[6][4]

targets.targetText: Lokacin da wani balaguron faransa a shekara ta 1885 a ƙarƙashin Col. AVA Combes yayi ƙoƙarin kwace filayen gwal na Buré ta hanyar kama Niagassola, Toure ya kai hari. Ya raba sojojinsa zuwa ginshiƙan wayar hannu guda uku, ya yi aiki da hanyarsa ta hanyar sadarwa ta Faransa kuma cikin sauri ya tilasta musu janyewa. [1] Tuni aka yi rikici da Mahmadu Lamine da Daular Toucouleur, Faransawa sun tilastawa yin shawarwari kan yarjejeniyar Kenieba Koura, da aka sanya hannu a ranar 28 ga watan Maris, 1886. Wannan yarjejeniya ta amince da mulkin Faransa a kan bankin hagu na Nijar har zuwa Siguiri, da ikon Samory na Bure da yankin Manding. [2] : 80-1 A matsayin wani ɓangare na yarjejeniyar, an aika da babban ɗan Samory kuma magaji Djaoulen-Karamo zuwa aikin diflomasiya/gano gaskiya/fatan alheri zuwa Faransa. [3] [4]

Ya raba sojojinsa zuwa ginshiƙan wayar hannu guda uku, ya yi aiki da hanyarsa ta hanyar sadarwa ta Faransa kuma cikin sauri ya tilasta musu janyewa. [1] Tuni aka yi rikici da Mahmadu Lamine da Daular Toucouleur, Faransawa sun tilastawa yin shawarwari kan yarjejeniyar Kenieba Koura, da aka sanya hannu a ranar 28 ga Maris, 1886. Wannan yarjejeniya ta amince da mulkin Faransa a kan bankin hagu na Nijar har zuwa Siguiri, da ikon Samory na Bure da yankin Manding . [2] : 80-1 A matsayin wani ɓangare na yarjejeniyar, an aika da babban ɗan Samory kuma magaji Djaoulen-Karamo zuwa aikin diflomasiya/ gano gaskiya/ fatan alheri zuwa Faransa. [3] [4]

items.sourceText: Among the leaders of the massacre was caïd Bel Hajj [al-Smaali], from the Smaala tribe and an influential caïd.[12] Also leading was chief Bendaoud ben al-Ghazwani al-Smiri from the Bani Smir, who led part of the massacre and killed five French citizens, fighting to the end and refusing to surrender.[13]

targets.targetText: Daga cikin jagororin kisan kiyashin har da caïd Bel Hajj [al-Smaali], dan kabilar Smaala kuma mai fada a ji . [1] Haka nan kuma babban hafsan sojin kasar Bendaoud ben al-Ghazwani al-Smiri na kungiyar Bani Smir, wanda ya jagoranci wani bangare na kisan gilla tare da kashe wasu Faransawa biyar, inda ya yi ta gwabzawa har zuwa karshe ya ki mika wuya. [2]

Daga cikin jagororin kisan kiyashin har da caïd Bel Hajj [al-Smaali], ɗan ƙabilar Smaala kuma mai fada a ji. [1] Haka nan kuma babban hafsan sojin ƙasar Bendaoud ben al-Ghazwani al-Smiri na kungiyar Bani Smir, wanda ya jagoranci wani ɓangare na kisan gilla tare da kashe wasu Faransawa biyar, inda ya yi ta gwabzawa har zuwa ƙarshe ya ki miƙa wuya. [2]

items.sourceText: On August 30, 1955, a large portion of the massacre participants surrendered and requested aman (a traditional act of clemency), offering their submission in exchange for peace. Their plea was accepted, and they sacrificed 12 young cattle.[14]

targets.targetText: A ranar 30 ga Agusta, 1955, babban ɓangare na mahalarta kisan kiyashin sun mika wuya kuma suka nemi aman (aikin jin kai na al'ada), suna ba da biyayyarsu don musanya zaman lafiya. An karɓi roƙonsu, kuma suka yi hadaya da shanu 12. [1]

A ranar 30 ga watan Agusta, 1955, babban ɓangare na mahalarta kisan kiyashin sun miƙa wuya kuma suka nemi aman (aikin jin kai na al'ada), suna ba da biyayyarsu don musanya zaman lafiya. An karɓi roƙonsu, kuma suka yi hadaya da shanu 12. [1]

items.sourceText: On August 20, 2023, for the 68th anniversary of the events, a group of 2,000 descendants of martyrs sent a letter regarding the crimes of August 19, 1955 to the President of the French Republic, Emmanuel Macron, but it went unanswered.[15]

targets.targetText: A ranar 20 ga Agusta, 2023, don cika shekaru 68 na abubuwan da suka faru, gungun zuriyar shahidai 2,000 sun aika da wasika game da laifukan da suka faru a ranar 19 ga Agusta, 1955 zuwa ga shugaban Jamhuriyar Faransa Emmanuel Macron, amma abin ya ci tura. [1]

A ranar 20 ga watan Agusta, 2023, don cika shekaru 68 na abubuwan da suka faru, gungun zuriyar shahidai 2,000 sun aika da wasika game da laifukan da suka faru a ranar 19 ga watan Agusta, 1955 zuwa ga shugaban Jamhuriyar Faransa Emmanuel Macron, amma abin ya ci tura. [1]

items.sourceText: Mekatilili was arrested by the colonial authorities on 17 October 1913, and exiled to Kisii in Nyanza Province. According to colonial records, five years later, she returned to her native area where she continued to oppose the imposition of colonial policies and ordinances. Mekatilili stated that Arthur Champion was solely responsible for forcing colonial policies on Giriama, which she claimed was eroding the traditional culture of Kenya.[1] However, some narratives say that Mekatilili escaped from the prison in Kisii and walked over 1,000 kilometers back home to Giriama. She was later arrested and sent to a prison in Kismayu, Somalia where she also mysteriously escaped and returned to her home.[1]

targets.targetText: Hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun kama Mekatilili a ranar 17 ga Oktoban 1913, kuma sun yi gudun hijira zuwa Kisii a Lardin Nyanza . Kamar yadda bayanan mulkin mallaka suka nuna, bayan shekaru biyar, ta koma yankinta na haihuwa inda ta ci gaba da adawa da sanya manufofin mulkin mallaka da farillai. Mekatilili ta bayyana cewa Arthur Champion ne kawai ke da alhakin tilasta manufofin mulkin mallaka a kan Giriama, wanda ta ce yana lalata al'adun gargajiya na Kenya. [1] Duk da haka, wasu labaran sun ce Mekatilili ya tsere daga kurkukun Kisii kuma ya yi tafiya mai nisan kilomita 1,000 zuwa gida zuwa Giriama. Daga baya aka kama ta aka kai ta gidan yari a birnin Kismayu na kasar Somaliya inda ita ma ta gudu a asirce ta koma gidanta. [1]

Hukumomin 'yan mulkin mallaka sun kama Mekatilili a ranar 17 ga watan Oktoban 1913, kuma sun yi gudun hijira zuwa Kisii a Lardin Nyanza. Kamar yadda bayanan mulkin mallaka suka nuna, bayan shekaru biyar, ta koma yankinta na haihuwa inda ta ci gaba da adawa da sanya manufofin 'yan mulkin mallaka da farillai. Mekatilili ta bayyana cewa Arthur Champion ne kawai ke da alhakin tilasta manufofin mulkin mallaka a kan Giriama, wanda ta ce yana lalata al'adun gargajiya na Kenya. [1] Duk da haka, wasu labaran sun ce Mekatilili ya tsere daga kurkukun Kisii kuma ya yi tafiya mai nisan kilomita 1,000 zuwa gida zuwa Giriama. Daga baya aka kama ta aka kai ta gidan yari a birnin Kismayu na ƙasar Somaliya inda ita ma ta gudu a asirce ta koma gidanta. [1]

items.sourceText: The Akure Kingdom, with its origins linked to the revered figure of Oduduwa, was established by Omoremilekun, a prince from Ile-Ife and a skilled elephant hunter. His journey led to the unification of various autonomous communities in the region, culminating in his crowning as the first Ajapada of Akure. The kingdom's early history was marked by resistance to centralised rule, similar to the early Ife kingdom, but Omoremilekun's leadership brought stability and unity, establishing a royal dynasty that would last for centuries.[2][3]

targets.targetText: Masarautar Akure, wacce asalinta ke da nasaba da babban mutum Oduduwa, Omoremilekun, wani basarake daga Ile-Ife kuma kwararre na farautar giwa ne ya kafa shi. Tafiyar tasa ta kai ga hada kan al’ummomin yankin masu cin gashin kansu daban-daban, har ya kai ga nadin sarautar shi na Ajapadan Akure na farko. Tarihin farko na masarautan ya kasance da tsayin daka ga tsarin mulki na tsakiya, kwatankwacin daular Ife ta farko, amma shugabancin Omoremilekun ya kawo kwanciyar hankali da hadin kai, ya kafa daular sarauta wacce za ta dau shekaru aru-aru.

Masarautar Akure, wacce asalinta ke da nasaba da babban mutum Oduduwa, Omoremilekun, wani basarake daga Ile-Ife kuma kwararre na farautar giwa ne ya kafa shi. Tafiyar tasa ta kai ga hada kan al’ummomin yankin masu cin gashin kansu daban-daban, har ya kai ga nadin sarautar shi na Ajapadan Akure na farko. Tarihin farko na masarautan ya kasance da tsayin daka ga tsarin mulki na tsakiya, kwatankwacin daular Ife ta farko, amma shugabancin Omoremilekun ya kawo kwanciyar hankali da hadin kai, ya kafa daular sarauta wacce za ta dau shekaru aru-aru. [ 2 ] [ 3 ]

items.sourceText: The revolt broke out in the evening of 23 January 1915 when rebels, incited by Chilembwe, attacked the headquarters of the A. L. Bruce Estates at Magomero and killed three white settlers. A largely unsuccessful attack on a weapons store in Blantyre followed during the night. By the morning of 24 January, the colonial authorities had mobilised the Nyasaland Volunteer Reserve (NVR) and called in regular troops from the King's African Rifles (KAR). After a failed attack by KAR troops on Mbombwe on 25 January, the rebels attacked a Christian mission at Nguludi and burned it down. The KAR and NVR captured Mbombwe without encountering any resistance on 26 January. Many of the rebels, including Chilembwe himself, fled towards Portuguese Mozambique, hoping to reach safety there, but many were captured. About 40 rebels were executed in the revolt's aftermath, and 300 were imprisoned; Chilembwe was shot dead by a police patrol near the border on 3 February.

targets.targetText: Tawayen dai ya ɓarke ne da yammacin ranar 23 ga watan Janairun 1915, lokacin da 'yan tawayen Chilembwe suka tunzura su, suka kai hari a hedikwatar AL Bruce Estates a Mahomero suka kashe fararen fata uku. Wani harin da bai yi nasara ba a wani kantin sayar da makamai a Blantyre ya biyo bayan dare. Da safiyar ranar 24 ga watan Janairu, hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun tattara rijiyoyin sa kai na Nyasaland (NVR) tare da kiran dakaru na yau da kullun daga King's African Rifles (KAR). Bayan wani harin da sojojin KAR suka kai kan Mbombwe a ranar 25 ga watan Janairu, 'yan tawayen sun kai hari kan wata tawagar Kiristoci a Nguludi tare da kona shi. KAR da NVR sun kama Mbombwe ba tare da fuskantar wata turjiya ba a ranar 26 ga watan Janairu. Yawancin 'yan tawayen, ciki har da Chilembwe da kansa, sun gudu zuwa Mozambique na Portugal, suna fatan samun tsira a can, amma an kama da yawa. An kashe kusan ’yan tawaye 40 a sakamakon tawayen, kuma an daure 300 a kurkuku; 'Yan sanda da ke sintiri sun harbe Chilembwe a kusa da kan iyaka a ranar 3 ga watan Fabrairu.

Tawayen dai ya barke ne da yammacin ranar 23 ga watan Janairun 1915, lokacin da 'yan tawayen Chilembwe suka tunzura su, suka kai hari a hedikwatar AL Bruce Estates a Mahomero suka kashe fararen fata uku. Wani harin da bai yi nasara ba a wani kantin sayar da makamai a Blantyre ya biyo bayan dare. Da safiyar ranar 24 ga watan Janairu, hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun tattara rijiyoyin sa kai na Nyasaland (NVR) tare da kiran dakaru na yau da kullun daga King's African Rifles (KAR). Bayan wani harin da sojojin KAR suka kai kan Mbombwe a ranar 25 ga watan Janairu, 'yan tawayen sun kai hari kan wata tawagar Kiristoci a Nguludi tare da kona shi. KAR da NVR sun kama Mbombwe ba tare da fuskantar wata turjiya ba a ranar 26 ga Janairu. Yawancin 'yan tawayen, ciki har da Chilembwe da kansa, sun gudu zuwa Mozambique na Portugal, suna fatan samun tsira a can, amma an kama da yawa. An kashe kusan ’yan tawaye 40 a sakamakon tawayen, kuma an daure 300 a kurkuku; 'Yan sanda da ke sintiri sun harbe Chilembwe a kusa da kan iyaka a ranar 3 ga Fabrairu.

items.sourceText: Although the rebellion did not itself achieve success, it is commonly cited as a watershed moment in Malawian history. The rebellion had lasting effects on the British system of administration in Nyasaland, and some reforms were enacted in its aftermath. After World War II, the growing Malawian nationalist movement reignited interest in the Chilembwe revolt, and after the independence of Malawi in 1964 it became celebrated as a key moment in the nation's history. Chilembwe's memory, which remains prominent in the collective national consciousness, has often been invoked in symbolism and rhetoric by Malawian politicians. Today, the uprising is celebrated annually and Chilembwe himself is considered a national hero.

targets.targetText: Ko da yake tawayen bai samu nasara da kansa ba, ana yawan ambatonsa a matsayin lokacin ruwan sha a tarihin Malawi . Tawayen ya yi tasiri mai dorewa a tsarin mulkin Birtaniya a Nyasaland, kuma an aiwatar da wasu gyare-gyare a bayansa. Bayan Yaƙin Duniya na Biyu, ƙungiyar masu kishin ƙasa ta Malawi mai girma ta sami sha'awar tawayen Chilembwe, kuma bayan samun 'yancin kai na Malawi a 1964 an yi bikin a matsayin muhimmin lokaci a tarihin ƙasar. Tunawa da Chilembwe, wanda ya kasance sananne a cikin fahimtar al'umma ta gama gari, yawancin 'yan siyasar Malawi sun yi amfani da su cikin alama da maganganu. A yau, ana gudanar da zanga-zangar a kowace shekara kuma Chilembwe da kansa ana daukarsa a matsayin gwarzo na kasa.

Ko da yake tawayen bai samu nasara da kansa ba, ana yawan ambatonsa a matsayin lokacin ruwan sha a tarihin Malawi. Tawayen ya yi tasiri mai ɗorewa a tsarin mulkin Birtaniya a Nyasaland, kuma an aiwatar da wasu gyare-gyare a bayansa. Bayan Yaƙin Duniya na Biyu, ƙungiyar masu kishin ƙasa ta Malawi mai girma ta sami sha'awar tawayen Chilembwe, kuma bayan samun 'yancin kai na Malawi a shekarar 1964 an yi bikin a matsayin muhimmin lokaci a tarihin ƙasar. Tunawa da Chilembwe, wanda ya kasance sananne a cikin fahimtar al'umma ta gama gari, yawancin 'yan siyasar Malawi sun yi amfani da su cikin alama da maganganu. A yau, ana gudanar da zanga-zangar a kowace shekara kuma Chilembwe da kansa ana ɗaukarsa a matsayin gwarzo na ƙasa.

items.sourceText: In 1861, Porto-Novo was attacked by British anti-slaving ships.[2] Porto-Novo asked for and received French protection in 1863, but this was rejected by Dahomey.[2] Another issue of contention was the status of Cotonou, a port the French believed was under their control because of a treaty signed by Dahomey's representative in Whydah. Dahomey ignored all French claims there as well and continued to collect customs from the port.[2]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1861, jiragen ruwa na Burtaniya sun kai farmaki Porto-Novo. [ 2 ] Porto-Novo ta nemi kuma ta sami kariyar Faransa a shekarar 1863, amma Dahomey ya ƙi wannan. [ 2 ] Wani batu na takaddama shi ne matsayin Cotonou, tashar jiragen ruwa da Faransawa suka yi imanin cewa tana ƙarƙashin ikonsu saboda yarjejeniyar da wakilin Dahomey a Whydah ya sanya wa hannu . Dahomey ya yi watsi da duk ikirarin Faransa a can kuma ya ci gaba da karɓar kwastan daga tashar jiragen ruwa. [ 2 ]

A cikin 1861, jiragen ruwa na Burtaniya sun kai farmaki Porto-Novo. [ 2 ] Porto-Novo ta nemi kuma ta sami kariyar Faransa a 1863, amma Dahomey ya ƙi wannan. [ 2 ] Wani batu na takaddama shi ne matsayin Cotonou, tashar jiragen ruwa da Faransawa suka yi imanin cewa tana ƙarƙashin ikonsu saboda yarjejeniyar da wakilin Dahomey a Whydah ya sanya wa hannu . Dahomey ya yi watsi da duk ikirarin Faransa a can kuma ya ci gaba da karbar kwastan daga tashar jiragen ruwa. [ 2 ]

items.sourceText: In 1874, King Toffa I took power in Porto-Novo and re-established French protection over the kingdom after Dahomey attacked it in 1882.[2] Dahomey continued raiding the town, which culminated in an incident that brought the Fon and French into war. In March 1889, Dahomey attacked a village on the Ouémé where the chief was under the protection of the French.[3] After remarking that the flag of the tricolour would protect him, the Fon commanded one of his Dahomey Amazons to behead him and wrap his head in the flag.[3] Then in March of that year, France sent a mission to Dahomey's capital of Abomey to assert its claims to Cotonou and offer an annual payment.[2] The crown prince and later king Béhanzin received the mission but nothing was achieved other than mutual distrust.[2]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1874, Sarki Toffa na farko ya karbi mulki a Porto-Novo kuma ya sake kafa kariyar Faransa a kan masarautar bayan Dahomey ya kai hari a 1882. [ 2 ]. Dahomey ya ci gaba da kai hari a garin, wanda ya kai ga wani lamari da ya kawo Fon da Faransa cikin yaki. A cikin Maris 1889, Dahomey ya kai hari a wani ƙauye a Ouémé inda babban sarki ke ƙarƙashin kariyar Faransa. [ 3 ] Bayan da ya yi furuci cewa tutar mai tricolor za ta kare shi, Fon ya umarci daya daga cikin Dahomey Amazons da ya fille kansa ya nade kansa a cikin tuta. [ 3 ] Sai kuma a watan Maris na waccan shekarar, Faransa ta aika da wata manufa zuwa babban birnin Dahomey na Abomey domin tabbatar da ikirarinta ga Cotonou da bayar da biyan kuɗi na shekara-shekara. [ 2 ] Yarima mai jiran gado kuma daga baya sarki Béhanzin ya sami aikin amma babu abin da aka cimma face rashin yarda da juna. [ 2 ]

A cikin shekarar 1874, Sarki Toffa na farko ya karɓi mulki a Porto-Novo kuma ya sake kafa kariyar Faransa a kan masarautar bayan Dahomey ya kai hari a shekarar 1882. [ 2 ]. Dahomey ya ci gaba da kai hari a garin, wanda ya kai ga wani lamari da ya kawo Fon da Faransa cikin yaki. A cikin watan Maris 1889, Dahomey ya kai hari a wani ƙauye a Ouémé inda babban sarki ke ƙarƙashin kariyar Faransa. [ 3 ] Bayan da ya yi furuci cewa tutar mai tricolor za ta kare shi, Fon ya umarci ɗaya daga cikin Dahomey Amazons da ya fille kansa ya naɗe kansa a cikin tuta. [ 3 ] Sai kuma a watan Maris na waccan shekarar, Faransa ta aika da wata manufa zuwa babban birnin Dahomey na Abomey domin tabbatar da ikirarinta ga Cotonou da bayar da biyan kuɗi na shekara-shekara. [ 2 ] Yarima mai jiran gado kuma daga baya sarki Béhanzin ya sami aikin amma babu abin da aka cimma face rashin yarda da juna. [ 2 ]

items.sourceText: On 4 March, a Dahomey army of several thousand charged the log stockade around Cotonou at approximately 5 in the morning.[4] This was usual for the Fon army of Dahomey that almost always marched at night and attacked just before dawn.[5] Prying apart the stakes and shoving their muskets through, the Fon fired into the enclosure.[4]

targets.targetText: A ranar 4 ga watan Maris, sojojin Dahomey dubu da dama sun caccaki tarin katako a kusa da Cotonou da misalin karfe 5 na safe. [ 4 ] Wannan ya saba wa sojojin Fon na Dahomey waɗanda kusan ko da yaushe suna tafiya da daddare suna kai hari kafin wayewar gari. [ 5 ] Suna raba kan gungumen azaba tare da korar musket ɗin su, Fon ya harba cikin shingen. [ 4 ]

A ranar 4 ga Maris, sojojin Dahomey dubu da dama sun caccaki tarin katako a kusa da Cotonou da misalin karfe 5 na safe. [ 4 ] Wannan ya saba wa sojojin Fon na Dahomey waɗanda kusan ko da yaushe suna tafiya da daddare suna kai hari kafin wayewar gari. [ 5 ] Suna raba kan gungumen azaba tare da korar musket ɗin su, Fon ya harba cikin shingen. [ 4 ]

items.sourceText: Dahomey did not launch any further attacks on Cotonou or Porto-Novo. On 3 October 1890, Dahomey signed a treaty recognising the kingdom of Porto-Novo as a French protectorate.[12] Béhanzin was also forced to cede Cotonou, but did receive 20,000 francs a year for giving up his customs rights.[12] The war resulted in victory for France and left Dahomey defeated. Despite the treaty, both sides believed peace could not last and made preparations for another decisive encounter.[13] Hostilities quickly resumed despite the treaty, escalating into the Second Franco-Dahomean War two years later.

targets.targetText: Dahomey bai sake kai wani hari a Cotonou ko Porto-Novo ba. A ranar 3 ga Oktoba 1890, Dahomey ya rattaba hannu kan wata yerjejeniya ta amince da mulkin Porto-Novo a matsayin kariyar Faransa. [ 12 ] An kuma tilasta wa Béhanzin ya ba da Cotonou, amma yana karbar francs 20,000 a shekara saboda ya yi watsi da hakkinsa na kwastam. [ 12 ] Yakin ya haifar da nasara ga Faransa kuma ya bar Dahomey ya sha kashi. Duk da yarjejeniyar, bangarorin biyu sun yi amanna cewa zaman lafiya ba zai dore ba, kuma sun yi shiri don sake haduwa da juna. [ 13 ] Haƙiƙa ya sake komawa cikin sauri duk da yarjejeniyar, wanda ya ƙaru zuwa Yaƙin Franco-Dahomean na biyu bayan shekaru biyu.
