[ 12 ] Yakin ya haifar da nasara ga Faransa kuma ya bar Dahomey ya sha kashi. Duk da yarjejeniyar, ɓangarorin biyu sun yi amanna cewa zaman lafiya ba zai dore ba, kuma sun yi shiri don sake haɗuwa da juna. [ 13 ] Haƙiƙa ya sake komawa cikin sauri duk da yarjejeniyar, wanda ya ƙaru zuwa Yaƙin Franco-Dahomean na biyu bayan shekaru biyu.

items.sourceText: Chief S. A. Ajayi // ⓘ OFR (2 December 1910 – 11 May 1994) was a Nigerian statesman who played an active role in the negotiations that led to Nigeria's independence. He was a pioneer politician of Okun land in the old Kabba province (in the present day Kogi State), who represented the people of Kabba Division in the Northern region house of Assembly. Chief Ajayi was passionate about educating his people therefore, He played a key role in the establishment of Kabba College of Agriculture, Division of Agricultural Colleges, The University of Northern Nigeria (now Ahmadu Bello University), the firm establishment of Kabba Teachers College now Federal Government Girls College Kabba but for the historic efforts of Chief Ajayi, the Northern Region Government had slated Kabba Teachers college for relocation to Kano, Chief Ajayi fought relentlessly to retain this citadel in Kabba division. The creation of Ijumu Division as an administrative headquarters (now, Ijumu, Local Government Area, Kogi State). was a burning desire for chief Ajayi, a move he started from 1960, unable to achieve this while in Government due to the unfortunate coup of 1966, Chief Ajayi pursued this vision with equally passionate illustrious sons of Ijumu until the Local Government was created. [1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Shugaban S. A. Ajayi // ⓘ OFR (2 Disamba 1910 – 11 ga Mayu 1994) ɗan Najeriya ne wanda ya taka rawar gani a tattaunawar da ta kai ga samun ‘yancin kai. Ya kasance ɗan siyasa na farko a yankin Okun a tsohuwar lardin Kabba (a halin yanzu jihar Kogi), wanda ya wakilci jama'ar yankin Kabba a majalisar dokokin yankin Arewa. Cif Ajayi ya kasance mai kishin tarbiyyar al’ummarsa saboda haka, ya taka rawar gani wajen kafa Kwalejin Koyon Aikin Gona ta Kabba, Division of Agricultural Colleges, Jami’ar Arewacin Najeriya (Jami’ar Ahmadu Bello a yanzu), da kafuwar Kwalejin Malamai ta Kabba yanzu Kwalejin ’Yan Mata ta Gwamnatin Tarayya ta Kabba amma saboda kokarin da Cif Ajayi ya yi na tarihi, Gwamnatin Jihar Arewa ta yi wa makarantar Kabba Malaman Kano baya, ta yi yaki da wannan makaranta ta Kano. Kabba division. Ƙirƙirar sashen Ijumu a matsayin hedkwatar gudanarwa (yanzu, Ijumu, ƙaramar hukumar, jihar Kogi ). Ya kasance mai tsananin sha'awar sarki Ajayi, matakin da ya fara tun daga 1960, ya kasa cimma hakan a lokacin da yake cikin Gwamnati saboda rashin tausayin juyin mulkin da aka yi a shekarar 1966, Cif Ajayi ya bi wannan hangen nesa tare da 'ya'yan Ijumu masu kishi har zuwa lokacin da aka kafa ƙaramar hukuma. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: He died on 11 May 1994 in Kabba, Kogi State and was buried in St John's Anglican Church, Ogidi, Ijumu, Kogi State, a church he built.[1]

targets.targetText: Ya rasu ne a ranar 11 ga watan Mayun 1994 a Kabba, jihar Kogi kuma an binne shi a cocin St John's Anglican Church, Ogidi, Ijumu, jihar Kogi, cocin da ya gina. [1]

items.sourceText: The treaty made it illegal for any subject of the empire of Brazil to be engaged in carrying out the African slave trade. It provided a three-year grace period after the exchange of ratifications, which meant that the ban took effect on 13 March 1830.[1]

targets.targetText: Yarjejeniyar ta haramtawa duk wani batu na daular Brazil shiga harkokin cinikin bayi na Afirka. Ya ba da lokacin alheri na shekaru uku bayan musayar ra'ayi, wanda ke nufin cewa haramcin ya fara aiki a ranar 13 ga Maris 1830. [1]

items.sourceText: The German Federal Republic (West Germany) was relaunched in May 1949 through a coming together of three of the four military occupation zones into which the country had been divided after the war. Allied armies remained in the country, however, though by now the principal perceived risk came from the fraternal forces across the new "Iron Curtain", occupying what had been identified till October 1949 as the Soviet occupation zone. Morain undertook his military service between April 1950 and October 1951 with an Engineering Regiment based in Trier, close to the West German frontier with Luxembourg. The regiment had a "troubled" reputation with the political establishment, having had its "colours" withdrawn following a refusal to carry out orders to put down strikes during 1947/48. Military service exposed Morain to libertarian and anti-militarist ideas. Released from the military late in 1951, he returned to building work in the Paris suburbs. He also volunteered intermittently as an adult mentor at the "Cité de l'Esperance" (loosely "City of hopefulness"), a refuge for "difficult or delinquent young people" at Conflans-Sainte-Honorine.[1]

targets.targetText: An sake kafa Jamhuriyar Tarayyar Jamus (Jamus ta Yamma) a cikin watan Mayun 1949 ta hanyar haɗuwa uku daga cikin yankuna huɗu na mamayar da aka raba ƙasar bayan yakin. Sojojin kawance sun kasance a ƙasar, duk da haka, ko da yake a yanzu babban hadarin ya fito ne daga rundunonin 'yan uwantaka a cikin sabon "Iron Curtain", suna mamaye abin da aka gano har zuwa watan Oktoba 1949 a matsayin yankin mamayar Soviet. Morain ya gudanar da aikin soja tsakanin watan Afrilu 1950 da Oktoba 1951 tare da Injiniya Regiment da ke Trier, kusa da iyakar Jamus ta Yamma tare da Luxembourg. Rundunar tana da "masu damuwa" suna tare da tsarin siyasa, saboda an cire "launuka" bayan kin aiwatar da umarnin dakatar da yajin aiki a lokacin 1947/48. Sabis na soja ya fallasa Morain ga ra'ayoyin 'yanci da masu adawa da soja. An sake shi daga aikin soja a ƙarshen 1951, ya koma aikin gine-gine a unguwannin Paris. Ya kuma ba da kansa kai tsaye a matsayin babban mai ba da shawara a "Cité de l'Esperance" ( wato "Birnin bege" ), mafaka ga "masu wahala ko matasa masu zalunci" a Conflans-Sainte-Honorine. [1]

An sake kafa Jamhuriyar Tarayyar Jamus (Jamus ta Yamma) a cikin watan Mayun 1949 ta hanyar haduwa uku daga cikin yankuna hudu na mamayar da aka raba kasar bayan yakin . Sojojin kawance sun kasance a kasar, duk da haka, ko da yake a yanzu babban hadarin ya fito ne daga rundunonin 'yan uwantaka a cikin sabon " Labulen Karfe ", suna mamaye abin da aka gano har zuwa Oktoba 1949 a matsayin yankin mamayar Soviet . Sabis na soja ya fallasa Morain ga ra'ayoyin 'yanci da masu adawa da soja. An sake shi daga aikin soja a ƙarshen 1951, ya koma aikin gine-gine a unguwannin Paris. Ya kuma ba da kansa kai tsaye a matsayin babban mai ba da shawara a "Cité de l'Esperance" ( wato "Birnin bege" ), mafaka ga "masu wahala ko matasa masu zalunci" a Conflans-Sainte-Honorine . [1]

items.sourceText: The "Building Workers' Union" (SUB) was part of the National Labour Confederation ("Confédération nationale du travail" / CNT), a left-wing organisation which at the time would have seen itself as part of the Anarcho-syndicalist movement. Membership of the SUB evidently meant that Morain was also a member of the CNT in or before 1953, which was the year in which he became Paris Region Secretary of the SUB.[1] He contributed to the journal "Combat Syndicaliste" and at the CNT's second Paris regional congress, held on 29 November 1953, he was elected to membership of the CNT's administrative commission. According to some sources it was also at around this time that he became a member of the Anarchist Federation,[2] but this is strenuously disputed.[3] He would, in any event, join its successor organisation in 1954.[3]

targets.targetText: "Kungiyar Ma'aikatan Gine-gine" (SUB) ta kasance wani ɓangare na Ƙungiyar Ma'aikata ta Ƙasa ("Confédération nationale du travail" / CNT), ƙungiyar hagu wacce a lokacin za ta ga kanta a matsayin wani ɓangare na ƙungiyar Anarcho-syndicalist. Kasancewa memba na SUB a bayyane yake yana nufin cewa Morain ya kasance memba na CNT a cikin ko kafin shekarar 1953, wanda shine shekarar da ya zama Sakataren Yankin Paris na SUB. [1] Ya ba da gudummawa ga mujallar "Combat Syndicaliste" kuma a taron yanki na biyu na CNT na Paris, wanda aka gudanar a ranar 29 ga watan Nuwamba 1953, an zaɓe shi memba na hukumar gudanarwa ta CNT. A cewar wasu kafofin kuma a wannan lokacin ne ya zama memba na Anarchist Federation, amma wannan ana jayayya sosai.[2][3] Zai, a kowane lokaci, ya shiga kungiyar da ta maye gurbinsa a shekara ta 1954.[3]

"Kungiyar Ma'aikatan Gine-gine" (SUB) ta kasance wani ɓangare na Ƙungiyar Ma'aikata ta Kasa ("Confédération nationale du travail" / CNT), ƙungiyar hagu wacce a lokacin za ta ga kanta a matsayin wani ɓangare na ƙungiyar Anarcho-syndicalist. Kasancewa memba na SUB a bayyane yake yana nufin cewa Morain ya kasance memba na CNT a cikin ko kafin 1953, wanda shine shekarar da ya zama Sakataren Yankin Paris na SUB . [1] Ya ba da gudummawa ga mujallar "Combat Syndicaliste" kuma a taron yanki na biyu na CNT na Paris, wanda aka gudanar a ranar 29 ga Nuwamba 1953, an zabe shi memba na hukumar gudanarwa ta CNT. A cewar wasu kafofin kuma a wannan lokacin ne ya zama memba na Anarchist Federation, amma wannan ana jayayya sosai.[2][3] Zai, a kowane lokaci, ya shiga kungiyar da ta maye gurbinsa a shekara ta 1954.[3]

items.sourceText: At the end of 1974, the party became known for having Lúcio participate in diplomatic negotiations on Angola's independence, taking part in the historic first delegation of the MPLA that was officially received in Luanda. He served in these positions until Angola's independence in 1975.[1] On Angola's independence day, with Henrique Onambwé, Joaquina, and Cici Cabral, Ruth helped to create the Angolan flag.[4]

targets.targetText: A karshen shekara ta 1974, jam'iyyar ta zama sananne ga samun Lúcio ya shiga shawarwarin diflomasiyya kan 'yancin kai na Angola, yana shiga cikin tawagar farko ta MPLA mai tarihi wacce aka karbe ta a hukumance a Luanda. Ya yi aiki a wadannan mukamai har zuwa lokacin da Angola ta samu ‘yancin kai a shekarar 1975. [1] A ranar 'yancin kai na Angola, tare da Henrique Onambwé, Joaquina, da Cici Cabral, Ruth ta taimaka wajen ƙirƙirar tutar Angola . [2]

A ƙarshen shekara ta 1974, jam'iyyar ta zama sananniya ga samun Lúcio ya shiga shawarwarin diflomasiyya kan 'yancin kai na Angola, yana shiga cikin tawagar farko ta MPLA mai tarihi wacce aka karɓe ta a hukumance a Luanda. Ya yi aiki a waɗannan mukamai har zuwa lokacin da Angola ta samu ‘yancin kai a shekarar 1975. [1] A ranar 'yancin kai na Angola, tare da Henrique Onambwé, Joaquina, da Cici Cabral, Ruth ta taimaka wajen ƙirƙirar tutar Angola. [2]

items.sourceText: Lara was born to German parents Lotte and Hermann Pflüger in Lisbon on 17 September 1936. Her parents were persecuted by Nazi Germany and had taken refuge in Lisbon, due to Lotte being Jewish and Hermann being a Communist militant. Her parents continued to be active in leftist activism while in Portugal, which influenced their children's political beliefs.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Lara ga iyayen Jamus Lotte da Hermann Pflüger a Lisbon a ranar 17 ga watan Satumba 1936. Jamus Nazi ta tsananta wa iyayenta kuma sun sami mafaka a Lisbon, saboda kasancewar Lotte Bayahude da Hermann kasancewarsa ɗan kwaminisanci. Iyayenta sun ci gaba da kasancewa masu fafutuka a cikin fafutuka na hagu yayin da suke Portugal, wanda ya rinjayi imanin 'ya'yansu na siyasa. [1]

An haifi Lara ga iyayen Jamus Lotte da Hermann Pflüger a Lisbon a ranar 17 ga Satumba 1936. Jamus Nazi ta tsananta wa iyayenta kuma sun sami mafaka a Lisbon, saboda kasancewar Lotte Bayahude da Hermann kasancewarsa ɗan kwaminisanci. Iyayenta sun ci gaba da kasancewa masu fafutuka a cikin fafutuka na hagu yayin da suke Portugal, wanda ya rinjayi imanin 'ya'yansu na siyasa. [1]

items.sourceText: Beginning in 1953, Ruth began dating Lúcio, marrying him in July 1955. Their first child, Paulo, was born in Lisbon in 1956. During this period, she began her studies in mathematics. The couple became godparents during the marriage of Agostinho Neto and Maria Eugénia Neto when they married in 1958.[1][3]

targets.targetText: Da farko a shekara ta 1953, Ruth ta fara soyayya da Lúcio, ta aure shi a watan Yuli 1955. Sun haifi ɗansu na farko, Paulo a Lisbon a shekara ta 1956. A wannan lokacin ta fara karatun ta a fannin lissafi. Ma'auratan sun zama iyayengiji a lokacin auren Agostinho Neto da Maria Eugénia Neto lokacin da suka yi aure a shekarar 1958. [1] [2]

Da farko a shekara ta 1953, Ruth ta fara soyayya da Lúcio, ta aure shi a watan Yuli 1955. An haifi ɗansu na farko, Paulo a Lisbon a shekara ta 1956. A wannan lokacin ta fara karatun ta a fannin lissafi. Ma'auratan sun zama iyayengiji a lokacin auren Agostinho Neto da Maria Eugénia Neto lokacin da suka yi aure a 1958. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: That year, Ruth left for Kinshasa with her husband to establish themselves there, where Lúcio worked at the party's headquarters. They later moved with the entirety of the MPLA to Brazzaville to reestablish the party headquarters. Their third child and last biological child, Bruno Lara, was born there. Ruth went on to work as a math professor at Liceu Mafua-Virgile de Brazavile. In 1960, the Laras adopted three children from Brazzaville: José da Silva Lara, Júnior Cadete Lara, and Jean-Michel Mabeko-Tali Lara. They would also later adopt three Angolan children: José Katuya Lara (who was given the nickname Vantagem Lara), Catarina Lara (Valia Lara), and Paulo Samba Lara.[1]

targets.targetText: A wannan shekarar, Ruth ta tafi Kinshasa tare da mijinta don su kafa kansu a can, inda Lúcio ya yi aiki a hedkwatar jam’iyyar. Daga baya sun koma tare da daukacin MPLA zuwa Brazzaville don sake kafa hedkwatar jam'iyyar. An haifi ɗansu na uku kuma ɗan na ƙarshe na halitta, Bruno Lara, a can. Ruth ta ci gaba da aiki a matsayin farfesa na lissafi a Liceu Mafua-Virgile de Brazavile. A cikin 1960, Laras ya ɗauki yara uku daga Brazzaville: José da Silva Lara, Júnior Cadete Lara, da Jean-Michel Mabeko-Tali Lara. Daga baya kuma za su ɗauki yaran Angola uku: José Katuya Lara (wanda aka ba wa laƙabi Vantagem Lara), Catarina Lara (Valia Lara), da Paulo Samba Lara. [1]

A wannan shekarar, Ruth ta tafi Kinshasa tare da mijinta don su kafa kansu a can, inda Lúcio ya yi aiki a hedkwatar jam’iyyar. Daga baya sun koma tare da ɗaukacin MPLA zuwa Brazzaville don sake kafa hedkwatar jam'iyyar. Sun haifi ɗansu na uku kuma ɗan na ƙarshe na halitta, Bruno Lara, a can. Ruth ta ci gaba da aiki a matsayin farfesa na lissafi a Liceu Mafua-Virgile de Brazavile. A cikin shekarar 1960, Laras ya ɗauki yara uku daga Brazzaville: José da Silva Lara, Júnior Cadete Lara, da Jean-Michel Mabeko-Tali Lara. Daga baya kuma za su ɗauki yaran Angola uku: José Katuya Lara (wanda aka ba wa laƙabi Vantagem Lara), Catarina Lara (Valia Lara), da Paulo Samba Lara. [1]

items.sourceText: Deolinda Rodrigues Francisco de Almeida was born in Catete, Angola, on 10 February 1939.[2] Her parents, Mariana Pedro Neto and Adão Francisco de Almeida, were both schoolteachers. Her father was also a Methodist minister. She had four siblings, including Angolan politician Roberto Francisco de Almeida. In 1954, Rodrigues moved with her mother and siblings to the capital Luanda and lived with her aunt Maria da Silva, in the same house as her son, the poet Agostinho Neto, who went on to become the first president of Angola.[3][4]

targets.targetText: An haifi Deolinda Rodrigues Francisco de Almeida a Catete, Angola, ranar 10 ga watan Fabrairu 1939. [ 2 ] Iyayenta, Mariana Pedro Neto da Adão Francisco de Almeida, dukkansu malaman makaranta ne. Mahaifinta kuma ministan Methodist ne. Ta na da 'yan'uwa huɗu, ciki har da ɗan siyasar Angola Roberto Francisco de Almeida. A shekara ta 1954, Rodrigues ta koma Luanda babban birnin ƙasar tare da mahaifiyarta da 'yan uwanta kuma suka zauna tare da mahaifiyarta Maria da Silva, a gida ɗaya da ɗanta, mawaƙin Agostinho Neto, wanda ya ci gaba da zama shugaban Angola na farko. [ 3 ] [1]

An haifi Deolinda Rodrigues Francisco de Almeida a Catete, Angola, ranar 10 ga Fabrairu 1939. [ 2 ] Iyayenta, Mariana Pedro Neto da Adão Francisco de Almeida, dukkansu malaman makaranta ne. Mahaifinta kuma ministan Methodist ne. Ta na da 'yan'uwa hudu, ciki har da dan siyasar Angola Roberto Francisco de Almeida . A shekara ta 1954, Rodrigues ya koma Luanda babban birnin kasar tare da mahaifiyarta da 'yan uwanta kuma suka zauna tare da mahaifiyarta Maria da Silva, a gida daya da danta, mawaƙin Agostinho Neto, wanda ya ci gaba da zama shugaban Angola na farko. [ 3 ] [1]

items.sourceText: In the subsequent period, Koma confronted a leadership conflict with a younger faction within the party, led by Michael Dingake, who attempted to unseat him in the late 1990s. Although their efforts failed, the resulting splinter party, known as the Botswana Congress Party, dealt a severe blow to the BNF during the 1999 election. Koma resigned as the BNF's leader after this defeat in mid-2000 and stepped down as the Leader of the Opposition in 2003. He retired from Parliament at the conclusion of his fourth term in 2004.[1]

targets.targetText: A lokacin da ya biyo baya, Koma ya fuskanci rikicin shugabanci da wani karamin bangare na jam’iyyar, karkashin jagorancin Michael Dingake, wanda ya yi yunkurin tsige shi a karshen shekarun 1990. Ko da yake yunƙurin nasu bai yi nasara ba, jam'iyyar da ta balle da aka fi sani da Botswana Congress Party, ta yi wa BNF mummunan rauni a lokacin zaɓen 1999 . Koma ya yi murabus a matsayin shugaban BNF bayan shan kayen da aka yi masa a tsakiyar shekara ta 2000 sannan ya sauka daga shugabancin jam'iyyar a shekara ta 2003. Ya yi ritaya daga majalisar a karshen wa'adinsa na hudu a 2004. [1]

A lokacin da ya biyo baya, Koma ya fuskanci rikicin shugabanci da wani ƙaramin ɓangare na jam’iyyar, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Michael Dingake, wanda ya yi yunkurin tsige shi a ƙarshen shekarun 1990. Ko da yake yunƙurin nasu bai yi nasara ba, jam'iyyar da ta ɓalle da aka fi sani da Botswana Congress Party, ta yi wa BNF mummunan rauni a lokacin zaɓen shekarar 1999. Koma ya yi murabus a matsayin shugaban BNF bayan shan kayen da aka yi masa a tsakiyar shekara ta 2000 sannan ya sauka daga shugabancin jam'iyyar a shekara ta 2003. Ya yi ritaya daga majalisar a karshen wa'adinsa na huɗu a shekarar 2004. [1]

items.sourceText: Sir Seretse Goitsebeng Maphiri Khama, GCB, KBE (1 July 1921 – 13 July 1980) was a Motswana politician who served as the first President of Botswana, a post he held from 1966 to his death in 1980.[2][3][4]

targets.targetText: Sir Seretse Goitsebeng Maphiri Khama, GCB, KBE (1 Yuli 1921) – 13 Yuli 1980) ɗan siyasan Motswana ne wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin shugaban ƙasar Botswana na farko, muƙamin da ya riƙe daga shekarun 1966 zuwa mutuwarsa a shekarar 1980. [1] [2] [3]

Sir Seretse Goitsebeng Maphiri Khama, GCB, KBE (1 Yuli 1921) – 13 Yuli 1980) ɗan siyasan Motswana ne wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin shugaban ƙasar Botswana na farko, mukamin da ya riƙe daga 1966 zuwa mutuwarsa a 1980. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Born into an influential royal family of what was then the British protectorate of Bechuanaland, he was educated abroad in the neighbouring country of South Africa[1] and then in the United Kingdom.[3] While in Britain, he married an Englishwoman named Ruth Williams, a decision opposed by the white-minority government of South Africa and which led to a controversy resulting in the British government making him stay in England in exile so as to not sour U.K.-South African relations.

targets.targetText: An haife shi a cikin gidan sarauta mai tasiri na abin da yake a lokacin mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya na Bechuanaland, ya yi karatu a kasashen waje a makwabciyar kasar Afirka ta Kudu [1] sannan kuma a Birtaniya. [1] A lokacin da yake Biritaniya ya auri wata 'yar kasar Ingila mai suna Ruth Williams, matakin da gwamnatin 'yan tsirarun fararen fata ta Afirka ta Kudu ta yi adawa da shi, lamarin da ya haifar da cece-kuce da ya sa gwamnatin Birtaniya ta sa ya zauna a Ingila yana gudun hijira don kada ya yi tsami tsakanin Birtaniya da Afirka ta Kudu .

An haife shi a cikin gidan sarauta mai tasiri na abin da yake a lokacin 'yan mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya na Bechuanaland, ya yi karatu a ƙasashen waje a makwabciyar ƙasar Afirka ta Kudu [1] sannan kuma a Birtaniya. [1] A lokacin da yake Biritaniya ya auri wata 'yar ƙasar Ingila mai suna Ruth Williams, matakin da gwamnatin 'yan tsirarun fararen fata ta Afirka ta Kudu ta yi adawa da shi, lamarin da ya haifar da cece-kuce da ya sa gwamnatin Birtaniya ta sa ya zauna a Ingila yana gudun hijira don kada dangantakarsu ta yi tsami tsakanin Birtaniya da Afirka ta Kudu.

items.sourceText: He entered the University of Coimbra in 1954 to study for a degree in physical chemistry, abandoning his studies in 1958 without completing them.

targets.targetText: Ya shiga Jami'ar Coimbra a shekarar 1954 don yin karatun digiri a kan ilimin kimiyyar jiki, ya yi watsi da karatunsa a shekarar 1958 ba tare da ya kammala ba.
Ya shiga Jami'ar Coimbra a 1954 don yin karatun digiri a kan ilimin kimiyyar jiki, ya yi watsi da karatunsa a 1958 ba tare da ya kammala ba.

items.sourceText: While participating in political party activities in Lisbon, he met Ruth Pflüger, a young Lisbon-born Portuguese Jew of German ancestry whom he married in 1955.[10]

targets.targetText: Yayin da yake shiga cikin ayyukan jam'iyyun siyasa a Lisbon, ya sadu da Ruth Pflüger, wata matashiya Bayahudiya haifaffen Lisbon haifaffen kasar Jamus wanda ya aura a 1955. [1]
Yayin da yake shiga cikin ayyukan jam'iyyun siyasa a Lisbon, ya haɗu da Ruth Pflüger, wata matashiya Bayahudiya haifaffiyar Lisbon haifaffen ƙasar Jamus wanda ya aura a shekarar 1955. [1]

items.sourceText: Henrique N'zita Tiago (14 July 1927[1] – 3 June 2016)[2][3] was a commander of the Armed Forces of Cabinda, a rebel guerrilla group that fights for the independence of Cabinda from Angola.[4] He died in Paris on 3 June 2016.[2][5] It was reported that Tiago was 88 years old when he died, and that he was buried in France.[6][5]

targets.targetText: Henrique N'zita Tiago (14 Yuli 1927 [1] - 3 Yuni 2016) [2] [3] ya kasance kwamandan rundunar sojojin Cabinda, kungiyar 'yan tawaye da ke fafutukar kwato 'yancin kan Cabinda daga Angola. [4] Ya mutu a Paris a ranar 3 ga watan Yuni 2016. [2] [5] An ba da rahoton cewa Tiago yana da shekaru 88 a duniya lokacin da ya rasu, kuma an binne shi a Faransa. [6] [5]

Henrique N'zita Tiago (14 Yuli 1927 [1] - 3 Yuni 2016) [2] [3] ya kasance kwamandan rundunar sojojin Cabinda, kungiyar 'yan tawaye da ke fafutukar kwato 'yancin kan Cabinda daga Angola . [4] Ya mutu a Paris a ranar 3 ga Yuni 2016. [2] [5] An ba da rahoton cewa Tiago yana da shekaru 88 a duniya lokacin da ya rasu, kuma an binne shi a Faransa . [6] [5]

items.sourceText: From March 1976 onwards, Van-Dúnem began to criticize influential leaders of the party and of the Angolan state, especially rallying against a supposed "white-mestiço elite",[3] purportedly exemplified by now Minister of Defense Iko Carreira, as well as MPLA vice-president and president of the Revolutionary Council Lúcio Lara. He later implicated Agostinho Neto himself and his government more broadly as targets of his criticisms.[3] These criticisms made him lose influence in the party, being sent to the 3rd Military Police Region.[2]

targets.targetText: Daga Maris 1976 zuwa gaba, Van-Dúnem ya fara sukar shugabannin jam'iyyar da na Angolan masu tasiri, musamman zanga-zangar adawa da "farar-mestiço elite", [1] wanda yanzu Ministan Tsaro Iko Carreira ya misalta, da kuma mataimakin shugaban MPLA kuma shugaban majalisar juyin juya hali Lúcio Lara . Daga baya ya sanya Agostinho Neto da kansa da gwamnatinsa gabaɗaya a matsayin masu sukar sa. [1] Wannan suka ya sa ya rasa tasiri a jam’iyyar, inda aka tura shi yankin ‘yan sandan soja na 3. [2]

Daga watan Maris 1976 zuwa gaba, Van-Dúnem ya fara sukar shugabannin jam'iyyar da na Angolan masu tasiri, musamman zanga-zangar adawa da "farar-mestiço elite", [1] wanda yanzu Ministan Tsaro Iko Carreira ya misalta, da kuma mataimakin shugaban MPLA kuma shugaban majalisar juyin juya hali Lúcio Lara. Daga baya ya sanya Agostinho Neto da kansa da gwamnatinsa gabaɗaya a matsayin masu sukar sa. [1] Wannan suka ya sa ya rasa tasiri a jam’iyyar, inda aka tura shi yankin ‘yan sandan soja na 3. [2]

items.sourceText: He participated in the Angolan War of Independence as an official in the intelligentsia of the People's Army for the Liberation of Angola (EPLA) and a coordinator of the Clandestine Regional Committee of Luanda (CRL),[2] organizing a cell network with the MPLA in Luanda.[2] His intellectual nature earned him the nickname "Filósofo" (Portuguese for philosopher).[2] He also participated in armed action, including capturing some aircraft in 1969.[2]

targets.targetText: Ya shiga yakin 'yancin kai na Angolan a matsayin jami'i a cikin basirar Sojojin Jama'a don 'Yantar da Angola (EPLA) da kuma mai gudanarwa na Kwamitin Yanki na Luanda (CRL), [1] yana shirya hanyar sadarwar salula tare da MPLA a Luanda. [1] Halinsa na hankali ya sa aka yi masa laƙabi "Filósofo" (Portuguese for philosopher). [1] Har ila yau, ya shiga cikin ayyukan makamai, ciki har da kama wasu jiragen sama a shekarar 1969. [1]

Ya shiga yakin 'yancin kai na Angolan a matsayin jami'i a cikin basirar Sojojin Jama'a don 'Yantar da Angola (EPLA) da kuma mai gudanarwa na Kwamitin Yanki na Luanda (CRL), [1] yana shirya hanyar sadarwar salula tare da MPLA a Luanda. [1] Halinsa na hankali ya sa aka yi masa laƙabi "Filósofo" (Portuguese don philosopher). [1] Har ila yau, ya shiga cikin ayyukan makamai, ciki har da kama wasu jiragen sama a 1969. [1]

items.sourceText: His nephew, Ruy Mingas, recorded the song "Homenagem a Liceu Vieira Dias" as a tribute to Liceu. Mingas also wrote the national anthem of Angola, Angola Avante. Liceu's family members also include Ruy's brother André Mingas, who is also a singer and composer; Saíde Mingas, an economist who became a major leader in the MPLA during the Civil War; and linguist and investigator Amélia Mingas.[8] His other nephews include Hélder Vieira Dias, a top military general in Angola, and Filomeno do Nascimento Vieira Dias, the current Archbishop of Luanda.[9] He was also related to fellow anticolonial leader and nationalist Mário Pinto de Andrade.

targets.targetText: Ɗan uwansa, Ruy Mingas, ya rubuta waƙar "Homenagem a Liceu Vieira Dias" a matsayin girmamawa ga Liceu. Mingas kuma ya rubuta taken ƙasar Angola, Angola Avante. Iyalan Liceu kuma sun haɗa da ɗan'uwan Ruy André Mingas, wanda shi ma mawaƙi ne kuma mawaki; Saíde Mingas, masanin tattalin arziki wanda ya zama babban jagora a cikin MPLA a lokacin yakin basasa; kuma masanin harshe kuma mai bincike Amélia Mingas. [1] Sauran 'ya'yansa sun haɗa da Hélder Vieira Dias, babban janar na soja a Angola, da Filomeno do Nascimento Vieira Dias, Archbishop na Luanda na yanzu. [2] Hakanan yana da alaƙa da ɗan'uwan shugaban 'yan mulkin mallaka kuma ɗan kishin ƙasa Mário Pinto de Andrade.

Dan uwansa, Ruy Mingas, ya rubuta waƙar "Homenagem a Liceu Vieira Dias" a matsayin girmamawa ga Liceu. Mingas kuma ya rubuta taken kasar Angola, Angola Avante . Iyalan Liceu kuma sun haɗa da ɗan'uwan Ruy André Mingas, wanda shi ma mawaƙi ne kuma mawaki; Saíde Mingas, masanin tattalin arziki wanda ya zama babban jagora a cikin MPLA a lokacin yakin basasa; kuma masanin harshe kuma mai bincike Amélia Mingas . [1] Sauran 'ya'yansa sun hada da Hélder Vieira Dias, babban janar na soja a Angola, da Filomeno do Nascimento Vieira Dias, Archbishop na Luanda na yanzu. [2] Hakanan yana da alaƙa da ɗan'uwan shugaban 'yan mulkin mallaka kuma ɗan kishin ƙasa Mário Pinto de Andrade .

items.sourceText: In 2009, the documentary "Estórias para a História da Música Angolana", by Mário Rui Silva,[1] was released, which classifies Liceu as a legendary figure in Angolan popular music and as one of the most important artists in the country's history.[10]

targets.targetText: A cikin 2009, an fitar da wani shirin gaskiya na "Estórias para a História da Música Angolana", na Mário Rui Silva, [1], wanda ya keɓe Liceu a matsayin babban jigo a shahararriyar kiɗan Angola kuma a matsayin ɗaya daga cikin manyan masu fasaha a tarihin ƙasar. [2]

A cikin shekarar 2009, an fitar da wani shirin gaskiya na "Estórias para a História da Música Angolana", na Mário Rui Silva, [1], wanda ya keɓe Liceu a matsayin babban jigo a shahararriyar kiɗan Angola kuma a matsayin ɗaya daga cikin manyan masu fasaha a tarihin ƙasar. [2]

items.sourceText: The project for the realization of this hydraulic structure was approved on 24 May 1911 in order to carry out the water supply of the Meraldene River as well as the construction of the dam itself.[5][6]

targets.targetText: An amince da aikin don aiwatar da wannan tsarin ruwa a ranar 24 ga watan Mayu 1911 don aiwatar da samar da ruwa na Kogin Meraldene da kuma gina madatsar ruwan ita kanta.[1][2]
An amince da aikin don aiwatar da wannan tsarin ruwa a ranar 24 ga Mayu 1911 don aiwatar da samar da ruwa na Kogin Meraldene da kuma gina madatsar ruwan kanta.[1][2]

items.sourceText: By 1976, there began to be a secretly formed opposition group within the MPLA called the Fractionists (or the nitistas), that had promoted inflammatory rhetoric against a purported “white-mestiço elite”, as well as against socioeconomic policies that they had attributed to the continuing widespread and deeply embedded poverty in Angola. This came after the war for independence but right as the civil war began to take form. The latter point made Mingas, a moderate within the movement, a personal adversary of the nitistas.[13]

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 1976, an fara samun wata ƙungiya ta adawa a asirce a cikin MPLA da ake kira Fractionists (ko nitistas), waɗanda suka inganta maganganu masu tayar da hankali a kan wani da ake kira "farar-mestico elite", da kuma adawa da manufofin tattalin arziki da suka danganta ga ci gaba da yaduwa da talauci a Angola. Hakan ya biyo bayan yakin neman ‘yancin kai amma daidai lokacin da yakin basasa ya fara kunno kai. Batu na ƙarshe ya sanya Mingas, matsakaita a cikin motsi, abokin gaba na nitistas. [1]

A shekara ta 1976, an fara samun wata ƙungiya ta adawa a asirce a cikin MPLA da ake kira Fractionists (ko nitistas), waɗanda suka inganta maganganu masu tayar da hankali a kan wani da ake kira "white-mestico elite", da kuma adawa da manufofin tattalin arziki da suka danganta ga ci gaba da yaɗuwa da talauci a Angola. Hakan ya biyo bayan yakin neman ‘yancin kai amma daidai lokacin da yakin basasa ya fara kunno kai. Batu na ƙarshe ya sanya Mingas, matsakaita a cikin motsi, abokin gaba na nitistas. [1]

items.sourceText: During the 2011 Libyan Civil War, Abusedra created "a database of people who disappeared, were injured, in hospitals, deprived of homes, or affected by the military actions in any other way."[1] She also founded the NGO Forum For a Democratic Libya, based in Benghazi, Cyrenaica,[3] and the Libyan Coalition of NGOs in 2011.[4]

targets.targetText: A lokacin yakin basasar Libya na 2011, Abusedra ya kirkiro "tattalin bayanai na mutanen da suka bace, suka ji rauni, a asibitoci, da aka hana su gidaje, ko ayyukan soja suka shafi ta wata hanya." [1] Har ila yau, ta kafa NGO Forum For a Democratic Libya, mai tushe a Benghazi, Cyrenaica, [2] da Libyan Coalition of NGOs a 2011. [3]

A lokacin yakin basasar Libya na shekarar 2011, Abusedra ya kirkiro "tattalin bayanai na mutanen da suka ɓace, suka ji rauni, a asibitoci, da aka hana su gidaje, ko ayyukan soja suka shafi ta wata hanya." [1] Har ila yau, ta kafa NGO Forum For a Democratic Libya, mai tushe a Benghazi, Cyrenaica, [2] da Libyan Coalition of NGOs a shekarar 2011. [3]

items.sourceText: Al-Khweldi Muhammad Salih Abdullah El-Hamedi (Arabic الخويلدي محمد الحميدي; January 1943 – 27 July 2015), also transliterated as Khuwailidi al-Humaidi, was a Libyan major general under Muammar Gaddafi, founding member of the Libyan Revolutionary Command Council, and the first Secretary General of the Libyan Popular National Movement.[1][2] He was part of Gaddafi's inner circle.[3]

targets.targetText: Al-Khweldi Muhammad Salih Abdullah El-Hamedi ( Larabci الخويلدي محمد الحميدي; Janairu 1943 - 27 Yuli 2015), wanda kuma aka fassara da Khuwailidi al-Humaidi, ya kasance Manjo Janar na Libya karkashin Muammar Gaddafi, wanda ya kafa babban sakataren kungiyar juyin juya hali na Libya na farko kuma babban sakataren kungiyar juyin juya hali ta Libya . [1] [2] Yana daga cikin da'irar Gaddafi. [3]

Al-Khweldi Muhammad Salih Abdullah El-Hamedi (Larabci الخويلدي محمد الحميدي; Janairu 1943 - 27 Yuli 2015), wanda kuma aka fassara da Khuwailidi al-Humaidi, ya kasance Manjo Janar na Libya ƙarƙashin Muammar Gaddafi, wanda ya kafa kuma babban sakataren kungiyar juyin juya hali na Libya na farko kuma babban sakataren kungiyar juyin juya hali ta Libya. [1] [2] Yana daga cikin da'irar Gaddafi. [3]

items.sourceText: Hameidi never stood trial in Tunisia and was not deported to Libya. He reportedly spent time in Morocco before settling in Egypt. In February 2012, the Libyan Popular National Movement was founded by Gaddafi loyalists in exile and Hameidi served as its first Secretary General. The party was banned from participating in the 2012 Libyan parliamentary election.[20][2]

targets.targetText: Hameidi bai taba fuskantar shari'a a Tunisiya ba kuma ba a kai shi Libya ba. A gwargwadon rahoto ya shafe lokaci a Maroko kafin ya zauna a Masar . A cikin Fabrairu 2012, Libyan Popular National Movement aka kafa ta Libyan Popular National Movement masu biyayya ga Gaddafi a gudun hijira kuma Hameidi ya zama Babban Sakatare Janar na farko. An dakatar da jam'iyyar daga shiga zaben 'yan majalisar dokokin kasar Libya a shekara ta 2012 . [1] [2]

Hameidi bai taɓa fuskantar shari'a a Tunisiya ba kuma ba a kai shi Libya ba. A gwargwadon rahoto ya shafe lokaci a Maroko kafin ya zauna a Masar. A cikin watan Fabrairu 2012, Libyan Popular National Movement aka kafa ta Libyan Popular National Movement masu biyayya ga Gaddafi a gudun hijira kuma Hameidi ya zama Babban Sakatare Janar na farko. An dakatar da jam'iyyar daga shiga zaɓen 'yan majalisar dokokin ƙasar Libya a shekara ta 2012. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Hameidi played a leading role in the 1969 Libyan coup d'état that overthrew King Idris and brought Muammar Gaddafi to power. Hameidi was specifically tasked with seizing the radio station in Tripoli and arresting the crown prince Hasan as-Senussi.[6][1] After the successful coup, Hameidi was part of the twelve men that formed the Libyan Revolutionary Command Council (RCC).[7]

targets.targetText: Hameidi ya taka rawar gani a juyin mulkin da aka yi a Libiya a shekara ta 1969 wanda ya hambarar da Sarki Idris kuma ya kawo Muammar Gaddafi kan ƙaragar mulki. Hameidi dai an ɗora masa alhakin kwace gidan rediyon da ke birnin Tripoli da kuma kame yarima mai jiran gado Hasan as-Senussi. [1] Bayan nasarar juyin mulkin, Hameidi yana cikin mutane goma sha biyu da suka kafa Majalisar Juyin Juya Hali ta Libiya (RCC). [2]

Hameidi ya taka rawar gani a juyin mulkin da aka yi a Libiya a shekara ta 1969 wanda ya hambarar da Sarki Idris kuma ya kawo Muammar Gaddafi kan karagar mulki. Hameidi dai an dora masa alhakin kwace gidan rediyon da ke birnin Tripoli da kuma kame yarima mai jiran gado Hasan as-Senussi . [ 6 ] [1] Bayan nasarar juyin mulkin, Hameidi yana cikin mutane goma sha biyu da suka kafa Majalisar Komar Juyin Juya Hali ta Libiya (RCC). [2]

items.sourceText: In 1966, he chose voluntary exile, not returning to Morocco until June, 1995. After his exile he was repeatedly implicated by the regime in various real and imagined plots against the monarchy, and repeatedly sentenced to death in absentia.[1]

targets.targetText: A shekarar 1966, ya zaɓi gudun hijira na son rai, bai koma Maroko ba har sai a watan Yuni, 1995. Bayan gudun hijira ya sha fama da gwamnatinsa a wasu makirce-makirce daban-daban a kan masarautun, kuma an yanke masa hukuncin kisa akai-akai ba ya nan. [1]

A 1966, ya zaɓi gudun hijira na son rai, bai koma Maroko ba har sai Yuni, 1995. Bayan gudun hijira ya sha fama da gwamnatinsa a wasu makirce-makirce daban-daban a kan masarautun, kuma an yanke masa hukuncin kisa akai-akai ba ya nan. [1]

items.sourceText: MC Oluomo was born in Oshodi, Lagos, Nigeria. He originally hails from Lagos State. He had primary level of education and dropped out of school because of his father's death. He ran away from home at the age of 13 and started working as a bus driver.[1] He became the head of a motor park in Oshodi and finally rose to become the most influential agbero in Oshodi before he emerged as the chairman of the National Union of Road Transport Workers in Lagos.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi MC Oluomo a Oshodi, Legas, Najeriya . Ya fito ne daga Jihar Legas. Yana da matakin firamare na ilimi kuma ya bar makaranta saboda mutuwar mahaifinsa. Ya gudu daga gida yana da shekaru 13 kuma ya fara aiki a matsayin Direban bas.[1] Ya zama shugaban wurin shakatawa a Oshodi kuma a ƙarshe ya tashi ya zama mai tasiri a Oshori kafin ya fito a matsayin shugaban kungiyar ma'aikatan sufuri ta kasa a Legas.[2]

An haifi MC Oluomo a Ƙaramar hukumarOshodi, Legas, Najeriya . Ya fito ne daga Jihar Legas. Yana da matakin firamare na ilimi kuma ya bar makaranta saboda mutuwar mahaifinsa. Ya gudu daga gida yana da shekaru 13 kuma ya fara aiki a matsayin Direban bas.[1] Ya zama shugaban wurin shakatawa a Oshodi kuma a ƙarshe ya tashi ya zama mai tasiri a Yankin Oshori kafin ya fito a matsayin shugaban ƙungiyar ma'aikatan sufuri ta ƙasa a Jihar Legas.[2]

items.sourceText: Tum is a village in Kagoro chiefdom, Kaura Local Government Area[1] in southern Kaduna State in the Middle Belt region of Nigeria.[2] The village uses the near by post office at Kagoro.[3]

targets.targetText: Tum ƙauye ne a cikin Shugabancin Kagoro, Karamar Hukumar Kaura a kudanci Jihar Kaduna a yankin Middle Belt na Najeriya. [1] Ƙauyen yana amfani da ofishin gidan waya a Kagoro .[2]
Tum wani ƙauye ne a cikin Shugabancin Kagoro, Ƙaramar Hukumar Kaura a kudanci Jihar Kaduna a yankin Middle Belt na Najeriya. [1] Ƙauyen yana amfani da ofishin gidan waya a Kagoro .[2]

items.sourceText: The battle of Ait Abdellah took place in 1934, in the commune with the same name, in Taroudant region, in the Anti-Atlas mountains of Morocco. It opposed resistance fighters led by Abdellah Zakour, to French forces. The battle lasted for 3 days where the French army used 18 warplanes and shelling to undermine the locals,[3] who surrendered after running out of ammunition.

targets.targetText: Yaƙin Ait Abdellah ya faru ne a cikin shekarar 1934, a cikin commune mai suna, a yankin Taroudant, a tsaunukan Anti-Atlas na Maroko. Ta yi adawa da mayakan adawa ƙarƙashin jagorancin Abdellah Zakour, ga sojojin Faransa. An kwashe kwanaki 3 ana gwabza faɗa inda sojojin Faransa suka yi amfani da jiragen yaki guda 18 da kuma harba makamai masu linzami wajen lalata al'ummar yankin, [1] waɗanda suka miƙa wuya bayan sun kare da harbin harsashi.

Yaƙin Ait Abdellah ya faru ne a cikin 1934, a cikin commune mai suna, a yankin Taroudant, a tsaunukan Anti-Atlas na Maroko. Ta yi adawa da mayakan adawa karkashin jagorancin Abdellah Zakour, ga sojojin Faransa. An kwashe kwanaki 3 ana gwabza fada inda sojojin Faransa suka yi amfani da jiragen yaki guda 18 da kuma harba makamai masu linzami wajen lalata al'ummar yankin, [1] wadanda suka mika wuya bayan sun kare da harsashi.

items.sourceText: Kaptein Hendrik Witbooi is one of nine national heroes of Namibia who were identified at the inauguration of the country's Heroes' Acre near Windhoek. Founding president Sam Nujoma remarked in his inauguration speech on 26 August 2002 that:

targets.targetText: Kaptein Hendrik Witbooi na daya daga cikin jaruman kasar Namibiya tara da aka gano a wajen bikin kaddamar da Acre na Jaruman kasar kusa da Windhoek . Shugaban kafa Sam Nujoma ya bayyana a jawabinsa na rantsar da shi a ranar 26 ga Agusta 2002 cewa:

Kaptein Hendrik Witbooi na ɗaya daga cikin jaruman ƙasar Namibiya tara da aka gano a wajen bikin kaddamar da Acre na Jaruman ƙasar kusa da Windhoek. Shugaban kafa Sam Nujoma ya bayyana a jawabinsa na rantsar da shi a ranar 26 ga watan Agusta 2002 cewa:

items.sourceText: Witbooi was a strong opponent of the South African system of Bantu Education which deprived black learners of an appropriate access to education. He then established the African Methodist Episcopal Church Private School which used English as medium of instruction. He was a strong opponent of the South African Homeland policy. Furthermore, he aggressively opposed the enforced resettlement of the ǃGami-ǂnun (Bondelswarts) from the Warmbad area to Gibeon. Throughout November 1967 he advised the ǃGami-ǂnun in Warmbad to reject any South African resettlement plans. Witbooi joined SWAPO in 1977 but died not long after that, in 1978. Hendrik Witbooi, Jr. succeeded him as chief of the ǀKhowesin.[1]

targets.targetText: Witbooi ya kasance mai tsananin adawa da tsarin Bantu na Afirka ta Kudu wanda ya hana masu koyo na bakar fata damar samun ilimi da ya dace. Sannan ya kafa Makarantar Private Church mai zaman kanta ta Methodist Episcopal Church wacce ke amfani da Ingilishi a matsayin hanyar koyarwa. Ya kasance mai tsananin adawa da manufofin gida na Afirka ta Kudu. Bugu da ƙari, ya yi adawa da tilasta sake tsugunar da ǃGami-ǂnun (Bondelswarts) daga yankin Warmbad zuwa Gibeyon. A cikin watan Nuwamba 1967 ya shawarci ǃGami-ǂnun a Warmbad da su ƙi duk wani shirin sake tsugunar da Afirka ta Kudu. Witbooi ya shiga SWAPO a shekarar 1977 amma ya mutu ba da daɗewa ba, a shekarar 1978. Hendrik Witbooi, Jr. ya gaje shi a matsayin shugaban ǀKhowesin. [1]

Witbooi ya kasance mai tsananin adawa da tsarin Bantu na Afirka ta Kudu wanda ya hana masu koyo bakar fata damar samun ilimi da ya dace. Sannan ya kafa Makarantar Private Church mai zaman kanta ta Methodist Episcopal Church wacce ke amfani da Ingilishi a matsayin hanyar koyarwa. Ya kasance mai tsananin adawa da manufofin gida na Afirka ta Kudu . Bugu da ƙari, ya yi adawa da tilasta sake tsugunar da ǃGami-ǂnun ( Bondelswarts ) daga yankin Warmbad zuwa Gibeyon. A cikin watan Nuwamba 1967 ya shawarci ǃGami-ǂnun a Warmbad da su ƙi duk wani shirin sake tsugunar da Afirka ta Kudu. Witbooi ya shiga SWAPO a 1977 amma ya mutu ba da dadewa ba, a 1978. Hendrik Witbooi, Jr. ya gaje shi a matsayin shugaban ǀKhowesin. [1]

items.sourceText: Caliph Ali appointed Nabame to a senior command in the Sokoto army, where he led several expeditions. During one such campaign against a Gobir revolt in Zamfara in 1847, a Gobir horseman recognised Nabame and shouted, "You should be on our side, not helping those who slew your father!" Although Nabame ignored the taunt at the time, it weighed heavily on his mind. During the battle, the Gobirawa nearly killed Umaru, a son of Ali, but Nabame narrowly saved him. Upon returning to Sokoto, Nabame was rewarded with his freedom and allowed to return to his people.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Halifa Ali ya naɗa Nabame a matsayin babban kwamanda a rundunar sojan Sakkwato, inda ya jagoranci balaguro da dama. A wani kamfen da aka yi a kan gobarar Gobir da aka yi a Zamfara a shekarar 1847, wani mahaya doki Gobir ya gane Nabame ya yi ihu, ya ce, “Ya kamata ku kasance tare da mu, kada ku taimaki waɗanda suka kashe ubanku! Duk da cewa Nabame ya yi watsi da zagin da aka yi masa a lokacin, hakan ya yi masa nauyi. A lokacin yakin, Gobirawa sun kusa kashe Umaru, ɗan Ali, amma Nabame ya cece shi da kyar. Bayan komawar sakkwato, Nabame ya samu yancinsa, aka bar shi ya koma ga jama’arsa. [1] [2] [3]

Halifa Ali ya nada Nabame a matsayin babban kwamanda a rundunar sojan Sakkwato, inda ya jagoranci balaguro da dama. A wani kamfen da aka yi a kan gobarar Gobir da aka yi a Zamfara a 1847, wani mahaya doki Gobir ya gane Nabame ya yi ihu, ya ce, “Ya kamata ku kasance tare da mu, kada ku taimaki wadanda suka kashe ubanku! Duk da cewa Nabame ya yi watsi da zagin da aka yi masa a lokacin, hakan ya yi masa nauyi. A lokacin yakin, Gobirawa sun kusa kashe Umaru, dan Ali, amma Nabame ya cece shi da kyar. Bayan komawar sakkwato, Nabame ya samu yancinsa, aka bar shi ya koma ga jama’arsa. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Back in Kebbi, Nabame continued to be troubled by the taunts of the Gobirawa. In 1849, he renounced his allegiance to Sokoto and declared himself Sarkin Kebbi, ending the 18-year truce between Kebbi and the Sokoto Caliphate. His revolt quickly gained momentum, with support coming in from his Kebbawa kinsmen and his father's former allies in Arewa and Zabarma.[6]

targets.targetText: A can birnin Kebbi, Nabame ya ci gaba da damuwa da zagin Gobirawa. A shekarar 1849, ya yi watsi da mubaya’arsa ga Sakkwato, ya naɗa kansa Sarkin Kebbi, inda ya kawo ƙarshen zaman sulhu na tsawon shekaru 18 tsakanin Kebbi da Daular Sakkwato. Tawayen nasa ya ƙara karfi da sauri, tare da samun goyon bayan ’yan uwansa na Kebbawa da tsoffin abokan mahaifinsa a Arewa da Zabarma. [1]

A can birnin Kebbi, Nabame ya ci gaba da damunsa da zagin Gobirawa. A shekarar 1849, ya yi watsi da mubaya’arsa ga Sakkwato, ya nada kansa Sarkin Kebbi, inda ya kawo karshen zaman sulhu na tsawon shekaru 18 tsakanin Kebbi da Daular Sakkwato. Tawayen nasa ya kara karfi da sauri, tare da samun goyon bayan ’yan uwansa na Kebbawa da tsoffin abokan mahaifinsa a Arewa da Zabarma. [1]

items.sourceText: Boshielo was born in 1920 in Phokoane in Sekhukhuneland in the former Northern Transvaal.[1] In his 20s, he moved to Johannesburg, where he found work as a gardener and later as a driver for a bakery.[2][1] He became active in the trade union movement and joined the Communist Party of South Africa (CPSA) and African National Congress (ANC). During the ANC's 1952 Defiance Campaign, he led the first corps of Johannesburg volunteers in their civil disobedience,[3][2] and he worked for the CPSA's newspaper, the Guardian.[4] He was also a founding member of Sebatakgomo, a resistance movement formed by Sekhukhune migrant workers in Johannesburg that went on to play a central role in the 1958 Sekhukhuneland revolt.[1][2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Boshielo a cikin 1920 a Phokoane a cikin Sekhukhuneland a tsohuwar Transvaal ta Arewa . [1] A cikin shekarunsa na 20, ya ƙaura zuwa Johannesburg, inda ya sami aiki a matsayin mai lambu kuma daga baya a matsayin direban gidan burodi. [2] [1] Ya zama mai himma a cikin ƙungiyoyin ƙwadago kuma ya shiga Jam'iyyar Kwaminis ta Afirka ta Kudu (CPSA) da Congress National Congress (ANC). A lokacin yaƙin neman zaɓe na ANC na 1952, ya jagoranci rukunin farko na masu sa kai na Johannesburg a cikin rashin biyayyarsu, [3] [2] kuma ya yi aiki ga jaridar CPSA, the Guardian . [4] Ya kuma kasance memba na kafa Sebatakgomo, ƙungiyar juriya da ma'aikatan bakin haure Sekhukhune suka kafa a Johannesburg wanda ya ci gaba da taka rawa a cikin tawayen Sekhukhuneland na 1958. [1] [2]

An haifi Boshielo a cikin shekara ta 1920 a Phokoane a cikin Sekhukhuneland a tsohuwar Transvaal ta Arewa. [1] A cikin shekarunsa na 20, ya ƙaura zuwa Johannesburg, inda ya sami aiki a matsayin mai lambu kuma daga baya a matsayin direban gidan burodi. [2] [1] Ya zama mai himma a cikin ƙungiyoyin ƙwadago kuma ya shiga Jam'iyyar Kwaminis ta Afirka ta Kudu (CPSA) da Congress National Congress (ANC). A lokacin yaƙin neman zaɓe na ANC na shekarar 1952, ya jagoranci ruƙunin farko na masu sa kai na Johannesburg a cikin rashin biyayyarsu, [3] [2] kuma ya yi aiki ga jaridar CPSA, the Guardian. [4] Ya kuma kasance memba na kafa Sebatakgomo, ƙungiyar juriya da ma'aikatan baƙin haure Sekhukhune suka kafa a Johannesburg wanda ya ci gaba da taka rawa a cikin tawayen Sekhukhuneland na shekarar 1958. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: In 1964, Davis was arrested and sentenced to seven years on Robben Island for "conspiring to commit sabotage." Four years into his incarceration, Davis received a school-leaving Senior Certificate by completing his work via correspondence. After his release in 1971, he was put under house arrest for five years. Once his time was complete, 1978 and 1990 he worked as assistant organiser at the Community Arts Project (CAP) in Cape Town. At the Evangelical Art and Craft Centre at Rorke's Drift in 1980 he worked toward a Diploma in Fine Arts. His interest in art led him to complete a BA Fine Art degree with the University of Cape Town in 1994.

targets.targetText: A cikin shekara ta 1964, an kama Davis kuma an yanke masa hukumcin shekaru bakwai a tsibirin Robben saboda "yunkurin yin zagon ƙasa." [1] "Shekaru huɗu a cikin kurkuku, Davis ya sami takardar shaidar kammala makaranta ta hanyar kammala aikinsa ta hanyar wasiƙa. Bayan an sake shi a shekarar 1971, an tsare shi a gidan yari na tsawon shekaru biyar. Da zarar lokacinsa ya cika, 1978 da 1990 ya yi aiki a matsayin mataimakin mai shirya shirye-shirye a Community Arts Project (CAP) a Cape Town. A Cibiyar Fasaha da Fasaha ta bishara a Rorke's Drift a cikin shekara ta 1980 ya yi aiki zuwa Difloma a Fine Arts. Sha'awar fasaha ta sa shi ya kammala digiri na BA Fine Art tare da Jami'ar Cape Town a shekarar 1994.

A cikin 1964, an kama Davis kuma an yanke masa hukumcin shekaru bakwai a tsibirin Robben saboda "yunkurin yin zagon kasa ." [1] "Shekaru hudu a cikin kurkuku, Davis ya sami takardar shaidar kammala makaranta ta hanyar kammala aikinsa ta hanyar wasiƙa. Bayan an sake shi a shekarar 1971, an tsare shi a gidan yari na tsawon shekaru biyar. Da zarar lokacinsa ya cika, 1978 da 1990 ya yi aiki a matsayin mataimakin mai shirya shirye-shirye a Community Arts Project (CAP) a Cape Town. A Cibiyar Fasaha da Fasaha ta bishara a Rorke's Drift a cikin 1980 ya yi aiki zuwa Difloma a Fine Arts . Sha'awar fasaha ta sa shi ya kammala digiri na BA Fine Art tare da Jami'ar Cape Town a 1994.

items.sourceText: Clarence Mlami Makwetu was born on 6 December 1928 in Hoyita, Cofimvaba in the bantustan of Transkei. He was the second of five children of Minah and Gqongo Makwetu. He was educated at Keilands Mission School in the Stutterheim district and matriculated at Lovedale, near Alice in the Eastern Cape.[1] Makwetu left the Transkei for Cape Town where African were not allowed after a brief stint in Port Elizabeth as a casual worker in the late 1940s. In Cape Town he was received by Chris Hani’s elder brother, with whom he was friends. He had a stint in a factory that made children’s toys, but left work after intermittent pass raids by the police. Makwetu soon became self-employed and sold various goods from his flat in Langa before he became involved in the struggle for liberation in 1952.[3]

targets.targetText: An haifi Clarence Mlami Makwetu a ranar 6 ga Disamba 1928 a Hoyita, Cofimvaba a cikin Bantustan na Transkei . Shi ne na biyu a cikin yara biyar na Minah da Gqongo Makwetu. Ya yi karatu a Makarantar Mishan ta Keilands a gundumar Stutterheim kuma ya yi karatu a Lovedale, kusa da Alice a Gabashin Cape . [1] Makwetu ya bar Transkei zuwa Cape Town inda ba a ba da izinin Afirka ba bayan ɗan gajeren lokaci a Port Elizabeth a matsayin ma'aikaci na yau da kullun a ƙarshen 1940s. A Cape Town ya sami karɓaɓɓen ɗan'uwan Chris Hani, wanda abokansa ne. Ya yi aiki a wata masana'anta da ke kera kayan wasan yara, amma ya bar aiki bayan wuce gona da iri da 'yan sanda suka yi. Ba da daɗewa ba Makwetu ya zama mai dogaro da kansa kuma ya sayar da kayayyaki daban-daban daga gidansa da ke Langa kafin ya shiga gwagwarmayar neman ’yanci a 1952. [2]

An haifi Clarence Mlami Makwetu a ranar 6 ga watan Disamba 1928 a Hoyita, Cofimvaba a cikin Bantustan na Transkei. Shi ne na biyu a cikin yara biyar na Minah da Gqongo Makwetu. Ya yi karatu a Makarantar Mishan ta Keilands a gundumar Stutterheim kuma ya yi karatu a Lovedale, kusa da Alice a Gabashin Cape. [1] Makwetu ya bar Transkei zuwa Cape Town inda ba a ba da izinin Afirka ba bayan ɗan gajeren lokaci a Port Elizabeth a matsayin ma'aikaci na yau da kullum a ƙarshen 1940s. A Cape Town ya sami karɓaɓɓen ɗan'uwan Chris Hani, wanda abokansa ne. Ya yi aiki a wata masana'anta da ke kera kayan wasan yara, amma ya bar aiki bayan wuce gona da iri da 'yan sanda suka yi. Ba da daɗewa ba Makwetu ya zama mai dogaro da kansa kuma ya sayar da kayayyaki daban-daban daga gidansa da ke Langa kafin ya shiga gwagwarmayar neman ’yanci a shekarar 1952. [2]

items.sourceText: Maphotho died of natural causes during the early hours of 13 July 2019 at his home in Bendor, Polokwane. National Spokesperson of the ANC, Pule Mabe, confirmed his death. He was 88 years old at the time of his death. President Cyril Ramaphosa declared on 17 July 2019 that a state funeral would be held for Maphotho. His funeral was held on 21 July 2019. President Ramaphosa delivered the eulogy. He is the first person to be buried at the newly-established Heroes Acre section of the Silicon Cemetery in Polokwane.[9][10][11][12][13]

targets.targetText: Maphotho ya mutu ne saboda dalilai na halitta a farkon sa'o'in 13 ga watan Yuli 2019 a gidansa da ke Bendor, Polokwane. Kakakin jam'iyyar ANC na ƙasa, Pule Mabe, ya tabbatar da mutuwarsa. Ya rasu yana da shekaru 88 a duniya. Shugaba Cyril Ramaphosa ya bayyana a ranar 17 ga watan Yuli, 2019 cewa za a yi jana'izar Maphotho. An yi jana'izar sa a ranar 21 ga watan Yuli, 2019. Shugaba Ramaphosa ya gabatar da wannan yabo. Shi ne mutum na farko da aka yi jana’izarsa a sabon kafuwar sashen Heroes Acre na makabartar Silicon da ke Polokwane. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5]

Maphotho ya mutu ne saboda dalilai na halitta a farkon sa'o'in 13 ga Yuli 2019 a gidansa da ke Bendor, Polokwane . Kakakin jam'iyyar ANC na kasa, Pule Mabe, ya tabbatar da mutuwarsa. Ya rasu yana da shekaru 88 a duniya. Shugaba Cyril Ramaphosa ya bayyana a ranar 17 ga Yuli, 2019 cewa za a yi jana'izar Maphotho. An yi jana'izar sa a ranar 21 ga Yuli, 2019. Shugaba Ramaphosa ya gabatar da wannan yabo. Shi ne mutum na farko da aka yi jana’izarsa a sabon kafuwar sashen Heroes Acre na makabartar Silicon da ke Polokwane . [1] [2] [3] [4] [5]

items.sourceText: He returned to South Africa in the 1990s after the end of apartheid which also saw the release of freedom fighters including Nelson Mandela. He obtained a diploma in community medicine from the Stellenbosch University in 1993 and a diploma in Palliative Care at the University of Cape Town in 2002.[8]

targets.targetText: Ya koma Afirka ta Kudu a cikin shekarun 1990 bayan kawo ƙarshen mulkin wariyar launin fata wanda kuma aka saki mayakan 'yanci ciki har da Nelson Mandela. Ya sami digiri a fannin likitancin jama'a daga Jami'ar Stellenbosch a shekarar 1993 da difloma a Palliative Care a Jami'ar Cape Town a shekarar 2002. [1]

Ya koma Afirka ta Kudu a cikin shekarun 1990 bayan kawo karshen mulkin wariyar launin fata wanda kuma aka saki mayakan 'yanci ciki har da Nelson Mandela . Ya sami digiri a fannin likitancin jama'a daga Jami'ar Stellenbosch a 1993 da difloma a Palliative Care a Jami'ar Cape Town a 2002. [1]

items.sourceText: After 26 years on Robben Island, Motsoaledi was released from prison on 15 October 1989 along with five others.[4][5] During the July 1991 National Conference, Motsoaledi was elected to the National Executive Committee (NEC) of the ANC.[3]

targets.targetText: Bayan shekaru 26 a Tsibirin Robben, an saki Motsoaledi daga kurkuku a ranar 15 ga Oktoba 1989 tare da wasu biyar.[1][2] A lokacin taron kasa na Yuli 1991, an zabi Motsoaledi a cikin Kwamitin Zartarwa na Kasa (NEC) na ANC . [3]

Bayan shekaru 26 a Tsibirin Robben, an saki Motsoaledi daga kurkuku a ranar 15 ga watan Oktoba 1989 tare da wasu biyar.[1][2] A lokacin taron ƙasa na watan Yuli 1991, an zaɓi Motsoaledi a cikin Kwamitin Zartarwa na Ƙasa (NEC) na ANC. [3]

items.sourceText: Motsoaledi joined the Communist Party of South Africa (CPSA) in 1945 and then the African National Congress (ANC) in 1948. He soon became involved with trade unions. He joined the Leather Workers' Union in 1949, served as chairman of the Committee of Non-European Trade Unions (CNETU), which was formed in 1941. He was elected chairperson of CNETU in 1953. later played an active role in the establishment of the South African Congress of Trade Unions (COSATU).[1]

targets.targetText: Motsoaledi ya shiga jam'iyyar Kwaminis ta Afirka ta Kudu (CPSA) a shekarar 1945 sannan ya shiga jam'iyyar ANC a shekarar 1948. Ba da daɗewa ba ya shiga cikin ƙungiyoyin kwadago. Ya shiga kungiyar ma’aikatan fata a shekarar 1949, ya zama shugaban kwamitin kungiyoyin kwadagon da ba na Turai ba (CNETU), wanda aka kafa a shekarar 1941. An zaɓe shi shugaban CNETU a shekarar 1953. daga baya ya taka rawar gani wajen kafa kungiyar kwadago ta Afirka ta Kudu (COSATU). [1]

items.sourceText: Motsoaledi received an Isitwalandwe Medal on 8 January 1992 along with Oliver Tambo, Nelson Mandela, Walter Sisulu, Helen Joseph, Ahmed Kathrada, Harry Gwala, Andrew Mlangeni, Raymond Mhlaba, and Wilton Mkwayi.

items.sourceText: He died on 9 May 1994, aged 69, the day before Mandela was inaugurated as the President of South Africa.

targets.targetText: Ya rasu a ranar 9 ga watan Mayun 1994, yana da shekaru 69, kwana guda kafin a rantsar da Mandela a matsayin shugaban ƙasar Afirka ta Kudu.

items.sourceText: She had her first daughter, Carol, with a coloured man in Doornfontein in 1920. She then had her second daughter, Francis, with another man in 1926.[1]

targets.targetText: Ta haifi 'yarta ta farko, Carol, tare da wani mutum mai launi a Doornfontein a cikin shekarar 1920. Sannan ta haifi 'yarta ta biyu, Francis, tare da wani mutum a shekarar 1926. [1]
Ta haifi 'yarta ta farko, Carol, tare da wani mutum mai launi a Doornfontein a cikin 1920. Sannan ta haifi 'yarta ta biyu, Francis, tare da wani mutum a 1926. [1]

items.sourceText: While incarcerated, Pokela worked towards uniting the various factions of the PAC. In 1980, having served his sentence, Pokela was released from Robben Island. In February 1981, he was appointed to succeed Vusumzi Make, (who had resigned after the Chunya massacre in March 1980 when APLA troops refused to accept his leadership), to become head of the Tanzanian backed faction of the PAC.[1] His leadership was rejected by the survivors of the 500 strong APLA Chunya force as well as the Maoist PAC factions in Zimbabwe, Libya, Ghana, and Kenya but Tanzania persuaded the Mugabe government to deport or imprison the major opponents (Leballo, Leeman, Gaelisiwe, Buqwana) .[5]

targets.targetText: Yayin da yake tsare, Pokela ya yi aiki don haɗa ƙungiyoyi daban-daban na PAC. A cikin shekarar 1980, bayan da aka yanke masa hukuncin, an sake Pokela daga tsibirin Robben. A cikin watan Fabrairun 1981, an naɗa shi don ya gaji Vusumzi Make, (wanda ya yi murabus bayan kisan kiyashin Chunya a watan Maris 1980 lokacin da sojojin APLA suka ki amincewa da shugabancinsa), ya zama shugaban kungiyar PAC mai goyon bayan Tanzaniya. [1] Waɗanda suka tsira daga APLA Chunya mai ƙarfi 500 da kuma ƙungiyoyin Maoist PAC a Zimbabwe, Libya, Ghana, da Kenya sun yi watsi da shugabancinsa amma Tanzaniya ta shawo kan gwamnatin Mugabe da ta kori ko ɗaure manyan 'yan adawa (Leballo, Leeman, Gaelisiwe, Buqwana). [2]

items.sourceText: Both Marius and Jeanette Schoon worked as university lecturers with the ANC in Lubango, Angola. On 28 June 1984, while Schoon was away, Jeanette Schoon collected—either from their personal postbox or from the University mail office—and carried home a parcel bomb, which exploded on opening. It has not been established whether the bomb was addressed to Marius Schoon individually or to both the Schoons as a couple. The explosion killed her and their daughter Katryn. Their son Fritz, a toddler at the time, survived and was found wandering around the house. He never fully recovered from the trauma of seeing his mother and sister murdered before his eyes and developed epilepsy as a direct consequence. After the bombing, Schoon and son moved several times, first to Tanzania, then Zambia and eventually to Ireland.

targets.targetText: Dukansu Marius da Jeanette Schoon sun yi aiki a matsayin malaman jami'a tare da ANC a Lubango, Angola . A ranar 28 ga Yuni 1984, yayin da Schoon ba ya nan, Jeanette Schoon ya tattara—ko dai daga akwatin gidan waya na sirri ko kuma daga ofishin wasiƙa na Jami’ar— kuma suka ɗauki bam ɗin fakitin gida, wanda ya fashe lokacin buɗewa. Ba a tabbatar da ko bam din an yi magana ne ga Marius Schoon a daidaiku ko kuma ga duka Schoon a matsayin ma'aurata. Fashewar ta kashe ta da diyarsu Katryn. Ɗansu Fritz, ɗan ƙaramin yaro a lokacin, ya tsira kuma an same shi yana yawo a cikin gida. Bai sake samun cikakkiyar lafiya daga raunin da ya faru na ganin an kashe mahaifiyarsa da 'yar uwarsa a gaban idanunsa kuma suka kamu da farfadiya sakamakon kai tsaye. Bayan tashin bam, Schoon da ɗansu sun ƙaura sau da yawa, da farko zuwa Tanzaniya, sannan Zambia kuma daga ƙarshe zuwa Ireland .

Dukansu Marius da Jeanette Schoon sun yi aiki a matsayin malaman jami'a tare da ANC a Lubango, Angola. A ranar 28 ga watan Yuni 1984, yayin da Schoon ba ya nan, Jeanette Schoon ya tattara—ko dai daga akwatin gidan waya na sirri ko kuma daga ofishin wasiƙa na Jami’ar— kuma suka ɗauki bam ɗin fakitin gida, wanda ya fashe lokacin buɗewa. Ba a tabbatar da ko bam din an yi magana ne ga Marius Schoon a ɗaiɗaiku ko kuma ga duka Schoon a matsayin ma'aurata. Fashewar ta kashe ɗiyarta Katryn. Ɗansu Fritz, ɗan ƙaramin yaro a lokacin, ya tsira kuma an same shi yana yawo a cikin gida. Bai sake samun cikakkiyar lafiya daga raunin da ya faru na ganin an kashe mahaifiyarsa da 'yar uwarsa a gaban idanunsa kuma suka kamu da farfaɗiya sakamakon kai tsaye. Bayan tashin bam, Schoon da ɗansu sun ƙaura sau da yawa, da farko zuwa Tanzaniya, sannan Zambia kuma daga ƙarshe zuwa Ireland.

items.sourceText: He met Stella Nkolombe, who would become his wife, in Durban, which he was visiting as a publicity officer for Boswell Wilkie Circus.[3] She was a nurse at Ladysmith Provincial Hospital. They quickly married and moved to Rhodesia. She gave birth to the first of their four children, son Farai (Shona language for "Be happy"), in 1956.[3]

targets.targetText: Ya haɗu da Stella Nkolombe, wacce za ta zama matarsa, a Durban, wanda ya ziyarta a matsayin jami'in yaɗa labarai na Boswell Wilkie Circus. [1] Ta kasance ma'aikaciyar jinya a Asibitin Lardin Ladysmith. Da sauri suka yi aure kuma suka ƙaura zuwa Rhodesia. Ta haifi ɗan fari a cikin 'ya'yansu huɗu, ɗan Farai (yaren Shona don "Ku yi farin ciki"), a cikin shekarar 1956. [1]

Ya sadu da Stella Nkolombe, wacce za ta zama matarsa, a Durban, wanda ya ziyarta a matsayin jami'in yada labarai na Boswell Wilkie Circus . [1] Ta kasance ma'aikaciyar jinya a Asibitin Lardin Ladysmith . Da sauri suka yi aure kuma suka ƙaura zuwa Rhodesia. items.sourceText: MaFuyana actively recruited cadres and delivered information from imprisoned nationalists for the resistance. In March 1977, information arrived that colonialists, under the late Prime Minister Ian Smith, were planning to kidnap her youngest child as an act of revenge. She was forced to flee and briefly stayed in England and the German Democratic Republic, which supported Zimbabwe’s independence.[1]

targets.targetText: MaFuyana yai dauki ƙwaƙƙwaran ƙwararru tare da isar da bayanai daga ƴan kishin ƙasa da aka ɗaure saboda turjiya. A watan Maris na shekarar 1977, bayanai sun zo cewa ‘yan mulkin mallaka, a karkashin marigayi Firayim Minista Ian Smith, na shirin yin garkuwa da ƙaramin yaronta a matsayin wani mataki na daukar fansa. An tilasta mata yin gudun hijira kuma ta zauna a Ingila da Jamhuriyar Demokradiyyar Jamus na ɗan lokaci, waɗanda suka goyi bayan 'yancin kai na Zimbabwe. [1]

MaFuyana ya dauki ƙwaƙƙwaran ƙwararru tare da isar da bayanai daga ƴan kishin ƙasa da aka daure saboda juriya. A watan Maris na shekarar 1977, bayanai sun zo cewa ‘yan mulkin mallaka, a karkashin marigayi Firayim Minista Ian Smith, na shirin yin garkuwa da karamin yaronta a matsayin wani mataki na daukar fansa. An tilasta mata yin gudun hijira kuma ta zauna a Ingila da Jamhuriyar Demokaradiyyar Jamus na ɗan lokaci, waɗanda suka goyi bayan 'yancin kai na Zimbabwe. [1]

items.sourceText: She was buried in her village homestead in Gutu. She was not acknowledged as a hero,[10][11] prompting ZANU-PF provincial official Mapiye Wekwete to question the late vice president Simon Muzenda about the criteria for recognizing pioneer war veterans.

targets.targetText: An binne ta ne a gidansu na ƙauyen Gutu. Ba a amince da ita a matsayin jaruma ba, [1] [2] wanda ya sa jami'in ZANU-PF na lardin Mapiye Wekwete ya yi wa marigayi mataimakin shugaban ƙasa Simon Muzenda tambayoyi game da sharuɗɗa na amincewa da tsoffin sojojin majagaba.

An binne ta ne a gidansu na kauyen Gutu . Ba a amince da ita a matsayin jaruma ba, [1] [2] wanda ya sa jami'in ZANU-PF na lardin Mapiye Wekwete ya yi wa marigayi mataimakin shugaban kasa Simon Muzenda tambayoyi game da sharudda na amincewa da tsoffin sojojin majagaba.

items.sourceText: After completing his primary education in Southern Rhodesia, Nkomo took a carpentry course at the Tsholotsho Government Industrial School and studied there for a year before becoming a driver. He later tried animal husbandry, then became a schoolteacher specialising in carpentry at Manyame School in Kezi. In 1942, at the age of 25, during his career as a teacher, he decided that he should go to South Africa to further his education, do carpentry and qualify to a higher level. He attended Adams College and the Jan H. Hofmeyr School of Social Work in South Africa,[1] where he met Nelson Mandela and other future nationalist leaders at the University of Fort Hare, although he did not attend that university. It was at the Jan Hofmeyr School of Social Work that he was awarded a diploma in social work in 1952. Nkomo married his wife Johanna Fuyana on 1 October 1949.

targets.targetText: Bayan kammala karatun firamare a Kudancin Rhodesia, Nkomo ya yi karatun kafinta a Makarantar Masana'antu ta Gwamnati ta Tsholotsho inda ya yi karatu a can na tsawon shekara guda kafin ya zama direba. Daga baya ya gwada kiwon dabbobi, sannan ya zama malamin makaranta wanda ya kware a aikin kafinta a makarantar Manyame da ke Kezi . A shekarar 1942, yana da shekaru 25 a duniya, a lokacin da yake aikin koyarwa, ya yanke shawarar cewa zai je Afirka ta Kudu don kara ilimi, aikin kafinta, kuma ya cancanci zuwa babban mataki. Ya halarci Kwalejin Adams da Jan H. Hofmeyr School of Social Work a Afirka ta Kudu, [1] inda ya sadu da Nelson Mandela da sauran shugabannin kasa na gaba a Jami'ar Fort Hare, ko da yake bai halarci wannan jami'a ba. Ya kasance a Jan Hofmeyr School of Social Work cewa an ba shi digiri a aikin zamantakewa a 1952. Nkomo ya auri matarsa Johanna Fuyana a ranar 1 ga Oktoba 1949.

items.sourceText: Nkomo was born on 19 June 1917 in Matopos, Matabeleland, Southern Rhodesia (now Matobo, Zimbabwe) to a poor Ndebele family.[4][5][6] He was one of eight children. His father (Thomas Nyongolo Letswansto Nkomo) worked as a preacher and a cattle rancher and worked for the London Missionary Society. His mother was Mlingo Hadebe.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: An haifi Nkomo a ranar 19 ga watan Yuni 1917 a Matopos, Matabeleland, Kudancin Rhodesia (yanzu Matobo, Zimbabwe) zuwa dangin Ndebele matalauta. [1] [2] [3] Yana ɗaya daga cikin yara takwas. Mahaifinsa (Thomas Nyongolo Letswansto Nkomo) ya yi aiki a matsayin mai wa'azi kuma mai kiwon shanu kuma ya yi aiki da Ƙungiyar Mishan ta London. Mahaifiyarsa ita ce Mlingo Hadebe. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

An haifi Nkomo a ranar 19 ga Yuni 1917 a Matopos, Matabeleland, Kudancin Rhodesia (yanzu Matobo, Zimbabwe ) zuwa dangin Ndebele matalauta. [1] [2] [3] Yana daya daga cikin yara takwas. Mahaifinsa (Thomas Nyongolo Letswansto Nkomo) ya yi aiki a matsayin mai wa'azi kuma mai kiwon shanu kuma ya yi aiki da Ƙungiyar Mishan ta London . Mahaifiyarsa ita ce Mlingo Hadebe. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: Sithole was born in Nyamandlovu, Southern Rhodesia, on 21 July 1920. Sithole's father was Ndau and his mother was Ndebele. He studied teaching in the United States from 1955 to 1958, and was ordained a Methodist minister in 1958. The publication of his book African Nationalism and its immediate prohibition by the minority government motivated his entry into politics. During his studies in the United States he studied at the Andover Newton Theological School and attended the First Church in Newton, founded in 1665, both located in Newton, Massachusetts.

targets.targetText: An haifi Sithole a Nyamandlovu, Kudancin Rhodesia, a ranar 21 ga Yuli 1920. Mahaifin Sithole Ndau ne mahaifiyarsa kuma Ndebele . Ya yi karatun koyarwa a Amurka daga 1955 zuwa 1958, kuma an nada shi ministan Methodist a 1958. Buga littafinsa na African Nationalism da kuma haramcinta da ‘yan tsiraru suka yi shi ya sa ya shiga siyasa. A lokacin karatunsa a Amurka ya yi karatu a Makarantar Tauhidi ta Andover Newton kuma ya halarci Cocin Farko a Newton, wanda aka kafa a 1665, duka suna a Newton, Massachusetts.

An haifi Sithole a Nyamandlovu, Kudancin Rhodesia, a ranar 21 ga watan Yuli 1920. Mahaifin Sithole Ndau ne mahaifiyarsa kuma Ndebele. Ya yi karatun koyarwa a Amurka daga shekarun 1955 zuwa 1958, kuma an naɗa shi ministan Methodist a shekarar 1958. Buga littafinsa na African Nationalism da kuma haramcinta da ‘yan tsiraru suka yi shi ya sa ya shiga siyasa. A lokacin karatunsa a Amurka ya yi karatu a Makarantar Tauhidi ta Andover Newton kuma ya halarci Cocin Farko a Newton, wanda aka kafa a shekarar 1665, duka suna a Newton, Massachusetts.

items.sourceText: At the invitation of Amílcar Cabral, in 1969 she became the director of the Pilot School of the African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde, which was launched in Conakry in 1965 with the goal of educating young fighters and war orphans.[1][2][6][7][8]

targets.targetText: A gayyatar Amílcar Cabral, a cikin 1969 ta zama darektan Makarantar Pilot na Jam'iyyar Afirka don 'Yancin Guinea da Cape Verde, wanda aka kaddamar a Conakry a 1965 da burin ilmantar da matasa mayakan da marayu na yaki. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5]

items.sourceText: Lilica Boal died in 2024 at age 90, in Praia.[11][12][13] She was buried in her hometown of Tarrafal.[11][13] On her death, Cabo Verde President José Maria Neves called her "a woman of courage and vision, one of the pillars of our history."[12] The Women's Organization of Cape Verde's Professional Training and Qualification Center in Tarrafal has been named in her honor since 2022.[11]

targets.targetText: Lilica Boal ta mutu a cikin 2024 tana da shekaru 90, a Praia . [1] [2] [3] An binne ta a garinsu na Tarrafal. [1] [3] A lokacin mutuwarta, shugaban Cabo Verde José Maria Neves ya kira ta "mace mai karfin zuciya da hangen nesa, daya daga cikin ginshiƙan tarihin mu." [2] Cibiyar Horar da Ƙwararrun Ƙwararru da Ƙwararrun Mata ta Cape Verde a Tarrafal ta kasance cikin girmamawarta tun 2022. [1]

Lilica Boal ta mutu a cikin shekarar 2024 tana da shekaru 90, a Praia. [1] [2] [3] An binne ta a garinsu na Tarrafal. [1] [3] A lokacin mutuwarta, shugaban Cabo Verde José Maria Neves ya kira ta "mace mai karfin zuciya da hangen nesa, ɗaya daga cikin ginshiƙan tarihin mu." [2] Cibiyar Horar da Ƙwararrun Ƙwararru da Ƙwararrun Mata ta Cape Verde a Tarrafal ta kasance cikin girmamawarta tun a shekarar 2022. [1]

items.sourceText: Following a visit to Melilla, Spanish War Minister Agustín Luque took control of the operations on 7 October, and the struggles brought numerous losses to both sides, 64 death and 204 wounded on the Spanish side.[5] On 14 October 1911 General Salvador Díaz Ordóñez was killed in action and a column commanded by General Navarro [es] had 33 deaths and 105 wounded.[5]

targets.targetText: Bayan ziyarar Melilla, Ministan Yakin Spaniya Agustín Luque ya karɓi ragamar ayyukan a ranar 7 ga watan Oktoba, kuma gwagwarmayar ta haifar da asarar da yawa ga ɓangarorin biyu, mutuwar 64 da 204 da suka jikkata a ɓangaren Spain. A ranar 14 ga watan Oktoba 1911 Janar Salvador Díaz Ordóñez aka kashe a cikin aiki kuma wani shafi da General Navarro ya umarta. ya mutu 33 kuma 105 sun jikkata.

Bayan ziyarar Melilla, Ministan Yakin Mutanen Espanya Agustín Luque ya karbi ragamar ayyukan a ranar 7 ga Oktoba, kuma gwagwarmayar ta haifar da asarar da yawa ga bangarorin biyu, mutuwar 64 da 204 da suka jikkata a bangaren Spain. [ 5 ] A ranar 14 ga Oktoba 1911 Janar Salvador Díaz Ordóñez aka kashe a cikin aiki kuma wani shafi da General Navarro ya umarta. ya mutu 33 kuma 105 sun jikkata. [ 5 ]

items.sourceText: The signing of the Treaty of Fez in 1912 established a French protectorate over Morocco.[4] The treaty had been prompted by the Agadir Crisis of 1911, during which French and Spanish troops had been sent to Morocco to put down a rebellion against Sultan Abdelhafid. The new French protectorate was led by a resident-general, Louis-Hubert Lyautey, and adopted the traditional Moroccan way of governing through the tribal system.[4] Upon taking up his post Lyautey replaced Abdelhafid with his brother, Yusef.[5] The tribes took offence at this, installing their own Sultan, Ahmed al-Hiba, in Marrakesh and taking eight Europeans captive.[5] Lyautey acted quickly against the revolt, dispatching General Charles Mangin and 5,000 troops to retake the town. Mangin's men were highly successful, rescuing the captives and inflicting heavy casualties on vastly superior numbers of tribesmen for the loss of 2 men killed and 23 wounded.[5] Al-Hiba escaped to the Atlas mountains with a small number of his followers and opposed French rule until his death in 1919.[6]

targets.targetText: Rattaba hannu kan yarjejeniyar Fez a cikin shekarar 1912 ya kafa kariyar Faransa a kan Maroko. [1] Rikicin Agadir na shekarar 1911 ne ya haifar da wannan yarjejeniya, inda aka tura sojojin Faransa da Spain zuwa Maroko don kawar da tawaye ga Sultan Abdelhafid. Wani babban mazaunin ƙasar, Louis-Hubert Lyautey ne ya jagoranci sabuwar kariyar Faransa, kuma ta ɗauki hanyar gargajiya ta Moroccan na gudanar da mulki ta tsarin ƙabilanci. [1] Bayan ya ɗauki muƙaminsa Lyautey ya maye gurbin Abdelhafid da ɗan'uwansa, Yusef. [2] Ƙabilun sun yi fushi da wannan, inda suka kafa Sultan nasu, Ahmed al-Hiba, a Marrakesh kuma suka kama turawa takwas. [2] Lyautey ya yi gaggawar nuna adawa da tawayen, inda ya aika Janar Charles Mangin da sojoji 5,000 domin su kwato garin. Mutanen Mangin sun yi nasara sosai, inda suka kuɓutar da mutanen da aka yi garkuwa da su tare da yi musu mummunar btarna a kan alkaluman ƙabilu masu tarin yawa saboda asarar mutane 2 da aka kashe da 23 suka jikkata. [2] Al-Hiba ya tsere zuwa tsaunukan Atlas tare da wasu tsirarun mabiyansa kuma suna adawa da mulkin Faransa har zuwa rasuwarsa a shekara ta 1919. [3]

Rattaba hannu kan yarjejeniyar Fez a cikin 1912 ya kafa kariyar Faransa a kan Maroko. [1] Rikicin Agadir na 1911 ne ya haifar da wannan yarjejeniya, inda aka tura sojojin Faransa da Spain zuwa Maroko don kawar da tawaye ga Sultan Abdelhafid . Wani babban mazaunin ƙasar, Louis-Hubert Lyautey ne ya jagoranci sabuwar kariyar Faransa, kuma ta ɗauki hanyar gargajiya ta Moroccan na gudanar da mulki ta tsarin kabilanci. [1] Bayan ya ɗauki mukaminsa Lyautey ya maye gurbin Abdelhafid da ɗan'uwansa, Yusef . [2] Ƙabilun sun yi fushi da wannan, inda suka kafa Sultan nasu, Ahmed al-Hiba, a Marrakesh kuma suka kama turawa takwas. [2] Lyautey ya yi gaggawar nuna adawa da tawayen, inda ya aika Janar Charles Mangin da sojoji 5,000 domin su kwato garin. Mutanen Mangin sun yi nasara sosai, inda suka kubutar da mutanen da aka yi garkuwa da su tare da yi musu mummunar barna a kan alkaluman kabilu masu tarin yawa saboda asarar mutane 2 da aka kashe da 23 suka jikkata. [2] Al-Hiba ya tsere zuwa tsaunukan Atlas tare da wasu tsirarun mabiyansa kuma suna adawa da mulkin Faransa har zuwa rasuwarsa a shekara ta 1919. [3]

items.sourceText: The second war involved a larger territory. It started when the Gqunukhwebe clans of the Xhosa started to penetrate back into the Zuurveld, a district between the Great Fish and the Sundays Rivers. Some frontiersmen, under Barend Lindeque, allied themselves with Ndlambe (regent of the Western Xhosas) to repel the Gqunukhwebe. Panic ensued and farms were abandoned.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Yaƙin na biyu ya ƙunshi yanki mafi girma. Ya fara ne lokacin da dangin Gqunukhwebe na Xhosa suka fara kutsawa zuwa cikin Zuurveld, gundumar tsakanin Babban kogin Kifi da Kogin Lahadi. Wasu masu kan iyaka, a ƙarƙashin Barend Lindeque, sun haɗa kansu da Ndlambe (sarkin Yammacin Xhosas) don korar Gqunukhwebe. Firgici ya tashi aka bar gonaki. [1] [2]

Wasu masu kan iyaka, a ƙarƙashin Barend Lindeque, sun haɗa kansu da Ndlambe (sarkin Yammacin Xhosas) don korar Gqunukhwebe. Firgici ya tashi aka bar gonaki. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: During the early 19th century, a diverse group of Sotho-, Nguni- and Tswana-speaking tribes settled in the Caledon River region. The latter two, which formed the minority of the population, were gradually assimilated by the culturally dominant Sotho. King Moshoeshoe I united the various Sotho-speaking chieftainships into a single nation during a period of political turbulence known as Lifaqane. He transformed the denigratory exonym of Sotho into the name of the nascent Basuto nation.[1][2] In 1833, missionaries from the Paris Evangelical Missionary Society began setting their outposts in Basuto lands following Moshoeshoe's invitation. They promoted a combination of Christianity, Western civilization, and commerce. They saw Basuto customs linked to obligatory labor and the dependence of the population on their chiefs as evil. They sought to undermine them by promoting private property, the commodization of production and closer economic ties with European settlers.[3]

targets.targetText: A farkon karni na 19, gungun kabilu daban-daban na Sotho -, Nguni - da Tswana - masu magana sun zauna a yankin kogin Caledon . Na biyun na ƙarshe, waɗanda suka zama tsirarun jama'a, a hankali Sotho da ke da rinjaye a al'adu sun haɗa su. Sarki Moshoeshoe na I ya haɗa sarakunan Sotho daban-daban zuwa al'umma guda a lokacin rikicin siyasa da aka sani da Lifaqane . Ya canza sunan Sotho na wulakanci zuwa sunan al'ummar Basuto . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] A shekara ta 1833, masu wa’azi a ƙasashen waje daga ƙungiyar bishara ta Paris suka fara kafa sansaninsu a ƙasashen Basuto bayan gayyatar Moshoeshoe. Sun inganta haɗin gwiwar Kiristanci, wayewar Yammacin Turai, da kasuwanci. Suna ganin al’adar Basuto tana da nasaba da aikin dole da kuma dogaro da jama’a ga sarakunansu a matsayin sharri. Sun nemi su lalata su ta hanyar tallata kadarori masu zaman kansu, samar da kayayyaki da kuma kusancin tattalin arziki tare da mazauna Turai. [ 3 ]
