Ɗansa, Sidi El Mekki Amhaouch, ya ci gaba da yaƙi da Faransawa har zuwa lokacin da ya sha kashi a shekara ta 1932. Zuriyar Amhaouch shugaban addini ne a Maroko ta zamani.

items.sourceText: The Gambela People's Liberation Movement (abbreviated GPLM) was a rebel group in the Gambela Region in Ethiopia. The GPLM was founded by Anuak dissidents during the Derg regime.[1] The organization remained dominated by Anuaks.[2] Agwa Alemu was the chairman of the GPLM.[3]

targets.targetText: Kungiyar 'yantar da jama'ar Gambela (wato GPLM) ƙungiya ce ta 'yan tawaye a yankin Gambela a ƙasar Habasha. Masu adawa da Anuak ne suka kafa GPLM a lokacin mulkin Dergi. [1] Ƙungiyar ta kasance ƙarƙashin ikon Anuaks. [2] Agwa Alemu shi ne shugaban GPLM. [3]

Kungiyar 'yantar da jama'ar Gambela ( wato GPLM ) kungiya ce ta 'yan tawaye a yankin Gambela a kasar Habasha . Masu adawa da Anuak ne suka kafa GPLM a lokacin mulkin Dergi . [1] Kungiyar ta kasance karkashin ikon Anuaks. [2] Agwa Alemu shi ne shugaban GPLM. [3]

items.sourceText: On 16 May 1991, the GPLM and EPRDF forces captured Gambela, routing the Derg and SPLA forces.[1] The GPLM would dominate Gambela politics during the transitional period of 1991–1994.[11] After the victory over the Derg regime, the regional government in Gambela was handed over to the GPLM.[3] GPLM participated in the 1991 National Conference.[12] During the transitional period, the GPLM had two delegates in the Council of Representatives.[13] In July 1992, the GPLM leader Agwa Alemu was killed by his own troops.[14]

targets.targetText: A ranar 16 ga watan Mayun 1991 ne sojojin GPLM da na EPRDF suka kwace Gambela, inda suka fatattaki sojojin Dergi da SPLA. [1] Jam'iyyar GPLM ce za ta mamaye siyasar Gambela a lokacin riƙon kwarya na shekarar 1991-1994. [2] Bayan nasarar da aka yi wa mulkin dergi, an mika gwamnatin yankin Gambela ga GPLM. [3] GPLM ta halarci taron ƙasa na shekarar 1991. [4] A lokacin rikon kwarya, GPLM tana da wakilai biyu a majalisar wakilai. [5] A watan Yulin 1992, sojojinsa suka kashe shugaban GPLM, Agwa Alemu. [6]

A ranar 16 ga watan Mayun 1991 ne sojojin GPLM da na EPRDF suka kwace Gambela, inda suka fatattaki sojojin Dergi da SPLA . [1] Jam'iyyar GPLM ce za ta mamaye siyasar Gambela a lokacin rikon kwarya na 1991-1994. [2] Bayan nasarar da aka yi wa mulkin dergi, an mika gwamnatin yankin Gambela ga GPLM. [3] GPLM ta halarci taron kasa na 1991. [4] A lokacin rikon kwarya, GPLM tana da wakilai biyu a majalisar wakilai. [5] A watan Yulin 1992, sojojinsa suka kashe shugaban GPLM, Agwa Alemu. [6]

items.sourceText: While it is unknown who created the group or even when it started, the first signs of active by the WTRF was back in December 2019 when a Facebook account by the name of Akplaga Seyram Matts started making pro-Western Togoland post including claiming that 2,000 Western Togoland military men and women passed from a guerrilla military school on 14 December.[1]

targets.targetText: Duk da yake ba a san wanda ya kirkiro kungiyar ba ko ma lokacin da aka fara, alamun farko na fara aiki da WTRF sun dawo a cikin Disamba 2019 lokacin da wani asusun Facebook mai suna Akplaga Seyram Matts ya fara yin posting na yammacin Togoland wanda ya hada da ikirarin cewa sojoji 2,000 na yammacin Togoland maza da mata sun mutu daga makarantar soja ta 'yan daba a ranar 14 ga Disamba. [1]

Duk da yake ba a san wanda ya kirkiro kungiyar ba ko ma lokacin da aka fara, alamun farko na fara aiki da WTRF sun dawo a cikin watan Disamba 2019 lokacin da wani asusun Facebook mai suna Akplaga Seyram Matts ya fara yin posting na yammacin Togoland wanda ya haɗa da ikirarin cewa sojoji 2,000 na yammacin Togoland maza da mata sun mutu daga makarantar soja ta 'yan daba a ranar 14 ga watan Disamba. [1]

items.sourceText: The Battle of Namutoni fought between the militaries of the Ondonga kingdoms and German South West Africa on 28 January 1904 was part of an uprising against German Colonial expansion catalysed by the Herero Uprising to the south that started a few weeks earlier. It was fought at the site of Fort Namutoni in northern Namibia.[2][3]

targets.targetText: Yakin Namutoni wanda aka gwabza tsakanin sojojin Masarautar Ondonga da Jamus ta Kudu maso yammacin Afirka a ranar 28 ga Janairun 1904 wani bangare ne na wani bore na fadada Turawan Mulkin Mallaka na Jamus wanda rikicin Herero ya yi a kudu wanda ya fara 'yan makonnin baya. An yi yakin ne a wurin Fort Namutoni a arewacin Namibiya . [1]

Yakin Namutoni wanda aka gwabza tsakanin sojojin Masarautar Ondonga da Jamus ta Kudu maso yammacin Afirka a ranar 28 ga watan Janairun 1904 wani ɓangare ne na wani bore na faɗaɗa Turawan Mulkin Mallaka na Jamus wanda rikicin Herero aka yi a kudu wanda ya fara 'yan makonnin baya. An yi yakin ne a wurin Fort Namutoni a arewacin Namibiya. [1]

items.sourceText: Continuous attacks on the fort by 500 Ondonga warriors lasted all day until slowing down in frequency as the day went on and eventually stopped in the afternoon. With only 150 rounds of ammunition remaining the defending Germans decided to retreat to the farm Sandhup 40 kilometres to the south on horseback during the night having incurred no casualties. The following morning the fort was sacked and destroyed by Ondonga forces claiming a number of cattle from the fort.[1]

targets.targetText: Hare-haren da mayakan Ondonga 500 suka ci gaba da kaiwa kan katangar ya ci gaba da kasancewa a duk rana har sai da ya ragu sosai yayin da ranar ke ci gaba da tsayawa da yamma. Da harsasai 150 kacal suka rage, Jamusawan da ke karewa sun yanke shawarar komawa gonar Sandhup mai tazarar kilomita 40 a kudu a kan dawakai a cikin dare ba tare da samun asarar rai ba. Washegari da safe ne sojojin Ondonga suka kori katangar tare da lalata su da suke ikirarin shanu da dama daga sansanin. [1]

Hare-haren da mayakan Ondonga 500 suka ci gaba da kaiwa kan katangar ya ci gaba da kasancewa a duk rana har sai da ya ragu sosai yayin da ranar ke ci gaba da tsayawa da yamma. Da harsasai 150 kacal suka rage, Jamusawan da ke karewa sun yanke shawarar komawa gonar Sandhup mai tazarar kilomita 40 a kudu a kan dawakai a cikin dare ba tare da samun asarar rai ba. Washegari da safe ne sojojin Ondonga suka murkushe katangar tare da lalata su da suke ikirarin samun shanu da dama daga sansanin. [1]

items.sourceText: The village has been the main settlement of the ǃKharakhoen (Fransman Nama), a subtribe of the Nama people,[2] since 1889.[3]

targets.targetText: Ƙauyen ya kasance babban wurin zama na ǃKharakhoen (Fransman Nama), ƙabilar mutanen Nama, [1] tun a shekarar 1889. [2]
Kauyen ya kasance babban wurin zama na ǃKharakhoen ( Fransman Nama ), ƙabilar mutanen Nama, [1] tun 1889. [2]

items.sourceText: Gochas was a flashpoint in the colonial Herero Wars in German South West Africa. It was used as a military post and camel station under Imperial German rule. In January 1905 the Germans defeated the Nama chief Simon Kooper here. The final battle of the war, the Battle of Seatsub, was fought in Bechuanaland in March 1908. Capt. Friedrich von Erckert was killed in action, and a memorial was built in Gochas.[4]

targets.targetText: Gochas ya kasance wuri mai haske a cikin yakin Herero na mulkin mallaka a Jamus ta Kudu maso yammacin Afirka . An yi amfani da shi azaman wurin soja da tashar raƙuma a ƙarƙashin mulkin Jamus na Imperial . A cikin Janairu 1905 Jamusawa sun ci nasara kan sarkin Nama Simon Kooper a nan. Yaƙin ƙarshe na yaƙin, Yaƙin Seatsub, an yi yaƙi ne a Bechuanaland a cikin Maris 1908. An kashe Kyaftin Friedrich von Erckert a mataki, kuma an gina wani abin tunawa a Gochas. [1]

Gochas ya kasance wuri mai haske a cikin yakin Herero na 'yan mulkin mallaka a Jamus ta Kudu maso yammacin Afirka. An yi amfani da shi azaman wurin soja da tashar raƙuma a ƙarƙashin mulkin Jamus na Imperial. A cikin watan Janairu 1905 Jamusawa sun ci nasara kan sarkin Nama Simon Kooper a nan. Yaƙin ƙarshe na yaƙin, Yaƙin Seatsub, an yi yaƙi ne a Bechuanaland a cikin watan Maris 1908. An kashe Kyaftin Friedrich von Erckert a mataki, kuma an gina wani abin tunawa a Gochas. [1]

items.sourceText: The French entrusted the war effort against Dahomey to Alfred-Amédée Dodds, an octoroon colonel of the Troupes de marine from Senegal. Colonel Dodds arrived with a force of 2,164 men, including Foreign Legionnaires, marines, engineers, artillery and Senegalese cavalry known as spahis plus the trusted tirailleurs.[4] These forces were armed with the new Lebel rifles, which would prove decisive in the coming battle.[5] The French protectorate kingdom of Porto-Novo also added some 2,600 porters to aid in the fight.[6]

targets.targetText: Faransawa sun damƙa aikin yaƙi da Dahomey ga Alfred-Amédée Dodds, wani sojan sojan octoroon na Troupes de marine daga Senegal. Kanar Dodds ya isa ne tare da sojojin 2,164, ciki har da Legionnaires na waje, ma'aikatan ruwa, injiniyoyi, manyan bindigogi da sojojin dawakai na Senegal da aka sani da spahis tare da amintattun tirailleurs . [ 4 ] Waɗannan sojojin suna ɗauke da sabbin bindigogin Lebel, waɗanda zasu tabbatar da yanke hukunci a yaƙin da ke tafe. [ 5 ] Masarautar Faransa ta Porto-Novo ta kuma kara wasu 'yan dako 2,600 don taimakawa a yakin. [ 6 ]

Faransawa sun damƙa aikin yaƙi da Dahomey ga Alfred-Amédée Dodds, wani sojan octoroon na Troupes de marine daga Senegal. Kanar Dodds ya isa ne tare da sojojin 2,164, ciki har da Legionnaires na waje, ma'aikatan ruwa, injiniyoyi, manyan bindigogi da sojojin dawakai na Senegal da aka sani da spahis tare da amintattun tirailleurs. [ 4 ] Waɗannan sojojin suna ɗauke da sabbin bindigogin Lebel, waɗanda zasu tabbatar da yanke hukunci a yaƙin da ke tafe. [ 5 ] Masarautar Faransa ta Porto-Novo ta kuma ƙara wasu 'yan dako 2,600 don taimakawa a yakin. [ 6 ]

items.sourceText: Rock art engravings of ox-drawn wagons and horse-driven chariots can be found in Algeria, Libya, southern Morocco, Mauritania, and Niger.[1]

targets.targetText: Ana iya samun zane-zanen zane- zanen dutse na kekunan shanu da karusan doki a Aljeriya, Libya, kudancin Maroko, Mauritania, da Nijar . [1]
Ana iya samun zane-zanen dutse na kekunan shanu da karusan doki a Aljeriya, Libya, kudancin Maroko, Mauritania, da Nijar . [1]

items.sourceText: Mesfin Hagos (born 1947) is an Eritrean who was one of the founding members of the Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF).[1] In government, he was the Eritrean Minister of Defense during the 1990s.[3]

targets.targetText: Mesfin Hagos (an haife shi a shekara ta 1947) ɗan ƙasar Eritiriya ne wanda yana ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa ƙungiyar EPLF ta Eritrea (Eritrean People's Liberation Front). [1] A cikin gwamnati, ya kasance Ministan Tsaro na Eritrea a shekarun 1990s.

Mesfin Hagos (an haife shi a shekara ta 1947) ɗan ƙasar Eritiriya ne wanda yana ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa ƙungiyar EPLF ta Eritrea . [1] A cikin gwamnati, ya kasance Ministan Tsaro na Eritrea a shekarun 1990s.

items.sourceText: Awate was born in 1910 in Gerset, located between Tessenei and Golluj in southwestern Italian Eritrea. His father, a peasant, trained him as early as childhood in the use of guns. Hamid was of Beni-Amer descent.[1][2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Awate a shekara ta 1910 a Gerset, dake tsakanin Tessenei da Golluj a kudu maso yammacin ƙasar Italiya. Mahaifinsa, Baƙauye, ya horar da shi tun yana ƙuruciya ta hanyar amfani da bindigogi. Hamid ɗan ƙabilar Beni-Amer ne. [1] [2]

An haifi Awate a shekara ta 1910 a Gerset, dake tsakanin Tessenei da Golluj a kudu maso yammacin kasar Italiya . Mahaifinsa, Baƙauye, ya horar da shi tun yana ƙuruciya ta hanyar amfani da bindigogi. Hamid dan kabilar Beni-Amer ne . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Sebhat Ephrem (Tigrinya: ስብሓት ኤፍረም; born 1951) is an Eritrean military officer and politician who is the Minister of Energy and Mines for Eritrea. He was also the former Minister of Defence and former Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF) commander during the Eritrean War of Independence.

targets.targetText: Sebhat Ephrem (Tigrinya: Sab ኤፍረም; an haife shi a shekara ta 1951) wani jami'in sojan Eritrea ne kuma ɗan siyasa wanda shi ne Ministan Makamashi da Ma'adinai na Eritrea. Ya kuma kasance tsohon ministan tsaro kuma tsohon kwamandan kungiyar EPLF a lokacin yakin neman ‘yancin kai na Eritrea.

Sebhat Ephrem ( Tigrinya : Sab ኤፍረም; an haife shi a shekara ta 1951) wani jami'in sojan Eritrea ne kuma ɗan siyasa wanda shi ne Ministan Makamashi da Ma'adinai na Eritrea . Ya kuma kasance tsohon ministan tsaro kuma tsohon kwamandan kungiyar EPLF a lokacin yakin ‘yancin kai na Eritrea .

items.sourceText: Petros Solomon (Tigrinya: ጴጥሮስ ሰሎሞን; born 5 May 1951[1]) is an Eritrean politician. He was an Eritrean People's Liberation Front commander and played a key role during the Eritrean War of Independence, following independence he served in several positions in the Cabinet, including Minister of Defense and Minister of Foreign Affairs.

targets.targetText: Petros Solomon (an haife shi 5 ga Mayu 1951 [1] ɗan siyasan Eritrea ne. Ya kasance kwamandan kungiyar 'yantar da jama'ar Eritrea kuma ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Eritriya, bayan samun 'yancin kai ya yi aiki a muƙamai da dama a majalisar ministocin ƙasar, ciki har da ministan tsaro da ministan harkokin waje .

Petros Solomon ( Tigrinya Pet ; an haife shi 5 ga Mayu 1951 [1] ɗan siyasan Eritrea ne. Ya kasance kwamandan kungiyar 'yantar da jama'ar Eritrea kuma ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Eritriya, bayan samun 'yancin kai ya yi aiki a mukamai da dama a majalisar ministocin kasar, ciki har da ministan tsaro da ministan harkokin waje .

items.sourceText: Saleh Meki (1948 – October 2, 2009) was an Eritrean politician and government minister. He was a member of the Eritrean People's Liberation Front, which had offices in the San Francisco Bay Area of the United States, during the period of the Eritrean War of Independence.[1]

targets.targetText: Saleh Meki (1948 - Oktoba 2, 2009) ɗan siyasan Eritrea ne kuma ministan gwamnati. Ya kasance memba na kungiyar 'yantar da jama'ar Eritrea, wacce ke da ofisoshi a yankin San Francisco Bay na Amurka, a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Eritrea. [1]

Saleh Meki (1948 - Oktoba 2, 2009) ɗan siyasan Eritrea ne kuma ministan gwamnati. Ya kasance memba na kungiyar 'yantar da jama'ar Eritrea, wadda ke da ofisoshi a yankin San Francisco Bay na Amurka, a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Eritrea . [1]

items.sourceText: The National Liberation Army or ALN (Arabic: جيش التحرير الوطني الجزائري, romanized: Jaīš al-taḥrīr al-waṭanī al-jazāʾirī; French: Armée de libération nationale) was the armed wing of the nationalist National Liberation Front of Algeria during the Algerian War. After Algeria won its independence from France in 1962, the ALN was converted into the regular Algerian People's National Armed Forces.

targets.targetText: The National Liberation Army ko ALN ( Arabic ; French ) ya kasance reshe mai dauke da makamai na kungiyar 'yantar da kasa ta Aljeriya a lokacin yakin Aljeriya . Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai daga Faransa a 1962, an mayar da ALN zuwa rundunar sojojin kasar Aljeriya na yau da kullun.

The National Liberation Army ko ALN ya kasance reshe mai ɗauke da makamai na kungiyar 'yantar da ƙasa ta Aljeriya a lokacin yakin Aljeriya. Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai daga Faransa a shekarar 1962, an mayar da ALN zuwa rundunar sojojin kasar Aljeriya na yau da kullun.

items.sourceText: The Mozambique Liberation Front, also known as FRELIMO, adopted armed struggle against its Portuguese colonizers.[4] However, in order to adopt armed struggle, it needed arms. The Front de Libération Nationale of Algeria is accredited with having provided weapons to national liberation groups, such as FRELIMO, in the 1960s.[2] Yet, how long and what exactly the Front de Liberation Nationale sent to its African counterparts remains widely unknown. Eventually, Algerian instructors within the FLN shifted their focus on violent modes of resisting colonialism, to ideological political agendas.[1] As a result, it was able to consolidate its progressive alliance with organizations like FRELIMO throughout the African continent [1] Nonetheless, the Algerian FLN is accused with having failed with regards to leaving long-standing political and ideological impressions on FRELIMO. Unlike the FLN, FRELIMO was able to consolidate its party ideology, all the while creating and solidifying its political institutions in Mozambique.[5] That being said, FRELIMO was able to establish itself within the society and politics of Mozambique.[5] Therefore, it is difficult to minimize the influence of the FLN on the rise of a Marxist regime in newly post-colonial Mozambique.[5]

targets.targetText: Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Mozambique, wadda aka fi sani da FRELIMO, ta ɗauki nauyin gwagwarmaya da masu mulkin mallaka na Portugal. [1] Duk da haka, don ɗaukar gwagwarmayar makamai, yana buƙatar makamai. An amince da Front de Liberation Nationale na Aljeriya da samar da makamai ga kungiyoyin 'yantar da kasa, kamar FRELIMO, a cikin 1960s. [2] Amma duk da haka, har zuwa wane lokaci da kuma ainihin menene ƙungiyar Front de Liberation Nationale ta aika wa takwarorinta na Afirka har yanzu ba a san ko ina ba. Daga ƙarshe, malaman Aljeriya a cikin FLN sun mai da hankali kan yanayin tashin hankali na adawa da mulkin mallaka, zuwa manufofin siyasa na akida. [2] Sakamakon haka, ta sami damar ƙarfafa haɗin gwiwarta na ci gaba da ƙungiyoyi kamar FRELIMO a duk faɗin nahiyar Afirka [2] Duk da haka, ana zargin FLN na Aljeriya da gazawa game da barin ra'ayoyin siyasa da akida na dogon lokaci akan FRELIMO. Ba kamar FLN ba, FRELIMO ta sami damar ƙarfafa akidun jam'iyyarta, duk lokacin da take ƙirƙira da ƙarfafa cibiyoyinta na siyasa a Mozambique . [3] Da aka ce, FRELIMO ta sami damar kafa kanta a cikin al'umma da siyasar Mozambique. [3] Don haka, yana da wahala a rage tasirin FLN a kan bullowar gwamnatin Markisanci a sabuwar kasar Mozambique bayan mulkin mallaka. [3]

Ƙungiyar neman 'Yancin Mozambique, wacce aka fi sani da FRELIMO, ta ɗauki nauyin gwagwarmaya da masu mulkin mallaka na Portugal. [1] Duk da haka, don ɗaukar gwagwarmayar makamai, yana buƙatar makamai. An amince da Front de Liberation Nationale na Aljeriya da samar da makamai ga kungiyoyin 'yantar da ƙasa, kamar FRELIMO, a cikin shekarar 1960s. [2] Amma duk da haka, har zuwa wane lokaci da kuma ainihin menene ƙungiyar Front de Liberation Nationale ta aika wa takwarorinta na Afirka har yanzu ba a san ko ina ba. Daga ƙarshe, malaman Aljeriya a cikin FLN sun mai da hankali kan yanayin tashin hankali na adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka, zuwa manufofin siyasa na akida. [2] Sakamakon haka, ta sami damar ƙarfafa haɗin gwiwarta na ci gaba da ƙungiyoyi kamar FRELIMO a duk faɗin nahiyar Afirka [2] Duk da haka, ana zargin FLN na Aljeriya da gazawa game da barin ra'ayoyin siyasa da akida na dogon lokaci akan FRELIMO. Ba kamar FLN ba, FRELIMO ta sami damar ƙarfafa akidun jam'iyyarta, duk lokacin da take ƙirƙira da ƙarfafa cibiyoyinta na siyasa a Mozambique. [3] Da aka ce, FRELIMO ta sami damar kafa kanta a cikin al'umma da siyasar Mozambique. [3] Don haka, yana da wahala a rage tasirin FLN a kan ɓullowar gwamnatin Markisanci a sabuwar kasar Mozambique bayan mulkin mallaka. [3]

items.sourceText: In 1952, he rode professionally in the French Terrot-Hutchinson team. Later that year, in July, he was one of the cyclists selected for the North African team to participate in the Tour de France. However, he did not make the time limit during the first stage.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1952, ya yi hawan gwaninta a cikin ƙungiyar Terrot-Hutchinson ta Faransa. Daga baya a wannan shekarar, a watan Yuli, yana ɗaya daga cikin masu tseren keken da aka zaɓa domin tawagar Arewacin Afirka don shiga gasar Tour de France. Duk da haka, bai sanya ƙayyadaddun lokaci ba a lokacin matakin farko. [1]

A cikin 1952, ya yi hawan gwaninta a cikin ƙungiyar Terrot-Hutchinson ta Faransa. Daga baya a wannan shekarar, a watan Yuli, yana daya daga cikin masu keken keke da aka zaba domin tawagar Arewacin Afirka don shiga gasar Tour de France. Duk da haka, bai sanya ƙayyadaddun lokaci ba a lokacin matakin farko. [1]

items.sourceText: Sid Ahmed Inal also known by his war surname Djaâfar, was an Algerian activist and teacher. He was born on February 21, 1931, in Tlemcen. He died on November 1, 1956, in Ben Badis (Province of Sidi Bel Abbès), after being captured and tortured by the French army during the Algerian War.

targets.targetText: Sid Ahmed Inal wanda kuma aka fi sani da sunan yaƙin Djaâfar, ɗan gwagwarmaya ne kuma malami ɗan Aljeriya. An haife shi a ranar 21 ga Fabrairu, 1931, a Tlemcen . Ya rasu a ranar 1 ga Nuwamba, 1956, a Ben Badis ( Lardin Sidi Bel Abbès ), bayan da sojojin Faransa suka kama shi tare da azabtar da shi a lokacin yakin Aljeriya .

Sid Ahmed Inal wanda kuma aka fi sani da sunan yaƙin Djaâfar, ɗan gwagwarmaya ne kuma malami ɗan Aljeriya. An haife shi a ranar 21 ga watan Fabrairu, 1931, a Tlemcen. Ya rasu a ranar 1 ga watan Nuwamba, 1956, a Ben Badis (Lardin Sidi Bel Abbès), bayan da sojojin Faransa suka kama shi tare da azabtar da shi a lokacin yakin Aljeriya.

items.sourceText: in 1961 he was one of the ALN representatives in the talks and the negotiations with France, which led to 'ceasefire' and the signing of Evian agreements.[3]

targets.targetText: A shekarar 1961 ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin wakilan ALN a tattaunawa da tattaunawa da Faransa, wanda ya haifar da 'tsagaita wuta' da rattaba hannu kan yarjejeniyar Evian. [1]
a 1961 ya kasance daya daga cikin wakilan ALN a tattaunawa da tattaunawa da Faransa, wanda ya haifar da 'tsagaita wuta' da rattaba hannu kan yarjejeniyar Evian. [1]

items.sourceText: Bouregaa was born in El Omaria on 15 March 1933. He performed his military service Mostaganem and Briançon with the Chasseurs Alpins.[1] He was then sent to Safi in Morocco, where he escaped in March 1956 to join the National Liberation Front.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Bouregaa a El Omaria a ranar 15 ga Maris 1933. Ya yi hidimar soji Mostaganem da Briançon tare da Chasseurs Alpins . [1] Daga nan aka aika shi zuwa Safi a Maroko, inda ya tsere a watan Maris 1956 ya shiga kungiyar 'yanci ta kasa . [2]

An haifi Bouregaa a El Omaria a ranar 15 ga watan Maris 1933. Ya yi hidimar soji Mostaganem da Briançon tare da Chasseurs Alpins. [1] Daga nan aka aika shi zuwa Safi a Maroko, inda ya tsere a watan Maris 1956 ya shiga kungiyar 'yanci ta ƙasa. [2]

items.sourceText: Ali studied law and became a lawyer. His political awakening took place during the days of the Popular Front. It was marked by the call for the emancipation of the Algerian Nation launched by Messali Hadj and sensitive to the commitment and communist mobilization in the Muslim Congress. He refused military service in the French Army, which earned him a list of anti-French activities and to be considered a dangerous nationalist.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: Ali ya yi karatun lauya kuma ya zama lauya. Farkawar siyasarsa ta faru ne a zamanin Popular Front . An yi bikin ne da kiran 'yantar da al'ummar Aljeriya da Messali Hadj ya kaddamar tare da kula da jajircewa da yunkurin gurguzu a cikin majalisar musulmi . Ya ƙi aikin soja a cikin Sojojin Faransa, wanda ya ba shi jerin abubuwan da ke adawa da Faransanci kuma an ɗauke shi a matsayin mai kishin ƙasa mai haɗari . [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

Ali ya yi karatun lauya kuma ya zama lauya. Farkawar siyasarsa ta faru ne a zamanin Popular Front. An yi bikin ne da kiran 'yantar da al'ummar Aljeriya da Messali Hadj ya kaddamar tare da kula da jajircewa da yunkurin gurguzu a cikin majalisar musulmi. Ya ƙi aikin soja a cikin Sojojin Faransa, wanda ya ba shi jerin abubuwan da ke adawa da Faransa kuma an ɗauke shi a matsayin mai kishin ƙasa mai haɗari . [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: Following the recommendations of the report by historian Benjamin Stora on remembrance of French Algeria, on March 2, 2021, French President Emmanuel Macron recognized that Ali Boumendjel was "tortured and murdered" by the French army. [5] The president received four of Ali Boumendjel's grandchildren to announce to them the recognition, on behalf of France, of his assassination.[6] The press release evokes the confession of Paul Aussaresses to have ordered one of his subordinates to disguise the murder as suicide. [7]

targets.targetText: Biyo bayan shawarwarin rahoton da masanin tarihi Benjamin Stora ya bayar kan tunawa da Aljeriya na Faransa, a ranar 2 ga Maris, 2021, Shugaban Faransa Emmanuel Macron ya gane cewa sojojin Faransa sun " azabtar da Ali Boumendjel kuma sun kashe shi . [1] Shugaban ya amshi jikokin Ali Boumendjel guda hudu don sanar da su amincewa da kisan gillar da aka yi masa a madadin Faransa . [2] Sanarwar da manema labarai ta fitar ta kori ikirari na Paul Aussaresses na ba da umarnin daya daga cikin wadanda ke karkashinsa ya mayar da kisan a matsayin kunar bakin wake. [3]

Biyo bayan shawarwarin rahoton da masanin tarihi Benjamin Stora ya bayar kan tunawa da Aljeriya na Faransa, a ranar 2 ga watan Maris, 2021, Shugaban Faransa Emmanuel Macron ya gane cewa sojojin Faransa sun "azabtar da Ali Boumendjel kuma sun kashe shi. [1] Shugaban ya amshi jikokin Ali Boumendjel guda huɗu don sanar da su amincewa da kisan gillar da aka yi masa a madadin Faransa. [2] Sanarwar da manema labarai ta fitar ta kori ikirari na Paul Aussaresses na ba da umarnin ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda ke ƙarƙashin sa ya mayar da kisan a matsayin kunar bakin wake. [3]

items.sourceText: In 1957, she was convicted alongside another Algerian rebel, Djamila Bouazza, of bombing a cafe and killing 11 civilians. She was sentenced to death, but the sentence was commuted after an international campaign for her to be spared, and she was released from prison in 1962.

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1957, an yanke mata hukunci tare da wani ɗan tawayen Aljeriya, Djamila Bouazza, da laifin tayar da bam a wani wurin shan ruwa tare da kashe fararen hula 11. An yanke mata hukuncin kisa, amma an sassauta hukuncin bayan wani kamfen da aka yi a duniya, kuma an sake ta daga kurkuku a shekara ta 1962.

A cikin 1957, an yanke mata hukunci tare da wani dan tawayen Aljeriya, Djamila Bouazza, da laifin tayar da bam a wani wurin shan ruwa tare da kashe fararen hula 11. An yanke mata hukuncin kisa, amma an sassauta hukuncin bayan wani yaƙin neman zaɓe da aka yi a duniya, kuma an sake ta daga kurkuku a shekara ta 1962.

items.sourceText: In April 1957, before a large planned demonstration in the Casbah, she was captured by the French and tortured for information. Bouhired maintains that she did not confess to any wrongdoing or reveal any confidential information about the FLN. According to Bouhired, the torture went on for a total of 17 days.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: A cikin watan Afrilu 1957, kafin wani babban zanga-zangar da aka shirya a Casbah, Faransawa sun kama ta kuma suka azabtar da ita don samun bayanai. Bouhired ta ci gaba da cewa ba ta amsa wani laifi ba ko kuma ta bayyana duk wani bayani na sirri game da FLN. A cewar Bouhired, an shafe kwanaki 17 ana azabtar da su. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

A cikin Afrilu 1957, kafin wani babban zanga-zangar da aka shirya a Casbah, Faransawa sun kama ta kuma suka azabtar da ita don samun bayanai. Bouhired ta ci gaba da cewa ba ta amsa wani laifi ba ko kuma ta bayyana duk wani bayani na sirri game da FLN. A cewar Bouhired, an shafe kwanaki 17 ana azabtar da su. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: However, she was not executed, remaining imprisoned, before the end of the war in 1962. In the Évian Accords, she was granted amnesty.[4]

targets.targetText: Duk da haka, ba a kashe ta ba, ta kasance a gidan yari, kafin ƙarshen yakin a shekarar 1962. A cikin yarjejeniyar Évian, an yi mata afuwa. [1]
Duk da haka, ba a kashe ta ba, ta kasance a gidan yari, kafin karshen yakin a 1962. A cikin yarjejeniyar Évian, an yi mata afuwa. [1]

items.sourceText: Hocine was born in May 1940, the third child in her family, which originally hailed from Ighil Imoul [ar], after two brothers.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Hocine a watan Mayu 1940, yaro na uku a cikin iyalinta, wanda asalinsa ya fito ne daga Ighil Imoul , bayan 'yan'uwa biyu.[1]
An haifi Hocine a watan Mayu 1940, yarinya ta uku da aka haifa a cikin iyalinta, wanda asalinta ta fito ne daga Ighil Imoul , bayan 'yan'uwa biyu.[1]

items.sourceText: Ahmed Mahsas (Arabic: أحمد (علي) محساس; 17 November 1923 – 24 February 2013) was an Algerian Fighter in the nationalist movement against French Algeria.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Ahmed Mahsas (17 Nuwamba 1923 - 24 Fabrairu 2013) ya kasance mayakin Aljeriya a cikin gwagwarmayar kishin ƙasa da Faransa Aljeriya. [1] [2]
Ahmed Mahsas ( Arabic ; 17 Nuwamba 1923 - 24 Fabrairu 2013) ya kasance mayakin Aljeriya a cikin gwagwarmayar kishin kasa da Faransa Aljeriya . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: After a disagreement started between him and the other revolutionary leaders, Mahsas was ousted from the FLN base in Tripoli. He was then sentenced to death by Amar Ouamrane and imprisoned in a Tunisian prison. He escaped with some help, left for Germany, and remained there until Algerian independence in 1962.[30][31]

targets.targetText: Bayan da aka soma rashin jituwa tsakaninsa da sauran jagororin juyin juya hali, an kori Mahsas daga sansanin FLN da ke Tripoli. Daga nan ne Amar Ouamrane ya yanke masa hukuncin kisa, aka kuma ɗaure shi a gidan yari na Tunisiya. Ya tsere da wani taimako, ya tafi Jamus, ya zauna a can har zuwa lokacin da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai a shekarar 1962. [1] [2]

Bayan da aka soma rashin jituwa tsakaninsa da sauran jagororin juyin juya hali, an kori Mahsas daga sansanin FLN da ke Tripoli . Daga nan ne Amar Ouamrane ya yanke masa hukuncin kisa, aka kuma daure shi a gidan yari na Tunisiya. Ya tsere da wani taimako, ya tafi Jamus, ya zauna a can har zuwa lokacin da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai a 1962. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: He was arrested on 28 May 1945, after refusing to obey orders to kill in the Sétif and Guelma massacre and deserting, and was transferred to the capital, where he was imprisoned, tortured, and sentenced to death on charges of planning to control the barracks. Then, in 1946, an amnesty was granted to him by General Georges Catroux. He returned to Kabylia and became responsible within the PPA-MTLD (Algerian People's Party-Movement for the Triumph of Democratic Liberties) as a deputy to Krim Belkacem. His political activity during the 1946 electoral campaign for the municipal elections led to him being arrested and sentenced to death again, but he managed to escape and was forced to go into hiding until the outbreak of the war.[1]

targets.targetText: An kama shi ne a ranar 28 ga watan Mayun 1945, bayan ya ki bin umarnin kisan gilla a Setif da Guelma da kuma gudun hijira, sannan aka kai shi babban birnin ƙasar, inda aka ɗaure shi, da azabtar da shi, da kuma yanke masa hukuncin kisa bisa zarginsa da shirin sarrafa bariki. Sannan, a cikin shekarar 1946, Janar Georges Catroux ya yi masa afuwa. Ya koma Kabylia kuma ya zama alhaki a cikin PPA-MTLD (Jam'iyyar Jama'ar Aljeriya - Movement for the Triumph of Democratic Liberties) a matsayin mataimakin Krim Belkacem. Ayyukansa na siyasa a lokacin yaƙin neman zaɓe na shekarar 1946 na zaɓen ƙananan hukumomi ya sa aka kama shi aka sake yanke masa hukuncin kisa, amma ya sami nasarar tserewa kuma aka tilasta masa ya ɓoye har lokacin da yakin ya barke. [1]

An kama shi ne a ranar 28 ga watan Mayun 1945, bayan ya ki bin umarnin kisan gilla a Setif da Guelma da kuma gudun hijira, sannan aka kai shi babban birnin kasar, inda aka daure shi, da azabtar da shi, da kuma yanke masa hukuncin kisa bisa zarginsa da shirin sarrafa bariki. Sannan, a cikin 1946, Janar Georges Catroux ya yi masa afuwa. Ya koma Kabylia kuma ya zama alhaki a cikin PPA-MTLD ( Jam'iyyar Jama'ar Aljeriya - Movement for the Triumph of Democratic Liberties ) a matsayin mataimakin Krim Belkacem . Ayyukansa na siyasa a lokacin yaƙin neman zaɓe na 1946 na zaɓen ƙananan hukumomi ya sa aka kama shi aka sake yanke masa hukuncin kisa, amma ya sami nasarar tserewa kuma aka tilasta masa ya ɓoye har lokacin da yakin ya barke. [1]

items.sourceText: He was voted onto the thirty-member central committee of the Etoile Nord-Africaine (ENA) and remained in this position through both subsequent renaming of the organization: the Parti du Peuple Algerien in 1937 and the Mouvement pour le Triomphe des Libertés Démocratiques in 1946. The start of the Algerian War of Independence on November 1, 1954, marked the merger of the military, religious, and political independence associations into the Front de Libération nationale (FLN). Radjef became a permanent member of this organization's central committee in 1956 and remained so until the Algerian Independence in 1962.

targets.targetText: An zabe shi a cikin mambobi 30 na kwamitin tsakiya na Etoile Nord-Africaine (ENA) kuma ya ci gaba da kasancewa a wannan matsayi ta hanyar canza sunan kungiyar: Parti du Peuple Algerien a 1937 da Mouvement pour le Triomphe des Libertés Democratiques a 1946. Farkon Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya a ranar 1 ga Nuwamba, 1954, ya nuna haɗewar ƙungiyoyin soja, addini, da siyasa na 'yancin kai zuwa Front de Liberation nationale (FLN). Radjef ya zama mamba na dindindin na kwamitin tsakiya na wannan kungiya a shekara ta 1956 kuma ya kasance a haka har zuwa lokacin da Aljeriya ta samu ‘yancin kai a shekarar 1962.

An zaɓe shi a cikin mambobi 30 na kwamitin tsakiya na Etoile Nord-Africaine (ENA) kuma ya ci gaba da kasancewa a wannan matsayi ta hanyar canza sunan kungiyar: Parti du Peuple Algerien a shekarar 1937 da Mouvement pour le Triomphe des Libertés Democratiques a shekarar 1946. Farkon Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya a ranar 1 ga watan Nuwamba, 1954, ya nuna haɗewar ƙungiyoyin soja, addini, da siyasa na 'yancin kai zuwa Front de Liberation nationale (FLN). Radjef ya zama mamba na dindindin na kwamitin tsakiya na wannan kungiya a shekara ta 1956 kuma ya kasance a haka har zuwa lokacin da Aljeriya ta samu ‘yancin kai a shekarar 1962.[1]

items.sourceText: In the 1994 European Parliament election, Helena led the PSR's candidacy, making her the first black leader of an electoral list in Portuguese elections. Her campaign brought visibility to the issues of racism and xenophobia in Portugal and Europe. In 1999, she was one of the founders of the Left Bloc,[1][3] among the 248 people who signed the party's founding declaration.[4] Helena was also a member of Cape Verde's Council of State,[1][3] having joined at the invitation of President Jorge Carlos Fonseca.[4] In 2015, she was honoured with the Second Degree of the Amílcar Cabral Order by the President of the Republic of Cape Verde.[1]

targets.targetText: A zaben Majalisar Tarayyar Turai na 1994, Helena ta jagoranci takarar jam'iyyar PSR, inda ta zama bakar fata ta farko shugabar jerin zabuka a zabukan Portugal . Kamfen nata ya kawo hangen nesa ga batutuwan wariyar launin fata da kyamar baki a Portugal da Turai. A cikin 1999, ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa Ƙungiyar Hagu, [1] [2] a cikin mutane 248 da suka sanya hannu kan sanarwar kafa jam'iyyar. [3] Helena kuma memba ce ta Majalisar Dokokin Jihar Cape Verde, [1] [2] bayan ta shiga bisa gayyatar Shugaba Jorge Carlos Fonseca . [4] A cikin 2015, an karrama ta da Digiri na biyu na odar Amílcar Cabral ta Shugaban Jamhuriyar Cape Verde. [1]

A zaɓen Majalisar Tarayyar Turai na 1994, Helena ta jagoranci takarar jam'iyyar PSR, inda ta zama bakar fata ta farko shugabar jerin zaɓuka a zaɓukan Portugal. Kamfen nata ya kawo hangen nesa ga batutuwan wariyar launin fata da kyamar baki a Portugal da Turai. A cikin shekarar 1999, ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa Ƙungiyar Hagu, [1] [2] a cikin mutane 248 da suka sanya hannu kan sanarwar kafa jam'iyyar. [3] Helena kuma memba ce ta Majalisar Dokokin Jihar Cape Verde, [1] [2] bayan ta shiga bisa gayyatar Shugaba Jorge Carlos Fonseca. [4] A cikin shekarar 2015, an karrama ta da Digiri na biyu na odar Amílcar Cabral ta Shugaban Jamhuriyar Cape Verde. [1]

items.sourceText: The phrase also gained prominence during the 2016 South African #FeesMustFall protests. Additionally, it has been used by human rights activists in Indonesia, particularly during the 2019 protests and riots, to demand government action on unresolved human rights violations.[10][11]

targets.targetText: Kalmar ta kuma yi fice a lokacin zanga-zangar #FeesMustFall ta Afirka ta Kudu ta 2016. Bugu da kari, masu fafutukar kare hakkin bil'adama a Indonesia sun yi amfani da shi musamman a lokacin zanga-zangar 2019 da tarzoma, don neman daukar matakin gwamnati kan take hakkin dan Adam da ba a warware ba . [1] [2]

Kalmar ta kuma yi fice a lokacin zanga-zangar #FeesMustFall ta Afirka ta Kudu ta 2016. Bugu da ƙari, masu fafutukar kare hakkin bil'adama a Indonesia sun yi amfani da ita musamman a lokacin zanga-zangar 2019 da tarzoma, don neman ɗaukar matakin gwamnati kan take hakkin ɗan Adam da ba a warware ba. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: At morning of 7 February 1878 a combined force of 1,500 Gcalaka and Rharhabe attacked the British camp near Centane (Kentani)[1] in an attempt to secure food and ammunition. Imperial forces consisting of about 400 British soldiers, mainly of the 67th Regiment of Foot of the Durham Light Infantry, commanded by Captain Russell Upcher were supported by approximately 560 Fengu warriors and the local Frontier Light Horse militia,[2] who fought mostly unhorsed, led by F. Carrington.[3] A subsequent attack was barely repelled, but outnumbered British were able to defend their posts with very low losses.

targets.targetText: A safiyar ranar 7 ga watan Fabrairun 1878 haɗaɗɗiyar dakarun Gcalaka 1,500 da Rharhabe sun kai hari sansanin Birtaniya kusa da Centane (Kentani) [1] a kokarin tabbatar da abinci da harsasai. Sojojin Imperial da suka ƙunshi kimanin sojojin Birtaniya 400, galibi na 67th Regiment of Foot of the Durham Light Infantry, wanda Kyaftin Russell Upcher ya ba da umarni sun sami goyon bayan kimanin 560 Fengu warriors da kuma na gida Frontier Light Horse mayakan, [2] wanda ya yi yaƙi mafi yawan marasa doki, jagorancin F. Carrington. [3] Da kyar aka dakile wani harin da ya biyo baya, amma da yawa daga cikin 'yan Birtaniyya sun sami damar kare muƙaman nasu da rashin asara.

A safiyar ranar 7 ga Fabrairun 1878 hadaddiyar dakarun Gcalaka 1,500 da Rharhabe sun kai hari sansanin Birtaniya kusa da Centane (Kentani) [1] a kokarin tabbatar da abinci da harsasai. Sojojin Imperial da suka ƙunshi kimanin sojojin Birtaniya 400, galibi na 67th Regiment of Foot of the Durham Light Infantry, wanda Kyaftin Russell Upcher ya ba da umarni sun sami goyon bayan kimanin 560 Fengu warriors da kuma na gida Frontier Light Horse mayakan, [2] wanda ya yi yaƙi mafi yawan marasa doki, jagorancin F. Carrington. [3] Da kyar aka dakile wani harin da ya biyo baya, amma da yawa daga cikin 'yan Birtaniyya sun sami damar kare mukaman nasu da rashin asara.

items.sourceText: Larbi Tbessi, whose real name was Larbi Ferhati, born in 1891 in Cheria Tébessa Province, was a revolutionary and reformist Algerian, president of the Association of Algerian Muslim Ulema. He disappeared on April 4, 1957, during the war of Algeria, following his arrest at his Algiers home by civilians disguised paratroopers, the French military are still denying arresting or detaining him.[1]

targets.targetText: Larbi Tbessi, wanda sunansa na ainihi shine Larbi Ferhati, an haife shi a shekara ta 1891 a lardin Cheria Tébessa, ɗan juyin juya hali ne kuma mai gyara Aljeriya, shugaban kungiyar Aljeriya Muslim Ulema . Ya ɓace a ranar 4 ga Afrilu, 1957, a lokacin yakin Aljeriya, bayan da fararen hula da ke ɓoyewa suka kama shi a gidansa na Algiers, sojojin Faransa har yanzu suna musanta kama shi ko tsare shi.[1]

Larbi Tbessi, wanda sunansa na ainihi shine Larbi Ferhati, an haife shi a shekara ta 1891 a lardin Cheria Tébessa, ɗan juyin juya hali ne kuma mai kawo sauyin Aljeriya, shugaban kungiyar Aljeriya Muslim Ulema. Ya ɓace a ranar 4 ga watan Afrilu, 1957, a lokacin yakin Aljeriya, bayan da fararen hula da ke ɓoyewa suka kama shi a gidansa na Algiers, sojojin Faransa har yanzu suna musanta kama shi ko tsare shi.[1]

items.sourceText: Abdel Nasser Ould Ethmane (Arabic: عبد الناصر ولد عثمان) is a Mauritanian human rights activist one of the founding members of SOS Esclaves(SOS Slaves). He along with Boubacar Messaoud founded the human rights organization to abolish slavery in Mauritania.

targets.targetText: Abdel Nasser Ould Ethmane ( Arabic ) ɗan gwagwarmayar kare hakkin ɗan Adam ɗan ƙasar Mauritania ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa kungiyar SOS Esclaves(SOS Slaves). Shi tare da Boubacar Messaoud sun kafa kungiyar kare hakkin ɗan adam don kawar da bautar bayi a ƙasar Mauritania.

Abdel Nasser Ould Ethmane ( Arabic ) dan gwagwarmayar kare hakkin dan Adam dan kasar Mauritania daya daga cikin wadanda suka kafa kungiyar SOS Esclaves(SOS Slaves). Shi tare da Boubacar Messaoud sun kafa kungiyar kare hakkin dan adam don kawar da bauta a kasar Mauritania .

items.sourceText: The Massacre of El Ouffia (French: L'affaire d'El Ouffia) took place on 6 April 1832 during the French conquest of Algeria. It was committed against the tribe of El Ouffia near El Harrach by the Troupes Coloniales under Colonel Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg.[1]

targets.targetText: Kisan kiyashin El Ouffia (Faransa: L'affaire d'El Ouffia) ya faru ne a ranar 6 ga watan Afrilu 1832 lokacin da Faransa ta mamaye Aljeriya. An yi ta ne a kan ƙabilar El Ouffia kusa da El Harrach ta Rundunar Sojojin 'yan mulkin Mallaka ƙarƙashin Kanar Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg. [1]

Kisan El Ouffia (Faransa: L'affaire d'El Ouffia) ya faru ne a ranar 6 ga Afrilu 1832 lokacin da Faransa ta mamaye Aljeriya . An yi ta ne a kan kabilar El Ouffia kusa da El Harrach ta Rundunar Sojojin Mallaka karkashin Kanar Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg . [1]

items.sourceText: The sleeping Algerians were surprised at dawn on 7 April 1832, and many were slain without attempting to defend themselves.[13]

targets.targetText: Aljeriya masu barci sun yi mamakin wayewar ranar 7 ga Afrilu 1832, kuma an kashe da yawa ba tare da ƙoƙarin kare kansu ba. [1]

items.sourceText: Lieutenant General Lookout Khalisabantu Vumindaba Masuku (7 April 1940 – 5 April 1986) commanded the Zimbabwe People's Revolutionary Army (ZIPRA), the militant wing of the Zimbabwe African People's Union (ZAPU), during the Rhodesian Bush War. He served as the deputy commander of the Zimbabwe National Army until his arrest in 1982 for allegedly plotting to overthrow President Robert Mugabe.[1]

targets.targetText: Laftanar Janar Lookout Khalisabantu Vumindaba Masuku (7 Afrilu 1940 – 5 Afrilu 1986) ya jagoranci Sojojin Juyin Juyin Juya Hali na Jama'ar Zimbabwe (ZIPRA), reshen 'yan gwagwarmaya na Zimbabwe African People's Union (ZAPU), a lokacin yakin Rhodesia. Ya riƙe muƙamin mataimakin kwamandan sojojin ƙasar Zimbabwe har zuwa lokacin da aka kama shi a shekarar 1982 bisa zarginsa da yunkurin kifar da gwamnatin shugaba Robert Mugabe. [1]

Laftanar Janar Lookout Khalisabantu Vumindaba Masuku (7 Afrilu 1940 – 5 Afrilu 1986) ya jagoranci Sojojin Juyin Juyin Juya Hali na Jama'ar Zimbabwe (ZIPRA), reshen 'yan gwagwarmaya na Zimbabwe African People's Union (ZAPU), a lokacin yakin Rhodesia . Ya rike mukamin mataimakin kwamandan sojojin kasar Zimbabwe har zuwa lokacin da aka kama shi a shekarar 1982 bisa zarginsa da yunkurin kifar da gwamnatin shugaba Robert Mugabe . [1]

items.sourceText: Phipps married James Phipps, an Englishman from Westbury in Wiltshire, c. 1705. Together, they had four daughters and one son: Bridget, Susanna, Henrietta, and a son whose name is not mentioned in available records. Bridget Phipps would go on to marry Chauncy Townsend, who became a Member of Parliament (MP) in England and was the mother of James Townsend, who later served as MP and Lord Mayor of London, and Joseph Townsend, who became a medical doctor, geologist, vicar, and economist.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Phipps ya auri James Phipps, Bature daga Westbury a Wiltshire, c. 1705. Tare, suna da 'ya'ya mata huɗu da ɗa ɗaya: Bridget, Susanna, Henrietta, da ɗa wanda ba a ambaci sunansa ba a cikin bayanan da ake da su. Bridget Phipps zai ci gaba da auren Chauncy Townsend, wanda ya zama Memba na Majalisar (MP) a Ingila kuma ita ce mahaifiyar James Townsend, wanda daga baya ya zama MP kuma Lord Mayor of London, da Joseph Townsend, wanda ya zama likita likita, masanin ilimin geologist, vicar, da masanin tattalin arziki. [1] [2] [3]

Phipps ta auri James Phipps, Bature daga Westbury a Wiltshire, c. 1705. Tare, suna da 'ya'ya mata huɗu da ɗa ɗaya: Bridget, Susanna, Henrietta, da ɗa wanda ba a ambaci sunansa ba a cikin bayanan da ake da su. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: The liberated Africans came from all over West Africa and some Central African countries. A significant portion of the recaptives settled in Freetown were Akan, Yoruba, Igbo and Hausa.

targets.targetText: 'Yan Afirkan da aka 'yantar sun fito ne daga ko'ina a yammacin Afirka da wasu kasashen tsakiyar Afirka . Wani muhimmin bangare na wadanda aka sake kama da suka zauna a Freetown sune Akan, Yarbawa, Igbo da Hausa .

'Yan Afirkan da aka 'yantar sun fito ne daga ko'ina a yammacin Afirka da wasu kasashen tsakiyar Afirka. Wani muhimmin ɓangare na waɗanda aka sake kamawa da suka zauna a Freetown sune Akan, Yarbawa, Igbo da Hausa .

items.sourceText: Besides these groups a newspaper, O Brado Africano was established in the early 1920s. One of the first African weeklies on the continent, it provided an outlet for native dissent. Chilcote, in 1967, wrote that "Although controlled by the Salazar government, it remains African-oriented."[1]

targets.targetText: Bayan waɗannan ƙungiyoyin jarida, O Brado Africano an kafa shi a farkon shekara ta 1920s. Ɗaya daga cikin makwanni na farko na Afirka a cikin nahiyar, ya ba da hanyar da za ta nuna rashin amincewa da 'yan ƙasa. Chilcote, a cikin shekarar 1967, ya rubuta cewa "Ko da yake gwamnatin Salazar ke iko da shi, ya kasance mai dogaro da Afirka." [1]

items.sourceText: The Casa dos Estudantes do Império was a semi-official centre for African students in Lisbon. It was pronounced subversive and closed by the government in 1965.

targets.targetText: Casa dos Estudantes do Império wata cibiya ce ta ɗalibin Afirka a Lisbon. An bayyana shi a matsayin juyin mulki kuma gwamnati ta rufe shi a shekarar 1965.

items.sourceText: In April 1961 Adelino Gwambe travelled to Rabat to represent all three parties, UDENAMO, MANU and UNAMI, at the conference where FRAIN was disbanded and replaced by the Confederação das Organizações Nacionalistas das Colónias Portuguesas (CONCP).

targets.targetText: A cikin Afrilu 1961 Adelino Gwambe ya yi tafiya zuwa Rabat don wakiltar dukkanin jam'iyyu uku, UDENAMO, MANU da UNAMI, a taron da aka watse FRAIN aka maye gurbinsa da Confederação das Organizações Nacionalistas das Colónia Portuguesas (CONCP).

A cikin watan Afrilu 1961 Adelino Gwambe ya yi tafiya zuwa Rabat don wakiltar dukkanin jam'iyyu uku, UDENAMO, MANU da UNAMI, a taron da aka watse FRAIN aka maye gurbinsa da Confederação das Organizações Nacionalistas das Colónia Portuguesas (CONCP).

items.sourceText: The Movement for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda (Portuguese: Movimento para a Libertação do Encrave de Cabinda; French: Mouvement de Libération de l'Enclave du Cabinda; MLEC) is a defunct, separatist organization that campaigned for the independence of Cabinda province from Portugal. MLEC merged with the Action Committee of the Cabinda National Union(which was originally a faction of MLEC) and the Mayombe National Alliance in 1963 to form the Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda. Cabinda is now a province and an exclave of Angola.[1]

targets.targetText: The Movement for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda (Portuguese: Movimento para a Libertação do Encrave de Cabinda; Faransanci: Mouvement de Libération de l'Enclave du Cabinda; MLEC) kungiya ce mai rabuwa wacce ta yi yakin neman 'yancin Lardin Cabinda daga Portugal. MLEC ta haɗu da Kwamitin Ayyuka na Ƙungiyar Ƙasa ta Cabinda (wanda asalinsa ƙungiya ce ta MLEC) da Mayombe National Alliance a 1963 don kafa Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda . Cabinda yanzu lardin ne kuma wani yanki ne na Angola . [1]

The Movement for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda (Portuguese: Movimento para a Libertação do Encrave de Cabinda; Faransanci: Mouvement de Libération de l'Enclave du Cabinda; MLEC) ƙungiya ce ta 'yan tawaye wacce ta yi yakin neman 'yancin Lardin Cabinda daga Portugal. MLEC ta haɗu da Kwamitin Ayyuka na Ƙungiyar Ƙasa ta Cabinda (wanda asalinta ƙungiya ce ta MLEC) da Mayombe National Alliance a shekarar 1963 don kafa Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda. Cabinda yanzu lardin ne kuma wani yanki ne na Angola. [1]

items.sourceText: Abdelkrim Al Khatib (2 March 1921 – 28 September 2008) was a Moroccan surgeon, politician and activist. He co-founded the National Popular Movement which would later split and was eventually re-branded as the Justice and Development Party. He became the first leader of Morocco's House of Representatives.

targets.targetText: Abdelkrim Al Khatib (2 Maris 1921 - 28 Satumba 2008) likitan fiɗa ne, ɗan siyasa kuma ɗan gwagwarmaya. Shi ne ya kafa jam'iyyar National Popular Movement wacce daga baya za ta rabu kuma a ƙarshe aka mayar da ita jam'iyyar Justice and Development Party. Ya zama shugaban majalisar wakilai na Morocco na farko.
