Shi ne ya kafa jam'iyyar National Popular Movement wadda daga baya za ta rabu kuma a karshe aka mayar da ita jam'iyyar Justice and Development Party . Ya zama shugaban majalisar wakilai na Morocco na farko.

items.sourceText: Al Khatib was born on 2 March 1921 in El Jadida. His father, Omar Al Khatib, was an administrative interpreter of Algerian origin and his mother Meriem El Guebbas was Moroccan.[1] He became the first surgeon in Morocco[2] and was involved when the Popular Movement was started. He was a campaigner for independence and he became the first leader of Morocco's House of Representatives. He was also a Government minister several times.[3]

targets.targetText: An haifi Al Khatib a ranar 2 ga Maris 1921 a El Jadida . Mahaifinsa, Omar Al Khatib, shi ne mai fassarar gudanarwa na asalin Aljeriya kuma mahaifiyarsa Meriem El Guebbas 'yar Morocco ce. [1] Ya zama likita na farko a Maroko [2] kuma ya shiga lokacin da aka fara Popular Movement . Ya kasance mai fafutukar neman ‘yancin kai kuma ya zama shugaban majalisar wakilai na Morocco na farko. Ya kuma kasance ministan Gwamnati sau da dama. [3]

An haifi Al Khatib a ranar 2 ga watan Maris 1921 a El Jadida. Mahaifinsa, Omar Al Khatib, shi ne mai fassarar gudanarwa na asalin Aljeriya kuma mahaifiyarsa Meriem El Guebbas 'yar Morocco ce. [1] Ya zama likita na farko a Maroko [2] kuma ya shiga lokacin da aka fara Popular Movement. Ya kasance mai fafutukar neman ‘yancin kai kuma ya zama shugaban majalisar wakilai na Morocco na farko. Ya kuma kasance ministan Gwamnati sau da dama. [3]

items.sourceText: Mahjoubi Aherdane (born 1921/1924 in Oulmes and died on November 15, 2020[1]) was a Moroccan politician, Amazigh nationalist, poet and painter. Alongside Abdelkrim al-Khatib, he founded the Popular Movement in 1957, a political party defending the Amazigh cause and formed mainly of former militants of the Moroccan Liberation Army (ALN).

targets.targetText: Mahjoubi Aherdane (an haife shi a shekara ta 1921/1924 a Oulmes kuma ya mutu a ranar 15 ga watan Nuwamba, 2020 [1] ) ɗan siyasan Moroko ne, Amazigh ɗan kishin ƙasa, mawaƙi kuma mai zane. Tare da Abdelkrim al-Khatib, ya kafa Popular Movement a shekara ta 1957, jam'iyyar siyasa mai kare manufar Amazigh kuma ya kafa mafi yawan tsoffin mayakan kungiyar 'yantar da Moroko (ALN).

Mahjoubi Aherdane (an haife shi a shekara ta 1921/1924 a Oulmes kuma ya mutu a ranar 15 ga Nuwamba, 2020 [1] ) ɗan siyasan Moroko ne, Amazigh ɗan ƙasa, mawaƙi kuma mai zane. Tare da Abdelkrim al-Khatib, ya kafa Popular Movement a shekara ta 1957, jam'iyyar siyasa mai kare manufar Amazigh kuma ya kafa mafi yawan tsoffin mayakan kungiyar 'yantar da Moroko (ALN).

items.sourceText: Oginga Odinga was born in the village of Nyamira Kang'o, Bondo, to Mama Opondo Nyamagolo and Odinga Raila.[5] In his autobiography, Not Yet Uhuru, Odinga estimates the date of his birth to be October 1911. Christened Obadiah Adonijah, he later renounced his Christian names and became known as Oginga Odinga. He was a student of Maseno School[6] and Alliance High School. He went to Makerere University in 1940, and returned to Maseno High School as a teacher. In 1948 he joined the political party Kenya African Union (KAU).

targets.targetText: An haifi Oginga Odinga a ƙauyen Nyamira Kang'o, Bondo, ɗa ga Mama Opondo Nyamagolo da Odinga Raila. [1] A cikin tarihin rayuwarsa, Ba tukuna Uhuru, Odinga ya kiyasta ranar haihuwarsa zuwa watan Oktoba 1911. Christened Obadiah Adonija, daga baya ya yi watsi da sunansa na Kirista kuma ya zama sananne da Oginga Odinga. Ya kasance ɗalibi na Makarantar Maseno [2] da Makarantar Sakandare ta Alliance. Ya tafi Jami'ar Makerere a shekarar 1940, kuma ya koma makarantar sakandare ta Maseno a matsayin malami. A shekarar 1948 ya shiga jam'iyyar siyasa ta Kenya African Union (KAU).

An haifi Oginga Odinga a kauyen Nyamira Kang'o, Bondo, ga Mama Opondo Nyamagolo da Odinga Raila. [1] A cikin tarihin rayuwarsa, Ba tukuna Uhuru, Odinga ya kiyasta ranar haihuwarsa zuwa Oktoba 1911. Christened Obadiah Adonija, daga baya ya yi watsi da sunansa na Kirista kuma ya zama sananne da Oginga Odinga. Ya kasance dalibi na Makarantar Maseno [2] da Makarantar Sakandare ta Alliance . Ya tafi Jami'ar Makerere a 1940, kuma ya koma makarantar sakandare ta Maseno a matsayin malami. A 1948 ya shiga jam'iyyar siyasa ta Kenya African Union (KAU).

items.sourceText: FORD split before the 1992 elections. Odinga himself vied for the presidency on Ford-Kenya ticket, but finished fourth with a share of 17.5% votes. However, he regained the Bondo Constituency seat after being forced out of parliamentary politics for over two decades. Odinga died in 1994 in Aga Khan Hospital, Kisumu. He is buried at the Jaramogi Oginga Odinga Mausoleum in his Bondo home.

targets.targetText: FORD ya rabu kafin zaben 1992 . Odinga da kansa ya nemi tikitin takarar shugaban kasa na Ford-Kenya, amma ya zo na hudu da kaso 17.5% na kuri'u. Duk da haka, ya sake samun kujerar mazabar Bondo bayan da aka tilasta masa ficewa daga siyasar majalisa sama da shekaru ashirin. Odinga ya mutu a 1994 a asibitin Aga Khan, Kisumu. An binne shi a Mausoleum na Jaramogi Oginga Odinga da ke gidansa na Bondo .

FORD ya rabu kafin zaɓen 1992. Odinga da kansa ya nemi tikitin takarar shugaban ƙasa na Ford-Kenya, amma ya zo na huɗu da kaso 17.5% na kuri'u. Duk da haka, ya sake samun kujerar mazaɓar Bondo bayan da aka tilasta masa ficewa daga siyasar majalisa sama da shekaru ashirin. Odinga ya mutu a shekarar 1994 a asibitin Aga Khan, Kisumu. An binne shi a Mausoleum na Jaramogi Oginga Odinga da ke gidansa na Bondo.

items.sourceText: Ngei was born at Kiima Kimwe near Machakos township, Kenya. He was the grandson of paramount chief Masaku after whom the town and the district were named. The family moved from Kiima Kimwe to a new settlement at Kangundo Division in a small village called Mbilini in 1929. This was a mountainous area with good rainfall for agriculture. His father had been converted to Christianity by the Africa Inland Mission.

targets.targetText: An haifi Ngei a Kiima Kimwe kusa da garin Machakos, Kenya . Shi jikan babban sarki Masaku ne aka sanya sunan garin da gundumar. Iyalin sun ƙaura daga Kiima Kimwe zuwa wani sabon ƙauye a yankin Kangundo a wani ƙaramin ƙauye da ake kira Mbilini a cikin 1929. Wannan yanki ne mai tsaunuka da ruwan sama mai kyau ga noma. Ofishin Jakadancin Afirka na cikin gida ya mayar da mahaifinsa zuwa Kiristanci.

An haifi Ngei a Kiima Kimwe kusa da garin Machakos, Kenya. Shi jikan babban sarki Masaku ne aka sanya sunan garin da gundumar. Iyalan sun ƙaura daga Kiima Kimwe zuwa wani sabon ƙauye a yankin Kangundo a wani ƙaramin ƙauye da ake kira Mbilini a cikin shekarar 1929. Wannan yanki ne mai tsaunuka da ruwan sama mai kyau ga noma. Ofishin Jakadancin Afirka na cikin gida ya mayar da mahaifinsa zuwa Kiristanci.

items.sourceText: In 1989, Muliro teamed up with Kenneth Matiba, Charles Rubia, Martin Shikuku, Phillip Gachoka and Oginga Odinga to form FORD (Forum for restoration of democracy), a pressure-group agitating for a return to pluralist politics. After violent clashes pitting FORD supporters against police and government supporters, the KANU government accepted multi-partyism in 1991. FORD became a party with Muliro as its vice chairman.

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1989, Muliro ya haɗu tare da Kenneth Matiba, Charles Rubia, Martin Shikuku, Phillip Gachoka da Oginga Odinga don kafa FORD (Majalisar maido da mulkin demokraɗiyya), ƙungiya mai matsa lamba don komawa ga siyasar jam'i. Bayan tashin hankalin da ya ɓarke tsakanin magoya bayan FORD da ‘yan sanda da magoya bayan gwamnati, gwamnatin KANU ta amince da jam’iyyu da dama a shekarar 1991. FORD ta zama jam’iyya tare da Muliro a matsayin mataimakin shugabanta.

A cikin 1989, Muliro ya haɗu tare da Kenneth Matiba, Charles Rubia, Martin Shikuku, Phillip Gachoka da Oginga Odinga don kafa FORD (Majalisar maido da mulkin demokraɗiyya), ƙungiya mai matsa lamba don komawa ga siyasar jam'i. Bayan tashin hankalin da ya barke tsakanin magoya bayan FORD da ‘yan sanda da magoya bayan gwamnati, gwamnatin KANU ta amince da jam’iyyu da dama a shekarar 1991. FORD ta zama jam’iyya tare da Muliro a matsayin mataimakin shugabanta.

items.sourceText: In 1969 he was arrested by his former friend Kenyatta following an incident in Kisumu during Kenyatta's visit to the town and was released in 1975.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1969 tsohon abokinsa Kenyatta ya kama shi bayan wani abin da ya faru a Kisumu yayin ziyarar Kenyatta a garin kuma aka sake shi a cikin shekarar 1975. [1]
A cikin 1969 tsohon abokinsa Kenyatta ya kama shi bayan wani abin da ya faru a Kisumu yayin ziyarar Kenyatta a garin kuma aka sake shi a cikin 1975. [1]

items.sourceText: Oneko returned to politics in 1992 when he was elected as an MP at the first multiparty elections in Kenya. He represented Ford-Kenya party, led by Oginga Odinga. However, he lost his Rarieda Constituency seat at the next elections held in 1997.[1]

targets.targetText: Oneko ya koma siyasa a 1992 lokacin da aka zabe shi a matsayin dan majalisa a zaben farko na jam'iyyu da yawa a Kenya. Ya wakilci jam'iyyar Ford-Kenya, karkashin jagorancin Oginga Odinga. Duk da haka, ya rasa kujerarsa na mazabar Rarieda a zabe mai zuwa da aka yi a 1997. [1]

Oneko ya koma siyasa a shekarar 1992 lokacin da aka zaɓe shi a matsayin ɗan majalisa a zaɓen farko na jam'iyyu da yawa a Kenya. Ya wakilci jam'iyyar Ford-Kenya, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Oginga Odinga. Duk da haka, ya rasa kujerarsa na mazaɓar Rarieda a zaɓe mai zuwa da aka yi a shekarar 1997. [1]

items.sourceText: When the British colonial government began building the Uganda Railway through the Nandi area, Koitalel led an eleven-year resistance movement against the railway.

targets.targetText: Lokacin da gwamnatin mulkin mallaka ta Burtaniya ta fara gina layin dogo na Uganda ta yankin Nandi, Koitalel ya jagoranci yunkurin juriya na tsawon shekaru goma sha daya kan hanyar dogo.
Lokacin da gwamnatin 'yan mulkin mallaka ta Burtaniya ta fara gina layin dogo na Uganda ta yankin Nandi, Koitalel ya jagoranci yunkurin tawaye na tsawon shekaru goma sha ɗaya kan hanyar dogo.

items.sourceText: In the later decades of the 19th century, at the time when the early European explorers started advancing into the interior of Kenya, Nandi territory was a closed country. Thompson in 1883 was warned to avoid the country of the Nandi, who were known for attacks on strangers and caravans that would attempt to scale the great massif of the Mau.[4]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarun baya bayan nan na karni na 19, a lokacin da masu bincike na farko na Turai suka fara shiga cikin kasar Kenya, yankin Nandi ya kasance kasa mai rufe. Thompson a cikin 1883 an gargadi Thompson da ya guje wa ƙasar Nandi, waɗanda aka san su da hare-haren baƙi da ayarin da za su yi ƙoƙari su daidaita babban taron Mau. [1]

A cikin shekarun baya bayan nan na ƙarni na 19, a lokacin da masu bincike na farko na Turai suka fara shiga cikin ƙasar Kenya, yankin Nandi ya kasance ƙasa mai rufewa. Thompson a cikin shekarar 1883 an gargadi Thompson da ya guje wa ƙasar Nandi, waɗanda aka san su da hare-haren baƙi da ayarin da za su yi ƙoƙari su daidaita babban taron Mau. [1]

items.sourceText: Pio Gama Pinto (31 March 1927 – 24 February 1965) was a Kenyan journalist, politician and freedom fighter. He was a socialist leader who was key in Kenya's struggle for independence. He was assassinated in 1965, leading many to consider him independent Kenya's first political martyr.[1]

targets.targetText: Pio Gama Pinto (31 Maris 1927 - 24 Fabrairu 1965) ɗan jaridar Kenya ne, ɗan siyasa kuma mai gwagwarmayar akan samun 'yanci. Ya kasance shugaban gurguzu wanda ya kasance jigon gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai na Kenya. An kashe shi a shekara ta 1965, wanda ya sa mutane da yawa suka ɗauke shi a matsayin shahidan siyasa na farko a Kenya. [1]

Pio Gama Pinto (31 Maris 1927 - 24 Fabrairu 1965) ɗan jaridar Kenya ne, ɗan siyasa kuma mai gwagwarmayar 'yanci. Ya kasance shugaban gurguzu wanda ya kasance jigon gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai na Kenya. An kashe shi a shekara ta 1965, wanda ya sa mutane da yawa suka dauke shi a matsayin shahidan siyasa na farko a Kenya . [1]

items.sourceText: Pinto was born in Nairobi on 31 March 1927 to a family of Goan Catholic descent. Born to immigrant Goan parents hailing from the Portuguese Goa, his father was an official in the colonial government of Kenya while his mother was a housewife.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Pinto a Nairobi a ranar 31 ga watan Maris 1927 ga dangin Goan Katolika. An haife shi ga iyayen Goan baƙi da suka fito daga Goa na Portugal, mahaifinsa jami'i ne a gwamnatin 'yan mulkin mallaka na Kenya yayin da mahaifiyarsa ta kasance uwar gida. [1]

An haifi Pinto a Nairobi a ranar 31 ga Maris 1927 ga dangin Goan Katolika . An haife shi ga iyayen Goan baƙi da suka fito daga Goa na Portugal, mahaifinsa jami'i ne a gwamnatin mulkin mallaka na Kenya yayin da mahaifiyarsa ta kasance uwar gida. [1]

items.sourceText: According to Ameru tradition, his parents who had migrated from Nkuene in South Imenti, gave him the name Baringo.[1] After his circumcision in 1942, and according to Meru tradition, his name had to be changed, and he was renamed M’Kirigua.[3] He had an older brother called Romano Ntabathia though from a different mother. Their father, M'Muchiri was a soothsayer and strict traditionalist.

targets.targetText: Bisa al'adar Ameru, iyayensa da suka yi hijira daga Nkuene a Kudancin Imenti, sun ba shi suna Baringo. [1] Bayan kaciyarsa a 1942, kuma bisa ga al'adar Meru, dole ne a canza sunansa, kuma aka sake masa suna M'Kirigua. [2] Yana da wani babban yaya mai suna Romano Ntabathia ko da yake daga uwa daban. Mahaifinsu M'Muchiri boka ne kuma mai tsaurin ra'ayi.

Bisa al'adar Ameru, iyayensa da suka yi hijira daga Nkuene a Kudancin Imenti, sun ba shi suna Baringo. [1] Bayan kaciyarsa a shekarar 1942, kuma bisa ga al'adar Meru, dole ne a canza sunansa, kuma aka sake masa suna M'Kirigua. [2] Yana da wani babban yaya mai suna Romano Ntabathia ko da yake daga uwa daban. Mahaifinsu M'Muchiri boka ne kuma mai tsaurin ra'ayi.

items.sourceText: Makhan Singh Jabbal (27 December 1913 – 18 May 1973) was a Kenyan labour union leader who is credited with establishing the foundations of trade unionism in Kenya.[1] He is credited to have played a vital role in the Kenyan Freedom Struggle. He was detained by the British colonialists for 11 years from 1950 to 1961 - the longest ever political detention in Kenya's history.

targets.targetText: Makhan Singh Jabbal (27 Disamba 1913). – 18 ga Mayu 1973) shugaba ne na ƙungiyar ƙwadago na Kenya wanda aka ba da lamuni da kafa tushen haɗin gwiwar kasuwanci a Kenya . [1] Ana ganin ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a gwagwarmayar neman 'yanci na Kenya. Turawan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya sun tsare shi tsawon shekaru 11 daga 1950 zuwa 1961 - tsare tsare mafi dadewa a siyasance a tarihin Kenya.

Makhan Singh Jabbal (27 Disamba 1913). – 18 ga Mayu 1973) shugaba ne na ƙungiyar ƙwadago na Kenya wacce aka ba da lamuni da kafa tushen haɗin gwiwar kasuwanci a Kenya. [1] Ana ganin ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a gwagwarmayar neman 'yanci na Kenya. Turawan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya sun tsare shi tsawon shekaru 11 daga 1950 zuwa 1961 - tsarewa mafi daɗewa a siyasance a tarihin Kenya.

items.sourceText: The Oujda group was formed around Col. Houari Boumédiène, posted in the Moroccan town of Oujda. He would later become chief of staff in the National Liberation Army (ALN), which was the armed wing of the National Liberation Front (FLN), the main nationalist organization fighting French colonial control over Algeria.[2]

targets.targetText: An kafa kungiyar ta Oujda a kusa da Col. Houari Boumédiène, wanda aka buga a garin Oujda na Morocco . Daga baya zai zama babban hafsan hafsoshi a rundunar sojojin 'yantar da kasa (ALN), wadda ita ce reshen kungiyar 'yantar da 'yanci ta kasa (FLN), babbar kungiyar 'yan kishin kasa da ke yaki da mulkin mallaka na Faransa a kan Aljeriya. [1]

An kafa kungiyar ta Oujda a kusa da Col. Houari Boumédiène, wanda aka buga a garin Oujda na Morocco. Daga baya zai zama babban hafsan hafsoshi a rundunar sojojin 'yantar da kasa (ALN), wacce ita ce reshen ƙungiyar 'yantar da 'yanci ta kasa (FLN), babbar ƙungiyar 'yan kishin ƙasa da ke yaki da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa a kan Aljeriya. [1]

items.sourceText: At about age 22, he was drawn to the movement for Algerian self-rule and independence, joining the Parti du peuple algérien (PPA) headed by Messali Hadj. Following the Sétif massacre, he was among those who pushed for the formation of an armed clandestine network, the Organisation spéciale (OS). The OS was soon crushed by France, and in 1948 he was arrested by France and imprisoned in Blida military prison, where he was tortured. After being freed in 1951, he left to live in France, where he was active in the Algerian labor movement.

targets.targetText: A lokacin da yake da shekaru 22, ya ja hankalinsa zuwa ga yunkurin neman 'yancin kai na ƙasar Aljeriya, ya shiga jam'iyyar Parti du peuple algérien (PPA) ƙarƙashin jagorancin Messali Hadj. Bayan kisan kiyashin na Sétif, yana cikin waɗanda suka yi yunkurin kafa wata kungiya ta sirri mai ɗauke da makamai, Organisation spéciale (OS). Ba da daɗewa ba Faransa ta murkushe OS ɗin, kuma a cikin shekarar 1948 Faransa ta kama shi tare da ɗaure shi a kurkukun soja na Blida, inda aka azabtar da shi. Bayan da aka sake shi a shekara ta 1951, ya tafi ya zauna a Faransa, inda yake aiki a kungiyar kwadago ta Aljeriya.

A lokacin da yake da shekaru 22, ya ja hankalinsa zuwa ga yunkurin neman ' yancin kai na Aljeriya, ya shiga jam'iyyar Parti du peuple algérien (PPA) karkashin jagorancin Messali Hadj . Bayan kisan kiyashin na Sétif, yana cikin wadanda suka yi yunkurin kafa wata kungiya ta sirri mai dauke da makamai, Organisation spéciale (OS). Ba da daɗewa ba Faransa ta murkushe OS ɗin, kuma a cikin 1948 Faransa ta kama shi tare da ɗaure shi a kurkukun soja na Blida, inda aka azabtar da shi. Bayan da aka sake shi a shekara ta 1951, ya tafi ya zauna a Faransa, inda yake aiki a kungiyar kwadago ta Aljeriya.

items.sourceText: He was born around 1818, and was the oldest of five brothers, whose father Hamou ben Abdelkrim (Arabic: حمو بن عبد الكريم) was a renowned and respected Sufi marabout in Kabylia, and his mother was Zehira bent Mohamed ben Amar (Arabic: زهيرة بنت محمد بن عمار).[4][5]

targets.targetText: An haife shi a shekara ta 1818, kuma shine babba a cikin 'yan'uwa biyar, mahaifinsa Hamou ben Abdelkrim mashahurin Sufi marabout ne a Kabiliya, kuma mahaifiyarsa ita ce Zehira bent Mohamed ben Amar. [1] [2]

An haife shi a shekara ta 1818, kuma shine babba a cikin 'yan'uwa biyar, mahaifinsa Hamou ben Abdelkrim ( Arabic ) mashahurin Sufi marabout ne a Kabiliya, kuma mahaifiyarsa ita ce Zehira bent Mohamed ben Amar ( Arabic ). [1] [2]

items.sourceText: The Battle of Alma or Battle of Boudouaou, which broke out on 19 April 1871, was a battle of the Mokrani Revolt by Algerian rebels against France, which had been the colonial power in the region since 1830.[1]

targets.targetText: Yakin Alma ko yakin Boudouaou, wanda ya barke a ranar 19 ga Afrilun 1871, yakin Mokrani ne na tawayen Mokrani da 'yan tawayen Aljeriya suka yi da Faransa, wadda ta kasance mulkin mallaka a yankin tun shekara ta 1830. [1]

Yakin Alma ko yakin Boudouaou, wanda ya ɓarke a ranar 19 ga watan Afrilun 1871, yakin Mokrani ne na tawayen Mokrani da 'yan tawayen Aljeriya suka yi da Faransa, wacce ta kasance 'yar mulkin mallaka a yankin tun shekara ta 1830. [1]

items.sourceText: It was Colonel Alexandre Fourchault who took charge of the counter-attack of the Troupes coloniales, to push back the Algerians who were going to overtake Boudouaou to begin the conquest of Mitidja.[9]

targets.targetText: Kanar Alexandre Fourchault ne ya ɗauki nauyin kai farmakin da sojojin 'yan mulkin mallaka suka yi, don tunkarar 'yan Aljeriya da za su ci karo da Boudouaou don fara mamaye Mitidja. [1]
Kanar Alexandre Fourchault ne ya dauki nauyin kai farmakin da sojojin mulkin mallaka suka yi, don tunkarar 'yan Aljeriya da za su ci karo da Boudouaou don fara mamaye Mitidja . [1]

items.sourceText: Colonel Fourchault and his snipers, after having stopped the Algerian insurrection in Alma on April 22, 1871, then marched on the Col des Beni Aïcha to dislodge the Algerian resistance fighters and punish the Kabyle population who supported them, before clearing and freeing Palestro and discovering the massacre of European settlers by supporters of Cheikh Mokrani.[11]

targets.targetText: Kanar Fourchault da maharbansa, bayan sun dakatar da tawayen Alma a ranar 22 ga watan Afrilu, 1871, daga nan sai suka nufi kan Col des Beni Aïcha don fatattakar mayakan gwagwarmayar Aljeriya tare da hukunta al'ummar Kabyle da ke goyon bayansu, kafin su kwashe tare da 'yantar da Palastinu tare da gano kisan kiyashin da magoya bayan Cheikh Mokrani suka yi wa Turawa mazauna ƙasar. [1]

Kanar Fourchault da maharbansa, bayan sun dakatar da tawayen Alma a ranar 22 ga Afrilu, 1871, daga nan sai suka nufi kan Col des Beni Aïcha don fatattakar mayakan gwagwarmayar Aljeriya tare da hukunta al'ummar Kabyle da ke goyon bayansu, kafin su kwashe tare da 'yantar da Palastinu tare da gano kisan kiyashin da magoya bayan Cheikh Mokrani suka yi wa Turawa mazauna kasar . [1]

items.sourceText: After the Algerian rebels took control of Palestro on 14 April 1871 after the Battle of Palestro, they wanted to conquer Mitidja and the city of Algiers.

targets.targetText: Bayan da 'yan tawayen Aljeriya suka karɓe iko da Palestro a ranar 14 ga watan Afrilun 1871 bayan yakin Palestro, sun so su mamaye Mitidja da birnin Algiers.
Bayan da 'yan tawayen Aljeriya suka karbe iko da Palastinu a ranar 14 ga Afrilun 1871 bayan yakin Palestro, sun so su mamaye Mitidja da birnin Algiers .

items.sourceText: In order to achieve this, Cheikh Mokrani's troops had to bypass the region of Réghaïa via Lower Kabylia, while the spring of 1871 had begun and the Oued Isser was in flood.[2]

targets.targetText: Don cimma wannan, sojojin Cheikh Mokrani sun ketare yankin Réghaïa ta hanyar Lower Kabylia, yayin da aka fara bazara na 1871 kuma Oued Isser yana cikin ambaliya. [1]
Don cimma wannan, sojojin Cheikh Mokrani sun ketare yankin Réghaïa ta hanyar Lower Kabylia, yayin da aka fara bazara na shekarar 1871 kuma Oued Isser yana cikin ambaliya. [1]

items.sourceText: One of the villagers who had fallen under the bullets was only wounded and he remained motionless pretending to be dead, and when the shooters went to take off his burnous, he took his course in the ravine and managed to escape, but five other men from the villages were similarly killed, and a woman was also killed while fleeing into the ravine.

targets.targetText: Daya daga cikin mutanen kauyen da ya fada karkashin harsashin ya samu rauni ne kawai, sai ya tsaya babu motsi yana mai cewa ya mutu, kuma a lokacin da masu harbin suka je dauke masa wuta, sai ya dauki hanyarsa a cikin kwarin, ya yi nasarar tserewa, amma an kashe wasu maza biyar daga kauyukan, sannan kuma an kashe wata mata yayin da ta gudu zuwa cikin kwarin.

Daya daga cikin mutanen ƙauyen da ya faɗa ƙarƙashin harsashin ya samu rauni ne kawai, sai ya tsaya babu motsi yana mai cewa ya mutu, kuma a lokacin da masu harbin suka je ɗauke masa wuta, sai ya ɗauki hanyarsa a cikin kwarin, ya yi nasarar tserewa, amma an kashe wasu maza biyar daga ƙauyukan, sannan kuma an kashe wata mata yayin da ta gudu zuwa cikin kwarin.

items.sourceText: Their arrest took place in 1871, and 212 persons were tried together in 1873, in the city of Constantine. Most were sent over to prisons in metropolitan France – Oléron and Saint-Martin-de-Ré (on Île de Ré) – then, as these were due to be closed, to Quélern (near Brest). At the same time, 29 of them were kept in Oran; Antoine Chanzy, the Governor-General, attempted to have them removed from the public's eye by proposing they should be sent to the Marquesas Islands. They too were ultimately transported to Quélern, through Marseille. A third group was imprisoned together with former Communards in Thouars.

targets.targetText: An kama su a shekara ta 1871, kuma an yi wa mutane 212 shari'a tare a shekara ta 1873, a birnin Constantine. Yawancin an aika su zuwa gidajen yari a babban birnin Faransa - Oléron da Saint-Martin-de-Ré (a kan Île de Ré) - sannan, kamar yadda za a rufe su, zuwa Quélern (kusa da Brest). A lokaci guda, 29 daga cikinsu an ajiye su a Oran; Antoine Chanzy, Gwamna-Janar, yayi ƙoƙarin cire su daga idon jama'a ta hanyar ba da shawarar a tura su tsibirin Marquesas. Su ma an kai su zuwa Quélern, ta hanyar Marseille. An ɗaure ruƙuni na uku tare da tsoffin kwamitocin a Thouars.

An kama su a shekara ta 1871, kuma an yi wa mutane 212 shari'a tare a shekara ta 1873, a birnin Constantine . Yawancin an aika su zuwa gidajen yari a babban birnin Faransa - Oléron da Saint-Martin-de-Ré (a kan Île de Ré ) - sannan, kamar yadda za a rufe su, zuwa Quélern (kusa da Brest ). A lokaci guda, 29 daga cikinsu an ajiye su a Oran ; Antoine Chanzy, Gwamna-Janar, yayi ƙoƙarin cire su daga idon jama'a ta hanyar ba da shawarar a tura su tsibirin Marquesas . Su ma an kai su zuwa Quélern, ta hanyar Marseille . An daure rukuni na uku tare da tsoffin kwamitocin a Thouars .

items.sourceText: Their arrival on the island coincided with transports of Communards, who were to leave precious testimonies of the Kabyles' presence. However, the Kabyles were left behind when the Communards were granted amnesty in 1879, and remained in exile despite campaigns to raise sympathy among the French public. An amnesty was awarded only in 1895, and they were not able to return to Algeria until after 1904.

targets.targetText: Zuwansu tsibirin ya yi daidai da jigilar kwamitoci, waɗanda za su bar shedu masu tamani na kasancewar Kabyles. Duk da haka, an bar Kabyles a baya lokacin da aka yi wa 'yan kwaminisanci afuwa a cikin shekarar 1879, kuma sun kasance a gudun hijira duk da yakin neman tausayawa tsakanin jama'ar Faransa. An ba da afuwar ne kawai a cikin shekarar 1895, kuma ba su sami damar komawa Algeria ba sai bayan shekarar 1904.

Zuwansu tsibirin ya yi daidai da jigilar kwamitoci, waɗanda za su bar shedu masu tamani na kasancewar Kabyles . Duk da haka, an bar Kabyles a baya lokacin da aka yi wa 'yan kwaminisanci afuwa a cikin 1879, kuma sun kasance a gudun hijira duk da yakin neman tausayawa tsakanin jama'ar Faransa. An ba da afuwar ne kawai a cikin 1895, kuma ba su sami damar komawa Algeria ba sai bayan 1904.

items.sourceText: Saâdi Yacef (Arabic: ياسف سعدي, romanized: Yāsaf Saʿadī; 20 January 1928 – 10 September 2021) was an Algerian revolutionary, politician and actor. A prominent figure during the Algerian War, he served as a leader of the National Liberation Front.[1] He was a Senator in Algeria's Council of the Nation until his death.

targets.targetText: Saâdi Yacef (20 Janairu 1928 - 10 Satumba 2021) ɗan juyin juya halin Aljeriya ne, ɗan siyasa kuma ɗan wasan kwaikwayo. Wani fitaccen jigo a lokacin yakin Aljeriya, ya taɓa zama jagoran kungiyar 'yanci ta ƙasa. [1] Ya kasance Sanata a Majalisar Aljeriya ta Aljeriya har zuwa rasuwarsa.

Saâdi Yacef ( Arabic ; 20 Janairu 1928 - 10 Satumba 2021) ɗan juyin juya halin Aljeriya ne, ɗan siyasa kuma ɗan wasan kwaikwayo. Wani fitaccen jigo a lokacin yakin Aljeriya, ya taba zama jagoran kungiyar 'yanci ta kasa . [1] Ya kasance Sanata a Majalisar Aljeriya ta Aljeriya har zuwa rasuwarsa.

items.sourceText: The Battle of Bab el Oued was principally a battle between the French Gendarmerie Mobile and the OAS Commando Delta. The French government forces used M8 Greyhound armoured cars to control the exits to the town whilst suspicious buildings were surveilled from the air by T-6 and T-28 aircraft departing from Boufarik Air Base. Four T-6s strafed the roofs to clear them from snipers after Army helicopters dropped canisters with tear gas.[2] As part of the attack, naval artillery support from the T 47-class destroyers Surcouf and Maillé-Brézé was planned, though it soon became evident that this was not practical and the bombardment was called off.[3] Most of the troops setting siege to the quarter had been ferried to Algeria by Surcouf and Maillé-Brézé, along with other three destroyers, on 2 March.[4]

targets.targetText: Yaƙin Bab el Oued ya kasance babban yaƙi tsakanin Gendarmerie Mobile na Faransa da OAS Commando Delta . Dakarun gwamnatin Faransa sun yi amfani da motoci masu sulke na M8 Greyhound wajen sarrafa hanyoyin fita zuwa garin yayin da wasu gine-ginen da ake tuhuma suka bi ta sama da jiragen T-6 da T-28 da suka taso daga sansanin sojin saman Boufarik . T-6 guda hudu ne suka yi wa rufin rufin asiri share su daga maharba bayan jirage masu saukar ungulu na Sojoji sun jefar da gwangwani da hayaki mai sa hawaye. [1] A matsayin wani ɓangare na harin, an shirya tallafin makaman sojojin ruwa daga T 47-class destroyers Surcouf da Maillé-Brézé, ko da yake ba da daɗewa ba ya bayyana cewa hakan bai dace ba kuma an dakatar da kai harin. [2] Yawancin sojojin da suka mamaye kwata-kwata Surcouf da Maillé-Brézé ne suka yi jigilar su zuwa Aljeriya, tare da wasu maharan uku, a ranar 2 ga Maris. [3]

Yaƙin Bab el Oued ya kasance babban yaƙi tsakanin Gendarmerie Mobile na Faransa da OAS Commando Delta. Dakarun gwamnatin Faransa sun yi amfani da motoci masu sulke na M8 Greyhound wajen sarrafa hanyoyin fita zuwa garin yayin da wasu gine-ginen da ake tuhuma suka bi ta sama da jiragen T-6 da T-28 da suka taso daga sansanin sojin saman Boufarik. T-6 guda huɗu ne suka yi wa rufin asiri share su daga maharba bayan jirage masu saukar ungulu na Sojoji sun jefar da gwangwani da hayaki mai sa hawaye. [1] A matsayin wani ɓangare na harin, an shirya tallafin makaman sojojin ruwa daga T 47-class destroyers Surcouf da Maillé-Brézé, ko da yake ba da daɗewa ba ya bayyana cewa hakan bai dace ba kuma an dakatar da kai harin. [2] Yawancin sojojin da suka mamaye kwata-kwata Surcouf da Maillé-Brézé ne suka yi jigilar su zuwa Aljeriya, tare da wasu maharan uku, a ranar 2 ga watan Maris. [3]

items.sourceText: In the early morning hours of 1 November 1954, FLN maquisards (guerrillas) attacked military and civilian targets throughout Algeria in what became known as the Toussaint Rouge (Red All-Saints' Day).[2] The country was divided into several Zones, later Wilayas, and each had a leader. The leader of Zone II, was Mourad Didouche,[3][4] who was one of the six founders of the FLN.[5] He regularly used hit and run tactics to weaken local French elements, and he was also well known to visit individual maquis, to inspect, or train them.

targets.targetText: A cikin safiya na 1 ga Nuwamba 1954, FLN maquisards ('yan ta'adda) sun kai hari kan sojoji da farar hula a ko'ina cikin Aljeriya a cikin abin da aka sani da Toussaint Rouge (Red All-Waliyai ). [1] An raba ƙasar zuwa yankuna da yawa, daga baya Wilayas, kuma kowanne yana da jagora. Shugaban Zone II, shi ne Mourad Didouche, [2] [3] wanda ya kasance daya daga cikin shida wadanda suka kafa FLN. [4] Ya kan yi amfani da dabarun bugawa da gudu don raunana abubuwan Faransanci na gida, kuma ya shahara wajen ziyartar maquis, don dubawa, ko horar da su.

A cikin safiya na 1 ga watan Nuwamba 1954, FLN maquisards ('yan tawaye) sun kai hari kan sojoji da farar hula a ko'ina cikin Aljeriya a cikin abin da aka sani da Toussaint Rouge (Red All-Waliyai). [1] An raba ƙasar zuwa yankuna da yawa, daga baya Wilayas, kuma kowanne yana da jagora. Shugaban Zone II, shi ne Mourad Didouche, [2] [3] wanda ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin shida waɗanda suka kafa FLN. [4] Ya kan yi amfani da dabarun bugawa da gudu don raunana abubuwan Faransan na gida, kuma ya shahara wajen ziyartar maquis, don dubawa, ko horar da su.

items.sourceText: On the night of September 5, as they prepared to depart, they found themselves surrounded by 20,000 French soldiers, accompanied by tanks and artillery, from all directions. Despite this overwhelming force, they managed to regroup, along with some civilians from Ghirane. However, before they could leave, they came under attack from T-6 helicopters, raining fire down upon them. Si Redouan's battalion split into two, with one group heading towards a nearby river and the other towards a nearby village. Meanwhile, Si Mahmoud led his group along a different route. Despite the 3km distance between the French and Algerians, the French continued their aerial bombardment, resulting in the martyrdom of many Algerians. The battle unfolded between Si Redouan and the colonial troops, bolstered by Senegalese and West African volunteers. As the intensity of the conflict escalated, it even devolved into hand-to-hand combat. The Algerians fiercely battled the Senegalese sharpshooter brigade, which was covering the mountain slope. Despite the French bombardment and their superior numbers, the Algerians held steadfast, and the resistance remained fierce. The French eventually began to lose hope, and faced with the determined Algerian resistance, they initiated multiple retreats using warplanes to withdraw to Oran. In their desperation, they resorted to using internationally banned napalm bombs, which wounded Si Redouan and led to the loss of one of his limbs after he managed to shoot down a Sikorsky helicopter. Unfortunately, this action also revealed his position to the enemy, highlighting the high cost of their resistance.[1][2][3] 650 men died on the French side, with 69 Deaths and 23 Wounded on the Algerian side mostly cause of the Napalm bombs unleashed by France.[4] France lost six aircraft.[1][3]

targets.targetText: A daren ranar 5 ga watan Satumba, yayin da suke shirin tashi, sai suka tarar da sojojin Faransa 20,000 tare da rakiyar tankokin yaki da manyan bindigogi daga ko wane ɓangare. Duk da wannan gagarumin karfi, sun yi nasarar sake haɗuwa, tare da wasu fararen hula daga Ghirane. Duk da haka, kafin su tashi, sun fuskanci farmaki daga jiragen sama masu saukar ungulu na T-6, inda aka yi ruwan wuta a kansu. Bataliyar ta Si Redouan ta rabu gida biyu, inda rukuni ɗaya ya nufi wani kogi da ke kusa, ɗayan kuma ya nufi wani ƙauye. A halin yanzu, Si Mahmoud ya jagoranci kungiyarsa ta wata hanya ta daban. Duk da tazarar kilomita 3 tsakanin Faransawa da Aljeriya, Faransawa sun ci gaba da kai hare-hare ta sama, lamarin da ya yi sanadin shahadar 'yan ƙasar da dama. Yaƙin ya ɓarke tsakanin Si Redouan da sojojin 'yan mulkin mallaka, waɗanda 'yan sa kai na Senegal da Afirka ta yamma suka ƙarfafa shi. Yayin da tsananin rikicin ya karu, har ma ya koma faɗa da hannu. 'Yan ƙasar Algeria sun yi kakkausar suka ga rundunar 'yan sandan Senegal da ke kan tudun mun tsira. Duk da harin bama-bamai na Faransa da yawansu, 'yan Algeria sun yi tsayin daka, kuma tsayin daka ya kasance mai tsanani. A ƙarshe Faransawa sun fara rasa bege, kuma sun fuskanci tsayin daka na Aljeriya, sun fara ja da baya da yawa ta hanyar amfani da jiragen yaƙi don janyewa zuwa Oran. A cikin ficewarsu, sai suka koma yin amfani da bama-baman napalm da aka haramtawa ƙasashen duniya, wanda ya raunata Si Redouan tare da rasa ɗaya daga cikin gabbansa bayan ya yi nasarar harbo wani jirgin sama mai saukar ungulu na Sikorsky. Sai dai kuma abin takaicin shi ne, wannan mataki ya kuma bayyana matsayinsa ga abokan gaba, inda ya nuna irin tsadar da suke fuskanta. [1] [2] [3] Mutane 650 ne suka mutu a ɓangaren Faransa, yayin da 69 suka mutu da kuma 23 da suka samu raunuka a ɓangaren Aljeriya mafi yawan musabbabin tashin bam ɗin Napalm da Faransa ta harba. [4] Faransa ta yi asarar jirage shida. [1] [3]

A daren ranar 5 ga watan Satumba, yayin da suke shirin tashi, sai suka tarar da sojojin Faransa 20,000 tare da rakiyar tankokin yaki da manyan bindigogi daga ko wane bangare. Duk da wannan gagarumin karfi, sun yi nasarar sake haduwa, tare da wasu fararen hula daga Ghirane . Duk da haka, kafin su tashi, sun fuskanci farmaki daga jiragen sama masu saukar ungulu na T-6, inda aka yi ruwan wuta a kansu. Bataliyar ta Si Redouan ta rabu gida biyu, inda rukuni ɗaya ya nufi wani kogi da ke kusa, ɗayan kuma ya nufi wani ƙauye. A halin yanzu, Si Mahmoud ya jagoranci kungiyarsa ta wata hanya ta daban. Duk da tazarar kilomita 3 tsakanin Faransawa da Aljeriya, Faransawa sun ci gaba da kai hare-hare ta sama, lamarin da ya yi sanadin shahadar 'yan kasar da dama. Yaƙin ya ɓarke tsakanin Si Redouan da sojojin mulkin mallaka, waɗanda 'yan sa kai na Senegal da Afirka ta yamma suka ƙarfafa shi. Yayin da tsananin rikicin ya karu, har ma ya koma fada da hannu. 'Yan kasar Algeria sun yi kakkausar suka ga rundunar 'yan sandan Senegal da ke kan tudun mun tsira. Duk da harin bama-bamai na Faransa da yawansu, 'yan Algeria sun yi tsayin daka, kuma tsayin daka ya kasance mai tsanani. A ƙarshe Faransawa sun fara rasa bege, kuma sun fuskanci tsayin daka na Aljeriya, sun fara ja da baya da yawa ta hanyar amfani da jiragen yaƙi don janyewa zuwa Oran . A cikin ficewarsu, sai suka koma yin amfani da bama-baman napalm da aka haramtawa kasashen duniya, wanda ya raunata Si Redouan tare da rasa daya daga cikin gabbansa bayan ya yi nasarar harbo wani jirgin sama mai saukar ungulu na Sikorsky . Sai dai kuma abin takaicin shi ne, wannan mataki ya kuma bayyana matsayinsa ga abokan gaba, inda ya nuna irin tsadar da suke fuskanta. [1] [2] [3] Mutane 650 ne suka mutu a bangaren Faransa, yayin da 69 suka mutu da kuma 23 da suka samu raunuka a bangaren Aljeriya mafi yawan musabbabin tashin bam din Napalm da Faransa ta harba. [4] Faransa ta yi asarar jirage shida. [1] [3]

items.sourceText: Franco-Libyan relations were quite unsteady. In November 1954, Bin Halim had assisted a delivery of supplies from Egypt to the Algerian resistance. Fezzan had then became the main supply route for the Algerian resistance.[2]

targets.targetText: Dangantakar Franco-Libyan ba ta da kyau sosai. A cikin Nuwamba 1954, Bin Halim ya taimaka a isar da kayayyaki daga Masar zuwa juriyar Aljeriya. Daga nan Fezzan ya zama babbar hanyar samar da wutar lantarki ga juriyar Aljeriya. [1]

Dangantakar Franco-Libyan ba ta da kyau sosai. A cikin watan Nuwamba 1954, Bin Halim ya taimaka a isar da kayayyaki daga Masar zuwa jajurtattun Aljeriya. Daga nan Fezzan ya zama babbar hanyar samar da wutar lantarki ga jajurtattun Aljeriya. [1]

items.sourceText: The Algerian War began on 1 November 1954, when the FLN launched "scores of scores of spectacular attacks".[3] The conflict quickly escalated, as evidenced by the remarks of the Socialist Minister of the Interior, François Mitterrand: "I will not agree to negotiate with the enemies of the homeland. The only negotiation is war!"[4] The French adopted an increasingly aggressive policy in Algeria, and in early March 1955, the French government of Prime Minister Pierre Mendès France was replaced by that of Edgar Faure.

targets.targetText: Yaƙin Aljeriya ya fara ne a ranar 1 ga Nuwamba 1954, lokacin da FLN ta ƙaddamar da " Hare-hare masu ban mamaki ". [1] Rikicin ya karu da sauri, kamar yadda ya nuna ta bakin Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida na Socialist François Mitterrand : "Ba zan yarda in yi shawarwari tare da abokan gaba na mahaifar gida ba. Tattaunawa kawai shine yaki!" [2] Faransawa sun ɗau matakin da ya dace a Aljeriya, kuma a farkon Maris 1955, gwamnatin Faransa ta Firayim Minista Pierre Mendès Faransa ta maye gurbin Edgar Faure .

Yaƙin Aljeriya ya fara ne a ranar 1 ga watan Nuwamba 1954, lokacin da FLN ta ƙaddamar da "Hare-hare masu ban mamaki". [1] Rikicin ya ƙaru da sauri, kamar yadda ya nuna ta bakin Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida na Socialist François Mitterrand: "Ba zan yarda in yi shawarwari tare da abokan gaba na mahaifar gida ba. Tattaunawa kawai shine yaki!" [2] Faransawa sun ɗau matakin da ya dace a Aljeriya, kuma a farkon watan Maris 1955, gwamnatin Faransa ta Firayim Minista Pierre Mendès Faransa ta maye gurbin Edgar Faure.

items.sourceText: By summer 1955, the steady pressure of French counterinsurgency had put the FLN in a very dire situation. Only one of the FLN's sections, Wilaya II, was capable of mounting any offensive.[5] Popular support for the FLN was still rather low and many of the Algerian Muslim elite advocated for a peaceful resolution of the conflict through conciliatory agreements with the French government.[6]

targets.targetText: A lokacin bazara na shekarar 1955, matsananciyar matsin lamba na adawa da Faransa ya sanya FLN cikin mawuyacin hali. Ɗaya daga cikin sassan FLN ne kawai, Wilaya II, ya iya hawa kowane irin mugun abu. [1] Shahararriyar goyon bayan FLN ya yi kaɗan kuma da yawa daga cikin manyan musulmin Aljeriya sun yi kira da a warware rikicin cikin lumana ta hanyar yarjejeniyar sulhu da gwamnatin Faransa. [2]

A lokacin bazara na 1955, matsananciyar matsin lamba na adawa da Faransanci ya sanya FLN cikin mawuyacin hali. Ɗaya daga cikin sassan FLN ne kawai, Wilaya II, ya iya hawa kowane irin mugun abu . [1] Shahararriyar goyon bayan FLN ya yi kadan kuma da yawa daga cikin manyan musulmin Aljeriya sun yi kira da a warware rikicin cikin lumana ta hanyar yarjejeniyar sulhu da gwamnatin Faransa. [2]

items.sourceText: General Charles de Gaulle headed the Free French Forces, which resisted Nazi Germany during World War II and became a national and military hero. Upon the liberation of France in 1944, de Gaulle became the French prime minister in a provisional government, but disagreements and political conflicts prompted him to quit and to retire from the military and politics in 1946.

targets.targetText: Janar Charles de Gaulle ya jagoranci Sojojin Faransa na 'Yanci, waɗanda suka yi tsayayya da Nazi Jamus a lokacin yakin duniya na biyu kuma ya zama jarumi na kasa da na soja. Bayan ' yantar da Faransa a 1944, de Gaulle ya zama firaministan Faransa a gwamnatin wucin gadi, amma rashin jituwa da rikice-rikicen siyasa sun sa shi yin murabus kuma ya yi ritaya daga aikin soja da siyasa a shekara ta 1946.

Janar Charles de Gaulle ya jagoranci Sojojin Faransa na 'Yanci, waɗanda suka yi tsayayya da Nazi Jamus a lokacin yakin duniya na biyu kuma ya zama jarumi na ƙasa da na soja. Bayan 'yantar da Faransa a shekarar 1944, de Gaulle ya zama firaministan Faransa a gwamnatin wucin gadi, amma rashin jituwa da rikice-rikicen siyasa sun sa shi yin murabus kuma ya yi ritaya daga aikin soja da siyasa a shekara ta 1946.

items.sourceText: Revolts and riots broke out in 1958 against the French government in Algiers, which prompted General Jacques Massu to create a French settlers' committee[1] to demand the formation of a new national government under de Gaulle, who was a national hero and had advocated a strong military policy, nationalism and the retention of French control over Algeria. Massu, who had gained prominence and authority when he ruthlessly suppressed Algerian militants, famously declared that unless de Gaulle was returned to power, the French Army would openly revolt. Massu and other senior generals had covertly planned the takeover of Paris with 1,500 paratroopers by preparing to take over airports with the support of French Air Force units.[1] Armored units from Rambouillet prepared to roll into Paris.[2]

targets.targetText: Tawaye da tarzoma sun ɓarke a cikin shekarar 1958 kan gwamnatin Faransa a Algiers, wanda ya sa Janar Jacques Massu ya kirkiro kwamitin mazauna Faransa [1] don neman kafa sabuwar gwamnatin ƙasa ƙarƙashin de Gaulle, wanda ya kasance gwarzon ƙasa kuma ya ba da shawarar manufofin soja mai karfi, kishin ƙasa da kuma riƙe ikon Faransa a kan Aljeriya. Massu, wanda ya samu ɗaukaka da iko a lokacin da ya murkushe mayakan Aljeriya cikin rashin tausayi, ya bayyana cewa matukar ba a mayar da de Gaulle kan mulki ba, sojojin Faransa za su yi tawaye a fili. Massu da wasu manyan hafsoshin sojan ƙasar sun yi shirin mamaye birnin na Paris a ɓoye tare da dakarun soji 1,500 ta hanyar shirin karɓar filayen jiragen sama tare da tallafin rundunonin sojojin saman Faransa. [1] Ruƙunin masu sulke daga Rambouillet sun shirya don mirgina zuwa Paris. [2]

Tawaye da tarzoma sun barke a cikin 1958 kan gwamnatin Faransa a Algiers, wanda ya sa Janar Jacques Massu ya kirkiro kwamitin mazauna Faransa [1] don neman kafa sabuwar gwamnatin kasa karkashin de Gaulle, wanda ya kasance gwarzon kasa kuma ya ba da shawarar manufofin soja mai karfi, kishin kasa da kuma rike ikon Faransa a kan Aljeriya. Massu, wanda ya samu daukaka da iko a lokacin da ya murkushe mayakan Aljeriya cikin rashin tausayi, ya bayyana cewa matukar ba a mayar da de Gaulle kan mulki ba, sojojin Faransa za su yi tawaye a fili. Massu da wasu manyan hafsoshin sojan kasar sun yi shirin mamaye birnin na Paris a boye tare da dakarun soji 1,500 ta hanyar shirin karbar filayen jiragen sama tare da tallafin rundunonin sojojin saman Faransa . [1] Raka'a masu sulke daga Rambouillet sun shirya don mirgina zuwa Paris. [2]

items.sourceText: On the ground, especially in Iflissen, Omar Toumi took charge of the recruitment, while Mehlal Said was in charge of the recruitment in Azazga region. Toumi apparently had all the confidence of Captain Maublanc who commanded the 15th Company BCA (Compagnie du 15e BCA), responsible for the sector. When they reached an agreement with Zaïdi,[who?] Hachiche claimed the arms and the promised funds. Algiers immediately executed the plan, and the van that delivered the newspaper L'Echo d'Alger brought the first weapons (muskets, Garands, Stens and shotguns), the corresponding ammunition, and two million francs. Thus, 200 weapons were delivered in January 1956, and 80 more in February–March. The funds allocated by the governor-general amounted to nine million per month.[4]

targets.targetText: A kasa, musamman a Iflissen, Omar Toumi ya dauki nauyin daukar ma'aikata, yayin da Mehlal Said ke kula da daukar ma'aikata a yankin Azazga . Toumi a fili yana da dukkan amincewar Kyaftin Maublanc wanda ya ba da umarnin Kamfanin 15th BCA (Compagnie du 15e BCA), wanda ke da alhakin sashin. A lokacin da suka yi yarjejeniya da Zaidi.  Hachiche ya yi ikirarin makamai da kudaden da aka alkawarta. Nan da nan Algiers ta aiwatar da shirin, kuma motar da ta isar da jaridar L'Echo d'Alger ta kawo makamai na farko ( muskets, Garands, Stens da harbin bindiga ), makaman da suka dace, da kuma francs miliyan biyu. Don haka, an kai makamai 200 a watan Janairu 1956, da ƙari 80 a cikin Fabrairu-Maris. Kudaden da gwamnan ya ware sun kai miliyan tara duk wata. [1]

A ƙasa, musamman a Iflissen, Omar Toumi ya ɗauki nauyin ɗaukar ma'aikata, yayin da Mehlal Said ke kula da ɗaukar ma'aikata a yankin Azazga. Toumi a fili yana da dukkan amincewar Kyaftin Maublanc wanda ya ba da umarnin Kamfanin 15th BCA (Compagnie du 15e BCA), wanda ke da alhakin sashin. A lokacin da suka yi yarjejeniya da Zaidi.  Hachiche ya yi ikirarin makamai da kuɗaɗen da aka alkawarta. Nan da nan Algiers ta aiwatar da shirin, kuma motar da ta isar da jaridar L'Echo d'Alger ta kawo makamai na farko (muskets, Garands, Stens da harbin bindiga), makaman da suka dace, da kuma francs miliyan biyu. Don haka, an kai makamai 200 a watan Janairu 1956, da ƙari 80 a cikin watan Fabrairu-Maris. Kudaden da gwamnan ya ware sun kai miliyan tara duk wata. [1]

items.sourceText: The idea of setting up a "counter-resistance" in Kabylie, French Algeria, came from Henri-Paul Eydoux [fr], a technical adviser to the cabinet of Governor-General Jacques Soustelle. He instructed Gaston Pontal, director of the Direction de la surveillance du territoire (DST) and the Algerian police, to set up the operation.[3] When the Service Action of the SDECE was first suggested to take charge of the "counter-resistance" in coastal Kabylie, the proposal was initially rejected.

targets.targetText: Tunanin kafa "juriya" a Kabylie, Faransanci Aljeriya, ya fito ne daga Henri-Paul Eydoux [ fr ], mashawarcin fasaha ga majalisar ministocin Gwamna-Janar Jacques Soustelle . Ya umurci Gaston Pontal, darektan Direction de la surveillance du territoire (DST) da kuma 'yan sandan Algeria, da su kafa aikin. [1] Lokacin da aka fara ba da shawarar Ayyukan Sabis na SDECE don ɗaukar nauyin "juriya" a bakin tekun Kabylie, da farko an ƙi amincewa da shawarar.

Tunanin kafa "tawaye" a Kabylie, Faransa Aljeriya, ya fito ne daga Henri-Paul Eydoux [ fr ], mashawarcin fasaha ga majalisar ministocin Gwamna-Janar Jacques Soustelle. Ya umurci Gaston Pontal, darektan Direction de la surveillance du territoire (DST) da kuma 'yan sandan Algeria, da su kafa aikin. [1] Lokacin da aka fara ba da shawarar Ayyukan Sabis na SDECE don ɗaukar nauyin "tawaye" a bakin tekun Kabylie, da farko an ƙi amincewa da shawarar.

items.sourceText: A fortification, Fort Buckingham, had been established by the British Colony of Natal near to the Middle Drift (crossing) on the Tugela River, which marked the boundary with Zululand. The governor of Natal in 1875, Sir Garnet Wolseley, had ordered the construction of a road to connect the fort and Middle Drift to the settlement of Greytown to the south-west.[1] By 1878, Sir Henry Bartle Frere, the British high commissioner for Southern Africa, had determined to annex the Zulu Kingdom, which he viewed as a threat to peace and to his plan to form a confederation of British territories in the region.[2] British lieutenant general Frederic Thesiger was appointed military commander to the region in 1878 and, anticipating a war, ordered an inspection of the border region.[1]

targets.targetText: Wani katafaren gini, Fort Buckingham, an kafa shi ta hannun Turawan mulkin mallaka na Birtaniyya na Natal kusa da Tsararriyar Tsakiyar Tsakiya (haye) akan kogin Tugela, wanda ke nuna iyaka da Zululand. Gwamnan Natal a cikin shekarar 1875, Sir Garnet Wolseley, ya ba da umarnin gina hanyar da za ta haɗa katanga da Tsarkakewa ta Tsakiya zuwa mazaunin Greytown zuwa kudu maso yamma. [ 1 ] A shekara ta 1878, Sir Henry Bartle Frere, babban kwamishinan Birtaniya a kudancin Afirka, ya kuduri aniyar mayar da mulkin Zulu, wanda ya ke kallonsa a matsayin barazana ga zaman lafiya da kuma shirinsa na kafa gamayyar yankunan Birtaniyya a yankin. [ 2 ] An naɗa Laftanar Janar na Burtaniya Frederic Thesiger a matsayin kwamandan soji a yankin a shekara ta 1878 kuma, yana tsammanin yakin, ya ba da umarnin duba yankin kan iyaka. [ 1 ]

items.sourceText: Belaid Abdessalam (Arabic: بلعيد عبد السلام; 20 July 1928 – 27 June 2020) was an Algerian politician, who served as Prime Minister from 1992 to 1993.

targets.targetText: Belaid Abdessalam (20 Yuli 1928 - 27 Yuni 2020) ɗan siyasan Aljeriya ne, wanda ya zama Firayim Minista daga shekarun 1992 zuwa 1993.
Belaid Abdessalam ( Arabic ; 20 Yuli 1928 - 27 Yuni 2020) ɗan siyasan Aljeriya ne, wanda ya zama Firayim Minista daga 1992 zuwa 1993.

items.sourceText: Belhouchet was born in Souk Ahras, Algeria. He initially joined the French military during the Indochina War before returning to Algeria, where he became involved with the National Liberation Army (ALN) at the onset of the armed struggle for independence from French colonial rule.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Belhouchet a Souk Ahras, Algeria. Da farko dai ya shiga aikin sojan Faransa ne a lokacin yakin Indochina kafin ya koma kasar Aljeriya, inda ya shiga cikin rundunar sojojin ‘yantar da kasa (ALN) a farkon fafutukar neman ‘yancin kai daga turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa . [1]

An haifi Belhouchet a Souk Ahras, Algeria. Da farko dai ya shiga aikin sojan Faransa ne a lokacin yakin Indochina kafin ya koma ƙasar Aljeriya, inda ya shiga cikin rundunar sojojin ‘yantar da ƙasa ta (ALN) a farkon fafutukar neman ‘yancin kai daga turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa. [1]

items.sourceText: Boulahrouf was born on 9 April 1923 in the region of Oued Zenati (Guelma). He grew up in a family of modest means, undertook his studies at Annaba, but did not have the time to continue his schooling after being dismissed from school during the first cycle.

targets.targetText: An haifi Boulahrouf a ranar 9 ga watan Afrilu 1923 a yankin Oued Zenati (Guelma). Ya taso ne a cikin iyali mai saukin hali, ya yi karatunsa a Annaba, amma bai da lokacin da zai ci gaba da karatunsa bayan an kore shi daga makaranta a zagaye na farko.

An haifi Boulahrouf a ranar 9 ga Afrilu 1923 a yankin Oued Zenati ( Guelma ). Ya taso ne a cikin iyali mai saukin hali, ya yi karatunsa a Annaba, amma bai da lokacin da zai ci gaba da karatunsa bayan an kore shi daga makaranta a zagaye na farko.

items.sourceText: Under the Provisional Government he had to take several missions. He was therefore appointed representative of the FLN in Rome and Geneva, where he played an important role in preliminary contacts with the French authorities. These contacts were crowned by the agreements of Evian, where he was involved during the different stages, from the secret contacts in Geneva in 1961 until the signing of definitive agreements on March 18, 1962.

targets.targetText: A ƙarƙashin gwamnatin wucin gadi dole ne ya ɗauki ayyuka da yawa. Don haka aka naɗa shi wakilin FLN a Rome da Geneva, inda ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a tuntuɓar farko da hukumomin Faransa. Waɗannan lambobin sadarwa sun kambi da yarjejeniyar Evian, inda ya shiga cikin matakai daban-daban, daga lambobin sirri a Geneva a shekarar 1961 har zuwa lokacin da aka sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar tabbatacciyar yarjejeniya a ranar 18 ga watan Maris, 1962.

A karkashin gwamnatin wucin gadi dole ne ya dauki ayyuka da yawa. Don haka aka nada shi wakilin FLN a Rome da Geneva, inda ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a tuntubar farko da hukumomin Faransa. Wadannan lambobin sadarwa sun kambi da yarjejeniyar Evian, inda ya shiga cikin matakai daban-daban, daga lambobin sirri a Geneva a 1961 har zuwa lokacin da aka sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar tabbatacciyar yarjejeniya a ranar 18 ga Maris, 1962.

items.sourceText: On 3 May 1982, his plane was shot down on the Iran-Turkey border during his mediation mission in the Iran–Iraq War.[8] Both Iran and Iraq denied responsibility.[9]

targets.targetText: A ranar 3 ga Mayun 1982, an harbo jirginsa a kan iyakar Iran da Turkiyya a lokacin da ya shiga tsakani a yakin Iran da Iraki . [1] Iran da Iraki dai sun musanta alhakinsu. [2]
A ranar 3 ga watan Mayun 1982, an harbo jirginsa a kan iyakar Iran da Turkiyya a lokacin da ya shiga tsakani a yakin Iran da Iraki. [1] Iran da Iraki dai sun musanta alhakinsu. [2]

items.sourceText: A top leader of the FLN's interior armed action in the 1954-62 Algerian war of independence. He was a member of all three issues of the FLN's exile government, the GPRA, in various ministerial capacities. He was a key participant at the negotiations of Evian who insisted on the integrity of the entire Algerian territory including the Sahara and its resources. On independence in 1962, he opposed the victorious military-backed takeover of Ahmed Ben Bella, and was arrested. On his release, he left politics, and spent the remainder of his career in various non-political administrative and business posts.

targets.targetText: Wani babban jigo ne na cikin gidan FLN a cikin yakin Aljeriya na shekarar 1954-62. Ya kasance memba na dukkanin batutuwa guda uku na gwamnatin gudun hijira ta FLN, GPRA, a matsayin minista daban-daban. Ya kasance babban mai shiga tsakani a tattaunawar Evian wanda ya dage kan amincin ɗaukacin yankin Aljeriya ciki har da Sahara da albarkatunsa. A kan neman 'yancin kai a shekarar 1962, ya yi adawa da nasarar da sojoji suka yi wa Ahmed Ben Bella, kuma aka kama shi. A lokacin da aka sake shi, ya bar siyasa, kuma ya shafe sauran ayyukansa a wasu muƙaman mulki da na kasuwanci da ba na siyasa ba.

Wani babban jigo na cikin gidan FLN a cikin yakin Aljeriya na 1954-62. Ya kasance memba na dukkanin batutuwa guda uku na gwamnatin gudun hijira ta FLN, GPRA, a matsayin minista daban-daban. Ya kasance babban mai shiga tsakani a tattaunawar Evian wanda ya dage kan amincin daukacin yankin Aljeriya ciki har da Sahara da albarkatunsa. A kan 'yancin kai a 1962, ya yi adawa da nasarar da sojoji suka yi wa Ahmed Ben Bella, kuma aka kama shi. A lokacin da aka sake shi, ya bar siyasa, kuma ya shafe sauran ayyukansa a wasu mukaman mulki da na kasuwanci da ba na siyasa ba.

items.sourceText: Ali Abd al-Latif (Arabic: علي عبد اللطيف; 1896–1948) was a prominent Sudanese nationalist who served as a key member of the White Flag League and played a prominent role in the 1924 Khartoum revolt.

targets.targetText: Ali Abd al-Latif ( Arabic ; 1896–1948 ) fitaccen ɗan kishin ƙasar Sudan ne wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin babban memba na ƙungiyar farar tuta kuma ya taka rawar gani a tawayen Khartoum na 1924 .
Ali Abd al-Latif (1896–1948 ) fitaccen ɗan kishin ƙasar Sudan ne wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin babban memba na ƙungiyar farar tuta kuma ya taka rawar gani a tawayen Khartoum na shekarar 1924.

items.sourceText: Ojike was born to the family of Mgbeke and Mbonu Emeanlulu in Arondizuogu, Colonial Nigeria.[4] Despite his father's protestations, Ojike attended Anglican schools,[5] he had his primary education at CMS School, Arondizuogu. In 1925, he was a pupil teacher at Anglican Central School in Arondizuogu and Abagana. In 1929, he entered CMS Teachers Training College, Awka to train as a teacher, finishing training in 1931. Ojike soon gained employment at Dennis Memorial Grammar School, Onitsha. At the school, he was a choirmaster, sunday school supervisor and school organist.[2] Ojike gradually became dissatisfied with a missionary's form of education criticizing it as not paramount to African development and suppressing African culture.[6] Soon, he left the school and worked as an agent for West African Pilot. Motivated by the writings of James Aggrey and Azikiwe, Ojike decided to pursue further education abroad.

targets.targetText: An haifi Ojike ga dangin Mgbeke da Mbonu Emeanlulu a Arondizuogu, mulkin mallaka na Najeriya. [ 4 ] Duk da zanga-zangar mahaifinsa, Ojike ya halarci makarantun Anglican, [ 5 ] ya yi karatun firamare a Makarantar CMS, Arondizuogu. A cikin shekarar 1925, ya kasance malami a makarantar Anglican Central School a Arondizuogu da Abagana. A shekarar 1929, ya shiga Kwalejin Horar da Malamai ta CMS, Awka don horar da malamai, inda ya kammala horo a shekarar 1931. Ba da daɗewa ba Ojike ya sami aiki a makarantar Dennis Memorial Grammar School, Onitsha. A makarantar, ya kasance mawaƙi, mai kula da makarantar sunday kuma organist na makaranta. [ 2 ] A hankali Ojike ya nuna rashin gamsuwa da salon ilimin ɗan mishan yana sukar sa da cewa ba shi da muhimmanci ga ci gaban Afirka da kuma danne al'adun Afirka. [ 6 ] Ba da daɗewa ba, ya bar makarantar kuma ya yi aiki a matsayin wakili na Pilot na Yammacin Afirka. Sakamakon rubuce-rubucen James Aggrey da Azikiwe, Ojike ya yanke shawarar ci gaba da karatu a ƙasashen waje.

items.sourceText: Afenifere under Adebanjo opposed military rule, supported the National Democratic Coalition (NADECO) during Nigeria’s pro-democracy struggles,[8] and endorsed Peter Obi of the Labour Party in the 2023 Nigerian presidential election.[9]

targets.targetText: Afenifere a ƙarƙashin Adebanjo sun yi adawa da mulkin soja, sun goyi bayan National Democratic Coalition (NADECO) a lokacin gwagwarmayar tabbatar da dimokuraɗiyya a Najeriya, [1] kuma ta amince da Peter Obi na Jam'iyyar Labour a zaɓen shugaban Najeriya na 2023. [2]

Afenifere a karkashin Adebanjo sun yi adawa da mulkin soja, sun goyi bayan National Democratic Coalition (NADECO) a lokacin gwagwarmayar tabbatar da dimokradiyya a Najeriya, [1] kuma ta amince da Peter Obi na Jam'iyyar Labour a zaben shugaban Najeriya na 2023 . [2]

items.sourceText: Assou Oubasslam[1][2] was a leader of an armed resistance in southeastern Morocco, against French colonization from the occupation of Morocco until the early 1930s. He was a Berber from the Aït Atta tribes and was born in 1890 in Ksar Taghya, Morocco.[3]

targets.targetText: Assou Oubasslam [1] [2] ya kasance jagoran gwagwarmaya da makamai a kudu maso gabashin Maroko, mai adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa daga mamayar Maroko har zuwa farkon shekara ta 1930s . Shi ɗan ƙabilar Berber ne daga ƙabilar Aït Atta kuma an haife shi a shekara ta 1890 a Ksar Taghya, Morocco. [3]

Assou Oubasslam [1] [2] ya kasance jagoran gwagwarmaya da makamai a kudu maso gabashin Maroko, adawa da mulkin mallaka na Faransa daga mamayar Maroko har zuwa farkon 1930s . Shi dan kabilar Berber ne daga kabilar Aït Atta kuma an haife shi a shekara ta 1890 a Ksar Taghya, Morocco . [3]

items.sourceText: After a prolonged struggle with diabetes, the Moroccan resistance fighter Assou Oubasslam died on August 16, 1960.[1] He was buried in his ancestors' cemetery in the Imilchan Commune.[2]

targets.targetText: Bayan doguwar gwagwarmaya da ciwon sukari, ɗan gwagwarmayar Moroko Assou Oubasslam ya mutu a ranar 16 ga watan Agusta, 1960. [1] An binne shi a makabartar kakanninsa da ke yankin Imilchan Commune. [2]

Bayan doguwar gwagwarmaya da ciwon sukari, dan gwagwarmayar gwagwarmayar Moroko Assou Oubasslam ya mutu a ranar 16 ga Agusta, 1960. [1] An binne shi a makabartar kakanninsa da ke yankin Imilchan Commune. [2]

items.sourceText: Muhammad Allal al-Fassi (Arabic: محمد علال الفاسي, romanized: Muḥammad ʿAllāl al-Fāsī) (January 10, 1910 – May 13, 1974) was a Moroccan revolutionary,[2] politician, writer, poet, Pan-Arabist[3] and Islamic scholar.[4]

targets.targetText: Muhammad Allal al-Fassi (Janairu 10, 1910 - Mayu 13, 1974) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Morocco, [1] ɗan siyasa, marubuci, mawaƙi, Pan-Arabist [2] kuma malamin addinin musulunci. [3]
Muhammad Allal al-Fassi ( Arabic ) (Janairu 10, 1910 - Mayu 13, 1974) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Morocco, [1] ɗan siyasa, marubuci, mawaƙi, Pan-Arabist [2] kuma malamin addinin musulunci . [3]

items.sourceText: While he was in exile, the CAM was renamed in 1944 as the Istiqlal Party, which became the nationalist party and the driving force after the Moroccan Army of Liberation (Jaysh al-Tahrir).

targets.targetText: Yayin da yake gudun hijira, an sake kiran CAM a cikin shekarar 1944 a matsayin jam'iyyar Istiqlal, wadda ta zama jam'iyyar kishin ƙasa da kuma motsa jiki bayan Sojojin Moroccan na Liberation (Jaysh al-Tahrir).

Yayin da yake gudun hijira, an sake kiran CAM a cikin 1944 a matsayin jam'iyyar Istiqlal, wadda ta zama jam'iyyar kishin kasa da kuma motsa jiki bayan Sojojin Moroccan na Liberation (Jaysh al-Tahrir).

items.sourceText: Rahal Meskini (1926 – December 17, 1956) was a Moroccan resistance fighter against French colonialism. He co-founded the Secret Organization along with Ibrahim Rudani in the late 1940s. He was assassinated in Casablanca, Morocco by members of the Black Crescent [ar].[1]

targets.targetText: Rahal Meskini (1926 – Disamba 17, 1956) ɗan gwagwarmayar gwagwarmayar Maroko ne da mulkin mallaka na Faransa . Ya kafa kungiyar asiri tare da Ibrahim Rudani a karshen shekarun 1940. An kashe shi ne a birnin Casablanca na kasar Maroko da 'yan Black Crescent [ ar ] . [1]

Rahal Meskini (1926 – Disamba 17, 1956) ɗan gwagwarmayar ƙasar Maroko ne mai adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa. Ya kafa kungiyar asiri tare da Ibrahim Rudani a ƙarshen shekarun 1940. An kashe shi ne a birnin Casablanca na ƙasar Maroko da 'yan Black Crescent [ ar ] . [1]

items.sourceText: Abdelkhalek Torres (Arabic: عبد الخالق الطريس; 1910 – May 27, 1970) was a Moroccan journalist and nationalist leader based in Tetouan, Morocco during the Spanish protectorate of Morocco era.[1]

targets.targetText: Abdelkhalek Torres (1910 - Mayu 27, 1970) ɗan jarida ɗan Moroko ne kuma jagora mai kishin ƙasa wanda ke zaune a Tetouan, Maroko a lokacin 'yan mulkin mallaka na Spain a lokacin Maroko. [1]
Abdelkhalek Torres ( Arabic ; 1910 - Mayu 27, 1970) ɗan jarida ɗan Moroko ne kuma jagora mai kishin ƙasa wanda ke zaune a Tetouan, Maroko a lokacin mulkin Spain na lokacin Maroko . [1]

items.sourceText: Libyan nationalism refers to the nationalism of Libyans and Libyan culture.[1] Libyan nationalism began to arise with the creation of the Senussi religious orders in the 1830s that blended North African Sufism with orthodox Islam.[1] After colonization of Libya by Italy, opponents of Italian colonial rule from Tripolitania and Cyrenaica combined forces in 1922, with Senussi leader Omar Mukhtar leading the revolt against Italian forces in Libya.[1] Libya became an independent state after World War II.[2]

targets.targetText: Kishin kasa na Libya yana nufin kishin kasa na Libya da al'adun Libya . [1] Kishin kasa na Libya ya fara tasowa ne tare da ƙirƙirar umarnin addini na Senussi a cikin 1830s wanda ya haɗu da Sufanci na Arewacin Afirka da Islama na Orthodox. [1] Bayan da Italiya ta yi wa Libya mulkin mallaka, masu adawa da mulkin mallaka na Italiya daga Tripolitania da Cyrenaica sun hada dakaru a 1922, tare da shugaban Senussi Omar Mukhtar ya jagoranci tawaye ga sojojin Italiya a Libya . [1] Libya ta zama kasa mai cin gashin kanta bayan yakin duniya na biyu . [2]

Kishin ƙasa na Libya yana nufin kishin ƙasa na Libya da al'adun Libya. [1] Kishin ƙasa na Libya ya fara tasowa ne tare da ƙirƙirar umarnin addini na Senussi a cikin shekarar 1830s wanda ya haɗu da Sufanci na Arewacin Afirka da Islama na Orthodox. [1] Bayan da Italiya ta yi wa Libya mulkin mallaka, masu adawa da mulkin mallaka na Italiya daga Tripolitania da Cyrenaica sun haɗa dakaru a shekarar 1922, tare da shugaban Senussi Omar Mukhtar ya jagoranci tawaye ga sojojin Italiya a Libya. [1] Libya ta zama ƙasa mai cin gashin kanta bayan yakin duniya na biyu . [2]

items.sourceText: Ramadan Sewehli, also spelt as Ramadan al-Suwayhili,[1] (Arabic: رمضان السويحلي Ramaḍān al-Swīḥlī) (c. 1879 – 1920) was a prominent Tripolitanian nationalist at the outset of the Italian occupation in 1911 and one of the founders of the Tripolitanian Republic.

targets.targetText: Ramadan Sewehli, also spelled as Ramadan al-Suwayhili, [1] ( Arabic Ramaḍān al-Swīḥlī (c. 1879 – 1920) ya kasance fitaccen dan kishin kasa na Tripolitaniya a farkon mamayar Italiya a 1911 kuma daya daga cikin wadanda suka kafa Jamhuriyar Tripolitaniya .

Ramadan Sewehli, also spelled as Ramadan al-Suwayhili, [1] Ramaḍān al-Swīḥlī (c. 1879 – 1920) ya kasance fitaccen ɗan kishin ƙasa na Tripolitaniya a farkon mamayar Italiya a shekarar 1911 kuma ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa Jamhuriyar Tripolitaniya.

items.sourceText: Located near Nanyuki, about 199.2 km North East of Nairobi[1] in Kenya's Central Province, the Mau Mau Cave was used as a hide-out by Kenyan Freedom Fighters during the Mau Mau Uprising of 1952 to 1960. It is located approximately 18 km south of the equator inside the thick Mount Kenya National Park.

targets.targetText: Yana kusa da Nanyuki, kusan 199.2 km Arewa maso Gabashin Nairobi [1] a Lardin Tsakiyar Kenya, Mau Mau Cave an yi amfani da shi a matsayin maɓoya daga mayaƙan masu neman 'Yancin Kenya a lokacin tashin hankalin Mau Mau na shekarun 1952 zuwa 1960. Tana kusan kilomita 18 kudu da equator a cikin kauri na Dutsen Kenya National Park.

Yana kusa da Nanyuki, kusan 199.2 km Arewa maso Gabashin Nairobi [1] a Lardin Tsakiyar Kenya, Mau Mau Cave an yi amfani da shi a matsayin maboya daga mayaƙan 'Yancin Kenya a lokacin tashin Mau Mau na 1952 zuwa 1960. Tana kusan kilomita 18 kudu da equator a cikin kauri na Dutsen Kenya National Park .

items.sourceText: Back in absolute control of Cairo, Bonaparte sought out the authors and instigators of the revolt. Several sheikhs, along with various people of influence, were convicted of participation in the plot and executed. To complete his punishment, a heavy tax was placed upon the city and its divan was replaced by a military commission. To negate the effects of the Great Lord's firman, the French posted a proclamation in all the cities of Egypt under their control, ending in the words:

targets.targetText: Komawa cikin cikakken ikon Alkahira, Bonaparte ya nemi marubuta da masu tada fitina. An yanke wa shehunai da dama, tare da wasu masu faɗa aji daban-daban hukuncin kisa da masu hannu a cikin wannan makirci, aka kuma kashe su. Bayan gama hukunta su, an saka haraji mai yawa a kan birnin kuma aka maye gurbinsa da dian garin da hukumar sojoji. Don kawar da tasirin Ubangiji Mai Girma, Faransawa sun buga shela a duk garuruwan Masar da ke ƙarƙashin ikonsu, suna ƙarewa da kalmomin:

items.sourceText: In 1944, an uprising took place in Kivu in the eastern Belgian Congo. The cause of the revolt lay in Belgian authority's taxation and communal labor policies, which the Watchtower Movement denounced as ungodly.[1] The revolt, which took place in spring, was a "bitter showdown" and resulted in hundreds of Congolese people and three white people being killed. Two rebels, including revolt leader Ngoie Mukalabushi, were hanged.[2]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1944, an yi tawaye a Kivu a gabashin Kongo na Belgian. Dalilin tawayen ya kasance a cikin tsarin haraji na hukumomin Belgian da manufofin ƙwadago na gama gari, waɗanda Ƙungiyar Hasumiyar Tsaro ta yi tir da cewa ba ta bin Ubangiji. [1] Tawayen da aka yi a lokacin bazara, ya kasance wani “mummunan tashin hankali” wanda ya yi sanadin kashe ɗaruruwan mutanen Congo da fararen fata uku. An rataye ’yan tawaye biyu da suka hada da shugaban masu tayar da kayar baya Ngoie Mukalabushi. [2]

Dalilin tawayen ya kasance a cikin tsarin haraji na hukumomin Belgian da manufofin ƙwadago na gama gari, waɗanda Ƙungiyar Hasumiyar Tsaro ta yi tir da cewa ba ta bin Allah. [1] Tawayen da aka yi a lokacin bazara, ya kasance wani “mummunan tashin hankali” wanda ya yi sanadin kashe daruruwan mutanen Congo da fararen fata uku. An rataye ’yan tawaye biyu da suka hada da shugaban masu tayar da kayar baya Ngoie Mukalabushi. [2]

items.sourceText: In the late 17th century, the Kingdom of Kongo was weakening due to internal divisions and the growing influence of Portuguese colonial power in Angola. Mbwila, a province within Kongo, was traditionally a vassal of the Portuguese, but tensions began to rise as Portuguese expansionism clashed with the independence movements in the region.[1]

targets.targetText: A ƙarshen karni na 17, Masarautar Kongo tana raguwa saboda rarrabuwar kawuna na cikin gida da kuma tasirin ikon mulkin mallaka na Portugal a Angola . Mbwila, wani lardi a cikin Kongo, a al'adance ya kasance ƙwararrun ƴan ƙasar Portugal, amma tashin hankali ya fara tashi yayin da faɗaɗawar Portuguese ta yi karo da ƙungiyoyin 'yancin kai a yankin. [ 1 ]

A ƙarshen ƙarni na 17, Masarautar Kongo tana raguwa saboda rarrabuwar kawuna na cikin gida da kuma tasirin ikon 'yan mulkin mallaka na Portugal a Angola. Mbwila, wani lardi a cikin Kongo, a al'adance ya kasance shahararrun ƴan ƙasar Portugal, amma tashin hankali ya fara tashi yayin da faɗaɗawar Portuguese ta yi karo da ƙungiyoyin 'yancin kai a yankin. [ 1 ]

items.sourceText: After Colonel Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg (1784-1838) perpetrated the Massacre of El Ouffia in 1832, the pace of spoliation and sequestration of Algerian lands and properties increased in order to settle more French farmers in Mitidja from the year 1836.[3] Thus, in Reghaïa, a settlement of more than 3,000 hectares was granted to two Frenchmen, called Mercier and Saussine, in order to establish a large agricultural establishment in this wet plain.[4] The entrepreneur Mercier who had just arrived from the United States of America in 1836 was already experienced in the handling of businesses and operations of this kind.[5]

targets.targetText: Bayan da Kanar Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg (1784-1838) ya yi kisan kiyashi a El Ouffia a shekarar 1832, sai da taki na cin zarafi da kwace filaye da kadarori na Aljeriya ya ƙaru domin samar da ƙarin manoman Faransa a Mitidja daga shekara ta 1836. [1] Don haka, a cikin Reghaïa, an ba wa Faransawa biyu, Mercier da Saussine wani yanki na sama da hectare 3,000, don kafa babban cibiyar noma a wannan fili mai dausayi. [2] 'Yar kasuwa Mercier wacce ta zo daga Amurka a cikin shekarar 1836 ta riga ta ƙware a cikin harkokin kasuwanci da ayyukan irin wannan. [3]

Bayan da Kanar Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg (1784-1838) ya yi kisan kiyashi a El Ouffia a 1832, sai da taki na cin zarafi da kwace filaye da kadarori na Aljeriya ya karu domin samar da karin manoman Faransa a Mitidja daga shekara ta 1836. [1] Don haka, a cikin Reghaïa, an ba wa Faransawa biyu, Mercier da Saussine wani yanki na sama da hectare 3,000, don kafa babban cibiyar noma a wannan fili mai dausayi. [2] 'Yar kasuwa Mercier wanda ya zo daga Amurka a cikin 1836 ya riga ya ƙware a cikin harkokin kasuwanci da ayyukan irin wannan. [3]

items.sourceText: In 1947 Abel Kingué was working in a large store in Douala, where he met Robert Ekwalla. Both became militants in the Union des Syndicats Confédérés du Cameroun (USCC). In April 1950 he left the store and joined the staff of the Union of the Peoples of Cameroon (UPC) at its first congress in Dschang. In 1951 at Nkongsamba he publicly denounced the political machinations of prince Ndoumbe Douala Manga Bell. He demonstrated that he had great skills as an orator, strong ideological convictions and a great capacity for work and organisation. He was re-elected vice-president of the UPC in September 1952 at its second congress in Eséka. He was also editor of the UPC organ the Voice of Cameroon.[1]

targets.targetText: A shekarar 1947 Abel Kingué yana aiki a wani babban shago a Douala, inda ya haɗu da Robert Ekwalla. Dukansu sun zama masu fafutuka a cikin Union des Syndicats Confedérés du Cameroun (USCC). A cikin watan Afrilu 1950 ya bar kantin sayar da ya shiga cikin ma'aikatan Tarayyar Jama'ar Kamaru (UPC) a babban taronta na farko a Dschang. A cikin shekarar 1951 a Nkongsamba ya fito fili ya yi tir da makircin siyasa na yarima Ndoumbe Douala Manga Bell. Ya nuna cewa yana da kwarewa sosai a matsayinsa na mai magana, da ƙwaƙƙwaran akida da kuma babban ƙarfin aiki da tsari. An sake zaɓen shi mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar UPC a watan Satumba na shekarar 1952 a babban taronta na biyu a Eséka. Ya kuma kasance editan kungiyar Muryar Kamaru ta UPC. [ 1 ]

items.sourceText: On 1 October 1990, Rwigyema led the splinter group of 10,000 NRA troops in an invasion of northern Rwanda.[5] This event started the Rwandan Civil War. What became the RPF chose this date as it was close to Ugandan independence day on 9 October.[2] This served as an opportunity for Rwigyema, as the movement could be disguised from the main NRA as a military parade.[3]

targets.targetText: A ranar 1 ga watan Oktoban 1990, Rwigyema ya jagoranci gungun runduna na NRA 10,000 a wani hari da suka kai arewacin Ruwanda. [1] Wannan taron ya fara yakin basasar Ruwanda. Abin da ya zama RPF ya zaɓi wannan rana yayin da yake kusa da ranar 'yancin kai na Uganda a ranar 9 ga watan Oktoba. [2] Wannan ya zama dama ga Rwigyema, saboda ana iya canza motsin daga babban NRA a matsayin faretin soja. [2]

A ranar 1 ga Oktoban 1990, Rwigyema ya jagoranci gungun 'yan ta'adda na NRA 10,000 a wani hari da suka kai arewacin Ruwanda. [1] Wannan taron ya fara yakin basasar Ruwanda . Abin da ya zama RPF ya zaɓi wannan rana yayin da yake kusa da ranar 'yancin kai na Uganda a ranar 9 ga Oktoba. [2] Wannan ya zama dama ga Rwigyema, saboda ana iya canza motsin daga babban NRA a matsayin faretin soja. [2]

items.sourceText: While elements can be traced to the writings of Abbé Raynal and precolonial travelers, the myth was seriously elaborated by French colonists between 1840 and 1857.[5] It emerged largely in the writings of French military men, such as Baron Aucapitaine [fr] and Adolphe Hanoteau [fr].[2] The Kabyle myth was diffused between 1860 and 1871, reaching its climax between 1871 and 1892[5][6] before finally being abandoned as a basis for social policy in 1915.[5]

targets.targetText: Yayin da abubuwa za a iya gano su zuwa rubuce-rubucen Abbé Raynal da matafiya na mulkin mallaka, ƙwararrun ƴan mulkin mallaka na Faransa sun bayyana tatsuniyar da gaske tsakanin shekarun 1840 da 1857. [1] Ya fito da yawa a cikin rubuce-rubucen sojojin Faransa, irin su Baron Aucapitaine [ fr ] da Adolphe Hanoteau [ fr ] . [2] An baza tatsuniyar Kabyle tsakanin shekarun 1860 da 1871, ta kai ga kololuwarta tsakanin shekarun 1871 da 1892 [1] [3] kafin daga bisani a yi watsi da ita a matsayin tushen manufofin zamantakewa a shekarar 1915. [1]

items.sourceText: In February 2002, AZAPO announced that Nefolovhodwe would be sworn into the party's sole seat in the National Assembly, the lower house of the South African Parliament. He replaced AZAPO president Mosibudi Mangena, who had resigned from Parliament after being appointed Deputy Minister of Education.[1] Nefolovhodwe was re-elected to a full term in the assembly in the 2004 general election.[9] During the legislative term that followed, he also served on the Pan-African Parliament.[3]

targets.targetText: A watan Fabrairun 2002, AZAPO ta sanar da cewa za a rantsar da Nefolovhodwe a kujerar jam'iyyar a Majalisar Dokoki ta kasa, 'yar majalisar wakilai ta Afirka ta Kudu . Ya maye gurbin shugaban AZAPO Mosibudi Mangena wanda ya yi murabus daga majalisar bayan an nada shi mataimakin ministan ilimi . [1] An sake zabar Nefolovhodwe zuwa cikakken wa'adi a majalisar a babban zaben shekara ta 2004 . [2] A lokacin wa'adin majalisa da ya biyo baya, ya kuma yi aiki a Majalisar Pan-African . [3]

Ya maye gurbin shugaban AZAPO Mosibudi Mangena wanda ya yi murabus daga majalisar bayan an naɗa shi mataimakin ministan ilimi. items.sourceText: In the 1963 Zanzibari general election, the ASP claimed 13 seats and the majority of votes cast, yet the election ended up favouring the Zanzibar Nationalist Party and Zanzibar and Pemba People's Party alliance who collectively claimed 18 seats.[5] Unsatisfied with such unfair representation in parliament, the ASP, headed by Abeid Karume, collaborated with the Umma Party to begin the Zanzibar Revolution on 12 January 1964. The revolution overthrew the Sultanate of Zanzibar and established the People's Republic of Zanzibar, ruled by Abeid Karume. Following the establishment of the republic, the ASP banned the previous ruling parties—the Zanzibar Nationalist Parity and the Zanzibar and Pemba People's Party.[6] On 5 February 1977, the party joined with the Tanganyika African National Union (TANU) to form Chama Cha Mapinduzi (CCM).[7]

targets.targetText: A babban zaben Zanzibari na 1963, ASP ta samu kujeru 13 da mafi yawan kuri'un da aka kada, duk da haka zaben ya kare da jam'iyyar Zanzibar Nationalist Party da kawancen Zanzibar da Pemba People's Party wadanda suka hada baki 18. [1] Ba tare da gamsuwa da irin wannan wakilci na rashin adalci ba a majalisar, ASP, karkashin jagorancin Abeid Karume, sun hada kai da jam'iyyar Umma domin fara juyin juya halin Zanzibar a ranar 12 ga Janairun 1964. Juyin juya halin ya hambarar da masarautar Zanzibar tare da kafa jamhuriyar jama'ar Zanzibar karkashin jagorancin Abeid Karume. Bayan kafuwar jamhuriyar, ASP ta haramtawa jam'iyyun da suka shude - Jam'iyyar Zanzibar Nationalist Parity da Zanzibar da Pemba People's Party. [2] A ranar 5 ga Fabrairun 1977, jam'iyyar ta hade da Tanganyika African National Union (TANU) don kafa Chama Cha Mapinduzi (CCM). [3]

A babban zaɓen Zanzibari na shekarar 1963, ASP ta samu kujeru 13 da mafi yawan kuri'un da aka kaɗa, duk da haka zaɓen ya ƙare da jam'iyyar Zanzibar Nationalist Party da kawancen Zanzibar da Pemba People's Party waɗanda suka haɗa baki 18. [1] Ba tare da gamsuwa da irin wannan wakilci na rashin adalci ba a majalisar, ASP, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Abeid Karume, sun haɗa kai da jam'iyyar Umma domin fara juyin juya halin Zanzibar a ranar 12 ga watan Janairun 1964.
