[2] A ranar 5 ga watan Fabrairun 1977, jam'iyyar ta haɗe da Tanganyika African National Union (TANU) don kafa Chama Cha Mapinduzi (CCM). [3]

items.sourceText: The area where the building complex is situated, Trou Fanfaron, was the landing point for the French East India Company, which took possession of Mauritius in 1721.[1] Slaves were imported from Africa, India and Madagascar to construct defensive walls and a hospital during the early phase of settlement.[2] By the mid-18th century, sugar plantations had been developed on the Island of Mauritius, utilizing slave labour.[6]

targets.targetText: Wurin da ginin yake, Trou Fanfaron, shine wurin saukowa na Kamfanin Faransa Gabashin Indiya, wanda ya mallaki Mauritius a shekarar 1721. [1] An shigo da bayi daga Afirka, Indiya da Madagascar don gina katangar tsaro da asibiti a lokacin farkon matakin. [2] A tsakiyar ƙarni na 18, an bunƙasa noman sukari a tsibirin Mauritius, ana amfani da aikin bayi. [2]

[1] An shigo da bayi daga Afirka, Indiya da Madagascar don gina katangar tsaro da asibiti a lokacin farkon matakin. [2] A tsakiyar karni na 18, an bunkasa noman sukari a tsibirin Mauritius, ana amfani da aikin bayi. [2]

items.sourceText: A Greek myth first recorded by Pindar in the early fifth century BC reports that the god Apollo fell in love with the huntress Cyrene and brought her to Libya, where she gave birth to a son Aristaeus.[2] Greek historical traditions, reported in Herodotus' Histories and in a fourth-century BC inscription found at Cyrene, say that a group of Cretan Greeks, who had been expelled from Sparta and settled on the island of Thera, founded Cyrene in 631 BC, under the leadership of Battus I, at the prompting of the Oracle of Delphi.[6][7] Some traditions say that the settlers left Thera because of a famine, others because of a civil war. Most say that the colonists first settled on an island at Aziris (east of Derna) before relocating to Cyrene.[7] The historicity of these narratives is uncertain, particularly the idea that Thera was Cyrene's sole "mother city." Relationships with other cities, such as Sparta[8] and Samos,[9] mentioned in the foundation narratives, are uncertain.[6]

targets.targetText: Wani tatsuniya na Girka da Pindar ya fara rubutawa a farkon karni na biyar BC ya ba da rahoton cewa allahn Apollo ya ƙaunaci maharbi Cyrene kuma ya kawo ta Libya, inda ta haifi ɗa Aristaeus . [ 2 ] Hadisai na tarihi na Girka, da aka ruwaito a cikin Tarihin Herodotus da kuma a cikin rubutun karni na huɗu BC da aka samu a Cyrene, sun ce ƙungiyar Helenawa ta Cretan, waɗanda aka kori daga Sparta kuma suka zauna a tsibirin Thera, sun kafa Cyrene a 631 BC, karkashin jagorancin Battus I, a lokacin da Oracle na Delphi ya jagoranci Oracle na Delphi . [1] [ 7 ] Wasu hadisai sun ce mazauna garin sun bar Thera saboda yunwa, wasu kuma saboda yakin basasa. Yawancin sun ce ’yan mulkin mallaka sun fara zama a wani tsibiri a Aziris (gabashin Derna ) kafin su ƙaura zuwa Sairina. [ 7 ] Tarihin waɗannan labarun ba shi da tabbas, musamman ma ra'ayin cewa Thera ita ce kawai "birnin uwar" Cyrene. Dangantaka da wasu garuruwa, irin su Sparta [2] da Samos, [3] da aka ambata a cikin labarun tushe, ba su da tabbas. [1]

items.sourceText: A series of meetings were held in November and December 1923 to form an association. On 21 December 1923, the Young Ansar Ud Deen was formed. A number of its original members were associated with Saros in Lagos.[1]

targets.targetText: An yi jerin tarurruka a watan Nuwamba da Disamba 1923 don kafa ƙungiyar. Ranar 21 ga watan Disamban 1923 aka kafa ƙaramar ƙungiyar Ansar Ud Deen. Yawancin membobinta na asali suna da alaƙa da Saros a Legas. [ 1 ]
An yi jerin tarurruka a watan Nuwamba da Disamba 1923 don kafa ƙungiya. A ranar 21 ga Disamba 1923 aka kafa Matashin Ansar Ud Deen. Yawancin membobinta na asali suna da alaƙa da Saros a Legas. [ 1 ]

items.sourceText: The Slave Trade Act of 1794 was a law passed by the United States Congress that prohibited the building or outfitting of ships in U.S. ports for the international slave trade. It was signed into law by President George Washington on March 22, 1794. This was the first of several anti-slave-trade acts of Congress. In 1800, Congress strengthened it by sharply raising the fines and awarding informants the entire value of any ship seized, as well as additional prohibitions on American investment and employment in the trade.[1]

targets.targetText: Dokar cinikin bayi ta 1794 wata doka ce da Majalisar Dokokin Amurka ta zartar da ta hana gini ko sanya kaya na jiragen ruwa a tashoshin jiragen ruwa na Amurka don cinikin bayi na duniya . Shugaba George Washington ya sanya hannu a kan doka a ranar 22 ga Maris, 1794. Wannan shi ne na farko na wasu ayyukan hana-bayi-ciniki na Majalisa. A shekara ta 1800, Majalisa ta ƙarfafa ta ta hanyar ƙara tara tara da ba wa masu ba da labari cikakken darajar duk wani jirgin da aka kama, da kuma ƙarin hani game da zuba jari da aikin Amirka a cikin cinikayya. [1]

Dokar cinikin bayi ta 1794 wata doka ce da Majalisar Dokokin Amurka ta zartar da ta hana gini ko sanya kaya na jiragen ruwa a tashoshin jiragen ruwa na Amurka don cinikin bayi na duniya. Shugaba George Washington ya sanya hannu a kan doka a ranar 22 ga watan Maris, 1794. Wannan shi ne na farko na wasu ayyukan hana-cinikin-bayi na Majalisa. A shekara ta 1800, Majalisa ta ƙarfafa ta ta hanyar ƙara tara da ba wa masu ba da labari cikakken darajar duk wani jirgin da aka kama, da kuma ƙarin hani game da zuba jari da aikin Amirka a cikin cinikayya. [1]

items.sourceText: In the Atlantic slave trade, captured individuals were temporarily transported to and imprisoned at barracoons along the coast of West Africa, where they awaited forced transportation across the Atlantic Ocean. A barracoon simplified the slave trader's job of keeping the people destined for slavery alive and in captivity, with the barracks being closely guarded and the captives being fed and allowed exercise.[2][3]

targets.targetText: A cikin cinikin bayin Atlantika, an kai mutanen da aka kama na wani dan lokaci kuma a daure su a gidajen yari da ke gabar tekun Afirka ta Yamma, inda suke jiran safarar tilas ta tsallaka Tekun Atlantika . Wani bariki ya sauƙaƙa aikin ɗan kasuwan bayi na kiyaye mutanen da aka yi niyyar bautar a raye da kuma zaman bauta, tare da kiyaye bariki sosai tare da ciyar da waɗanda aka kama tare da ba da izinin motsa jiki. [1] [2]

A cikin cinikin bayin Atlantika, an kai mutanen da aka kama na wani ɗan lokaci kuma a ɗaure su a gidajen yari da ke gaɓar tekun Afirka ta Yamma, inda suke jiran safarar tilas ta tsallaka Tekun Atlantika. Wani bariki ya sauƙaƙa aikin ɗan kasuwan bayi na kiyaye mutanen da aka yi niyyar bautar da su a raye da kuma zaman bauta, tare da kiyaye bariki sosai tare da ciyar da waɗanda aka kama tare da ba da izinin motsa jiki. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: San hunter and gatherers, ancestors of the Khoisani peoples, were the first known inhabitants of the region that is now Mozambique, followed in the 1st and 4th centuries by Bantu-speaking peoples who migrated there across the Zambezi River. In 1498, Portuguese explorers landed on the Mozambican coastline.[48] Portugal's influence in East Africa grew throughout the 16th century; it established several colonies known collectively as Portuguese East Africa. Slavery and gold became profitable for the Europeans; influence was largely exercised through individual settlers and there was no centralized administration.[49]

targets.targetText: San mafarauci da tara, kakannin al'ummar Khoisani, su ne mutanen farko da aka sani a yankin da a yanzu ya zama Mozambique, a cikin ƙarni na 1 da na 4 na mutanen Bantu da suka yi ƙaura zuwa can ƙetare kogin Zambezi . A cikin 1498, masu binciken Portuguese sun sauka a bakin tekun Mozambique. [1] Tasirin Portugal a Gabashin Afirka ya karu a cikin karni na 16; ta kafa yankuna da yawa da aka sani gaba ɗaya kamar Portuguese Gabashin Afirka . Bauta da zinariya sun zama riba ga Turawa; An yi tasiri sosai ta hanyar daidaikun mazauna kuma babu wata gwamnati ta tsakiya. [2]

San mafarauci da tara, kakannin al'ummar Khoisani, su ne mutanen farko da aka sani a yankin da a yanzu ya zama Mozambique, a cikin ƙarni na 1 da na 4 na mutanen Bantu da suka yi ƙaura zuwa can ƙetare kogin Zambezi. A cikin shekarar 1498, masu binciken Portuguese sun sauka a bakin tekun Mozambique. [1] Tasirin Portugal a Gabashin Afirka ya karu a cikin ƙarni na 16; ta kafa yankuna da yawa da aka sani gaba ɗaya kamar Portuguese Gabashin Afirka. Bauta da zinariya sun zama riba ga Turawa; An yi tasiri sosai ta hanyar ɗaiɗaikun mazauna kuma babu wata gwamnati ta tsakiya. [2]

items.sourceText: The Gaza Empire, a collection of indigenous tribes who inhabited the area that now constitutes Mozambique and Zimbabwe, was defeated by the Portuguese in 1895,[1] and the remaining inland tribes were eventually defeated by 1902; in that same year, Portugal established Lourenço Marques as the capital.[51] In 1926, political and economic crisis in Portugal led to the establishment of the Second Republic (later to become the Estado Novo), and a revival of interest in the African colonies. Calls for self determination in Mozambique arose shortly after World War II, in light of the independence granted to many other colonies worldwide in the great wave of decolonisation.[41][4]

targets.targetText: Masarautar Gaza, tarin kabilun ƴan asalin ƙasar da ke zaune a yankin da yanzu ya zama Mozambique da Zimbabwe, Turawan Portugal sun ci nasara a 1895, [1] kuma sauran ƙabilu na cikin gida sun ci nasara a 1902; A wannan shekarar, Portugal ta kafa Lourenço Marques a matsayin babban birnin kasar. [2] A cikin 1926, rikicin siyasa da tattalin arziki a Portugal ya haifar da kafuwar Jamhuriya ta biyu (daga baya ta zama Estado Novo ), da farfaɗo da sha'awar ƙasashen Afirka. Kiraye-kirayen neman yancin kai a Mozambik ya taso ne jim kadan bayan yakin duniya na biyu, bisa la’akari da ‘yancin kai da aka bai wa wasu kasashen duniya da dama a cikin babban guguwar neman mulkin mallaka . [3]

Masarautar Gaza, tarin ƙabilun ƴan asalin ƙasar da ke zaune a yankin da yanzu ya zama Mozambique da Zimbabwe, Turawan Portugal sun ci nasara a shekarar 1895, [1] kuma sauran ƙabilu na cikin gida sun ci nasara a shekarar 1902; A wannan shekarar, Portugal ta kafa Lourenço Marques a matsayin babban birnin ƙasar. [2] A cikin shekarar 1926, rikicin siyasa da tattalin arziki a Portugal ya haifar da kafuwar Jamhuriya ta biyu (daga baya ta zama Estado Novo), da farfaɗo da sha'awar ƙasashen Afirka. Kiraye-kirayen neman yancin kai a Mozambik ya taso ne jim kaɗan bayan yakin duniya na biyu, bisa la’akari da ‘yancin kai da aka bai wa wasu ƙasashen duniya da dama a cikin babban guguwar neman mulkin mallaka. [3]

items.sourceText: Armed struggle against the Portuguese began in March 1962 with an abortive attack by PAIGC guerrillas on Praia. Guerrilla warfare was largely concentrated to the mainland Guinea, however, as logistical reasons prevented an armed struggle on the Cape Verde islands. On the Cape Verde islands PAIGC worked in a clandestine manner. After being nearly crippled militarily, Amílcar Cabral ordered that sabotage be the PAIGC's main weapon until military strength could be regained. On 23 January 1963 the PAIGC started the Guinea-Bissau War of Independence by attacking a Portuguese garrison in Tite.[1] Frequent attacks in the north also took place. In that same month, attacks on police stations in Fulacunda and Buba were carried out not only by the PAIGC but also by the FLING.

targets.targetText: An fara gwagwarmayar makamai da Portuguese a cikin Maris 1962 tare da wani hari na zubar da ciki da 'yan ta'addar PAIGC suka yi a Praia . Yakin Guerrilla ya fi karkata ne zuwa babban yankin Guinea, duk da haka, saboda dalilai na dabaru sun hana gwagwarmayar makami a tsibiran Cape Verde. A kan tsibiran Cape Verde PAIGC sun yi aiki a cikin sirri. Bayan kusan gurgunta aikin soji, Amílcar Cabral ya ba da umarnin cewa zagon kasa ya zama babban makamin PAIGC har sai an sami karfin soja . A ranar 23 ga watan Janairun 1963 kungiyar PAIGC ta fara yakin 'yancin kai na Guinea-Bissau ta hanyar kai hari ga wani sansanin 'yan gudun hijira a Tite . [1] Haka kuma an kai hare-hare akai-akai a arewacin kasar. A cikin wannan watan, an kai hare-hare a ofisoshin 'yan sanda a Fulacunda da Buba ba wai PIGC kadai ba har ma da FLING .

An fara gwagwarmayar makamai da Portuguese a cikin watan Maris 1962 tare da wani hari na zubar da ciki da 'yan ta'addar PAIGC suka yi a Praia. Yakin Guerrilla ya fi karkata ne zuwa babban yankin Guinea, duk da haka, saboda dalilai na dabaru sun hana gwagwarmayar makami a tsibiran Cape Verde. A kan tsibiran Cape Verde PAIGC sun yi aiki a cikin sirri. Bayan kusan gurgunta aikin soji, Amílcar Cabral ya ba da umarnin cewa zagon kasa ya zama babban makamin PAIGC har sai an sami karfin soja. A ranar 23 ga watan Janairun 1963 kungiyar PAIGC ta fara yakin 'yancin kai na Guinea-Bissau ta hanyar kai hari ga wani sansanin 'yan gudun hijira a Tite. items.sourceText: In January 1966, Amílcar Cabral attended the Tricontinental Conference 1966 in Havana and made a great impression on Fidel Castro. As a result of this, Cuba agreed to supply artillery experts, doctors and technicians to assist in the independence struggle. The head of the Cuban Military Mission was Víctor Dreke.[9] In the context of the ongoing Cold War, PAIGC guerrillas also received Kalashnikovs from the USSR and recoilless rifles from the People's Republic of China, with all three countries helping train guerrilla troops. SFR Yugoslavia sent a small cache of weapons to PAIGC in 1966.[10]

targets.targetText: A cikin watan Janairu 1966, Amílcar Cabral ya halarci taron Tricontinental 1966 a Havana kuma ya yi babban ra'ayi akan Fidel Castro. Sakamakon haka, Cuba ta amince da samar da kwararrun manyan bindigogi, likitoci da masu fasaha don taimakawa a gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai. Shugaban Ofishin Jakadancin Cuban shine Víctor Dreke. [1] Dangane da yakin cacar baki da ake ci gaba da yi, 'yan ta'addar PAIGC sun kuma karbi Kalashnikov daga jam'iyyar USSR da kuma bindigogi marasa karko daga jamhuriyar jama'ar kasar Sin, inda dukkan kasashen uku suka taimaka wajen horas da dakarun sa-kai. SFR Yugoslavia ta aika da ƙananan tarin makamai zuwa PAIGC a cikin 1966. [2]

Sakamakon haka, Cuba ta amince da samar da kwararrun manyan bindigogi, likitoci da masu fasaha don taimakawa a gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai. Shugaban Ofishin Jakadancin Cuban shine Víctor Dreke . SFR Yugoslavia ta aika da ƙananan tarin makamai zuwa PAIGC a cikin 1966. [2]

items.sourceText: The Italian government decided on a military solution to force Ethiopia to abide by the Italian version of the treaty. As a result, Italy and Ethiopia came into confrontation, in what was later to be known as the First Italo-Ethiopian War. In December 1894, Bahta Hagos led a rebellion against the Italians in Akele Guzai, in what was then Italian controlled Eritrea. Units of General Oreste Baratieri's army under Major Pietro Toselli crushed the rebellion and killed Bahta. In January 1895, Baratieri's army went on to defeat Ras Mengesha Yohannes in the Battle of Coatit, forcing Mengesha to retreat further south.

targets.targetText: Gwamnatin Italiya ta yanke shawarar samar da mafita ta soja don tilastawa Habasha yin biyayya ga tsarin Italiya na yarjejeniyar. Sakamakon haka, Italiya da Habasha sun yi arangama, a wani abin da daga baya aka fi sani da Yaƙin Italo da Habasha na Farko. A cikin watan Disamba 1894, Bahta Hagos ya jagoranci tawaye ga Italiya a Akele Guzai, a lokacin da Italiya ke iko da Eritrea. Rukunin sojojin Janar Oreste Baratieri ƙarƙashin Manjo Pietro Toselli sun murkushe tawaye suka kashe Bahta. A cikin watan Janairu 1895, sojojin Baratieri sun ci gaba da fatattakar Ras Mengesha Yohannes a yakin Coatit, wanda ya tilasta Mengesha ya koma kudu.

Gwamnatin Italiya ta yanke shawarar samar da mafita ta soja don tilastawa Habasha yin biyayya ga tsarin Italiyanci na yarjejeniyar. Sakamakon haka, Italiya da Habasha sun yi arangama, a wani abin da daga baya aka fi sani da Yaƙin Italo da Habasha na Farko . A cikin Disamba 1894, Bahta Hagos ya jagoranci tawaye ga Italiyanci a Akele Guzai, a lokacin da Italiya ke iko da Eritrea . Rukunin sojojin Janar Oreste Baratieri karkashin Manjo Pietro Toselli sun murkushe tawaye suka kashe Bahta. A cikin Janairu 1895, sojojin Baratieri sun ci gaba da fatattakar Ras Mengesha Yohannes a yakin Coatit, wanda ya tilasta Mengesha ya koma kudu.

items.sourceText: By late 1895, Italian forces had advanced deep into Ethiopian territory and occupied much of Tigray. On 7 December 1895, Ras Makonnen Wolde Mikael, Fitawrari Gebeyehu and Ras Mengesha Yohannes commanding a larger Ethiopian group of Menelik's vanguard annihilated a small Italian unit at the Battle of Amba Alagi. The Italians were then forced to withdraw to more defensible positions in Tigray Province, where the two main armies faced each other. By late February 1896, supplies on both sides were running low. General Oreste Baratieri, commander of the Italian forces, knew the Ethiopian forces had been living off the land, and once the supplies of the local peasants were exhausted, Emperor Menelik II's army would begin to melt away. However, the Italian government insisted that General Baratieri act.

targets.targetText: A ƙarshen shekarun 1895, sojojin Italiya sun yi zurfi zuwa cikin ƙasar Habasha kuma sun mamaye yawancin Tigray. A ranar 7 ga watan Disamba 1895, Ras Makonnen Wolde Mikael, Fitawrari Gebeyehu da Ras Mengesha Yohannes da ke jagorantar wata babbar ƙungiyar Habasha ta dakarun Menelik sun halaka wata ƙaramar ƙungiyar Italiya a yakin Amba Alagi. Daga nan ne aka tilastawa Italiyan janyewa zuwa wasu wurare masu tsaro a lardin Tigray, inda manyan sojojin biyu suka fuskanci juna. A ƙarshen watan Fabrairu 1896, kayayyaki a ɓangarorin biyu sun yi ƙasa. Janar Oreste Baratieri, kwamandan sojojin Italiya, ya san cewa sojojin Habasha suna zaune a cikin ƙasa, kuma da zarar kayan amfanin gonakin yankin ya ƙare, sojojin Emperor Menelik na biyu za su fara narkewa. Duk da haka, gwamnatin Italiya ta dage cewa Janar Baratieri ya yi aiki.

A ƙarshen 1895, sojojin Italiya sun yi zurfi zuwa cikin ƙasar Habasha kuma sun mamaye yawancin Tigray. A ranar 7 ga Disamba 1895, Ras Makonnen Wolde Mikael, Fitawrari Gebeyehu da Ras Mengesha Yohannes da ke jagorantar wata babbar ƙungiyar Habasha ta dakarun Menelik sun halaka wata ƙaramar ƙungiyar Italiya a yakin Amba Alagi . Daga nan ne aka tilastawa Italiyan janyewa zuwa wasu wurare masu tsaro a lardin Tigray, inda manyan sojojin biyu suka fuskanci juna. A ƙarshen Fabrairu 1896, kayayyaki a bangarorin biyu sun yi ƙasa. Janar Oreste Baratieri, kwamandan sojojin Italiya, ya san cewa sojojin Habasha suna zaune a cikin ƙasa, kuma da zarar kayan amfanin gonakin yankin ya ƙare, sojojin Emperor Menelik na biyu za su fara narke. Duk da haka, gwamnatin Italiya ta dage cewa Janar Baratieri ya yi aiki.

items.sourceText: The Battle of Dogali was fought on 26 January 1887 between Italy and Ethiopia in Dogali near Massawa, in present-day Eritrea.

targets.targetText: An yi yakin Dogali a ranar 26 ga watan Janairun 1887 tsakanin Italiya da Habasha a Dogali kusa da Massawa, a ƙasar Eritrea ta yau.
An yi yakin Dogali a ranar 26 ga Janairun 1887 tsakanin Italiya da Habasha a Dogali kusa da Massawa, a kasar Eritrea ta yau .

items.sourceText: This battle was celebrated under the Derg regime, and Mengistu Haile Mariam commemorated the centennial with much attention, including the erection of a monument topped with a red star on the battlefield. Following Eritrean independence, the monument was removed. Paul B. Henze diplomatically notes in a footnote, "When I crossed the battlefield in 1996, I could detect no trace of the monument."[7]

targets.targetText: An yi wannan yakin ne a zamanin mulkin Dergi, kuma Mengistu Haile Mariam ya yi bikin cika shekaru 100 da kulawa, ciki har da kafa wani abin tarihi da aka yi sama da jajayen tauraro a fagen daga. Bayan 'yancin kai na Eritriya, an cire abin tunawa. Paul B. Henze a fannin diflomasiyya ya lura a cikin wani rubutu na ƙasa, "Lokacin da na ketare fagen fama a shekarar 1996, ban iya gano wani alamar abin tunawa ba." [1]

An yi wannan yakin ne a zamanin mulkin Dergi, kuma Mengistu Haile Mariam ya yi bikin cika shekaru 100 da kulawa, ciki har da kafa wani abin tarihi da aka yi sama da jajayen tauraro a fagen daga. Bayan 'yancin kai na Eritriya, an cire abin tunawa. Paul B. Henze a fannin diflomasiyya ya lura a cikin wani rubutu na ƙasa, "Lokacin da na ketare fagen fama a 1996, ban iya gano wani alamar abin tunawa ba." [1]

items.sourceText: The Battle of Amba Alagi was the first in a series of battles between the Italian General Baratieri and Ethiopia's Emperor Menelik during the First Italo-Ethiopian War. Amba Alagi was one of Baratieri's forward positions; it was under the command of Major Toselli with 2,000 Eritrean Askari. On 7 December 1895, the Ras Makonnen, Fitawrari Gebeyehu and Ras Mengesha Yohannes commanded an assault of Menelik's vanguard that annihilated the Italians and killed Major Toselli.

targets.targetText: Yakin Amba Alagi shi ne na farko a jerin fadace-fadacen da aka yi tsakanin Janar Baratieri na Italiya da Sarkin Habasha Menelik a lokacin Yaƙin Italo da Habasha na Farko . Amba Alagi yana daya daga cikin jiga-jigan Baratieri; yana karkashin jagorancin Major Toselli tare da Askari Eritrea 2,000 . A ranar 7 ga Disamba 1895, Ras Makonnen, Fitawrari Gebeyehu da Ras Mengesha Yohannes sun ba da umarnin kai hari ga jami'an tsaron Menelik wanda ya hallaka Italiyawa tare da kashe Major Toselli.

Yakin Amba Alagi shi ne na farko a jerin faɗace-faɗacen da aka yi tsakanin Janar Baratieri na Italiya da Sarkin Habasha Menelik a lokacin Yaƙin Italo da Habasha na Farko. Amba Alagi yana ɗaya daga cikin jiga-jigan Baratieri; yana ƙarƙashin jagorancin Major Toselli tare da Askari Eritrea 2,000. A ranar 7 ga watan Disamba 1895, Ras Makonnen, Fitawrari Gebeyehu da Ras Mengesha Yohannes sun ba da umarnin kai hari ga jami'an tsaron Menelik wanda ya hallaka Italiyawa tare da kashe Major Toselli.

items.sourceText: In the early 16th century, the Portuguese arrived, destroyed Mutapa's trade with Swahili merchants and began a series of wars which left the empire so weakened that it was near collapse in the early 17th century. Several Kalanga communities came together to form the Rozwi Empire, which covered more than half of present-day Zimbabwe. By 1690 they forced the Portuguese off the plateau and the Rozvi controlled much of the land formerly under Mwene Mutapa.

targets.targetText: A farkon karni na 16, Portuguese sun isa, sun lalata kasuwancin Mutapa tare da 'yan kasuwa na Swahili kuma sun fara yaƙe-yaƙe wanda ya sa daular ta yi rauni har ya kusa rushewa a farkon karni na 17. Al'ummomin Kalanga da dama sun taru don kafa daular Rozwi, wadda ta mamaye fiye da rabin Zimbabwe a yau . A shekara ta 1690 sun tilastawa 'yan Portugal daga tudun ruwa kuma Rozvi sun mallaki yawancin ƙasar da ke karkashin Mwene Mutapa.

A farkon ƙarni na 16, Portuguese sun isa, sun lalata kasuwancin Mutapa tare da 'yan kasuwa na Swahili kuma sun fara yaƙe-yaƙe wanda ya sa daular ta yi rauni har ta kusa rushewa a farkon ƙarni na 17. Al'ummomin Kalanga da dama sun taru don kafa daular Rozwi, wadda ta mamaye fiye da rabin Zimbabwe a yau. A shekara ta 1690 sun tilastawa 'yan Portugal daga tudun ruwa kuma Rozvi sun mallaki yawancin ƙasar da ke ƙarƙashin Mwene Mutapa.

items.sourceText: Rhodes used the concession to persuade the British government to grant a royal charter to his British South Africa Company (BSAC) over Matabeleland and its subject states, such as Mashonaland. Through such concessions and treaties, many of which were similarly deceitful,[1] he promoted the colonization of the region's land, labor, and precious metal and mineral resources.[3] In 1895 the BSAC adopted the name 'Rhodesia' for Zambesia and in 1898 'Southern Rhodesia' was officially adopted for the part south of the Zambezi River,[4] which later became Zimbabwe.

targets.targetText: Rhodes ya yi amfani da wannan rangwame don shawo kan gwamnatin Birtaniyya ta ba da takardar shedar sarauta ga Kamfanin sa na Afirka ta Kudu na Burtaniya (BSAC) akan Matabeleland da jihohin da ke karkashinta, kamar Mashonaland . Ta hanyar irin wannan rangwame da yarjejeniyoyin, da yawa daga cikinsu sun kasance masu ha'inci iri-iri, [1] ya inganta mulkin mallaka na yankin yanki, aiki, da albarkatun ƙarfe da ma'adinai masu daraja. [2] A cikin 1895 BSAC ta karɓi sunan ' Rhodesia ' don Zambesia kuma a cikin 1898' Kudancin Rhodesia ' an karbe su a hukumance don sashin kudancin kogin Zambezi, [3] wanda daga baya ya zama Zimbabwe.

Rhodes ya yi amfani da wannan rangwame don shawo kan gwamnatin Birtaniyya ta ba da takardar shedar sarauta ga Kamfanin sa na Afirka ta Kudu na Burtaniya (BSAC) akan Matabeleland da jihohin da ke ƙarƙashin ta, kamar Mashonaland. Ta hanyar irin wannan rangwame da yarjejeniyoyin, da yawa daga cikinsu sun kasance masu ha'inci iri-iri, [1] ya inganta mulkin mallaka na yankin yanki, aiki, da albarkatun ƙarfe da ma'adinai masu daraja. [2] A cikin shekarar 1895 BSAC ta karɓi sunan 'Rhodesia' don Zambesia kuma a cikin shekarar 1898 'Kudancin Rhodesia' an karɓe su a hukumance don sashin kudancin kogin Zambezi, [3] wanda daga baya ya zama Zimbabwe.

items.sourceText: In 1890 Rhodes used this fact to justify sending the Pioneer Column of European settlers, protected by well-armed British South Africa Police (BSAP), the BSAC's own paramilitary force. Rhodes said they hoped to start a "new Rand" from the ancient gold mines of Mashonaland. The gold had been largely depleted, and the settlers became farmers. Rhodes declared that Lobengula had never really conquered the Shona, so he proclaimed Mashonaland as independent of Matabeland, exploiting tribal rivalries to cement the British settlers' occupation.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1890 Rhodes ya yi amfani da wannan gaskiyar don ba da hujjar aika Rukunin Pioneer na mazauna Turai, waɗanda 'yan sandan Afirka ta Kudu masu ƙwararru (BSAP) ke kiyaye su, rundunar BSAC ta ma'aikatar tsaro. Rhodes ya ce suna fatan fara "sabon Rand" daga tsohuwar ma'adinan zinare na Mashonaland. Zinarin ya ƙare da yawa, kuma mazaunan sun zama manoma. Rhodes ya bayyana cewa Lobengula bai taba cin nasara da Shona ba, don haka ya yi shelar Mashonaland a matsayin mai zaman kanta daga Matabeland, yana amfani da kishiyoyin kabilanci don tabbatar da mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya. [1]

A cikin 1890 Rhodes ya yi amfani da wannan gaskiyar don ba da hujjar aika Rukunin Pioneer na mazauna Turai, waɗanda 'yan sandan Afirka ta Kudu masu ƙwararru (BSAP) ke kiyaye su, rundunar BSAC ta ma'aikatar tsaro. Rhodes ya ce suna fatan fara "sabon Rand " daga tsohuwar ma'adinan zinare na Mashonaland. Zinarin ya ƙare da yawa, kuma mazaunan sun zama manoma. Rhodes ya bayyana cewa Lobengula bai taba cin nasara da Shona ba, don haka ya yi shelar Mashonaland a matsayin mai zaman kanta daga Matabeland, yana amfani da kishiyoyin kabilanci don tabbatar da mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1918, the BSAC cut back on expenditure and public services such as the mail system, which worsened its popularity among settlers. Agitation continued to grow for self-rule independent of any private corporation. The Legislative Council election of 1920 resulted in a majority who favoured immediate moves towards establishing 'Responsible Government' within the colony. Immediately after the election, the Legislative Council passed a resolution requesting the United Kingdom government to inaugurate responsible government. The UK established a Commission under Earl Buxton, a former Liberal minister. The Commission reported in 1921 that the Colony was ready for responsible government and that a referendum should be held to confirm it. On 27 October 1922 a referendum was held to determine whether the colony should join the Union of South Africa or establish self-government. The self-government camp won the referendum by a wide margin.[6]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1918, BSAC ta rage kashe kuɗi da sabis na jama'a kamar tsarin wasiƙa, wanda ya tsananta shahararsa a tsakanin mazauna. Tashin hankali ya ci gaba da girma don mulkin kai ba tare da wani kamfani mai zaman kansa ba. Zaɓen Majalisar Dokoki na shekarar 1920 ya haifar da mafi rinjaye waɗanda suka goyi bayan yunƙuri kai tsaye don kafa 'Gwamnati Mai Alhaki' a cikin mulkin mallaka. Nan da nan bayan zaɓen, Majalisar Dokoki ta zartas da wani kudiri na neman gwamnatin Burtaniya ta kaddamar da gwamnati mai alhaki. Birtaniya ta kafa Hukumar ƙarƙashin Earl Buxton, tsohon ministan Liberal. Hukumar ta ba da rahoto a cikin shekarar 1921 cewa Mulkin Mallaka ya shirya don gudanar da gwamnati mai alhakin kuma ya kamata a gudanar da zaɓen raba gardama don tabbatar da shi. A ranar 27 ga watan Oktoban 1922 ne aka gudanar da ƙuri'ar raba gardama don sanin ko mulkin mallaka ya kamata ya shiga Tarayyar Afirka ta Kudu ko kuma ya kafa mulkin kai. Sansanin gwamnatin kai ya lashe zaɓen raba gardama da tazara mai yawa. [1]

items.sourceText: Umuguma Town is Owerri West Local Government Area's headquarters. It is in Imo State, Nigeria. It evolved out of the old Owerri Local Government Area in 1996. Umuguma—a descendant of Arugo—is one of the 774 communities in the constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria as Local Government administrative[1][2]

targets.targetText: Garin Umuguma shine hedkwatar karamar hukumar Owerri West. Yana cikin Jihar Imo, Najeriya. Ya samo asali ne daga tsohuwar karamar hukumar Owerri a shekarar 1996. Umuguma - zuriyar Arugo - tana ɗaya daga cikin al'ummomi 774 a cikin kundin tsarin mulkin Tarayyar Najeriya a matsayin karamar hukuma [1][2]

Garin Umuguma shi ne hedkwatar ƙaramar hukumar Owerri West. Yana cikin Jihar Imo, Najeriya. Ya samo asali ne daga tsohuwar ƙaramar hukumar Owerri a cikin shekarar 1996. items.sourceText: A disciple of Abdelhamid Ben Badis, he was active in the Islamic reformation of Algeria and the Algerian War of Independence. He directed the Friends of the Manifesto and Liberty Party's (in French: Amis du Manifeste et de la Liberté, AML) Federation in Constantine, and was a member of the Central Committee and Deputy of the Constantine region from 1947 to 1951.

targets.targetText: Almajirin Abdelhamid Ben Badis, ya kasance mai fafutukar kawo sauyi na Musulunci na Aljeriya da Yakin 'Yancin Aljeriya . Ya jagoranci Abokan Manifesto da Liberty Party 's (a cikin Faransanci: Amis du Manifeste et de la Liberté, AML) Tarayya a cikin Constantine, kuma ya kasance memba na kwamitin tsakiya kuma mataimakin yankin Constantine daga 1947 zuwa 1951.

Abdelhamid Ben Badis, ya kasance mai fafutukar kawo sauyi na Musulunci na Aljeriya da Yakin 'Yancin Aljeriya. Ya jagoranci Abokan Manifesto da Liberty Party 's (a cikin Faransanci: Amis du Manifeste et de la Liberté, AML) Tarayya a cikin Constantine, kuma ya kasance memba na kwamitin tsakiya kuma mataimakin yankin Constantine daga shekarun 1947 zuwa 1951.

items.sourceText: Mourad Didouche, nicknamed Si Abdelkader, was born on July 13, 1927, at El Mouradia in Algiers in a family originally from the village of Ibskriène, Aghribs in Kabylia. He did his primary and the junior school in El Mouradia and then studied at the technical high school of Algiers (Ruisseau).[1]

targets.targetText: Mourad Didouche, wanda ake yi wa laƙabi da Si Abdelkader, an haife shi a ranar 13 ga watan Yuli, 1927, a El Mouradia a Algiers a cikin dangi na asali daga ƙauyen Ibskriène, Aghribs a cikin Kabylia. Ya yi firamarensa a ƙaramar makarantar El Mouradia sannan ya yi karatu a makarantar fasaha ta Algiers (Ruisseau). [1]

Mourad Didouche, wanda ake yi wa lakabi da Si Abdelkader, an haife shi a ranar 13 ga Yuli, 1927, a El Mouradia a Algiers a cikin dangi na asali daga ƙauyen Ibskriène, Aghribs a cikin Kabylia . Ya yi firamarensa da karamar makarantar El Mouradia sannan ya yi karatu a makarantar fasaha ta Algiers (Ruisseau). [1]

items.sourceText: Strongly anti-French, Ighilahriz joined the FLN under the codename Lila in late 1956 to work as a courier, smuggling information, weapons and bombs across Algiers in bread baked by her father.[1] On 28 September 1957 while traveling with a FLN party, Ighilahriz was ambushed by the French paratroopers at Chébli, badly wounded and captured.[3] At the hospital, Ighilahriz was given the "truth drug" Pentothal to make her talk, which failed to achieve its purpose.[3]

targets.targetText: Ƙarfin adawa da Faransanci, Ighilahriz ya shiga FLN a ƙarƙashin sunan Lila a ƙarshen 1956 don yin aiki a matsayin mai aikawa, bayanai, makamai da bama-bamai a cikin Algiers a cikin burodin da mahaifinta ya toya. [1] A ranar 28 ga Satumba 1957 yayin tafiya tare da jam'iyyar FLN, Ighilahriz ya yi wa 'yan sintiri na Faransa kwanton bauna a Chébli, ya ji rauni kuma suka kama shi. [1] A asibitin, an ba Ighilahriz "magungunan gaskiya" Pentothal don yin magana, wanda ya kasa cimma manufarsa. [1]

Ƙarfin adawa da Faransa, Ighilahriz ta shiga FLN a ƙarƙashin sunan Lila a ƙarshen shekarar 1956 don yin aiki a matsayin mai aikawa, bayanai, makamai da bama-bamai a cikin Algiers a cikin burodin da mahaifinta ya toya. [1] A ranar 28 ga watan Satumba 1957 yayin tafiya tare da jam'iyyar FLN, Ighilahriz ta yi wa 'yan sintiri na Faransa kwanton ɓauna a Chébli, ta ji rauni kuma suka kama ta. [1] A asibitin, an bai wa Ighilahriz "magungunan gaskiya" Pentothal don yin magana, wanda ya kasa cimma manufarsa. [1]

items.sourceText: Peschard was born on 15 September 1927 in Bologhine, French Algeria. Her father worked as a station master. During the 1950s, Peschard joined the Algerian Communist Party; when the French government cracked down on communist activity in Algeria, she was exiled from Constantine. In 1956, Peschard was incorrectly accused of being an accomplice to the Milk Bar Café bombing and was forced to flee from the colonial authorities.[1] As such, Peschard joined the Front de Libération Nationale, going on to participate in several missions the group launched against the colonial government. Peschard continued her activities, joining the more militant National Liberation Army in 1957. While operating with the ALN, she operated under the code-name "الطاووس"—"Peacock" in Arabic—serving as a nurse for the rebels.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Peschard a ranar 15 ga Satumba 1927 a Bologhine, Faransa Aljeriya . Mahaifinta yayi aiki a matsayin maigidan tasha. A cikin shekarun 1950, Peschard ya shiga jam'iyyar gurguzu ta Aljeriya ; lokacin da gwamnatin Faransa ta murkushe ayyukan gurguzu a Aljeriya, an kore ta daga Constantine . A cikin 1956, an zargi Peschard da laifin kasancewa mai hannu a harin bam na Milk Bar Café kuma an tilasta masa ya gudu daga hukumomin mulkin mallaka. [1] Don haka, Peschard ya shiga cikin Front de Libération Nationale, yana ci gaba da shiga cikin ayyuka da yawa da ƙungiyar ta ƙaddamar da gwamnatin mulkin mallaka. Peschard ta ci gaba da ayyukanta, tare da shiga cikin rundunar 'yantar da 'yancin kai a cikin 1957. Yayin da take aiki da ALN, ta yi aiki a ƙarƙashin lambar sunan "الطاووس" - "Peacock" a cikin Larabci - tana hidima a matsayin ma'aikaciyar jinya ga 'yan tawaye. [2]

items.sourceText: Ali Ammar (Arabic: علي عمار‎; 14 May 1930 – 8 October 1957), better known by his nom de guerre Ali la Pointe, was an Algerian militant, prominent revolutionary and guerilla figure of the Algerian War. He is best known for being one of the FLN commanders during the Battle of Algiers.

targets.targetText: Ali Ammar ( ‎ 14 ga Mayu 1930 - 8 ga Oktoba 1957), wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Ali la Pointe, ɗan gwagwarmayar Aljeriya ne, fitaccen ɗan juyin juya hali kuma ɗan tawaye a Yaƙin Aljeriya. An san shi da kasancewa ɗaya daga cikin kwamandojin FLN a lokacin Yaƙin Algiers.

Ali Ammar ( Arabic ‎ 14 ga Mayu 1930 - 8 ga Oktoba 1957), wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Ali la Pointe, ɗan gwagwarmayar Aljeriya ne, fitaccen ɗan juyin juya hali kuma ɗan daba a Yaƙin Aljeriya . An san shi da kasancewa ɗaya daga cikin kwamandojin FLN a lokacin Yaƙin Algiers .

items.sourceText: Eduardo Jonatão Samuel "Dinho" Chingunji (son of Kafundanga Chingunji) (born 7 September 1964) served as a political leader in UNITA, a pro-Western rebel group in Angola. During Angola's civil war (1975–2002), Eduardo was the only one of his brothers not to die in mysterious circumstances. Rumors attributed his brothers' deaths to assassination plots ordered by UNITA leader Jonas Savimbi.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Eduardo Jonatão Samuel "Dinho" Chingunji (ɗan Kafundanga Chingunji) (an haife shi 7 ga Satumba 1964) ya yi aiki a matsayin jagoran siyasa a UNITA, ƙungiyar 'yan tawayen Yammacin Turai a Angola . A lokacin yakin basasar Angola (1975 – 2002), Eduardo shi kadai ne a cikin ’yan’uwansa da bai mutu ba a cikin yanayi na ban mamaki. Jita-jita sun danganta kisan ’yan uwansa da makircin kisan da shugaban UNITA Jonas Savimbi ya bayar. [1] [2]

Eduardo Jonatão Samuel "Dinho" Chingunji (ɗan Kafundanga Chingunji) (an haife shi a ranar 7 ga watan Satumba 1964) ya yi aiki a matsayin jagoran siyasa a UNITA, ƙungiyar 'yan tawayen Yammacin Turai a Angola. A lokacin yakin basasar Angola (1975 – 2002), Eduardo shi kaɗai ne a cikin ’yan’uwansa da bai mutu ba a cikin yanayi na ban mamaki. Jita-jita sun danganta kisan ’yan uwansa da makircin kisan da shugaban UNITA Jonas Savimbi ya bayar. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: On the date of Agostinho Neto's death, Lara was the highest member of the political bureau and vice-president of the MPLA. With this, he assumed, on an interim basis, the functions of president of the party, and, by extension, president of the People's Republic of Angola.[citation needed] He urgently convened the 2nd MPLA Congress on 11 September 1979, working hard for the election of José Eduardo dos Santos, which occurred on September 20 of that same year. He rejected all proposals made to him to effectively take over the leadership of the country.[15][16][17][18]

targets.targetText: A ranar da Agostinho Neto ya mutu, Lara ta kasance mamba mafi girma a ofishin siyasa kuma mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar MPLA. Da wannan ne ya zaci ayyukan shugaban jam'iyyar na rikon kwarya, da kuma shugaban jam'iyyar jama'ar Angola . Ya kira babban taron MPLA na 2 a cikin gaggawa a kan 11 Satumba 1979, yana aiki tukuru don zaben José Eduardo dos Santos, wanda ya faru a ] 20 [ Satumba na wannan shekarar. Ya yi watsi da duk shawarwarin da aka yi masa na karbar ragamar shugabancin kasar yadda ya kamata. [1] [2] [3] [4]

A ranar da Agostinho Neto ya mutu, Lara ya kasance mamba mafi girma a ofishin siyasa kuma mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar MPLA. Da wannan ne ya zaci ayyukan shugaban jam'iyyar na rikon kwarya, da kuma shugaban jam'iyyar jama'ar Angola. Ya kira babban taron MPLA na 2 a cikin gaggawa a ranar 11 Satumba 1979, yana aiki tukuru don zaɓen José Eduardo dos Santos, wanda ya faru a ] 20 [ watan Satumba na wannan shekarar. Ya yi watsi da duk shawarwarin da aka yi masa na karɓar ragamar shugabancin ƙasar yadda ya kamata. [1] [2] [3] [4]

items.sourceText: Sangumba studied in the United States before joining the National Union of Angolan Students (UNEA) in the early 1960s. In 1965 he became UNEA's representative for external affairs, a precursor for his future appointment as the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA's) Foreign Minister in August 1969.[1]

targets.targetText: Sangumba ya yi karatu a Amurka kafin ya shiga kungiyar daliban Angolan (UNEA) a farkon shekarun 1960. A cikin 1965 ya zama wakilin UNEA mai kula da harkokin waje, wanda ya kasance mafarin nada shi nan gaba a matsayin Ƙungiyar Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Ƙasa ta Angola (UNITA's) Ministan Harkokin Wajen Angola a watan Agustan 1969. [1]

Sangumba ya yi karatu a Amurka kafin ya shiga kungiyar ɗaliban Angolan (UNEA) a farkon shekarun 1960. A cikin shekarar 1965 ya zama wakilin UNEA mai kula da harkokin waje, wanda ya kasance mafarin naɗa shi nan gaba a matsayin Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Ƙasa ta Angola (UNITA's) Ministan Harkokin Wajen Angola a watan Agustan 1969. [1]

items.sourceText: Fernando Wilson dos Santos (died November 1991)[1][2] served as the representative of the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA), a Freedom fighter group in Angola, to Portugal.[3] His brother-in-law, Tito Chingunji, served as Foreign Secretary of UNITA, the principal rebel group that fought against the dos Santos government in Angola's civil war.[4] He studied law at the University of Lisbon and the University of Coimbra in the late 1960s, and later at the Graduate Institute of International Studies in Geneva.[5]

targets.targetText: Fernando Wilson dos Santos (ya rasu a watan Nuwamba 1991) [1] [2] ya yi aiki a matsayin wakilin National Union for the Total Independence of Angola ( UNITA ), wata kungiyar gwagwarmayar 'yanci a Angola, zuwa Portugal . [3] Surukinsa, Tito Chingunji, ya yi aiki a matsayin sakataren harkokin wajen UNITA, babbar kungiyar 'yan tawaye da ta yaki gwamnatin dos Santos a yakin basasar Angola . [4] Ya karanci shari'a a Jami'ar Lisbon da Jami'ar Coimbra a karshen shekarun 1960, sannan ya karanci Cibiyar Nazarin Kasa da Kasa da ke Geneva. [5]

Fernando Wilson dos Santos (ya rasu a watan Nuwamba 1991) [1] [2] ya yi aiki a matsayin wakilin National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA), wata kungiyar 'yan gwagwarmayar samun 'yanci kai a Angola, zuwa Portugal. [3] Surukinsa, Tito Chingunji, ya yi aiki a matsayin sakataren harkokin wajen UNITA, babbar kungiyar 'yan tawaye da ta yaki gwamnatin dos Santos a yakin basasar Angola. [4] Ya karanci shari'a a Jami'ar Lisbon da Jami'ar Coimbra a ƙarshen shekarun 1960, sannan ya karatu a Cibiyar Nazarin Ƙasa da Ƙasa da ke Geneva. [5]

items.sourceText: In 1976, Van-Dúnem married Sita Valles, another activist in the MPLA that had overseen the youth movement and peoples' movement of the party in Luanda.[1] They had a son whom they named João Ernesto "Che" Valles Van-Dúnem, his name being a tribute to Che Guevara.[4]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1976, Van-Dúnem ya auri Sita Valles, wata mai fafutuka a cikin MPLA wadda ta kula da motsin matasa da motsin jama'a na jam'iyyar a Luanda. [1] Suna da ɗa wanda suka sa masa suna João Ernesto "Che" Valles Van-Dúnem, sunansa shine haraji ga Che Guevara . [1]

A cikin shekarar 1976, Van-Dúnem ya auri Sita Valles, wata mai fafutuka a cikin MPLA wadda ta kula da motsin matasa da motsin jama'a na jam'iyyar a Luanda. [1] Suna da ɗa wanda suka sa masa suna João Ernesto "Che" Valles Van-Dúnem, sunansa shine haraji ga Che Guevara. [1]

items.sourceText: Lake Tréné is a small lake located in the Mayo-Kebbi Ouest Region of south-western Chad. It is about 6km by 2km and is fed by the Mayo Kébbi river that leaves near Léré and proceeds through the larger Lake Léré.[1]

targets.targetText: Tafkin Tréné wani karamin tafki ne da ke yankin Mayo-Kebbi Ouest na kudu maso yammacin Chadi . Yana da kimanin kilomita 6 da kilomita 2 kuma kogin Mayo Kébbi ne ke ciyar da shi wanda ke barin kusa da Lere kuma yana ci gaba ta hanyar Tafkin Léré mafi girma.[1]

Tafkin Tréné wani karamin tafki ne da ke yankin Mayo-Kebbi Ouest na kudu maso yammacin Chadi. Tafkin na da kimanin nisan kilomita 6 da kilomita 2 kuma kogin Mayo Kébbi ne ke bashi ruwa wanda ke bangaren kusa da Lere kuma yana bi ta hanyar Tafkin Léré mafi girma.[1]

items.sourceText: Prince Abdulkadir Aliyu Mahe (1951 – 28 December 2024) was a Nigerian politician and the State Secretary to the Government of Kwara state and the chief of staff to executive governor of Kwara state Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq until his death.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Yarima Abdulkadir Aliyu Mahe (1951 - 28 Disamba 2024) ɗan siyasan Najeriya ne kuma sakataren gwamnatin jihar Kwara kuma shugaban ma'aikata na gwamnan jihar Kwara Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq har zuwa rasuwarsa. [1] [2]

Prince Abdulkadir Aliyu Mahe (1951 - 28 Disamba 2024) ɗan siyasan Najeriya ne kuma sakataren gwamnatin jihar Kwara kuma shugaban ma'aikata na gwamnan jihar Kwara Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq har zuwa rasuwarsa. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Although the lake is visibly polluted by the effluent from a copper mine, schistosomiasis seems to thrive and a number of infections have been reported.[6]

targets.targetText: Kodayake tafkin yana da gurɓata daga ma'adinin jan ƙarfe, schistosomiasis yana da alama yana bunƙasa kuma an ba da rahoton kamuwa da cuta da yawa.[1]
Kodayake tafkin yana da gurɓataccen gurɓatacce daga ma'adinin jan ƙarfe, schistosomiasis yana da alama yana bunƙasa kuma an ba da rahoton kamuwa da cuta da yawa.[1]

items.sourceText: He remained serving in various European offices of the MPLA during a certain period until he was able to receive a scholarship to continue his studies in Cuba.[1] While in Cuba, he graduated as an economist at the Instituto de Planificación Física and earned a doctorate degree in economics from the University of Havana. He also received military training[2] with a specialization in martial arts.[6] His time in Cuba transformed him, along with being a nationalist, into a Marxist.[6]

targets.targetText: Ya ci gaba da yin hidima a ofisoshin MPLA daban-daban na Turai har zuwa wani lokaci har ya sami damar samun gurbin karatu don ci gaba da karatunsa a Cuba. [1] Yayin da yake Cuba, ya kammala karatu a matsayin masanin tattalin arziki a Instituto de Planificación Física kuma ya sami digiri na uku a fannin tattalin arziki daga Jami'ar Havana. Ya kuma sami horon soji [2] tare da ƙwarewa a fasahar yaƙi. [1] Zamansa a Cuba ya canza shi, tare da zama mai kishin ƙasa, zuwa Markisanci. [1]

Ya ci gaba da yin hidima a ofisoshin MPLA daban-daban na Turai har zuwa wani lokaci har ya sami damar samun gurbin karatu don ci gaba da karatunsa a Cuba . [1] Yayin da yake Cuba, ya sauke karatu a matsayin masanin tattalin arziki a Instituto de Planificación Física kuma ya sami digiri na uku a fannin tattalin arziki daga Jami'ar Havana . Ya kuma sami horon soji [2] tare da ƙware a fasahar yaƙi. [1] Zamansa a Cuba ya canza shi, tare da zama mai kishin kasa, zuwa Markisanci. [1]

items.sourceText: He returned to the party headquarters in Brazzaville in 1971, during the Angolan War of Independence. He obtained the rank of major,[1] and became a member of and fighting with the People's Armed Forces of Liberation of Angola (EPLA) under the pseudonym Lutuima.[6] He was named the Director of the Center of Revolutionary Instruction of the Eastern Front, a position he occupied until 1972, including a time when in which he assumed leadership of the “Movement of Readjustment of the Eastern Front”. In 1972, he was transferred to the Department of Foreign Relations, being also invited to work in the party's regional offices in Lusaka. While there, he officially made his codename, Saíde, his legal name.[6]

targets.targetText: Ya koma hedkwatar jam'iyyar a Brazzaville a shekara ta 1971, lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Angola . Ya sami matsayi na Major, [1] kuma ya zama memba kuma ya yi yaƙi tare da Sojojin Jama'ar Liberation of Angola (EPLA) a ƙarƙashin sunan Lutuima. [1] An nada shi Daraktan Cibiyar Koyar da Juyin Juya Hali ta Gabas, matsayin da ya yi har zuwa 1972, ciki har da lokacin da ya karbi jagorancin "Movement of Rejustment of Eastern Front". A cikin 1972, an canza shi zuwa Sashen Harkokin Waje, ana kuma gayyatarsa don yin aiki a ofisoshin yanki na jam'iyyar a Lusaka . Yayin da yake wurin, a hukumance ya sanya lambar lambar sa, Saíde, sunansa na doka. [1]

Ya koma hedkwatar jam'iyyar a Brazzaville a shekara ta 1971, lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Angola. Ya sami matsayi na Major, [1] kuma ya zama memba kuma ya yi yaƙi tare da Sojojin Jama'ar Liberation of Angola (EPLA) a ƙarƙashin sunan Lutuima. [1] An naɗa shi Daraktan Cibiyar Koyar da Juyin Juya Hali ta Gabas, matsayin da ya yi har zuwa shekara ta 1972, ciki har da lokacin da ya karɓi jagorancin "Movement of Rejustment of Eastern Front". A cikin shekarar 1972, an canza shi zuwa Sashen Harkokin Waje, ana kuma gayyatarsa don yin aiki a ofisoshin yanki na jam'iyyar a Lusaka. Yayin da yake wurin, a hukumance ya sanya lambar lambar sa, Saíde, sunansa na doka. [1]

items.sourceText: The Ain Zada Dam is an embankment dam located 10 km (6 mi) east of Khelil on the Bou-Sellam River in Bordj Bou Arréridj Province, Algeria. Constructed between 1982 and 1986, the primary purpose of the dam is supplying drinking and irrigation water to Sétif, located 24 km (15 mi) to the west.[1]

targets.targetText: Dam din Ain Zada wani madatsar ruwa ne mai nisan kilomita 10 (6 a gabashin Khelil a kan Kogin Bou-Sellam a Lardin Bordj Bou Arréridj, Aljeriya. An gina dam din tsakanin shekarar 1982 zuwa 1986, ainihin manufar madatsar ruwan shine samar da ruwan sha da ban ruwa ga Setif, wanda ke da nisan kilomita 24 () zuwa yamma.[1]

Dam din Ain Zada wani madatsar ruwa ne mai nisan kilomita 10 (6 a gabashin Khelil a kan Kogin Bou-Sellam a Lardin Bordj Bou Arréridj, Aljeriya . An gina shi tsakanin 1982 da 1986, ainihin manufar madatsar ruwan shine samar da ruwan sha da ban ruwa ga Setif, wanda ke da nisan kilomita 24 () zuwa yamma.[1]

items.sourceText: Charles Taylor visited Libya several times, probably between 1986 and 1989. He met with Sanyang and other Gambians who had participated in the 1981 coup attempt. In 1989 “Dr. Manning” was listed by the NPFL as Taylor's vice-president, but was soon edged out by Taylor and retired to manage a bar in Ouagadougou.[1]

targets.targetText: Charles Taylor ya ziyarci Libya sau da yawa, watakila tsakanin 1986 zuwa 1989. Ya gana da Sanyang da wasu 'yan Gambia da suka shiga yunkurin juyin mulkin 1981. A cikin shekarar 1989 NPFL ta jera "Dr. Manning" a matsayin mataimakin shugaban Taylor, amma ba da daɗewa ba Taylor ya kore shi kuma ya yi ritaya don gudanar da mashaya a Ouagadougou. [1]

items.sourceText: On 3 May 2022, Abusedra became Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary as the new Permanent Representative of Libya to the United Nations (UN) at Geneva.[1][5][6]

targets.targetText: A ranar 3 ga watan Mayu, 2022, Abusedra ya zama jakada na musamman kuma mai cikakken iko a matsayin sabon wakilin dindindin na Libya a Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya (UN) a Geneva. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: In 1954, he was arrested by the authorities of the French Protectorate and imprisoned at Kenitra; the next year, he succeeded in escaping from the prison along with 37 other insurgents.

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1954, hukumomin Faransa sun kama shi kuma aka tsare shi a Kenitra; a shekara ta gaba, ya yi nasarar tserewa daga gidan yarin tare da wasu mahara guda 37.

items.sourceText: He was arrested and tortured for supposedly taking part in the so-called 'July 1960 Plot' against the monarchy, and again in 1963.

targets.targetText: An kama shi tare da azabtar da shi saboda zargin shiga cikin abin da ake kira 'Yuli 1960 Plot' a kan masarautar, kuma a cikin 1963.

items.sourceText: In 1966, Afolayan joined Moses Olaiya's drama troupe. In 1971, he left to establish his own drama group which went on to stage comedic plays.[4]

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 1966, Afolayan ya shiga ƙungiyar wasan kwaikwayo ta Moses Olaiya. A shekara ta 1971, ya bar ya kafa ƙungiyar wasan kwaikwayo ta kansa wacce ta ci gaba da yin wasan kwaikwayo.[1]

items.sourceText: Once Morocco was granted independence, Bouabid was named State Minister for Negotiations under Mbarek Bekkay's government. In 1956, he became Ambassador of Morocco in Paris, and he was later appointed a Minister of National Economy. On 12 May 1958, he was in charge of the Ministry of National Economy and Agriculture in Ahmed Balafrej’s cabinet. He was Minister of Economy and Finance from December 1958 to May 1960.[3]

targets.targetText: Da Maroko ta samu 'yancin kai, an naɗa Bouabid a matsayin Ministan Tattaunawa a ƙarƙashin gwamnatin Mbarek Bekkay. A shekarar 1956 ya zama jakadan Morocco a birnin Paris, daga baya kuma aka naɗa shi ministan tattalin arzikin ƙasa. A ranar 12 ga watan Mayu 1958, ya kasance mai kula da Ma'aikatar Tattalin Arziƙi da Aikin Noma ta ƙasa a majalisar ministocin Ahmed Balafrej. Ya kasance Ministan Tattalin Arziki da Kuɗi daga watan Disamba 1958 zuwa watan Mayu 1960. [1]

Da Maroko ta samu 'yancin kai, an nada Bouabid a matsayin Ministan Tattaunawa a karkashin gwamnatin Mbarek Bekkay . A shekarar 1956 ya zama jakadan Morocco a birnin Paris, daga baya kuma aka nada shi ministan tattalin arzikin kasa. A ranar 12 ga Mayu 1958, ya kasance mai kula da Ma'aikatar Tattalin Arziƙi da Aikin Noma ta ƙasa a majalisar ministocin Ahmed Balafrej . Ya kasance Ministan Tattalin Arziki da Kuɗi daga Disamba 1958 zuwa Mayu 1960. [1]

items.sourceText: Samuel Maharero died there in March 1923, and his body was temporarily buried in Bechuanaland.[5] On August 23, 1923, his body was returned to Okahandja and was ceremoniously reburied alongside his ancestors, an occasion that the Herero people still celebrate on Herero Day.

targets.targetText: Samuel Maharero ya mutu a can a cikin Maris 1923, kuma an binne gawarsa na ɗan lokaci a Bechuanaland. [1] A ranar 23 ga Agusta, 1923, an mayar da gawarsa Okahandja kuma an sake binne shi tare da kakanninsa, wani lokaci da har yanzu mutanen Herero ke bikin ranar Herero .

items.sourceText: Andimba Toivo ya Toivo was born on 22 August 1924 as second of seven children in Omangundu in Ovamboland, northern South West Africa.[1] He attended the church school at Onayena but was herding cattle often, as was common for boys in this area.[2] He trained to become a carpenter at Ongwediva Industrial School between 1939 and 1942.[3]

targets.targetText: An haifi Andimba Toivo ya Toivo a ranar 22 ga watan Agustan 1924 a matsayin na biyu a cikin yara bakwai a Omangundu a Ovamboland, arewacin Afirka ta Kudu maso Yamma. [1] Ya halarci makarantar coci a Onayena amma yana yawan kiwon shanu, kamar yadda ya zama ruwan dare ga yara maza a wannan yanki. [2] Ya horar da zama kafinta a Makarantar Masana'antu ta Ongwediva tsakanin shekarun 1939 zuwa 1942. [3]

items.sourceText: Witbooi was born circa 1830 in Pella, Northern Cape, in the Cape Colony, which is today part of South Africa. He was educated as a Lutheran by German missionary Johannes Olp and was well-versed in many languages, including his native Nama. He was a member of the Nama people, also known as the Khoekhoe.

targets.targetText: An haifi Witbooi kusan shekara ta 1830 a Pella, Arewacin Cape, a cikin Cape Colony, wanda a yau yanki ne na Afirka ta Kudu. Wani ɗan ƙasar Jamus Johannes Olp ya koyar da shi a matsayin ɗan Lutheran kuma ya ƙware sosai a cikin yaruka da yawa, har da ɗan ƙasarsa Nama. Ya kasance ɗan ƙabilar Nama, wanda aka fi sani da Khoekhoe.

An haifi Witbooi kusan 1830 a Pella, Arewacin Cape, a cikin Cape Colony, wanda a yau yanki ne na Afirka ta Kudu. Wani ɗan ƙasar Jamus Johannes Olp ya koyar da shi a matsayin ɗan Lutheran kuma ya ƙware sosai a cikin yaruka da yawa, har da ɗan ƙasarsa Nama . Ya kasance dan kabilar Nama, wanda aka fi sani da Khoekhoe.

items.sourceText: He was born to a Hindu family in Johannesburg. As a child he attended Bree Street Primary School and later Johannesburg Indian High School in Fordsburg.[2] He married Luxmi in India on 5 May 1952.[2] In the early 1950s, Chiba became friends with Ahmed Kathrada, Herbie Pillay and Bobby and Tommy Vassen, all members of the Transvaal Indian Youth Congress (TIYC).[2]

targets.targetText: An haife shi ga dangin Hindu a Johannesburg . Tun yana yaro ya halarci makarantar firamare ta Bree Street sannan daga baya makarantar sakandaren Indiya ta Johannesburg a Fordsburg . [1] Ya auri Luxmi a Indiya a ranar 5 ga Mayu 1952. [1] A farkon 1950s, Chiba ya zama abokai tare da Ahmed Kathrada, Herbie Pillay da Bobby da Tommy Vassen, duk membobi na Transvaal Indian Youth Congress (TIYC). [1]

items.sourceText: Lionel Davis is a visual artist, teacher, and public speaker from South Africa. He was born in Cape Town, South Africa, in 1936 in the infamous District Six neighborhood. He was a prominent figure in the anti-apartheid movement, and was incarcerated for seven years on Robben Island,[1] an infamous prison for political prisoners under the apartheid regime. It was here that Davis met Nelson Mandela.[2]

targets.targetText: Lionel Davis ƙwararren mai zane ne, malami, kuma mai magana da jama'a daga Afirka ta Kudu. An haife shi a Cape Town, Afirka ta Kudu, a cikin 1936 a cikin sanannen unguwar gundumar Shida . Ya kasance fitaccen mutum a cikin gwagwarmayar adawa da wariyar launin fata, kuma an tsare shi tsawon shekaru bakwai a tsibirin Robben Island, [1] wani gidan yari mai ban sha'awa ga fursunonin siyasa a karkashin mulkin wariyar launin fata. A nan ne Davis ya gana da Nelson Mandela . [2]

Lionel Davis ƙwararren mai zane ne, malami, kuma mai magana da jama'a daga Afirka ta Kudu. An haife shi a Cape Town, Afirka ta Kudu, a cikin shekara ta 1936 a cikin sananniyar unguwar gundumar Shida (District Six). Ya kasance fitaccen mutum a cikin gwagwarmayar adawa da wariyar launin fata, kuma an tsare shi tsawon shekaru bakwai a tsibirin Robben Island, [1] wani gidan yari mai ban sha'awa ga fursunonin siyasa a ƙarƙashin mulkin wariyar launin fata. A nan ne Davis ya gana da Nelson Mandela . [2]

items.sourceText: When Potlako Leballo, Chairman of the Pan Africanist Congress (PAC), was forced out of the position, Make joined a Presidential Council consisting of David Sibeko, Ellias Ntloedibe, and himself. Several months later, Make became the sole chairman.[6] He resigned from the chairmanship in January 1981 to make way for John Nyathi Pokela, who had been recently imprisoned on Robben Island. Under Pokela, Make served as deputy chairman of the PAC.[2]

targets.targetText: Lokacin da Potlako Leballo, Shugaban Jam'iyyar Pan Africanist Congress (PAC), aka tilasta wa barin muƙamin, Make ya shiga Majalisar Shugaban ƙasa wanda ya kunshi David Sibeko, Ellias Ntloedibe, da kansa. Bayan watanni da yawa, Make ya zama shugaba tilo. [1] Ya yi murabus daga shugabancin a cikin watan Janairu 1981 don ba da damar John Nyathi Pokela, wanda aka ɗaure a kurkuku kwanan nan a tsibirin Robben. A ƙarƙashin Pokela, Make ya zama mataimakin shugaban PAC. [2]

Bayan watanni da yawa, Make ya zama shugaba tilo. [1] Ya yi murabus daga shugabancin a cikin Janairu 1981 don ba da damar John Nyathi Pokela, wanda aka daure a kurkuku kwanan nan a tsibirin Robben . A karkashin Pokela, Make ya zama mataimakin shugaban PAC. [2]

items.sourceText: Isaac Lesiba Maphotho (26 February 1931 – 13 July 2019) was a South African anti-apartheid activist, revolutionary leader, African National Congress (ANC) stalwart and Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) veteran. Maphotho had previously served as a Member of the Limpopo Provincial Legislature.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Isaac Lesiba Maphotho (26 Fabrairu 1931 - 13 Yuli 2019) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne na Afirka ta Kudu, kuma jagoran juyin juya hali, jiga-jigan Congress National Congress (ANC) kuma tsohon soja Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK). Maphotho ya taɓa zama memba a majalisar dokokin lardin Limpopo. [1] [2]

Isaac Lesiba Maphotho (26 Fabrairu 1931 - 13 Yuli 2019) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne na Afirka ta Kudu, jagoran juyin juya hali, jiga-jigan Congress National Congress (ANC) kuma tsohon soja Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK). Maphotho ta taba zama memba a majalisar dokokin lardin Limpopo . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Nxumalo held significant importance to the anti-apartheid movement. Nxumalo also played heavy roles in the African National Congress (ANC), Umkhonto weSizwe (MK) and the South African Communist Party (SACP) while in exile.[1] During Nxumalo's exile, he would serve liberation movements in Swaziland (now Eswatini), Angola, Mozambique, Tanzania, and the United Kingdom.[2] During this time Nxumalo would write plenty of books, all still subject to heavy debate, about South African revolutionary theory. Nxumalo would pass while in London, United Kingdom in 1991 at the age of 35.[3]

targets.targetText: Nxumalo ya ba da muhimmiyar mahimmanci ga yunkurin yaki da wariyar launin fata . Nxumalo ya kuma taka rawar gani sosai a jam'iyyar African National Congress (ANC), Umkhonto weSizwe (MK) da jam'iyyar gurguzu ta Afirka ta Kudu (SACP) yayin da yake gudun hijira. [1] A lokacin gudun hijira Nxumalo, zai yi hidima ga ƙungiyoyin 'yanci a Swaziland (yanzu Eswatini), Angola, Mozambique, Tanzania, da Birtaniya . [2] A wannan lokacin Nxumalo zai rubuta litattafai masu yawa, duk har yanzu suna fuskantar muhawara mai tsanani, game da ka'idar juyin juya halin Afirka ta Kudu. Nxumalo zai wuce yayin da yake London, United Kingdom a 1991 yana da shekaru 35. [3]

Nxumalo zai wuce yayin da yake London, United Kingdom a shekarar 1991 yana da shekaru 35. [3]

items.sourceText: Nxumalo was born on October 27, 1955, in Dundee, KwaZulu-Natal. A son of two teachers, Benjamin and Elsie, Nxumalo quickly became infatuated with learning. Nxumalo would attend school in Louwsburg, then later Bethal College in Butterworth, and he matriculated in KwaDlangezwa in Empangeni. He then would study at the University of Zululand and the University of Natal[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Nxumalo a ranar 27 ga Oktoba, 1955, a Dundee, KwaZulu-Natal . Dan malamai biyu, Benjamin da Elsie, Nxumalo da sauri ya fara sha'awar koyo. Nxumalo zai halarci makaranta a Louwsburg, sannan daga bisani Bethal College a Butterworth, kuma ya yi digiri a KwaDlangezwa a Empangeni . Sannan zai yi karatu a Jami'ar Zululand da Jami'ar Natal [1]

Nxumalo zai halarci makaranta a Louwsburg, sannan daga bisani Bethal College a Butterworth, kuma ya yi digiri a KwaDlangezwa a Empangeni. Sannan zai yi karatu a Jami'ar Zululand da Jami'ar Natal [1]

items.sourceText: Born in Herschel in the Transkei region, he was educated at Healdtown Comprehensive School and the University of Fort Hare.[3]: 239  Graduating as a teacher he would teach in Standerton.[3]: 239  Originally a member of the African National Congress Youth League where he was a member of the Africanist wing which rejected contact with other racial groups in the ANC.[3]: 239  He left the African National Congress in November 1958 and helped found the PAC in the late 1950s becoming its Acting Secretary-general.[2][3]: 240  He would leave South Africa in 1963, leading the organisation in exile from Lesotho.[3]: 240

targets.targetText: An haife shi a Herschel a cikin yankin Transkei, ya yi karatu a makarantar Healdtown Comprehensive School da Jami'ar Fort Hare. [1] : 239 Ya kammala karatunsa a matsayin malami zai koyarwa a Standerton. [1] : 239 Asalinsa mamba ne a kungiyar matasan Afirka ta National Congress Youth League inda ya kasance memba na reshen Afirka wanda ya ki yin hulɗa da wasu kungiyoyin ƙabilu a ANC. [1] : 239 Ya bar Majalisar Tarayyar Afirka a watan Nuwamba 1958 kuma ya taimaka wajen kafa PAC a ƙarshen shekarar 1950 ya zama Babban Sakatare Janar na riko. [2] [1] : 240 Zai bar Afirka ta Kudu a shekarar 1963, yana jagorantar ƙungiyar a gudun hijira daga Lesotho. [1] : 240
