items.sourceText: Pokela died in Parirenyatwa Hospital in Zimbabwe in June 1985. He was buried in a state funeral in Zimbabwe officiated by Stanley Mogoba, a Methodist bishop, and was praised by Zimbabwean president Robert Mugabe for reuniting the PAC. Pokela was succeeded as chairman by Johnson Mlambo.[1]

targets.targetText: Pokela ya mutu a asibitin Parirenyatwa da ke Zimbabwe a watan Yunin 1985. An binne shi ne a wani jana'izar da aka yi a ƙasar Zimbabwe wanda Stanley Mogoba, wani Bishop na Methodist, ya jagoranta, kuma shugaban ƙasar Zimbabwe Robert Mugabe ya yaba da sake haɗuwa da kungiyar PAC. Johnson Mlambo ne ya gaji Pokela a matsayin shugaba. [1]

Pokela ya mutu a asibitin Parirenyatwa da ke Zimbabwe a watan Yunin 1985. An binne shi ne a wani jana'izar jana'izar da aka yi a kasar Zimbabwe wanda Stanley Mogoba, wani Bishop na Methodist, ya jagoranta, kuma shugaban kasar Zimbabwe Robert Mugabe ya yaba da sake haduwa da kungiyar PAC. Johnson Mlambo ne ya gaji Pokela a matsayin shugaba. [1]

items.sourceText: He was schooled at the Murehwa Mission until 1948, when he won a scholarship to the Munali Secondary School, in Northern Rhodesia (now Zambia), where he studied until 1952.[1][2] After graduation he worked as a broadcaster, publicist, and salesman throughout Rhodesia and South Africa.[1]

targets.targetText: Ya yi karatu a Makarantar Murehwa har zuwa shekara ta 1948, lokacin da ya samu gurbin karatu a Makarantar Sakandare ta Munali, a Arewacin Rhodesia (yanzu Zambia ), inda ya yi karatu har zuwa shekara ta 1952. [1] [2] Bayan kammala karatunsa ya yi aiki a matsayin mai watsa shirye-shirye, mai ba da labari, kuma mai siyarwa a ko'ina cikin Rhodesia da Afirka ta Kudu. [1]

Ya yi karatu a Makarantar Murehwa har zuwa 1948, lokacin da ya samu gurbin karatu a Makarantar Sakandare ta Munali, a Arewacin Rhodesia (yanzu Zambia ), inda ya yi karatu har 1952. [1] [2] Bayan kammala karatunsa ya yi aiki a matsayin mai watsa shirye-shirye, mai ba da labari, kuma mai siyarwa a ko'ina cikin Rhodesia da Afirka ta Kudu . [1]

items.sourceText: Ndabaningi Sithole (21 July 1920 – 12 December 2000) was a Zimbabwean politician and statesman who was the founder of the Zimbabwe African National Union (ZANU), a militant, nationalist organisation that opposed the government of Rhodesia, in July 1963.[1] He worked as a United Church of Christ in Zimbabwe (UCCZ) minister.[2] He spent 10 years in prison after the government banned ZANU. A rift along tribal lines split ZANU in 1975, and he lost the 1980 elections to Robert Mugabe.

targets.targetText: Ndabaningi Sithole (21 Yuli 1920 - 12 Disamba 2000) ɗan siyasan Zimbabwe ne kuma ɗan majalisar dokoki wanda ya kasance wanda ya kafa Ƙungiyar Tarayyar Afirka ta Zimbabwe (ZANU), ƙungiya mai fafutuka, ƙungiyar masu kishin ƙasa da ke adawa da gwamnatin Rhodesia, a cikin watan Yuli 1963. [1] Ya yi aiki a matsayin minista na Cocin United Church of Christ a Zimbabwe (UCCZ). [2] Ya shafe shekaru 10 a gidan yari bayan gwamnati ta haramtawa ZANU. Rikicin ƙabilanci ya raba kan ZANU a shekarar 1975, kuma ya sha kaye a zaɓen shekarar 1980 a hannun Robert Mugabe.

Ndabaningi Sithole (21 Yuli 1920 - 12 Disamba 2000) ɗan siyasan Zimbabwe ne kuma ɗan majalisar dokoki wanda ya kasance wanda ya kafa Ƙungiyar Tarayyar Afirka ta Zimbabwe (ZANU), ƙungiya mai fafutuka, ƙungiyar masu kishin ƙasa da ke adawa da gwamnatin Rhodesia, a cikin Yuli 1963. [1] Ya yi aiki a matsayin minista na Cocin United Church of Christ a Zimbabwe (UCCZ). [2] Ya shafe shekaru 10 a gidan yari bayan gwamnati ta haramtawa ZANU. Rikicin kabilanci ya raba kan ZANU a 1975, kuma ya sha kaye a zaben 1980 a hannun Robert Mugabe .

items.sourceText: Cde Zvobgo was also a member of the Zanu-PF Central Committee during the first decade of Zimbabwe's independence.[1] She was elected Secretary for Publicity and Information in the Women's League in 1984 and re-elected MP for Zvishavane in 1985. She retired from active politics in 1990 to concentrate on family business.[3]

targets.targetText: Cde Zvobgo yai kasance mamba a kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar Zanu-PF a cikin shekaru goma na farko na 'yancin kai na Zimbabwe. [1] An zaɓe ta Sakatariyar Yaɗa Labarai da Watsa Labarai a Kungiyar Mata a shekarar 1984 kuma ta sake zaɓar MP ga Zvishavane a shekarar 1985. Ta yi ritaya daga siyasa mai himma a cikin shekarar 1990 don mai da hankali kan kasuwancin iyali. [1]

Cde Zvobgo ya kasance mamba a kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar Zanu-PF a cikin shekaru goma na farko na 'yancin kai na Zimbabwe. [1] An zabe ta Sakatariyar Yada Labarai da Watsa Labarai a Kungiyar Mata a 1984 kuma ta sake zabar MP ga Zvishavane a 1985. Ta yi ritaya daga siyasa mai himma a cikin 1990 don mai da hankali kan kasuwancin iyali. [1]

items.sourceText: Boal was born in 1934 in Tarrafal, Cape Verde, on the island of Santiago. Her parents were fairly well-off merchants: Dona Eulália Andrade, better known as Nha Beba, and José Freire Andrade, better known as Nho Papacho.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: An haifi Boal a cikin 1934 a Tarrafal, Cape Verde, a tsibirin Santiago . Iyayenta sun kasance 'yan kasuwa masu wadata: Dona Eulália Andrade, wanda aka fi sani da Nha Beba, da José Freire Andrade, wanda aka fi sani da Nho Papacho. [1] [2] [3]

An haifi Boal a cikin shekarar 1934 a Tarrafal, Cape Verde, a tsibirin Santiago. Iyayenta sun kasance 'yan kasuwa masu wadata: Dona Eulália Andrade, wanda aka fi sani da Nha Beba, da José Freire Andrade, wanda aka fi sani da Nho Papacho. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Boal settled in Senegal, in Dakar, to work in the office of the African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde. It was from there that she made contact with the community in Cape Verde to discuss and develop the possibility of fighting for independence in her home country.[1][2] She also worked to treat the war wounded who arrived across the border via Ziguinchor.[5]

targets.targetText: Boal ya zauna a Senegal, a Dakar, don yin aiki a ofishin jam'iyyar Afirka don 'yancin kai na Guinea da Cape Verde . Daga nan ne ta tuntubi al'ummar Cape Verde don tattaunawa da bunkasa yiwuwar fafutukar kwato 'yancin kai a kasarta ta haihuwa. [1] [2] Ta kuma yi aiki don jinyar wadanda suka ji rauni a yakin da suka isa kan iyaka ta Ziguinchor . [3]

Boal ta zauna a Senegal, a Dakar, don yin aiki a ofishin jam'iyyar Afirka na 'yancin kai na Guinea da Cape Verde. Daga nan ne ta tuntuɓi al'ummar Cape Verde don tattaunawa da bunƙasa yiwuwar fafutukar kwato 'yancin kai a ƙasar ta ta haihuwa. [1] [2] Ta kuma yi aiki don jinyar waɗanda suka ji rauni a yakin da suka isa kan iyaka ta Ziguinchor. [3]

items.sourceText: The Barue uprising (also known as the Barue revolt[1] or the Barue rebellion[2]) was an uprising in 1917 during WW1 in Portuguese Mozambique.[3]

targets.targetText: Barue uprising (wanda kuma aka sani da tawayen Barue [1] ko tawayen Barue [2] ) wani tawaye ne da akayi a shekarar 1917 a lokacin WW1 a Mozambique Portuguese. [3]
Tashin Barue (wanda kuma aka sani da tawayen Barue [1] ko tawayen Barue [2] ) wani tawaye ne a 1917 a lokacin WW1 a Mozambique Portuguese . [3]

items.sourceText: Their advance was influenced by the need to expand agricultural plantations, road and railway lines; and to exact forced labour for those purposes. Factors that facilitated their movement into the hinterlands included the construction of a port at Lomé, installation of the Kamina Funkstation radio communications transmitter, and the minimal resistance posed by the tribes they encountered such as the Ewe people, who mostly settled as fragmented clans.[2]

targets.targetText: Buƙatar faɗaɗa ayyukan noma, tituna da layin dogo ya rinjayi ci gabansu; da kuma aiwatar da aikin tilastawa don waɗannan dalilai. Abubuwan da suka sauƙaƙa ƙaura zuwa lungu da sako sun haɗa da gina tashar jiragen ruwa a Lomé, sanya na’urar watsa shirye-shiryen rediyon Kamina Funkstation, da kuma ƙarancin juriya daga ƙabilun da suka ci karo da su kamar mutanen Ewe, waɗanda galibi suka zauna a matsayin masu rarrabuwar kawuna.

Bukatar fadada ayyukan noma, tituna da layin dogo ya rinjayi ci gabansu; da kuma aiwatar da aikin tilastawa don waɗannan dalilai. Abubuwan da suka sauƙaƙa ƙaura zuwa lungu da sako sun haɗa da gina tashar jiragen ruwa a Lomé, sanya na’urar watsa shirye-shiryen rediyon Kamina Funkstation, da kuma ƙarancin juriya daga ƙabilun da suka ci karo da su kamar mutanen Ewe, waɗanda galibi suka zauna a matsayin rarrabuwar kawuna.

items.sourceText: The Black Lions dominated the early resistance movement in Ethiopia. Members of the Black Lions included students from the Holeta Military Academy and foreign-educated Ethiopians. The military academy was founded in 1935 and is located in Holeta Genet.

targets.targetText: Black Lions ne suka mamaye yunkurin juriya na farko a Habasha. Mambobin Black Lions sun haɗa da ɗalibai daga Makarantar Soja ta Holeta da Habashawa waɗanda suka yi karatu a ƙasashen waje. An kafa makarantar soji a shekarar 1935 kuma tana cikin Holeta Genet.

Bakar Lions ne suka mamaye yunkurin juriya na farko a Habasha. Mambobin Bakar Lions sun hada da dalibai daga Makarantar Soja ta Holeta da Habashawa wadanda suka yi karatu a kasashen waje. An kafa makarantar soji a 1935 kuma tana cikin Holeta Genet .

items.sourceText: Shortly after Italy entered the war, a number of Libyan leaders living in exile in Egypt called on their compatriots to organise themselves into military units and join the British in the war against the Axis powers. Five battalions, which were initially designed for guerrilla warfare in the Jabal al Akhdar region of Cyrenaica, were established under British command. Because the high mobility of the desert campaigns required a considerable degree of technical and mechanical expertise, the Libyan forces were used primarily as auxiliaries, guarding military installations and prisoners. One battalion participated in the fighting at the Siege of Tobruk (April–November 1941).

targets.targetText: Jim kadan bayan da Italiya ta shiga yakin, wasu da dama daga cikin shugabannin Libya da ke gudun hijira a Masar sun yi kira ga 'yan uwansu da su hada kansu cikin runfunan soji tare da hada kai da Birtaniya a yakin da ake yi da Axis. Bataliyoyin bataliyoyin biyar, waɗanda da farko an kera su don yaƙin ƴan tawaye a yankin Jabal al Akhdar na Cyrenaica, an kafa su a ƙarƙashin ikon Birtaniyya. Saboda babban motsi na kamfen na hamada yana buƙatar ƙwararrun ƙwararrun fasaha da injiniyoyi, an yi amfani da sojojin Libiya da farko a matsayin mataimaka, gadin kayan aikin soja da fursunoni. Bataliya ɗaya ta shiga yaƙin a Siege na Tobruk (Afrilu-Nuwamba 1941).

Jim kaɗan bayan da Italiya ta shiga yakin, wasu da dama daga cikin shugabannin Libya da ke gudun hijira a Masar sun yi kira ga 'yan uwansu da su haɗa kansu cikin runfunan soji tare da haɗa kai da Birtaniya a yakin da ake yi da Axis. Bataliyoyi biyar, waɗanda da farko an kera su don yaƙin ƴan tawaye a yankin Jabal al Akhdar na Cyrenaica, an kafa su a ƙarƙashin ikon Birtaniyya. Saboda babban motsi na kamfen na hamada yana buƙatar ƙwararrun fasaha da injiniyoyi, an yi amfani da sojojin Libiya da farko a matsayin mataimaka, gadin kayan aikin soja da fursunoni. Bataliya ɗaya ta shiga yaƙin a Siege na Tobruk (Afrilu-Nuwamba 1941).

items.sourceText: After the British retreat from Cyrenaica during Operation Sonnenblume (6 February – 25 May 1941) the military administration of Cyrenaica lapsed. In the course of 1941, the British proposed to send the Libyan-Arab-Force to Syria.[3] In the autumn preparations were made for the administration of Cyrenaica again once it had been reoccupied. On 14 October, GHQ Middle East revived a small military administration for Cyrenaica commanded by Brigadier Stephen Longrigg. A small number of people were transferred to 102 Military Mission which had trained the British Senussi Army, later called the Libyan Arab Force. The new establishment began on 19 December at the fall of Derna.[4]

targets.targetText: Bayan da Birtaniyya ta koma daga Cyrenaica a lokacin Operation Sonnenblume (6 Fabrairu – 25 May 1941) mulkin soja na Cyrenaica ya lalace. A cikin 1941, Birtaniya ta ba da shawarar tura sojojin Libya-Arab-Force zuwa Siriya. [1] A cikin kaka an sake yin shirye-shiryen gudanar da mulkin Cyrenaica da zarar an sake mamaye shi. A ranar 14 ga Oktoba, GHQ Gabas ta Tsakiya ta farfado da karamar hukumar soji don Cyrenaica wanda Brigadier Stephen Longrigg ya ba da umarni. An tura wasu tsirarun mutane zuwa Ofishin Jakadancin Soja 102 da suka horar da Sojan Birtaniya Senussi, wanda daga baya ake kira Dakarun Larabawa na Libya. Sabuwar kafa ta fara ne a ranar 19 ga Disamba a faduwar Derna. [ 4 ]

Bayan da Birtaniyya ta koma daga Cyrenaica a lokacin Operation Sonnenblume (6 Fabrairu – 25 May 1941) mulkin soja na Cyrenaica ya lalace. A cikin shekarar 1941, Birtaniya ta ba da shawarar tura sojojin Libya-Arab-Force zuwa Siriya. [1] A cikin kaka an sake yin shirye-shiryen gudanar da mulkin Cyrenaica da zarar an sake mamaye shi. A ranar 14 ga watan Oktoba, GHQ Gabas ta Tsakiya ta farfaɗo da ƙaramar hukumar soji don Cyrenaica wanda Brigadier Stephen Longrigg ya ba da umarni. An tura wasu tsirarun mutane zuwa Ofishin Jakadancin Soja 102 da suka horar da Sojan Birtaniya Senussi, wanda daga baya ake kira Dakarun Larabawa na Libya. Sabuwar kafa ta fara ne a ranar 19 ga watan Disamba a faɗuwar Derna. [ 4 ]

items.sourceText: All three leaders were the descendants of Hova who had been politically prominent in the former Merina royal court. The movement was pacifist, and while it sought independence for Madagascar, it embraced the French vision of the island as part of the global Francophone economic and cultural community.[1] Their platform garnered mass support that cut across geographic, ethnic and class divisions, and in November 1946 the trio were elected to represent Madagascar as deputies (députés) in the French National Assembly. The Malagasy deputies submitted a bill to grant independence for Madagascar from French rule, but French deputies rejected it.[2]

targets.targetText: Dukan shugabannin uku zuriyar Hova ne da suka yi fice a siyasance a tsohuwar fadar sarauta ta Merina. Ƙungiyar ta kasance mai son zaman lafiya, kuma yayin da take neman 'yancin kai ga Madagascar, ta rungumi hangen nesa na Faransanci na tsibirin a matsayin wani ɓangare na tattalin arziki da al'adun Faransanci na duniya. [1] Dandalin su ya sami goyon bayan jama'a wanda ya raba tsakanin yanki, kabilanci da na aji, kuma a cikin Nuwamba 1946 an zaɓi ukun su wakilci Madagascar a matsayin wakilai ( deputés ) a Majalisar Dokokin Faransa. Wakilan Malagasy sun gabatar da daftarin doka na baiwa Madagaska 'yancin kai daga Faransawa, amma wakilan Faransa sun yi watsi da shi. [2]

Dukan shugabannin uku zuriyar Hova ne da suka yi fice a siyasance a tsohuwar fadar sarauta ta Merina. Ƙungiyar ta kasance mai son zaman lafiya, kuma yayin da take neman 'yancin kai ga Madagascar, ta rungumi hangen nesa na Faransanci na tsibirin a matsayin wani ɓangare na tattalin arziki da al'adun Faransa na duniya. [1] Dandalin su ya sami goyon bayan jama'a wanda ya raba tsakanin yanki, kabilanci da na aji, kuma a cikin watan Nuwamba 1946 an zaɓi ukun su wakilci Madagascar a matsayin wakilai (deputés) a Majalisar Dokokin Faransa. Wakilan Malagasy sun gabatar da daftarin doka na baiwa Madagaska 'yancin kai daga Faransawa, amma wakilan Faransa sun yi watsi da shi. [2]

items.sourceText: Senator Chief Rekayi Tangwena (c. 1910 – 11 June 1984) was a traditional chief from Zimbabwe's eastern province of Manicaland, and was of the Nhewa/Simboti totem (leopard).[1] He was also a member of Zimbabwe's first parliament.

targets.targetText: Sanata Cif Rekayi Tangwena (c. 1910 - 11 Yuni 1984) basaraken gargajiya ne daga lardin Manicaland na gabashin Zimbabwe, kuma ya kasance na Nhewa/Simboti totem ( damisa ). [1] Ya kuma kasance dan majalisar dokokin Zimbabwe na farko.

Sanata Cif Rekayi Tangwena (c. 1910 - 11 Yuni 1984) basaraken gargajiya ne daga lardin Manicaland na gabashin ƙasar Zimbabwe, kuma ya kasance na Nhewa/Simboti totem (damisa). [1] Ya kuma kasance ɗan majalisar dokokin Zimbabwe na farko.

items.sourceText: Verónica came to power following the Portuguese war against Matamba in 1681 in which her predecessor and brother was killed at the Battle of Katole. Although her brother was killed in the action, the forces of Matamba won the battle and the Portuguese withdrew their army. Nevertheless, Queen Verónica decided to treat for peace, signing the agreement with Portugal in 1683. This peace treaty would govern relations between Portugal and Matamba for a long time to come, but was, in fact rarely followed by either participant.

targets.targetText: Verónica ta hau ƙaragar mulki bayan yakin Portugal da Matamba suka yi a shekara ta 1681 inda aka kashe magabatanta da ɗan uwanta a yakin Katole. Ko da yake an kashe ɗan uwanta a wannan harin, amma sojojin Matamba sun yi nasara a yakin, kuma Portuguese sun janye sojojinsu. Duk da haka, Sarauniya Verónica ta yanke shawarar magance zaman lafiya, ta sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar da Portugal a shekarar 1683. Wannan yarjejeniya ta zaman lafiya za ta tafiyar da dangantakar da ke tsakanin Portugal da Matamba na dogon lokaci mai zuwa, amma, a gaskiya ma, ba a cika samun kowane mahalarta ba.

Verónica ta hau karagar mulki bayan yakin Portugal da Matamba suka yi a shekara ta 1681 inda aka kashe magabatanta da dan uwansa a yakin Katole . Ko da yake an kashe dan uwanta a wannan harin, amma sojojin Matamba sun yi nasara a yakin, kuma Portuguese sun janye sojojinsu. Duk da haka, Sarauniya Verónica ta yanke shawarar magance zaman lafiya, ta sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar da Portugal a 1683. Wannan yarjejeniya ta zaman lafiya za ta tafiyar da dangantakar da ke tsakanin Portugal da Matamba na dogon lokaci mai zuwa, amma, a gaskiya ma, ba a cika samun kowane mahalarta ba.

items.sourceText: The Somaliland campaign, also called the Anglo-Somali War or the Dervish rebellion, was a series of military expeditions that took place between 1900 and 1920 in modern-day Somaliland. The British were assisted in their offensives by the Ethiopian Empire and the Kingdom of Italy.

targets.targetText: Kamfen na Somaliland, wanda kuma ake kira Yaƙin Anglo-Somalia ko tawayen Dervish, wani jerin balaguron soji ne da ya gudana tsakanin 1900 zuwa 1920 a Somaliland ta zamani . Masarautar Habasha da Masarautar Italiya sun taimaka wa Turawan Ingila a farmakin da suka kai .

Kamfen na Somaliland, wanda kuma ake kira Yaƙin Anglo-Somalia ko tawayen Dervish, wani jerin balaguron soji ne da ya gudana tsakanin shekarun 1900 zuwa 1920 a Somaliland ta zamani. Masarautar Habasha da Masarautar Italiya sun taimaka wa Turawan Ingila a farmakin da suka kai.

items.sourceText: In 1874–75, the Khedivate of Egypt obtained a firman from the Ottomans by which they secured claims over the city. At the same time, the Egyptians received British recognition of their nominal jurisdiction as far east as Cape Guardafui.[1] In practice, however, Egypt had little authority over the interior and their period of rule on the coast was brief, lasting only a few years (1870–84).[2]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1874-75, Khedivate na Masar sun sami wani tabbaci daga Ottomans ta hanyar da suka tabbatar da ikirarin kan birnin. A lokaci guda kuma, Masarawa sun sami amincewar Birtaniya game da ikon da suke da shi a gabas zuwa Cape Guardafui . [1] A aikace, duk da haka, Misira ba ta da iko a kan ciki kuma lokacin mulkin su a bakin teku ya kasance takaice, yana da shekaru kawai (1870-84). [2]

A cikin shekarar 1874-75, Khedivate na Masar sun sami wani tabbaci daga Ottomans ta hanyar da suka tabbatar da ikirarin kan birnin. A lokaci guda kuma, Masarawa sun sami amincewar Birtaniya game da ikon da suke da shi a gabas zuwa Cape Guardafui. [1] A aikace, duk da haka, Misira ba ta da iko a kan ciki kuma lokacin mulkin su a bakin teku ya kasance takaice, yana da shekaru kawai (1870-84). [2]

items.sourceText: Anlo had previously acquired a significant amount of territory from its neighbours in various wars, and knowing this the Danish-Norwegians sought to form an overwhelming alliance in order to effectively crush Anlo.

targets.targetText: A baya Anlo ya mallaki yanki mai yawa daga makwabta a yaƙe-yaƙe daban-daban, kuma sanin hakan ne 'yan Danish-Norwegian suka nemi kulla ƙawancen ƙawance don murkushe Anlo yadda ya kamata.
A baya Anlo ya mallaki yanki mai yawa daga makwabta a yaƙe-yaƙe daban-daban, kuma sanin hakan ne 'yan Danish-Norwegian suka nemi kulla ƙawancen don murkushe Anlo yadda ya kamata.

items.sourceText: British colonial rule in the region of modern-day Malawi, where the revolt occurred, began between 1899 and 1900, when the British sought to increase their formal control over the territory to preempt encroachment by the Portuguese or German colonial empires.[1] The region became a British protectorate in 1891 as the British Central Africa Protectorate and in 1907 was named Nyasaland.[2] Unlike many other parts of Africa, where British rule was dependent on the support of local factions, in Nyasaland British control rested on military superiority. During the 1890s the colonial authorities suppressed numerous rebellions by the local Yao, Ngoni and Chewa peoples.[2]

targets.targetText: Turawan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya a yankin Malawi na zamani, inda aka yi tawaye, ya fara ne tsakanin shekarun 1899 zuwa 1900, lokacin da Birtaniyyan suka nemi su kara karfin ikonsu a kan yankin don kawar da mamaye daular Portuguese ko Jamusawa. [ 1 ] Yankin ya zama yankin kariyar Birtaniyya a cikin shekarar 1891 a matsayin Biritaniya ta Tsakiyar Afirka ta Tsakiya kuma a cikin shekarar 1907 ana kiranta Nyasaland. [ 2 ] Ba kamar sauran sassa na Afirka ba, inda mulkin Birtaniya ya dogara da goyon bayan ƙungiyoyin gida, a Nyasaland ikon Birtaniyya ya dogara ne akan fifikon soja. A cikin shekarun 1890 hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun murkushe tawaye da yawa daga mutanen Yao, Ngoni da Chewa. [ 2 ]

Turawan mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya a yankin Malawi na zamani, inda aka yi tawaye, ya fara ne tsakanin 1899 zuwa 1900, lokacin da Birtaniyyan suka nemi su kara karfin ikonsu a kan yankin don kawar da mamaye daular Portuguese ko Jamusawa. [ 1 ] Yankin ya zama yankin kariyar Birtaniyya a cikin 1891 a matsayin Biritaniya ta Tsakiyar Afirka ta Tsakiya kuma a cikin 1907 ana kiranta Nyasaland . A cikin shekarun 1890 hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun murkushe tawaye da yawa daga mutanen Yao, Ngoni da Chewa . [ 2 ]

items.sourceText: Pierre Morain was born at Saint-Germain-en-Laye, a short distance down-river from Paris. Robert Morain, his father, worked for the government in an administrative capacity. Suzanne Courtois, his mother, worked as a typist. In 1947 Pierre Morain started working as a tiler for a small building company based at Saint-Germain-en-Laye.[1] At some stage, probably quite early on, he joined the "Building Workers' Union" ("Syndicat Unique du bâtiment" / SUB).[2] In 1949 he started working in the workers' cooperative, "Le Carrelage à Vanves" which had been founded back in 1936 by the Communist Party ("Parti communiste français" / PCF) and the CGT (trades union). Becoming unemployed, he joined the PCF and CGT.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Pierre Morain a Saint-Germain-en-Laye, ɗan tazarar ƙasa- kogin Paris. Robert Morain, mahaifinsa, ya yi aiki da gwamnati a matsayin gudanarwa. Suzanne Courtois, mahaifiyarsa, ta yi aiki a matsayin mai buga rubutu. A cikin shekarar 1947 Pierre Morain ya fara aiki a matsayin tiler na ƙaramin kamfanin gini da ke Saint-Germain-en-Laye. [1] A wani mataki, mai yiwuwa tun da wuri, ya shiga "Ƙungiyar Ma'aikatan Gini" ("Syndicat Unique du bâtiment" / SUB). [2] A cikin shekarar 1949 ya fara aiki a cikin haɗin gwiwar ma'aikata, "Le Carrelage à Vanves" wanda aka kafa baya a cikin shekarar 1936 ta Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ("Parti communiste français" / PCF) da kuma CGT (kungiyoyin kasuwanci) . Kasancewa bashi da aikin yi, ya shiga PCF da CGT. [1]

[1] A wani mataki, mai yiwuwa tun da wuri, ya shiga "Ƙungiyar Ma'aikatan Gini" ( "Syndicat Unique du bâtiment" / SUB). Kasancewa bashi da aikin yi, ya shiga PCF da CGT. [1]

items.sourceText: She was a developer of one of the first literacy manuals made by Angolans, along with having been responsible, alongside her husband, for their historic documents on the process of Angolan decolonization during the Angolan War of Independence.[1]

targets.targetText: Ta kasance mai haɓaka ɗaya daga cikin litattafan karatu na farko da mutanen Angola suka yi, tare da kasancewa da alhakin, tare da mijinta, don takaddun tarihinsu kan tsarin raba Angolan mulkin mallaka a lokacin Yaƙin yancin kai na Angolan . [1]

Ta kasance mai haɓaka ɗaya daga cikin litattafan karatu na farko da mutanen Angola suka yi, tare da kasancewa da alhakin, tare da mijinta, don takaddun tarihinsu kan tsarin raba Angolan a lokacin 'yan mulkin mallaka a lokacin Yaƙin yancin kai na Angolan. [1]

items.sourceText: He clashed with his successor, Agostinho Neto, and in 1974 founded within the MPLA a group called Revolta Activa (Active Revolt). Angola became independent on November 11, 1975, but Andrade continued to live in exile in Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde and Mozambique. He died in London in 1990.[1]

targets.targetText: Ya yi karo da magajinsa, Agostinho Neto, kuma a cikin 1974 ya kafa a cikin MPLA ƙungiyar da ake kira Revolta Activa (Active Revolt). Angola ta sami 'yancin kai a ranar 11 ga Nuwamba, 1975, amma Andrade ya ci gaba da zama a gudun hijira a Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde da Mozambique . Ya mutu a London a 1990. [1]

Ya yi karo da magajinsa, Agostinho Neto, kuma a cikin shekarar 1974 ya kafa a cikin MPLA ƙungiyar da ake kira Revolta Activa (Active Revolt). Angola ta sami 'yancin kai a ranar 11 ga watan Nuwamba, 1975, amma Andrade ya ci gaba da zama a gudun hijira a Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde da Mozambique. Ya mutu a London a shekarar 1990. [1]

items.sourceText: Koma's leadership oversaw significant growth in the opposition's electoral success in the dominant party system of Botswana. The BNF assumed control of most major urban centers in 1984 and solidified this in 1989, surpassing other political factions to establish itself as the sole party, apart from the BDP, with nationwide influence. Koma applied pressure to Quett Masire's government to enact reforms, enhancing the transparency of electoral management. Under his leadership, the BNF achieved its best-ever result in the 1994 election and to date remains the highest popular vote percentage achieved by any single opposition party in Botswana, securing 13 out of the 40 parliamentary seats.

targets.targetText: Jagorancin Koma ya sa ido kan gagarumin ci gaba a nasarar zaben da 'yan adawa suka samu a tsarin jam'iyya mai rinjaye na Botswana. BNF ta karbi iko da mafi yawan manyan cibiyoyin birane a 1984 kuma ta karfafa hakan a cikin 1989, ta zarce sauran ƙungiyoyin siyasa don kafa kanta a matsayin jam'iyya tilo, baya ga BDP, mai tasiri a cikin ƙasa. Koma ya yi matsin lamba ga gwamnatin Quett Masire da ta aiwatar da gyare-gyare, wanda ya kara tabbatar da gaskiyar gudanar da zabe. A karkashin jagorancinsa, BNF ta samu mafi kyawun sakamakonta a zaben 1994 kuma har yau ya kasance mafi girman yawan kuri'un jama'a da kowace jam'iyyar adawa daya ta samu a Botswana, inda ta samu kujeru 13 cikin 40 na 'yan majalisar dokoki.

Koma ya yi matsin lamba ga gwamnatin Quett Masire da ta aiwatar da gyare-gyare, wanda ya kara tabbatar da gaskiyar gudanar da zaɓe. items.sourceText: Ouezzin Coulibaly was believed to have been born sometime during 1910–1914 in the Banfora region of today's Burkina Faso, then known as Upper Volta. Known at birth as Makoukou (or Macoucou) Traoré,[3] she was the daughter of Balla Traoré, who was chief of the Sindou Canton. Her education culminated in a teaching diploma.[2] In 1930, she married Daniel Ouezzin Coulibaly, obtaining the name Célestine in 1931 when she and her husband were baptized as Roman Catholics.[3]

targets.targetText: An yi imanin an haifi Ouezzin Coulibaly a wani lokaci tsakanin 1910-1914 a yankin Banfora na Burkina Faso a yau, wanda a lokacin ake kira Upper Volta. An santa da haihuwa a matsayin Makoukou (ko Macoucou) Traoré, [1] ita 'yar Balla Traoré ce, wadda ita ce shugabar Canton Sindou . Iliminta ya kai ga digirin koyarwa. [2] A shekara ta 1930, ta auri Daniel Ouezzin Coulibaly, ta sami sunan Célestine a shekara ta 1931 sa’ad da ita da mijinta suka yi baftisma a matsayin ’yan Katolika na Roman Katolika . [3]

An yi imanin an haifi Ouezzin Coulibaly a wani lokaci tsakanin shekarun 1910-1914 a yankin Banfora na Burkina Faso a yau, wanda a lokacin ake kira Upper Volta. An santa da haihuwa a matsayin Makoukou (ko Macoucou) Traoré, [1] ita 'yar Balla Traoré ce, wacce ita ce shugabar Canton Sindou. Iliminta ya kai ga digirin koyarwa. [2] A shekara ta 1930, ta auri Daniel Ouezzin Coulibaly, ta sami sunan Célestine a shekara ta 1931 sa’ad da ita da mijinta suka yi baftisma a matsayin ’yan Katolika na Roman Katolika. [3]

items.sourceText: Ruben Um Nyobè (1913 – 13 September 1958) was an anti-colonialist Cameroonian leader, slain by the French army on 13 September 1958, near his natal village of Boumnyebel, in the department of Nyong-et-Kellé in the maquis Bassa.

targets.targetText: Ruben Um Nyobè (1913 - 13 Satumba 1958) shugaban Kamaru ne mai adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka, wanda sojojin Faransa suka kashe a ranar 13 ga watan Satumba 1958, kusa da ƙauyensa na Boumnyebel, a cikin sashin Nyong-et-Kellé a cikin maquis Bassa.

Ruben Um Nyobè (1913 - 13 Satumba 1958) shugaban Kamaru ne mai adawa da mulkin mallaka, wanda sojojin Faransa suka kashe a ranar 13 ga Satumba 1958, kusa da ƙauyensa na Boumnyebel, a cikin sashin Nyong-et-Kellé a cikin maquis Bassa .

items.sourceText: Hassan Gouled Aptidon (Somali: Xasan Guuleed Abtidoon; Arabic: حسن جوليد أبتيدون; October 15, 1916 – November 21, 2006) was the first President of Djibouti from 1977 to 1999.

targets.targetText: Hassan Gouled Aptidon (Oktoba 15, 1916 - Nuwamba 21, 2006) shine shugaban Djibouti na farko daga 1977 zuwa 1999.
Hassan Gouled Aptidon ( Somali ; Arabic ; Oktoba 15, 1916 - Nuwamba 21, 2006) shine shugaban Djibouti na farko daga 1977 zuwa 1999.

items.sourceText: In 1974, Hassan Gouled called a vote with the support of François Mitterrand. He became president of the African People's League for Independence (LPAI) created in February 1975 by the merger of the African People's Union (UPA) and the League for the Future and Order. The General Secretary was Ahmed Dini.

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1974, Hassan Gouled ya kira kuri'a tare da goyon bayan François Mitterrand. Ya zama shugaban kungiyar LPAI ta Afirka wanda aka kirkira a watan Fabrairun 1975 ta hanyar haɗewar kungiyar jama'ar Afirka (UPA) da League for the Future and Order. Babban sakataren shi ne Ahmed Dini.

A cikin 1974, Hassan Gouled ya kira kuri'a tare da goyon bayan François Mitterrand . Ya zama shugaban kungiyar LPAI ta Afirka wanda aka kirkira a watan Fabrairun 1975 ta hanyar hadewar kungiyar jama'ar Afirka (UPA) da League for the Future and Order. Babban sakataren shi ne Ahmed Dini .

items.sourceText: Aïcha Bogoreh Darrar (Arabic: عائشة بوغوره; 1928 – August 5, 2001) was a Djiboutian independence and women's rights activist. She was the inaugural First Lady of Djibouti.

targets.targetText: Aïcha Bogoreh Darrar (1928– Agusta 5, 2001) ta kasance 'yar Jabuti 'yancin kai kuma mai fafutukar kare hakkin mata. Ita ce uwargidan shugaban ƙasar Djibouti ta farko.
Aïcha Bogoreh Darrar ( Arabic ; 1928 – Agusta 5, 2001) ta kasance 'yar Jabuti ' yancin kai kuma mai fafutukar kare hakkin mata. Ita ce uwargidan shugaban kasar Djibouti ta farko.

items.sourceText: Aïcha Bogoreh Darrar was born into a family of railway workers in 1928 in Dikhil, then part of French Somaliland, She married Hassan Gouled Aptidon, a nurse and future President of Djibouti. She marshalled women to vote on behalf of both independence and his political career. She became first lady when her husband became the first president of an independent Djibouti.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Aïcha Bogoreh Darrar a cikin dangin ma'aikatan jirgin ƙasa a shekarar 1928 a Dikhil, a lokacin wani yanki na Somaliland Somaliland, ta auri Hassan Gouled Aptidon, ma'aikacin jinya kuma shugaban ƙasar Djibouti na gaba. Ta shirya mata don kaɗa kuri'a a madadin 'yancin kai da kuma aikinsa na siyasa. Ta zama uwargidan shugaban ƙasa lokacin da mijinta ya zama shugaban ƙasar Djibouti mai cin gashin kanta. [1]

An haifi Aïcha Bogoreh Darrar a cikin dangin ma'aikatan jirgin kasa a 1928 a Dikhil, a lokacin wani yanki na Somaliland Somaliland , ta auri Hassan Gouled Aptidon, ma'aikacin jinya kuma shugaban kasar Djibouti na gaba . Ta shirya mata don kada kuri'a a madadin 'yancin kai da kuma aikinsa na siyasa. Ta zama uwargidan shugaban kasa lokacin da mijinta ya zama shugaban kasar Djibouti mai cin gashin kanta. [1]

items.sourceText: For several years, Manuela lived with her father, who in 1817 arranged for her marriage to a wealthy English doctor, James Thorne, who was twice her age. She married Dr. Thorne out of obedience, not out of love.[3] The couple moved to Lima, Peru, in 1819 where she lived as an aristocrat and held social gatherings in her home where guests included political leaders and military officers. These guests shared military secrets about the ongoing revolution with her, and, in 1819, when Simón Bolívar took part in the successful liberation of New Granada, Manuela Sáenz was radicalized and an active member in the conspiracy against the viceroy of Perú, José de la Serna e Hinojosa during 1820.[4]

targets.targetText: Shekaru da yawa, Manuela ya zauna tare da mahaifinta, wanda a cikin 1817 ya shirya aurenta ga wani likitan Ingila mai arziki, James Thorne, wanda ya kasance sau biyu. Ta auri Dr. Thorne saboda biyayya, ba don soyayya ba. [1] Ma'auratan sun ƙaura zuwa Lima, Peru, a cikin 1819 inda ta zauna a matsayin ɗan sarki kuma ta gudanar da taron jama'a a gidanta inda baƙi suka haɗa da shugabannin siyasa da jami'an soja. Wadannan baƙi sun ba da sirrin soja game da juyin juya halin da ke gudana tare da ita, kuma, a cikin 1819, lokacin da Simón Bolívar ya shiga cikin nasarar 'yantar da New Granada, Manuela Sáenz ya kasance mai tsaurin ra'ayi kuma memba mai aiki a cikin makircin mataimakin Perú, José de la Serna e Hinojosa a lokacin 1820.

Ta auri Dr. Thorne saboda biyayya, ba don soyayya ba. Waɗannan baƙi sun ba da sirrin soja game da juyin juya halin da ke gudana tare da ita, kuma, a cikin shekarar 1819, lokacin da Simón Bolívar ya shiga cikin nasarar 'yantar da New Granada, Manuela Sáenz ta kasance mai tsaurin ra'ayi kuma memba mai aiki a cikin makircin mataimakin Perú, José de la Serna e Hinojosa a lokacin 1820.

items.sourceText: When the Ga Shifimo Kpee was created to protect the interest of the Ga people, Nikoi, and Dzenzle Dzewu was chosen to lead the new movement. In 1952, Nikoi together with other opposition parties formed the Ghana Congress Party, led by Kofi Abrefa Busia.[7] He contested in the 1954 Gold Coast general election for the newly created Akim Abuakwa East constituency, but lost to Kwaku Amoah-Awuah of the C.P.P.[8]

targets.targetText: Lokacin da aka ƙirƙiri Ga Shifimo Kpee don kare muradun mutanen Ga, an zaɓi Nikoi, da Dzenzle Dzewu don jagorantar sabon motsi. A cikin shekarar 1952, Nikoi tare da wasu jam'iyyun adawa suka kafa jam'iyyar Ghana Congress Party, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Kofi Abrefa Busia. [1] Ya tsaya takara a zaɓen shekarar 1954 na Gold Coast na sabuwar mazaɓar Akim Abuakwa East, amma ya sha kaye a hannun Kwaku Amoah-Awuah na CPP [2]

items.sourceText: On 9 February 1950, a case against Woode was brought before the Magistrate's Court in Sekondi. The charges against him included inciting people to participate in an illegal strike and committing an act prejudicial to public safety.[7] He was sentenced on 18 February to one year in prison.[8]

targets.targetText: A ranar 9 ga Fabrairun 1950, an gabatar da karar Woode a gaban Kotun Majistare da ke Sekondi . Laifukan da ake tuhumarsa da shi sun hada da tunzura mutane su shiga yajin aikin ba bisa ka'ida ba da kuma aikata wani abu da ya saba wa tsaron lafiyar jama'a. [1] An yanke masa hukunci a kan 18 Fabrairu zuwa shekara guda a gidan yari. [2]

A ranar 9 ga watan Fabrairun 1950, an gabatar da karar Woode a gaban Kotun Majistare da ke Sekondi. [1] An yanke masa hukunci a ranar 18 ga watan Fabrairu zuwa shekara guda a gidan yari. [2]

items.sourceText: Chibesa Chibesakunda Kankasa was born on 23 March 1936 at Lubwa Mission in Chinsali. She was the sixth child of Yotam Chibesakunda, a carpenter, and Chilufya Mununga Mutale Chibwe. She had 10 siblings, including Jackson Ng'ona Chibesakunda, Jericho Ng'ona Chibesakunda, Smart Yasa Ng'ona Chibesakunda, Margaret Chibesakunda, Chanda Chibesakunda, Kunda Chibesakunda and Friday Ng'ona Chibesakunda. In 1941 her parents moved to Chalimbana, and later to Kitwe. She attended Mingolo Girls Boarding School, and later studied to become a social worker, specialising in matrimonial and juvenile delinquency cases. She worked as a social worker from 1951 to 1961.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Chibesa Chibesakunda Kankasa a ranar 23 ga watan Maris 1936 a Ofishin Jakadancin Lubwa a Chinsali. Ita ce 'ya ta shida ga Yotam Chibesakunda, kafinta, da Chilufya Mununga Mutale Chibwe. Ta na da 'yan'uwa 10, ciki har da Jackson Ng'ona Chibesakunda, Jericho Ng'ona Chibesakunda, Smart Yasa Ng'ona Chibesakunda, Margaret Chibesakunda, Chanda Chibesakunda, Kunda Chibesakunda da Friday Ng'ona Chibesakunda. A cikin shekarar 1941 iyayenta sun ƙaura zuwa Chalimbana, daga baya kuma zuwa Kitwe. Ta halarci makarantar kwana ta 'yan mata ta Mingo, daga baya kuma ta yi karatu don zama ma'aikaciyar zamantakewa, ta kware a shari'o'in laifuffuka na aure da na yara. Ta yi aiki a matsayin ma'aikaciyar zamantakewa daga shekarun 1951 zuwa 1961. [1]

Ta yi aiki a matsayin ma'aikacin zamantakewa daga 1951 zuwa 1961. [1]

items.sourceText: Nabiha Ben Miled (Arabic: نبيــهة بــن ميلاد, 4 March 1919-6 May 2009) was a pioneering Tunisian women's rights activist and nationalist. She was a leading voice in the press speaking for women's rights and Tunisian independence from French colonialism. She served as president of the Union of Tunisian Women from 1952 to 1963 and wrote articles in favor of Tunisia's independence.

targets.targetText: Nabiha Ben Miled (4 Maris 1919-6 Mayu 2009) ta kasance majagaba mai fafutukar kare hakkin mata 'yar Tunisiya kuma mai kishin ƙasa. Ta kasance babbar murya a cikin 'yan jaridu da ke magana game da 'yancin mata da 'yancin kai na Tunisiya daga 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa. Ta taɓa zama shugabar kungiyar matan Tunusiya daga shekarun 1952 zuwa 1963 kuma ta yi rubuce-rubucen goyon bayan samun 'yancin kai a Tunisiya.

Nabiha Ben Miled ( Arabic , 4 Maris 1919-6 Mayu 2009) ta kasance majagaba mai fafutukar kare hakkin mata 'yar Tunisiya kuma mai kishin kasa. Ta kasance babbar murya a cikin 'yan jaridu da ke magana game da 'yancin mata da 'yancin kai na Tunisiya daga mulkin mallaka na Faransa . Ta taba zama shugabar kungiyar matan Tunusiya daga 1952 zuwa 1963 kuma ta yi rubuce-rubucen goyon bayan samun 'yancin kai a Tunisiya.

items.sourceText: In 1946, he was named Secretary of the party's section in Beledweyne, Somalia. In 1951, the Mudug Regional Council appointed him for the Regional Council, and two years later, he became Vice President of the Regional Council. From 1954 until 1956, he was the President of the Somali Youth League. He was re-elected in May 1958, and he continued to hold this position simultaneously along with that of Speaker of the Legislative Assembly until 1960.

targets.targetText: A cikin 1946, an nada shi Sakataren sashin jam'iyyar a Beledweyne, Somaliya. A shekara ta 1951, Majalisar yankin Mudug ta nada shi Majalisar yankin, kuma bayan shekaru biyu, ya zama mataimakin shugaban majalisar yankin. Daga 1954 zuwa 1956, ya kasance shugaban kungiyar matasan Somaliya . An sake zabe shi a watan Mayun 1958, kuma ya ci gaba da rike wannan mukamin a lokaci guda tare da na Shugaban Majalisar Dokoki har zuwa 1960.

A cikin shekarar 1946, an naɗa shi Sakataren sashin jam'iyyar a Beledweyne, Somaliya. A shekara ta 1951, Majalisar yankin Mudug ta naɗa shi a Majalisar yankin, kuma bayan shekaru biyu, ya zama mataimakin shugaban majalisar yankin. Daga shekarun 1954 zuwa 1956, ya kasance shugaban kungiyar matasan Somaliya. An sake zaɓen shi a watan Mayun 1958, kuma ya ci gaba da riƙe wannan muƙamin a lokaci guda tare da na Shugaban Majalisar Dokoki har zuwa shekara ta 1960.

items.sourceText: Daar was born on 9 December 1908 in Beledweyne, situated in the south-central Hiraan region of Somalia.[3] He hailed from the Udejeen, Abdile Afarah clan of Hawiye. He was an orphan, who lost his parents at a young age. Daar, was an avid reader, and self taught on many subjects. He spoke Arabic, Somali, Italian and English.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: An haifi Daar ne a ranar 9 ga Disamba 1908 a Beledweyne, da ke yankin kudu maso tsakiyar Hiraan na Somalia . [1] Ya fito daga kabilar Udejeen, Abdile Afarah na Hawiye . Ya kasance maraya, wanda ya rasa iyayensa tun yana karami. Daar, ya kasance ƙwararren mai karatu, kuma ya koyar da kansa akan batutuwa da yawa. Ya yi magana da Larabci, Somaliya, Italiyanci da Ingilishi. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

An haifi Daar ne a ranar 9 ga watan Disamba 1908 a Beledweyne, da ke yankin kudu maso tsakiyar Hiraan na Somalia. [1] Ya fito daga ƙabilar Udejeen, Abdile Afarah na Hawiye. Ya kasance maraya, wanda ya rasa iyayensa tun yana ƙarami. Daar, ya kasance ƙwararren mai karatu, kuma ya koyar da kansa akan batutuwa da yawa. Ya yi magana da Larabci, Somaliya, Italiyanci da Ingilishi. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: Ephraim Kamati Andjengo Kapolo (1924–1967) was a Namibian activist who participated in the pre-independence movement.[1] He was one of the early members of the Ovamboland People's Organization. Kapolo was an active and founding member of the South West Africa Liberation Army (SWALA), the forerunner of the People's Liberation Army of Namibia (PLAN), at the beginning of the Namibian War of Independence.

targets.targetText: Ephraim Kamati Andjengo Kapolo (1924-1967) ɗan gwagwarmayar Namibiya ne wanda ya shiga cikin gwagwarmayar samun yancin kai. [1] Ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin membobin farko na Ƙungiyar Jama'ar Ovamboland . Kapolo ya kasance memba mai himma kuma wanda ya kafa rundunar 'yantar da 'yancin kai na South West Africa Liberation Army (SWALA), wanda ya kasance na gaba na Sojojin Yantar da Namibiya (PLAN), a farkon yakin 'yancin kai na Namibia .

Ephraim Kamati Andjengo Kapolo (1924-1967) ɗan gwagwarmayar Namibiya ne wanda ya shiga cikin gwagwarmayar samun yancin kai na Namibia. [1] Ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin membobin farko na Ƙungiyar Jama'ar Ovamboland. Kapolo ya kasance memba mai himma kuma wanda ya kafa rundunar 'yantar da 'yancin kai na South West Africa Liberation Army (SWALA), wanda ya kasance na gaba na Sojojin Yantar da Namibiya (PLAN), a farkon yakin neman 'yancin kai na ƙasar Namibia.

items.sourceText: Sharif Mohamed Amezian belonged to an Arab sharifian family that traced its lineage to Hasan ibn Ali and Fatima.[2] Amezian is believed to have been descended from Idrisid Hammudids who lived among the Qala'iya tribe.[3] His family created the Zawiya Al Qadiria which is also known by the Zawiya of Sidi Ahmed ou Abdsalam in Azghenghan.[3][4] Amezian memorized the Quran in his father's zawiya and joined the Mosque of al-Qarawiyyin to complete his studies between 1887 and 1891.[3]

targets.targetText: Sharif Mohamed Amezian ya kasance daga dangin Sharifan Larabawa waɗanda suka samo asali daga zuriyar Hasan ibn Ali da Fatima. [1] An yi imanin cewa Amezian ya fito ne daga zuriyar Idrisid Hammudids da ke zaune a cikin ƙabilar Qala'iya. [2] Iyalinsa sun kirkiro Zawiya Al Qadiria wanda kuma Zawiya na Sidi Ahmed ou Abdsalam ya fi sani da shi a Azghenghan. [3] [4] Amezian ya haddace Alqur'ani a cikin zawiyar mahaifinsa sannan ya shiga masallacin al-Qarawiyyin don kammala karatunsa tsakanin shekarun 1887 zuwa 1891. [2]

Sharif Mohamed Amezian ya kasance daga dangin Sharifan Larabawa waɗanda suka samo asali daga zuriyar Hasan ibn Ali da Fatima . [1] An yi imanin cewa Amezian ya fito ne daga zuriyar Idrisid Hammudids da ke zaune a cikin kabilar Qala'iya. [2] Iyalinsa sun kirkiro Zawiya Al Qadiria wanda kuma Zawiya na Sidi Ahmed ou Abdsalam ya fi sani da shi a Azghenghan . [3] [4] Amezian ya haddace Alqur'ani a cikin zawiya mahaifinsa sannan ya shiga masallacin al-Qarawiyyin don kammala karatunsa tsakanin 1887 zuwa 1891. [2]

items.sourceText: After 1907, following the cession by Bou Hmara of the mining operations in the area to the Spanish, Ameziane prosecuted the former.[5] Bou hmara tried to arrest him in the early 1907, but he managed to escape and took refuge in the Moroccan army whose base was near Melilla.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: Bayan 1907, bayan dakatarwar da Bou Hmara ya yi na ayyukan hakar ma'adinai a yankin zuwa Mutanen Espanya, Ameziane ya gurfanar da tsohon. [1] Bou hmara ya yi kokarin kama shi a farkon shekara ta 1907, amma ya yi nasarar tserewa ya kuma fake da sojojin Morocco wanda sansaninsu ke kusa da Melilla . [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

Bayan shekarar 1907, bayan dakatarwar da Bou Hmara ya yi na ayyukan hakar ma'adinai a yankin zuwa Spaniya, Ameziane ya gurfanar da tsohon. [1] Bou hmara ya yi kokarin kama shi a farkon shekara ta 1907, amma ya yi nasarar tserewa ya kuma fake da sojojin Morocco wanda sansaninsu ke kusa da Melilla. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: N'Ifrutant's force of 1,500 tribesmen was engaged in battle on 9 August 1918 by French Colonel Paul Doury at Gaouz.[1][2] As the French force entered a thickly vegetated oasis, n'Ifrutant's men attacked and, in a closely fought action, inflicted losses of 238 killed and 68 wounded - the worst losses since the Battle of El Herri in 1914.[3][4] Doury's commander, Hubert Lyautey chastised him for his rash actions and failed to believe his report that he had "almost annihilated" n'Ifrutant's troops.[5][6] French General Joseph-François Poeymirau defeated n'Ifrutant in battle at Meski on 15 January 1919, but was seriously wounded in the chest by the accidental explosion of an artillery shell and forced to hand command to Colonel Antoine Huré.[6]

targets.targetText: Sojojin N'Ifrutant na mutane 1,500 sun shiga yaƙi a ranar 9 ga watan Agustan shekara ta 1918 da Colonel Paul Doury na Faransa a Gaouz . [1][2] Yayin da sojojin Faransa suka shiga wani wuri mai cike da ciyayi, mutanen n'Ifrutant sun kai hari kuma, a cikin wani yunkuri na kusa, sun haifar da asarar 238 da aka kashe da 68 da suka ji rauni - mafi munin asarar tun Yaƙin El Herri a shekara ta 1914.[3][4] Kwamandan Doury, Hubert Lyautey ya tsawata masa saboda ayyukansa na gaggawa kuma ya kasa gaskata rahotonsa cewa ya "kusan ya hallaka" sojojin Ifrutant.[5][6] Janar na Faransa Joseph-François Poeymirau ya kayar da n'Ifrutant a yaƙi a kan ranar 15 ga Janairun 1919, amma ya ji rauni sosai a kirji ta hanyar fashewar fashewar bindigogi kuma ya tilasta masa ya ba da umurni ga Colonel Antoine Huré.[6]

Sojojin N'Ifrutant na mutane 1,500 sun shiga yaƙi a ranar 9 ga watan Agustan shekara ta 1918 da Colonel Paul Doury na Faransa a Gaouz. [1][2] Yayin da sojojin Faransa suka shiga wani wuri mai cike da ciyayi, mutanen n'Ifrutant sun kai hari kuma, a cikin wani yunkuri na kusa, sun haifar da asarar mutane 238 da aka kashe da 68 da suka ji rauni - mafi munin asarar tun Yaƙin El Herri a shekara ta 1914.[3][4] Kwamandan Doury, Hubert Lyautey ya tsawata masa saboda ayyukansa na gaggawa kuma ya ƙasa gaskata rahotonsa cewa ya "kusan ya hallaka" sojojin Ifrutant.[5][6] Janar na Faransa Joseph-François Poeymirau ya kayar da n'Ifrutant a yaƙi a kan ranar 15 ga watan Janairun 1919, amma ya ji rauni sosai a kirji ta hanyar fashewar bindigogi kuma ya tilasta masa ya ba da umurni ga Colonel Antoine Huré.[6]

items.sourceText: Teague was born free in Virginia, United States, in 1805.[2][3][4] His mother was Frances Teague[5] and his father Colin Teague, a former slave who became a Baptist missionary during early efforts to establish the colony of Liberia.[6] The family emigrated to West Africa in 1821.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Teague kyauta a Virginia, Amurka, a cikin 1805. [1] [2] [3] Mahaifiyarsa ita ce Frances Teague [4] da mahaifinsa Colin Teague, tsohon bawa wanda ya zama mishan na Baptist a lokacin ƙoƙarin farko na kafa ƙasar Laberiya . [5] Iyalin sun yi hijira zuwa Afirka ta Yamma a 1821. [1]

An haifi Teague kyauta a Virginia, Amurka, a cikin shekarar 1805. [1] [2] [3] Mahaifiyarsa ita ce Frances Teague [4] da mahaifinsa Colin Teague, tsohon bawa wanda ya zama mishan na Baptist a lokacin ƙoƙarin farko na kafa ƙasar Laberiya. [5] Iyalin sun yi hijira zuwa Afirka ta Yamma a shekarar 1821. [1]

items.sourceText: CONCP was founded on 18 April 1961 in Casablanca, Morocco by the PAIGC of Guinea-Bissau and Cape Verde, the MPLA of Angola, UDENAMO (later FRELIMO) of Mozambique and the MLSTP of São Tomé and Príncipe.[1] A delegation of Indian nationalists from Goa also attended, including Aquino de Bragança.[1] Marcelino dos Santos of UDENAMO was appointed CONCP's first secretary-general and Mário Pinto de Andrade of the MPLA as the first president.[2][3] CONCP replaced the Revolutionary Front for the National Independence of the Portuguese Colonies (Portuguese: Frente Revolucionária Africana para a Independência Nacional das colonias portuguesas FRAIN) which had been established by the PAIGC and the MPLA in Tunis in 1960.[4] A second meeting of CONCP was held in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, in October 1965.[5]

targets.targetText: An kafa CONCP a ranar 18 ga Afrilu 1961 a Casablanca, Morocco ta PAIGC na Guinea-Bissau da Cape Verde, MPLA na Angola, UDENAMO (daga baya FRELIMO ) na Mozambique da MLSTP na São Tomé da Príncipe . [1] Tawagar 'yan kishin Indiya daga Goa kuma ta halarci, ciki har da Aquino de Bragança . [1] An nada Marcelino dos Santos na UDENAMO a matsayin babban sakatare na farko na CONCP da Mário Pinto de Andrade na MPLA a matsayin shugaban farko. [2] [3] CONCP ya maye gurbin Juyin Juyin Juya Hali don 'Yancin Ƙasa na Ƙasar Turawan Mulkin Fotigal ( Portuguese: Independência Nacional das colonias portuguesas FRAIN ) wanda PAIGC da MPLA suka kafa a Tunis a cikin 1960. [4] An gudanar da taro na biyu na CONCP a Dar es Salaam, Tanzaniya, a cikin Oktoba 1965. [5]

An kafa CONCP a ranar 18 ga watan Afrilu 1961 a Casablanca, Morocco ta PAIGC na Guinea-Bissau da Cape Verde, MPLA na Angola, UDENAMO (daga baya FRELIMO) na Mozambique da MLSTP na São Tomé da Príncipe. [1] Tawagar 'yan kishin Indiya daga Goa kuma ta halarta, ciki har da Aquino de Bragança. [1] An naɗa Marcelino dos Santos na UDENAMO a matsayin babban sakatare na farko na CONCP da Mário Pinto de Andrade na MPLA a matsayin shugaban farko. [2] [3] CONCP ya maye gurbin Juyin Juyin Juya Hali don neman 'Yancin Ƙasa na Ƙasar daga Turawan Mulkin Fotigal (Portuguese: Independência Nacional das colonias portuguesas FRAIN) wanda PAIGC da MPLA suka kafa a Tunis a cikin shekarar 1960. [4] An gudanar da taro na biyu na CONCP a Dar es Salaam, Tanzaniya, a cikin watan Oktoba 1965. [5]

items.sourceText: The Second Franco-Dahomean War, which raged from 1892 to 1894, was a major conflict between France, led by General Alfred-Amédée Dodds, and Dahomey under King Béhanzin. The French emerged triumphant and incorporated Dahomey into their growing colonial territory of French West Africa.

targets.targetText: Yakin Franco-Dahomean na biyu, wanda ya barke daga 1892 zuwa 1894, babban rikici ne tsakanin Faransa, karkashin jagorancin Janar Alfred-Amédée Dodds, da Dahomey karkashin Sarki Béhanzin . Faransawa sun fito cikin nasara suka shigar da Dahomey cikin yankinsu na mulkin mallaka na Faransa ta Yamma .

Yakin Franco-Dahomean na biyu, wanda ya ɓarke daga shekarun 1892 zuwa 1894, babban rikici ne tsakanin Faransa, a ƙarƙashin jagorancin Janar Alfred-Amédée Dodds, da Dahomey ƙarƙashin Sarki Béhanzin. Faransawa sun fito cikin nasara suka shigar da Dahomey cikin yankinsu na mulkin mallaka na Faransa ta Yamma.

items.sourceText: In 1890, the Fon kingdom of Dahomey and the Third French Republic had gone to war in what was remembered as the First Franco-Dahomean War over the former's rights to certain territories, specifically those in the Ouémé Valley.[1] The Fon ceased hostilities with the French after two military defeats, withdrawing their forces and signing a treaty conceding to all of France's demands.[2] However, Dahomey remained a potent force in the area and quickly re-armed with modern weapons in anticipation of a second, decisive conflict.

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1890, Masarautar Fon ta Dahomey da Jamhuriyar Faransa ta Uku sun tafi yaƙi a cikin abin da ake tunawa da yaƙin Franco-Dahomean na Farko akan haƙƙin tsofaffin wasu yankuna, musamman waɗanda ke cikin kwarin Ouémé. [ 1 ] Fon ya dakatar da faɗa da Faransawa bayan da sojoji biyu suka sha kashi, inda suka janye dakarunsu tare da rattaba hannu kan wata yarjejeniya da ta amince da dukkan buƙatun Faransa. [ 2 ] Duk da haka, Dahomey ya kasance mai karfi a yankin kuma cikin sauri ya sake yin amfani da makamai na zamani a cikin tsammanin tashin rikici na biyu.

A cikin 1890, Masarautar Fon ta Dahomey da Jamhuriyar Faransa ta Uku sun tafi yaƙi a cikin abin da ake tunawa da yaƙin Franco-Dahomean na Farko akan haƙƙin tsohon ga wasu yankuna, musamman waɗanda ke cikin kwarin Ouémé . [ 1 ] Fon ya dakatar da fada da Faransawa bayan da sojoji biyu suka sha kashi, inda suka janye dakarunsu tare da rattaba hannu kan wata yarjejeniya da ta amince da dukkan bukatun Faransa. [ 2 ] Duk da haka, Dahomey ya kasance mai karfi a yankin kuma cikin sauri ya sake yin amfani da makamai na zamani a cikin tsammanin tashin rikici na biyu.

items.sourceText: The Italians colonised Eritrea in 1882 and ruled it until 1941.[41] In 1936, Italy invaded Ethiopia and declared it part of their colonial empire, which they called Italian East Africa. Italian Somaliland and Eritrea were also part of that entity, ruled by a Governor-General or Viceroy.[42]

targets.targetText: Italiya ta yi wa Eritrea mulkin mallaka a shekarar 1882 kuma ta yi mulkinta har zuwa shekara 1941. [1] A cikin shekarar 1936, Italiya ta mamaye Habasha kuma ta ayyana ta a matsayin wani yanki na mulkin mallaka, wanda suka kira Italiya Gabashin Afirka. Italiya Somaliland da Eritriya suma wani yanki ne na wannan mahallin, wanda Gwamna-Janar ko mataimakinsa ya mulka. [2]

Italiyanci ya yi wa Eritrea mulkin mallaka a 1882 kuma ya yi mulkinta har zuwa 1941. [1] A cikin 1936, Italiya ta mamaye Habasha kuma ta ayyana ta a matsayin wani yanki na mulkin mallaka, wanda suka kira Italiyanci Gabashin Afirka . Italiyanci Somaliland da Eritriya suma wani yanki ne na wannan mahallin, wanda Gwamna-Janar ko mataimakinsa ya mulka. [2]

items.sourceText: The She'eb massacre was a massacre committed against the Eritrean civilian population in the town of She'eb during the Eritrean War of Independence by the Ethiopian military during the spring of 1988, towards the end of the Ethiopian Civil War.

targets.targetText: Kisan She'eb kisan kiyashi ne da aka yi wa farar hular Eritriya a garin She'eb a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai da sojojin Habasha suka yi a Eritiriya a lokacin bazara na 1988, a karshen yakin basasar Habasha .

Kisan She'eb kisan kiyashi ne da aka yi wa farar hular Eritriya a garin She'eb a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai da sojojin Habasha suka yi a Eritiriya a lokacin bazara na shekarar 1988, a ƙarshen yakin basasar Habasha.

items.sourceText: Solomon was born in a recognized family in Asmara. He completed his early education in Asmara and Addis Ababa. He was attending the Haile Selassie University in 1972, when he joined EPLF. He is married to Aster Yohannes, who joined the front in 1972. The pair have four children, Simon, the twins Zerai and Hanna, and Meaza. The pair fought in the independence struggle with Ethiopia, in which the EPLF gained de facto independence for Eritrea in 1991.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Sulemanu a cikin sanannen iyali a Asmara. Ya yi karatunsa na farko a Asmara da Addis Ababa. Ya halarci Jami'ar Haile Selassie a shekarar 1972, lokacin da ya shiga EPLF. Yana auren Aster Yohannes, wanda ya shiga gaba a cikin shekarar 1972. Ma'auratan suna da 'ya'ya huɗu, Simon, tagwayen Zerai da Hanna, da Meaza. Ma'auratan sun yi gwagwarmaya a gwagwarmayar 'yancin kai tare da Habasha, inda EPLF ta sami 'yancin kai ga Eritrea a shekarar 1991. [1]

An haifi Sulemanu a cikin sanannen iyali a Asmara. Ya yi karatunsa na farko a Asmara da Addis Ababa . Ya halarci Jami'ar Haile Selassie a 1972, lokacin da ya shiga EPLF. Yana auren Aster Yohannes, wanda ya shiga gaba a cikin 1972. Ma'auratan suna da 'ya'ya hudu, Simon, tagwayen Zerai da Hanna, da Meaza. Ma'auratan sun yi gwagwarmaya a gwagwarmayar 'yancin kai tare da Habasha, inda EPLF ta sami 'yancin kai ga Eritrea a 1991. [1]

items.sourceText: The Eritrean War of Independence was fought as a guerrilla campaign by two main Eritrean liberation fronts, first by the Eritrean Liberation Front (ELF) and then, after the Eritrean Civil Wars, by the Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF) against the Ethiopian Empire, and later the Marxist Derg regime. This asymmetrical campaign against Ethiopian control left the Ethiopian military at a disadvantage and so it embarked on a policy of destroying Eritrean villages.[citation needed] It was hoped that this would prevent the separatists from continuing their campaign. Listed below are some of the major civilian massacres committed by both the Ethiopian Empire and the Derg.

targets.targetText: Yakin yancin kai na Eritiriya an yi yaƙi ne a matsayin yaƙin neman zaɓe ta manyan fagagen ‘yantar da ‘yancin kai na Eritiriya, na farko da ƙungiyar ‘yantar da ‘yancin kai ta Eritrea (ELF) sannan kuma bayan yakin basasa na Eritriya, da EPLF ta yi yaƙi da daular Habasha, daga baya kuma gwamnatin Marxist Dergi . Wannan kamfen da bai dace ba ga ikon Habasha ya bar sojojin Habasha cikin wahala don haka suka shiga manufar lalata kauyukan Eritrea. An yi [ ] zai hana 'yan aware ci gaba da yakin neman zabensu. A kasa akwai wasu manyan kashe-kashen fararen hula da daular Habasha da kuma Dariku suka yi.

Yakin neman 'yancin kai na Eritiriya an yi yaƙi ne a matsayin kamfen na manyan fagagen ‘yantar da ‘yancin kai na Eritiriya, na farko da ƙungiyar ‘yantar da ‘yancin kai ta Eritrea (ELF) sannan kuma bayan yakin basasa na Eritriya, da EPLF ta yi yaƙi da daular Habasha, daga baya kuma gwamnatin Marxist Dergi. Wannan kamfen da bai dace ba ga ikon Habasha ya bar sojojin Habasha cikin wahala don haka suka shiga manufar lalata ƙauyukan Eritrea. An yi [ ] zai hana 'yan aware ci gaba da kamfen ɗin nasu. A ƙasa akwai wasu manyan kashe-kashen fararen hula da daular Habasha da kuma Derg suka yi.

items.sourceText: Meki was trained as a nurse anesthesiologist in the United States. He returned to Eritrea following the end of the country's war for independence against Ethiopia.[1]

targets.targetText: An horar da Meki a matsayin ma’aikaciyar jinya a Amurka. Ya koma Eritrea ne bayan kawo karshen yakin neman yancin kai da kasar ta yi da Habasha . [1]
An horar da Meki a matsayin ma’aikacin jinya a Amurka. Ya koma Eritrea ne bayan kawo ƙarshen yakin neman yancin kai da ƙasar ta yi da Habasha. [1]

items.sourceText: Born on 24 August 1933 in the Belcourt district of Algiers, Malika Gaïd was the youngest of seven children in a literate middle-class family, keen to participate in the cause for independence. Her father, Mohand Amokrane, was a schoolteacher.[1] After completing her school education, in 1948 she trained in nursing at Sétif, earning her diploma in 1951. She worked in the hospitals of Kherrata, Guenzet and finally Bougaâ where she stayed until 1956. During this period, she secretly cared for members of the Mujahideen.[2]

targets.targetText: An haife ta a ranar 24 ga watan Agusta 1933 a gundumar Belcourt na Algiers, Malika Gaïd ita ce ƙarama a cikin yara bakwai a cikin dangi masu matsakaicin ilimi, mai sha'awar shiga fagen samun 'yancin kai. Mahaifinta, Mohand Amokrane, malamin makaranta ne. [1] Bayan ta kammala karatunta na makaranta, a cikin shekarar 1948 ta horar da aikin jinya a Sétif, inda ta sami difloma a shekarar 1951. Ta yi aiki a asibitocin Kherrata, Guenzet da kuma a ƙarshe Bougaâ inda ta zauna har shekara ta 1956. A wannan lokacin ta kasance tana kula da 'yan uwa Mujahid a asirce. [2]

An haife shi a ranar 24 ga Agusta 1933 a gundumar Belcourt na Algiers, Malika Gaïd ita ce ƙarami a cikin yara bakwai a cikin dangi masu matsakaicin ilimi, mai sha'awar shiga fagen samun 'yancin kai. Mahaifinta, Mohand Amokrane, malamin makaranta ne. [1] Bayan ta kammala karatunta na makaranta, a cikin 1948 ta horar da aikin jinya a Sétif, inda ta sami difloma a 1951. Ta yi aiki a asibitocin Kherrata, Guenzet da kuma a ƙarshe Bougaâ inda ta zauna har 1956. A wannan lokacin ta kasance tana kula da 'yan uwa Mujahid a asirce. [2]

items.sourceText: In 1985, he participated in the founding of the first Algerian League for Human Rights (LADH), and in 2005 he became president of the Algerian League for the Defense of Human Rights. [3]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1985, ya shiga cikin kafa kungiyar Kare Hakkokin Dan Adam ta Aljeriya ta farko (LADH), kuma a cikin 2005 ya zama shugaban Kungiyar Kare Hakkokin Dan Adam ta Aljeriya . [1]
A cikin shekarar 1985, ya shiga cikin kafa kungiyar Kare Hakkokin Ɗan Adam ta Aljeriya ta farko (LADH), kuma a cikin shekarar 2005 ya zama shugaban Kungiyar Kare Hakkokin Ɗan Adam ta Aljeriya. [1]

items.sourceText: Mustapha Chareuf (18 May 1925 – 18 September 1957) was an Algerian racing cyclist[1] and militant for the National Liberation Front (FLN) during the Algerian War for independence.[2] As a cyclist he rode in the 1952 Tour de France.[3][4]

targets.targetText: Mustapha Chareuf (18 ga Mayu 1925 – 18 ga Satumba 1957) ɗan wasan tseren keke ne na Aljeriya [1] kuma mai fafutukar neman 'yanci na National Liberation Front (FLN) a lokacin Yaƙin Aljeriya na samun 'yancin kai. [2] A matsayin mai tuka keke ya hau a shekarar 1952 Tour de France . [3] [4]

Mustapha Chareuf (18 ga Mayu 1925 – 18 ga Satumba 1957) ɗan tseren keke ne na Aljeriya [1] kuma mai fafutukar fafutukar neman 'yanci na National Liberation Front (FLN) a lokacin Yaƙin Aljeriya na samun 'yancin kai. [2] A matsayin mai tuka keke ya hau a 1952 Tour de France . [3] [4]

items.sourceText: Ahmed Mahsas was born on 17 November 1923 in Boudouaou, Kabylia (now Boumerdès). He grew up in the wooded and mountainous region of the Col des Beni Aïcha.[3][4]

targets.targetText: An haifi Ahmed Mahsas a ranar 17 ga Nuwamba 1923 a Boudouaou, Kabylia (yanzu Boumerdès ). Ya girma a cikin daji da dutsen yankin Col des Beni Aïcha . [1] [2]
An haifi Ahmed Mahsas a ranar 17 ga watan Nuwamba 1923 a Boudouaou, Kabylia (yanzu Boumerdès). Ya girma a cikin daji da dutsen yankin Col des Beni Aïcha. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Mahsas, like Ben Bella, denounced the results of the Soummam conference, and in December 1956 and early 1957 tried to bring dissident elements from the border regions with Tunisia together.[1][26][27]

targets.targetText: Mahsas, kamar Ben Bella, ya yi tir da sakamakon taron Soummam, kuma a cikin Disamba 1956 da farkon 1957 ya yi ƙoƙari ya haɗa ɓangarorin da ba su da tushe daga yankunan kan iyaka da Tunisiya . [1] [2] [3]

Mahsas, kamar Ben Bella, ya yi tir da sakamakon taron Soummam, kuma a cikin watan Disamba 1956 da farkon 1957 ya yi ƙoƙari ya haɗa ɓangarorin da ba su da tushe daga yankunan kan iyaka da Tunisiya. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Ahmed Zabana (Arabic: أحمد زبانة; real name: Ahmed Zahana; 1926 – 19 June 1956) was an Algerian fighter who participated in the outbreak of the Algerian War. He was executed by guillotine by French regime colonizers on 19 June 1956, in Algiers.

targets.targetText: Ahmed Zabana (ainihin suna: Ahmed Zahana ; 1926 - 19 ga watan Yuni 1956) wani mayaki ne ɗan ƙasar Aljeriya wanda ya halarci ɓarkewar yakin Aljeriya. Masu mulkin mallaka na Faransa sun kashe shi ta hanyar guillotine a ranar 19 ga watan Yuni 1956, a Algiers.

Ahmed Zabana ( Arabic ; ainihin suna: Ahmed Zahana ; 1926 - 19 ga Yuni 1956) wani mayaki ne dan kasar Aljeriya wanda ya halarci barkewar yakin Aljeriya . Masu mulkin mallaka na Faransa sun kashe shi ta hanyar guillotine a ranar 19 ga Yuni 1956, a Algiers .

items.sourceText: The Ahmed Zabana National Museum and Ahmed Zabana Stadium in Oran are named after him. In 2012, the Algerian film director Saïd Ould-Khelifa launched a biographical film Zabana! with the lead role of Zabana played by Imad Benchenni.[5]

targets.targetText: An sanya wa gidan tarihin Ahmed Zabana National Museum da Ahmed Zabana Stadium da ke Oran sunansa. A cikin shekarar 2012, darektan fina-finai na Aljeriya Saïd Ould-Khelifa ya ƙaddamar da wani fim na tarihin rayuwar Zabana! tare da jagoranci na Zabana wanda Imad Benchenni ya taka. [1]

An sanya wa gidan tarihin Ahmed Zabana National Museum da Ahmed Zabana Stadium da ke Oran sunansa. A cikin 2012, darektan fina-finai na Aljeriya Saïd Ould-Khelifa ya ƙaddamar da wani fim na tarihin rayuwar Zabana! tare da jagoranci na Zabana wanda Imad Benchenni ya taka . [1]

items.sourceText: Born in Cape Verde to a petty-bourgeois family, Helena stayed in the country until she had completed her secondary education. In 1967, she moved to Portugal to attend university.[1][2]

targets.targetText: An haife ta a Cape Verde ga ɗan ƙaramin ɗan bourgeois, Helena ta zauna a ƙasar har sai da ta kammala karatun sakandare. A shekarar 1967, ta koma Portugal don halartar jami'a. [1] [2]
An haife ta a Cape Verde ga ɗan ƙaramin ɗan bourgeois, Helena ta zauna a ƙasar har sai ta kammala karatun sakandare . A 1967, ta koma Portugal don halartar jami'a. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: The Morice Line had a significant impact of the reduction of guerrillas activities by forces that originated from Tunisia. Though the Morice Line was not a "fortification" in the traditional sense of the word, it was nonetheless effective in reducing FLN activity during the Algerian War.

targets.targetText: Layin Morice ya yi tasiri sosai wajen rage ayyukan 'yan ta'adda da dakarun da suka samo asali daga Tunisiya ke yi. Kodayake Layin Morice ba "ƙarfafa" ba ne a cikin ma'anar kalmar, amma duk da haka yana da tasiri wajen rage ayyukan FLN a lokacin Yaƙin Aljeriya .

Layin Morice ya yi tasiri sosai wajen rage ayyukan 'yan tawaye da dakarun da suka samo asali daga Tunisiya ke yi. Kodayake Layin Morice ba "ƙarfafa" ba ne a cikin ma'anar kalmar, amma duk da haka yana da tasiri wajen rage ayyukan FLN a lokacin Yaƙin Aljeriya.

items.sourceText: In the summer of 1629, three Barbary pirate ships with 500 pirates entered the bay of Hvalba in Suðuroy. They had a Faroese guide, the brother of the owner of the Nøstgaard farm, who felt that his brother had cheated him on his inheritance, and who showed the pirates to his brother's farm and the rest of the parish.[1]

targets.targetText: A lokacin rani na shekarar 1629, jiragen ruwa na Barbary guda uku tare da 'yan fashi 500 sun shiga bakin teku na Hvalba a Suðuroy. Suna da jagoran Faroese, ɗan'uwan mai gonar Nøstgaard, wanda ya ji cewa ɗan'uwansa ya yaudare shi a kan gadonsa, kuma wanda ya nuna 'yan fashin zuwa gonar ɗan'uwansa da sauran Ikklesiya. [1]

A lokacin rani na 1629, jiragen ruwa na Barbary guda uku tare da 'yan fashi 500 sun shiga bakin teku na Hvalba a Suðuroy . Suna da jagoran Faroese, ɗan'uwan mai gonar Nøstgaard, wanda ya ji cewa ɗan'uwansa ya yaudare shi a kan gadonsa, kuma wanda ya nuna 'yan fashin zuwa gonar ɗan'uwansa da sauran Ikklesiya. [1]

items.sourceText: Through the ordinance of 17 November 1831, the Chasseurs d'Afrique were created to establish the presence of cavalry capable of rapid incursions into the heart of rebel areas in French North Africa.[3] Four squadrons were formed, and these regiments of horsemen immediately began targeting the insurrectionary tribes around Algiers.[4]

targets.targetText: Ta hanyar dokar 17 ga watan Nuwamba 1831, an ƙirƙiri Chasseurs d'Afrique don tabbatar da kasancewar mayaƙan dawakai waɗanda ke iya saurin kutsawa cikin tsakiyar yankunan 'yan tawaye a Arewacin Afirka ta Faransa. [1] An kafa runduna huɗu, kuma nan da nan waɗannan runduna ta mahayan dawakai suka fara kai hari kan ƙabilun 'yan tawaye da ke kewayen Algiers. [2]

items.sourceText: Nyamubaya was a featured poet in literature festivals and events in Africa and abroad, including Poetry Africa on Tour, September 2010 in Harare, Zimbabwe,[11] and the 18th International Poetry Festival of Medellín in Colombia in 2008.[9]

targets.targetText: Nyamubaya wani mawaƙi ne da aka yi fice a cikin bukukuwan wallafe-wallafe da abubuwan da suka faru a Afirka da ƙasashen waje, ciki har da Poetry Africa on Tour, Satumba 2010 a Harare, Zimbabwe, [1] da kuma 18th International Poetry Festival na Medellín a Colombia a 2008. [2]

Nyamubaya wata mawaƙiya ce da ta yi fice a cikin bukukuwan wallafe-wallafe da abubuwan da suka faru a Afirka da ƙasashen waje, ciki har da Poetry Africa on Tour, Satumba 2010 a Harare, Zimbabwe, [1] da kuma 18th International Poetry Festival na Medellín a Colombia a shekarar 2008. [2]

items.sourceText: Her three daughters were sent to England, which was unusual for girls at the time, but she refused to follow them and remained in Cape Coast. This resulted in her children growing up far away from her and marrying into English society. Phipps died on 11 March 1738 in Cape Coast.[1][2]

targets.targetText: An aika da 'ya'yanta mata uku zuwa Ingila, wanda ya kasance sabon abu ga 'yan mata a lokacin, amma ta ƙi bin su kuma ta kasance a Cape Coast. Hakan ya sa 'ya'yanta suka girma a nesa da ita kuma suka yi aure a cikin al'ummar Ingila. Phipps ta mutu a ranar 11 ga watan Maris 1738 a Cape Coast. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: After the Ethiopian Empire violated a 1952 UN resolution that guaranteed Eritrea the right to an autonomous government, the ELF was established in 1960 in order to waged an armed struggle for independence. Under Emperor Haile Selassie, the Ethiopian government banned Eritrean political parties, free press and right to assembly. During 1961, the ELF began the Eritrean War of Independence.[1] Idris Muhammad Adam and other Eritrean intellectuals founded the ELF as a primary Pan Arab movement in Cairo, but the first act of armed resistance was led by Hamid Idris Awate. Over the course of the 1960s, the ELF was able to obtain support from Arab countries such as Egypt and Sudan. However, tensions between Muslims and Christians in the ELF along with the failure of the ELF to ward off Ethiopia's 1967–1968 counter offensive internally fractured the ELF, causing it to split.

targets.targetText: Bayan da Masarautar Habasha ta keta ƙudirin Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya na shekarar 1952 wanda ya bai wa Eritrea samun 'yancin daga 'yan mulkin mallaka, an kafa ELF a shekara ta 1960 domin yin gwagwarmayar neman yancin kai. A ƙarƙashin Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie, gwamnatin Habasha ta haramtawa jam'iyyun siyasa na Eritriya, 'yan jaridu da 'yancin yin taro. A lokacin 1961, ELF ta fara Yaƙin Independence na Eritrea. [1] Idris Muhammad Adam da sauran hazikan 'yan Eritrea ne suka kafa ELF a matsayin kungiyar Pan Arab na farko a birnin Alkahira, amma Hamid Idris Awate ne ya jagoranta na farko na gwagwarmaya da makami. A cikin shekarun 1960s, ELF ta sami damar samun tallafi daga ƙasashen Larabawa kamar Masar da Sudan. Duk da haka, takun-saka tsakanin Musulmi da Kirista a cikin ELF tare da gazawar ELF wajen kawar da kai farmakin da Habasha ta kai a shekarar 1967-1968 ta cikin gida ta raba kan ELF, wanda ya sa ta rabu.

items.sourceText: Discontent with the Ethiopian government ensured as Emperor Haile Selassie took actions to destabilize Eritrea's autonomous government. As Ethiopia was more authoritarian than Eritrea, Selassie felt that increased freedom in Eritrea would destabilize Ethiopia.[1] Consequently, the same year that the UN resolution went into effect, Selassie disposed of Eritrea's constitution. In 1953, the Eritrean Trade Union was outlawed. By 1955, Eritrea's president was removed and a year later, the Eritrean National Assembly ceased to exist. The year 1956 also marked the year that Amharic replaced Arabic and Tigrinya as the official language of Eritrea.[6] The coming years also saw the suppression of insurgency movements against Ethiopia, the arrests of newspaper editors who spoke against the Ethiopian crown, the seizure of private Eritrean businesses, and the removal of the Eritrean flag.[3]

targets.targetText: Rashin gamsuwa da gwamnatin Habasha ya tabbata yayin da Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ya dauki matakin dagula gwamnatin Eritrea mai cin gashin kanta. Yayin da Habasha ta fi Eritiriya mulki, Selassie yana jin cewa ƙarin 'yanci a Eritriya zai kawo cikas ga Habasha . [1] Sakamakon haka, a shekarar da kudurin Majalisar Dinkin Duniya ya fara aiki, Selassie ya yi watsi da kundin tsarin mulkin Eritrea. A cikin 1953, an haramta kungiyar kwadago ta Eritrea . A shekara ta 1955, an cire shugaban Eritiriya kuma shekara guda bayan haka, Majalisar ƙasar Eritrea ta daina wanzuwa. Shekarar 1956 ita ma ta zama shekarar da Amharic ya maye gurbin Larabci da Tigrinya a matsayin harshen Iritiriya . [2] Shekaru masu zuwa kuma an ga murkushe ƙungiyoyin tawaye a kan Habasha, kama editocin jaridu da suka yi magana game da kambin Habasha, kama wasu kamfanoni masu zaman kansu na Eritrea, da kuma cire tutar Eritrea. [3]

items.sourceText: In 1956, units of the Army, which started to move its staff from North Spanish Morocco, began infiltrating Ifni and other enclaves of Spanish Morocco, as well as Spanish Sahara (today Western Sahara), to claim them as being part of Morocco. Initially, they received important backing from the Moroccan government. In the Spanish Sahara, the Army rallied Sahrawi tribes along the way, and triggered a large-scale rebellion. In early 1958, the Moroccan king reorganized the Army of Liberation units fighting in the Spanish Sahara as the "Saharan Liberation Army" [citation needed], also known as 'the Southern Liberation Army' (Armée de Libération du Sud), sometimes abbreviated as ALS. The ALS had prestigious leaders such as Abderrahmane Youssoufi[citation needed], Fqih Basri and Bensaid Aït Idder.

targets.targetText: A cikin 1956, rukunin Sojoji, waɗanda suka fara motsa ma'aikatansu daga Arewacin Sipaniya Maroko, sun fara kutsawa cikin Ifni da sauran yankuna na Sifen Maroko, da kuma Saharar Sipaniya (yau Yammacin Sahara ), don ɗaukar su a matsayin ɓangare na Maroko. Da farko dai sun sami gagarumin goyon baya daga gwamnatin Moroko. A cikin yankin sahara na kasar Sipaniya, Sojoji sun tattaro kabilun Sahrawi akan hanya, inda suka haifar da gagarumin tawaye . A farkon shekara ta 1958, Sarkin Moroko ya sake tsara rundunonin soji na 'yantar da sojojin da ke yaki a cikin Saharar Sipaniya a matsayin "Rundunar 'Yancin Sahara". , wanda kuma aka sani da 'Sojan 'Yancin Kudancin' (Armée de Libération du Sud), wani lokaci ana rage shi da ALS. ALS tana da manyan shugabanni irin su Abderrahmane Youssoufi  and Bensaid Aït Idder .

A cikin shekarar 1956, ruƙunin Sojoji, waɗanda suka fara motsa ma'aikatansu daga Arewacin Sipaniya Maroko, sun fara kutsawa cikin Ifni da sauran yankuna na Sifen Maroko, da kuma Saharar Sipaniya (yau Yammacin Sahara), don ɗaukar su a matsayin ɓangare na Maroko. Da farko dai sun sami gagarumin goyon baya daga gwamnatin Moroko. A cikin yankin sahara na ƙasar Sipaniya, Sojoji sun tattaro ƙabilun Sahrawi akan hanya, inda suka haifar da gagarumin tawaye. A farkon shekara ta 1958, Sarkin Moroko ya sake tsara rundunonin soji na 'yantar da sojojin da ke yaki a cikin Saharar Sipaniya a matsayin "Rundunar 'Yancin Sahara". , wanda kuma aka sani da 'Sojan 'Yancin Kudancin' (Armée de Libération du Sud), wani lokaci ana rage shi da ALS. ALS tana da manyan shugabanni irin su Abderrahmane Youssoufi  da Bensaid Aït Idder.

items.sourceText: It was founded in 1955 as an attempt to organise the various factions of rural Moroccan armed resistance after the assassination of the Tunisian labor unionist Farhat Hached and the forced exile of King Mohamed ben Youssef.[1]

targets.targetText: An kafa ta a shekara ta 1955 a matsayin ƙoƙari na shirya ɓangarori daban-daban na adawa da makamai na yankunan karkara na Maroko bayan kisan gillar ɗan kungiyar kwadago a Tunisia Farhat Hached da kuma tilasta gudun hijira na Sarki Mohamed ben Youssef. [1]

An kafa shi a shekara ta 1955 a matsayin ƙoƙari na shirya bangarori daban-daban na adawa da makamai na yankunan karkara na Maroko bayan kisan gillar dan kungiyar kwadago ta Tunisia Farhat Hached da kuma tilasta gudun hijira na Sarki Mohamed ben Youssef . [1]

items.sourceText: Ngei attended primary school at DEB Kangundo from 1932, intermediate school at Kwa Mating'i in Machakos town from 1936, and Alliance High School in Kiambu District. He then joined the army in the King's African Rifles (KAR) for a four-year stint. After that he enrolled at Makerere University in Uganda as a journalism student from 1948 to 1950.

targets.targetText: Ngei ya yi makarantar firamare a DEB Kangundo daga shekarun 1932, ya yi tsaka-tsaki a Kwa Mating'i a cikin garin Machakos daga shekarar 1936, da babbar makarantar Alliance a gundumar Kiambu. Daga nan ya shiga aikin soja a cikin King's African Rifles (KAR) na tsawon shekaru huɗu. Bayan haka ya shiga Jami'ar Makerere da ke Uganda a matsayin ɗalibin aikin jarida daga shekarun 1948 zuwa 1950.

Ngei ya yi makarantar firamare a DEB Kangundo daga 1932, ya yi tsaka-tsaki a Kwa Mating'i a cikin garin Machakos daga 1936, da babbar makarantar Alliance a gundumar Kiambu . Daga nan ya shiga aikin soja a cikin King's African Rifles (KAR) na tsawon shekaru hudu. Bayan haka ya shiga Jami'ar Makerere da ke Uganda a matsayin dalibin aikin jarida daga 1948 zuwa 1950.

items.sourceText: The first parliamentary election were held on independence in 1963 and Achieng Oneko won the Nakuru Town Constituency seat.[6] Jomo Kenyatta became the first president of Kenya and soon appointed Achieng Oneko Minister for Information, Broadcasting and Tourism. However, in 1966 Oneko quit the government and joined the newly created Kenya People's Union, a socialist party led by his comrade Oginga Odinga.[2]

targets.targetText: An gudanar da zaben ‘yan majalisa na farko kan ‘yancin kai a shekarar 1963 kuma Achieng Oneko ya lashe zaben mazabar garin Nakuru . [1] Jomo Kenyatta ya zama shugaban Kenya na farko kuma nan da nan ya nada Achieng Oneko ministan yada labarai, yada labarai da yawon bude ido. Duk da haka, a cikin 1966 Oneko ya yi murabus daga gwamnati kuma ya shiga sabuwar ƙungiyar jama'ar Kenya da aka kafa, jam'iyyar gurguzu karkashin jagorancin abokinsa Oginga Odinga . [2]

[1] Jomo Kenyatta ya zama shugaban Kenya na farko kuma nan da nan ya naɗa Achieng Oneko ministan yaɗa labarai, yada labarai da yawon buɗe ido.
