items.sourceText: Although he never learnt to read or write, he was an articulate man, politically active and influential. He led his clan from 1905, and was appointed “headman” by the Colonial administration in 1921, and Senior Chief of Kiambu District in 1938. By 1942 he was Senior Chief without location. He was then to become an adviser on African affairs to the District Commissioner who once described him as “the evil genius of Kiambu”.[1]

targets.targetText: Duk da cewa bai taɓa koyon karatu ko rubutu ba, amma mutum ne mai hazaka, mai fafutukar siyasa da tasiri. Ya jagoranci danginsa daga shekarar 1905, kuma gwamnatin 'yan mulkin mallaka ta naɗa shi “shugaba” a shekarar 1921, da Babban Hakimin Kiambu a shekarar 1938. A shekara ta 1942 ya kasance Babban Shugaban ba tare da wuri ba. Daga nan ne zai zama mai ba wa Hakimin gundumar shawara kan harkokin Afirka wanda ya taba bayyana shi a matsayin "mugun hazaka na Kiambu". [1]

Duk da cewa bai taba koyon karatu ko rubutu ba, amma mutum ne mai hazaka, mai fafutukar siyasa da tasiri. Ya jagoranci danginsa daga 1905, kuma gwamnatin mulkin mallaka ta nada shi “shugaba” a 1921, da Babban Hakimin Kiambu a 1938. A shekara ta 1942 ya kasance Babban Shugaban ba tare da wuri ba. Daga nan ne zai zama mai ba wa Hakimin gundumar shawara kan harkokin Afirka wanda ya taba bayyana shi a matsayin "mugun hazaka na Kiambu". [1]

items.sourceText: Makhan Singh was born in Gharjakh, a village in Gujranwala District, Punjab to a Sikh family. In 1927, at the age of 13, he moved with his family to Nairobi, a municipality which, since 1905, had functioned as the administrative capital of the British East African protectorate.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Makhan Singh a Gharjakh, ƙauye a gundumar Gujranwala, Punjab ga dangin Sikh. A cikin shekarar 1927, yana ɗan shekara 13, ya ƙaura tare da danginsa zuwa Nairobi, gundumar da, tun 1905, ta yi aiki a matsayin babban birnin gudanarwa na British East African protectorate. [1]

items.sourceText: Still, a more generally defined "old guard", including some of the Oujda men, would continue to exercise influence after Boumédiène's death in 1978, over his successor Chadli Bendjedid. Bendjedid consciously strove to marginalise these men, and to replace them with his own loyalists. This policy became informally known as de-Boumédiènisation. The early 1980s therefore marked the end of whatever remained of the Oujda clan as a (somewhat) cohesive faction within Algerian politics, even if FLN "conservatives" favoring Boumédiène-style policies continued to challenge Chadli from within until they were finally purged following the October Riots in 1988.

targets.targetText: Har yanzu, “tsohuwar tsaro” da aka fi sani da ita, gami da wasu daga cikin mutanen Oujda, za su ci gaba da yin tasiri bayan mutuwar Boumédiène a 1978, kan magajinsa Chadli Bendjedid . Bendjedid da sane ya yi ƙoƙari ya kawar da waɗannan mutanen, kuma ya maye gurbinsu da nasa masu biyayya. Wannan manufar ta zama sanannun sanannun da sunan de-Boumédiènisation. Saboda haka farkon shekarun 1980 ya nuna ƙarshen duk abin da ya rage na dangin Oujda a matsayin ƙungiya mai haɗin kai a cikin siyasar Aljeriya, koda kuwa FLN "masu ra'ayin mazan jiya" suna goyon bayan manufofin salon Boumédiène sun ci gaba da ƙalubalantar Chadli daga ciki har sai da aka tsarkake su biyo bayan tarzomar Oktoba a 1988.

Har yanzu, “tsohuwar tsaro” da aka fi sani da ita, gami da wasu daga cikin mutanen Oujda, za su ci gaba da yin tasiri bayan mutuwar Boumédiène a shekarar 1978, kan magajinsa Chadli Bendjedid. Saboda haka farkon shekarun 1980 ya nuna ƙarshen duk abin da ya rage na dangin Oujda a matsayin ƙungiya mai haɗin kai a cikin siyasar Aljeriya, koda kuwa FLN "masu ra'ayin mazan jiya" suna goyon bayan manufofin salon Boumédiène sun ci gaba da ƙalubalantar Chadli daga ciki har sai da aka tsarkake su biyo bayan tarzomar Oktoba a shekarar 1988.

items.sourceText: El-Mokrani was a descendant of the rulers of the Kingdom of Ait Abbas,[2] descendants of Abderrahmane of Djebel Ayad.[3][4] The Amokrane, had been rulers since the sixteenth century of the Kalâa of Ait Abbas in the Bibans and of the Medjana region.[5] In the 1830s, Cheikh Mokrani's father Ahmed El Mokrani (d. 1853), had chosen to ally himself with the French invaders. It was Ahmed El Mokrani who had allowed the Iron Gates expedition of 1839 and he had become khalifa of the Medjana under the tutelage of the French authorities.[6] This alliance had soon revealed itself to be a form of subordination - a decree of 1845 abolished the khalifalik of Medjana so that when Mohamed succeeded his father, as the choice of the French Arab Bureaux, his title was no more than “bachagha” (Turkish: başağa=chief commander).[7]: 35

targets.targetText: El-Mokrani zuriyar sarakunan Ait Abbas ne, [1] zuriyar Abderrahmane na Djebel Ayad. [2] [3] Amokrane, sun kasance masu mulki tun ƙarni na sha shida na Kalaa na Ait Abbas a cikin Bibans da na yankin Medjana. [4] A cikin shekarun 1830, mahaifin Cheikh Mokrani Ahmed El Mokrani (wanda ya rasu a shekara ta 1853), ya zaɓi ya haɗa kansa da mahara Faransawa. Ahmed El Mokrani ne ya ba da izinin balaguron Iron Gates na shekarar 1839 kuma ya zama khalifa na Medjana a ƙarƙashin kulawar hukumomin Faransa. [5] Ba da daɗewa ba wannan ƙawancen ya bayyana kansa a matsayin wani nau'i na ƙasƙanci - wata doka ta shekarar 1845 ta soke khalifalik na Medjana ta yadda lokacin da Mohamed ya gaji mahaifinsa, a matsayin zaɓi na Ofishin Larabawa na Faransa, lakaƙinsa bai wuce "bachagha" ba ( Turkish: başağa=babban kwamanda). [6] : 35

[4] A cikin shekarun 1830, mahaifin Cheikh Mokrani Ahmed El Mokrani (wanda ya rasu a shekara ta 1853), ya zabi ya hada kansa da mahara Faransawa. Ahmed El Mokrani ne ya ba da izinin balaguron Iron Gates na 1839 kuma ya zama khalifa na Medjana a ƙarƙashin kulawar hukumomin Faransa. items.sourceText: Thus in March 1871, the Algerians saw Alsatian farmers disembark on their ancestral lands after the territories, corresponding to the current departments of Bas-Rhin, Haut-Rhin and Moselle, were integrated into the German Empire.[10]

targets.targetText: Don haka a cikin watan Maris 1871, 'yan Aljeriya sun ga manoma Alsatian sun sauka a kan ƙasashen kakanninsu bayan yankuna, daidai da sassan Bas-Rhin, Haut-Rhin da Moselle na yanzu, an haɗa su cikin daular Jamus. [1]

items.sourceText: Several criminal charges weighed on each of the accused who had all, without exception, participated in the insurrection, and the prosecution brought charges against each of the accused, including Cheikh Boumerdassi, for the crimes alleged against these main leaders and leaders of the uprising of 1871.[16]

targets.targetText: An yi la'akari da laifuka da dama a kan kowanne daga cikin wadanda ake tuhuma wanda ke da duka, ba tare da togiya ba, sun shiga cikin tayar da hankali, kuma masu gabatar da kara sun gabatar da tuhuma a kan kowanne daga cikin wadanda ake tuhuma, ciki har da Cheikh Boumerdassi, bisa laifuffukan da ake zargin wadannan manyan shugabanni da jagororin tawaye na 1871. [1]

[1]

items.sourceText: The rebels of the Mokrani Revolt, after several successes, headed for Algiers via Alma (Boudouaou) after having taken control of Palestro (Lakhdaria), Laazib Zamoum (Naciria), Bordj Menaïel, the Issers and the Col des Beni Aïcha (Thenia).[2]

targets.targetText: 'Yan tawayen Mokrani Revolt, bayan nasarori da dama, sun nufi Algiers ta hanyar Alma (Boudouaou) bayan sun mamaye Palestro (Lakhdaria), Laazib Zamoum (Naciria), Bordj Menaïel, Issers da Col des Beni Aïcha (Thenia). [1]

'Yan tawayen Mokrani Revolt, bayan nasarori da dama, sun nufi Algiers ta hanyar Alma ( Boudouaou ) bayan sun mamaye Palestro ( Lakhdaria ), Laazib Zamoum ( Naciria ), Bordj Menaïel, Issers da Col des Beni Aïcha ( Thenia ). [1]

items.sourceText: Since 17 May 1837, Colonel Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg and his French soldiers during the Expedition of the Col des Beni Aïcha understood that control of the Col des Beni Aïcha region was crucial for the pacification of eastern Algiers and Kabylia.[4]

targets.targetText: Tun daga ranar 17 ga Mayu 1837, Kanar Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg da sojojinsa na Faransa a lokacin balaguro na Col des Beni Aïcha sun fahimci cewa iko da yankin Col des Beni Aïcha na da mahimmanci ga zaman lafiyar gabashin Algiers da Kabylia . [1]

Tun daga ranar 17 ga watan Mayu 1837, Kanar Maximilien Joseph Schauenburg da sojojinsa na Faransa a lokacin balaguro na Col des Beni Aïcha sun fahimci cewa iko da yankin Col des Beni Aïcha na da mahimmanci ga zaman lafiyar gabashin Algiers da Kabylia. [1]

items.sourceText: The Col des Beni Aïcha colony quickly became a stage coach, and a café was opened there as well as a wooden chapel and a distillery.[7]

targets.targetText: Wurin Col des Beni Aïcha da sauri ya zama mai horar da wasan kwaikwayo, kuma an buɗe gidan cin abinci a wurin da ɗakin ɗakin karatu na katako da kuma wurin dafa abinci. [1]
Wurin Col des Beni Aïcha da sauri ya zama mai horar da wasan kwaikwayo, kuma an buɗe gidan cin abinci a wurin da ɗakin karatu na katako da kuma wurin dafa abinci. [1]

items.sourceText: The Algerians of the Pacific were a group of Algerian men deported by French authorities to labor camps on the island of New Caledonia, after taking part in the 1871–1872 Mokrani Revolt against colonial rule in Algeria.

targets.targetText: Aljeriya mazauna yankin Pacific gungun mutanen Aljeriya ne da hukumomin Faransa suka kora zuwa sansanonin aiki a tsibirin New Caledonia, bayan sun shiga cikin Tawayen Mokrani na shekarun 1871-1872 na adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka a Aljeriya.

Aljeriya mazauna yankin Pacific gungun mutanen Aljeriya ne da hukumomin Faransa suka kora zuwa sansanonin aiki a tsibirin New Caledonia, bayan sun shiga cikin Tawayen Mokrani na 1871-1872 na adawa da mulkin mallaka a Aljeriya .

items.sourceText: In July 1982, Bouyali took to the maquis, with significant support in local towns, particularly Larbaa. The "Group for Defense against the Illicit" announced its transformation into the Algerian Islamic Armed Movement (MAIA). According to the government, it planned a variety of attacks, including the assassination of the Prime Minister, which were forestalled by the arrest of 23 of its members in mid-December. Further arrests were made in January 1983. However, Bouyali himself evaded the security forces, and fled abroad (probably either Iran or Libya).

targets.targetText: A cikin watan Yuli 1982, Bouyali ya ɗauki maquis, tare da gagarumin tallafi a garuruwan gida, musamman Larbaa. Ƙungiyar "Group for Defence against the Inlicic" ta sanar da sauya sheka zuwa kungiyar Islamic Armed Movement (MAIA). A cewar gwamnatin, ta shirya kai hare-hare iri-iri, ciki har da kisan gillar da aka yi wa Firayim Minista, wanda aka yi wa katsalandan bayan da aka kama mambobinta 23 a tsakiyar watan Disamba. An sake kama shi a watan Janairun 1983. Duk da haka, Bouyali da kansa ya guje wa jami'an tsaro, kuma ya gudu zuwa ƙasashen waje (watakila Iran ko Libya).

A cikin Yuli 1982, Bouyali ya ɗauki maquis, tare da gagarumin tallafi a garuruwan gida, musamman Larbaa . Kungiyar "Group for Defence against the Inlicic" ta sanar da sauya sheka zuwa kungiyar Islamic Armed Movement (MAIA). A cewar gwamnatin, ta shirya kai hare-hare iri-iri, ciki har da kisan gillar da aka yi wa Firayim Minista, wanda aka yi wa katsalandan bayan da aka kama mambobinta 23 a tsakiyar watan Disamba. An sake kama shi a watan Janairun 1983. Duk da haka, Bouyali da kansa ya guje wa jami'an tsaro, kuma ya gudu zuwa kasashen waje (watakila Iran ko Libya ).

items.sourceText: Beginning in 1882, the British Empire initiated an occupation of Egypt after the Anglo-Egyptian War broke out. The 1919 Egyptian revolution led to the British recognition of Egypt's independence in 1922 as the Kingdom of Egypt, though Britain retained de facto control over the region. After World War II, the British occupation zone had shrunk to the area around the Suez Canal. Beginning in the 1950s, Egyptian nationalists opposed to the occupation organized themselves into guerrilla groups known as fedayeen and launched attacks on British forces in Egypt.[1]

targets.targetText: Tun daga shekara ta 1882, daular Burtaniya ta fara mamaye ƙasar Masar bayan yakin Anglo-Masar. Juyin Juyin Juya Halin Masar na shekarar 1919 ya kai ga amincewar Burtaniya ga samun ‘yancin kai a shekarar 1922 a matsayin Masarautar Masar, kodayake Birtaniyya ta ci gaba da riƙe madafun iko a yankin. Bayan yakin duniya na biyu, yankin da Birtaniyya ta mamaye ya ragu zuwa yankin da ke kusa da mashigin Suez. Tun daga shekarun 1950 ne masu kishin ƙasar Masar masu adawa da mamaya suka shirya kansu cikin kungiyoyin faɗa fadayen tare da kaddamar da hare-hare kan sojojin Birtaniya a Masar. [1]

Tun daga shekara ta 1882, daular Burtaniya ta fara mamaye kasar Masar bayan yakin Anglo-Masar . Juyin Juyin Juya Halin Masar na 1919 ya kai ga amincewar Burtaniya ga samun ‘yancin kai a 1922 a matsayin Masarautar Masar, kodayake Birtaniyya ta ci gaba da rike madafun iko a yankin. Bayan yakin duniya na biyu, yankin da Birtaniyya ta mamaye ya ragu zuwa yankin da ke kusa da mashigin Suez . Tun daga shekarun 1950 ne masu kishin kasar Masar masu adawa da mamaya suka shirya kansu cikin kungiyoyin fada - fadayen tare da kaddamar da hare-hare kan sojojin Birtaniya a Masar. [1]

items.sourceText: Habib Bourguiba allowed the FLN to use Tunis as a de facto capital/headquarters,[5] and the ALN to install itself on the border. The ALN used several Tunisian cities and villages near the border as bases to train their units (katibas), and smuggle weapons to the inside of the country. These bases included Ghardimaou, Sakiet Sidi Youssef, El Kef, Tajerouine, Thala, Thélepte, Gafsa and Kasserine. After being trained, these katibas crossed the border to reinforce the wilayas of Kabylia (Wilaya III), Algérois (Wilaya IV), Constantinois (Wilaya II), and the Aurès (Wilaya I), bringing with them arms and ammunition. The Oranais (Wilaya V) was in the hands of the ALN in Morocco, while the Sahara (Wilaya VI) was at the time struggling to survive thanks to the harsh desert condition and poor logistics, and was mostly carried by guerilla Si El Haouès. Thus the Constantinois, Kabylia and the Aurès were, in 1958, the most important theatres of the war. The amount of weapons passing through the border was large.

targets.targetText: Habib Bourguiba ya ƙyale FLN ta yi amfani da Tunis a matsayin babban birni / hedkwata, [1] da ALN don shigar da kanta a kan iyaka. Kungiyar ALN ta yi amfani da garuruwa da kauyuka da dama na kasar Tunisiya da ke kusa da kan iyaka a matsayin sansanin horar da rukuninsu (katibas), tare da safarar makamai zuwa cikin kasar. Wadannan sansanonin sun hada da Ghardimaou, Sakiet Sidi Youssef, El Kef, Tajerouine, Thala, Thélepte, Gafsa da Kasserine . Bayan horar da su, waɗannan katibas sun ketare kan iyaka don ƙarfafa wilaya na Kabylia ( Wilaya III ), Algérois ( Wilaya IV ), Constantinois ( Wilaya II ), da Aurès ( Wilaya I ), tare da su da makamai da alburusai. Oranais ( Wilaya V ) yana hannun ALN a Maroko, yayin da Sahara ( Wilaya VI ) a lokacin ya kasance yana gwagwarmayar rayuwa saboda mummunan yanayin hamada da rashin kayan aiki, kuma mafi yawancin 'yan tawaye Si El Haouès ne ke dauke da su . Don haka Constantinois, Kabylia da Aurès sun kasance a cikin 1958, mafi mahimmancin wasan kwaikwayo na yakin. Yawan makaman da ke wucewa ta kan iyakar sun yi yawa.

Habib Bourguiba ya ƙyale FLN ta yi amfani da Tunis a matsayin babban birni/hedkwata, [1] da ALN don shigar da kanta a kan iyaka. Kungiyar ALN ta yi amfani da garuruwa da ƙauyuka da dama na ƙasar Tunisiya da ke kusa da kan iyaka a matsayin sansanin horar da ruƙuninsu (katibas), tare da safarar makamai zuwa cikin ƙasar. Wadannan sansanonin sun haɗa da Ghardimaou, Sakiet Sidi Youssef, El Kef, Tajerouine, Thala, Thélepte, Gafsa da Kasserine. Bayan horar da su, waɗannan katibas sun ketare kan iyaka don ƙarfafa wilaya na Kabylia (Wilaya III), Algérois (Wilaya IV), Constantinois (Wilaya II), da Aurès (Wilaya I), tare da su da makamai da alburusai. Oranais (Wilaya V) yana hannun ALN a Maroko, yayin da Sahara (Wilaya VI) a lokacin ya kasance yana gwagwarmayar rayuwa saboda mummunan yanayin hamada da rashin kayan aiki, kuma mafi yawancin 'yan tawaye Si El Haouès ne ke ɗauke da su. Don haka Constantinois, Kabylia da Aurès sun kasance a cikin shekarar 1958, mafi mahimmancin wasan kwaikwayo na yakin. Yawan makaman da ke wucewa ta kan iyakar sun yi yawa.

items.sourceText: The First Battle of El Djorf (or El-Djorf, also known as Djeurf in French) took place on 22 September 1955, during the Algerian War, between the National Liberation Army and the French Army.

targets.targetText: Yaƙin farko na El Djorf (ko El-Djorf, kuma aka sani da Djeurf a Faransa) ya faru ne a ranar 22 ga watan Satumba 1955, a lokacin Yaƙin Aljeriya, tsakanin Sojojin Yancin Ƙasa da Sojojin Faransa.
Yaƙin farko na El Djorf (ko El-Djorf, kuma aka sani da Djeurf a Faransanci) ya faru ne a ranar 22 ga Satumba 1955, a lokacin Yaƙin Aljeriya, tsakanin Sojojin Yancin Ƙasa da Sojojin Faransa .

items.sourceText: On December 29, 1958, the Zoubiria, El Hamdania, and El Omaria units, deployed throughout Wilaya IV, gathered near the commune of Ouled Bouachraa, located west of Medea where the headquarters of Wilaya IV was situated. A meeting was planned to consolidate these units into a single division. However, before this could happen, they were alerted to the unusual presence of French colonial forces around Ouled Bouachraa. In response, the command of Wilaya IV ordered the deployment of these units and preparation for combat.[1][2][3][4]

targets.targetText: A ranar 29 ga watan Disamba, 1958, ruƙunin Zoubiria, El Hamdania, da El Omaria, waɗanda aka tura a ko'ina cikin Wilaya IV, sun taru kusa da commune of Ouled Bouachraa, wanda ke yammacin Medea inda hedkwatar Wilaya IV take. An shirya taro don haɗa waɗannan ruƙunin zuwa kashi ɗaya. Duk da haka, kafin hakan ya faru, an faɗakar da su game da kasancewar sojojin Faransa na mulkin mallaka a kusa da Ouled Bouachraa. Dangane da mayar da martani, kwamandan Wilaya IV ya ba da umarnin tura wadannan rukunin da kuma shirye-shiryen yaki. [1] [2] [3] [4]

A ranar 29 ga Disamba, 1958, rukunin Zoubiria, El Hamdania, da El Omaria, waɗanda aka tura a ko'ina cikin Wilaya IV, sun taru kusa da commune of Ouled Bouachraa, wanda ke yammacin Medea inda hedkwatar Wilaya IV take. An shirya taro don haɗa waɗannan raka'a zuwa kashi ɗaya. Duk da haka, kafin hakan ya faru, an faɗakar da su game da kasancewar sojojin Faransa na mulkin mallaka a kusa da Ouled Bouachraa. Dangane da mayar da martani, kwamandan Wilaya IV ya ba da umarnin tura wadannan rukunin da kuma shirye-shiryen yaki. [1] [2] [3] [4]

items.sourceText: Operation Jumelles (English: Operation Binoculars) was a military operation which was part of the Algerian War in Kabylia, Algeria. It lasted from 22 July 1959 to March 1960. It was fought between the FLN and the French Army.

targets.targetText: Operation Jumelles ( English: ) wani farmakin soji ne wanda wani bangare ne na yakin Aljeriya a Kabiliya, Aljeriya . Ya kasance daga 22 ga Yuli 1959 zuwa Maris 1960. An gwabza tsakanin FLN da Sojojin Faransa .

Operation Jumelles wani farmakin soji ne wanda wani ɓangare ne na yakin Aljeriya a Kabiliya, Aljeriya. Ya kasance daga ranar 22 ga watan Yuli 1959 zuwa Maris 1960. An gwabza tsakanin FLN da Sojojin Faransa.

items.sourceText: Operation Resurrection was a planned military operation of the French Army in 1958 that sought to take over the capital of France, Paris, to force the return of Charles de Gaulle to head the government. Masterminded by General Jacques Massu, the operation was to be preceded by Opération Corse in which French Army paratroopers took over Corsica. The operation was cancelled after French politicians had immediately arranged for de Gaulle's return to power.

targets.targetText: Operation Resurrection wani shiri ne na soji na sojojin Faransa a 1958 wanda ya nemi karbe babban birnin Faransa, Paris, don tilasta dawowar Charles de Gaulle kan gwamnati. Janar Jacques Massu ne ya ƙware, za a gudanar da wannan aiki ne da Opération Corse wanda dakarun sojin Faransa suka mamaye Corsica . An soke aikin ne bayan da 'yan siyasar Faransa suka shirya shirin komowar de Gaulle kan karagar mulki.

Operation Resurrection wani shiri ne na soji na sojojin Faransa a shekarar 1958 wanda ya nemi karɓe babban birnin Faransa, Paris, don tilasta dawowar Charles de Gaulle kan gwamnati. Janar Jacques Massu ne ya ƙware, za a gudanar da wannan aiki ne da Opération Corse wanda dakarun sojin Faransa suka mamaye Corsica. An soke aikin ne bayan da 'yan siyasar Faransa suka shirya shirin komowar de Gaulle kan ƙaragar mulki.

items.sourceText: On 17 September 1878, a British surveyor for the Colony of Natal and a trader were detained by the Zulu while on an island in the Tugela River, which marked the boundary between Natal and Zululand. The men were robbed but released unharmed. The incident was seized upon by Sir Henry Bartle Frere, the British high commissioner for Southern Africa, as a pretext for war with the Zulu, and reparations for the incident formed part of his December 1878 ultimatum to the Zulu king Cetshwayo. British forces invaded Zululand on 11 January 1879, following the expiry of the ultimatum.

targets.targetText: A ranar 17 ga Satumbar 1878, Zulu ta kama wani dan Burtaniya mai binciken Turawan mulkin mallaka na Natal da wani dan kasuwa a wani tsibiri a cikin kogin Tugela, wanda ke nuna iyaka tsakanin Natal da Zululand . An yi wa mutanen fashi amma an sako su ba tare da wani lahani ba. Sir Henry Bartle Frere, babban kwamishinan Burtaniya a Kudancin Afirka ne ya kama wannan lamarin a matsayin hujjar yaki da Zulu, da kuma biyan diyya na abin da ya faru ya kasance wani bangare na wa'adinsa na Disamba 1878 ga Sarkin Zulu Cetshwayo . Sojojin Burtaniya sun mamaye Zululand a ranar 11 ga Janairun 1879, bayan cikar wa'adin.

A ranar 17 ga watan Satumbar 1878, Zulu ta kama wani ɗan Burtaniya mai binciken Turawan mulkin mallaka na Natal da wani ɗan kasuwa a wani tsibiri a cikin kogin Tugela, wanda ke nuna iyaka tsakanin Natal da Zululand. An yi wa mutanen fashi amma an sako su ba tare da wani lahani ba. Sir Henry Bartle Frere, babban kwamishinan Burtaniya a Kudancin Afirka ne ya kama wannan lamarin a matsayin hujjar yaki da Zulu, da kuma biyan diyya na abin da ya faru ya kasance wani ɓangare na wa'adinsa na Disamba 1878 ga Sarkin Zulu Cetshwayo. Sojojin Burtaniya sun mamaye Zululand a ranar 11 ga watan Janairun 1879, bayan cikar wa'adin.

items.sourceText: As part of the inspection it was decided to survey the condition of the road between Greytown and Fort Buckingham. This provided access to the Middle Drift which was a potential route for British forces to cross into Zululand.[3] David Smith of the Natal Colonial Engineers Department was ordered to survey the road, but was ordered to do so without a military escort because troops on the border had previously raised tensions with the Zulu.[3][1] Smith proceeded in his task, accompanied only by a trader named W. H. Deighton.[1]

targets.targetText: A matsayin wani ɓangare na binciken an yanke shawarar bincika yanayin hanyar tsakanin Greytown da Fort Buckingham. Wannan ya ba da damar shiga Tsakiyar hanya wacce hanya ce mai yuwuwar sojojin Burtaniya su tsallaka zuwa Zululand. [ 3 ] An umurci David Smith na Sashen Injiniyoyi na Natal Colonial Engineers da ya binciki hanyar, amma an umarce shi da yin hakan ba tare da rakiyar sojoji ba saboda a baya sojojin da ke kan iyaka sun tayar da rikici da Zulu. [ 3 ] [ 1 ] Smith ya ci gaba da aikinsa, tare da wani ɗan kasuwa mai suna W. H. Deighton. [ 1 ]

A matsayin wani ɓangare na binciken an yanke shawarar bincika yanayin hanyar tsakanin Greytown da Fort Buckingham. Wannan ya ba da damar shiga Tsakiyar Tsakiyar hanya wacce hanya ce mai yuwuwar sojojin Burtaniya su tsallaka zuwa Zululand. [ 3 ] An umurci David Smith na Sashen Injiniyoyi na Natal Colonial Engineers da ya binciki hanyar, amma an umarce shi da yin hakan ba tare da rakiyar sojoji ba saboda a baya sojojin da ke kan iyaka sun tayar da rikici da Zulu. [ 3 ] [ 1 ] Smith ya ci gaba da aikinsa, tare da wani ɗan kasuwa mai suna W. H. Deighton. [ 1 ]

items.sourceText: In November 1988, following the October riots, he was reassigned as a military advisor to president Chadli Bendjedid. His departure from the position of chief of staff was part of a broader reshuffle aimed at modernizing the military leadership and reducing its political involvement.[4]

targets.targetText: A cikin Nuwamba 1988, bayan tarzomar Oktoba, an sake sanya shi a matsayin mai ba da shawara kan soji ga shugaba Chadli Bendjedid . Ficewar tasa daga mukamin babban hafsan hafsoshin soji na daga cikin wani gagarumin sauyi da aka yi da nufin zamanantar da shugabancin sojoji da kuma rage shigarsa siyasa. [1]

A cikin watan Nuwamba 1988, bayan tarzomar Oktoba, an sake sanya shi a matsayin mai ba da shawara kan soji ga shugaba Chadli Bendjedid. Ficewar tasa daga muƙamin babban hafsan hafsoshin soji na daga cikin wani gagarumin sauyi da aka yi da nufin zamanantar da shugabancin sojoji da kuma rage shigarsa siyasa. [1]

items.sourceText: The PPA/MTLD leader Messali Hadj accused him of having too close ties to the French Communist Party (PCF), and after leading a mission to Cairo to hold talks with the exiled leadership of the rival nationalist movement, the Front de libération nationale (FLN), he defected to join that group as its New York City representative. He then served as minister of information in the FLN's government-in-exile (GPRA) set up in 1958, retaining his post through both cabinet reshuffles (in 1960 and 1961).

targets.targetText: Shugaban PPA/MTLD Messali Hadj ya zarge shi da cewa yana da alaka ta kut-da-kut da jam'iyyar gurguzu ta Faransa (PCF), kuma bayan da ya jagoranci tawagarsa zuwa birnin Alkahira domin tattaunawa da jagoran gwagwarmayar kishin kasa mai adawa, Front de Liberation nationale (FLN), ya sauya sheka ya shiga kungiyar a matsayin wakilinta na birnin New York . Daga nan ya yi aiki a matsayin ministan yada labarai a gwamnatin FLN na gudun hijira ( GPRA ) da aka kafa a 1958, yana riƙe da mukaminsa ta hanyar sake fasalin majalisar ministocin biyu (a cikin 1960 da 1961).

Shugaban PPA/MTLD Messali Hadj ya zarge shi da cewa yana da alaka ta kut-da-kut da jam'iyyar gurguzu ta Faransa (PCF), kuma bayan da ya jagoranci tawagarsa zuwa birnin Alkahira domin tattaunawa da jagoran gwagwarmayar kishin ƙasa mai adawa, Front de Liberation nationale (FLN), ya sauya sheka ya shiga kungiyar a matsayin wakilinta na birnin New York. Daga nan ya yi aiki a matsayin ministan yaɗa labarai a gwamnatin FLN na gudun hijira (GPRA) da aka kafa a shekarar 1958, yana riƙe da muƙaminsa ta hanyar sake fasalin majalisar ministocin biyu (a cikin shekarar 1960 da 1961).

items.sourceText: Mohamed Bach Hamba was born in 1881 into a family of Turkish origin; his brother, Ali Bach Hamba, was a co-founder of the Young Tunisians.[2][3] After travelling in Constantinople, in May 1916, Bach Hamba launched the nationalist "Revue du Maghreb" in Geneva.[3] This monthly magazine aimed at calling for reforms in Tunisia and Algeria, amounting to equality for all under French rule. However, copies that were sent to Tunisia were often confiscated due to its strong criticisms of the existing colonial order. The magazine, which was subsidised by Turkey, also went further and called for self-determination.[1] In 1918, Bach Hamba published a memoir under the title "Le Peuple algéro-tunisien et la France" where he denounced the policy of "participation" with the French Protectorate and argues for the independence of the Algerian-Tunisian people. He died on 27 December 1920, and was buried in the cemetery of Hasenheide southeast of Berlin.

targets.targetText: An haifi Mohamed Bach Hamba a shekara ta 1881 a cikin iyali na asalin Turkiyya ; dan uwansa, Ali Bach Hamba, shi ne wanda ya kafa Matasan Tunusiya . [1] [2] Bayan tafiya a Constantinople, a watan Mayu 1916, Bach Hamba ya kaddamar da " Revue du Maghreb " mai kishin kasa a Geneva . [3] Wannan mujallar na wata-wata da nufin yin kira ga sauye-sauye a Tunisia da Aljeriya, wanda ya kai ga daidaito ga kowa a karkashin mulkin Faransa. To sai dai kuma ana kwace kwafin kwafin da aka aika zuwa Tunisiya saboda tsananin sukar da take yi na mulkin mallaka. Mujallar wacce Turkiyya ta ba da tallafi, ita ma ta ci gaba da yin kira da a tabbatar da kai. [3] A cikin 1918, Bach Hamba ya buga wani abin tunawa a ƙarƙashin taken " Le Peuple algéro-tunisien et la France " inda ya yi tir da manufar "haɗawa" tare da Kariyar Faransa kuma ya yi jayayya da 'yancin kai na al'ummar Aljeriya-Tunisiya. Ya mutu a ranar 27 ga Disamba 1920, kuma an binne shi a makabartar Hasenheide kudu maso gabashin Berlin .

An haifi Mohamed Bach Hamba a shekara ta 1881 a cikin iyali na asalin Turkiyya; ɗan uwansa, Ali Bach Hamba, shi ne wanda ya kafa Matasan Tunusiya. [3] Wannan mujallar na wata-wata da nufin yin kira ga sauye-sauye a Tunisia da Aljeriya, wanda ya kai ga daidaito ga kowa a ƙarƙashin mulkin Faransa. To sai dai kuma ana kwace kwafin kwafin da aka aika zuwa Tunisiya saboda tsananin sukar da take yi na ga 'yan mulkin mallaka. Mujallar wacce Turkiyya ta ba da tallafi, ita ma ta ci gaba da yin kira da a tabbatar da kai. [3] A cikin shekarar 1918, Bach Hamba ya buga wani abin tunawa a ƙarƙashin taken "Le Peuple algéro-tunisien et la France" inda ya yi tir da manufar "haɗawa" tare da Kariyar Faransa kuma ya yi jayayya da 'yancin kai na al'ummar Aljeriya-Tunisiya. Ya mutu a ranar 27 ga watan Disamba 1920, kuma an binne shi a makabartar Hasenheide kudu maso gabashin Berlin.

items.sourceText: His father, Abd al-Latif Ahmad, was a Nuba and a former slave and soldier from the Nuba Mountains. His mother, al-Sabr hailed from the Dinka of Bahr El Ghazal and had formerly been a slave in al-Khandaq before marrying his father. She was thought to have had a huge influence to young Ahmad. Ahmad too had originally been a household slave in al-Khanadaq, then a center of commerce. He was later acquired by Mahdist forces under Wad el Nujumi to serve in the Mahdists 1889 invasion of Egypt. Ahmad either deserted or was taken prisoner by Anglo-Egyptian forces following the Battle of Toski, and ended up enlisted in the Egyptian Army.[1]

targets.targetText: Mahaifinsa, Abd al-Latif Ahmad, Nuba ne kuma tsohon bawa ne kuma soja daga tsaunin Nuba. Mahaifiyarsa, al-Sabr ta fito daga Dinka na Bahr El Ghazal kuma ta taɓa zama baiwa a al-Khandaq kafin ta auri mahaifinsa. Ana tunanin ta yi tasiri sosai ga matashi Ahmad. Ahmad kuma ya kasance bawa ne a gida a al-Khanadaq, a lokacin cibiyar kasuwanci. Daga baya sojojin Mahdist ƙarƙashin Wad el Nujumi suka same shi don ya yi aiki a cikin mamayar Mahdi a shekarar 1889 a Masar. Ahmad ko dai ya gudu ko kuma sojojin Anglo-Masar sun kama shi a fursuna bayan yakin Toski, kuma ya kasance a cikin sojojin Masar. [1]

items.sourceText: Drawing inspiration from the Alliance Israélite Universelle and the school it established in Tetuan in 1862, he contacted scholars, faqīhs, and literary figures in Morocco and established the Moroccan Scientific Society (المجمع العلمي المغربي) on December 30, 1916.[1]

targets.targetText: Da yake zana wahayi daga Alliance Israélite Universelle da makarantar da ta kafa a Tetuan a cikin shekarar 1862, ya tuntuɓi masana, faqīhs, da masana adabi a Maroko kuma ya kafa Ƙungiyar Kimiyya ta Moroccan (المجمع العلمي المغربي ) a ranar 30 ga watan Disamba, 1916. [1]

Da yake zana wahayi daga Alliance Israélite Universelle da makarantar da ta kafa a Tetuan a cikin 1862, ya tuntuɓi masana, faqīhs, da masana adabi a Maroko kuma ya kafa Ƙungiyar Kimiyya ta Moroccan ( المجمع العلمي المغربي ) a ranar 30 ga Disamba, 1916. [1]

items.sourceText: His political activity from the 1930s on culminated in the independence of Morocco in 1956.[4][5][6] In his later years, Torres served first as ambassador to Spain and Egypt, and then as Minister of Justice.[7]

targets.targetText: Ayyukansa na siyasa tun daga 1930s ya ƙare a cikin 'yancin kai na Maroko a 1956. [1] [2] [3] A cikin shekarunsa na baya, Torres ya fara zama jakada a Spain da Masar, sannan ya zama Ministan Shari'a. [4]

Ayyukansa na siyasa tun daga shekarar 1930s ya ƙare a cikin samun 'yancin kai na Maroko a shekarar 1956. [1] [2] [3] A cikin shekarunsa na baya, Torres ya fara zama jakada a Spain da Masar, sannan ya zama Ministan Shari'a. [4]

items.sourceText: He escaped the shots fired at him after the operation, but was captured by the forces of the French Protectorate shortly thereafter. On June 18, 1954, while imprisoned, he committed suicide by swallowing a cyanide tablet. Possessing critical and sensitive information, Zarqtuni did not want to risk giving up any secrets under torture that might betray his country. He is widely regarded as a national hero in Morocco, and as an icon of the resistance movement.[4] One of Casablanca's main thoroughfares, Boulevard Zerqtouni , is named after him.

targets.targetText: Ya tsallake rijiya da baya ne daga harbin da aka yi masa bayan an kai masa farmaki, amma dakarun kare hakkin Faransa sun kama shi jim kadan bayan haka. Ranar 18 ga Yuni, 1954, yayin da yake kurkuku, ya kashe kansa ta hanyar haɗiye kwamfutar hannu na cyanide. Samun bayanai masu mahimmanci da mahimmanci, Zarqtuni baya son yin kasadar bada duk wani sirri a karkashin azabtarwa wanda zai iya cin amanar kasarsa. Ana yi masa kallon gwarzon kasa a Maroko, kuma a matsayin alamar gwagwarmayar gwagwarmaya. [1] Daya daga cikin manyan titunan Casablanca, Boulevard Zerqtouni, ana kiransa da sunansa.

Ya tsallake rijiya da baya ne daga harbin da aka yi masa bayan an kai masa farmaki, amma dakarun kare hakkin Faransa sun kama shi jim kaɗan bayan haka. Ranar 18 ga watan Yuni, 1954, yayin da yake kurkuku, ya kashe kansa ta hanyar haɗiye kwamfutar hannu na cyanide. Ana yi masa kallon gwarzon ƙasa a Maroko, kuma a matsayin alamar gwagwarmayar gwagwarmaya. [1] Ɗaya daga cikin manyan titunan Casablanca, Boulevard Zerqtouni, ana kiransa da sunansa.

items.sourceText: King Muhammad Idris was overthrown in the 1969 coup led by Captain Muammar Gaddafi.[1] Inspired by Nasser in Egypt, Gaddafi joined his project of regional unity, also called pan-Arabism, aiming at creating a common Arab state.[9] In this project, Gaddafi viewed Islam as an essential pillar, hence approaching ideas of pan-Islamism. Islam worked as a unifying factor of universal relevance.[10] Gaddafi wished to promote an alternative to the communism and capitalist philosophies in the Third International Theory.[11] This theory, developed in The Green Book, was addressing not only the Arab world but the entire globe and promoted direct democracy through the General People's Committee establishing a direct dialogue between the population and the government.[2]

targets.targetText: An hambarar da Sarki Muhammad Idris a juyin mulkin 1969 karkashin jagorancin Kaftin Muammar Gaddafi . [1] Nasser a Masar ya zaburar da shi, Gaddafi ya shiga aikin sa na haɗin kan yanki, wanda ake kira pan-Arabism, da nufin samar da ƙasa ɗaya ta Larabawa. [2] A cikin wannan aikin, Gaddafi ya ɗauki Musulunci a matsayin ginshiƙi mai mahimmanci, don haka yana gabatowa ra'ayoyin addinin Islama . Musulunci ya yi aiki a matsayin wani abu mai haɗe-haɗe da dacewa da duniya baki ɗaya. [3] Gaddafi ya yi fatan inganta wani madadin gurguzu da falsafar jari hujja a ka'idar kasa da kasa ta uku . [4] Wannan ka'idar, wanda aka haɓaka a cikin The Green Book, yana magana ba kawai ƙasashen Larabawa ba amma dukan duniya kuma ya inganta dimokiradiyya kai tsaye ta hanyar Kwamitin Jama'a na kafa tattaunawa kai tsaye tsakanin jama'a da gwamnati. [1]

An hambarar da Sarki Muhammad Idris a juyin mulkin 1969 ƙarƙashin jagorancin Kaftin Muammar Gaddafi. [1] Nasser a Masar ya zaburar da shi, Gaddafi ya shiga aikin sa na haɗin kan yanki, wanda ake kira pan-Arabism, da nufin samar da ƙasa ɗaya ta Larabawa. [2] A cikin wannan aikin, Gaddafi ya ɗauki Musulunci a matsayin ginshiƙi mai mahimmanci, don haka yana gabatowa ra'ayoyin addinin Islama. Musulunci ya yi aiki a matsayin wani abu mai haɗe-haɗe da dacewa da duniya baki ɗaya. [3] Gaddafi ya yi fatan inganta wani madadin gurguzu da falsafar jari hujja a ka'idar ƙasa da ƙasa ta uku. [4] Wannan ka'idar, wanda aka haɓaka a cikin The Green Book, yana magana ba kawai ƙasashen Larabawa ba amma dukan duniya kuma ya inganta dimokuraɗiyya kai tsaye ta hanyar Kwamitin Jama'a na kafa tattaunawa kai tsaye tsakanin jama'a da gwamnati. [1]

items.sourceText: The three principal separatist leaders, MPLA's Agostinho Neto, UNITA's Jonas Savimbi, and the FNLA's Holden Roberto met in Nakuru from June 15–21. Kenyan President Jomo Kenyatta moderated the negotiations. The leaders "denounce[d] the use of force as a means of solving problems" and again agreed to put down their arms and disarm civilians.[2]

targets.targetText: Manyan shugabannin 'yan awaren uku, Agostinho Neto na MPLA, Jonas Savimbi na UNITA, da Holden Roberto na FNLA sun haɗu a Nakuru daga ranakun 15-21 ga watan Yuni. Shugaban Kenya Jomo Kenyatta ne ya jagoranci tattaunawar. Shugabannin sun yi Allah-wadai da yin amfani da karfi a matsayin hanyar magance matsalolin, sannan suka sake amincewa da ajiye makamansu da kuma kwance ɗamarar fararen hula. [1]

Shugaban Kenya Jomo Kenyatta ne ya jagoranci tattaunawar. Shugabannin sun yi Allah-wadai da yin amfani da karfi a matsayin hanyar magance matsalolin, sannan suka sake amincewa da ajiye makamansu da kuma kwance damarar fararen hula. [1]

items.sourceText: FLEC-FAC has continued its struggle for independence both inside and outside Cabinda. In October 2006 FLEC-FAC asked for intervention by the African Union's Commission on Human and Peoples' Rights.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: FLEC-FAC ta ci gaba da gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai a ciki da wajen Cabinda. A cikin watan Oktoba 2006 FLEC-FAC ta nemi Hukumar Tarayyar Afirka kan Hakkokin Ɗan Adam da Jama'a ta sa baki. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: The Revolt of Cairo was a revolt that occurred on 21–22 October 1798 by the citizens of Cairo against the French occupation of Egypt led by Napoleon Bonaparte.[1]

targets.targetText: Tawayen Alkahira tawaye ne da ya faru a ranakun 21–22 ga Oktoban 1798 da al'ummar Alkahira suka yi kan mamayar da Faransa ta yi wa Masar karkashin jagorancin Napoleon Bonaparte . [1]
Tawayen Alkahira tawaye ne da ya faru a ranakun 21–22 ga watan Oktoban 1798 da al'ummar Alkahira suka yi kan mamayar da Faransa ta yi wa Masar ƙarƙashin jagorancin Napoleon Bonaparte. [1]

items.sourceText: Kaggia was a leading member of the KAU Study Circle which assisted its members with drafting memoranda, resolutions and discussions papers. He was the President of the Anti Federation League. This league was set up to oppose the proposed Federation with Central Africa, which would strengthen the white settlers' political control of these territories. The Anti-Federation League succeeded in its objective as Kenya did not join the Federation when in 1953 the Central African Federation of three British colonies: Northern Rhodesia (now Zambia), Southern Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe) and Nyasaland (now Malawi) was founded.[10]

targets.targetText: Kaggia ta kasance ja-gora a cikin da'irar Nazarin KAU wadda ta taimaka wa membobinta da rubuta abubuwan tunawa, kudurori da takaddun tattaunawa. Ya kasance shugaban kungiyar Anti Federation League. An kafa wannan gasa ne don adawa da shirin Tarayyar Afirka da Afirka ta Tsakiya, wanda zai karfafa ikon da fararen hula ke da shi a siyasance na wadannan yankuna. Kungiyar Anti-Federation League ta yi nasara a kan manufarta yayin da Kenya ba ta shiga Tarayyar ba a lokacin da aka kafa Tarayyar Afirka ta Tsakiya mai mulkin mallaka uku a cikin 1953: Arewacin Rhodesia (yanzu Zambia ), Kudancin Rhodesia (yanzu Zimbabwe ) da Nyasaland (yanzu Malawi ). [1]

An kafa wannan gasa ne don adawa da shirin Tarayyar Afirka da Afirka ta Tsakiya, wanda zai karfafa ikon da fararen hula ke da shi a siyasance na waɗannan yankuna. [1]

items.sourceText: Emir Mustapha (1814–1863) organized an attack which took place from 8 May 1837 against the farm of Reghaia, located between Oued Reghaïa [ar] and Oued Hamiz [ar] within the Mitidja plain. The Zwawa confederacy, more specifically the Beni Aïcha, the Issers and the Amraoua tribes looted Reghaïa.[6] Two French colonists were killed by the Zwawa in the agricultural fields, and a considerable amount of cattle was taken from the enclosures and transported to the region of Oued Isser. Nevertheless, the Reghaïa farm was successfully defended by its owners and the local troops against this first attack in the dividing line between Mitidja and Kabylia, as it was next during the second attack in 1839, then under Emir Abdelkader, and Ahmed ben Salem.[7]

targets.targetText: Sarki Mustapha (1814-1863) ya shirya wani hari da aka kai tun ranar 8 ga watan Mayu 1837 a gonar Reghaia, dake tsakanin Oued Reghaïa [ ar ] da Oued Hamiz [ ar ] a cikin filin Mitidja. Ƙungiyoyin Zwawa, musamman Beni Aïcha, Issers da kuma ƙabilar Amraoua sun wawashe Reghaïa. [1] Wasu ‘yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa guda biyu ne Zwawa suka kashe a cikin gonakin noma, kuma an kwashe shanu masu yawa daga wuraren da aka yi garkuwa da su zuwa yankin Oued Isser. Duk da haka, an samu nasarar kare gonar Reghaïa daga masu mallakarta da kuma sojojin gida daga wannan hari na farko a cikin layin da aka raba tsakanin Mitidja da Kabylia, kamar yadda ya kasance na gaba a lokacin harin na biyu a shekarar 1839, sannan a karkashin Sarki Abdelkader, da Ahmed ben Salem. [2]

items.sourceText: Rwigema was born in Gitarama, in southern Rwanda. Considered a Tutsi, in 1960 he and his family fled to Uganda and settled in a refugee camp in Nshungerezi, Ankole following the Rwandan Revolution of 1959 and the ouster of King Kigeli V.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Rwigema a Gitarama, a kudancin Ruwanda. An yi la'akari da shi a matsayin Tutsi, a cikin shekarar 1960 shi da iyalinsa suka gudu zuwa Uganda kuma suka zauna a sansanin 'yan gudun hijira a Nshungerezi, Ankole bayan juyin juya halin Ruwanda na shekarar 1959 da kuma hambarar da Sarki Kigeli V. [1]

An haifi Rwigema a Gitarama, a kudancin Ruwanda. An yi la'akari da shi a matsayin Tutsi, a cikin 1960 shi da iyalinsa suka gudu zuwa Uganda kuma suka zauna a sansanin 'yan gudun hijira a Nshungerezi, Ankole bayan juyin juya halin Ruwanda na 1959 da kuma hambarar da Sarki Kigeli V . [1]

items.sourceText: After finishing high school in 1976, he went to Tanzania and joined the Front for National Salvation (FRONASA), a rebel group headed by Yoweri Museveni, the brother of his friend Salim Saleh. It was at this point that he began calling himself Fred Rwigema. Later that year, he traveled to Mozambique and joined the FRELIMO rebels who were fighting for the liberation of Mozambique from Portugal's colonial rule.

targets.targetText: Bayan kammala makarantar sakandare a shekarar 1976, ya tafi Tanzaniya kuma ya shiga cikin Front for National Ceto (FRONASA), ƙungiyar tawaye ƙarƙashin jagorancin Yoweri Museveni, ɗan'uwan abokinsa Salim Saleh. A wannan lokacin ne ya fara kiran kansa Fred Rwigema. A wannan shekarar, ya yi tafiya zuwa Mozambique kuma ya shiga cikin 'yan tawayen FRELIMO da ke fafutukar kwato Mozambik daga hannun turawan mulkin mallaka na Portugal.

Bayan kammala makarantar sakandare a 1976, ya tafi Tanzaniya kuma ya shiga cikin Front for National Ceto (FRONASA), ƙungiyar tawaye karkashin jagorancin Yoweri Museveni, ɗan'uwan abokinsa Salim Saleh . A wannan lokacin ne ya fara kiran kansa Fred Rwigema. A wannan shekarar, ya yi tafiya zuwa Mozambique kuma ya shiga cikin 'yan tawayen FRELIMO da ke fafutukar kwato Mozambik daga hannun turawan mulkin mallaka na Portugal.

items.sourceText: Among the proponents of this myth was the French officer Baron Aucapitaine [fr], who claimed: "In one hundred years, the Kabyles will be French!"[1] Camille Sabatier [fr], a colonist theorist of "Berber separatism" and racist, claimed that the qanuns (customary laws) of the Kabyles came from someone who was "not of the family of Mohamed and Moses but of that of Montesquieu and Condorcet."[4]

targets.targetText: Daga cikin masu wannan tatsuniyar akwai Baron Aucapitaine jami'in Faransa, wanda ya yi iƙirarin: "A cikin shekaru ɗari, Kabyles za su zama Faransanci!" [1] Camille Sabatier [ fr ], mai ra'ayin mulkin mallaka na "Berber Separatism" da wariyar launin fata, ya yi iƙirarin cewa qanuns (dokokin al'ada) na Kabyles sun fito ne daga wani wanda ba "ba na dangin Mohamed da Musa ba amma na Montesquieu da Condorcet ." [1]

[1]

items.sourceText: After 12 days of siege,[n. 1] General Navarro was allowed to negotiate surrender terms.[4] He agreed on 9 August on the delivering of the weapons in exchange for free passage.[4] However, the Riffians failed to honor the agreement (either from treason from the Riffian leaders who had negotiated the terms or revolt by the disgruntled low-rank Riffians)[5] and most of the remaining Spanish soldiers (over 2,000)[6] were slaughtered on that day after the capitulation.[4] About 400 (or 600),[7] mostly officers—including General Navarro—were spared to be held for ransom.[4]

targets.targetText: Bayan kwanaki 12 na kewaye, [ n. 1 ] An ba Janar Navarro damar yin shawarwari kan sharuɗɗan mika wuya. [ 4 ] Ya amince a ranar 9 ga watan Agusta game da isar da makaman a madadin wucewa kyauta. [ 4 ] Duk da haka, Riffian sun kasa girmama yarjejeniyar (ko dai daga cin amana daga shugabannin Riffian waɗanda suka yi shawarwari da sharuɗɗan ko tayar da hankali ta hanyar rashin jin daɗi da ƙananan Riffian) [ 5 ] da kuma yawancin sauran sojojin Spain (sama da 2,000) [ 6 ] an kashe su a wannan rana bayan da aka kama wasu. [ 4 ] Kimanin 400 (ko 600), [ 7 ] galibin jami'ai - ciki har da Janar Navarro - an kare su don a tsare su don neman fansa. [ 4 ]

[ 4 ] Kimanin 400 (ko 600), [ 7 ] galibin jami'ai - ciki har da Janar Navarro - an kare su don a tsare su don neman fansa . [ 4 ]

items.sourceText: Simultaneously he was the coordinator for labour studies at the Ubuntu Social Development Institute from 1988 to 1994.[1] He also completed a Bachelor of Science from the University of South Africa and a Master of Business Administration from De Montfort University.[7]

targets.targetText: A lokaci guda ya kasance mai kula da karatun aiki a Cibiyar Ci gaban Jama'a ta Ubuntu daga 1988 zuwa 1994. [1] Har ila yau, ya kammala karatun digiri na farko na Kimiyya daga Jami'ar Afirka ta Kudu da kuma Jagoran Harkokin Kasuwanci daga Jami'ar De Montfort . [2]

items.sourceText: The Ambazonia Defence Forces (ADF) are a military organization that fights for the independence of Ambazonia, a self-declared independent state in the Anglophone regions of the former Southern Cameroons, Cameroon. It was formally established by the Ambazonia Governing Council (AGovC) on 9 September 2017, the same day as the organization declared a war of independence.[7]

targets.targetText: Ambazonia Defence Forces (ADF) ƙungiya ce ta soji da ke fafutukar kwato 'yancin kai na Ambazonia, ƙasa mai cin gashin kanta a yankunan Anglophone na tsohuwar Kudancin Kamaru, Kamaru. Majalisar gudanarwar Ambazonia (AGovC) ce ta kafa ta a ranar 9 ga Satumba 2017, a daidai wannan rana da kungiyar ta ayyana yakin neman yancin kai. [1]

Ambazonia Defence Forces (ADF) kungiya ce ta soji da ke fafutukar kwato 'yancin kai Ambazonia, kasa mai cin gashin kanta a yankunan Anglophone na tsohuwar Kudancin Kamaru, Kamaru . Majalisar gudanarwar Ambazonia (AGovC) ce ta kafa ta a ranar 9 ga Satumba 2017, a daidai wannan rana da kungiyar ta ayyana yakin neman yancin kai. [1]

items.sourceText: In July 2023, Cho Lucas declared that henceforth, whenever Cameroonian forces killed Anglophone civilians, the ADF would kill Francophone civilians. The AGovC leader added that "when Cameroon begins to respect the Geneva Convention, we will do the same".[27]

targets.targetText: A cikin Yuli 2023, Cho Lucas ya bayyana cewa daga yanzu, a duk lokacin da sojojin Kamaru suka kashe farar hular Anglophone, ADF za ta kashe farar hula na Faransa. Shugaban AGovC ya kara da cewa "lokacin da Kamaru ta fara mutunta yarjejeniyar Geneva, za mu yi hakan". [1]

A cikin watan Yuli 2023, Cho Lucas ya bayyana cewa daga yanzu, a duk lokacin da sojojin Kamaru suka kashe farar hular Anglophone, ADF za ta kashe farar hula na Faransa. Shugaban AGovC ya ƙara da cewa "lokacin da Kamaru ta fara mutunta yarjejeniyar Geneva, za mu yi hakan". [1]

items.sourceText: It is adjacent to the Prince and Princess Estate and is in proximity to the Kaura Market,[1] in southern Abuja.[2]
