Yana kusa da Gidan Yarima da Gimbiya kuma yana kusa da Kasuwar Kaura, [ 1 ] a kudancin Abuja. [ 2 ]

items.sourceText: It opened in 1998 in a campus at Life Camp BNL; its current Prince and Princess Estate campus opened in April 2010. Construction began on the current campus in September 2009.[1]

targets.targetText: An buɗe shi a cikin 1998 a cikin harabar a Life Camp BNL; Harabar makarantar ta Prince and Princess Estate ta buɗe a cikin Afrilu 2010. An fara ginin harabar makarantar a watan Satumbar 2009. [ 1 ]
An buɗe makarantar a shekarar 1998 a cikin a Life Camp BNL; Harabar makarantar ta Prince and Princess Estate ta buɗe a cikin Afrilu 2010. An fara ginin harabar makarantar a watan Satumbar 2009. [ 1 ]

items.sourceText: Aapravasi Ghat (“The Immigration Depot”) is a building complex located in Port Louis, Mauritius, the first British colony to receive indentured, or contracted, labour workforce from many countries.[1] From 1849 to 1923, half a million Indian indentured labourers passed through the Immigration Depot, to be transported to plantations throughout the British Empire. The large-scale migration of the labourers left an indelible mark on the societies of many former British colonies, with Indians constituting a substantial proportion of their national populations.[2] In Mauritius alone, 68 percent of the current total population is of Indian ancestry. The Immigration Depot has thus become an important reference point in the history and cultural identity of Mauritius.[3][4]

targets.targetText: Aapravasi Ghat ("Ma'ajiyar Shige da Fice") wani katafaren gini ne da ke Port Louis, Mauritius, mulkin mallaka na farko na Birtaniyya don karɓar ma'aikata, ko kwangila, daga ƙasashe da yawa. [1] Daga 1849 zuwa 1923, ma'aikatan Indiya rabin miliyan sun wuce ta wurin ajiyar shige da fice, don jigilar su zuwa gonaki a cikin daular Burtaniya . Babban ƙaura na ma'aikatan ya bar alamar da ba za a taɓa mantawa da ita ba a cikin al'ummomin tsoffin ƙasashen Biritaniya, tare da Indiyawan da ke zama wani kaso mai tsoka na al'ummar ƙasarsu . [2] A Mauritius kadai, kashi 68 cikin 100 na yawan jama'a na yanzu sun fito ne daga zuriyar Indiya . Ta haka ma'ajiyar shige da fice ta zama muhimmin batu a cikin tarihi da al'adun Mauritius. [3] [4]

Aapravasi Ghat ("Ma'ajiyar Shige da Fice") wani katafaren gini ne da ke Port Louis, Mauritius, na 'yan mulkin mallaka na farko na Birtaniyya don karɓar ma'aikata, ko kwangila, daga ƙasashe da yawa. [1] Daga shekarun 1849 zuwa 1923, ma'aikatan Indiya rabin miliyan sun wuce ta wurin ajiyar shige da fice, don jigilar su zuwa gonaki a cikin daular Burtaniya. Babban ƙaura na ma'aikatan ya bar alamar da ba za a taɓa mantawa da ita ba a cikin al'ummomin tsoffin ƙasashen Biritaniya, tare da Indiyawan da ke zama wani kaso mai tsoka na al'ummar ƙasarsu. [2] A Mauritius kaɗai, kashi 68 cikin 100 na yawan jama'a na yanzu sun fito ne daga zuriyar Indiya. Ta haka ma'ajiyar shige da fice ta zama muhimmin batu a cikin tarihi da al'adun Mauritius. [3] [4]

items.sourceText: The town is divided by the Ébrié Lagoon into two-halves: Ancien Bassam is the former French settlement, facing the Gulf of Guinea. It is home to the grander colonial buildings, some of which have been restored. The district is also home to a cathedral and the Ivory Coast National Museum of Costume, located in the former Governor's Palace.[1] Nouveau Bassam, linked to Ancient Bassam by a bridge, lies on the inland, northern side of the lagoon. It grew from the African servants' quarters and is now the main commercial centre of the town.

targets.targetText: Yankin Ebrié Lagoon ya raba garin zuwa kashi biyu: Ancien Bassam shine tsohon mazaunin Faransa, yana fuskantar Gulf of Guinea . Gida ne ga manyan gine-ginen mulkin mallaka, wasu daga cikinsu an maido da su. Gundumar kuma tana da wani babban coci da kuma gidan tarihi na Costume na Ivory Coast, dake cikin fadar tsohon gwamnan. [1] Nouveau Bassam, wanda aka haɗa da Bassam na Ancient ta hanyar gada, ya ta'allaka ne a kan ƙasa, arewacin gefen tafkin. Ya girma daga rukunin ma'aikatan Afirka kuma yanzu shine babbar cibiyar kasuwanci ta garin.

Yankin Ebrié Lagoon ya raba garin zuwa kashi biyu: Ancien Bassam shine tsohon mazaunin Faransa, yana fuskantar Gulf of Guinea. Gida ne ga manyan gine-ginen 'yan mulkin mallaka, wasu daga cikinsu an maido da su. Gundumar kuma tana da wani babban coci da kuma gidan tarihi na Costume na Ivory Coast, dake cikin fadar tsohon gwamnan. [1] Nouveau Bassam, wanda aka haɗa da Bassam na Ancient ta hanyar gada, ya ta'allaka ne a kan ƙasa, arewacin gefen tafkin. Ya girma daga ruƙunin ma'aikatan Afirka kuma yanzu shine babbar cibiyar kasuwanci ta garin.

items.sourceText: A barracoon (an adaptation of Portuguese barracão, an augmentative form of the Catalan loanword barraca ('hut') through Spanish barracón[1]) is a type of barracks used historically for the internment of enslaved or criminal human beings.

targets.targetText: Barracoon (daidaitaccen Barracão na Portuguese, wani nau'i mai haɓakawa na kalmar lamuni ta Catalan barraca ('buka') ta hanyar Barracón na Mutanen Espanya [1] ) wani nau'in bariki ne da aka yi amfani da shi a tarihi don shigar da bayi ko mutane masu laifi .

Barracoon (daidaitaccen Barracão na Portuguese, wani nau'i mai haɓakawa na kalmar lamuni ta Catalan barraca ('bukka') ta hanyar Barracón na Spaniya [1] ) wani nau'in bariki ne da aka yi amfani da shi a tarihi don shigar da bayi ko mutane masu laifi.

items.sourceText: José Mendes de Carvalho (c. 1941 – April 14, 1968), known by his nom de guerre Hoji-ya-Henda, was a guerrilla fighter of the People's Armed Forces for the Liberation of Angola (FAPLA). Now remembered as a folk hero in Angola, he was killed during the Portuguese Colonial War.

targets.targetText: José Mendes de Carvalho (c. 1941 - Afrilu 14, 1968), wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Hoji-ya-Henda, ya kasance mayaki ne na rundunar sojojin da ke fafutukar 'yantar da Angola (FAPLA). Yanzu an tuna da shi a matsayin gwarzon jama'a a Angola, an kashe shi a lokacin Yaƙin Turawan Mulkin Mallaka na Portugal.

José Mendes de Carvalho (c. 1941 - Afrilu 14, 1968), wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Hoji-ya-Henda, ya kasance mayaka ne na rundunar sojojin da ke fafutukar 'yantar da Angola (FAPLA). Yanzu an tuna da shi a matsayin gwarzon jama'a a Angola, an kashe shi a lokacin Yaƙin Turawan Mulkin Portugal .

items.sourceText: Kukoi Samba Sanyang (1952 – 18 June 2013) was a Gambian politician and leader of the unsuccessful 1981 coup d'état against the government of Dawda Jawara.

targets.targetText: Kukoi Samba Sanyang (1952 - 18 Yuni 2013) ɗan siyasan Gambia ne kuma jagoran juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba a 1981 akan gwamnatin Dawda Jawara .
Kukoi Samba Sanyang (1952 - 18 Yuni 2013) ɗan siyasan Gambia ne kuma jagoran juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba a shekarar 1981 akan gwamnatin Dawda Jawara.

items.sourceText: Musiliu Akinsanya (born 14 March 1975) popularly known as MC Oluomo was the head of the Lagos state branch of the National Union of Road Transport Workers.[1][2] He is regarded as Lagos state's richest and most illustrious thug agbero.[3][4][5]

targets.targetText: Musiliu Akinsanya (an haife shi a ranar 14 ga watan Maris na shekara ta 1975) wanda aka fi sani da MC Oluomo shi ne shugaban reshen jihar Legas na Ƙungiyar Ma'aikatan Sufuri ta Kasa . [1][2] An ɗauke shi a matsayin mai arziki kuma mafi mashahurin ƴan fashi na jihar Legas .[3][4][5]

Musiliu Akinsanya (an haife shi a ranar 14 ga watan Maris na shekara ta 1975) wanda aka fi sani da MC Oluomo shi ne shugaban reshen jihar Legas na Ƙungiyar Ma'aikatan Sufuri ta Kasa . [1][2] An dauke shi a matsayin mai arziki kuma mafi mashahuriyar 'yan fashi na jihar Legas .[3][4][5]

items.sourceText: Nkunda was born in Muidumbe district, Cabo Delgado province, in 1952. She joined FRELIMO in 1964 and subsequently became part of the Women's Detachment, the organ of FRELIMO's armed forces providing education and military training to women. In July 1968, she participated in FRELIMO's second party congress, held in Matchedje, Niassa.[1] In 1974, Nkunda helped begin military campaigns in Zambezia and headed a group of guerrillas that trained the first women soldiers in Milange district.[2]

targets.targetText: An haifi Nkunda a gundumar Muidumbe, lardin Cabo Delgado, a shekara ta 1952. Ta shiga FRELIMO a cikin shekarar 1964 kuma daga baya ta zama wani ɓangare na Ƙungiyar Mata, ƙungiyar sojojin FRELIMO da ke ba da ilimi da horar da sojoji ga mata. A cikin watan Yuli 1968, ta halarci taron jam'iyyar FRELIMO na biyu, wanda aka gudanar a Matchedje, Niassa. [1] A cikin shekarar 1974, Nkunda ta taimaka wajen fara yaƙin neman zaɓe a Zambezia kuma ta jagoranci ƙungiyar ƴan daba da suka horar da mata na farko sojoji a gundumar Milange. [2]

An haifi Nkunda a gundumar Muidumbe, lardin Cabo Delgado, a shekara ta 1952. Ta shiga FRELIMO a cikin 1964 kuma daga baya ta zama wani ɓangare na Ƙungiyar Mata, ƙungiyar sojojin FRELIMO da ke ba da ilimi da horar da sojoji ga mata. A cikin Yuli 1968, ta halarci taron jam'iyyar FRELIMO na biyu, wanda aka gudanar a Matchedje, Niassa . [1] A cikin 1974, Nkunda ya taimaka wajen fara yaƙin neman zaɓe a Zambezia kuma ya jagoranci ƙungiyar ƴan daba da suka horar da mata na farko sojoji a gundumar Milange . [2]

items.sourceText: Hendrik Witbooi (c.1830 – 29 October 1905)[1] was a chief of the ǀKhowesin people, a sub-tribe of the Khoekhoe. He led the Nama people during their revolts against the German colonial empire in present-day Namibia, in connection with the events surrounding the Herero and Nama genocide. He was killed in action on 29 October 1905. Witbooi is regarded as one of the national heroes of Namibia, and his face is portrayed on the obverse of all N$50, N$100, and N$200 Namibian dollar banknotes.

targets.targetText: Hendrik Witbooi (c.1830 - 29 Oktoba 1905) [1] ya kasance shugaban mutanen ǀKhowesin, ƙabilar Khoekhoe . Ya jagoranci al'ummar Nama a lokacin da suka yi tawaye ga daular mulkin mallaka na Jamus a Namibiya a yau, dangane da abubuwan da suka faru dangane da kisan kare dangi na Herero da Nama . An kashe shi a ranar 29 ga Oktoba 1905. Ana kallon Witbooi a matsayin daya daga cikin jaruman kasar Namibiya, kuma an kwatanta fuskarsa a kan duk wasu takardun kudi na N$50, N$100, da N$200 na Dalar Namibiya .

Hendrik Witbooi (c.1830 - 29 Oktoba 1905) [1] ya kasance shugaban mutanen ǀKhowesin, ƙabilar Khoekhoe. Ya jagoranci al'ummar Nama a lokacin da suka yi tawaye ga daular mulkin mallaka na Jamus a Namibiya a yau, dangane da abubuwan da suka faru dangane da kisan kare dangi na Herero da Nama. An kashe shi a ranar 29 ga watan Oktoba 1905. Ana kallon Witbooi a matsayin ɗaya daga cikin jaruman ƙasar Namibiya, kuma an kwatanta fuskarsa a kan duk wasu takardun kuɗi na N$50, N$100, da N$200 na Dalar Namibiya.

items.sourceText: Together with Hosea Kutako, Samuel Witbooi was involved in the drafting of a petition to the United Nations in 1947 to put Namibia under British trusteeship. The petition was signed at the occasion of the 1947 Herero Day gathering and subsequently presented to the UN by Reverend Michael Scott, because neither Kutako nor Witbooi were allowed to leave South-West African territory.[2] In 1956, Witbooi addressed the UN again, "on behalf of the non-European inhabitants of SWA".[3] The results were that the UN rejected a request to divide South-West Africa and allocate its southern parts permanently to South Africa.[3] They also extended their own mandate on South-West Africa for one more year.

targets.targetText: Tare da Hosea Kutako, Samuel Witbooi ya shiga cikin rubuta takardar koke ga Majalisar Dinkin Duniya a 1947 don sanya Namibiya karkashin jagorancin Birtaniya. An rattaba hannu kan takardar koken a lokacin taron ranar Herero na 1947 sannan Reverend Michael Scott ya gabatar da shi ga Majalisar Dinkin Duniya, saboda ba a bar Kutako ko Witbooi su bar yankin Kudu-maso-Yammacin Afirka ba. [1] A cikin 1956, Witbooi ya sake yin jawabi ga Majalisar Dinkin Duniya, "a madadin mutanen da ba na Turai ba na SWA". [2] Sakamakon ya kasance cewa Majalisar Dinkin Duniya ta yi watsi da bukatar raba Afirka ta Kudu-maso-Yamma tare da ware sassan kudancinta na dindindin ga Afirka ta Kudu . [3] Sun kuma kara wa'adin nasu kan Kudu-maso-Yammacin Afirka na karin shekara guda.

Tare da Hosea Kutako, Samuel Witbooi ya shiga cikin rubuta takardar koke ga Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya a shekarar 1947 don sanya Namibiya ƙarƙashin jagorancin Birtaniya. An rattaba hannu kan takardar koken a lokacin taron ranar Herero na shekarar 1947 sannan Reverend Michael Scott ya gabatar da shi ga Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, saboda ba a bar Kutako ko Witbooi su bar yankin Kudu-maso-Yammacin Afirka ba. [1] A cikin shekarar 1956, Witbooi ya sake yin jawabi ga Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, "a madadin mutanen da ba na Turai ba na SWA". [2] Sakamakon ya kasance cewa Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya ta yi watsi da buƙatar raba Afirka ta Kudu-maso-Yamma tare da ware sassan kudancinta na dindindin ga Afirka ta Kudu. [3] Sun kuma ƙara wa'adin nasu kan Kudu-maso-Yammacin Afirka na karin shekara guda.

items.sourceText: Her parents were Georgina Garson and Stephen Bonny Mpama, a government interpreter.[1] She described herself as coloured; her father was Zulu, though his family had left their community and converted to Christianity, and her mother was Mfengu, Afrikaner, and moSotho.[2][3][4]

targets.targetText: Iyayenta sune Georgina Garson da Stephen Bonny Mpama, mai fassara na gwamnati. [1] Ta bayyana kanta a matsayin mai kala; mahaifinta shi ɗan ƙabilar Zulu ne, ko da yake danginsa sun bar al'ummarsu sun koma Kiristanci, kuma mahaifiyarta ita ce Mfengu, Afrikaner, da moSotho. [2] [3] [4]

Iyayenta sune Georgina Garson da Stephen Bonny Mpama, mai fassara na gwamnati. [1] Ta bayyana kanta a matsayin mai kala ; mahaifinta shi ne Zulu, ko da yake danginsa sun bar al'ummarsu sun koma Kiristanci, kuma mahaifiyarta ita ce Mfengu, Afrikaner, da moSotho . [2] [3] [4]

items.sourceText: In 1935, she traveled to Moscow to attend the Seventh World Congress of the Communist International and study at the Communist University of the Toilers of the East.[9][10]

targets.targetText: A 1935, ta yi tafiya zuwa Moscow don halartar taron duniya na bakwai na kwaminisanci na kasa da kasa da kuma karatu a Jami'ar Kwaminisanci na Toilers na Gabas . [1] [2]
A shekarar 1935, ta yi tafiya zuwa Moscow don halartar taron duniya na bakwai na kwaminisanci na ƙasa da ƙasa da kuma karatu a Jami'ar Kwaminisanci na Toilers na Gabas. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: With Mofutsanyana, she had another daughter, Hilda, in 1928.[11] She later had a son, Dennis, possibly the product of an affair with Moses Kotane.[2]

targets.targetText: Tare da Mofutsanyana, ta haifi wata ɗiya, Hilda, a cikin shekarar 1928. [1] Daga baya ta haifi ɗa, Dennis, watakila samfurin wani al'amari tare da Musa Kotane. [2]
Tare da Mofutsanyana, ta haifi wata diya, Hilda, a cikin 1928. [1] Daga baya ta haifi ɗa, Dennis, watakila samfurin wani al'amari tare da Musa Kotane . [2]

items.sourceText: Declaring that his life was in danger from political enemies, Sithole went into self-imposed exile first in the United Kingdom in the early-1980s and then in Silver Spring, Maryland, United States, around 1984, returning to Zimbabwe in January 1992.[6]

targets.targetText: Da yake bayyana cewa rayuwarsa na cikin hatsari daga abokan gaba na siyasa, Sithole ya tafi gudun hijira na kansa da farko a Burtaniya a farkon shekarun 1980 sannan a Silver Spring, Maryland, Amurka, a kusa da shekarar 1984, ya koma Zimbabwe a cikin watan Janairu 1992. [1]

Da yake bayyana cewa rayuwarsa na cikin hatsari daga abokan gaba na siyasa, Sithole ya tafi gudun hijira na kansa da farko a Burtaniya a farkon shekarun 1980 sannan a Silver Spring, Maryland, Amurka, a kusa da 1984, ya koma Zimbabwe a cikin Janairu 1992. [1]

items.sourceText: Zvobgo was among the first group of Zanu-PF cadres to return to Zimbabwe in December 1979 after the Lancaster House Conference.[1] She was part of election directorate and helped open the party's head office at 88 Manica Road (now Robert Mugabe Road).[2] She was imprisoned for two weeks during the 1980 election campaign for allegedly assisting Zanla forces in the Zvishavane area and was only released after the polls.[3] Julia was elected MP for the Midlands constituency of Zvishavane at the historic 1980 elections and was subsequently elected secretary for publicity and information in the Women's League in 1984.[2]

targets.targetText: Zvobgo yana cikin rukuni na farko na 'yan jam'iyyar Zanu-PF da suka koma Zimbabwe a watan Disambar 1979 bayan taron majalisar Lancaster . [1] Ta kasance cikin daraktan zabe kuma ta taimaka wajen bude babban ofishin jam’iyyar a titin 88 Manica Road (yanzu Robert Mugabe Road). [2] An daure ta na tsawon makonni biyu a lokacin yakin neman zabe na 1980 bisa zarginta da taimakawa sojojin Zanla a yankin Zvishavane kuma an sake ta ne kawai bayan zaben. [1] An zabi Julia MP don mazabar Midlands na Zvishavane a zaben 1980 mai tarihi kuma an zabe shi sakatariyar yada labarai da bayanai a cikin kungiyar mata a 1984. [2]

Zvobgo tana cikin ruƙuni na farko na 'yan jam'iyyar Zanu-PF da suka koma Zimbabwe a watan Disambar 1979 bayan taron majalisar Lancaster. [1] Ta kasance cikin daraktan zaɓe kuma ta taimaka wajen buɗe babban ofishin jam’iyyar a titin 88 Manica Road (yanzu Robert Mugabe Road). [2] An ɗaure ta na tsawon makonni biyu a lokacin yakin neman zabe na shekarar 1980 bisa zarginta da taimakawa sojojin Zanla a yankin Zvishavane kuma an sake ta ne kawai bayan zaɓen. [1] An zabi Julia MP a mazaɓar Midlands na Zvishavane a zaɓen 1980 mai tarihi kuma an zaɓe ta sakatariyar yaɗa labarai da bayanai a cikin kungiyar mata a shekarar 1984. [2]

items.sourceText: The Zaian (or Zayan) War was fought between France and the Zaian Confederation of Berber tribes in Morocco between 1914 and 1921 during the French conquest of Morocco. Morocco had become a French protectorate in 1912, and Resident-General Louis-Hubert Lyautey sought to extend French influence eastwards through the Middle Atlas mountains towards French Algeria. This was opposed by the Zaians, led by Mouha ou Hammou Zayani. The war began well for the French, who quickly took the key towns of Taza and Khénifra. Despite the loss of their base at Khénifra, the Zaians inflicted heavy losses on the French, who responded by establishing groupes mobiles, combined arms formations that mixed regular and irregular infantry, cavalry and artillery into a single force.

targets.targetText: Yakin Zaian (ko Zayan ) an yi shi ne tsakanin Faransa da Gamayyar kabilun Berber na Zaian a Maroko tsakanin 1914 zuwa 1921 lokacin da Faransa ta mamaye Maroko . Kasar Maroko ta zama kasar Faransa a shekarar 1912, kuma shugaban kasar Louis-Hubert Lyautey ya nemi fadada tasirin Faransa zuwa gabas ta tsaunukan Atlas na tsakiya zuwa kasar Aljeriya . Wannan ya samu adawa da Zaiyan, karkashin jagorancin Mouha ou Hammou Zayani . Yaƙin ya fara da kyau ga Faransawa, waɗanda suka ɗauki manyan garuruwan Taza da Khénifra da sauri. Duk da asarar tushen su a Khénifra, Zaians sun yi hasara mai yawa a kan Faransanci, wanda ya amsa ta hanyar kafa ƙungiyoyin wayar hannu, haɗa nau'o'in makaman da suka haɗu da na yau da kullum da na yau da kullum, mayaƙan doki da bindigogi a cikin karfi guda.

Yakin Zaian (ko Zayan ) an yi shi ne tsakanin Faransa da Gamayyar ƙabilun Berber na Zaian a Maroko tsakanin shekarun 1914 zuwa 1921 lokacin da Faransa ta mamaye Maroko. Ƙasar Maroko ta zama ƙasar Faransa a shekarar 1912, kuma shugaban ƙasar Louis-Hubert Lyautey ya nemi faɗaɗa tasirin Faransa zuwa gabas ta tsaunukan Atlas na tsakiya zuwa ƙasar Aljeriya. Wannan ya samu adawa da Zaiyan, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Mouha ou Hammou Zayani. Yaƙin ya fara da kyau ga Faransawa, waɗanda suka ɗauki manyan garuruwan Taza da Khénifra da sauri. Duk da asarar tushen su a Khénifra, Zaians sun yi hasara mai yawa a kan Faransa, wanda ya amsa ta hanyar kafa ƙungiyoyin wayar hannu, haɗa nau'o'in makaman da suka haɗu da na yau da kullum da na yau da kullum, mayaƙan doki da bindigogi a cikin karfi guda.

items.sourceText: In the 1820s the Basuto faced a number of cattle raids from the Koranna, a group of Khoekhoe people who had migrated from the Cape following the European settlement of the region.[5] It was during this time that they first encountered horses and guns in a combat setting. After a number of initial setbacks, the Basuto managed to either capture or acquire horses and guns of their own, and began stockpiling gunpowder. By 1843, Moshoeshoe had accumulated more horses and guns than any other chieftain in South Africa. Nevertheless, most of the guns in Basuto possession were outdated flintlocks, which had flooded the South African market after the introduction of percussion lock muskets.[6]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1820s Basuto sun fuskanci hare-haren shanu da dama daga Kur'ani, gungun mutanen Khoekhoe da suka yi hijira daga Cape bayan mazaunan Turai na yankin. [ 5 ] A wannan lokacin ne suka fara cin karo da dawakai da bindigu a fagen fama. Bayan da aka samu koma baya na farko, Basuto ya yi nasarar kamawa ko kuma ya samu dawakai da bindigogin nasu, suka fara tara foda. A shekara ta 1843, Moshoeshoe ya tara dawakai da bindigogi fiye da kowane jigo a Afirka ta Kudu. Duk da haka, akasarin bindigogin da ke hannun Basuto sun kasance tsofaffin ƙulle-ƙulle, waɗanda suka mamaye kasuwannin Afirka ta Kudu bayan da aka fara amfani da su na kulle-kulle . [ 6 ]

A cikin shekarar 1820s Basuto sun fuskanci hare-haren shanu da dama daga Kur'ani, gungun mutanen Khoekhoe da suka yi hijira daga Cape bayan mazaunan Turai na yankin. [ 5 ] A wannan lokacin ne suka fara cin karo da dawakai da bindigu a fagen fama. Bayan da aka samu koma baya na farko, Basuto ya yi nasarar kamawa ko kuma ya samu dawakai da bindigogin nasu, suka fara tara foda. A shekara ta 1843, Moshoeshoe ya tara dawakai da bindigogi fiye da kowane jigo a Afirka ta Kudu. Duk da haka, akasarin bindigogin da ke hannun Basuto sun kasance tsofaffin ƙulle-ƙulle, waɗanda suka mamaye kasuwannin Afirka ta Kudu bayan da aka fara amfani da su na kulle-kulle. [ 6 ]

items.sourceText: The Battle of Mufilo (Portuguese: Combate de Mufilo) took place on 27 August 1907, in the southwest of Portuguese Angola, during the Ovambo resistance to Portuguese colonization.

targets.targetText: Yaƙin Mufilo ( Portuguese ) ya faru ne a ranar 27 ga watan Agustan shekarar 1907, a kudu maso yammacin kasar Portuguese Angola, a lokacin da Ovambo ya yi adawa da mulkin mallaka na Portugal.

Yaƙin Mufilo (Portuguese; Combate de Mufilo) ya faru ne a ranar 27 ga watan Agustan shekarar 1907, a kudu maso yammacin ƙasar Portuguese Angola, a lokacin da Ovambo ya yi adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Portugal.

items.sourceText: At the close of the 19th century, European powers were busy conquering and colonising much of Africa. In what is today Benin, the main colonial power was the Third French Republic. The French had established commercial ties with the indigenous peoples of the area including one of West Africa's most powerful states at the time, the Fon kingdom of Dahomey. In 1851, a Franco-Dahomean friendship treaty was ratified allowing the French to operate commercially and missionaries to enter the country.[1]

targets.targetText: A ƙarshen ƙarni na 19, ƙasashen Turai sun shagaltu da mamaye da mamaye yawancin Afirka . A halin da ake ciki a yau Benin, babbar mulkin mallaka ita ce Jamhuriyar Faransa ta Uku . Faransawa sun kulla huldar kasuwanci da ’yan asalin yankin da suka hada da daya daga cikin kasashen yammacin Afirka mafi karfi a lokacin, masarautar Fon ta Dahomey . A cikin 1851, an ƙulla yarjejeniya ta abokantaka ta Franco-Dahomean da ke ba Faransa damar yin kasuwanci da kuma mishan shiga cikin ƙasar. [1]

A ƙarshen ƙarni na 19, ƙasashen Turai sun shagaltu da mamaye da mamaye yawancin Afirka. A halin da ake ciki a yau Benin, babbar 'yar mulkin mallaka ita ce Jamhuriyar Faransa ta Uku. Faransawa sun kulla hulɗar kasuwanci da ’yan asalin yankin da suka haɗa da ɗaya daga cikin ƙasashen yammacin Afirka mafi karfi a lokacin, masarautar Fon ta Dahomey. A cikin shekarar 1851, an ƙulla yarjejeniya ta abokantaka ta Franco-Dahomean da ke ba wa Faransa damar yin kasuwanci da kuma mishan shiga cikin ƙasar. [1]

items.sourceText: Akufo-Addo was called to the Middle Temple Bar, London, UK, in 1940[1] and returned to what was then the Gold Coast to start a private legal practice a year later in Accra.[2]

targets.targetText: An kira Akufo-Addo zuwa Cibiyar Haikali ta Tsakiya, London, UK, a cikin shekarar 1940 [1] kuma ya koma abin da yake a lokacin Gold Coast don fara aikin shari'a na sirri bayan shekara guda a Accra. [2]
An kira Akufo-Addo zuwa Cibiyar Haikali ta Tsakiya, London, UK, a cikin 1940 [1] kuma ya koma abin da yake a lokacin Gold Coast don fara aikin shari'a na sirri bayan shekara guda a Accra . [2]

items.sourceText: William Ofori Atta (10 October 1910 – 14 July 1988), popularly called "Paa Willie", was a Ghanaian founding member of the United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) and one of the founding fathers of Ghana as one of "The Big Six" detained by the British colonial government in the then Gold Coast. He later became a Minister for Foreign Affairs in Ghana's second republic between 1971 and 1972.[3]

targets.targetText: William Ofori Atta (10 Oktoba 1910 - 14 Yuli 1988), wanda aka fi sani da " Paa Willie ", dan Ghana ne wanda ya kafa kungiyar United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) kuma daya daga cikin iyayen da suka kafa Ghana a matsayin daya daga cikin " Babban Shida " da gwamnatin mulkin mallaka ta Burtaniya ta tsare a lokacin Gold Coast . Daga baya ya zama ministan harkokin waje a jamhuriya ta biyu ta Ghana tsakanin 1971 da 1972. [1]

William Ofori Atta (10 Oktoba 1910 - 14 Yuli 1988), wanda aka fi sani da "Paa Willie", ɗan Ghana ne wanda ya kafa kungiyar United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) kuma daya daga cikin iyayen da suka kafa Ghana a matsayin daya daga cikin "Big Six" da gwamnatin 'yan mulkin mallaka ta Burtaniya ta tsare a lokacin Gold Coast. Daga baya ya zama ministan harkokin waje a jamhuriya ta biyu ta Ghana tsakanin shekarun 1971 da 1972. [1]

items.sourceText: Hassib Ben Ammar (Arabic: حسيب بن عمار; 11 April 1924 – 15 December 2008) was a leading Tunisian politician and journalist/editor. He was a powerful campaigner for human rights.[1]

targets.targetText: Hassib Ben Ammar ( Arabic ; 11 Afrilu 1924 - 15 Disamba 2008) babban ɗan siyasan Tunisiya ne kuma ɗan jarida / edita. Ya kasance mai fafutukar kare hakkin dan adam . [1]
Hassib Ben Ammar (11 Afrilu 1924 - 15 Disamba 2008) babban ɗan siyasan Tunisiya ne kuma ɗan jarida/edita. Ya kasance mai fafutukar kare hakkin ɗan Adam. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1944, Miled left the MWUT, disillusioned by the lack of action of the group and its reliance on the political party Destour. She joined the Tunisian Women's Union (TWU) (Arabic: الاتحـاد النسـائـي التونسـي), which was affiliated with the Tunisian Communist Party.[4] Her shift in ideology and allegiance came about because the leadership of the Destour party, rather than demanding Tunisian autonomy outright, was in favor of liberalization through modification of the existing constitution.[2][6] Miled was in favor of the more radical approach, which combined nationalist goals with social improvement programs,[2] especially those aimed at providing for women's rights and schooling opportunities for disadvantaged children.[3]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1944, Miled ta bar MWUT, saboda rashin aikin da kungiyar ta yi da kuma dogaro da jam'iyyar siyasa Destour. Ta shiga kungiyar matan Tunisiya (TWU), wacce ke da alaƙa da Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Tunisiya. [ 4 ] Canjin akida da amincewarta ya samo asali ne saboda shugabancin jam'iyyar Destour, maimakon neman 'yancin cin gashin kai ga Tunisiya gaba ɗaya, tana goyon bayan samar da 'yanci ta hanyar gyara kundin tsarin mulkin da ake da shi. [ 2 ] [ 6 ] Miled ta goyi bayan mafi tsattsauran ra'ayi, wanda ya haɗa manufofin kishin ƙasa tare da shirye-shiryen inganta zamantakewa, [ 2 ] musamman waɗanda ke da nufin samar da yancin mata da damar makaranta ga yara marasa galihu. [ 3 ]

A cikin 1944, Miled ya bar MWUT, saboda rashin aikin da kungiyar ta yi da kuma dogaro da jam'iyyar siyasa Destour . Ta shiga kungiyar matan Tunisiya (TWU) ( Arabic ), wanda ke da alaƙa da Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Tunisiya . [ 4 ] Canjin akida da amincewarta ya samo asali ne saboda shugabancin jam'iyyar Destour, maimakon neman 'yancin cin gashin kai ga Tunisiya gaba daya, yana goyon bayan samar da 'yanci ta hanyar gyara kundin tsarin mulkin da ake da shi. [ 2 ] [ 6 ] Miled ya goyi bayan mafi tsattsauran ra'ayi, wanda ya haɗa manufofin kishin ƙasa tare da shirye-shiryen inganta zamantakewa, [ 2 ] musamman waɗanda ke da nufin samar da yancin mata da damar makaranta ga yara marasa galihu. [ 3 ]

items.sourceText: Bibi Titi Mohammed's legacy lives on in Tanzania. She played a pivotal role in education and women's equality. She fought her government for what she believed in, even when it got her in trouble. Today, one of Dar es Salaam's major roads is named after Mohammed in honour of the great achievements made by her toward Tanzanian independence.

targets.targetText: Gadon Bibi Titi Mohammed tana rayuwa a Tanzaniya. Ta taka rawar gani a fannin ilimi da daidaiton mata. Ta yaki gwamnatinta kan abin da ta yi imani da shi, ko da ta jefa ta cikin matsala. A yau, ɗaya daga cikin manyan titunan Dar es Salaam an sanya wa sunan Bibi Mohammed don girmama manyan nasarorin da ta samu na samun 'yancin kai na Tanzaniya.

Gadon Bibi Titi Mohammed yana rayuwa a Tanzaniya. Ta taka rawar gani a fannin ilimi da daidaiton mata. Ta yaki gwamnatinta kan abin da ta yi imani da shi, ko da ta jefa ta cikin matsala. A yau, daya daga cikin manyan titunan Dar es Salaam an sanya wa sunan Mohammed don girmama manyan nasarorin da ta samu na samun 'yancin kai na Tanzaniya.

items.sourceText: He was born in Cape Town and studied at the University of Cape Town. Abrahams later earned his MD in Stockholm. He became active in SWAPO politics in 1960 along with his wife Ottilie Abrahams. He became identified with the guerrilla group, Yu Chi Chan Club who was started by Neville Alexander, and attempted to flee to Botswana. The South African police arrested him and his associates there, but the South African Government released him due to lack of jurisdiction. After a stint in Tanzania, Abrahams formed the SWAPO Democrats with his wife in Sweden. He campaigned for the Namibia National Front during the 1989 elections. In 1991, Abrahams opened a medical practice in Khomasdal.[2]

targets.targetText: An haife shi a Cape Town kuma ya yi karatu a Jami'ar Cape Town. Daga baya Abrahams ya sami MD a Stockholm. Ya fara aiki a siyasar SWAPO a shekarar 1960 tare da matarsa Ottilie Abrahams. An gano shi tare da ƙungiyar masu fafutuka, Yu Chi Chan Club wanda Neville Alexander ya fara, kuma ya yi ƙoƙarin gudu zuwa Botswana. 'Yan sandan Afirka ta Kudu sun kama shi da abokansa a can, amma gwamnatin Afirka ta Kudu ta sake shi saboda rashin hurumi. Bayan zamansa a Tanzania, Abrahams ya kafa jam'iyyar SWAPO Democrat tare da matarsa a ƙasar Sweden. Ya yi wa Namibia National Front yakin neman zabe a lokacin zaɓen shekara ta 1989. A cikin shekarar 1991, Abrahams ya buɗe aikin likita a Khomasdal. [1]

An haife shi a Cape Town kuma ya yi karatu a Jami'ar Cape Town . Daga baya Abrahams ya sami MD a Stockholm . Ya fara aiki a siyasar SWAPO a 1960 tare da matarsa Ottilie Abrahams . An gano shi tare da ƙungiyar masu fafutuka, Yu Chi Chan Club wanda Neville Alexander ya fara, kuma ya yi ƙoƙarin gudu zuwa Botswana. 'Yan sandan Afirka ta Kudu sun kama shi da abokansa a can, amma gwamnatin Afirka ta Kudu ta sake shi saboda rashin hurumi. Bayan zamansa a Tanzania, Abrahams ya kafa jam'iyyar SWAPO Democrat tare da matarsa a kasar Sweden. Ya yi wa Namibia National Front yakin neman zabe a lokacin zaben 1989. A cikin 1991, Abrahams ya buɗe aikin likita a Khomasdal . [1]

items.sourceText: In March 1971, Josina traveled again, this time to Cabo Delgado, to evaluate social programs being implemented there. During the marches she struggled with chronic fatigue and exhaustion. Yet, at one point, she led a meeting of more than 1,000 persons. Tired and very thin, she decided to return to Dar es Salaam at the beginning of April. As she crossed the border into Tanzania, she handed her pistol to a companion and said: "Comrades, I can continue no longer. Give this to the military commander of the province so that it may contribute to the salvation of the Mozambican people."

targets.targetText: A cikin watan Maris 1971, Josina ta sake tafiya zuwa Cabo Delgado, don kimanta shirye-shiryen zamantakewa da ake aiwatarwa a can. A lokacin tattakin tana fama da gajiya da kasala. Duk da haka, a wani lokaci, ta jagoranci taron mutane fiye da 1,000. A gajiye da sirara sosai, ta yanke shawarar komawa Dar es Salaam a farkon watan Afrilu. Yayin da ta ke tsallakawa zuwa Tanzaniya, sai ta miƙa wa wani abokinta bindigarta ta ce: "Ya ku 'yan uwa, ba zan iya ci gaba ba, ku ba da wannan ga kwamandan sojan lardin domin ya taimaka wajen ceton al'ummar Mozambique."

A cikin Maris 1971, Josina ya sake tafiya zuwa Cabo Delgado, don kimanta shirye-shiryen zamantakewa da ake aiwatarwa a can. A lokacin tattakin tana fama da gajiya da gajiya. Duk da haka, a wani lokaci, ta jagoranci taron mutane fiye da 1,000. A gajiye da sirara sosai, ta yanke shawarar komawa Dar es Salaam a farkon watan Afrilu. Yayin da ta ke tsallakawa zuwa Tanzaniya, sai ta mika wa wani abokinta bindigarta ta ce: "Ya ku 'yan uwa, ba zan iya ci gaba ba, ku ba da wannan ga kwamandan sojan lardin domin ya taimaka wajen ceton al'ummar Mozambique."

items.sourceText: During the Mozambican War of Independence Muthemba was involved with the underground movements in Lourenço Marques.[1] After being arrested in João Belo by the PIDE, she was exiled to Muecate in Nampula Province, where she was required to report to the administration on a daily basis.[2] In 1967 she began working for the Credito Agricola de Nampula as a bookkeeper.[2]

targets.targetText: A lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Mozambique Muthemba ta shiga cikin ƙungiyoyin ƙarƙashin ƙasa a Lourenço Marques. [1] Bayan an kama ta a João Belo ta PIDE, an kai ta gudun hijira zuwa Muecate a Lardin Nampula, inda aka buƙaci ta ba da rahoto ga gwamnati a kowace rana. [2] A shekarar 1967 ta fara aiki da Credito Agricola de Nampula a matsayin mai kula da littattafai. [2]

A lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Mozambique Muthemba ya shiga cikin ƙungiyoyin karkashin kasa a Lourenço Marques . [1] Bayan an kama ta a João Belo ta PIDE, an kai ta gudun hijira zuwa Muecate a Lardin Nampula, inda aka bukaci ta ba da rahoto ga gwamnati a kowace rana. [2] A 1967 ta fara aiki da Credito Agricola de Nampula a matsayin mai kula da littattafai. [2]

items.sourceText: Pachinuapa was involved in the Mozambican War of Independence, founding the Female Detachment of FRELIMO.[1] She later held the rank of colonel in the military reserve,[2] and was among the founders of the Organization of Mozambican Women.[3] Following independence, she was a FRELIMO candidate in the 1977 parliamentary elections,[4] in which she was one of the first group of 27 women elected to the People's Assembly.[5] She was re-elected in 1986 from Sofala Province representing Moçambique Industrial.[6] In 2010 she was appointed to the National Defence and Security Council.

targets.targetText: Pachinuapa ya shiga cikin yakin 'yancin kai na Mozambique, wanda ya kafa Ƙungiyar Mata na FRELIMO . [1] Daga baya ta rike mukamin kanar a ajiyar soja, [2] kuma tana cikin wadanda suka kafa kungiyar mata ta Mozambique . [3] Bayan samun 'yancin kai, ta kasance 'yar takarar FRELIMO a zaɓen 'yan majalisa na 1977, [4] a cikinsa yana ɗaya daga cikin rukuni na farko na mata 27 da aka zaɓa a Majalisar Jama'a. [5] An sake zaɓe ta a 1986 daga lardin Sofala mai wakiltar masana'antar Moçambique. [6] A shekarar 2010 aka nada ta a Majalisar Tsaro da Tsaro ta kasa.

Pachinuapa ta shiga cikin yakin 'yancin kai na Mozambique, wacce ta kafa Ƙungiyar Mata na FRELIMO. [1] Daga baya ta riƙe muƙamin kanar a ajiyar soja, [2] kuma tana cikin waɗanda suka kafa kungiyar mata ta Mozambique. [3] Bayan samun 'yancin kai, ta kasance 'yar takarar FRELIMO a zaɓen 'yan majalisa na 1977, [4] a cikinsa tana ɗaya daga cikin ruƙuni na farko na mata 27 da aka zaɓa a Majalisar Jama'a. [5] An sake zaɓen ta a shekara ta 1986 daga lardin Sofala mai wakiltar masana'antar Moçambique. [6] A shekarar 2010 aka naɗa ta a Majalisar Tsaro da Tsaro ta ƙasa.

items.sourceText: The GPLM emerged from one faction of the erstwhile Gambela Liberation Front (GLF). The group that would form the GPLM were supported by the Sudanese government and linked to the Oromo Liberation Front.[4] The faction took the name GPLM in 1985.[5] GPLM guerillas operated out of bases in Sudan.[4]

targets.targetText: Jam'iyyar GPLM ta fito ne daga wani ɓangare na tsohuwar jam'iyyar Gambela Liberation Front (GLF). Kungiyar da za ta kafa GPLM ta samu goyon bayan gwamnatin Sudan kuma tana da alaƙa da kungiyar 'yanci ta Oromo. [1] Ƙungiyar ta ɗauki sunan GPLM a cikin shekarar 1985. [2] 'Yan tawayen GPLM sun yi amfani da sansanoni a Sudan. [1]

Jam'iyyar GPLM ta fito ne daga wani bangare na tsohuwar jam'iyyar Gambela Liberation Front (GLF). Kungiyar da za ta kafa GPLM ta samu goyon bayan gwamnatin Sudan kuma tana da alaka da kungiyar 'yanci ta Oromo . [1] Ƙungiyar ta ɗauki sunan GPLM a cikin 1985. [2] 'Yan tawayen GPLM sun yi amfani da sansanoni a Sudan. [1]

items.sourceText: Western Togoland Restoration Front (French: Front de restauration du Togoland de l'Ouest; abbreviated WTRF or FRTO) is a Ewe political, militant, nationalist and a separatist organization that advocates for an independent state of Western Togoland and possibly the Ewe ethnic parts of the Volta Region from Ghana.

targets.targetText: Western Togoland Restoration Front (WTRF ko FRTO) ƙungiyar siyasa ce ta Ewe, mai fafutuka, mai kishin ƙasa kuma ƙungiyar 'yan aware mai fafutukar neman 'yancin kai na yammacin Togoland da yuwuwar sassan ƙabilar Ewe na yankin Volta daga Ghana.

Western Togoland Restoration Front ( French ; WTRF ko FRTO ) ƙungiyar siyasa ce ta Ewe, mai fafutuka, mai kishin ƙasa kuma ƙungiyar 'yan aware mai fafutukar neman 'yancin kai na yammacin Togoland da yuwuwar sassan kabilar Ewe na yankin Volta daga Ghana .

items.sourceText: The Franco-Trarzan War of 1825 was a conflict between the forces of the new emir of Trarza, Muhammad al Habib, and France, ruled at the time by Charles X and the ultra comte de Villèle. In 1825, Muhammad attempted to establish control over the French-protected Waalo Kingdom, then located south of the Senegal River, by marrying the heiress to the kingdom. The French responded by sending a large expeditionary force that crushed Muhammad's army. The war incited the French to expand to the north of the Senegal River.

targets.targetText: Yakin Franco-Trarzan na 1825 rikici ne tsakanin sojojin sabon sarkin Trarza Muhammad al Habib da Faransa wanda Charles X da ultra comte de Villèle suka yi mulki a lokacin.[1] A cikin shekarar 1825, Muhammad ya yi ƙoƙari ya kafa iko a kan masarautar Waalo da Faransa ke kariya a lokacin, wanda ke kudu da kogin Senegal,[2] ta hanyar auren mai gadon sarautar.[3] Faransa ta mayar da martani ta hanyar aika dakaru masu yawa da suka murkushe sojojin Muhammad.[4] Yakin ya zaburar da Faransawa zuwa arewacin kogin Senegal.[5]

Yakin Franco-Trarzan na 1825 rikici ne tsakanin sojojin sabon sarkin Trarza Muhammad al Habib da Faransa wanda Charles X da ultra comte de Villèle suka yi mulki a lokacin. A cikin 1825, Muhammad ya yi ƙoƙari ya kafa iko a kan masarautar Waalo da Faransa ke kariya a lokacin, wanda ke kudu da kogin Senegal, ta hanyar auri mai gadon sarautar. Faransawa ta mayar da martani ta hanyar aika dakaru masu yawa da suka murkushe sojojin Muhammad. Yakin ya zaburar da Faransawa zuwa arewacin kogin Senegal.

items.sourceText: Conquered by the Allies in 1941, Italian East Africa was sub-divided. Italian Somaliland remained under Italian rule, but as a United Nations protectorate not a colony, until 1960 when it united with British Somaliland, to form the independent state of Somalia.[43]

targets.targetText: Ƙungiyoyin Ƙawance sun ci nasara a 1941, Italiya ta Gabas ta Tsakiya ta rabu. Somaliland Somaliland ta ci gaba da zama karkashin mulkin Italiya, amma a matsayinta na kariyar Majalisar Dinkin Duniya ba mulkin mallaka ba, har zuwa 1960 lokacin da ta hade da British Somaliland, don kafa kasar Somaliya mai cin gashin kanta. [1]

Ƙungiyoyin Ƙawance sun ci nasara a shekarar 1941, Italiya ta Gabas ta Tsakiya ta rabu. Somaliland ta ci gaba da zama ƙarƙashin mulkin Italiya, amma a matsayinta na kariyar Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya ba mulkin mallaka ba, har zuwa shekara ta 1960 lokacin da ta haɗe da British Somaliland, don kafa ƙasar Somaliya mai cin gashin kanta. [1]

items.sourceText: Abraha studied political science and chemistry in the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic, where he became a chemist.[1] He then moved to the former East Germany.[2] In 1975, Abraha left Germany to join the Eritrean separatist rebels in the ongoing Eritrean War of Independence.[2]

targets.targetText: Abraha ya yi karatun kimiyyar siyasa da sinadarai a cikin Tarayyar Soviet Tarayya Socialist Republic, inda ya zama masanin kimiyyar sinadarai. [1] Daga nan sai ya koma tsohuwar Jamus ta Gabas. [1] A cikin shekarar 1975, Abraha ya bar Jamus don shiga cikin 'yan tawayen Eritriya a yakin 'yancin kai na Eritriya. [1]

Abraha ya yi karatun kimiyyar siyasa da sinadarai a cikin Tarayyar Soviet Tarayya Socialist Republic, inda ya zama masanin kimiyyar sinadarai. [1] Daga nan sai ya koma tsohuwar Jamus ta Gabas . [1] A cikin 1975, Abraha ya bar Jamus don shiga cikin 'yan tawayen Eritriya a yakin 'yancin kai na Eritriya . [1]

items.sourceText: In 1996, Abraha was stationed in London, where he served in the Embassy of Eritrea from 1996 until 2001.[1][2] Abraha's wife, Fatina Ahmedin, an Eritrean artist and former rebel fighter, was struck by a car in London, and became paralyzed from the accident.[2] As a result, couple decided to permanently remain in the United Kingdom so Ahmedin could receive medical treatment.[1] Abraha remained her caretaker for more than 20 years.[1][2]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1996, Abraha ya kasance a London, inda ya yi aiki a Ofishin Jakadancin Eritrea daga 1996 har zuwa 2001. [1] [2] Matar Abraha, Fatina Ahmedin, mai zane-zanen Eritiriya kuma tsohuwar mayakin tawaye, wata mota ta taka a London, kuma ta zama gurgu saboda hadarin. [2] Sakamakon haka, ma'auratan sun yanke shawarar ci gaba da zama a Burtaniya na dindindin don Ahmedin ya sami jinya. [1] Abraha ya kasance mai kula da ita fiye da shekaru 20. [1] [2]

A cikin shekarar 1996, Abraha ya kasance a London, inda ya yi aiki a Ofishin Jakadancin Eritrea daga shekarun 1996 har zuwa 2001. [1] [2] Matar Abraha, Fatina Ahmedin, mai zane-zanen Eritiriya kuma tsohuwar mayakiya 'yar tawaye, wata mota ta takata a London, kuma ta zama gurguwa saboda hadarin. [2] Sakamakon haka, ma'auratan sun yanke shawarar ci gaba da zama a Burtaniya na dindindin don Ahmedin ya sami jinya. [1] Abraha ya kasance mai kula da ita fiye da shekaru 20. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Genet's first writing project was a play about the disadvantages of traditional medicine, based on her own childhood experiences, that she wrote on finishing her training with the EPLF. In 1984, she began writing her first book, the autobiographical novel Shigom. She worried that she would be killed in the war before she would be able to finish it, but she completed it in 1987.[1] She was subsequently given the nickname Shigom after the title character in the book.[2]

targets.targetText: Aikin rubutun farko na Genet wasa ne game da illolin magungunan gargajiya, bisa la’akari da irin abubuwan da ta samu a yarinta, wanda ta rubuta a kan kammala horar da ta da EPLF. A cikin shekarar 1984, ta fara rubuta littafinta na farko, littafin tarihin rayuwar Shigom. Ta damu cewa za a kashe ta a yakin kafin ta iya gamawa, amma ta kammala shi a shekarar 1987. [1] Daga baya aka yi mata laƙabi da Shigom bayan sunan take a littafin. [2]

Aikin rubutun farko na Genet wasa ne game da illolin magungunan gargajiya, bisa la’akari da irin abubuwan da ta samu a yarinta, wanda ta rubuta a kan kammala horar da ta da EPLF. A cikin 1984, ta fara rubuta littafinta na farko, littafin tarihin rayuwar Shigom . Ta damu cewa za a kashe ta a yakin kafin ta iya gamawa, amma ta kammala shi a 1987. [1] Daga baya aka yi mata lakabi da Shigom bayan sunan take a littafin. [2]

items.sourceText: The Front de Libération Nationale (National Liberation Front) was established by the Comité Révolutionnaire d'Unité et d'Action (Revolutionary Committee of Unity and Action) and organised in March 1954. Around two years later this group absorbed most but not all the Algerian nationalist organisations. It then re-organised itself and established a provisional government. This government included five members in executive and legislative bodies; all the members were district heads. During the ongoing war of independence in Algeria; Colonel Houari Boumedienne (the future President of Algeria) led the military wing of the FLN, the National Liberation Army, against the French.[1]

targets.targetText: The Front de Libération Nationale Comité Révolutionnaire d'Unité et d'Action ne ya kafa (National Liberation Front) (Kwamitin Juyin Juya Hali na Haɗin kai da Aiki) kuma an shirya shi a cikin Maris 1954. Kusan shekaru biyu bayan wannan rukunin ya mamaye mafi yawan amma ba duka ƙungiyoyin kishin ƙasa na Aljeriya ba. Sannan ta sake shirya kanta tare da kafa gwamnatin wucin gadi. Wannan gwamnati ta kunshi wakilai biyar a hukumomin zartaswa da na majalisa; duk membobin sun kasance hakimai. A lokacin yakin neman yancin kai a kasar Aljeriya ; Kanar Houari Boumedienne ( shugaban Aljeriya na gaba) ya jagoranci reshen soja na FLN, Rundunar 'Yancin Kasa, da Faransanci. [1]

The Front de Libération Nationale Comité Révolutionnaire d'Unité et d'Action ne ya kafa (National Liberation Front) (Kwamitin Juyin Juya Hali na Haɗin kai da Aiki) kuma an shirya shi a cikin watan Maris 1954. Kusan shekaru biyu bayan wannan ruƙunin ya mamaye mafi yawan amma ba duka ƙungiyoyin kishin ƙasa na Aljeriya ba. Sannan ta sake shirya kanta tare da kafa gwamnatin wucin gadi. Wannan gwamnati ta kunshi wakilai biyar a hukumomin zartaswa da na majalisa; duk membobin sun kasance hakimai. A lokacin yakin neman yancin kai a ƙasar Aljeriya; Kanar Houari Boumedienne (shugaban Aljeriya na gaba) ya jagoranci reshen soja na FLN, Rundunar 'Yancin Ƙasa, dake yaki da Faransa. [1]

items.sourceText: The Congress of Soummam was the founding act of the modern Algerian state and a crucial element of success of the Algerian War of Independence. It took place on 20 August 1956, when the FLN's leadership in Algeria met secretly in the Soummam Valley (Ighbane and Ifri at Ouzellaguen) to compose a common platform and create a new organizational structure.

targets.targetText: Majalisar Soummam ita ce ta kafa tsarin mulkin Aljeriya na zamani kuma muhimmin ɓangare na nasarar yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya. Ya faru ne a ranar 20 ga watan Agustan 1956, lokacin da shugabannin FLN a Aljeriya suka gana a asirce a kwarin Soummam (Ighbane da Ifri a Ouzellaguen) don tsara dandamali na gama gari da ƙirƙirar sabon tsarin ƙungiyar.

Majalisar Soummam ita ce ta kafa tsarin mulkin Aljeriya na zamani kuma muhimmin bangare na nasarar yakin 'yancin kai na Aljeriya . Ya faru ne a ranar 20 ga Agustan 1956, lokacin da shugabannin FLN a Aljeriya suka gana a asirce a kwarin Soummam (Ighbane da Ifri a Ouzellaguen ) don tsara dandamali na gama gari da ƙirƙirar sabon tsarin ƙungiya.

items.sourceText: Lakhdar Bouregaa died of COVID-19 in El Biar on 4 November 2020, at the age of 87.[27][28] He was buried the next day at Cimetière Sidi Yahia in Algiers.[29]

targets.targetText: Lakhdar Bouregaa ya mutu daga COVID-19 a El Biar a ranar 4 ga Nuwamba, 2020, yana da shekaru 87. [1] [2] An binne shi washegari a Cimetière Sidi Yahia a Algiers . [3]

items.sourceText: Djamila Bouhired now lives in Algiers, and continues to participate in protests and marches for several causes, including the 2019 Algerian protests.[6]

targets.targetText: Djamila Bouhired yanzu tana zaune a Algiers, kuma tana ci gaba da shiga cikin zanga-zangar da jerin gwano saboda dalilai da yawa, gami da zanga-zangar Aljeriya na shekara ta 2019. [1]

items.sourceText: On 21 April 1955, Zabana was brought to the military court in Oran and sentenced to death. On 3 May 1955, he was transferred to the Serkadji Prison in Algiers. He was executed on 19 June 1956.[3] He is sometimes described as the first martyr (French: Chahid) to be the guillotined in the war.[4]

targets.targetText: A ranar 21 ga watan Afrilu, 1955, an gabatar da Zabana a kotun soja a Oran kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin kisa. A ranar 3 ga watan Mayu 1955, an tura shi kurkukun Serkadji a Algiers. An kashe shi a ranar 19 ga watan Yuni 1956. [1] Wani lokaci ana kwatanta shi a matsayin shahidi na farko (French: Chahid) ya zama guillotin a cikin yaƙi. [2]

A ranar 21 ga Afrilu, 1955, an gabatar da Zabana a kotun soja a Oran kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin kisa. A ranar 3 ga Mayu 1955, an tura shi kurkukun Serkadji a Algiers . An kashe shi a ranar 19 ga Yuni 1956. [1] Wani lokaci ana kwatanta shi a matsayin shahidi na farko ( French ) ya zama guillotin a cikin yaƙi. [2]

items.sourceText: The Morice Line was a defensive line which went into effect in September 1957 during the Algerian War. It was constructed under French authority to prevent supplies reaching the rebel guerrillas of the Algerian National Liberation Front in the then French-controlled Algeria, from the neighbouring country of Tunisia.[1] It was named after then French Minister of Defence André Morice.

targets.targetText: Layin Morice layin tsaro ne wanda ya fara aiki a watan Satumbar 1957 a lokacin yakin Aljeriya. An gina ta ne a ƙarƙashin ikon Faransa don hana kai kayan agaji ga 'yan tawayen kungiyar 'yantar da al'ummar Aljeriya a Aljeriya ƙarƙashin ikon Faransa a lokacin, daga makwabciyar ƙasar Tunisia. [1] An sanya masa suna bayan Ministan Tsaro na Faransa André Morice.

Layin Morice layin tsaro ne wanda ya fara aiki a watan Satumbar 1957 a lokacin yakin Aljeriya . An gina ta ne a karkashin ikon Faransa don hana kai kayan agaji ga 'yan tawayen kungiyar 'yantar da al'ummar Aljeriya a Aljeriya karkashin ikon Faransa a lokacin, daga makwabciyar kasar Tunisia . [1] An sanya masa suna bayan Ministan Tsaro na Faransa André Morice .

items.sourceText: Nyamubaya was passionate about traditional mbira music, and performed as a dancer onstage, including with internationally renowned musician Thomas Mapfumo.

targets.targetText: Nyamubaya ta kasance mai sha'awar kiɗan mbira na gargajiya, kuma ta yi wasa a matsayin 'yar wasan rawa, gami da fitaccen mawaƙin duniya Thomas Mapfumo.
Nyamubaya ya kasance mai sha'awar kiɗan mbira na gargajiya, kuma ya yi wasa a matsayin ɗan wasan rawa, gami da fitaccen mawaƙin duniya Thomas Mapfumo .

items.sourceText: Phipps's husband, James Phipps, rose through the ranks of the Royal African Company (RAC) and became the Governor of Cape Coast Castle, a major British trading fort on the Gold Coast, and Captain-General of the RAC, the highest-ranking position in the company's operations in West Africa. James Phipps served in these roles for 20 years before passing away on the coast in 1723.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Mijin Phipps, James Phipps, ya tashi ta cikin matsayi a Kamfanin Royal African Company (RAC) kuma ya zama Gwamnan Cape Coast Castle, babban sansanin kasuwanci na Birtaniya a kan Gold Coast, da Kyaftin-Janar na RAC, matsayi mafi girma a cikin ayyukan kamfanin a yammacin Afirka. James Phipps ya yi aiki a cikin waɗannan ayyuka na shekaru 20 kafin ya mutu a bakin teku a shekarar 1723. [1] [2]

Mijin Phipps, James Phipps, ya tashi ta cikin matsayi na Kamfanin Royal African Company (RAC) kuma ya zama Gwamnan Cape Coast Castle, babban sansanin kasuwanci na Birtaniya a kan Gold Coast, da Kyaftin-Janar na RAC, matsayi mafi girma a cikin ayyukan kamfanin a yammacin Afirka . James Phipps ya yi aiki a cikin waɗannan ayyuka na shekaru 20 kafin ya mutu a bakin teku a 1723. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: At baptism in Freretown by the Reverend Canon Harry Kerr Binns,[2] he was christened James Mbuto. He, later on in 1918, while working in Mombasa, anglicized his name Mbutu to Beauttah,[3] allegedly so as to be able to circumvent then racist colonial restrictions that would've prevented him from buying shares of Brooke Bond, a white tea company operating in Kenya at the time.

targets.targetText: A lokacin baftisma a Freretown da Reverend Canon Harry Kerr Binns, [1] an yi masa baftisma James Mbuto. Daga baya a shekarar 1918, yayin da yake aiki a Mombasa, ya sanya sunansa Mbutu zuwa Beauttah, wanda ake zargin don ya iya kauce wa ƙuntatawa na mulkin mallaka na wariyar launin fata wanda zai hana shi sayen hannun jari na Brooke Bond, kamfanin farin shayi da ke aiki a Kenya a lokacin.[2]

A lokacin baftisma a Freretown da Reverend Canon Harry Kerr Binns, [1] an yi masa baftisma James Mbuto . Ya, daga baya a 1918, yayin da yake aiki a Mombasa, ya sanya sunansa Mbutu zuwa Beauttah, wanda ake zargin don ya iya kauce wa ƙuntatawa na mulkin mallaka na wariyar launin fata wanda zai hana shi sayen hannun jari na Brooke Bond, kamfanin farin shayi da ke aiki a Kenya a lokacin.[2]

items.sourceText: Mboya worked with both John F. Kennedy and Martin Luther King Jr. to create educational opportunities for African students, an effort that resulted in the Kennedy Airlifts of the 1960s enabling East African students to study in American colleges. Notable beneficiaries of this airlift include Wangari Maathai. In 1960, Mboya was the first Kenyan to be featured on the front page cover of Time magazine in a painting by Bernard Safran.[7]

targets.targetText: Mboya ya yi aiki tare da John F. Kennedy da Martin Luther King Jr. don samar da damammaki na ilimi ga daliban Afirka, kokarin da ya haifar da Kennedy Airlifts na shekarun 1960 ya baiwa daliban gabashin Afirka damar yin karatu a kwalejojin Amurka. Sanannun waɗanda suka ci gajiyar wannan jigilar jirgin sun haɗa da Wangari Maathai . A cikin 1960, Mboya shine ɗan Kenya na farko da aka nuna a bangon shafin farko na mujallar Time a cikin wani zane na Bernard Safran . [1]

Mboya ya yi aiki tare da John F. Kennedy da Martin Luther King Jr. don samar da damammaki na ilimi ga ɗaliban Afirka, kokarin da ya haifar da Kennedy Airlifts na shekarun 1960 ya baiwa ɗaliban gabashin Afirka damar yin karatu a kwalejojin Amurka. Sanannun waɗanda suka ci gajiyar wannan jigilar jirgin sun haɗa da Wangari Maathai. A cikin shekarar 1960, Mboya shine ɗan Kenya na farko da aka nuna a bangon shafin farko na mujallar Time a cikin wani zane na Bernard Safran. [1]

items.sourceText: Cheikh Boumerdassi had thus embarked on 5 June 1874, under the orders of the frigate captain Adolphe Lucien Mottez [fr] (1822-1892), on the ship La Loire which left Brest, and the Cheikh was condemned to a simple deportation.[31]

targets.targetText: Cheikh Boumerdassi ya tashi a ranar 5 ga watan Yuni 1874, ƙarƙashin umarnin kyaftin din jirgin ruwa Adolphe Lucien Mottez [ fr ] (1822-1892), a kan jirgin La Loire wanda ya bar Brest, kuma an yanke wa Cheikh hukuncin fitar da shi cikin sauki. [1]

items.sourceText: Several battles followed one another in this region until 1857 when Kabylia was pacified and the process of human and agricultural colonization began on the sequestered and despoiled land of the natives.[5]

targets.targetText: Yaƙe-yaƙe da dama sun biyo bayan juna a wannan yanki har zuwa shekara ta 1857 lokacin da aka sasanta Kabylia kuma aka fara aiwatar da mulkin mallaka da na ɗan adam a ƙasar da aka yi wa ɓarna da ta'adi. [1]

items.sourceText: After the Battle of Alma turned to defeat against the Algerian rebels on 23 April 1871, after the arrival of Colonel Alexandre Fourchault and his French reinforcements from Algiers, the Algerians entrenched themselves at the Col des Beni Aïcha to try to rebound again on Alma.

targets.targetText: Bayan yakin Alma ya koma kan 'yan tawayen Aljeriya a ranar 23 ga watan Afrilun 1871, bayan isowar Kanar Alexandre Fourchault da sojojinsa na Faransa daga Algiers, 'yan Aljeriya sun dage kan Col des Beni Aïcha don kokarin sake komawa kan Alma.

items.sourceText: The Battle of Bab El Bekkouche during the Algerian War took place on 28 May 1958 in the region of Ouarsenis.

targets.targetText: Yaƙin Bab El Bekkouche a lokacin Yaƙin Aljeriya ya faru ne a ranar 28 ga watan Mayu 1958 a yankin Ouarsenis.

items.sourceText: In the summer of 1944, along with five others (Algerians and Germans), Mohammedi was sent by the Abwehr on intelligence and sabotage missions to Algeria, but was arrested in the region of Tebessa and sentenced to death. Mohammedi's sentence was commuted to life in prison, and he was released from prison in 1952.[1] He was known for always wearing his Wehrmacht steel helmet during Algerian War.[2]

targets.targetText: A lokacin rani na shekarar 1944, tare da wasu biyar (Aljeriya da Jamus), Abwehr ya aika Mohammedi kan ayyukan leken asiri da zagon ƙasa zuwa Algeria, amma an kama shi a yankin Tebessa kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin kisa. An mayar da hukuncin Mohammedi zuwa gidan yari, kuma an sake shi daga kurkuku a shekarar 1952. [1] An san shi da sanya kwalkwali na karfe na Wehrmacht koyaushe a lokacin yakin Aljeriya. [2]

items.sourceText: Saïd Mohammedi was an activist for the North African Star, the PPA and the MTLD. He made contact with the resistance as soon as he was released from prison in 1952.

targets.targetText: Saïd Mohammedi mai fafutuka ne na Tauraruwar Arewacin Afirka, PPA da MTLD. Ya yi hulɗa da juriya da zarar an sake shi daga kurkuku a 1952.

items.sourceText: He was born in 1908 in Taourirt n'Mangllat (Ain El Hammam) Grande Kabylie.[5] He first worked as a teacher then resumed his studies, got a law degree and practiced the profession of lawyer.

targets.targetText: An haife shi a cikin 1908 a Taourirt n'Mangllat (Ain El Hammam) Grande Kabylie . [1] Ya fara aiki a matsayin malami sannan ya ci gaba da karatunsa, ya sami digiri na lauya kuma ya yi aikin lauya.

items.sourceText: He enrolled at the Council of Legal Education and was called to the English Bar at Lincoln's Inn in 1961.[2] He then returned to Nigeria to join the chambers of Chief Obafemi Awolowo.[3][3]

items.sourceText: Flooding in Nigeria has become a yearly occurrence that claims lives and destroys many properties.[1] In 2024, flooding in Nigeria killed more than 1,200 people, injured at least 2,712 others, and displaced 1.2 million.[2][3][4]

targets.targetText: Ambaliyar ruwa a Najeriya ta zama ruwan dare a duk shekara da ke lakume rayuka tare da lalata dukiyoyi da dama. [1] A shekarar 2024, ambaliyar ruwa a Najeriya ta kashe mutane fiye da 1,200, sannan wasu akalla 2,712 suka jikkata, sannan wasu miliyan 1.2 suka rasa muhallansu. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Having discovered the limits of civil, political resistance against General Alphonse Juin and his administration, he founded, with his friends including Abbas Messaâdi, the first clandestine cells of the armed Moroccan urban resistance.[1] Expanding these cells across the entire city, he quickly formed relations with other urban networks.[2] He organized training sessions in weapon handling and became one of the leaders of the Secret Resistance Organization, along with Abderrahmane Senhaji.[2]

targets.targetText: Bayan gano iyakokin farar hula, gwagwarmaya na siyasa ga Janar Alphonse Juin da gwamnatinsa, ya kafa, tare da abokansa ciki har da Abbas Messaâdi, sel na farko na ɓoye na gwagwarmaya na birane na Morocco. [1] Faɗaɗa waɗannan sel a duk faɗin birni, cikin sauri ya kulla dangantaka da sauran hanyoyin sadarwa na birane. [1] Ya shirya tarurrukan horo kan sarrafa makamai kuma ya zama ɗaya daga cikin shugabannin kungiyar Resistance Organisation, tare da Abderrahmane Senhaji. [1]

items.sourceText: Bashir Saadawi (Arabic: بشير السعداوي, ALA-LC: Bashīr al-Saʻdāwī; 1884 – 17 January 1957) was a Libyan politician and the founder and leader of the unitarist National Congress Party.[1]

targets.targetText: Bashir Saadawi ( Arabic , ALA-LC : Bashir al-Sa'dāwī ; 1884 - 17 ga Janairu 1957) ɗan siyasan Libya ne kuma wanda ya kafa kuma shugaban jam'iyyar National Congress Party na unitarist . [1]
Bashir Saadawi (ALA-LC : Bashir al-Sa'dāwī ; 1884 - 17 ga watan Janairu 1957) ɗan siyasan Libya ne kuma wanda ya kafa kuma shugaban jam'iyyar National Congress Party na unitarist. [1]

items.sourceText: Before colonization the Igawawen, also known as Zwawas served as troops under the Deylik of Algiers. Following a coup by Ali Khodja they gained more influence inside the country. In 1830 France invaded Algiers, and started the French conquest of Algeria. The Zwawa served under the armies led by Ibrahim Agha, and particularly in the Battle of Staouéli. Following the Fall of Algiers, the French started encroaching on the Mitidja region surrounding the city. Initially defeating the forces of Mostéfa Boumezrag at Médea, they were soon halted at the First Battle of Blida by Mohamed ben Zamoum. By 1837 the majority of the Mitidja was seized, and France started encroaching on the lands of the Zwawa.

targets.targetText: Kafin mulkin mallaka Igawawen, wanda aka fi sani da Zwawas ya yi aiki a matsayin sojoji a karkashin Deylik na Algiers . Bayan juyin mulkin da Ali Khodja ya yi sun kara samun tasiri a cikin kasar. A cikin 1830 Faransa ta mamaye Algiers, kuma ta fara mamaye Faransanci na Aljeriya. Zwawa sun yi aiki a karkashin sojojin karkashin jagorancin Ibrahim Agha, musamman a yakin Staouéli . Bayan faduwar Algiers, Faransawa sun fara mamaye yankin Mitidja da ke kewaye da birnin. Da farko sun ci sojojin Mostéfa Boumezrag a Médea, ba da daɗewa ba Mohamed ben Zamoum ya dakatar da su a Yaƙin Blida na farko . A shekara ta 1837 aka kwace yawancin Mitidja, kuma Faransa ta fara mamaye ƙasashen Zwawa.

Kafin mulkin mallaka Igawawen, wanda aka fi sani da Zwawas ya yi aiki a matsayin sojoji a ƙarƙashin Deylik na Algiers. Bayan juyin mulkin da Ali Khodja ya yi sun ƙara samun tasiri a cikin ƙasar. A cikin shekarar 1830 Faransa ta mamaye Algiers, kuma ta fara mamaye Faransa na Aljeriya. Zwawa sun yi aiki a ƙarƙashin sojojin ƙarƙashin jagorancin Ibrahim Agha, musamman a yakin Staouéli. Bayan faɗuwar Algiers, Faransawa sun fara mamaye yankin Mitidja da ke kewaye da birnin. Da farko sun ci sojojin Mostéfa Boumezrag a Médea, ba da daɗewa ba Mohamed ben Zamoum ya dakatar da su a Yaƙin Blida na farko. A shekara ta 1837 aka kwace yawancin Mitidja, kuma Faransa ta fara mamaye ƙasashen Zwawa.

items.sourceText: Abel Kegne (his birth name) was born at Fokoué, near Bamendou in the MENOUA department of West Province, Cameroon in 1924.[a] He came from a Bamiléké background.[2] He left home early and went to Dschang to live with Mathieu Yamdjeu, a friend of his father. He became a ball boy at the tennis club, and was noticed there and enrolled in school. He studied at Dschang, Bafang, Nkongsamba and then at the Nursing School in Ayos.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Abel Kegne (sunan haihuwarsa) a Fokoué, kusa da Bamendou a sashen MENOUA na Lardin Yamma, Kamaru a cikin shekarar 1924. [ a ] Ya fito daga asalin Bamiléké. [ 2 ] Ya bar gida da wuri kuma ya tafi Dschang don ya zauna tare da Mathieu Yamdjeu, abokin mahaifinsa. Ya zama ɗan ball a gidan wasan tennis, kuma an lura da shi a can kuma ya shiga makaranta. Ya yi karatu a Dschang, Bafang, Nkongsamba sannan kuma a Makarantar koyon aikin jinya da ke Ayos. [ 1 ]

items.sourceText: The Riffians forces advanced quite rapidly into a number of positions following the crushing defeat of the Spanish forces at the 22 July 1921 Battle of Annual and by early August they had already taken Zeluán and Nador.[1] General Felipe Navarro [es] had retreated to Arruit on 29 July,[2] with around 2,201 ready soldiers and 252 wounded, joining the garrison of 964 soldiers.[3]

targets.targetText: Sojojin Riffian sun ci gaba da sauri zuwa wurare da dama bayan murkushe sojojin Spain a yakin shekara ta 22 ga watan Yuli 1921 kuma a farkon watan Agusta sun riga sun kwace Zeluán da Nador. [ 1 ] General Felipe Navarro [ es ] ya koma Arruit a ranar 29 ga watan Yuli, [ 2 ] tare da kusan 2,201 shirye-shiryen sojoji da 252 suka ji rauni, tare da shiga sansanin sojoji 964. [ 3 ]

Sojojin Riffian sun ci gaba da sauri zuwa wurare da dama bayan murkushe sojojin Spain a yakin shekara ta 22 ga Yuli 1921 kuma a farkon watan Agusta sun riga sun kwace Zeluán da Nador . [ 1 ] General Felipe Navarro [ es ] ya koma Arruit a ranar 29 ga Yuli, [ 2 ] tare da kusan 2,201 shirye-shiryen sojoji da 252 suka ji rauni, tare da shiga sansanin sojoji 964. [ 3 ]

items.sourceText: During apartheid, Nefolovhodwe was a leading member of the Black Consciousness movement, particularly at the University of the North at Turfloop. He was national president of the South African Students' Organisation (SASO) in 1974, when he and eight others were charged under the Terrorism Act in the SASO Nine trial. He was imprisoned on Robben Island from 1976 to 1982 and upon his release became involved in union organising, including as a founding member of the National Council of Trade Unions.

targets.targetText: A lokacin wariyar launin fata, Nefolovhodwe ya kasance babban memba na kungiyar Black Consciousness, musamman a Jami'ar Arewa a Turfloop . Ya kasance shugaban kungiyar daliban Afirka ta Kudu (SASO) na kasa a 1974, lokacin da aka tuhume shi da wasu mutane takwas a karkashin dokar ta'addanci a shari'ar SASO tara . An daure shi a tsibirin Robben daga 1976 zuwa 1982 kuma bayan an sake shi ya shiga harkar hada-hadar kungiya, ciki har da mamban kafa kungiyar kwadago ta kasa .

A lokacin wariyar launin fata, Nefolovhodwe ya kasance babban memba na kungiyar Black Consciousness, musamman a Jami'ar Arewa a Turfloop. Ya kasance shugaban ƙungiyar ɗaliban Afirka ta Kudu (SASO) na ƙasa a shekarar 1974, lokacin da aka tuhume shi da wasu mutane takwas a ƙarƙashin dokar ta'addanci a shari'ar SASO tara. An ɗaure shi a tsibirin Robben daga shekarun 1976 zuwa 1982 kuma bayan an sake shi ya shiga harkar hada-hadar kungiya, ciki har da mamban kafa ƙungiyar kwadago ta ƙasa.

items.sourceText: The name Bassam may come from an ancient African word for the mouth of the Comoé River.[citation needed] Inhabited by the Nzema people since the 15th century, the city grew into a profitable fishing village and a trading center.[citation needed] In 1843, after signing a treaty with the African ruler of the Grand-Bassam region, the French built Fort Memours on the banks of the river.[citation needed] This fort became the primary French trading point in the region, and after the Berlin Conference in 1885, became a base for exploration of West Africa by the colonizers. Grand-Bassam became the capital for the French Colonie de Côte d’Ivoire from 1893 until 1900.[6]

targets.targetText: Sunan Bassam na iya fitowa daga tsohuwar kalmar Afirka don bakin kogin Comoé. Mutanen Nzema suna zaune tun ƙarni na 15, birnin ya girma ya zama ƙauyen kamun kifi ] [ da cibiyar kasuwanci. A cikin shekarar 1843, bayan sanya ] kan [ yarjejeniya tare da shugaban Afirka na yankin Grand-Bassam, Faransa ta gina Fort Memours a bakin kogin. Wannan katanga ta zama wurin kasuwanci na farko na Faransa a yankin, kuma bayan taron Berlin a shekara ta 1885, ya zama tushe don binciken yammacin Afirka ta hanyar masu ] mallaka [ Grand-Bassam ya zama babban birnin Faransa Colonie de Cote d'Ivoire daga shekarun 1893 har zuwa 1900. [1]

Sunan Bassam na iya fitowa daga tsohuwar kalmar Afirka don bakin kogin Comoé . Mutanen Nzema suna zaune tun ƙarni na 15, birnin ya girma ya zama ƙauyen kamun kifi ] [ da cibiyar kasuwanci. A cikin 1843, bayan sanya ] kan [ yarjejeniya tare da shugaban Afirka na yankin Grand-Bassam, Faransanci ya gina Fort Memours a bakin kogin. Wannan katanga ta zama wurin kasuwanci na farko na Faransa a yankin, kuma bayan taron Berlin a 1885, ya zama tushe don binciken yammacin Afirka ta hanyar masu ] mallaka [ Grand-Bassam ya zama babban birnin Faransa Colonie de Cote d'Ivoire daga 1893 har zuwa 1900. [1]

items.sourceText: Federal outlawing of importation of slaves to the United States was enacted in 1807. The domestic trade and owning of slaves became illegal in the entire U.S. with the Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution in 1865 following the American Civil War.

targets.targetText: An kafa dokar hana shigo da bayi zuwa Amurka a cikin 1807. Kasuwancin cikin gida da mallakar bayi ya zama doka a duk faɗin Amurka tare da Kwaskwarima na Goma Sha Uku ga Tsarin Mulkin Amurka a 1865 bayan Yaƙin Basasa na Amurka .

An kafa dokar hana shigo da bayi zuwa Amurka a cikin shekarar 1807. Kasuwancin cikin gida da mallakar bayi ya zama doka a duk faɗin Amurka tare da Kwaskwarima na Goma Sha Uku ga Tsarin Mulkin Amurka a shekara ta 1865 bayan Yaƙin Basasa na Amurka.

items.sourceText: Between 859 and 861 a Viking fleet of 62 ships, led by Hastein and Björn Ironside sailed from the Loire to raid in the Mediterranean, including North Africa.

targets.targetText: Tsakanin 859 da 861 jirgin Viking na jiragen ruwa 62, karkashin jagorancin Hastein da Björn Ironside sun tashi daga Loire don kai hari a cikin Bahar Rum, ciki har da Arewacin Afirka.
Tsakanin shekarun 859 da 861 jirgin Viking na jiragen ruwa 62, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Hastein da Björn Ironside sun tashi daga Loire don kai hari a cikin Bahar Rum, ciki har da Arewacin Afirka.

items.sourceText: From 1894 the colony's executive branch was run by the BSAC's administrator. The Southern Rhodesia Order in Council created a quasi-legislature called the Southern Rhodesia Legislative Council. Elections were held in 1899, 1902, 1905, 1908, 1911, 1914 and 1920.

targets.targetText: Daga 1894 reshen zartarwa na BSAC ne ke tafiyar da shi . Dokar Kudancin Rhodesia a cikin Majalisar ta ƙirƙiri wata majalissar dokoki mai suna Southern Rhodesia Legislative Council. An gudanar da zaɓe a 1899, 1902, 1905, 1908, 1911, 1914 da 1920.

Daga shekarun 1894 reshen zartarwa na BSAC ne ke tafiyar da shi. Dokar Kudancin Rhodesia a cikin Majalisar ta ƙirƙiri wata majalissar dokoki mai suna Southern Rhodesia Legislative Council. An gudanar da zaɓe a shekarun 1899, 1902, 1905, 1908, 1911, 1914 da 1920.

items.sourceText: Mourad Didouche (Arabic: مراد ديدوش; 1927–1955) was an Algerian revolutionary, and a political and military figure of the Algerian War of Independence.

targets.targetText: Mourad Didouche (1927-1955) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Aljeriya, kuma ɗan siyasa da soja na Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya.
Mourad Didouche ( Arabic ; 1927-1955) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Aljeriya, kuma ɗan siyasa da soja na Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya .

items.sourceText: Zbiri served in the Algerian People's National Army as a colonel, the highest rank that existed during the regime of Houari Boumédiène, the second head of the state.[2] Zbiri led an unsuccessful coup attempt against president Houari Boumédiène in 1967 after participating in the 1965 military takeover.[2]

targets.targetText: Zbiri ya yi aiki a rundunar sojojin kasar Aljeriya a matsayin kanar, matsayi mafi girma da ya wanzu a zamanin gwamnatin Houari Boumédiène, shugaban kasa na biyu . [1] Zbiri ya jagoranci yunkurin juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba kan shugaba Houari Boumédiène a shekara ta 1967 bayan ya shiga hannun sojoji a 1965 . [2]

Zbiri ya yi aiki a rundunar sojojin ƙasar Aljeriya a matsayin kanar, matsayi mafi girma da ya wanzu a zamanin gwamnatin Houari Boumédiène, shugaban ƙasa na biyu. [1] Zbiri ya jagoranci yunkurin juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba kan shugaba Houari Boumédiène a shekara ta 1967 bayan ya shiga hannun sojoji a shekarar 1965. [2]

items.sourceText: Alves was delegated to the Congress, where he gave the impression of being an instransigent Maoist, violently denouncing the factional leader Daniel Chipenda for his Eastern Revolt. Although his interjections won the support of MPLA leader Agostinho Neto, Alves' speeches also lay the foundations of his own divergence from the movement's leadership, as he vocally expressed his desire for the Angolan Revolution to be one of black power.[5] At the subsequent Inter-Regional Conference of Militants, held in the liberated territories of Eastern Angola, Alves called for a "struggle against the bourgeoisie", which he identified in racial terms as White Angolans. Alves' anti-White policies were rejected by the MPLA majority, which upheld multiracialism.[5]

targets.targetText: An wakilta Alves zuwa Majalisa, inda ya ba da ra'ayi na kasancewa Maoist mai ra'ayin mazan jiya, yana mai da martani da kakkausar suka ga shugaban kungiyar Daniel Chipenda kan Tawayen Gabashinsa . Ko da yake shisshigin nasa sun sami goyon bayan shugaban MPLA Agostinho Neto, jawaban Alves ya kuma kafa tushe na banbance-banbancensa da shugabancin kungiyar, yayin da ya bayyana ra'ayinsa na neman juyin juya halin Angola ya zama daya daga cikin masu karfin bakar fata . [ 5 ] A taron tsagerun yankin da ya biyo baya, da aka gudanar a yankunan da aka kwato na gabashin Angola, Alves ya yi kira da a yi yaki da 'yan burguza, wanda ya bayyana a matsayin fararen fata na Angolan . Mafi rinjayen MPLA sun ƙi manufofin Alves na adawa da fararen fata, waɗanda suka goyi bayan bambancin launin fata . [ 5 ]

An wakilta Alves zuwa Majalisa, inda ya ba da ra'ayi na kasancewa Maoist mai ra'ayin mazan jiya, yana mai da martani da kakkausar suka ga shugaban kungiyar Daniel Chipenda kan Tawayen Gabashinsa. Ko da yake shisshigin nasa sun sami goyon bayan shugaban MPLA Agostinho Neto, jawaban Alves ya kuma kafa tushe na bambance-bambancensa da shugabancin kungiyar, yayin da ya bayyana ra'ayinsa na neman juyin juya halin Angola ya zama ɗaya daga cikin masu karfi na bakar fata. [ 5 ] A taron tsagerun yankin da ya biyo baya, da aka gudanar a yankunan da aka kwato na gabashin Angola, Alves ya yi kira da a yi yaki da 'yan burguza, wanda ya bayyana a matsayin fararen fata na Angolan. Mafi rinjayen MPLA sun ƙi manufofin Alves na adawa da fararen fata, waɗanda suka goyi bayan bambancin launin fata. [ 5 ]

items.sourceText: He was acting president of Angola for ten days, from 10 September 1979 to 20 September 1979, briefly leading the country between the death of Agostinho Neto and the inauguration of José Eduardo dos Santos.[citation needed] He was a member of the Angolan parliament from independence until 2003.[2][3]

targets.targetText: Ya kasance shugaban kasar Angola na riko na tsawon kwanaki goma, daga 10 ga Satumba 1979 zuwa 20 ga Satumba 1979, a takaice ya jagoranci kasar tsakanin mutuwar Agostinho Neto da rantsar da José Eduardo dos Santos . Ya kasance memba na majalisar dokokin Angola daga 'yancin kai har zuwa ] [ [ [1] [2]

Ya kasance shugaban ƙasar Angola na riƙo na tsawon kwanaki goma, daga 10 ga Satumba 1979 zuwa 20 ga Satumba 1979, a takaice ya jagoranci ƙasar tsakanin mutuwar Agostinho Neto da rantsar da José Eduardo dos Santos. Ya kasance memba na majalisar dokokin Angola daga 'yancin kai har zuwa shekara ta 2003. ] [ [ [1] [2]

items.sourceText: After leaving a political career, Lara dedicated himself to organizing his historical and documental collection about the independence process and the formation of Angola, creating the Tchiweka Documentation Association (ATD).[20] In 1996 he released the memoir "For a broad movement…", with a preface by his wife Ruth.[2]

targets.targetText: Bayan ya bar aikin siyasa, Lara ya sadaukar da kansa don tsara tarihin tarihinsa da takardun shaida game da tsarin 'yancin kai da kuma samuwar Angola, yana samar da Ƙungiyar Takardun Takardun Tchiweka (ATD). [1] A cikin 1996 ya fito da abin tunawa "Don faɗuwar motsi…", tare da gabatarwar matarsa Ruth. [2]

Bayan ya bar aikin siyasa, Lara ya sadaukar da kansa don tsara tarihin tarihinsa da takardun shaida game da tsarin 'yancin kai da kuma samuwar Angola, yana samar da Ƙungiyar Takardun Tchiweka (ATD). [1] A cikin shekarar 1996 ya fito da abin tunawa "Don faɗuwar motsi…", tare da gabatarwar matarsa Ruth. [2]

items.sourceText: Instead he became associated with students from Angola and other Portuguese colonies who were preparing themselves for anti-colonial resistance and had contacts with the clandestine Portuguese Communist Party. He knew Agostinho Neto, who was at that time studying medicine and who later became president of the MPLA and Angola's first state President. Under increasing pressure from the Portuguese secret police (PIDE), Savimbi left Portugal for Switzerland with the assistance of Portuguese and French communists and other sympathizers, and eventually wound up in Lausanne. There he was able to obtain a new scholarship from American missionaries and studied social sciences. He then went to the University of Fribourg for further studies.[a]

targets.targetText: A maimakon haka ya zama yana da alaƙa da ɗalibai daga Angola da sauran ƙasashen Portugal waɗanda ke shirya kansu don adawa da mulkin mallaka kuma suna da alaƙa da jam'iyyar gurguzu ta Portugal ta ɓoye. Ya san Agostinho Neto, wanda a lokacin yana karatun likitanci kuma wanda daga baya ya zama shugaban jam'iyyar MPLA kuma shugaban kasar Angola na farko. Karkashin matsin lamba daga ' yan sandan sirri na Portuguese ( PIDE ), Savimbi ya bar Portugal zuwa Switzerland tare da taimakon 'yan gurguzu na Portugal da Faransanci da sauran masu goyon bayansa, kuma daga bisani ya ji rauni a Lausanne . A nan ya sami damar samun sabon guraben karatu daga mishan na Amurka kuma ya yi karatun kimiyyar zamantakewa. Daga nan sai ya tafi Jami'ar Friborg don ƙarin karatu. [ a ]

Ya san Agostinho Neto, wanda a lokacin yana karatun likitanci kuma wanda daga baya ya zama shugaban jam'iyyar MPLA kuma shugaban ƙasar Angola na farko. Ƙarƙashin matsin lamba daga 'yan sandan sirri na Portuguese (PIDE), Savimbi ya bar Portugal zuwa Switzerland tare da taimakon 'yan gurguzu na Portugal da Faransa da sauran masu goyon bayansa, kuma daga bisani ya ji rauni a Lausanne. A nan ya sami damar samun sabon guraben karatu daga mishan na Amurka kuma ya yi karatun kimiyyar zamantakewa. Daga nan sai ya tafi Jami'ar Friborg don ƙarin karatu. [ a ]

items.sourceText: Abusedra returned to Libya and her alma mater the University of Garyounis in 2010, where she taught at the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering.[2]

targets.targetText: Abusedra ta koma Libiya tare da almajiranta a Jami'ar Garyounis a shekarar 2010, inda ta koyar a Sashen Injiniyancin na Lantarki. [1]
