items.sourceText: Hameidi was born in Surman in 1943. His father owned a farm between Surman and Sabratha. He attended primary school in Surman, secondary school in Zawiya, and graduated from the Benghazi Military University Academy as a second lieutenant in 1965. His first military assignment was with the Royal Battalion in Derna. He was subsequently appointed assistant commander of the 1st Idris Battalion in Sabha and later Tarhuna.[1]

targets.targetText: An haifi Hameidi a Surman a shekara ta 1943. Mahaifinsa ya mallaki gona tsakanin Surman da Sabratha. Ya halarci makarantar firamare a Surman, makarantar sakandare a Zawiya, kuma ya kammala karatu daga Jami'ar Soja ta Benghazi a matsayin Laftanar na biyu a shekarar 1965. Aikin soja na farko shine tare da Royal Battalion a Derna. Daga baya aka naɗa shi mataimakin kwamandan bataliya ta ɗaya Idris a Sabha daga baya kuma Tarhuna. [1]

An haifi Hameidi a Surman a shekara ta 1943. Mahaifinsa ya mallaki gona tsakanin Surman da Sabratha . Ya halarci makarantar firamare a Surman, makarantar sakandare a Zawiya, kuma ya sauke karatu daga Jami'ar Soja ta Benghazi a matsayin Laftanar na biyu a 1965. Aikin soja na farko shine tare da Royal Battalion a Derna . Daga baya aka nada shi mataimakin kwamandan bataliya ta daya Idris a Sabha daga baya kuma Tarhuna . [1]

He fought on the British side of the Allied Forces.[4] and attained the rank of a corporal during his service.[2][5] When he was tried for terrorism in the 1960s he remembered his motivation thusly:[6]

Ya yi yaki a bangaren Birtaniya na rundunar kawance . [1] kuma ya kai matsayin kofur a lokacin hidimarsa. items.sourceText: The family of Hendrik Witbooi made its mark as important members of the Nama tribes. His grandfather, David Witbooi, was Chief of the tribe, who led the tribe across the Orange River into Namaland. His father, Moses Witbooi, was also a Chief of the tribe. His uncle, Jonker Afrikaner, was also a well-known Nama Chief, and opponent of Hendrik Witbooi. Jonker Afrikaner was in turn the son of the famous Jager Afrikaner. Hendrik Witbooi himself had seven sons and five daughters, including his son Isaak Witbooi.

targets.targetText: Iyalin Hendrik Witbooi sun yi tambarinsu a matsayin muhimman mambobi na kabilar Nama . Kakansa, David Witbooi, shi ne Shugaban kabilar, wanda ya jagoranci kabilar ta haye kogin Orange zuwa Namaland. Mahaifinsa, Moses Witbooi, shi ma shugaban kabilar. Kawunsa, Jonker Afrikaner, kuma sanannen Nama Cif ne, kuma abokin adawar Hendrik Witbooi. Jonker Afrikaner shi ne ɗan shahararren Jager Afrikaner . Hendrik Witbooi da kansa yana da 'ya'ya maza bakwai da mata biyar, ciki har da dansa Isaak Witbooi .

Iyalin Hendrik Witbooi sun yi tambarinsu a matsayin muhimman mambobi na ƙabilar Nama. Kakansa, David Witbooi, shi ne Shugaban ƙabilar, wanda ya jagoranci ƙabilar ta haye kogin Orange zuwa Namaland. Mahaifinsa, Moses Witbooi, shi ma shugaban ƙabilar. Kawunsa, Jonker Afrikaner, kuma sanannen Nama Cif ne, kuma abokin adawar Hendrik Witbooi. Jonker Afrikaner shi ne ɗan shahararren Jager Afrikaner. Hendrik Witbooi da kansa yana da 'ya'ya maza bakwai da mata biyar, ciki har da ɗansa Isaak Witbooi.

items.sourceText: Ishwarlal Laloo "Isu" Chiba (5 November 1930 – 8 December 2017) was a South African politician and revolutionary. He was arrested and sentenced at the Little Rivonia Trial in 1964 with Mac Maharaj and Wilton Mkwayi to join Nelson Mandela, Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki and other revolutionary prisoners on Robben Island.[1]

targets.targetText: Ishwarlal Laloo "Isu" Chiba (5 Nuwamba 1930 - 8 Disamba 2017) ɗan siyasan Afirka ta Kudu ne kuma mai neman sauyi. An kama shi kuma aka yanke masa hukunci a Kotun Little Rivonia a 1964 tare da Mac Maharaj da Wilton Mkwayi don shiga Nelson Mandela, Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki da sauran fursunonin juyin juya hali a tsibirin Robben . [1]

Ishwarlal Laloo "Isu" Chiba (5 Nuwamba 1930 - 8 Disamba 2017) ɗan siyasan Afirka ta Kudu ne kuma mai neman sauyi ɗan juyin juya hali. An kama shi kuma aka yanke masa hukunci a Kotun Little Rivonia a shekarar 1964 tare da Mac Maharaj da Wilton Mkwayi don shiga Nelson Mandela, Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki da sauran fursunonin juyin juya hali a tsibirin Robben. [1]

items.sourceText: Upon the ANC's legalization in 1990, he became the president of its Lenasia branch.[1] He was elected to South Africa's parliament in 1994 and 1999.[3] In 2004 he was named a member of the Order of Luthuli in silver.[3] He was a board member of the Ahmed Kathrada Foundation.[2]

targets.targetText: Bayan da ANC ta halatta a 1990, ya zama shugaban reshen Lenasia. [1] An zabe shi a majalisar dokokin Afirka ta Kudu a 1994 da 1999. [2] A 2004 an nada shi memba na Order of Luthuli a azurfa. [2] Ya kasance memba na hukumar Ahmed Kathrada Foundation . [1]

Bayan da ANC ta halatta a shekarar 1990, ya zama shugaban reshen Lenasia. [1] An zaɓe shi a majalisar dokokin Afirka ta Kudu a shekarar 1994 da 1999. [2] A shekarar 2004 an naɗa shi memba na Order of Luthuli a azurfa. [2] Ya kasance memba na hukumar Ahmed Kathrada Foundation. [1]

items.sourceText: Elias Motsoaledi was born on 26 July 1924, the third of eight children, in Phokoane in the Nebo District in Sekhukuneland, now Limpopo. He moved to Johannesburg at the age of 17 in search of work. His first brush with the law in Johannesburg was his arrest for failure to produce his pass book, and he was sentenced to work on the construction of a road in Pretoria.

targets.targetText: An haifi Elias Motsoaledi a ranar 26 ga Yuli 1924, na uku cikin yara takwas, a Phokoane a gundumar Nebo a Sekhukuneland, yanzu Limpopo . Ya koma Johannesburg yana dan shekara 17 don neman aiki. Buga na farko da ya yi da doka a Johannesburg shi ne kama shi saboda rashin fitar da littafin sa na fasfo, kuma an yanke masa hukuncin yin aikin gina titi a Pretoria .

An haifi Elias Motsoaledi a ranar 26 ga watan Yuli 1924, na uku cikin yara takwas, a Phokoane a gundumar Nebo a Sekhukuneland, yanzu Limpopo. Ya koma Johannesburg yana ɗan shekara 17 don neman aiki. Buga na farko da ya yi da doka a Johannesburg shi ne kama shi saboda rashin fitar da littafin sa na fasfo, kuma an yanke masa hukuncin yin aikin gina titi a Pretoria.

items.sourceText: At eighteen years old, Mujuru was the only woman who trained in Lusaka.[1] After completing two years of secondary education, she decided to join the Rhodesian Bush War. She is said to have downed a helicopter with a machine gun on 17 February 1974 after refusing to flee. The helicopter downing incident has been vehemently denied by War Veterans chairman, Christopher Mutsvangwa after her expulsion from the party; other ballistic experts have also questioned the possibility of shooting down a helicopter with such a light weapon as narrated on her story.[2] By 1975, she was the political instructor of two successful military bases. At 21, Mujuru was camp commander at the Chimoio military and refugee camp in Mozambique.[1]

targets.targetText: Mujuru tana da shekara goma sha takwas, ita kaɗai ce macen da ta yi horo a Lusaka. [1] Bayan ta kammala karatun sakandare na shekaru biyu, ta yanke shawarar shiga yakin Bush na Rhodesia. An ce ta faɗi wani jirgin sama mai saukar ungulu da bindiga a ranar 17 ga watan Fabrairun 1974 bayan ta ki guduwa. Shugaban Sojojin Yaki, Christopher Mutsvangwa ya musanta kakkausar murya kan faɗuwar jirgin mai saukar ungulu bayan fitar ta daga jam’iyyar; Haka kuma wasu masana harkar ballistic sun nuna shakku kan yiwuwar harbo jirgi mai saukar ungulu da irin wannan makami mai haske kamar yadda aka ruwaito kan labarinta. [2] A shekarar 1975, ta kasance malamar siyasa na sansanonin soja guda biyu masu nasara. A shekarunta 21, Mujuru ta kasance kwamandan sansanin a Chimoio sojoji da sansanin 'yan gudun hijira a Mozambique. [1]

Mujuru tana da shekara goma sha takwas, ita kaɗai ce macen da ta yi horo a Lusaka . [1] Bayan ta kammala karatun sakandare na shekaru biyu, ta yanke shawarar shiga yakin Bush na Rhodesia . An ce ta fadi wani jirgin sama mai saukar ungulu da bindiga a ranar 17 ga Fabrairun 1974 bayan ta ki guduwa. Shugaban Sojojin Yaki, Christopher Mutsvangwa ya musanta kakkausar murya kan faduwar jirgin mai saukar ungulu bayan fitar ta daga jam’iyyar; Haka kuma wasu masana harkar ballistic sun nuna shakku kan yiwuwar harbo jirgi mai saukar ungulu da irin wannan makami mai haske kamar yadda aka ruwaito kan labarinta. [2] A shekarar 1975, ta kasance malamin siyasa na sansanonin soja guda biyu masu nasara. A 21, Mujuru ya kasance kwamandan sansanin a Chimoio sojoji da sansanin 'yan gudun hijira a Mozambique . [1]

items.sourceText: The Ifni War, sometimes called the Forgotten War (la Guerra Olvidada) in Spain, was a series of armed incursions into Spanish West Africa by Moroccan insurgents that began in November 1957 and culminated with the abortive siege of Sidi Ifni.

targets.targetText: Yakin Ifni, wani lokaci ana kiransa Yaƙin Manta ( la Guerra Olvida ) a ƙasar Sipaniya, wani jerin kutse ne da makami da 'yan tawayen Moroko suka yi a Afirka ta Yamma , wanda ya fara a watan Nuwamba 1957 kuma ya ƙare da ƙulla Sidi Ifni .

Yakin Ifni, wani lokaci ana kiransa Yaƙin Manta (la Guerra Olvida) a ƙasar Sipaniya, wani jerin kutse ne da makami da 'yan tawayen Moroko suka yi a Afirka ta Yamma, wanda ya fara a watan Nuwamba 1957 kuma ya ƙare da kama Sidi Ifni.

items.sourceText: France wanted to control Bouna while keeping Samory and the British apart. Capt. Paul Braulot [fr] came south from the Niger bend to attempt to negotiate a protectorate agreement but was rebuffed, as Toure wanted only to live apart from the French. In April 1897, British Governor William Edward Maxwell of the Gold Coast tried to intimidate Saranken Mori, Samory's son and the commander in the region, into abandoning Bouna. When this failed, a force of the Southern Nigeria Regiment under Henderson marched on the town but were defeated at Dokita, then later routed and Henderson was captured at Wa.[1]: 117–8

targets.targetText: Faransa ta so ta mallaki Bouna yayin da ta keɓe Samory da Birtaniya. Kyaftin Paul Braulot [ fr ] ya zo kudu daga Nijar ya lankwasa don yin yunƙurin yin shawarwarin yarjejeniyar tsaro amma ya ƙi, saboda Toure yana so kawai ya zauna ban da Faransa. A watan Afrilun 1897, Gwamnan Birtaniya William Edward Maxwell na Gold Coast ya yi ƙoƙari ya tsorata Saranken Mori, ɗan Samory kuma kwamandan yankin, ya watsar da Bouna. Lokacin da abin ya faskara, sai dakarun Rundunar Sojojin Kudancin Najeriya ƙarƙashin Henderson suka mamaye garin amma an fatattake su a Dokta, daga bisani kuma aka kama Henderson a Wa. [1] : 117-8

Faransa ta so ta mallaki Bouna yayin da ta kebe Samory da Birtaniya. Kyaftin Paul Braulot [ fr ] ya zo kudu daga Nijar ya lankwasa don yin yunƙurin yin shawarwarin yarjejeniyar tsaro amma ya ƙi, saboda Toure yana so kawai ya zauna ban da Faransanci. A watan Afrilun 1897, Gwamnan Birtaniya William Edward Maxwell na Gold Coast ya yi ƙoƙari ya tsorata Saranken Mori, ɗan Samory kuma kwamandan yankin, ya watsar da Bouna. Lokacin da abin ya faskara, sai dakarun Rundunar Sojojin Kudancin Najeriya karkashin Henderson suka mamaye garin amma an fatattake su a Dokta, daga bisani kuma aka kama Henderson a Wa . [1] : 117-8

items.sourceText: Verónica Guterres Kangala Kingwanda (Cangala Quinguanda in contemporary spelling; died 1721) was the ruler of the joint kingdom of Ndongo and Matamba, 1681–1721.

targets.targetText: Verónica Guterres Kangala Kingwanda ( Cangala Quinguanda a cikin rubutun zamani; ya mutu a shekara ta 1721) shine mai mulkin masarautar hadin gwiwa ta Ndongo da Matamba, 1681-1721.
Verónica Guterres Kangala Kingwanda (Cangala Quinguanda a cikin rubutun zamani; ta mutu a shekara ta 1721) ita ce mai mulkin masarautar haɗin gwiwa ta Ndongo da Matamba, 1681-1721.

items.sourceText: The First Franco-Dahomean War was fought in 1890 between France, led by General Alfred-Amédée Dodds, and Dahomey under King Béhanzin.

targets.targetText: An yi yakin Franco-Dahomean na farko a shekara ta 1890 tsakanin Faransa ƙarƙashin jagorancin Janar Alfred-Amédée Dodds, da Dahomey ƙarƙashin Sarki Béhanzin.
An yi yakin Franco-Dahomean na farko a cikin 1890 tsakanin Faransa, karkashin jagorancin Janar Alfred-Amédée Dodds, da Dahomey a ƙarƙashin Sarki Béhanzin .

items.sourceText: Cheikh Bouamama was a leader of the tribe Awlad Sidi Shaykh.[6] The resistance that he led in the southwest of Algeria from 1881 to 1908.[6][7]

targets.targetText: Cheikh Bouamama shugaban ƙabilar Awlad Sidi Shaykh. [ 6 ] Juriyar/gwagwarmayar da ya jagoranta a kudu maso yammacin Aljeriya daga shekarun 1881 zuwa 1908. [ 6 ] [ 7 ].
Cheikh Bouamama shugaban kabilar Awlad Sidi Shaykh . [ 6 ] Juriyar da ya jagoranta a kudu maso yammacin Aljeriya daga 1881 zuwa 1908. [ 6 ] [ 7 ].

items.sourceText: After being educated in his youth at the Tiger Kloof Educational Institute in South Africa, Khama attended Fort Hare University College there, graduating with a general B.A. in 1944. He travelled to the United Kingdom and studied for a year at Balliol College, Oxford. He next joined the Inner Temple in London in 1946, to study to become a barrister.[9]

targets.targetText: Bayan samun ilimi a lokacin kuruciyarsa a Cibiyar Ilimi ta Tiger Kloof a Afirka ta Kudu, Khama ya halarci Kwalejin Jami'ar Fort Hare a can, inda ya kammala karatunsa na BA a 1944. Ya yi tafiya zuwa Ingila kuma ya yi karatu na tsawon shekara a Balliol College, Oxford . Daga baya ya shiga Haikali na ciki a Landan a cikin 1946, don yin karatu don zama barrister . [1]

Bayan samun ilimi a lokacin ƙuruciyarsa a Cibiyar Ilimi ta Tiger Kloof a Afirka ta Kudu, Khama ya halarci Kwalejin Jami'ar Fort Hare a can, inda ya kammala karatunsa na BA a shekarar 1944. Ya yi tafiya zuwa Ingila kuma ya yi karatu na tsawon shekara a Balliol College, Oxford. Daga baya ya shiga Haikali na ciki a Landan a cikin shekarar 1946, don yin karatu don zama barrister. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1947, he became a founding member of the United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) and was one of the "Big Six" (the others being Ebenezer Ako-Adjei, Joseph Boakye Danquah, Kwame Nkrumah, Emmanuel Obetsebi-Lamptey and William Ofori Atta) detained after disturbances in Accra in 1948.[1] From 1949 to 1950, he was a member of the Gold Coast Legislative Council and the Coussey Constitutional Commission.[2]

targets.targetText: A 1947, ya zama memba na kafa United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) kuma yana daya daga cikin " Big shida " (sauran sune Ebenezer Ako-Adjei, Joseph Boakye Danquah, Kwame Nkrumah, Emmanuel Obetsebi-Lamptey da William Ofori Atta ) da aka tsare bayan tashin hankali a Accra a [1] Daga 1949 zuwa 1950, ya kasance memba na Majalisar Dokokin Gold Coast da Hukumar Tsarin Mulki ta Coussey. [2]

A shekarar 1947, ya zama memba na kafa United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) kuma yana daya daga cikin "Big Six" (sauran sune Ebenezer Ako-Adjei, Joseph Boakye Danquah, Kwame Nkrumah, Emmanuel Obetsebi-Lamptey da William Ofori Atta) da aka tsare bayan tashin hankali a Accra a [1] Daga shekarun 1949 zuwa 1950, ya kasance memba na Majalisar Dokokin Gold Coast da Hukumar Tsarin Mulki ta Coussey. [2]

items.sourceText: Bibi Titi Mohammad began her public career as the lead singer in a ngoma (a dance and music group), where she celebrated the birth of the prophet Mohammed during Maulidi. In the 1950s, after World War II, she started to get involved with the nationalist movement in Tanzania and on July 7, 1954, TANU was created by Julius Nyerere. She became a close friend of his, after being introduced to him in 1954 by the driver of a family cab.[4]

targets.targetText: Bibi Titi Mohammad ta fara sana'ar ta a bainar jama'a a matsayin jagorar mawaƙa a cikin ngoma (ƙungiyar rawa da kiɗa), inda ta yi bikin maulidin annabi Mohammed (S) a lokacin Maulidi. A cikin shekarar 1950s, bayan yakin duniya na biyu, ta fara shiga cikin gwagwarmayar kishin ƙasa a Tanzaniya kuma a ranar 7 ga Yuli, 1954, Julius Nyerere ya kirkiro TANU. Ta zama amininsa na kud da kud, bayan da direban taksi na iyali ya gabatar da shi a shekarar 1954. [1]

Bibi Titi Mohammad ta fara sana'ar ta a bainar jama'a a matsayin jagorar mawaƙa a cikin ngoma (ƙungiyar rawa da kiɗa), inda ta yi bikin maulidin annabi Mohammed a lokacin Maulidi . A cikin 1950s, bayan yakin duniya na biyu, ta fara shiga cikin gwagwarmayar kishin kasa a Tanzaniya kuma a ranar 7 ga Yuli, 1954, Julius Nyerere ya kirkiro TANU . Ta zama amininsa na kud da kud, bayan da direban taksi na iyali ya gabatar da shi a 1954. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1966, Kapolo was arrested with other prominent members of SWAPO following the battle of Omugulugwombashe. He was detained without trial and held in solitary confinement in Pretoria, South Africa for more than a year. Kapolo died in police custody in 1967 during the "terrorism trial":[2] The State vs. Tuhadeleni and Others.[3][4][5]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1966, an kama Kapolo tare da wasu manyan 'yan kungiyar SWAPO bayan yakin Omugulugwombashe. An tsare shi ba tare da an gurfanar da shi a gaban kotu ba kuma an tsare shi a gidan yari a keɓe a birnin Pretoria na Afirka ta Kudu fiye da shekara guda. Kapolo ya mutu a hannun 'yan sanda a shekarar 1967 a lokacin "shara'ar ta'addanci": [1] Jiha da Tuhadeleni da sauransu. [2] [3] [4]

A cikin 1966, an kama Kapolo tare da wasu manyan 'yan kungiyar SWAPO bayan yakin Omugulugwombashe . An tsare shi ba tare da an gurfanar da shi a gaban kotu ba kuma an tsare shi a gidan yari a keɓe a birnin Pretoria na Afirka ta Kudu fiye da shekara guda. Kapolo ya mutu a hannun 'yan sanda a shekarar 1967 a lokacin "shara'ar ta'addanci": [1] Jiha da Tuhadeleni da sauransu . [2] [3] [4]

items.sourceText: Under the pseudonyms Kalungano and Lilinho Micaia, he published his early poems in O Brado Africano, and his work appeared in two anthologies produced by the Casa dos Estudantes do Imperio in Lisbon. Under the pen-name Lilinho Micaia, a collection of his poetry was published in the Soviet Union. Under his real name, he had a book published by the Associação dos Escritores Moçambicanos (Mozambican Writers' Association) in 1987, entitled Canto do Amor Natural.

targets.targetText: Karkashin sunaye na Kalungano da Lilinho Micaia, ya buga wakokinsa na farko a cikin O Brado Africano, kuma aikinsa ya bayyana a cikin litattafai biyu na Casa dos Estudantes do Impero a Lisbon . A karkashin sunan alkalami Lilinho Micaia, an buga tarin wakokinsa a Tarayyar Soviet. A ƙarƙashin sunansa na ainihi, yana da littafi wanda Associação dos Escritores Moçambicanos (Ƙungiyar Marubuta ta Mozambique) ta buga a cikin 1987, mai suna Canto do Amor Natural .

Ƙarƙashin sunaye na Kalungano da Lilinho Micaia, ya buga wakokinsa na farko a cikin O Brado Africano, kuma aikinsa ya bayyana a cikin litattafai biyu na Casa dos Estudantes do Impero a Lisbon. A ƙarƙashin sunan alkalami Lilinho Micaia, an buga tarin wakokinsa a Tarayyar Soviet. A ƙarƙashin sunansa na ainihi, yana da littafi wanda Associação dos Escritores Moçambicanos (Ƙungiyar Marubuta ta Mozambique) ta buga a cikin shekarar 1987, mai suna Canto do Amor Natural.

items.sourceText: Uria Timoteo Simango (15 March 1926 - c. October 1979)[1] was a Mozambican Presbyterian minister and prominent leader of the Mozambique Liberation Front (FRELIMO) during the liberation struggle against Portuguese colonial rule. His precise date of death is unknown as he was extrajudicially executed along with several other FRELIMO dissidents and his wife, Celina[2] by the post-independence government of Samora Machel.

targets.targetText: Uria Timothy Simango (15 Maris 1926 - c. Oktoba 1979) [1] ya kasance ministan Presbyterian Mozambique kuma fitaccen jagoran kungiyar yaƙin neman 'Yancin Mozambique (FRELIMO) a lokacin gwagwarmayar 'yantar daga hannun 'yan mulkin mallaka na Portugal. Ba a san takamaiman ranar mutuwarsa ba yayin da aka kashe shi ba bisa ka'ida ba tare da wasu 'yan adawa na FRELIMO da matarsa, Celina [2] ta gwamnatin bayan samun 'yancin kai ta Samora Machel.

Uria Timothy Simango (15 Maris 1926 - c. Oktoba 1979) [1] ya kasance ministan Presbyterian Mozambique kuma fitaccen jagoran kungiyar 'Yancin Mozambique ( FRELIMO ) a lokacin gwagwarmayar 'yantar da mulkin mallaka na Portugal . Ba a san takamaiman ranar mutuwarsa ba yayin da aka kashe shi ba bisa ka'ida ba tare da wasu 'yan adawa na FRELIMO da matarsa, Celina [2] ta gwamnatin bayan samun 'yancin kai ta Samora Machel .

items.sourceText: Hilary Teague also served as a Baptist minister in Monrovia and was a merchant trading in palm oil.[7] In 1835, Teague became the owner and editor of the Liberia Herald in Monrovia after John Brown Russwurm left to become governor of the Republic of Maryland.[2] As editor, Teague became a dedicated promoter of Liberian independence and combined republicanism, black nationalism, and Christianity to make his case.[8] He remained the newspaper's head until 1849, when he left to devote full attention to politics.[3]

targets.targetText: Hilary Teague kuma ta yi hidima a matsayin mai hidimar Baptist a Monrovia kuma ɗan kasuwa ne da ke cinikin dabino . [1] A cikin 1835, Teague ya zama mai shi kuma editan Laberiya Herald a Monrovia bayan John Brown Russwurm ya bar zama gwamnan Jamhuriyar Maryland . [2] A matsayin edita, Teague ya zama mai sadaukar da kai ga 'yancin kai na Laberiya kuma ya haɗu da jumhuriya, baƙar fata, da Kiristanci don gabatar da shari'arsa. [3] Ya kasance shugaban jarida har zuwa 1849, lokacin da ya tafi don ba da cikakkiyar hankali ga siyasa. [2]

Hilary Teague kuma ya yi hidima a matsayin mai hidimar Baptist a Monrovia kuma ɗan kasuwa ne da ke cinikin dabino. [1] A cikin shekarar 1835, Teague ya zama mai shi kuma editan Laberiya Herald a Monrovia bayan John Brown Russwurm ya bar zama gwamnan Jamhuriyar Maryland. [2] A matsayin edita, Teague ya zama mai sadaukar da kai ga 'yancin kai na Laberiya kuma ya haɗu da jumhuriya, baƙar fata, da Kiristanci don gabatar da shari'arsa. [3] Ya kasance shugaban jarida har zuwa shekara ta 1849, lokacin da ya tafi don ba da cikakkiyar hankali ga siyasa. [2]

items.sourceText: In 1821, during the Mfecane, the town was sacked by the Batlokwa under the warrior queen Mantatisi. The attack was followed round 1823 by another under Sebetwane and the Bafokeng tribe. The survivors fled west and sought sanctuary among the Bakwena and other Tswana tribes.[4] Crumbling stone walls, foundations, ash middens and remains of a metal working industry are the only evidence of the settlement's previous existence. In 2011 the ruins were declared a National Heritage Site by the Government.[5][6]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 1821, a lokacin Mfecane, Batlokwa ya kori garin a ƙarƙashin sarauniya Mantatisi. An kai harin a wurin shekarar 1823 a wani ƙarƙashin Sebetwane da ƙabilar Bafokeng. Waɗanda suka tsira sun gudu zuwa yamma suka nemi mafaka a tsakanin Bakwena da sauran ƙabilun Tswana. [1] Rugujewar bangon dutse, harsashi, ash middens da ragowar masana'antar aikin ƙarfe sune kaɗai shaidar wanzuwar sulhu a baya. A shekarar 2011 gwamnati ta ayyana rugujewar a matsayin Gidan Tarihi na Ƙasa. [2] [3]

A cikin 1821, a lokacin Mfecane, Batlokwa ya kori garin a ƙarƙashin sarauniya Mantatisi . An kai harin a zagaye na 1823 da wani karkashin Sebetwane da kabilar Bafokeng . Wadanda suka tsira sun gudu zuwa yamma suka nemi mafaka a tsakanin Bakwena da sauran kabilun Tswana. [1] Rugujewar bangon dutse, harsashi, ash middens da ragowar masana'antar aikin ƙarfe sune kaɗai shaidar wanzuwar sulhu a baya. A shekarar 2011 gwamnati ta ayyana rugujewar a matsayin Gidan Tarihi na Kasa. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Popular with the fighters, Mesfin served as the defence minister of Eritrea in the 1990s. He was fired in 2001 for joining the G-15 (Eritrea), but was out of Eritrea for medical treatment and managed to escape detention[3] In 2013, Mesfin sought asylum in Germany after his colleagues opposing the President were hunted down.[4] As of December 2020[update], Mesfin lived in Germany.[3]

targets.targetText: Shahararren mayaƙan, Mesfin ya kasance ministan tsaro na Eritrea a shekarun 1990. An kore shi a cikin 2001 saboda shiga G-15 (Eritrea), amma ya fita daga Eritrea don jinya kuma ya sami nasarar tserewa daga tsare A cikin 2013, Mesfin ya nemi mafaka a Jamus bayan da aka kama abokan aikinsa da ke adawa da shugaban. [1] As of December 2020 , Mesfin ya zauna a Jamus.

Shahararren mayaƙin, Mesfin ya kasance ministan tsaro na Eritrea a shekarun 1990. An kore shi a cikin shekarar 2001 saboda shiga G-15 (Eritrea), amma ya fita daga Eritrea don jinya kuma ya sami nasarar tserewa daga tsarewar. A cikin shekarar 2013, Mesfin ya nemi mafaka a Jamus bayan da aka kama abokan aikinsa da ke adawa da shugaban. [1] As of December 2020 , Mesfin ya zauna a Jamus.

items.sourceText: Mohamed Harbi (born June 16, 1933) is an Algerian historian who was a member of the National Liberation Front (Algeria) (FLN) during the Algerian War of Independence.

targets.targetText: Mohamed Harbi (an haife shi a watan Yuni 16, 1933) ɗan tarihi ne na Aljeriya wanda ya kasance memba na Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Ƙasa (Algeria) (FLN) a lokacin Yaƙin 'Yancin Aljeriya .

Mohamed Harbi (an haife shi a watan Yuni 16, 1933) masanin tarihi ne na Aljeriya wanda ya kasance memba na Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Ƙasa ta (Algeria) (FLN) a lokacin Yaƙin neman 'Yancin kai na ƙasar Aljeriya.

items.sourceText: He took part in resistance of colonial rule starting in 1953 and wrote articles related to nationalism including the review Claridade. In February 1956, along with other writers from Angola and Mozambique, he took part in the First Congress of Black Writers in Paris. In, 1957, he went to Dakar, Senegal with the militants helping their independence movement in Senegal, later he visited Bissau together with other nationalists. He worked with and was later married to Dulce Almada.[2]

targets.targetText: Ya shiga cikin juriya na mulkin mallaka tun daga 1953 kuma ya rubuta labaran da suka shafi kishin kasa ciki har da bita Claridade . A watan Fabrairun 1956, tare da wasu marubuta daga Angola da Mozambique, ya halarci taron farko na Marubuta bakar fata a birnin Paris. A cikin 1957, ya tafi Dakar, Senegal tare da masu fafutuka na taimaka musu 'yancin kai a Senegal, daga baya ya ziyarci Bissau tare da sauran masu kishin kasa. Ya yi aiki tare kuma daga baya ya auri Dulce Almada . [1]

Ya shiga cikin tawaye ga 'yan mulkin mallaka tun daga shekarar 1953 kuma ya rubuta labaran da suka shafi kishin ƙasa ciki har da bita Claridade. A watan Fabrairun 1956, tare da wasu marubuta daga Angola da Mozambique, ya halarci taron farko na Marubuta bakar fata a birnin Paris. A cikin shekarar 1957, ya tafi Dakar, Senegal tare da masu fafutuka na taimaka musu 'yancin kai a Senegal, daga baya ya ziyarci Bissau tare da sauran masu kishin ƙasa. Ya yi aiki tare kuma daga baya ya auri Dulce Almada. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1957, Sahrawis began to enroll in the Moroccan Army of Liberation and launched attacks against French positions in southwestern Algeria and the extreme north of Mauritania, capitalizing on Western Sahara’s strategic location. In Western Sahara itself, by the end of 1957, the Sahrawi contingent of the guerilla movement forced the Spanish army to retreat near Sidi Ifni.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1957, Sahrawis ya fara shiga cikin Rundunar 'Yancin Moroccan kuma ta kaddamar da hare-hare a kan wuraren Faransanci a kudu maso yammacin Aljeriya da kuma iyakar arewacin Mauritania, wanda ya yi amfani da kyakkyawan wuri na yammacin Sahara. A Yammacin Sahara da kanta, a ƙarshen 1957, ƙungiyar Sahrawi na ƙungiyar 'yan tawaye ta tilastawa sojojin Spain ja da baya kusa da Sidi Ifni . [1]

A cikin shekarar 1957, Sahrawis ta fara shiga cikin Rundunar 'Yancin Moroccan kuma ta kaddamar da hare-hare a kan wuraren Faransa a kudu maso yammacin Aljeriya da kuma iyakar arewacin Mauritania, wanda ya yi amfani da kyakkyawan wuri na yammacin Sahara. A Yammacin Sahara da kanta, a ƙarshen 1957, ƙungiyar Sahrawi na ƙungiyar 'yan tawaye ta tilastawa sojojin Spain ja da baya kusa da Sidi Ifni. [1]

items.sourceText: Sheikh Mohamed El-Mokrani (Arabic: الشيخ محمد المقراني‎; Kabyle: Lḥaǧ Muḥend n Ḥmed n At-Meqqran;[1] d. 1871), also known as Mohand Amokrane, was one of the principal leaders and the namesake of the Mokrani Revolt of 1871 against the French occupation of Algeria.

targets.targetText: Sheikh Mohamed El-Mokrani ( ‎ [1] d. 1871), wanda kuma aka fi sani da Mohand Amokrane, ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin manyan shugabanni kuma mai suna Mokrani Revolt na shekarar 1871 a kan mamayar Faransa a Aljeriya.

Sheikh Mohamed El-Mokrani ( Arabic ‎ Kabyle ; [1] d. 1871), wanda kuma aka fi sani da Mohand Amokrane, ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin manyan shugabanni kuma mai suna Mokrani Revolt na 1871 a kan mamayar Faransa na Aljeriya .

items.sourceText: The application of this decree of spoliation of the land of the family of Cheikh Boumerdassi, the Ben Hamou ben Ali brothers, was supported by the administration of the domains which took possession of it and published its consistency, the content and the designation in 22 May 1877 after the said administration had rented these goods for several years, then put them up for public tender on 2 December 1879 with other lands also sequestered at the town hall of Ménerville.[37]

targets.targetText: A ranar 22 ga watan Mayun shekarar 1877 ne hukumomin ƙasar Ben Hamou ben Ali suka goyi bayan aiwatar da wannan doka ta cin amanar ƙasa na iyalan Cheikh Boumerdassi, sannan kuma ta ba da hayar gidajen jama'a a wani babban ɗakin taro a watan Disamba 22, 1877. na Ménerville. [1]

A ranar 22 ga watan Mayun shekarar 1877 ne hukumomin kasar Ben Hamou ben Ali suka goyi bayan aiwatar da wannan doka ta cin amanar kasa na iyalan Cheikh Boumerdassi, sannan kuma ta ba da hayar gidajen jama'a a wani babban dakin taro na Disamba 22, 1877. na Ménerville . [1]

items.sourceText: On August 4, 8, and 12, 1957, Ali Khodja of the National Liberation Army (ALN), reinforced with local units, faced French Army units commanded by several generals, including Jacques Massu.[4]

targets.targetText: A ranakun 4, 8, da 12 ga Agusta, 1957, Ali Khodja na Sojan Yancin Ƙasa (ALN), wanda ya ƙarfafa shi da ƙungiyoyin gida, ya fuskanci rundunonin sojojin Faransa waɗanda wasu janar-janar suka ba da umarni, ciki har da Jacques Massu . [1]

A ranakun 4, 8, da 12 ga watan Agusta, 1957, Ali Khodja na Sojan Yancin Ƙasa (ALN), wanda ya ƙarfafa shi da ƙungiyoyin gida, ya fuskanci rundunonin sojojin Faransa waɗanda wasu janar-janar suka ba da umarni, ciki har da Jacques Massu. [1]

items.sourceText: On 18 January 1955, Mourad Didouche, was at the head of a group of nine Fellaghas, in a local maquis called Douar Souadek located 12 km from the town of Condé-Smendou. He was most likely training them. They were armed with 6 rifles, and 6 pistols. According to the details reported by the La Dépêche de Constantine newspaper, about twenty French gendarmes led by Lieutenant Malherbe had taken the direction of Douar Souadek in the dawn of 18 January 1955. On the spot, near the Boukerker wadi, they were ambushed by the aforementioned maquis.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: A ranar 18 ga Janairu 1955, Mourad Didouche, ya kasance shugaban ƙungiyar tara Fellaghas, a cikin wani maquis na gida da ake kira Douar Souadek da ke 12. km daga garin Condé-Smendou . Wataƙila ya kasance yana horar da su. Suna dauke da bindigogi 6, da kuma bindigogi 6. Dangane da cikakkun bayanai da jaridar La Dépêche de Constantine ta ruwaito, kimanin gendars na Faransa 20 karkashin jagorancin Laftanar Malherbe ne suka jagoranci Douar Souadek a farkon 18 ga Janairu 1955. Nan take, kusa da rafin Boukerker, maquis ɗin da aka ambata sun yi musu kwanton bauna. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

A ranar 18 ga Janairu 1955, Mourad Didouche, ya kasance shugaban ƙungiyar tara Fellaghas, a cikin wani maquis na gida da ake kira Douar Souadek da ke 12. km daga garin Condé-Smendou. Wataƙila ya kasance yana horar da su. Suna dauke da bindigogi 6. Dangane da cikakkun bayanai da jaridar La Dépêche de Constantine ta ruwaito, kimanin gendars na Faransa 20 ƙarƙashin jagorancin Laftanar Malherbe ne suka jagoranci Douar Souadek a farkon 18 ga watan Janairu 1955. Nan take, kusa da rafin Boukerker, maquis ɗin da aka ambata sun yi musu kwanton ɓauna. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: This battle was even nicknamed as the ’Second Battle of Dian Bian Phu’ referencing the disastrous French campaign in Vietnam.[1][2]

targets.targetText: An ma yi wa wannan yaƙi lakabi da 'Yaƙin Dian Bian Phu na biyu' wanda ke nuni da mummunan kamfen na Faransa a Vietnam. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: The Eastern Revolt (Portuguese: Revolta do Leste; RDL) is an Angolan nationalist organization that fought in the war of independence from Portugal under the leadership of Daniel Chipenda.[1] The RDL drew its support from the Ovimbundu ethnic group.[2]

targets.targetText: Tawayen Gabas (Portuguese Revolta do Leste; RDL) ƙungiya ce ta Angola mai kishin ƙasa da ta yi yakin neman 'yancin kai daga Portugal karkashin jagorancin Daniel Chipenda. [1] RDL ta samu goyon bayanta daga ƙabilar Ovimbundu. [2]

Tawayen Gabas ( Portuguese ; RDL ) kungiya ce ta Angola mai kishin kasa da ta yi yakin neman 'yancin kai daga Portugal karkashin jagorancin Daniel Chipenda . [1] RDL ta samu goyon bayanta daga kabilar Ovimbundu . [2]

items.sourceText: Bildad Mwaganu Kaggia (1921 – 7 March 2005) was a Kenyan nationalist, activist, and politician. Kaggia was a member of the Mau Mau Central Committee. After independence he became a Member of Parliament. He established himself as a militant, fiery nationalist who wanted to serve the poor and landless people. Because of this he fell out irreconcilably with Jomo Kenyatta.

targets.targetText: Bildad Mwaganu Kaggia (1921 - 7 Maris 2005) ɗan ƙasar Kenya ne, ɗan kishin ƙasa, ɗan gwagwarmaya, kuma ɗan siyasa. Kaggia mamba ne a kwamitin tsakiya na Mau Mau. Bayan samun 'yancin kai ya zama ɗan majalisa. Ya kafa kansa a matsayin mayaki, mai zafin kishin ƙasa mai son yi wa talakawa hidima da marasa ƙasa. Saboda haka ya yi rashin jituwa da Jomo Kenyatta.

Bildad Mwaganu Kaggia (1921 - 7 Maris 2005) ɗan ƙasar Kenya ne, ɗan gwagwarmaya, kuma ɗan siyasa. Kaggia mamba ce a kwamitin tsakiya na Mau Mau. Bayan samun 'yancin kai ya zama dan majalisa. Ya kafa kansa a matsayin mayaka, mai zafin kishin kasa mai son yi wa talakawa hidima da marasa kasa. Saboda haka ya yi rashin jituwa da Jomo Kenyatta .

items.sourceText: As the uprising extended along the coastal areas initially and later into the eastern mountains of Mitidja, reaching as far as Constantine, it continued its progression into the Belezma mountains. It interlinked with indigenous revolts, extending all the way down to the Sahara desert. The momentum of these events moved steadily towards the city of Algiers itself, Eventually they reached Lakhdaria.[1]

targets.targetText: Yayin da tashin hankalin ya mamaye yankunan bakin teku tun farko kuma daga baya zuwa tsaunukan gabashin Mitidja, ya kai har zuwa Constantine, ya ci gaba da tafiya zuwa tsaunin Belezma. Yana da alaƙa da tawayen ƴan asalin ƙasar, har zuwa hamadar Sahara. Gudun waɗannan abubuwan sun ci gaba da tafiya a hankali zuwa birnin Algiers da kansa, daga ƙarshe suka isa Lakhdaria. [1]

Yayin da tashin hankalin ya mamaye yankunan bakin teku tun farko kuma daga baya zuwa tsaunukan gabashin Mitidja, ya kai har zuwa Constantine, ya ci gaba da tafiya zuwa tsaunin Belezma . Yana da alaƙa da tawayen ƴan asalin ƙasar, har zuwa hamadar Sahara . Gudun wadannan abubuwan sun ci gaba da tafiya a hankali zuwa birnin Algiers da kansa, daga karshe suka isa Lakhdaria . [1]

items.sourceText: This is a list of colonial governors of Seychelles, an archipelagic island country in the Indian Ocean. Seychelles was first colonized by the French in 1770, and captured by the British in 1810, who governed it under the subordination to Mauritius until 1903, when it became a separate crown colony. Seychelles achieved independence from the United Kingdom on 29 June 1976.

targets.targetText: Wannan jerin gwamnonin mulkin mallaka ne na Seychelles, ƙasar tsibiri mai tsibiri a Tekun Indiya . Seychelles dai Faransa ce ta fara yi mata mulkin mallaka a shekarar 1770, sannan turawan ingila sun kama ta a shekara ta 1810, wadanda suka yi mata mulkin mallaka a karkashin Mauritius har zuwa 1903, lokacin da ta zama wani yanki na daban . Seychelles ta sami ' yancin kai daga Burtaniya a ranar 29 ga Yuni 1976.

Wannan jerin gwamnonin 'yan mulkin mallaka ne na Seychelles, ƙasa mai tsibiri a Tekun Indiya. Seychelles dai Faransa ce ta fara yi mata mulkin mallaka a shekarar 1770, sannan turawan ingila sun kama ta a shekara ta 1810, waɗanda suka yi mata mulkin mallaka a ƙarƙashin Mauritius har zuwa shekara ta 1903, lokacin da ta zama wani yanki na daban. Seychelles ta sami 'yancin kai daga Burtaniya a ranar 29 ga watan Yuni 1976.

items.sourceText: The Slave Trade Act of 1800 was a law passed by the United States Congress to build upon the Slave Trade Act of 1794, limiting American involvement in the trade of human cargo. It was signed into law by President John Adams on May 10, 1800. This was among several acts of Congress that eventually outlawed the importation of slaves to the United States. The owning of slaves, and the domestic trade, would later be made illegal throughout the U.S. by the Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution in 1865 following the American Civil War.

targets.targetText: Dokar cinikin bayi ta 1800 wata doka ce da Majalisar Dokokin Amurka ta zartar don ginawa a kan dokar cinikin bayi ta 1794, ta iyakance shigar Amurkawa cikin cinikin kayakin ɗan adam . Shugaba John Adams ya sanya hannu a kan doka a ranar 10 ga Mayu, 1800. Wannan na daga cikin wasu ayyukan Majalisar da a karshe suka haramta shigo da bayi zuwa Amurka . Mallakar bayi, da cinikayyar cikin gida, daga baya za su zama doka a duk faɗin Amurka ta Kwaskwarimar Kwaskwarima ta Goma Sha Uku ga Tsarin Mulkin Amurka a 1865 bayan Yaƙin Basasa na Amurka .

Shugaba John Adams ya sanya hannu a kan doka a ranar 10 ga watan Mayu, 1800. Wannan na daga cikin wasu ayyukan Majalisar da a ƙarshe suka haramta shigo da bayi zuwa Amurka. Mallakar bayi, da cinikayyar cikin gida, daga baya za su zama doka a duk faɗin Amurka ta Kwaskwarimar Kwaskwarima ta Goma Sha Uku ga Tsarin Mulkin Amurka a shekarar 1865 bayan Yaƙin Basasa na Amurka.

items.sourceText: The company domain was named "Rhodesia" after its founder, Cecil Rhodes, in 1895; the portion south of the Zambezi became officially called Southern Rhodesia in 1898. Concurrently with the expiry of the company's charter in 1923, Southern Rhodesia was granted responsible government by the UK, and became a self-governing colony.

targets.targetText: Sunan yankin na kamfanin "Rhodesia" bayan wanda ya kafa shi, Cecil Rhodes, a shekarar 1895; Yankin kudancin Zambezi ya zama sunan Kudancin Rhodesia a hukumance a cikin shekarar 1898. A lokaci guda tare da ƙarewar yarjejeniyar kamfani a cikin shekarar 1923, Kudancin Rhodesia ta sami ikon gwamnati ta Burtaniya, kuma ta zama 'yar mulkin mallaka mai cin gashin kansa.

Sunan yankin na kamfanin " Rhodesia " bayan wanda ya kafa shi, Cecil Rhodes, a 1895; Yankin kudancin Zambezi ya zama sunan Kudancin Rhodesia a hukumance a cikin 1898. A lokaci guda tare da ƙarewar yarjejeniyar kamfani a cikin 1923, Kudancin Rhodesia ta sami ikon gwamnati ta Burtaniya, kuma ta zama mulkin mallaka mai cin gashin kansa .

items.sourceText: In 1967, Alves was put in command of the Centre of Revolutionary Instruction, and by 1971, he had joined the regional leadership under the command of Jacob Caetano.[2] Encouraged by Alves, the Dembos guerrillas began to develop a "certain regionalism" which centred Dembos as the main theatre in the war for national liberation. Already by 1969, they were taking greater casualties than other regions, with the defeat of their southern front resulting in them being cut off from the rest of the anti-colonial movement. The situation moved Caetano to seek aid in Cabinda, leaving Alves as the regional supreme commander.[3]

targets.targetText: A cikin 1967, an nada Alves a matsayin kwamandan Cibiyar Koyarwar Juyin Juya Hali, kuma a shekara ta 1971, ya shiga cikin jagorancin yankin karkashin umarnin Yakubu Caetano . [ 2 ] Alves ya ƙarfafa shi, 'yan tawayen Dembos sun fara haɓaka "wasu yanki na yanki " wanda ya kasance Dembos a matsayin babban gidan wasan kwaikwayo a yakin neman 'yanci na kasa . Tun a shekarar 1969, sun sha fama da asarar rayuka fiye da sauran yankuna, tare da shan kashin da suka yi a kudancin kasar, wanda ya sa aka yanke su daga sauran masu adawa da mulkin mallaka. Lamarin ya motsa Caetano don neman taimako a Cabinda, ya bar Alves a matsayin babban kwamandan yankin. [ 3 ]

A cikin shekarar 1967, an naɗa Alves a matsayin kwamandan Cibiyar Koyarwar Juyin Juya Hali, kuma a shekara ta 1971, ya shiga cikin jagorancin yankin ƙarƙashin umarnin Jacob Caetano. [ 2 ] Alves ya ƙarfafa shi, 'yan tawayen Dembos sun fara haɓaka "wasu yanki na yanki" wanda ya kasance Dembos a matsayin babban gidan wasan kwaikwayo a yakin neman 'yanci na ƙasa. Tun a shekarar 1969, sun sha fama da asarar rayuka fiye da sauran yankuna, tare da shan kashin da suka yi a kudancin ƙasar, wanda ya sa aka yanke su daga sauran masu adawa da mulkin mallaka. Lamarin ya motsa Caetano don neman taimako a Cabinda, ya bar Alves a matsayin babban kwamandan yankin. [ 3 ]

items.sourceText: Rodrigo Rodrigues Mingas[1][2][3][4][5] is the leader of the Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda-Military Position (FLEC/PM, Portuguese: Frente para a Libertação do Enclave de Cabinda), a guerrilla independence movement fighting since 1975 for the total independence of Cabinda,[6] one of Angola's 14 provinces which is rich with oil reserves.[7]

targets.targetText: Rodrigo Rodrigues Mingas [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] shi ne shugaban Front-Military Position (FLEC/PM, Portuguese Frente para a Libertação do Enclave de Cabinda), ƙungiyar gwagwarmayar neman ' yancin kai tun a shekarar 1975 don samun 'yancin kai na Cabinda, [6] ɗaya daga cikin larduna 14 na Angola waɗanda ke da arzikin mai. [7]

Rodrigo Rodrigues Mingas [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] shi ne shugaban Front -Military Position (FLEC/PM, Portuguese Frente para a Libertação do Enclave de Cabinda ) ), ƙungiyar gwagwarmayar neman ' yancin kai tun 1975 don samun 'yancin kai na Cabinda, [6] ɗaya daga cikin larduna 14 na Angola waɗanda ke da arzikin mai . [7]

items.sourceText: In 2004, she posthumously received the Order of Luthuli in Silver for her activism against apartheid and in favour of workers' rights.[12][13]

targets.targetText: A cikin 2004, ta karɓi odar Luthuli a cikin Azurfa bayan mutuwarta saboda gwagwarmayarta da wariyar launin fata da kuma goyon bayan haƙƙin ma'aikata. [1] [2]
A cikin shekarar 2004, ta karɓi odar Luthuli a cikin Azurfa bayan mutuwarta saboda gwagwarmayarta na yaki da wariyar launin fata da kuma goyon bayan haƙƙin ma'aikata. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Louis Marius Schoon (22 June 1937 – 7 February 1999) was a white anti-apartheid activist of Afrikaner descent. Marius died from lung cancer, after a long call from Nelson Mandela, thanking him for his sacrifice against the struggle.

targets.targetText: Louis Marius Schoon (22 ga Yuni 1937 - 7 ga Fabrairu 1999) farar fata ce mai fafutukar yaki da wariyar launin fata na asalin Afirkaner . Marius ya mutu daga ciwon huhu na huhu, bayan dogon kira daga Nelson Mandela, yana gode masa saboda sadaukarwar da ya yi a kan gwagwarmaya.

Louis Marius Schoon (22 ga Yuni 1937 - 7 ga Fabrairu 1999) farin fata ne mai fafutukar yaki da wariyar launin fata na asalin Afirkaner. Marius ya mutu daga ciwon kansar huhu, bayan dogon kira daga Nelson Mandela, yana gode masa saboda sadaukarwar da ya yi a kan gwagwarmaya.

items.sourceText: Edward Akufo-Addo JSC (26 June 1906 – 17 July 1979)[1][2] was a Ghanaian politician and lawyer. He was a member of the "Big Six" leaders of the United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) and one of the founding fathers of Ghana who engaged in the fight for Ghana's independence.[3] He became the Chief Justice (1966–70), and later ceremonial President (1970–72), of the Republic of Ghana.[4] He is the father of the former (executive) President of Ghana, Nana Addo Akufo-Addo.[5]

targets.targetText: Edward Akufo-Addo JSC (26 Yuni 1906 - 17 Yuli 1979) [1] [2] ɗan siyasan Ghana ne kuma lauya. Ya kasance memba na shugabannin " Big shida " na United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) kuma daya daga cikin iyayen da suka kafa Ghana wadanda suka yi gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin Ghana. [3] Ya zama Alkalin Alkalai (1966–70), sannan daga baya shugaban biki (1970–72), na Jamhuriyar Ghana. [4] Shi ne mahaifin tsohon shugaban kasar Ghana, Nana Addo Akufo-Addo . [5]

Edward Akufo-Addo JSC (26 Yuni 1906 - 17 Yuli 1979) [1] [2] ɗan siyasan Ghana ne kuma lauya. Ya kasance memba na shugabannin "Big Six" na United Gold Coast Convention (UGCC) kuma ɗaya daga cikin iyayen da suka kafa Ghana waɗanda suka yi gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin Ghana. [3] Ya zama Alkalin Alkalai (1966–70), sannan daga baya shugaban biki (1970–72), na Jamhuriyar Ghana. [4] Shi ne mahaifin tsohon shugaban ƙasar Ghana, Nana Addo Akufo-Addo. [5]

items.sourceText: In 1956, five years later, they married after she received her B.A. and he his M.A. At the time of their marriage, Janet was 22 and Eduardo 36. They had three children, Eduardo, Jr., Chude, and Nyeleti.[2]

items.sourceText: During her youth, Tembe was involved with the Igreja Presbiteriana de Moçambique. A student activist,[1] she joined FRELIMO and in 1964 was one of a group that attempted to go into exile in Tanzania to avoid the PIDE. However, she was arrested while travelling through Rhodesia and deported back to Mozambique, where she was detained by the PIDE.[2] She rose to become a member of the party's central committee.[3]

targets.targetText: A lokacin ƙuruciyarta, Tembe ta kasance tare da Igreja Presbiteriana de Moçambique. Wata ɗaliba mai fafutuka, [1] ta shiga FRELIMO kuma a cikin shekarar 1964 tana ɗaya daga cikin ƙungiyar da ta yi ƙoƙarin yin hijira a Tanzaniya don guje wa PIDE. Duk da haka, an kama ta yayin da take tafiya ta Rhodesia kuma aka mayar da ita zuwa Mozambique, inda PIDE ta tsare ta. [2] Ta tashi ta zama mamba a kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar. [3]

items.sourceText: His killing was the first in a series of assassinations directed against members of the Moroccan Army of liberation and other factions competing with the Istiqlal party and the Alaouite family.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: Kisan nasa shi ne na farko a jerin kashe-kashe da aka yi wa sojojin Maroko na 'yantar da 'yan ta'adda da sauran bangarorin da ke fafatawa da jam'iyyar Istiqlal da iyalan Alaouite . [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: Hamid Idris Awate (Tigrinya: ሓምድ እድሪስ ዓዋተ; 10 April 1910 – 28 May 1962) was an Eritrean revolutionary and prominent guerrilla commander, and a symbol of the Eritrean War of Independence and independence struggle.

targets.targetText: Hamid Idris Awate ( Tigrinya ; 10 Afrilu 1910 - 28 ga Mayu 1962) ɗan juyin juya halin Eritrea ne kuma fitaccen kwamandan ƴan daba, kuma alama ce ta Yaƙin ƴancin kai da gwagwarmayar 'yancin kai na Eritriya .

Hamid Idris Awate (10 Afrilu 1910 - 28 ga Mayu 1962) ɗan juyin juya halin Eritrea ne kuma fitaccen kwamandan ƴan tawaye, kuma alama ce ta Yaƙin neman ƴancin kai da gwagwarmayar 'yancin kai na Eritriya.

items.sourceText: In 1935, Hamid was conscripted by the Italians to serve in the colonial army of the Eritrean Ascari. Beside his fluency in Arabic, Tigre, Tigrinya, Nara, Hedareb, and Kunama, Hamid learned the Italian language very well within a short period of time and was sent to Rome for a course in military intelligence.[3]

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 1935, Italiya ta tura Hamid aiki a cikin sojojin mulkin mallaka na Eritrea Ascari. Bayan yaren Larabci, Tigre, Tigrinya, Nara, Hedareb, da Kunama, Hamid ya koyi yaren Italiyanci sosai cikin ƙanƙanin lokaci kuma an tura shi Roma don yin kwas na leken asirin soja. [1]

A shekara ta 1935, Italiyanci ya tura Hamid aiki a cikin sojojin mulkin mallaka na Eritrea Ascari . Bayan yaren Larabci, Tigre, Tigrinya, Nara, Hedareb, da Kunama, Hamid ya koyi yaren Italiyanci sosai cikin kankanin lokaci kuma an tura shi Roma don yin kwas na leken asirin soja. [1]

items.sourceText: Genet Sium (alternate spelling, Ganat Seyum; nickname, Shigom) is an Eritrean writer, activist, and nurse. She was an active member of the Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF) during the war for Eritrean independence from Ethiopia. Her autobiographical novel Shigom recounts her experiences as a freedom fighter. She has subsequently written several works of fiction as well as texts on sexual and reproductive health.

targets.targetText: Genet Sium (madaidaicin rubutun, Ganat Seyum ; laƙabi, Shigom) marubuciya 'yar ƙasar Eritrea ce, 'yar gwagwarmaya, kuma ma'aikaciyar jinya. Ta kasance mamba mai ƙwazo a ƙungiyar EPLF a lokacin yaƙin neman 'yancin kai daga Habasha. Littafin tarihin rayuwarta Shigom ya ba da labarin abubuwan da ya faru a matsayinta na mayaƙiyar neman 'yanci. Daga baya ta rubuta ayyukan almara da yawa da kuma rubutu akan lafiyar jima'i da haihuwa.

Genet Sium (madaidaicin rubutun, Ganat Seyum ; laƙabi, Shigom ) marubuci ɗan ƙasar Eritrea ne, ɗan gwagwarmaya, kuma ma'aikacin jinya. Ta kasance mamba mai ƙwazo a ƙungiyar EPLF a lokacin yaƙin neman 'yancin kai daga Habasha. Littafin littafin tarihin rayuwarta Shigom ya ba da labarin abubuwan da ta faru a matsayinta na mayaƙin 'yanci. Daga baya ta rubuta ayyukan almara da yawa da kuma rubutu akan lafiyar jima'i da haihuwa.

items.sourceText: Djamila Bouhired (Arabic: جميلة بوحيرد, born June 1935[2]) is an Algerian nationalist militant,[2] who opposed the French colonial rule of Algeria as a member of the National Liberation Front.

targets.targetText: Djamila Bouhired (an haife ta a watan Yuni 1935 [1] 'yar gwagwarmayar kishin ƙasa ce ta Aljeriya, [1] wacce ta yi adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa a Aljeriya a matsayin memba na Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Ƙasa.

Djamila Bouhired ( Arabic , an haife shi a watan Yuni 1935 [1] ɗan gwagwarmayar kishin ƙasa ne na Aljeriya, [1] wanda ya yi adawa da mulkin mallaka na Faransa na Aljeriya a matsayin memba na Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Ƙasa .

items.sourceText: Helena Lopes da Silva (30 January 1949 – 8 September 2018) was a Cape Verdean-Portuguese surgeon, feminist and anti-colonialist activist. She was a founder of the Left Bloc and the first black woman to head an electoral list in Portugal.

targets.targetText: Helena Lopes da Silva (30 Janairu 1949 - 8 Satumba 2018) likita ce ta Cape Verde - Fotigal, mai fafutukar yaki da mulkin mallaka . Ita ce ta kafa kungiyar Hagu kuma bakar fata ta farko da ta shugabanci jerin zabuka a Portugal.

Helena Lopes da Silva (30 Janairu 1949 - 8 Satumba 2018) likita ce ta Cape Verde-Fotigal, mai fafutukar yaki da 'yan mulkin mallaka. Ita ce ta kafa kungiyar Left Bloc kuma bakar fata ta farko da ta shugabanci jerin zaɓuka a Portugal.

items.sourceText: In Nigeria, the slogan has been embraced by students and activists. It is the motto of the National Association of Nigerian Students and is often shortened to "Aluta." The full version, "A luta continua; vitória é certa," meaning "The struggle continues; victory is certain," is commonly used during protests and demonstrations.

targets.targetText: A Najeriya, ɗalibai da masu fafutuka ne suka rungumi taken. Taken kungiyar ɗaliban Najeriya ce ta ƙasa kuma galibi ana takaita ta zuwa "Aluta." Cikakken sigar, "A luta continua; vitória é certa," ma'ana "Ana ci gaba da gwagwarmaya; nasara ta tabbata," ana amfani da ita a lokacin zanga-zangar da gangami.

A Najeriya, dalibai da masu fafutuka ne suka rungumi taken. Taken kungiyar daliban Najeriya ce ta kasa kuma galibi ana takaita shi zuwa "Aluta." Cikakken sigar, "A luta continua; vitória é certa," ma'ana "Ana ci gaba da gwagwarmaya; nasara ta tabbata," ana amfani da ita a lokacin zanga-zangar da zanga-zangar.

items.sourceText: The siege of Igueriben was a clash between the Rif tribes of Abd el-Krim and the Spanish army, from 16 to July 21, 1921, in the Spanish base of Igueriben where they were besieged by forces of Abd el-Krim. The clash ended with the victory of Abd el-Krim's forces. wiping out the Spanish contingent.

targets.targetText: Sifen Igueriben ya kasance wani rikici ne tsakanin ƙabilun Rif na Abd el-Krim da sojojin Spain, daga ranar 16 zuwa 21 ga watan Yuli, 1921, a sansanin Spain na Igueriben inda sojojin Abd el-Krim suka yi musu ƙawanya. Faɗan dai ya ƙare ne da samun nasarar dakarun Abd el-Krim. Sun shafe tawagar Spaniya.

Sifen Igueriben ya kasance wani rikici tsakanin kabilun Rif na Abd el-Krim da sojojin Spain, daga ranar 16 zuwa 21 ga Yuli, 1921, a sansanin Spain na Igueriben inda sojojin Abd el-Krim suka yi musu kawanya. Fadan dai ya kare ne da samun nasarar dakarun Abd el-Krim. shafe tawagar Mutanen Espanya.

items.sourceText: In December 1831, Duc de Rovigo arrived in Algiers to establish the French colonial power in Mitidja. His arrival coincided with the reconfiguration of the regiments of Troupes Coloniales involved in the offensive against the Algerian resistance fighters scattered all around the Casbah of Algiers.[2]

targets.targetText: A cikin Disamba 1831, Duc de Rovigo ya isa Algiers don kafa ikon mulkin mallaka na Faransa a Mitidja . Zuwansa ya zo dai-dai da sake fasalin rundunonin Sojoji 'yan mulkin mallaka da ke da hannu wajen kai farmaki kan mayakan gwagwarmayar Aljeriya da suka warwatsu a ko'ina cikin Casbah na Algiers . [1]

A cikin watan Disamba 1831, Duc de Rovigo ya isa Algiers don kafa ikon mulkin mallaka na Faransa a Mitidja. Zuwansa ya zo dai-dai da sake fasalin rundunonin Sojoji 'yan mulkin mallaka da ke da hannu wajen kai farmaki kan mayakan gwagwarmayar Aljeriya da suka warwatsu a ko'ina cikin Casbah na Algiers. [1]

items.sourceText: During the day of 19 April 1837, the Algerian rebels sprang from the south of the colonial village of Col des Beni Aïcha coming from liberated Palestro, and arriving from the Issers and the heights of the Iflissen, and invaded the entire periphery of the future Menerville then Thenia.[9]

targets.targetText: A ranar 19 ga watan Afrilun 1837, 'yan tawayen Aljeriya sun taso daga kudancin ƙauyen Col des Beni Aïcha da suka yi wa mulkin mallaka suka fito daga Palestro 'yanto, suka iso daga Issers da tudun Iflissen, suka mamaye gaba ɗayan yankin Menerville na gaba sai Thenia . [1]

A ranar 19 ga Afrilun 1837, 'yan tawayen Aljeriya sun taso daga kudancin kauyen Col des Beni Aïcha da suka yi wa mulkin mallaka suka fito daga Palestro ' yanto, suka iso daga Issers da tudun Iflissen, suka mamaye gaba dayan yankin Menerville na gaba sai Thenia . [1]

items.sourceText: Colonel Lotfi died in battle against French troops on March 27, 1960, two years before independence in a mountain in eastern Béchar.

targets.targetText: Kanar Lotfi ya mutu a yaƙi da sojojin Faransa a ranar 27 ga watan Maris, 1960, shekaru biyu kafin 'yancin kai a wani dutse a gabashin Béchar.
Kanar Lotfi ya mutu a yaƙi da sojojin Faransa a ranar 27 ga Maris, 1960, shekaru biyu kafin 'yancin kai a wani dutse a gabashin Béchar .

items.sourceText: Marching from Palestro towards Algiers, the insurgents faced a halt at Boudouaou on April 22, 1871, thwarted by Colonel Alexandre Fourchault under the leadership of General Orphis Léon Lallemand. This encounter on May 5 resulted in a devastating defeat for Cheikh Mokrani.[6][7]

targets.targetText: Tafiya daga Palestro zuwa Algiers, 'yan tawayen sun fuskanci dakatarwa a Boudouaou a ranar 22 ga Afrilu, 1871, wanda Kanar Alexandre Fourchault ya dakile a karkashin jagorancin Janar Orphis Léon Lallemand . Wannan haduwar da aka yi a ranar 5 ga watan Mayu ta haifar da mummunar kaye ga Cheikh Mokrani . [1] [2]

Tafiya daga Palestro zuwa Algiers, 'yan tawayen sun fuskanci dakatarwa a Boudouaou a ranar 22 ga watan Afrilu, 1871, wanda Kanar Alexandre Fourchault ya dakile a ƙarƙashin jagorancin Janar Orphis Léon Lallemand. Wannan haɗuwar da aka yi a ranar 5 ga watan Mayu ta haifar da mummunar kaye ga Cheikh Mokrani. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: He was sensitized to anti-colonialist and communist ideas during his studies, notably with Gabriel d'Arboussier (the future Secretary General of the African Democratic Rally) and the historian Jean Suret-Canale.

targets.targetText: An wayar da kan shi ga ra'ayoyin masu adawa da mulkin mallaka da gurguzu a lokacin karatunsa, musamman tare da Gabriel d'Arboussier (Mai Gabatar Babban Sakatare na Jam'iyyar Democratic Rally ) da kuma masanin tarihi Jean Suret-Canale .

items.sourceText: Grand-Bassam (French pronunciation: [ɡʁɑ̃ basam]) is a town in southeastern Ivory Coast, lying east of Abidjan. It is a sub-prefecture of and the seat of Grand-Bassam Department; it is also a commune. During the late 19th century, Grand-Bassam was briefly the French colonial capital of Ivory Coast. Because of its outstanding examples of colonial architecture and town-planning, and the juxtaposition of the colonial town with a traditional Nzema village, the historic center of Grand-Bassam was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2012.[5]

targets.targetText: Grand-Bassam (  ) wani gari ne a kudu maso gabashin Ivory Coast, yana gabas da Abidjan . Karamar hukuma ce kuma wurin zama na Sashen Grand-Bassam ; ita ma jama'a ce . A karshen karni na 19, Grand-Bassam ya kasance babban birnin kasar Faransa yan mulkin mallaka a takaice. Saboda fitattun misalan gine-ginen mulkin mallaka da tsarin gari, da kuma juxtaposition na garin mulkin mallaka tare da ƙauyen Nzema na gargajiya, cibiyar tarihi ta Grand-Bassam an sanya ta a matsayin Cibiyar Tarihi ta UNESCO a cikin 2012. [1]

Grand-Bassam (  ) wani gari ne a kudu maso gabashin Ivory Coast, yana gabas da Abidjan. Ƙaramar hukuma ce kuma wurin zama na Sashen Grand-Bassam; ita ma sashe ce. A ƙarshen ƙarni na 19, Grand-Bassam ya kasance babban birnin ƙasar Faransa 'yan mulkin mallaka a takaice. Saboda fitattun misalan gine-ginen 'yan mulkin mallaka da tsarin gari, da kuma juxtaposition na garin 'yan mulkin mallaka tare da ƙauyen Nzema na gargajiya, cibiyar tarihi ta Grand-Bassam an sanya ta a matsayin Cibiyar Tarihi ta UNESCO a cikin shekarar 2012. [1]

items.sourceText: Erlich provides more information: when Eritrean troops gained control of the area in 1989, "a prominent commander of the Eritrean People's Liberation Front, and a former Minister of Foreign Affairs, Petros Solomon himself was delighted to blast Mengistu's monument of Ras Alula."[8]

targets.targetText: Erlich ya ba da ƙarin bayani: lokacin da sojojin Eritrea suka sami iko a yankin a shekarar 1989, "fitaccen kwamandan 'yantar da jama'ar Eritrea, kuma tsohon ministan harkokin waje, Petros Solomon da kansa ya yi farin ciki da fashewa da abin tunawa na Mengistu na Ras Alula." [1]

items.sourceText: On 25 February 2023, in a series of videos on social media during the 2023 Nigerian presidential election in Lagos, Nigeria Musiliu Akinsanya (MC Oluomo) was accused of allegedly intimidating and preventing the Igbo people from voting Peter Obi at his polling unit.[7] also, for allegedly using (agbero) to disrupt the Nigerian presidential election in lagos.[8]

targets.targetText: A ranar 25 ga watan Fabrairun 2023, a cikin jerin bidiyo a kan kafofin sada zumunta a lokacin Zaben shugaban kasa na Najeriya na 2023 a Legas, an zargi Musiliu Akinsanya (MC Oluomo) da zargin tsoratar da hana Mutanen Igbo kada kuri'a ga Peter Obi a sashin zabe. [1] Har ila yau, don zargin yin amfani da (Agbero) don rushe Zaben shugaban kasa na Najeriya a cikin lagos.[2]

A ranar 25 ga watan Fabrairun Shekarar 2023, a cikin jerin bidiyo a kan kafofin sada zumunta a lokacin Zaben shugaban kasa na Najeriya na Shekarar 2023 a Legas, an zargi Musiliu Akinsanya (MC Oluomo) da zargin tsoratar da hana Mutanen Igbo kaɗa ƙuri'a ga ɗan takarar Peter Obi a sashin zaɓe. items.sourceText: Chiba died on the 8 December 2017.[4] He is survived by wife Luxmi, three daughters - Gita, Kailash, and Yaswanti, seven grandchildren, and four great grandchildren.[2][4] He was laid to rest on the following day at Avalon Cemetery.

targets.targetText: Chiba ya mutu a ranar 8 ga watan Disamba 2017. [1] Ya bar matarsa Luxmi, da 'ya'ya mata uku - Gita, Kailash, da Yaswanti, jikoki mata bakwai, da jikoki maza huɗu. [1][2] An kwantar da shi washegari a Kabari na Avalon.

items.sourceText: The Kert campaign (Spanish: campaña del Kert) was a conflict in northern Morocco between Spain and insurgent Riffian harkas led by Mohammed Ameziane, who had called for a jihad against the Spanish occupation in the eastern Rif. It took place between 1911 and 1912.

targets.targetText: Yakin Kert (Spanish) rikici ne a arewacin Morocco tsakanin Spain da Rif harkas mai tayar da kayar baya ƙarƙashin jagorancin Mohammed Ameziane, wanda ya yi kira ga jihadi a kan mamayar Spaniya a gabashin Rif. Ya faru ne tsakanin shekarun 1911 da 1912.

Yakin Kert (Spanish) rikici ne a arewacin Morocco tsakanin Spain da Rif harkas mai tayar da kayar baya karkashin jagorancin Mohammed Ameziane, wanda ya yi kira ga jihadi a kan mamayar Mutanen Espanya a gabashin Rif . Ya faru ne tsakanin 1911 da 1912.

items.sourceText: The Black Lions were an anti-fascist resistance movement[1] formed to fight against Fascist Italy during the occupation of the Ethiopian Empire in World War II.[2][3]

targets.targetText: Bakar Lions wani yunkuri ne na adawa da Fascist [1] da aka kafa don yakar Italiyan Fascist a lokacin mamayar daular Habasha a yakin duniya na biyu . [2] [3]
Black Lions wani yunkuri ne na adawa da Fascist [1] da aka kafa don yakar Italiyan Fascist a lokacin mamayar daular Habasha a yakin duniya na biyu. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Haji Muse Boqor Osman (Somali: Xaaji Muuse Boqor; Arabic: حاجي موسى بوقور; 1911–1991) was a politician, businessman, and Somalia's president-in-waiting following the assassination of President Sharmarke. He was the son of Boqor Osman and served as the first Minister of Interior Affairs during the Italian Trusteeship of Somalia.[1] He was also a member of Somalia's first Parliament.[2] Boqor was assassinated in 1991 in Mogadishu.

targets.targetText: Haji Muse Boqor Osman ( Somali ; Arabic ; 1911–1991) ɗan siyasa ne, ɗan kasuwa, kuma shugaban ƙasar Somaliya mai jiran gado bayan kisan shugaba Sharmarke . Ya kasance dan Sarki Osman kuma ya zama Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida na farko a lokacin da Italiya ta Amince ta Somaliya . [1] Ya kuma kasance dan Majalisar Dokokin Somaliya na farko. [2] An kashe Sarki a 1991 a Mogadishu .

Haji Muse Boqor Osman (1911–1991) ɗan siyasa ne, ɗan kasuwa, kuma shugaban ƙasar Somaliya mai jiran gado bayan kisan shugaba Sharmarke. Ya kasance ɗan Sarki Osman kuma ya zama Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida na farko a lokacin da Italiya ta Amince da Somaliya. [1] Ya kuma kasance ɗan Majalisar Dokokin Somaliya na farko. [2] An kashe Sarki a shekarar 1991 a Mogadishu.

items.sourceText: As a member of the Political Bureau of the National Liberation Front in 1964, in charge of the guidance sector, Hocine Zehouane participated in the first regional Congress of the General Union of Algerian Workers.[4] On this occasion, he declared that "Algerian workers must gain access to political power".[5]

targets.targetText: A matsayinsa na memba na Ofishin Siyasa na Ƙungiyar neman 'Yancin Ƙasa a cikin shekarar 1964, mai kula da sashen jagoranci, Hocine Zehouane ya halarci taron farko na yanki na Ƙungiyar Ma'aikata ta Aljeriya. [1] A wannan karon, ya bayyana cewa "Dole ne ma'aikatan Algeria su sami damar yin siyasa". [2]

A matsayinta na memba na Ofishin Siyasa na Ƙungiyar 'Yancin Ƙasa a cikin 1964, mai kula da sashen jagoranci, Hocine Zehouane ya halarci taron farko na yanki na Ƙungiyar Ma'aikata ta Aljeriya . [1] A wannan karon, ya bayyana cewa "Dole ne ma'aikatan Algeria su sami damar yin siyasa". [2]

items.sourceText: By the mid 1970s, the ELF and the Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF), an ideologically Maoist liberation movement, were the key liberation movements in Eritrea. The EPLF ultimately overtook the ELF as the primary Eritrean independence movement by 1977, and the ELF was subsequently defeated in 1981.

targets.targetText: A tsakiyar shekarar 1970s, ELF da EPLF, ƙungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin kai na Maoist, sune manyan ƙungiyoyin 'yanci a Eritrea. A ƙarshe EPLF ta mamaye ELF a matsayin ƙungiyar 'yancin kai ta Eritrea ta shekarar 1977, sannan ELF ta ci nasara a shekarar 1981.

A tsakiyar 1970s, ELF da EPLF, ƙungiyar ' yantar da 'yancin kai na Maoist, sune manyan ƙungiyoyin 'yanci a Eritrea. A ƙarshe EPLF ta mamaye ELF a matsayin ƙungiyar 'yancin kai ta Eritrea ta 1977, sannan ELF ta ci nasara a 1981.

items.sourceText: The Nandi Resistance was a military conflict that took place in present-day Kenya between 1890 and 1906. It involved members of the Kalenjin ethnic group, mainly from the Nandi section, and the British colonial administration. The close of the 19th century, a time referred to as the "pacification period" by Matson, saw a number of local populations that resisted British colonial rule. Of these, the Nandi resistance would stand out for being the longest and most tenacious.[1]

targets.targetText: Resistance Nandi wani rikici ne na soja da ya faru a Kenya a yau tsakanin 1890 zuwa 1906. Ya shafi 'yan kabilar Kalenjin, musamman daga bangaren Nandi, da kuma mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya. Ƙarshen karni na 19, lokacin da ake magana da shi a matsayin "lokacin sulhu" na Matson, ya ga yawancin al'ummomin yankin da suka yi adawa da mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya . Daga cikin waɗannan, juriyar Nandi zai fito fili don kasancewa mafi tsayi kuma mafi tsayi. [1]

Resistance Nandi wani rikici ne na soja da ya faru a Kenya a yau tsakanin shekarun 1890 zuwa 1906. Ya shafi 'yan ƙabilar Kalenjin, musamman daga ɓangaren Nandi, da kuma 'yan mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya. Ƙarshen ƙarni na 19, lokacin da ake magana da shi a matsayin "lokacin sulhu" na Matson, ya ga yawancin al'ummomin yankin da suka yi adawa da mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya. Daga cikin waɗannan, tawayen Nandi zai fito fili don kasancewa mafi tsayi. [1]

items.sourceText: The Moroccan Nationalist Movement (Arabic: الحركة الوطنية المغربية, romanized: Al-Harakah al-Wataniyah al-Maghribiyah) was an Arab nationalist[1] and Pan-Arabist[2] political movement in Morocco that opposed the French protectorate. It was nominally led by the Moroccan sultan Mohammed bin Youssef.[3] Most of its leaders were from the Istiqlal Party.[4]

targets.targetText: Harkar kishin kasa ta Moroko ( Arabic ) ɗan kishin ƙasa Larabawa ne [1] da ƙungiyar Pan-Arabist [2] a Maroko wanda ke adawa da kariyar Faransa . Sarkin Moroko Mohammed bin Youssef ne ya jagorance ta. [3] Yawancin shugabanninta sun fito ne daga jam'iyyar Istiqlal . [4]

Harkar kishin kasa ta Moroko 'yan kishin ƙasa Larabawa ne [1] da ƙungiyar Pan-Arabist [2] a Maroko wanda ke adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa. Sarkin Moroko Mohammed bin Youssef ne ya jagorance ta. [3] Yawancin shugabanninta sun fito ne daga jam'iyyar Istiqlal. [4]

items.sourceText: Knowing that he was constantly under surveillance by the French intelligence services, he ensured that he never flew over French territory and avoided the airspace of the countries that were members of the French Community. He feared that his plane would be intercepted, as the plane of Ahmed Ben Bella and FLN leaders was in 1956. He lived mainly between Ghana and Guinea where he sought to gain support for the UPC.

targets.targetText: Sanin cewa har kullum jami'an leken asirin Faransa suna sa ido a kai, ya tabbatar da cewa bai taɓa shawagi a cikin ƙasar Faransa ba kuma ya kauce wa sararin samaniyar ƙasashen da ke cikin kungiyar Faransawa. Ya ji tsoron kada a katse jirginsa, kamar yadda jirgin Ahmed Ben Bella da shugabannin FLN ke cikin shekarar 1956. Ya zauna ne a tsakanin Ghana da Guinea inda ya nemi goyon bayan jam'iyyar UPC.

Sanin cewa har kullum jami'an leken asirin Faransa suna sa ido a kai, ya tabbatar da cewa bai taba shawagi a cikin kasar Faransa ba kuma ya kauce wa sararin samaniyar kasashen da ke cikin kungiyar Faransawa . Ya ji tsoron kada a katse jirginsa, kamar yadda jirgin Ahmed Ben Bella da shugabannin FLN ke cikin 1956. Ya zauna ne a tsakanin Ghana da Guinea inda ya nemi goyon bayan jam'iyyar UPC.

items.sourceText: He later joined Museveni's National Resistance Army (NRA), which fought a guerrilla war called the Ugandan Bush War against the government of Milton Obote. It was here that Rwigema first fought alongside a number of future RPF leaders including future Rwandan president Paul Kagame, James Kabarebe, Patrick Karegeya and Kayumba Nyamwasa.[3]

targets.targetText: Daga baya ya shiga kungiyar ta Museveni ta National Resistance Army (NRA), wacce ta yi kamfen mai suna Yakin Bush na Uganda da gwamnatin Milton Obote. A nan ne Rwigema ya fara fafatawa tare da wasu jagororin RPF masu zuwa ciki har da shugaban Rwanda Paul Kagame na gaba, James Kabarebe, Patrick Karegeya da Kayumba Nyamwasa. [1]

Daga baya ya shiga kungiyar ta Museveni ta National Resistance Army (NRA), wacce ta yi yakin neman zabe mai suna Yakin Bush na Uganda da gwamnatin Milton Obote . A nan ne Rwigema ya fara fafatawa tare da wasu jagororin RPF masu zuwa ciki har da shugaban Rwanda Paul Kagame na gaba, James Kabarebe, Patrick Karegeya da Kayumba Nyamwasa . [1]

items.sourceText: The Lambeth Waterworks Company was a utility company supplying water to parts of south London in England. The company was established in 1785 with works in north Lambeth and became part of the publicly owned Metropolitan Water Board in 1904.

targets.targetText: Kamfanin Lambeth Waterworks kamfani ne a Landan, mai samar da ruwa ga wasu sassan kudancin London a Ingila. An kafa kamfanin ne a shekarar 1785 tare da wasu ayyuka a arewacin Lambeth kuma ya zama wani ɓangare na Hukumar Ruwa ta Metropolitan mallakar jama'a a shekarar 1904.

Kamfanin Lambeth Waterworks kamfani ne mai amfani Landan ke samar da ruwa ga wasu sassan kudancin London a Ingila. An kafa kamfanin ne a cikin 1785 tare da ayyuka a arewacin Lambeth kuma ya zama wani ɓangare na Hukumar Ruwa ta Metropolitan mallakar jama'a a cikin 1904.

items.sourceText: Born on March 17, 1921, at Tiaret, Si Ahmed was born into a family of small landowners installed in Sidi Belgacem. Sidi Belgacem is located in the town of Tagdemt not far from Mina and on lands of the former capital of Emir Abdelkader. His father, a former communal guard was tortured and murdered by the French army in 1957 in Mostaganem.

targets.targetText: An haife shi a ranar 17 ga Maris, 1921, a Tiaret, an haifi Si Ahmed a cikin dangin ƙananan masu mallakar ƙasa da aka girka a Sidi Belgacem . Sidi Belgacem yana cikin garin Tagdemt wanda ba shi da nisa da Mina kuma a kan filayen tsohon babban birnin sarki Abdelkader . Sojojin Faransa sun azabtar da mahaifinsa, wanda tsohon mai gadin jama'a ne a 1957 a Mostaganem .

An haife shi a ranar 17 ga watan Maris, 1921, a Tiaret, an haifi Si Ahmed a cikin dangin ƙananan masu mallakar ƙasa a Sidi Belgacem. Sidi Belgacem yana cikin garin Tagdemt wanda ba shi da nisa da Mina kuma a kan filayen tsohon babban birnin sarki Abdelkader. Sojojin Faransa sun azabtar da mahaifinsa, wanda tsohon mai gadin jama'a ne a shekarar 1957 a Mostaganem.

items.sourceText: The Movement for the Liberation of São Tomé and Príncipe – Social Democratic Party (Portuguese: Movimento de Libertação de São Tomé e Príncipe – Partido Social Democrata, abbr. MLSTP–PSD) is one of the main political parties in São Tomé and Príncipe. Jorge Bom Jesus is the current president of the party.

targets.targetText: The Movement for the Liberation of São Tomé and Príncipe – Social Democratic Party (Portuguese Movimento de Libertação de São Tomé e Príncipe - Partido Social Democrata, abbr. MLSTP-PSD ) ɗaya ce daga cikin manyan jam'iyyun siyasa a Sao Tomé da Principe. Jorge Bom Jesus shine shugaban jam'iyyar na yanzu.

Movement for the Liberation of São Tomé and Príncipe - Social Democratic Party (Portuguese: Movimento de Libertação de São Tomé e Príncipe - Partido Social Democrata, Abra.. MLSTP-PSD) yana daya daga cikin manyan jam'iyyun siyasa a São Tomé da Príncipe . Jorge Bom Yesu shine shugaban jam'iyyar na yanzu.

items.sourceText: When only seventeen, he started an agitation in Bombay against the Portuguese colonial occupation of Goa.[1] His political activism soon made it necessary for him to return to Kenya to avoid being arrested and deported to the Tarrafal concentration camp in Cape Verde.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: Lokacin da goma sha bakwai kawai, ya fara tayar da hankali a Bombay game da mulkin mallaka na Portugal na Goa . [1] Ba da daɗewa ba gwagwarmayar siyasarsa ta sa ya zama dole ya koma Kenya don gudun kada a kama shi da kuma tura shi sansanin taro na Tarrafal a Cape Verde . [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

items.sourceText: Anthony Kobina Woode was born on 1 February 1923.[1] A trade unionist, he actively participated in the movement for independence in the Gold Coast, later to become Ghana.

targets.targetText: An haifi Anthony Kobina Woode a ranar 1 ga Fabrairu 1923. [1] Ɗan kungiyar kwadago, ne ya taka rawa sosai a yunkurin neman 'yancin kai a gaɓar tekun Gold Coast, daga baya ta zama Ghana.
An haifi Anthony Kobina Woode a ranar 1 ga Fabrairu 1923. [1] Dan kungiyar kwadago, ya taka rawa sosai a yunkurin neman 'yancin kai a gabar tekun Gold, daga baya ya zama Ghana .

items.sourceText: The Battle of Ansaba took place in autumn of 1963, and was part of the Eritrean War of Independence. It was fought in Jengeren, North of Keren, In Anseba Region.

targets.targetText: Yakin Ansaba ya faru ne a cikin kakar shekara ta 1963, kuma yana cikin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Eritriya. An yi yakin ne a Jengeren da ke Arewacin Keren a yankin Anseba.
Yakin Ansaba ya faru ne a cikin kaka na shekara ta 1963, kuma yana cikin yakin 'yancin kai na Eritriya . An yi yakin ne a Jengeren da ke Arewacin Keren a yankin Anseba .

items.sourceText: He was arrested by French authorities for the first time in 1941 with Mohamed Belouizdad for his actions within the PPA in the Belcourt (Belouizdad) district of Algiers.[9][2]

targets.targetText: Hukumomin Faransa sun kama shi a karon farko a cikin 1941 tare da Mohamed Belouizdad saboda ayyukansa a cikin PPA a gundumar Belcourt ( Belouizdad ) na Algiers . [1] [2]
Hukumomin Faransa sun kama shi a karon farko a cikin shekarar 1941 tare da Mohamed Belouizdad saboda ayyukansa a cikin PPA a gundumar Belcourt (Belouizdad) na Algiers. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: The Museum of the Armed Forces (Portuguese: Museu das Forças Armadas) is located in Fortaleza de São Miguel de Luanda, in the Ingombota District of Luanda, Angola.

targets.targetText: Gidan kayan gargajiya na Sojojin ( Portuguese ) yana cikin Fortaleza de São Miguel de Luanda, a cikin gundumar Ingombota na Luanda, Angola .
Gidan kayan gargajiya na Sojojin ( Portuguese: Museu das Forças Armadas) yana cikin Fortaleza de São Miguel de Luanda, a cikin gundumar Ingombota na Luanda, Angola.
